job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

As a Web Developer on the Digital Marketing team, your primary focus will be on designing, developing, and maintaining web-based solutions that enhance customer experiences across our digital platforms. This role requires strong proficiency in WordPress development, including custom field modules, and a functional understanding of various web technologies and CMS platforms.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Director, Marketing - Digital
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Web Development:
* Develop efficient, testable, and scalable code using WordPress.
* Utilize Advanced Custom Fields (ACF) for custom WordPress development, creating flexible and dynamic content modules.
* Ensure cross-browser compatibility, responsive design, and optimize performance for all web properties.
* Manage and deploy changes using GitHub and version control best practices.
* Troubleshoot and optimize data flows between websites and back-end systems such as Google Tag Manager and GA4, ensuring data accuracy.
* Maintain and update websites across multiple CMS platforms while ensuring seamless integrations with third-party APIs and services.
* Collaborative Efforts:
* Work closely with the digital marketing team to translate business needs into functional web solutions that enhance user experience and drive engagement.
* Assist with daily updates requested by marketing managers and other stakeholders, ensuring a high level of quality and timely delivery.
* Assist in managing digital assets, including product documentation, software downloads, and other hosted resources.
* Stay updated on emerging technologies, web standards, and industry trends, applying these innovations to improve website performance and functionality.
* Data Analysis and Feedback:
* Assist in analyzing user interactions and feedback to identify areas for improvement.
* Collaborate with UX/UI designers to enhance the user experience based on analytics and user feedback.


**Who you are:**  

* Post-secondary education in Computer Science or a related field preferred, or equivalent related experience.
* Proven experience as a WordPress Developer, with expertise in Advanced Custom Fields (ACF), PHP, MySQL, and server-side integrations.
* Proficiency in front-end development (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery) and responsive web design.
* Strong knowledge of web development technologies and frameworks.
* Experience using Google Tag Manager (GTM), Google Analytics 4 (GA4), and related data integration tools.
* Working knowledge of version control systems like GitHub for managing and deploying code.
* Familiarity with SEO best practices.
* Knowledge of web performance optimization tools and techniques.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with attention to detail.
* Strong communication and teamwork abilities.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

The Camera Motion Systems team is seeking a senior full stack developer to help shape, design, build, and maintain the operator-facing control system for our robotics product line.
  
  

You are passionate about coding and enjoy using various development tools and frameworks to create highly functional user experiences. You enjoy exploring new ideas and know how to test your work quickly and effectively.
  
  

We value experience in multi-threading, design patterns, best practices such as Domain Driven Design, Test Driven Development, Behavior Driven Development, high performance design, and Agile software methodologies.
  
  

We work in an Agile environment, with a flat structure that encourages minimal oversight and encourages freedom and flexibility to complete your task.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Senior Manager, Software Development
  
What we offer
  
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got an energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Work with the team to design and develop a modern, scalable, and secure control system for managing and controlling camera robots.
* Engage in the complete software development lifecycle: requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, documentation, testing, and maintenance.
* Write code across the full stack: UI, server application, and data storage.
* Conduct design and code reviews for team members, promoting high-quality work, sound software methodologies, and attention to detail.
* Produce clean, testable, and efficient code based on specifications.
* Collaborate with the UX team to create a beautiful, coherent application.
* Create technical documentation for reference and reporting.
* Coach and mentor other developers on the team.
* Assist tech support and/or customers in resolving technical issues when required.
* Pragmatically advocate for new tools, technologies, and approaches that can benefit the team and our products.
* Collaborate with team lead to plan and schedule work for the team.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with other teams.
* Occasionally travel to customer sites to conduct and assist with beta trials.


**Who you are:**  

* 8+ years of software development experience.
* Bachelor’s degree or higher in a related field of study.
* Demonstrated project experience in scalable web systems architecture, with considerable front-end and back-end coding experience.
* Proficient full stack web developer in modern, secure web technologies.
* Enjoy working in a team environment and have experience leading teams.
* Understand the value of leveraging company platforms to accelerate value delivery to end-users.
* Know when a product is “good enough” and prefer working on the next feature rather than gold-plating an existing one.
* Value good test automation and actively contribute to unit test development.
* Strong interpersonal and observational skills.
* Exceptional analytical skills for solving complex technical problems.
* Proactive self-starter passionate about technology, quick learner, and able to work with minimal supervision to meet schedules and project deadlines.
* Able to work independently or as part of a team.
* Able and willing to regularly visit the Ottawa lab as required.
* Object-oriented software design.
* Interest in implementing development processes and adopting best practices to enhance quality and performance.
* Familiarity with Git and Gitlab.


**Bonus points if you have the following:**  

* Experience with React.
* Experience with Java Enterprise Edition or ASP.NET Core.
* Experience with Equinox/OSGi, and/or Spring.
* Experience with cloud-based applications, deployment to AWS or Azure.
* Experience working in an Agile Scrum software development team.
* Knowledge and experience with Domain Driven Design, Hexagonal Architecture, Test Driven Development, and Behavior Driven Development.
* Interest in implementing development processes and adopting best practices to enhance quality and performance.
* Experience in television or video production, especially in video acquisition.
* Experience in the broadcast industry.


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

As a Senior Industrial Engineering Specialist, you will drive the optimization of processes across all manufacturing areas in our Iroquois facilities. Collaborating with various departments, external stakeholders and various levels of management to develop standard processes and establish measurement standards throughout our manufacturing facility, you will oversee the technical direction of our Industrial Engineering initiatives, leading complex projects to drive significant improvements in efficiency, quality, safety and costs.
  
**Who you report to:** Director, Manufacturing Engineering
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

This role involves but is not limited to providing mentorship to junior team members, sharing knowledge, best practices and expertise. Lead complex projects with a wide range of tasks, including studies relating to process management and optimal use of machinery, materials and resources. Facilitate the introduction of new equipment and ensure compliance. Implement and manage advanced systems for collecting production time and efficiency data. You will lead projects of various sizes, related to facility layout & design for continuous improvement, as well as corrective action initiatives, ensuring timely resolution of issues. You will promote environmental sustainability, collaborate on workstation design, evaluate and assess industrial facilities to ensure they meet operational and health & safety standards. You will also be a technical resource for compliance audits for regulatory bodies.
  
  

**Who you are:**  

* BEng in Industrial Engineering, with relative BEng experience (7 years), or equivalent education/experience. Advanced degree preferred.
* Lean Six Sigma certification (Green belt or Black belt.).
* Excellent leadership, communication, and organization skills.
* Demonstrated continuous learning and professional development.
* Advanced proficiency with Excel, AutoCAD, Visio and data analysis tools like Power BI.
* Skilled in performing detailed cost analysis for cost reduction opportunities, including optimizing energy consumption and reducing waste; as well as collecting and analyzing production data.


**Bonus points if you have the following:**  

* Demonstrated Project management experience.
* Experience with PCB assembly processes.
* Proven experience in designing and optimizing factory layouts and process flows to enhance productivity and quality.
* Demonstrated ability to implement and manage advanced systems for collecting and analyzing production data.


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. The Test Developer within Product Engineering will play a crucial role in ensuring the high performance and quality of Ross Video's products through comprehensive testing and data analysis. This role involves developing and implementing robust test solutions, collaborating with various departments, and contributing to the continuous improvement of testing processes. The developer is responsible for designing and maintaining test documentation, supporting manufacturing staff, and enhancing test methodologies.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager, Test Development
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Assist in the design, development, and implementation of automated and semi-automated test solutions and procedures to validate the functionality, performance, and reliability of products.
* Develop and adjust test plans for new products in collaboration with R&D and the Test Development team, establishing the technical requirements.
* Conduct functional, performance, and reliability tests on electronic hardware components and systems, ensuring comprehensive coverage.
* Analyze test results, identify root causes of issues, and provide actionable insights to improve product quality. Document findings and suggest corrective actions.
* Prepare and update comprehensive test reports, documentation, and technical summaries for internal and external stakeholders.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of test methodologies and processes to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and coverage.
* Provide technical support for manufacturing staff with product and test station implementation knowledge.
* Assist in the development and maintenance of custom test tools and fixtures, ensuring they meet performance and reliability standards.
* Work closely with hardware design engineers, firmware developers, and manufacturing teams to identify and resolve issues.
* Ensure all test procedures comply with industry standards and regulatory requirements.
* Independence of managing your work: Plan and schedule own work effectively, understanding project timelines.
* Ownership of learning: Demonstrate ownership of learning by staying current with industry trends and continuously updating skills.
* Informed decisions: Understand the business and financial impacts of the functional role and make informed decisions for the greater benefit of the business.


**Who you are:**  

* Undergraduate degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent education and experience.
* 3-5 years professional experience in electronic hardware testing and development, preferably within a manufacturing environment.
* Knowledge of Broadcast Industry standards and implementation.
* Knowledge of electronic manufacturing processes, procedures, and best practices.
* Experience with electronic hardware and a solid understanding of electronic theory, especially digital components such as CPUs, FPGA, flash, etc.
* Ability to comprehend electrical schematics and PCBA design files.
* Familiarity with a wide variety of test equipment (e.g., high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.).
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, or Python
* Knowledge of data acquisition concepts such as TCP/IP, RS232, USB, and CAN.
* Understanding of JTAG and Boundary Scan concepts (preferred).
* Ability to learn an object-oriented language and basic database interfacing (preferred).
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Attention to detail and a commitment to quality.
* Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.
* Willingness to take on new challenges and initiate improvements.
* Well-organized, prepared, and detail oriented.
* Collaborative mindset to work effectively with cross-functional teams.


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

The Hyperconverged signal processing team plays a key role in helping Ross Video achieving its corporate vision to lead the world in video production solution : We enable our customers to integrate any media into their production and we do that using highly acclaimed hardware platforms such as openGear and Ultrix. Here is your chance to join the world class, passionate and innovative team behind the Emmy award winning openGear platform ! On top of being responsible for delivering high quality RTL code for video processing systems, you also have a voice in shaping the products and help our customers building world class media productions infrastructure.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Director, Hyperconverged Solutions - Processing
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Promote, refine and develop challenging and innovative video processing and transport features in the most integrated hardware platform in the broadcast industry.
* Develop RTL for high performance realtime media processing systems involving high bandwidth media interfaces to memory, PCIe or hardware accelerated processing functions such as video scaling or HDR/SDR conversion
* Implement realtime transport protocols in FPGA designs including SDI and SMPTE 2110
* Be involved in the architecture by reviewing schematic designs, advising on density of FPGA functions, thermal design, clocking etc
* Create complete IO ring designs for Arria10/Stratix-10/Ultrascale+/MPSoC/Agilex FPGAs to verify pin-outs and IP in Quartus and Vivado
* Develop high-level design requirements, manage/negotiate key part selection, and support aggressive project scheduling
* Generate both specification & design documentation to support cross functional team
* Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of FPGA & HW designs
* Efficient and systematic debugging skills.
* Assist in supporting other staff members as necessary through entire NPI process flow – including design, documentation, test, manufacturing and customer support


**Who you are:**  

* Intermediate - Senior level FPGA design knowledge and experience across broad range of topics including:
* FPGA building blocks & system architecture
* High speed transceivers, clock domain analysis, & timing closure
* Fluent in development languages used in FPGA design – Verilog, System Verilog, TCL scripting
* Ability to create Verilog simulation testbenches and run VCS simulations
* Expertise in current Xilinx & Intel devices and associated design and debugging tools
* Knowledge of high-speed serial interfaces using gigabit transceivers, DDR3/4 interfaces, HBM, and PLL’s
* Excellent debugging skills & proficient with typical lab equipment (scopes, JBERTs, network analyzers, WFMs, etc)
* Ability to work in an embedded environment. Linux, bash, C/C++ and networking skills a plus
* Knowledge of broadcast studio applications & workflow preferred; especially distribution / production systems a plus
* Understanding of digital video and associated audio standards a plus
* Signal Integrity knowledge a plus
* Sound interpersonal skills with ability to work as part of a team or independently as required
* Keen observational skills and problem solving intuition
* Self-starter with the tenacity to bring product to market
* Ability to learn new concepts quickly and work towards finding creative solutions to challenging problems
* Comfortable moving forward aggressively; balancing risks appropriately to optimize success across all business aspects – good, fast, and cheap
* Equally comfortable contributing as a team member or championing an idea with upper management
* Minimum 5 years FPGA & HW development experience with expertise in Video/Audio technologies preferred


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Working closely with all members of the Human Resources team, the Senior HR Generalist will play a strategic role in support to managers and employees based in EMEA region, In addition, they will development and maintain local HR policies and programs. As the sole HR representative in the region, day to day activities span from strategic to hands on, employee relations to Talent Acquisition.
  
**Who you report to:** Director, Human Resources – Regional
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Understand business goals and work to ensure the effective execution of HR programs, processes, policies, communications, and strategic initiatives to meet business objectives
* Take a hands-on approach to strategic partnering as trusted advisor to client group leaders and employees in coaching, mentoring and educating on their obligations to ensure all company standards and practices are upheld to enable a safe, healthy and compliant work environment
* Provide HR insights to help localize and drive talent management strategic priorities in assigned client groups, including workforce planning and talent acquisition, manager and employee development, succession planning, and annual compensation and performance review cycles
* Act as local Health & Safety representative; ensure compliance with jurisdictional H&S regulations including creating and updating policies and procedures, training, documentation and communication with local staff
* Working independently with regional people leaders, relying on support from HR colleagues primarily in Ottawa for support or subject matter expertise and consulting their manager for complex issues
* Support the full recruitment life-cycle for all EMEA region roles, from candidate sourcing to onboarding
* Provide guidance and support on HR policies or processes related to country specific legislation and compliance for the region including time and leave policies, governmental compliance reporting submissions, internal or external audits, corporate wide policies that include HR subject matter
* Act as liaison between the regional client group and corporate head-office administrative teams assist with implementation of corporate programs and initiatives as required
* Assist with special HR projects and local initiatives as required
* Perform other related duties as required


**Who you are:**  

* University or college degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or related discipline, and/or equivalent work experience in an HR team
* Minimum 8+ years of HR Generalist/HR Business Partner experience preferably in a multi-national organization
* Ability to work independently and make decisions within the scope of the role, raising issues as required to their manager
* Experience navigating the full recruitment and employee life cycle
* Effective communication skills and the ability to collaborate with many levels in the organization
* Ability to deal with confidential information with a high degree of diplomacy; ability to build trusted relationships with both regional leaders and employees
* Knowledge of UK employment related legislation required, additional regions in EMEA an asset
* Strong-working knowledge of MS-Office package and general computer software; familiarity with Ceridian Dayforce an asset
* Fluency in and English (oral and written) required
* Travel less than 5% of the time both regionally in EMEA and to Ottawa, Canada


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. * Minimum of 4 years experience with full stack software development life cycle in an agile environment.
* The ability to explore and integrate different tools and technologies in your applications.

* You enjoy working collaboratively on projects.

job_description:
INTERNAL OPPORTUNITIES AT ROSS VIDEOThinking about what’s next for your career? At Ross Video we are committed to your professional growth and to providing opportunities to develop your career. Our internal talent mobility program is intended to facilitate effective hiring from within, as appropriate, to fill open opportunities in the company.
  
  

Manufacturing Test Developer
  
The Test Developer II within Product Engineering team will play a crucial role in ensuring the high performance and quality of Ross Video's products through comprehensive testing and data research. This role involves developing and implementing robust test solutions, collaborating with various departments, and contributing to the continuous improvement of testing processes. The developer is responsible for designing and maintaining test documentation, supporting manufacturing staff, and enhancing test methodologies. This role is located in Iroquois, Ontario within our manufacturing facility.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager Test Development
  
**Work Arrangement:** Work from Office
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Assist in the design, development, and implementation of automated and semi-automated test solutions and procedures to validate the functionality, performance, and reliability of product.
* Develop and adjust test plans for new products in collaboration with R&D and the Test Development team, establishing the technical requirements
* Conduct functional, performance, and reliability tests on electronic hardware components and systems, ensuring comprehensive coverage
* Analyze test results, identify root causes of issues, and provide actionable insights to improve product quality. Document findings and suggest corrective actions
* Prepare and update comprehensive test reports, documentation, and technical summaries for internal and external stakeholders
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of test methodologies and processes to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and coverage.
* Provide technical support for manufacturing staff with product and test station implementation knowledge
* Assist in the development and maintenance of custom test tools and fixtures, ensuring they meet performance and reliability standards
* Work closely with hardware design engineers, firmware developers, and manufacturing teams to identify and resolve issues and ensure compliance with standards and regulatory requirements
* Independence of managing your work: Plan and schedule own work effectively, understanding project timelines.
* Ownership of learning: Demonstrate ownership of learning by staying current with industry trends and continuously updating skills.
* Informed outcomes: Understand the business and financial impacts of the functional role and make informed choices for the greater benefit of the business.


**Who you are:**  

* Undergraduate degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent education and experience, 3-5 years
* knowledge of Broadcast Industry standards and implementation.
* knowledge of electronic manufacturing processes, procedures, and best practices.
* Experience with electronic hardware and a solid understanding of electronic theory, especially digital components such as CPUs, FPGA, flash, etc.
* Ability to comprehend electrical schematics and PCBA design files.
* Familiarity with a wide variety of test equipment (e.g., high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.).
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, or Python
* Knowledge of data acquisition concepts such as TCP/IP, RS232, USB, and CAN.
* Understanding of JTAG and Boundary Scan concepts (preferred).
* Ability to learn an object-oriented language and basic database interfacing (preferred).


**Bonus points if you have the following:**  

* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Attention to detail and a commitment to quality.
* Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.
* Willingness to take on new challenges and initiate improvements.
* Well-organized, prepared, and detail oriented.
* Collaborative mindset to work effectively with cross-functional teams.


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

As part of the development team, you will be helping conceive, design, develop and deliver products in a variety of broadcast applications. You will work to improve and grow the technical competence of our designs. Our small teams encourage outside of the box thinking, we value innovation and feedback, and you will work alongside a diverse group of people with a broad range of skills and experience. You will be working on real-world applications and get to see the results of your hard work firsthand.
  
  

WE'RE AFTER A PARTICULAR TYPE OF AWESOME
  
  

You need to be passionate about working in code and love working with different development tools and frameworks to create powerful applications with highly functional user experiences. We value experience in embedded systems engineering, multi-threading, design patterns, best practices such as Domain Driven Design, Test Driven Development, Behavior Driven Development, high performance design, and Agile software methodologies.
  
  

You enjoy exploring new ideas and know how to test your work quickly and effectively. We work in an Agile environment, with a flat structure that encourages minimal oversight and encourages freedom and flexibility to complete your task.
  
**Who you report to:** Manager, Software Development
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Participate in the full software development lifecycle – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, documentation, testing, and maintenance.
* Write code across the full stack – UI, server application, device drivers and data storage.
* Provide design reviews and code reviews for fellow team members promoting high-quality work, sound software methodologies and attention to detail.
* Produce clean, testable, and efficient code based on specifications.
* Create technical documentation for reference and reporting.
* Coach and mentor other developers on the team.
* Assist tech support and/or customers to resolve technical issues when required
* Advocate for new tools, technologies and approaches that can help the team and our products.


**Who you are:**  

* 8+ years of experience in software engineering or a related industry.
* Bachelor Degree or higher in a related field of study
* Familiarity with SVN, Git or Mercurial
* Familiarity with TCP/IP client-server programming
* An embedded systems development background.
* Object-oriented software design using C++
* Interest in implementing development processes and adopting best practices, particularly when it comes to enhancing both quality and performance.
* Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills.


**Bonus points if you have the following:**  

* Experience with Qt
* Experience working in an Agile Scrum software development team
* Experience with test automation and related development techniques
* Knowledge and experience with Domain Driven Design, Hexagonal Architecture, Test Driven Development and Behavioral Driven Development
* Interest in implementing development processes and adopting best practices, particularly when it comes to enhancing both quality and performance.
* Experience in the video equipment industry


WHO WE ARE
  
Ross Video is a world leader in High-Definition Video Production Equipment, designed and manufactured in Canada and sold world-wide. Our products are used by a who's who of the global entertainment industry, including top broadcast networks like NBC, ABC, CBS and Fox in the USA, Rogers, CTV and the CBC in Canada and others around the world from Fiji to Finland and everywhere in between. We are # 1 in providing behind the scenes HD production gear used in Sports Stadiums including places where the NY Mets, LA Lakers, Pittsburgh Penguins and Buffalo Bills play. Our equipment was used extensively at the Vancouver 2010 and other Olympic games. Our systems are used by top acts including Beyoncé, Taylor Swift, Kenny Chesney, Springsteen and The Red Hot Chili Peppers to name a few. Top webcasters like Revision 3 and MLB.com use Ross. Our equipment is even used on the International Space Station. Join Ross and you will have a chance to work on advanced technology used in a wide variety of very cool ways by our clients.
  
  

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

As a Full Stack AI Developer at Ross Research Labs, you will be at the forefront of integrating artificial intelligence into our cutting-edge products and services. This role requires a unique blend of AI expertise and full-stack development skills, enabling you to contribute to every stage of the product development lifecycle—from concept and design to deployment and optimization. You will work closely with other members of the RRL team and the R&D team to build and deploy AI-driven features that provide real-time insights, improve user experience, and drive innovation in broadcast and video production technologies. Your work will focus on leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) and enhancing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems to deliver highly accurate and efficient AI solutions.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Technical Director - Ross Research Labs
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* AI Algorithm Development: Design, implement, and optimize AI algorithms, with a particular focus on LLMs, that provide personalized insights, enhance product functionality, and improve user engagement.
* LLM Integration: Access and utilize LLM models within our codebase, ensuring seamless integration and optimal performance in production environments.
* RAG System Enhancement: Fine-tune and optimize RAG systems, including tasks such as re-ranking and retrieval improvements, to enhance the relevance and accuracy of AI-generated outputs.
* Full Stack Development: Develop and maintain the full stack of our platforms, ensuring high performance, reliability, and scalability across web and cloud environments.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work with product, design, and engineering teams to define, develop, and ship new features that leverage AI to create impactful user experiences.
* Continuous Improvement: Identify performance bottlenecks, debug issues, and deploy fixes and enhancements to ensure our AI-driven solutions are robust and reliable.
* Innovation and Prototyping: Lead the development of advanced AI-driven tools and frameworks that accelerate the ML/AI feature development cycle and support rapid prototyping.
* Code Quality and Review: Produce clean, maintainable, and well-documented code. Conduct code reviews to ensure adherence to best practices and Ross Video’s coding standards.


**Who you are:**  

* Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field. A master’s degree or equivalent experience is a plus.
* Technical Experience: Proficient in coding languages such as Python, Node.js, Golang, and JavaScript (with experience in frameworks like React), and familiar with API concepts such as RESTful API, WebSocket connectivity, and backend SQL.
* AI/ML Expertise: Experience in using, developing, and deploying ML/AI models to production at scale, with a particular focus on LLMs. Proficiency with popular AI/ML frameworks and tools.
* Web Development: Proven track record of developing and scaling web applications, particularly those involving high-load distributed systems and cloud deployments.
* RAG Systems: Experience in working with RAG systems, including fine-tuning re-ranking algorithms and optimizing retrieval mechanisms.
* Cloud Computing: Experience with cloud platforms like Azure or AWS, including experience in deploying and managing AI workloads in cloud environments.
* Collaboration Skills: Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively across various teams and disciplines.


**Bonus points if you have the following:**  

* Advanced AI/ML Skills: Experience in designing, deploying, and optimizing AI/ML workloads in production environments, especially involving LLMs.
* Scalable Systems: Expertise in building scalable, distributed systems, including familiarity with message brokers, job queues, and event-driven architectures.
* Advanced Degree: A postgraduate degree in computer science, machine learning, or a related field is highly desirable.
* Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead by example, mentor junior developers, and drive innovation within the team.


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Come Freelance with ROSS!
  
At Ross Mobile Productions (Ross MP), we power video production for hundreds of shows each year across the United States and the World using the industry’s widest range of smart production solutions, you will help create. Our company is experiencing strong growth in eSports, entertainment and sports and is searching for a dynamic, self-motivated, highly technical doer to take Ross MP engineering to the next level.
  
  

As a Broadcast Engineer at Ross MP, you will work with a team of like-minded experts building and then engineering trucks and fly packs with the latest and greatest Ross equipment. You will then deploy what your team builds in remote events for the top networks and brands in several industries. As a developing engineer, you will begin to develop new/creative/innovative technical offerings that will meet our customer’s needs, help differentiate Ross and Ross MP in the market place and continue the business’ strong expansion.
  
  

Ross Mobile Productions currently has 6 of the most powerful small mobile units in the industry, a studio and fly packs at all levels. 2021/2022 promises to be the most exciting time ever, worldwide, with new equipment and customers coming on board. Be a part of events for the biggest networks, eSports companies and media brands. Be a part of Ross MP.
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
  

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Working with dedicated broadcast hardware including all Ross products and other best standard industry equipment.
* Desire to learn and develop.
* Hand out and Inventory all Equipment on Remotes.
* Knowledge of video shading and cameras (Work as a V1 on shows).
* Proficient in one or several technical areas, mostly Mira Lead and RO, A1, Lead EVS, and TD.
* Be able to work with crew and help follow through with EIC/Tech manager plan.
* Instruct Crew as needed, direct the activities of crew members related to the operation of the mobile unit, including setup and breakdown of the truck.
* Pack and unpack your truck and drive to and from Remotes
* Learn to Build shows from the ground up, including router configuration, signal flow troubleshooting, and working with various technicians to establish show requirements and turn them into executed solutions.
* Provide information to EIC for the Post Show Report at the conclusion of each event.
* Work directly with the EIC to handle all required preventative and technical maintenance of onboard broadcast equipment.
* Maintaining a positive work atmosphere by behaving and communicating in a manner that works well with co-workers, supervisors, customers, and vendors.
* Responsible end-to-end for select, small scale events.
* Introduction to some system design and building and on-site integration and set up to include video path, audio path, fiber linked systems, digital video compression and transmission standards, PC networking, Master Control facilities and hub, and network storage systems. This will include broadcast trucks, fly packs and fiber kits.
* Estimate that you could travel more than 50% of the time
* Valid Driver’s License


**Who you are:**  

* 1-3 years relevant experience
* Strong technical mind
* Want to work with the coolest technology on the best events and maximize your potential, alongside a team of Ross superstars
* If you are familiar with broadcast signal flow or networking, have built or engineered equipment, worked on the technical side of the live event industry or love technology and trends
* You like sports and eSports
* Perform well under pressure and love challenges


#LI-JF1
  
  

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.
  
  

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
  
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

Working with the Corporate Facilities team located in Ottawa, the Facilities Coordinator - Programs will play a crucial role in coordinating programs for physical security, WFH furniture, server room HVAC replacement, as well as writing, and monitoring Facilities policies, procedures, and communications material. This role will also involve documenting Requests for Information (RFIs) and Requests for Proposals (RFPs) to support our operational and strategic goals. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in physical security, policy development and effective communication strategies.
  
**Who you report to:** Manager, Global Facilities
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Conduct reviews and audits, assessing the implementation of programs to identify any issues or concerns and recommend appropriate corrective action.
* Prepare written statistical reports as required.
* Regularly improve processes and procedures by identifying and documenting changes in practices, and scope of business activities.
* Maintain applicable program directives, regulations, manuals and guidelines.
* Provide input to Emergency response plan.
* Physical Security Program:
* Survey existing security measures and installations to ensure a standardized security program, and processes while ensuring that all documentation and operational processes are well written, uniform, and integrated.
* Participate in the design and development of systems for access control, video surveillance, intrusion detection, and protective measures against attacks.
* Provide regular advice, support and guidance on a wide variety of safety and security issues.
* Be involved in initial security response to situations/incidents and ensure appropriate emergency services are advised including notification to management and others as required.
* Collect and analyze security data and identify trends and potential causes of security related incidents, criminal activity and disturbances and reports data
* Conduct threat analysis, vulnerability assessments, and security assessments on Ross office locations.
* Provide input and support on security-related projects and initiatives.
* Support the development of internal physical security awareness campaigns.
* Policy and Procedure Development:
* Develop, review, and update facilities policies and procedures to ensure compliance with regulations, standards, and best practices.
* Administers standards, guidelines and procedures as it relates to Facilities.
* Communications:
* Create clear, concise, and engaging communication materials including reports, memos, newsletters, and presentations.
* Develop communications to effectively convey Facilities messages and updates to internal audiences.
* Edit and proofread documents to ensure accuracy, consistency, and adherence to style guidelines.
* RFI and RFP Management:
* Coordinate Requests for Information (RFIs) and Requests for Proposals (RFPs) to support procurement and partnership initiatives.
* Coordinate with various departments to gather and integrate requirements into RFI/RFP documents.
* Evaluate responses and provide recommendations based on criteria and organizational needs.
* Other related duties as required.


**Who you are:**  

* Minimum of 3 years’ experience in Facilities that includes responsibility for physical security.
* Post-secondary education in Facilities related field or Security preferred with equivalent work experience considered.
* Ability to be part of the after hours on-call rotation.
* Demonstrated positive working relationship with internal and external customers.
* Possess a high degree of originality, creativity, initiative requiring minimal supervision.
* Knowledge of MS Office suite software including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

Ross Video is a rapidly expanding broadcast industry solutions provider.
  
  

Reporting to the Director, Sales - Asia, the General Manager will oversee and coordinate multiple functions within the India region, including Sales, Service Delivery, Creative Services, Marketing and Market Vertical development. This role will also involve a significant component of selling and driving revenue growth. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the overall operations, developing business strategies, profitability, growth and ensuring the successful implementation of Ross Video's vision within India.
  
  

All staff outside of the Global Sales department will have a dotted line reporting to the managers of their respective departments.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Director, Sales - Asia
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

This unique position will include, but is not limited to, the following duties:
  
  

**General Management:**  

* Develop and implement a strategic and operational business plan for the India region that aligns with Ross Video's global strategy and profitable growth objectives.
* Drive cross-functional collaboration and synergy across different departments and teams within the India region, fostering a cohesive and aligned approach to customer engagement, brand representation, and market positioning.
* Manage budgets, financial performance, and resource allocation for the India region.
* Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the India team, promoting employee engagement, cooperation, and development.
* Responsible for the overall hiring, motivation, and management of the direct reports in the region. Working with the Director, Sales – Asia and Department Leaders, this includes recruitment, mentoring, coaching, and evaluating team members while driving a culture of performance.
* Exudes the behaviors identified within Ross Video’s Culture Statements, as well as our company’s Code of Ethics.
* Mention winning aspiration and emphasis on growth and profitability


**Sales Leadership:**  

* Lead and inspire the sales team to achieve revenue targets, ensuring the consistent growth of sales within the India region.
* Develop and execute strategic sales plans and make strategic adjustments as market conditions require, in collaboration with the Director, Sales - Asia, to expand market share and penetrate new customer segments.
* Foster strong customer relationships, acting as a trusted advisor to key clients and driving customer satisfaction and provide a superior customer experience.
* Stay up to date with industry trends, market conditions, and competitor activities to drive continuous improvement and identify new business opportunities.
* Attend trade shows and industry conferences to increase sales through improved levels of product knowledge and further develop industry contacts via networking.
* Build C-Level credibility/relationships.


**Service Delivery Management:**  

* Oversee the service delivery operations, ensuring the timely and efficient execution of projects and customer support.
* Manage the creative services team responsible for delivering high-quality video production solutions, including graphics, virtual sets, and augmented reality.
* Collaborate with the global service team to develop and implement standardized processes, service levels, and quality assurance measures.
* Maintain a customer-centric approach, striving for excellence in service delivery and exceeding customer expectations.


**Who you are:**  

* Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field.
* 7+ years of experience in sales and/or general management roles in the broadcast or related industry.
* Experience working with North American based organizations
* Strong leadership and team management skills, with a proven track record of achieving business targets and driving growth.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills, with the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with customers, partners, and stakeholders across diverse cultures.
* Demonstrated ability to develop and execute strategic plans, and to analyze and interpret market trends and customer needs, and track progress to ensure successful outcomes.
* Strong commercial acumen, with experience managing budgets and financial performance.
* Ability to travel up to 50% of the time, including extensive regional travel and occasionally internationally.
* Valid Passport
* Valid Driver’s License & a clear driving record
* Language proficiency: Fluent in English and Hindi
* Based in Delhi, HQ India


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. As a Senior Product Engineering Specialist, you will be an advocate for product success within the manufacturing department. You will work across multiple manufacturing teams and act as manufacturing’s technical liaison to the product development teams. You will manage and support the introduction of new products into manufacturing while additionally supporting the continuous improvement, optimization, and general oversight of existing products through their complete lifecycle.
  
  

Members of product engineering need to possess both a deep understanding of the technologies used in the products and an understanding of the manufacturing technologies required to produce them.
  
  

The manufacturing department at Ross Video specializes in high mix and low volume production, catering primarily to the live production industry's need for high-end electronics. With a comprehensive in-house operation that includes Surface Mount Technology (SMT), assembly, testing, and product configuration. Beyond electronics, the department also exhibits expertise in creating mechanically oriented production control panels and advanced robotic systems. This blend of technical precision and innovative engineering underscores Ross Video's commitment to quality and excellence in the fast-paced world of live production technology.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager, Manufacturing Product Engineering
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Within manufacturing, spearhead the introduction of new products, coordinating with various manufacturing subject matter experts while monitoring the progress and results.
* Liaise between manufacturing and R&D to synchronize project timelines, expectations, and milestones. Engage early on product designs to work through manufacturing risk mitigations.
* Participate in DFX reviews and work with the technical teams to resolve potential issues.
* Review ECO’s to ensure proper product structures and approve MCO status changes.
* Ensure manufacturing readiness for launch schedules through progress tracking, issue resolution. and activity coordination.
* Foster collaboration between teams, facilitating feedback, and suggestions for design improvements.
* Estimate and measure the impact new designs will have on manufacturing in terms of labour, equipment, processes, facilities, and technological improvements.
* Conduct assessments to identify potential manufacturing improvements or upgrades and liaise with relevant teams regarding implementation plans.
* Collaborate with quality assurance teams to develop quality control plans and procedures, focusing on test and inspection oversight.
* Analyze product performance data, identifying areas for improvement and monitoring defect trends, yields, process times, and field return trends.
* Implement cost reduction initiatives without compromising product quality and conduct failure analysis to identify and resolve product-related issues, taking ownership of macro-level issues.


**Who you are:**  

* Post-secondary education (degree or diploma) in a technical field such as engineering.
* 7+ years of professional experience in a manufacturing or a high-tech environment.
* 4+ years managing simultaneous projects and activities.
* Knowledge of embedded systems and electronics.
* Knowledge of product lifecycle management.
* Knowledge of configuration management systems and best practices.
* Solid knowledge of electronic manufacturing processes, procedures, and best practices.
* Education or training on project/program management.
* Well organized, prepared, persistent, and detail oriented.
* Capable of managing numerous competing tasks.
* Able to independently problem solve and resolve issues.
* Capable of comfortably working with a variety of personalities
* Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills.

At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. This role involves executing routine tasks and adhering to standard manufacturing work instructions as part of the primary responsibility. A solid attention to detail is necessary along with the ability to accurately follow processes while effectively collaborating with various departments is essential to ensure the timely fulfillment of orders
  
  

**Who you report to:** Production Manager

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

* Have a solid understanding of ERP for product structures and scanning product bar codes into the sales order module for shipping traceability.
* Have a solid understanding of MES in following instructions and routing through the PACK process point to receive product into stock.
* Pick assemblies from finished goods to fulfill sales order line item. requirements and ensuring any testing and configuration is performed on these items when necessary

* A team player with excellent communication skills
* Willing to get the job done
* Works closely and shares information with the direct team
* Offers support and suggestions to fellow teammates ensuring inclusiveness.
* High School Diploma
* College diploma and/or additional education and computer courses are considered an asset
* 2 years’ experience in a manufacturing environment is an asset.
* Mechanical and Electrical assembly an asset

The successful candidate will become an expert in Ross Enterprise Management control systems. This expertise will be gained through a review of the current documentation, direct contact with the products and working with the technical personnel. You will also be a champion of product quality - working with development to improve test coverage and test efficiency through automation. You will not just be writing automation scripts; rather you will be developing automation software being reused for many years to come.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager, Software Development
  
  

What we offer
  
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

* Participate in the design process and collaborate with the development teams to enable and deliver product test automation.
* Develop test automation plans and cases.
* Regular automated test execution and reporting.
* Participate in the management of the automation environment.
* Document automation, test environment and test execution processes.
* Provide effort estimation for scheduling purposes.
* Provide regular status updates.
* Collaborate with other teams as needed.
* Perform other related duties as required.


**Who you are:**  

* Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering.
* A minimum of 5 years experience in an automation role.
* Experience with automation testing concepts.
* Strong development skills/experience.
* Knowledge of operating systems (Linux and various Windows platforms)
* Experience with test cycle management tools
* Experience with development management tools such as source control and code review
* You have a full automation toolbox
* Python, JavaScript
* Robo framework, Playwright, selenium, BASH
* Postman, JMeter


**Bonus points if you have the following:**  

* Knowledge of DevOps (Jenkins, Docker, Ec2, RDS, etc)

All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager, Manufacturing Production - Configuration & Systems
  
  

**Work Arrangement:** Work from Office
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Can execute routine tasks and follow standard work instructions with minimal coaching.
* Assembles panels, frames, solders electronic components, and subassemblies.
* Positions and mounts units according to instructions, regarding duties to be performed.
* Reads work orders, follows production drawings and sample assemblies, or receives verbal instructions regarding duties to be performed.
* Positions and aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jig, fixture, or other holding device.
* Crimps, screws, bolts, rivets, press fits, tweaks pots, sanding, solder leads and components, cleaning or performs similar operations to join or secure parts in place.
* Connects component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points.
* Installs finished assemblies or subassemblies in panels.
* Assembles and attaches hardware, such as caps, knobs, switches, clamps, bumpers, clips, fasteners, nuts, washers, labels to assemblies.
* Performs intermediate assembly tasks, such as cleaning, sanding, packaging etc.
* Functional tests of assemblies and panels
* Makes electrical connections.
* Does electrical testing of production.
* Performs assembly tasks like kitting, tag defective parts and transfer to holding area for evaluation and repair.
* Maintains records data.
* May work in a variety of positions in a progressive assembly.
* Takes periodic inventory of stock and assembly.
* Shift work or overtime may be required.
* Perform other related duties as required.
* Engage in basic information exchange within their immediate team, and exhibit teamwork.
* Works closely and shares information with the direct team, is a great team player.
* Offers support and suggestions to fellow teammates ensuring inclusiveness.


**Who you are:**  

* High School Diploma
* Mechanical aptitude.
* Able to work independently or as part of a team.
* Capable of following procedures and working logically.
* Strong aptitude for learning.
* Good organizational skills
* 1-2 years’ experience in a manufacturing environment is an asset.
* Mechanical and Electrical assembly an asset
* Fine soldering skills and previous experience soldering electronic components is an asset.


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. job_title: Sr Manufacturing Data Engineering Specialist (Job Req #2024-232)
job_description:
INTERNAL OPPORTUNITIES AT ROSS VIDEOThinking about what’s next for your career? At Ross Video we are committed to your professional growth and to providing opportunities to develop your career. Our internal talent mobility program is intended to facilitate effective hiring from within, as appropriate, to fill open opportunities in the company.
  
  

The Senior Manufacturing Data Engineering Specialist will lead the development and optimization of manufacturing’s data systems, ensuring the delivery of insights and real-time data exchanges that drive production performance. This role will involve mentoring junior team members, working independently, driving improvements, and providing technical leadership. The successful candidate will collaborate with various departments to ensure timely and accurate data and help optimize manufacturing processes. You will steer the selection of technology stacks and solution designs, using third-party technologies and in-house development.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager, Manufacturing Data Infrastructure
  
**Work Arrangement:** Primarily work from home (PWFH)
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Innovative data solutions, a driving force in transforming manufacturing data into actionable insights that power efficiency and performance.
* Design and implement comprehensive data solutions that provide actionable insights and facilitate real-time data exchanges, driving production performance and efficiency.
* Lead technical decision-making processes, including the selection of technology stacks and third-party technologies to best support manufacturing goals.
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines that collect, process, and store data from diverse manufacturing systems.
* Establish and manage data warehouses and data lakes, ensuring centralized, accessible, and well-documented manufacturing data for analysis.
* Provide guidance and mentorship to junior technical staff to develop and maintain data portals, dashboards, and reports, offering insights into manufacturing operations and performance metrics.
* Implement robust data validation and cleansing processes to ensure high-quality data integrity.
* Collaborate closely with teams including manufacturing engineering, production, operational technology, and quality assurance to understand data needs and deliver tailored solutions.
* Develop software tools that support automated data collection and reporting processes, enhancing efficiency and reducing manual efforts to connect manufacturing systems with various business platforms such as ERP and Oracle Agile, ensuring seamless data flow and integration.
* Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices in data engineering and manufacturing technologies, continuously seeking opportunities to enhance the data infrastructure.
* Ensure that implemented solutions effectively support and enhance manufacturing and business objectives, prioritizing practical results.
* Provide guidance and mentorship to junior team members, fostering a culture of learning and professional growth.


**Job Requirements:****Knowledge/Education/Training:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field, with a specialization in data science/engineering.
* Advanced knowledge of data engineering tools and technologies, such as SQL, Python, ETL processes, BI Tools, and data warehousing solutions.
* Familiarity with key manufacturing metrics and operational performance measurements.
* Experience in creating data visualizations and reports using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
* Familiarity with manufacturing systems such as MES, ERP, and SCADA.


**Who you are:**  

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in data engineering
* 8 years of experience in a technical position, with a background in manufacturing
* Demonstrated experience in developing and managing data pipelines, data integration, and data warehousing.


**Traits:**  

* Solid problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks effectively.
* Proactive approach to identifying and addressing data-related issues and opportunities.
* Ability to work independently and drive improvements in the role.


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. Demonstrations

* Responsible for maintaining the operational and technical integrity of demo and training experiences and providing solutions for improvements

* Advise Sales and Marketing Product Management (MPM) on industry trends and customer feedback
* Maintain advanced knowledge and skill sets of Ross Video’s solutions, which contain product lines including Production Switchers, Character Generation & Graphics, Routing, Signal Processing, Camera motion systems, Video Servers, and Production Workflow tools
