* Maintain training equipment, assist with set-up and prepare equipment prior to training sessions
* Maintain the integrity of the training experience and provides feedback and input
* Maintain knowledge of Ross Solutions and Products, train on multiple platforms, and assist in workflow implementation cross products


Commissioning
  
* Perform onsite software installation and upgrades, commissioning multiple product lines
* Encompasses troubleshooting technical and system issues at customer facilities, providing comprehensive customer and technical support, and maintaining thorough documentation, such as daily reports
* Maintain advanced knowledge in relevant product lines, provide customer feedback to Sales, Management, and Product teams.


Technical Support
  
Assist the Technical Support team to research, diagnose, and resolve customer issues, as required.
  
  

Project Coordination
  
* Be the client-facing contact for the delivery of Ross Video’s solutions, understanding client needs, supporting user requirements creation, and facilitating communication between Ross Video and the client
* Be the bridge between Sales Team and the project, ensuring SOW changes and its associated impact are understood and implemented seamlessly
* Deliver projects to customers through to handover
* Guide project activities and communicate outcomes effectively

* Minimum 5 years of combined experience in Broadcast engineering, operations, systems application, product specialisation, or related fields
* Experience in project coordination
* Proven track record and technical expertise in customer-facing environments
* Understanding of live production operations and workflows and has strong knowledge of industry-standards
* Experience with common Live Production products, including Television graphics systems, video servers, production switchers, routers, and device control protocols
* Ability to clearly communicate and present ideas to various audiences with proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and project management tools, even in highly stressful situations
* Well-organized, very details oriented, positive, determined, and able to work on multiple projects simultaneously
* Must be able to work with a team as well as independently
* Skilled at navigating uncertainty and learning swiftly


**Bonus points if you have the following:**  

* Existing knowledge and use of Ross Video products


**Other:**  

* Holds a valid passport as required to travel up to 60% of time for industry trade shows and Sales Meetings as required
* Valid Driver’s License & a clear driving record
* Work from home office, with high volume travel as required

At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Manufacturing Engineering Support Specialist
  
This position resides within the Manufacturing Engineering Services team. The group’s primary responsibilities are to support the Manufacturing Engineering Team, providing primary support for work instruction creation, MES project creation, change management and technical writing. This position is responsible for ensuring the quality and accuracy of our procedures, work instructions and product through consulting with technical owners and shop floor personnel, scheduled audits, and regular data metric review. Attention to detail, ability to work with others and a broad manufacturing process knowledge are key assets for this role. This role works out of our state of the art manufacturing facility, in Iroquois, On.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager, Manufacturing Engineering Services
  
**Work Arrangement:** Work from office
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

Create and maintain online documentation within a Manufacturing Execution System (MES) software platform, ensuring product build requirements and process workflows are clearly defined and easily accessible for shop floor operators.
  
Provide support to the production floor with respect to software used for production purposes. This includes implementation, training, troubleshooting and maintenance. Assist with build support and troubleshooting in all shop floor processes.
  
Implement MCO/ECO changes into the MES to ensure manufacturing has accurate BOM, documentation and programming information, ensuring proper data integrity and traceability.
  
Change management review of Engineering Change Orders (ECO’s) to ensure Bill of Materials and design data meet the requirements for MES importation.
  
Ensure product is quarantined and appropriately reworked/updated prior to shipment when a WIP/FIN change occurs.
  
Provide technical writing services for the Manufacturing Engineering team, assisting with creation of SOPs and training content for production processes.
  
Assist in MES to Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) integration, maintenance, and training including validating labour hours under the guidance of Manufacturing or Industrial Engineering.
  
Providing reports to assist the Manufacturing, Production, and Industrial Engineering teams
  
Creation of jigs/fixtures, and control documentation using CAD tools, while working with members of the Manufacturing Engineering team to prepare CAD/BOM files for automated equipment SMT, SPI and AOI.
  
Coordinate build requests for alternate component evaluations.
  
  

**Job Requirements:****Knowledge/Education/Training:**  

Post-secondary education or equivalent work experience in a manufacturing environment.
  
Knowledge of CAD systems is an asset.
  
Advanced skill level with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook) and Microsoft Project.
  
Demonstrated knowledge of the manufacturing product lifecycle process.
  
  

**Who you are:**  

Innovative, motivated and eager to learn within a fast-paced environment
  
Work well within a team or independently
  
Possess a solid mechanical aptitude and can follow procedures in a logical way
  
Exceptional attention to detail and willingness to ask questions.
  
  

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

Are you passionate about leveraging data to optimize manufacturing processes? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment where innovation is encouraged? Ross Video is looking for a Manager of Manufacturing Data Infrastructure to lead a talented team of data engineers and analysts in developing cutting-edge data solutions for our manufacturing activities.
  
  

In this role, you will need to balance technical expertise with strong business acumen and management skills. We are seeking a leader who can drive business-focused strategies, inspire their team, and ensure that our data infrastructure aligns with and supports our broader business goals. This role is within our state of the art manufacturing facility located in Iroquois, On.
  
  

**Who you report to:** VP, Manufacturing Engineering and Technologies
  
**Work Arrangement:** Work from Office
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Lead and Inspire: Steer and manage a small team of data engineers and analysts. Provide guidance, support, and performance management while fostering a collaborative and innovative team environment.
* Data Engineering: Oversee the development and maintenance of data solutions, including data hubs, ETL processes, data warehouses, and BI toolsets.
* System Integration: Collaborate with corporate IS to integrate manufacturing systems with business systems (ERP, Agile PLM, SalesForce). Ensure seamless integration of equipment and data sources into the data hub and data lake.
* Support for Production Equipment: Provide IT hardware support specifically for production equipment.
* Software Tools: Identify, evaluate, and integrate software tools for data collection, data entry, and data manipulation, ensuring they enhance data operations within the manufacturing ecosystem.
* Technology Strategy: Recommend and implement technology changes that align with the organization’s strategic goals.
* Business Analysis: Work with manufacturing stakeholders to build out data solutions and streamline processes using software systems like ERP.
* Web Development and Scripting: Develop custom interfaces and perform scripting for data manipulation to support manufacturing needs.
* Data Analytics: Analyze manufacturing data to derive insights and optimize processes.


**Who you are:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, data science, or a related field.
* Proficiency in Python, SQL, and BI tools. Familiarity with databases, dashboards, business metrics, and business intelligence solutions.
* 5-7 years in data engineering, system integration, or a related technical field. At least 3 years in a leadership role, preferably within a manufacturing environment.
* Ability to think critically and analyze complex problems to develop innovative solutions. Keen attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.
* Solid leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate a team. Capable of providing clear direction, support, and mentorship.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and ensure clear, effective communication across teams.
* Commitment to understanding and meeting the needs of internal stakeholders and customers. Ensuring that data solutions provide real value and support business objectives.
* Excellent collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Ability to build solid relationships with stakeholders and facilitate teamwork.
* Ability to think strategically about technology and its role in achieving business goals. Forward-thinking approach to technology adoption and process improvement.


**Bonus points if you have the following:**  

* Excellent collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Ability to build solid relationships with stakeholders and facilitate teamwork
* You have expert-level proficiency in data research and proficiency in understanding infrastructure needs assessments using tools such as cost-benefit research being a bonus


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

As the Marketing Manager - Products, your primary responsibility is to create demand for products and services through effective marketing strategies. This role binds product strategy to sales and marketing tactics, driving success and achieving results. You will be the product evangelist and play an integral role in go-to-market product launches.

Attention to detail and an eye for quality are critical to your success, along with an ability to present our product’s value proposition in a way that resonates and clearly articulates how we solve our buyers’ problems.

In addition to the marketing team, you will regularly collaborate with product teams and, on occasion, the sales teams. This requires strong diplomatic skills, including knowing when to push back and when to dive in.

 Who you report to:  Director, Product Marketing

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best - including flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

*  Go-to-Market Strategy & Execution 
*  Support the product teams in building and implementing comprehensive go-to-market plans, ensuring consistency across communication channels and maximizing overall marketing ROI. 
*  Develop ‘always on’ marketing for products once launched to keep building momentum to support the retention of existing customers and the acquisition of new customers. 
*  Customer-Centric Positioning & Messaging
*  Collaborate with product management teams to create compelling, customer-centric positioning and messaging - ensuring ‘customer voices’ are prominent. 
*  Translate product strategies and complex product features into clear, compelling benefits and value propositions that resonate with customers. 
*  Infuse a deep understanding of customer needs and preferences into marketing materials, enhancing value clarity to our target customers across multiple regions and verticals.  

*  Sales Enablement
*  Collaborate with product management and the marketing content team to create high-impact sales collateral, training materials, award submissions and competitive intelligence tailored to multiple regions and verticals. 
*  Map product messaging to content strategies that mirror the sales process, including building assets to support the growth of business partners. 

Who you are:

*  5+ years of product marketing experience 
*  Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Marketing or Business or Engineering (with appropriate marketing experience) 
*  Proficient in productivity applications such as Microsoft Office, Outlook, Asana, Aha. 
*  Comfortable using collaboration and CRM tools and Marketing Automation tools such as Salesforce, Marketing Cloud Account Engagement, and Google Analytics. 
*  Excellent people skills to interact with colleagues, cross-functional teams and third parties. Team player! 
*  Excellent written, oral and presentation skills. 
*  Strong preference for broadcast industry experience and B2B environments. 
*  Valid passport and willingness to travel to tradeshows and events, as required. 

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion

At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

The Facilities Team is responsible for designing and maintaining the Ottawa R&D Facilities and the global facilities, as well as providing facilities services to all staff. We are a customer service team with Ross Video staff being our primary customers. The Facilities Coordinator is a pivotal role responsible for coordinating, organizing, and documenting facilities service activities and initiatives. Reporting to the Facilities Coordinator, Team Lead, you will coordinate repairs, maintenance schedules, alterations, occupancy services, help desk as needed and facilities related third-party contractors across the global portfolio.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager, Global Facilities
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Identifies and understands changing needs of end users, addressing their needs and managing their expectations regarding the office environment, amenities, and services.
* Provide support and assistance to employees regarding facilities related issues, requests, and inquiries, ensuring a comfortable and functional work environment.
* Provide oversight of office furniture and building operations encompassing HVAC and electrical systems. Involves managing maintenance activities to enhance facility infrastructure, diagnose issues, introduce efficiency enhancements, and prioritize occupancy safety.
* Oversee external vendors, contractors, and service providers for various facilities-related services to ensure they deliver high-quality services and implement improvements to ensure service standards are met and maintained.
* Work with relevant subject matter experts to develop evacuation plans and updates as required to ensure plans are relevant for each site.
* Assist with the development of the budget for facilities-related expenses, monitoring costs, and identifying opportunities for cost savings or efficiency improvements. Works with Finance, Accounting and Purchasing to process variable types of documents for procurement, receiving and payment of contracted services, as well as reporting on completeness of projects and orders. Identifies most appropriate service provider for facility related services. When needed, prepare, and maintain RFP’s, bid information, and other contract documents.
* Manage inventory of office supplies and equipment, and track company assets including furniture and technology within facilities.
* Serve as the main point of contact for communication with landlords or property management, addressing lease agreements, resolving maintenance issues, and other landlord-related matters.
* Represents End User requirements and needs during implementation of projects and be responsible for follow up on actions based on various team projects.
* Work independently, handle multiple concurrent demands, make routine decisions within defined guidelines, and seek guidance for more complex issues.
* Participation in joint health & safety committees where appropriate.
* Be available to cover main receptionist when required.
* Additional duties may be assigned to support the goals and objectives of the Facilities Management department as needed.


**Who you are:**  

* Facilities Management Certificate (e.g. FMA, FMC, FMP, SFP, CFM) OR a college / university degree in a facilities related field.
* 3 to 5 years of experience in facilities management or facilities related field.
* Strong knowledge in systems furniture, space management, health and safety, inventory management, asset management, relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards pertaining to facilities management and regulatory oversight.
* Strong communication, interpersonal, leadership, and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to respond quickly and accurately to all client requests; strong trouble-shooting skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
* Demonstrated customer service excellence.


**Other:**  

* May require travel to Ross Global offices.
* A driver’s license is required.
* Frequent walking between several buildings at the Ottawa Campus.
* Able to lift 25 lbs.
* Able to maneuver dolly with 50-75lbs of goods.


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. **What the job is all about:**  

* Participate in the full software development lifecycle – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, documentation, testing, and maintenance.
* Be a part of a larger team to provide technical leadership, architect, and implement our web applications on our existing and new switcher products.
* Collaborate with the leadership, UX, Marketing, and Product Management to enable an excellent front-end user experience.

The Executive Assistant to the CEO provides high-level administrative support to the Chief Executive Officer, ensuring the smooth operation of the CEO's office. This role involves managing the CEO's schedule, handling and responding to correspondence, arranging travel plans, and performing various tasks to support the CEO in achieving the company's strategic objectives.
  
When time permits, this role also assists other members of the Board and the Executive Leadership Team. The Executive Assistant is required to maintain confidentiality while professionally and courteously representing the CEO in all interactions.
  
**Work Arrangement:** Hybrid. This position is based in the Greater Ottawa Area and requires being present in the Ottawa (Auriga Drive) office two to three days per week.
  
**Who you report to:** Chief Executive Officer
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Calendar Management: Schedule and coordinate meetings, appointments, and unallocated time for the CEO; proactively identify priorities, deadlines, and urgent matters to optimize the executive's time; ensure recurring meetings are held consistently; anticipate and resolve scheduling conflicts and adapt quickly to changing priorities; manage the Corporate Calendar.
* Travel Arrangements: Organize and manage complex travel plans, including booking flights, hotels, and transportation; coordinate with stakeholders to prepare detailed travel itineraries and background information; ensure all necessary travel documents and visas are in order.
* Communication: Regularly review the CEO’s incoming email and social media messages looking for opportunities to proactively respond and manage requests for the CEO; proactively assist in selectively growing the CEO’s social media followers; manage incoming and outgoing paper mail; coordinate these activities with the CEO with regular updates as appropriate; perform follow-ups for the CEO as required.
* Relationship Management: Develop and sustain strong relationships and a level of professionalism with stakeholders, including executives, board members, employees, shareholders, suppliers, business partners, customers and the public; work collaboratively with other Executive and Administrative Assistants within the company.
* Event Management: Coordinate board meetings, Quarterly Staff Update meetings, shareholder meetings, industry association meetings, select company events, and other special events as requested to ensure they happen smoothly; consolidate and if required, convert associated presentations into standard formats.
* Information Management: Handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion; assist with expense reports, timesheets, and credit cards; check direct report expenses and minor purchase approvals; company car logs and appointments; manage certain company charitable donations; manage selected company travel points systems.
* Administrative Support: Ensure food and drinks arrive when required; ensure the CEO office is clean, tidy and well equipped; very rarely, perform personal errands.
* Organizational Integration: Optionally, become an active member of the Social Committee, Health and Safety Committee, Health and Wellness Committee, and other groups in Ross to build an additional bridge between the Office of the CEO and the rest of the company.
* Other: Handle special projects and tasks as assigned by the CEO; proactively look for additional ways to help others in the organization when time permits; perform other related duties as required.


**Who you are:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, communications, or a related field preferred.
* Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in an administrative role preferred
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to make sound decisions under pressure
* High attention to detail.
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Ability to multi-task when required and with a good sense of urgency.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Ability to work independently and unsupervised, as well as part of a team.
* Proactive and able to anticipate the needs of the CEO.
* Ability to deal with confidential information with a high degree of diplomacy; ability to build trusted relationships.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams)


**Other:**  

* Driver’s License and access to a vehicle


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. The Inside Sales Specialist is a hands-on role that plays an active part in helping develop Ross Video’s pipeline for revenue generation through the creation of sales leads, initiation of prospect calls, and establishment of ongoing rapport with existing and potential customers. As a direct extension of our front-line group of Regional Sales Managers, the Inside Sales Specialist facilitates sales opportunities with both end users and via Ross’ authorized business partner network.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager, Inside Sales - North America
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Handle inbound, unsolicited prospect calls and convert them into sales.
* Make outbound follow-up contact with existing customers via telephone and e-mail to determine customer satisfaction, cross-sell and up-sell opportunities.
* Advise and assist business partners, system integrators and clients concerning sales and purchase of Ross Video product line.
* Emphasize product/service features and benefits, prepare quotes, and discuss terms.

job_title: Junior FPGA and Hardware Developer (Job Req #2024-186)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

The ideal candidate is part of our product development team creating world-leading next generation broadcast video processing technology. You develop and maintain the development lab to ensure the highest quality product possible, and enable various groups to do the same. You participate in all phases of FPGA development from specifications and design, to customer support with a focus on ensuring the quality of our products. Coordinating with the senior DevOps engineers to bring development and operations together through integration to create products more efficiently and of the highest quality.
  
  

You are very proficient in Python scripting and integrating into a DevOps automation framework environment. You enjoy working hands on with hardware products in a lab environment. You have a good understanding of RTL design and implementation and are looking to contribute to many different aspects of product design.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Director, Hyperconverged Solutions – Platforms
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Write and maintain testcases as part of the DevOps automation framework
* Collaborate with various groups to contribute to the automation framework environment
* Maintain the development lab and equipment
* Work with members of several groups and team members to verify the functionality of products
* Generate and maintain documentation and test plans to track and ensure product quality
* Support PV/QA throughout development – validating feedback, and debugging/fixing hardware problems as required
* Participate in Agile Scrum ceremonies like stand-ups, retrospectives, refinement, and sprint kick-offs
* Contribute to FPGA design/implementation tasks in various areas


**Who you are:**  

* In-depth knowledge of several scripting languages (Tcl, Perl, Bash) and in particular Python
* Knowledge of Git revision control systems, branching and tagging methodologies
* Good knowledge of hardware debugging and design
* Good understanding of continuous integration/delivery practices and other DevOps concepts
* Familiarity with the following technologies:
* Jenkins and Gitlab CI/CD pipelines
* SoC FPGA interconnects such as Avalon or AXI interfaces
* PCI Express, Ethernet 1/10/25/100GE, 12G-SDI, HDMI, DisplayPort
* High-speed transceivers
* Timing recovery / Synchronization
* Vivado and Quartus development tools
* Knowledge of software languages such as C, C++ a plus
* Understanding of digital video, audio and associated audio standards a plus
* B.S. in Engineering required
* Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work as part of a team or independently as required
* Keen observational skills and problem solving intuition
* Organized and detail oriented self-starter
* Ability to learn new concepts quickly and work towards finding creative solutions to challenging problems
* Comfortable moving forward aggressively; balancing risks appropriately to optimize success across all business aspects – good, fast, and cheap
* Equally comfortable contributing as a team member or championing your own ideas
* Minimum 2-4 years FPGA development experience
* Knowledgeable in Video/Audio technologies preferred


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. job_title: Vice President of Sales - North America (Job Req #2024-217)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

The Vice President of Sales - North America, plays a critical role in steering Ross Video's strategic direction and execution of sales initiatives across multiple vertical markets, including Broadcast, Sports & Live Events, AV Corporate sectors and other segments within the North America region.
  
This executive leadership position is tasked with setting and realizing sales objectives, spearheading strategic partnerships, and guiding the sales team towards achieving the company's expansive business goals. By working in concert with the Senior Vice President of Global Sales and other members of Ross leadership team, the VP of Sales, North America, ensures that regional strategies are not only aligned with global objectives but also tailored to capitalize on the unique opportunities and challenges across these diverse verticals.
  
The role demands a proactive approach to expanding market share and fostering innovation in product and service offerings, with a focus on providing a superior customer experience, making Ross Video a preferred partner in the industry.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Senior Vice President of Global Sales
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Collaborate and align with the Corporate Marketing, Vertical Markets & Solutions, and Product teams to ensure a cohesive market strategy, leveraging cross-functional insights to drive regional sales initiatives and support global brand positioning.
* Strategically steer the North America sales direction, aligning regional goals with global sales objectives and customizing efforts to penetrate multiple vertical markets such as Broadcast, Sports & Live Events, and AV Corporate.
* Develop and implement strategic plans to meet sales targets and expand the customer base across the diverse North America markets.
* Lead the North America Team to consistently achieve quarterly and annual sales targets by managing a stratified client pipeline to ensure key prospects are identified, prioritized, and pursued to meet financial goals.
* Lead and collaborate with the North America Management Team to develop short- and long-term strategic plans, including the preparation of annual business plans.
* Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships, understanding their needs across various industries.
* Act as an example of sales excellence and strategic leadership, fostering a culture of accountability, collaboration, and high performance.
* Continuously seek and implement productivity improvements within the sales team to enhance both efficiency and effectiveness, leveraging innovative tools, processes, and strategies to optimize operations and drive superior sales performance.
* Enhance organizational effectiveness through strategic recruitment, mentoring, and development.
* Collaborate with the Channel Manager to develop and execute channel partner engagement and expansion strategies, aiming to widen market reach and deepen penetration in key segments, ensuring a unified approach to market penetration.
* Provide accurate sales forecasting and QBRs and compile reports for the Senior Vice President of Global Sales and the executive leadership, facilitating informed strategic decisions.
* Create training and development plans for direct reports, including contributing to the evolution of the Ross Way To Sell (RWTS), and ensuring the sales team is following RWTS practices. Complete Performance Reviews for your direct reports timely and thoroughly.
* Represent Ross Video at industry events, conferences, and trade shows to promote the company’s innovations across vertical markets.
* Monitor market trends and competitor activities, adapting strategies to maintain competitiveness and meet customer needs.
* Drive the adoption of sales processes and tools to maximize team productivity and effectiveness.
* Actively participate in the Global Sales Leadership Team, contributing to the formulation and execution of global sales strategies and initiatives.
* Exude the behaviors identified within Ross Video’s Culture Statements and adhere to the company’s Code of Ethics, setting a standard for integrity and professionalism within the team.
* Perform other related duties as required by the Senior Vice President of Global Sales, demonstrating flexibility and a commitment to Ross Video's overarching goals.


**Who you are:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in technology, business administration, marketing, sales, or a related field.
* 7+ years of proven experience in leadership roles within the broadcast or related technology sectors.
* Demonstrated ability to communicate, present, and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization, including executive and C-level.
* Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills.
* Proven ability to drive the sales process from plan to close with a track record of consistently meeting or exceeding targets.
* Strong experience in all aspects of sales, including growth strategies, distribution channel management, account development, and business planning.
* Demonstrate exceptional ability to influence without authority and effectively resolve conflicts, fostering a collaborative environment where diverse perspectives are valued, and consensus is achieved.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, with proficiency in additional languages relevant to the North America region being highly desirable.
* Strong business acumen and industry expertise, with a deep understanding of regional market dynamics within the North America territory.
* Demonstrated knowledge of accounting and financial practices.
* Exceptional mentoring, coaching, and people management skills.
* Excellent negotiation and leadership skills, with the ability to set and achieve challenging goals.
* Advanced analytical and quantitative skills to interpret data and translate it into actionable insights.
* High level of integrity, professionalism, and the ability to maintain confidentiality.
* Willingness to travel extensively across the North America region and internationally as required.


The VP of Sales - North America, role at Ross Video is designed for a strategic leader dedicated to guiding the company's expansion across a broad spectrum of vertical markets.
  
  

This individual will not only drive significant sales growth but also embody and promote Ross Video's core values and ethical standards. As a key member of the Global Sales Leadership Team, the successful candidate will play a crucial role in shaping and executing global sales strategies, ensuring the alignment of regional objectives with the company's overall goals.
  
  

This leadership position emphasizes strategic thinking, team development, and a deep commitment to fostering long-term customer relationships, thereby securing Ross Video's position as a leader in the broadcast and media technology industry.
  
  

**Other:**  

* Willing to Travel up to 50% of the time.
* Valid Passport.
* Valid Driver’s License & a clear driving record.

This position based in Sacramento, CA. focuses on assisting in the successful installation of D3 LED displays and providing a wide range of mechanical, electrical, electronics and control system on site technical support. Providing top-level system troubleshooting, electronics repair and testing. Assisting, interacting, and collaborating with systems technician, production, and project management team members to assure successful project completion. Check for common problems such as defective manufacturing or loose connections, refer to schematics and specifications to locate malfunction; electronics repair, and testing; document services performed; crimp connector terminals; assemble discrete wiring and harnesses, soldering components using hand and wave soldering techniques. Methodical approach to all intended tasks and approach to problem solving is necessary. Self-starter spirit with naturally strong rapport with customers and subcontractor trades will be highly valued.
  
  

This position is a 6-month contract.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Provide on-site and/or remote technical support including tasks such as system troubleshooting, electronics repair and testing.
* 80% Travel
* Install operating systems and video equipment for LED displays and performing commissioning procedures to ensure proper system functionality.
* Ability to manage and monitor all installed systems and infrastructure
* Competency in writing and maintaining custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower downtime due to required human intervention
* Work alongside the team to help design information and operational support systems
* Assist Project Manager in physical installation, operator training and technical support of LED Display
* Coordination with various disciplined subcontractors as necessary during installation and supplemental maintenance visits
* Monitor and test performance of applications, foreseeing potential issues and identifying possible solutions
* Ability to work with developers to implement those fixes
* Excellence in communication as a liaison with vendors and other IT personnel to resolve issues
* Perform other duties as needed and directed by Field Service Manager.


**Who you are:**  

* Associates degree or higher in a technician, electrical engineering, computer technology or mechatronics-based field of study or 3+ years relevant experience in a related field.
* 2 years or greater of technician experience, preferably (but not required) within the electronics industry.
* Advanced computer hardware and networking knowledge.
* Proven ability to monitor systems successfully and efficiently
* Proven working experience in the above fields including installing, configuring, and troubleshooting UNIX /Linux based environments
* Experience with use of Multi-meter required, soldering and fiber termination skills a plus.
* Experienced with reading and interpreting blueprints, construction drawings and schematics.
* Working knowledge and experience Microsoft Office tools, specifically Excel, Word, Project, and Visio.
* Valid driver's license and passport with ability to travel locally and worldwide on short notice via air or ground.
* Able to work from a ladder, at various heights, including on aerial platforms and carry tools/ladder/parts to and from work site.
* Required to bend, reach, lift and use hands, vision and hearing to perform essential on site and troubleshooting tasks.


**Expectations:**  

* This is a fast-moving position with a high expectation to execute industry best service of top quality and the highest level of tech innovation using exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
* Must be able to take direction and work with minimal supervision and guidance in a fast paced and at times pressure packed environment.​

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

As a Senior Electronic Technician (ET) you will be responsible for the successful troubleshooting of electronic assemblies and systems from production fallout and customer returns. The ETs may work closely with the manufacturing test development team to learn new products and work with the production cells to support the test systems. ETs will have the opportunity to work with a large variety of products and technologies. This role works to troubleshoot and recover the electronic products that failed production process and test steps and the products returned by customers.
  
**Who you report to:** Manager, Troubleshoot & RMA
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Trouble shoot issues that were not solved by other team members.
* Use bench top equipment and tools (hardware and software) to test and debug products.
* Utilizes the proper routing, rework, and knowledgebase tools that help create a sustainable production system.
* Document work, assisting others who may face similar issues. Update troubleshoot guides as required.
* Validate the determined repairs by testing and measuring units after defect identification and repair.
* Shares technical knowledge, insights, and best practices with coworkers.
* Eagerness to learn new things and take on different responsibilities when needed.
* Perform production configuration, testing and calibration following established procedures, policies, and protocols.
* Follows quality guidelines and documented processes while ensuring others do the same.
* Works alongside product engineering to understand the new products and technologies.
* Work with production managers, lead-hands, and cell supervisors to support production demands.
* Takes ownership of the functional role by suggesting improvements and adapting to change.
* Adhere to Ross Video Health and Safety policies.
* Perform other related duties as required that contribute to manufacturing’s overall success.


**Who you are:**  

* Possess an Electronics Technician/Technologist diploma and/or completed a multi-year program in electronics.
* Solid understanding of electronic theory and applications, with emphasis on digital components such as CPU, FPGA, flash, etc
* Excellent foundations in schematic reading and interpretation.
* Working knowledge of Linux and other command line interface with hardware
* Knowledge of JTAG technologies (IEEE 1149.1, 1149.6)
* Familiarity with wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.).
* Manages a wide range of tasks and projects, often with significant complexity and impact.
* Takes on leadership roles in major projects or initiatives, driving them to successful completion.
* Interacts extensively with various departments, external stakeholders, and customers.
* Plays a strategic role in shaping the direction of projects, teams, and potentially the organization.
* Engages in cross-departmental and cross-functional initiatives, providing strategic and technical guidance.
* Minimum of 4 years of electronic troubleshooting experience on complex printed circuit board assemblies.
* Experience with scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, C, C++ or equivalent.
* Working proficiency PC/Windows computer skills specifically related to network and serial interface and configuration.
* Must have computer proficiency with Microsoft Office and core business-use tools.
* Knowledge of video and audio standards and broadcasting would be an asset.

As a Configuration Technician, you will enable and test software/hardware items that are offered as options on custom Sales Orders. Your role involves interpreting our customer configuration documentation, DWI’s or Sales Order notes to meet these requirements and use these documents to verify configuration. In this role you will mentor, train and support other team members in their development
  
  

**Who you report to:** Production Manager, Configuration & Systems
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Configuring systems to meet sales order criteria which involves picking finished goods hardware from stock to populate and align into frame chassis or systems for software loads, licensing and testing according to customer requirements.
* Create data records which associate product serial numbers to their parent Sales Order.
* System level debug if product doesn’t perform as expected with the configuration hardware in place.
* Determine whether failures are assembly or system related hardware problems or are due to test infrastructure issues (failures at circuit board level passed to another dept for research)
* Confirm procedure adherence and infrastructure integrity. If the root cause is a PCBA, funnel it to the PCBA Test group for repair.
* Coordinate with technical departments to perform critical product changes that affect inventory (physical routing for rework/testing, relabeling, etc.) which includes reprogramming with new software updates.
* Works closely with Test Development regarding new product introduction by learning new test processes, infrastructure and aligning these processes with upper-level sales order line items, including all corresponding custom configuration documentation.
* Will be responsible for training Configuration Testers


**Who you are:**  

* Able to work with in a Team environment
* Excellent communication skills
* Manufacturing experience within an electronics environment
* Understanding of inventory processes
* Able to Identify products failing specifications and route product accordingly, both physically and in the routing system.
* High level PC/Windows computer skills.
* A+ Certification


**Bonus points if you have the following:**  

* Innovative
* Demonstrated work experience
* Willing to share your knowledge
* Passion to learn

The Director, Product Marketing is a newly created critical leadership role within the marketing team driven by the mandate of standardizing and modernizing the product marketing function at Ross. This includes collaborating closely with product and sales teams to establish processes for go-to-market, positioning and messaging, sales enablement, and competitor intelligence.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Vice President, Marketing
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Go-to-Market Strategy & Execution
* Partner with product management teams to develop comprehensive go-to-market plans, ensuring consistency across communication channels and maximizing overall marketing ROI.
* Oversee successful go-to-market execution by product marketing managers.
* Customer-Centric Positioning & Messaging
* Collaborate with product management teams to create compelling, customer-centric positioning and messaging - ensuring ‘customer voices’ are prominent.
* Translate product strategies and complex product features into clear, compelling benefits and value propositions that resonate with customers.
* Infuse a deep understanding of customer needs and preferences into marketing materials, enhancing value clarity to our target customers across multiple regions and verticals.
* Sales Enablement
* Collaborate with product management to create high impact sales collateral, training materials, and competitive intelligence tailored to multiple regions and verticals.
* Define processes to customer-validate messaging and positioning destined for enablement.
* Map product messaging to content strategies that mirror the sales process.
* Team Management & Collaboration:
* Establish and maintain a symbiotic relationship between product management and product marketing, ensuring that modernization and standardization are embraced, and that change-management is factored in for long-term company success.
* Oversee the success of the product marketing team (currently consisting of three product marketing managers) within the larger marketing group, and establish appropriate product marketing team size and skill-set as the company continues to grow.


**Who you are:**  

* 10 years of experience in a product marketing role, with at least 5 years of experience leading teams.
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a range of stakeholders.
* Strong preference for broadcast industry experience and B2B environments.
* Demonstrated product launch success across multiple verticals and regions.
* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or related field.
* Familiarity with Pragmatic and/or other product marketing frameworks.
* Excellent written, oral and presentation skills.
* Office environment (hybrid / work from home acceptable).
* Valid passport and willingness to travel to tradeshows and events, as required.

With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

At Ross Mobile Productions (Ross MP), we power video production for hundreds of shows each year across the United States and the World using the industry’s widest range of smart production solutions, you will help create. Our company is experiencing strong growth in eSports, entertainment and sports and is searching for a dynamic, self-motivated, highly technical doer to take Ross MP engineering to the next level.
  
  

As a Broadcast Engineer at Ross MP, you will work with a team of like-minded experts building and then engineering trucks and fly packs with the latest and greatest Ross equipment. You will then deploy what your team builds in remote events for the top networks and brands in several industries. As an experienced engineer and Ross leader, you will begin to develop new/creative/innovative technical offerings that will meet our customer’s needs, help differentiate Ross and Ross MP in the market place and continue the business’ strong expansion.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager, Broadcast Engineering
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**More specifically, you will be:**  

* Working with dedicated broadcast hardware including all Ross products and other best standard industry equipment.
* Doing system design and building and on site integration and set up to include video path, audio path, fiber linked systems, digital video compression and transmission standards, PC networking, Master Control facilities and hub, and network storage systems. This will include broadcast trucks, fly packs and fiber kits.
* Do Tech Books, Tech Manage Crew on site, Set up Shipments to or from shows.
* Manage and run your own truck, work with E2 and Equipment Manager on the inventory of your truck.
* Help give suggestions to the team on how to improve a system.
* Interacting daily with customers at the event and deliver the Ross MP experience.
* Working closely with Producers for the event and assist with managing the crew.
* Pack and unpack your truck and drive to and from Remotes with your E2 .
* Build shows from the ground up, including router configuration, signal flow troubleshooting, and working with various technicians to establish show requirements and turn them into executed solutions.
* Able to coordinate transmission and set up transmission for your show.
* Maintaining a positive work atmosphere by behaving and communicating in a manner that works well with co-workers, supervisors, customers and vendors.
* Provide guidance and training to E2 and/or less experienced team members.
* Responsible end-to-end for large scale events, overseeing extensive crew.


If you are a strong technical mind with 4+ years of relevant, hands-on experience and want to work with the coolest technology on the best events and maximize your potential, alongside a team of Ross superstars, this role may be just for you. If you are familiar with broadcast signal flow or networking, have built or engineered equipment, worked on the technical side of the live event industry or love technology and trends, and you want to be the best at what you do, please apply! If, on top of all this, you like sports and eSports, perform well under pressure and love challenges, then we definitely want to meet you.
  
  

We will offer you the opportunity to work with cutting-edge broadcast production solutions, to be part of a passionate & talented team, we will send you to fascinating places to engineers shows at the highest levels (we estimate that you could travel more then 50% of the time so make sure your driver’s license and passport are valid!).
  
  

Ross Mobile Productions currently has 6 of the most powerful small mobile units in the Industry, a studio and fly packs at all levels. 2019/2020 promises to be the most exciting time ever, worldwide, with new equipment and customers coming on board. Be a part of events for the biggest networks, eSports companies and media brands. Be a part of Ross MP.
  
  

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

job_title: Web Developer - Marketing (6 Month Contract) (Job Req #2024-207)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

As a Web Developer in the Digital Marketing team, your role is to design, develop, and maintain web-based solutions that enhance the overall customer experience across Ross's digital platforms. Your projects will include the Ross AI Support Chat, which involves implementing and managing AI technologies within the server architecture using Microsoft Copilot Studio. Additionally, you will work on various customer-facing web properties such as the Ross website and other digital assets owned by Ross.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Director, Digital Marketing
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Web Development:
* Create efficient, testable code and user-friendly interfaces to enhance visitor interactions across all digital properties.
* Integrate data from various back-end services and databases.
* Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs.
* Ensure cross-browser compatibility and troubleshoot website issues as they arise.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to implement web features that improve user engagement and experience.
* Stay plugged into emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities.
* Assist with managing web-hosted assets such as software downloads and documentation for products.
* AI Support Chat Development:
* Assist in designing and implementing an AI-powered chatbot using Microsoft Copilot Studio.
* Ensure the chatbot provides accurate, efficient, and human-like interactions to enhance user experience.
* Integrate the chatbot with various platforms, including Zendesk, the Ross website, and other public-facing platforms such as Ross Community.
* Scale the AI support chat to include all products in the Ross portfolio using vectorized methods to enhance the chatbot's ability to retrieve and provide accurate information across a wide range of products.
* Documentation Management:
* Facilitate the easy addition and management of new products and documentation sources.
* Ensure the chatbot can support an expanding range of products, aiming to cover the entire Ross product portfolio.
* AI System Optimization:
* Monitor and improve the accuracy and relevancy of AI responses.
* Implement guardrails to maintain on-topic conversations and prevent misuse.
* Explore advanced techniques and support the optimization of existing systems for better performance.
* Integration and Deployment:
* Manage the integration of AI solutions with existing digital marketing platforms.
* Coordinate with the IT and marketing teams to ensure seamless deployment of AI tools.
* Data Analysis and Feedback:
* Assist in analyze user interactions and feedback to identify areas for improvement.
* Collaborate with UX/UI designers to enhance the user experience based on analytics and user feedback.


**Who you are:**  

* Post-secondary education in Computer Science, AI/ML, or a related field.
* Strong knowledge of web development technologies and frameworks.
* Experience with AI/ML technologies and frameworks, including familiarity with Microsoft Copilot Studio, OpenAI, Power Apps, and other AI tools.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Strong communication and teamwork abilities.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python, Ruby, Go, Node.js, C#, etc.
* Experience with WordPress development.
* Basic Linux knowledge is preferred.


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. This role binds product strategy to sales and marketing tactics, driving success and achieving results. You will be the product evangelist and play an integral role in go-to-market product launches.

Attention to detail and an eye for quality are critical to your success, along with an ability to present our product’s value proposition in a way that resonates and clearly articulates how we solve our buyers’ problems.

In addition to the marketing team, you will regularly collaborate with product teams and, on occasion, the sales teams. This requires strong diplomatic skills, including knowing when to push back and when to dive in.

 Who you report to:  Director, Product Marketing

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best - including flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

*  Go-to-Market Strategy & Execution 
*  Support the product teams in building and implementing comprehensive go-to-market plans, ensuring consistency across communication channels and maximizing overall marketing ROI. 
*  Develop ‘always on’ marketing for products once launched to keep building momentum to support the retention of existing customers and the acquisition of new customers. 
*  Customer-Centric Positioning & Messaging
*  Collaborate with product management teams to create compelling, customer-centric positioning and messaging - ensuring ‘customer voices’ are prominent. 
*  Translate product strategies and complex product features into clear, compelling benefits and value propositions that resonate with customers. 
*  Infuse a deep understanding of customer needs and preferences into marketing materials, enhancing value clarity to our target customers across multiple regions and verticals.  

*  Sales Enablement
*  Collaborate with product management and the marketing content team to create high-impact sales collateral, training materials, award submissions and competitive intelligence tailored to multiple regions and verticals. 
*  Map product messaging to content strategies that mirror the sales process, including building assets to support the growth of business partners. 

Who you are:

*  5+ years of product marketing experience 
*  Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Marketing or Business or Engineering (with appropriate marketing experience) 
*  Proficient in productivity applications such as Microsoft Office, Outlook, Asana, Aha. 
*  Comfortable using collaboration and CRM tools and Marketing Automation tools such as Salesforce, Marketing Cloud Account Engagement, and Google Analytics. 
*  Excellent people skills to interact with colleagues, cross-functional teams and third parties. Team player! 
*  Excellent written, oral and presentation skills. 
*  Strong preference for broadcast industry experience and B2B environments. 
*  Valid passport and willingness to travel to tradeshows and events, as required. 

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion

At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

The ideal candidate is part of our software team creating world-leading next generation broadcast video processing technology including compressed video streaming. He/she coordinates with the product manager on overall product vision and leads a team in the design of new products and the improvement of existing products.
  
  

Our team is Agile and DevOps aligned, with a focus on continuous learning and automation. We hold backlog refinements and post-mortems, regularly tackle technical debt and reserve time for innovation.
  
  

If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. Major award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Director TPM, Edge Technologies, KVM
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best - including flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Participate in Agile Scrum ceremonies like retrospectives, refinement, and sprint kick-offs
* Participate in a daily scrum meeting and work with team members afterward to resolve a blocking integration issue
* Work with an FPGA designer to help debug a lab issue and create code to help gather additional telemetry and status information
* Participate in a design/code review of a field system update software and provide your feedback on how to better handle a fault condition
* Review test coverage strategy and provide feedback to further improve coverage or to scale back based on acceptable risk
* Work with a hardware and software designer to resolve a FIFO overflow issue
* Implement in C++ a driver that controls a hardware accelerator to perform color correction for high dynamic range video
* Document an API to support integration with another software team
* Design a thread safe register interface module for a high-speed register interface
* Host a post-mortem, capture the feedback, and make plans for changes
* Discuss the implementation of a new customer requested feature with the marketing team and product manager
* Work with the project manager to identify key project milestones and integrations
* Help maintain the Linux R&D build server and create a script to add a new feature to our build automation flow
* Meet with software and RTL designers to propose a lab integration strategy
* Teach a new hire how to analyze network packets with Wireshark
* Perform other related duties as required


As a team leader, the candidate will also be expected to oversee the following:
  
* Propose a vision or theme for the next sprint
* Review the backlog, add stories, points and prioritize
* Lead the design team, other cross functional teams, suppliers and customers to ensure the overall design and each specified sub-system meets all requirements according to an established project plan
* Provide significant technical leadership to design review preparation, execution, and timely action item closure for complex issues
* Document the design to a high standard for internal and customer review
* Effectively communicate technology applications and benefits to a wide audience including customers and design partners.
* Coach and mentor team members to attain breakthrough results in assigned deliverables


**Who you are:**  

* Bachelors degree in computer science, computer engineering, software engineering or related discipline
* Experienced with C and C++
* Experience leading software and mixed discipline development teams
* Experience with ARM multi-processor systems within an embedded Linux environment
* Possess experience developing under Linux with GNU tool chain
* Experience working with scripted tool flow (tcl, perl, sh), source control
* Experience working with lab equipment to debug complex designs that could involve multiple people.
* Knowledge of TCP/IP networking including familiarity with UDP, TCP, HTTP, FTP, SLP, Zeroconf.
* Knowledge of software design for embedded system with a mix of application, library and driver development is an asset
* Ability to resolve memory leaks and deadlocks
* Knowledge of creating hardware stubs for simulated testing
* Experience performing static code analysis
* Knowledge of revision control systems, branching and tagging methodologies
* Expertise in software debugging through JTAG interfaces and logic analyzers
* Familiarity with hardware integration and lab tools


#LI-JD1
  
  

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross!
