job_title: Freelance Demonstrator and Trainer –News Production Workflow
job_description:
FREELANCE OPPORTUNITIES AT ROSS VIDEOIn addition to our full time roles, we rely on talented external Freelancers to supplement our team. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible.
  
  

The Freelance Demonstration Artist and Training Specialist is responsible for performing training of Ross products, solutions, and integrations at client locations globally. The position requires above average knowledge on the following products or their industry equivalents: Ross Inception, Newsroom Control Systems, Social Media Management, MOS, Streamline Pro, Streamline Xchange, and Streamline Classic. This front-line individual is responsible for managing customer expectations, completing required documentation, providing end user operational training, and ensuring integrity of the training experience. This key individual works closely with our Sales and Demonstration Artist Team to ensure delivery of the Ross Superior Customer Experience.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
Demonstrations
  
* Perform on-site, off-site, online/remote customer demonstrations.
* Assist the Inception team with content creation, organization, and technical execution of major trade shows throughout the year.
* Is responsible for the operational and technical integrity of both the demo and training experience and offers effective solutions for areas of improvement in house and online.
* Set up demo equipment, assist with set-up and prepare/test gear prior to demos.
* Advise the Sales and Product Management (PM) groups regarding current industry trends and customer feedback.
* Maintain above average knowledge base and skill set in the functionality and demonstration of all system features for Inception Solutions
* Develop demonstration techniques, methods, and materials for use by other demo staff.


Training
  
* Perform on-site, off-site, and online/remote customer training.
* Maintain training equipment, assist with set-up and prepare/test gear prior to training sessions.
* Assist in the development of News Production Workflow customer training methods, materials, and techniques.
* Provide feedback to the Inception and Streamline Product Management on product operation, features and roadmap.
* Participate in the review process for upcoming software feature lists.
* Champion customer needs, notably operational features, roll-out and training methods as well as future feature requirements
* Actively participate in Ross’ user forums, lead key discussions, and assist Inception users.
* A maximum of 75% international travel is possible.
* Must have a valid passport and driver’s license.


Knowledge/Experience
  
* Post-secondary degree related to television broadcast or appropriate work experience in a broadcast/post/corporate video environment using a newsroom control system.
* Minimum of 5 years’ experience in training required.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* In-depth knowledge of newsroom workflows, production, customer needs and applications
* Background knowledge of MAM systems is a plus.
* Experience in the selling and marketing process for broadcast equipment is very useful.
* Knowledge of use of Ross Video products and a willingness to learn how to demonstrate and train on these products, notably: Inception News and Inception Social
* Organized and very detail oriented.
* Ability to problem solve and troubleshoot.
* Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changing environments.
* Experience in the selling and marketing process for broadcast equipment is ideal.
* Fluent in English with additional languages a bonus

Ross Video specializes in the design of products and solutions for the professional broadcast market. We manufacture and support a wide range of innovative products for use in broadcast, distribution, live event and production applications. Ross Video products have sold into more than 100 countries. Visit www.rossvideo.com to learn more.
  
  

The Freelance Demo Artist & Trainer – Sports Generalist is responsible for performing the commissioning and training of Ross products and integrating these into the Sports systems at client locations globally. The position requires above average knowledge on Ross Switchers, XPression, Dashboard and Ultrix. This front line individual is responsible for managing customer expectations, completing required documentation, providing end user technical & operational training and ensuring that the system performs as specified. job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

As a Senior Financial Accounting Analyst at Ross Video, you will be responsible for ensuring timely and complete month end close procedures, preparing complex accounting entries and reconciliations, generating required financial reports and audit support, implementing our new ERP system, developing, and implementing business process improvements and required internal controls. With a strong working knowledge of IFRS accounting, solid experience working in all aspects of general accounting, reporting and financial systems you will become an integral part of the Ross finance team and will report to the Manager of Financial Reporting.
  
**Who you report to:** Manager, Financial Reporting
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Responsible for supporting the month end close process, overseeing the balance sheet, identifying issues, and making recommendations for the accounting treatment of various financial transactions.
* Prepare capital schedules, reconciliations, and reports for the executive leadership team.
* Process and reconcile deferred revenue transactions, ensuring revenue for completed services is earned in correct period.
* Develop and maintain reports, reconciliations and working papers used for financial reporting and analysis, external audits, and year-end processes.
* Compare anticipated financial outcomes with actual results to identify areas for improvement, develop recommendations and follow through on the required implementation deliverables.
* Work with business partners to explain difficult financial concepts, provide data and analysis to assist in decision making and problem solving.
* Mentor and support junior staff in resolving issues to address / streamline financial transactions and processes.
* Support the transition to the new ERP system, the establishment of the new business processes and the identification and implementation of required internal controls.
* Ad-hoc project work as assigned.


**Who you are:**  

* University degree in Business/Accounting, with a Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) or in the final stages of completion of the designation
* Minimum 5-7 years combined experience in accounting, finance, and audit.
* Experience with various accounting software (LN an asset),
* Advanced skill level with MS Office and Excel
* High level of critical and logical thinking, analysis, and/or reasoning
* Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to explain difficult financial concepts and to interact with high credibility at all levels of the organization.
* Attention to detail, analytical skills, and adherence to financial regulations are critical for success in this role.
* Experience working with a High Tech, Software Products or Manufacturing organization would be an asset.

We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. The Lead Generation Specialist will have an active, hands-on role in helping to develop the sales pipeline through prospecting various markets and verticals for net new customers. As a key part of the North American Inside Sales Team, the Lead Generation Specialist will be responsible for creating and qualifying new leads, managing the lead development lifecycle using tools including Apollo.io and Salesforce, and communicating sales-ready leads to the rest of the sales team. The Lead Generation Specialist will work closely with the existing sales team, including the Directors of Sales and Business Development Managers
  
  

**Who you report to:** Inside Sales Manager – North America
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Research, develop and implement key processes around lead generation and outbound prospecting activities, including how best to leverage the Apollo.io B2B sales platform and expand the lead generation function within the North American Inside Sales team.
* Research and develop processes for use of AI tools that help to automate essential sales functions, such as customer data analysis, lead sourcing and sales forecasting.
* Manage inbound sales leads and trade show leads from net new prospects, and transition them from cold to warm leads, and eventually, to new Ross customers.
* Develop a broad understanding of Ross’ product lines and service offerings to be able to have effective conversations with new, prospective customers.
* Conduct contact and account searches using CRM tools to generate best-fit prospects and build a qualified pipeline.
* Cold call prospects and leads to develop rapport, pitch Ross products/services, schedule follow-up calls and meetings, with the intention of converting cold leads into warm customers.
* Research and qualify new vertical markets and prospects using a variety of tools, including Apollo.io and Salesforce.
* Generate new leads through outbound prospecting activities and communicate sales ready leads to the Business Development Manager(s) and Regional Sales Manager(s).
* Accurately convey the value of Ross products and services to customers through excellent communication both via virtual meetings, in-person and via written communication.
* Monitor market trends and competitor activities, providing actionable insights to adapt sales strategies.
* Maintain and update activities related to lead prospecting and qualification in Salesforce.
* Input and maintain accurate customer data within Salesforce.com.
* Proactively assist Directors of Sales to execute annual territory plans and identify areas of development within the various regions for prospecting.
* Collaborate with and provide input to the Corporate Marketing team in an effort to generate top tier prospecting campaigns.


**Who you are:**  

* University degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Data Analysis or a related discipline and/or equivalent work experience.
* Minimum of two (2) years of professional experience on a sales and/or customer success team in a solutions sales environment would be ideal.
* Demonstrated experience in activities such as outbound prospecting, cold-calling, opportunity qualification, account development, deal management and customer-facing meetings.
* Though not a mandatory requirement, any knowledge of the broadcast and live production industry; including familiarity with key components used in broadcast electronics applications, Ross Video product lines, key accounts and competitors, would be a key asset to this role.
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills, both virtually and in-person are a must.
* 2-3 years of experience working daily with CRM software (preferably Salesforce.com) is ideal, and any exposure to Apollo.io or a similar end-to-end sales tool would be an asset.
* Any experience working with AI-powered software and online sales tools would also be an asset.
* Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills.
* Exceptional ability to work independently
* Outstanding customer-facing skills, including cold-calling abilitities, professional attitude and an aptitude for sales
* Thrives in a commercial environment
* A self-starter with lots of drive and ambition who is passionate about getting results and resilient to hearing “no”
* Demonstrated ability and desire to work in a fast paced, deadline-driven environment.
* Self-motivated, with high energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm.
* Desire to learn and progress a career in sales, while contributing to a global team environment.
* Valid passport and willingness to travel internationally to customer sites and/or major tradeshows and events.

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Serve as a key member of the USA sales leadership team that drives the region’s strategic sales growth.
* Responsible for the overall hiring, motivation and management of USA Regional Sales Managers (RSMs). Working with the VP Sales, North America, this includes recruitment, mentoring, coaching and evaluating team members while driving a culture of performance.
* Attend trade shows and industry conferences to increase sales through improved levels of product knowledge and further develop industry contacts via networking.
* Participates and contributes to sales opportunities driven by the RSMs, including face to face customer meetings and relationship development.
* Devise and deploy sales goals and objectives focusing on existing and new business and channel partnerships within the USA, including the preparation of sales quotas and budgets.
* Lead the USA RSM team to consistently achieve quarterly and annual sales targets by managing a stratified client pipeline to ensure key prospects are identified, prioritized, and pursued to meet financial goals.
* Report and share information with the VP Sales, USA & Canada to ensure they are kept up-to-date on past, current, and predicted sales performance and customer relations.
* Collaborate with the USA Sales leadership team to develop short- and long-term strategic plans, including the preparation of annual business plans.
* Help develop and implement a sales channels plan.
* Create training and development plans for direct reports, including contributing to the evolution of the Ross Way To Sell, and ensuring the RSMs are following RWTS practices.
* Manage Sales Professionals to keep contact and opportunities database up to date.
* Prepare weekly/quarterly sales forecasts, trip reports, weekly update meetings.
* Prepare and deliver quotations and proposals.
* Coach Sales Professionals on developing WinPlans. Periodically review WinPlans and provide assistance with closing deals.
* Prepare and deliver high level presentations to networks, business partners, and industry associations.
* Develop and maintain sales forecasting activities and assist in setting of territory sales goals with integrators and dealers, where applicable.
* Monitors and evaluates the activities and products of the competition by reviewing articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.
* Exudes the behaviours identified within Ross Video’s Culture Statements, as well as our company’s Code of Ethics.
* Performs other related duties as required.


**Who you are:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, marketing, sales, or a related field preferred
* 10+ years of sales experience with 5+ years in a sales leadership position
* Strong experience in all aspects of sales, including growth strategies, distribution channel management, account development, and business planning
* Outstanding consultative selling abilities and excellent interpersonal skills at the executive level
* Success closing large, complex sales in terms of dollar value and using multiple channels.
* Budgeting and forecasting skills
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Strong business acumen
* Demonstrated knowledge of accounting and financial practices
* Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills
* High level of proficiency with the Microsoft Office productivity suite
* Understanding of the Broadcast / Media Technology Market (Live Production experience an asset.
* Existing knowledge and use of Ross Video products, or experience selling hardware and software based technology.
* Extensive experience working with CRM’s such as Salesforce.
* Willing to Travel up to 40% of the time
* Valid Passport
* Valid Driver’s License & a clear driving record

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

Ross Video is a world leader in Live Video Production Equipment. Our products are used by a who’s who of the global entertainment industry, including top broadcast networks like NBC, ABC, CBS and Fox in the USA; Rogers, CTV and the CBC in Canada and others around the world from Fiji to Finland and everywhere in between. We are # 1 in video production gear used in world-class Stadiums that host the top-tier sporting events such as the Olympics and NFL Superbowl. We create everything that touches video including robotic camera systems, video routing and processing platforms, production switchers, to graphics, virtual set and other software systems. Our products are used by top touring live acts to provide video walls, backdrops, and other production elements. Top webcasters like Revision 3 and MLB.com use Ross, as do other familiar names such as Peloton, Apple and Google. Our equipment is even used in deep-sea exploration and on the International Space Station. Join Ross and you will have a chance to work on advanced technology used to create and deliver content that connects people all around (and even above) the globe.
  
  

The successful candidate will contribute to the development of a rapidly growing and expanding video control system adaptable for use in workflows ranging from traditional broadcast studios to highly scalable IP based facilities, and the growing field of streaming and cloud-based productions.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Director, Hyperconverged Solutions - Control Systems
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Application software application design in Embedded/Desktop/Server Linux, container, or similar environment.
* Developing new and extending features within the existing application framework.
* Developing interfaces that facilitate communication within and between application modules.
* Troubleshooting and debugging developed application and interactions with other system modules
* Estimate development tasks and project effort levels.
* Participating in code design and code reviews.


**Who you are:**  

* Bachelor’s Degree, program certificate or equivalent experience Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science or related field.
* Programming experience in one or more of the following languages C, C++, Java, Go
* Familiarity with Agile software development methods (e.g. Scrum), issue tracking (e.g. Jira) and version control systems (e.g git)
* Other experience, desirable skills or areas of interest, considered a strong plus:
* Unix/Linux command line tools, scripts scripting languages (e.g. Bash, Python)
* Experience with Docker (or similar) and container-based environments.
* Familiarity with Linux system configuration and upgrades (e.g. apt or similar package management systems)
* Linux startup, system configuration and customization of GUI environments (e.g. grub, Plymouth, X, OpenBox)
* Familiarity with Linux distribution installer environments (e.g.,d-i, ubiquity, subiquity and similar)
* Linux startup environment integration (e.g. systemd and similar) for hardware and container-based environments
* HTML and JavaScript based Web Page development.
* Familiarity with database systems and related programming interfaces (e.g. SQL, Redis etc.)
* Live production or Broadcast industry experience or knowledge of relevant workflows, standards, and practices
* You revel in problem solving, take ownership of and have pride in your work.
* You enjoy the creative process of ‘finding a way’ to overcome challenges.
* You are a flexible, adaptable, self-starter that thrives in a dynamic environment.
* You like people and working/collaborating with a skilled team.
* You recognize that communication skills are as important as technical skills.
* You want to be part of a team that builds great, successful products that customers love.
* Minimum 2 years SW & Embedded, desktop or container-based Linux development experience

At Ross Video, we are at the cutting edge of Live Video production, powering much of the world’s most compelling Live Events with our Smart Production Solutions. We are looking for a dynamic, highly driven Commercial Operations Specialist to help move us toward completion and implementation of projects.
  
  

The Product & Pricing Operations Specialist will actively support our product and sales teams by handling various tasks on Salesforce and the CPQ platform, including the creation and configuration of products (both standalone and bundled), troubleshooting quoting issues, and offering pricing support and analysis. This role involves a strategic and proactive approach in recommending enhancements in Salesforce.com or CPQ functionalities to boost the Product Team's marketing efforts and equip our Sales team with essential tools.
  
  

This position requires a proactive, detail-oriented individual with a commitment to continuous improvement. The ideal candidate will apply their analytical prowess and strategic thinking to streamline workflows, improve the quality of our data, and align product structuring methods with business initiatives and customer expectations. Integrity, motivation, passion, and exceptional communication skills are crucial for this role.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager, CPQ Systems
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Create and maintain product structures and rules within SFDC, ensuring consistency in how we present products across product lines.
* Assist in updating product and pricing data in SFDC.
* Perform detailed analysis of current operational workflows and systems to pinpoint inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and enhancement opportunities.
* Utilize advanced data analysis and process mapping methodologies to thoroughly document existing operations.
* Support Sales and Product Management on commercial systems (Conga CPQ, SFDC, etc.).
* Answer questions and aid product management and sales users.
* Research and implement new commercial systems functionality as required (for example, guided selling, price rules, promotions, etc.).
* Develop and deliver training to new Product Management staff (BDM’s, PM’s, POM’s) on how to use SFDC and the CPQ.


**Who you are:**  

* BA/BS degree or equivalent.
* Basic Knowledge & Proficiency (minimum 1 years’ experience) with Salesforce.com.
* Basic Knowledge & Proficiency (minimum 1-year experience) with Salesforce CPQ, Conga CPQ or another CPQ tool (certification is a plus).
* Intermediate Knowledge & Proficiency with MS Excel (navigational shortcuts, formulas such as VLOOKUP and SUMIF, PivotTables and Pivot Charts).
* Basic Knowledge & Proficiency with standard office tools such as MS Word, PowerPoint, and Visio.
* Knowledge of sales processes and/or experience in sales.
* Knowledge of product management process and/or experience in product management/marketing.
* Extremely detail oriented – passionate about accuracy.
* Organized – able to juggle the demands of multiple projects.
* Excellent planning and scheduling skills.
* Proactive and action oriented.
* Strong interpersonal skills - an ability to collaborate effectively within a team environment.
* Adaptable in a fast-paced, multi-project environment.
* “Change agent” who is interested in improving internal processes.
* Excellent communication skills – comfortable presenting to audiences of 10-20 ppl.
* Analytical problem solver – able to understand and create solutions for complex requirements.
* Ability to collaborate as well as work independently.


Remote candidates welcome. Occasional travel to our Ottawa, Ontario, Canada offices will be required.

This key role in Ross’ Global Sales organization requires a unique blend of engineering, on-site services, customer facing “soft skills”, and post-sale project management. This is a diverse role that reports directly to the Manager, Project Management and Solutions Services, Sports & Live Events – Global, as well as frequent interaction with the company’s prospects, partners, Services, and Technical Support teams to ensure that solutions specified can also be supported. This unique position will include, but is not limited to, the following duties:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

**What the job is all about:**  

* Participates and contributes to sales opportunities driven by the Vice President of Sports & Live Events and Regional Sales Managers, prioritizing efforts based on maximizing total impact on the team’s productivity.
* Post-sale project management/deployment for systems-oriented and highly technical projects, including:
* Establishing and maintaining processes for managing scope during the project lifecycle, setting quality and performance standards, and assessing risks.
* Understanding customers’ main goals, determining the best solution for each project, managing timelines, managing customer expectations, and interpreting their needs to work towards a successful outcome.
* Developing and maintaining partnerships with third-party resources, including vendors and integrators.
* Assigning and monitoring resources to ensure project efficiency and deliverables.
* Report project outcomes and/or risks to the appropriate management channels and escalate issues, as necessary, according to project work plan.
* On a global scale, assists the Services team with internal/external training and commissioning, to ensure solutions requirements are met.
* Scopes technical solutions to address customer requirements, assess customers met and unmet needs, and recommend solutions that optimize value for both the customer and Ross Video.
* Coordinates closely with Ross’ internal Sales team and business partners to align solutions designed to meet customers’ business requirements.
* Generates localized sales tools on various mediums for internal and external distribution (PowerPoint’s, Application Notes, Competitive Guides, etc.).
* Engages in customer facing product presentations, demos, training, and workflow guidance to end-users and business partners at customer sites or tradeshows.
* Acts as a “Technical Evangelist” to help build trust and inspiration with our partners and customers.
* Provides client feedback to Marketing Product Manager(s) on product & application requirements.
* Performs other related duties, as required.


**Who you are:**  

* Minimum 5 years of combined sales, pre-/post-sales engineering, systems application, product specialist, or end user experience.
* Record of achievement and technical solution expertise in a customer facing environment.
* Understanding of the Sports Venue Production Control Room, Live Venue Display, and Sports Broadcast workflows.
* Possesses strong knowledge of industry standard protocols, connectors and terminations.
* Working knowledge of Graphics systems, Sports Data feeds, Playback Servers, Production Switchers, Scalers, Routers, Device Control protocols, and the roles they play in various applications.
* Excellent communication & presentation Skills.
* Ability to work co-operatively with and across all company departments.
* Strong knowledge of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Smartsheets.
* Possesses strong and creative problem-solving traits.
* Existing knowledge and use of Ross Video products (preferred).
* PMP or other project management certification (preferred).
* Post-secondary education in Communications, Multi-media or a related field would be an asset.
* Passionate about Ross Video equipment solutions
* Positive, Determined, Problem Solver
* Deadline-driven
* Strong organization and communication skills
* Ability to schedule duties/projects (multi-task)
* Ability to work well independently
* Attention to detail and a strong work ethic
* Desire to contribute to a team environment
* Ability to handle stressful situations
* Willing to Travel up to 60% of the time (North America)
* Valid Passport
* Valid Driver’s License & a clear driving record
* Travel to annual NAB, IDEA, SVG, and other sports related trade shows, as required.
* Attend Sales Meetings, as required.

With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager, Product Compliance
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Evaluation of designs and compliance testing of all products to conform with applicable Electromagnetic (EMC) requirements along with electrical safety, mechanical safety requirements.
* Perform internal EMC evaluation of products, such as radiated emission, ESD, etc. before NRTL certification.
* Maintain compliance lab, EMC, and electrical safety equipment.
* Co-ordinates with Project Managers and NRTL agencies such as CSA, TUV and NEMKO during the certification process.
* Work closely with Product Design teams, Order Management, Sales Teams, and other Product teams supporting product design and sales in the area product certification.
* Review Engineering Change Requisitions (ECRs) and approve for compliance.
* Conduct product safety design reviews, make design recommendations, and perform compliance testing of products, for creepage/clearances, insulation material, flammability, up to 100 VDC systems before NRTL (National Recognized Testing Laboratory) certification.
* Work closely with Product Design teams, Order Management, Sales Teams, and other Product teams supporting product design and sales in the area product certification.
* Staying informed with international compliance and regulatory requirements (updating to existing standards and identifying new standards and requirements)
* Maintaining compliance documentation and declarations.
* Maintaining detailed work schedule of compliance responsibilities.
* Support NRTLs factory audits.
* Provide suggestions/plans for ongoing improvements in the R&D and compliance process.
* Follow company policies and procedures.
* Perform other related duties as required.


**Who you are:**  

* Working knowledge of product global and international EMC standards is required: CISPR 32 / EN 55032, CISPR 35 / EN55035, CISPR 24 / EN 55024, FCC Part 15, ICES-003
* Asset working knowledge of Electrical safety standards such as IEC/UL/EN 62368-1, IEC/EN 60825-1 and IEC/EN 60825-2
* Asset working knowledge of Mechanical Directives
* Asset working knowledge of various country approvals, regulatory marks and homologation processes is preferred.
* Asset knowledge of environmental standards such as RoHS, WEEE, REACH, etc.
* Good understanding of laboratory test equipment such as Hi-Pot testers, Spectrum Analyzers, ESD gun, antennas, etc.
* Strong interpersonal, and observational skills.
* Organized and very detail orientated.
* Self-starter, quick learner, and able to work with minimum supervision in meeting schedules, project deliverables, and deadlines.
* Able to work independently and as part of a team.
* Strong communication skills orally, verbally, and in writing
* Minimum 3-5 years’ experience working with EMC with knowledge of safety standards
* Valid Driver’s License and access to a vehicle for occasional travel to Iroquois and NRTL locations.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

Where You'll Be Working
  
Ross Video is a world leader in High-Definition Video Production Equipment, designed and manufactured in Canada and sold world-wide. Our products are used by a who's who of the global entertainment industry, including top broadcast networks like NBC, ABC, CBS and Fox in the USA; Rogers, CTV and the CBC in Canada and others around the world from Fiji to Finland and everywhere in between. We are # 1 in providing behind the scenes HD production gear used in Sports Stadiums including places where the Atlanta Falcons, NY Mets, LA Lakers, Pittsburgh Penguins and Buffalo Bills play. Our equipment was used extensively at the Vancouver 2010 and other Olympic games. Our systems are used by top acts including Springsteen, Blink 182, The Red Hot Chili Peppers and the Police to name a few. Top webcasters like Revision 3 and MLB.com use Ross. Our equipment is even used on the International Space Station. Join Ross and you will have a chance to work on advanced technology used in a wide variety of very cool ways by our clients.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager Component Engineering and Change Management
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

We are looking for a talented and self-motivated Engineering Change Coordinator to join Ross’ R&D Operations team reporting to the Manager of Component Engineering & Change Management.
  
The Engineering Change Coordinator plays a crucial role in maintaining a structured change control process for efficiently managing product changes, including documentation requirements, approval workflows, and revision control mechanisms.
  
As an Engineering Change Coordinator, you will receive Engineering Change Orders (ECOs) initiated by the engineering teams, facilitate cross-functional reviews and ensure timely approvals for implementation at Ross’ in-house manufacturing facility.
  
You will work within the Engineering organization to assist with Bill of Materials (BOMs) and ECO-related inquiries, providing guidance, support, and assistance to stakeholders as needed. You will be responsible for enforcing BOM structure, hierarchy, and naming conventions to maintain the accuracy and integrity of product definitions. You will regularly liaise with product management, engineering, manufacturing, procurement, supply chain and quality assurance stakeholders to ensure alignment and consensus.
  
This position is located at our Ottawa location. During the on-boarding period, the candidate will be expected to be in the office at least 2 days per week.
  
  

**Who you are:**  

* A sound understanding of assembly BOMs and product structure
* Strong level using Excel: Pivot tables and Macros a definite asset
* Experience with PowerPoint
* Ability to multitask in fast paced environment
* knowledge of Engineering Change Management principles
* Experience delivering training is an asset
* An inquisitive self-starter, who can work effectively in a team or as an individual contributor
* An effective communicator, who can interact with internal stakeholders as well as external suppliers
* A quality and efficiency driven team member whose attention to detail is world class
* Organized, adaptable and able to manage a fluctuating workload, able to adapt to the business needs


**Bonus points if you have the following:**  

* Experience working in an Engineering Change Coordinator role, or equivalent


Knowledge of Engineering Change Management principles
  
* Knowledge of Oracle Agile or other PLM system

The successful candidate will collaborate with the Ross Graphics development teams to enable and deliver product testing strategies. Expertise will be gained through direct testing of both hardware and software products, working closely with technical personnel, and developing automation environments. The candidate will be a champion of product quality, working with the development team to improve test coverage and test efficiency through automation. The candidate will report directly to the Product Verification Manager. This position is located at our Ottawa Research & Development facility.
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Develop manual and automated test plans and test strategies
* Participate in the management, maintenance, and expansion of the lab environment, including investigating third party software/hardware integration (racking servers, cabling, installing and configuring graphics cards etc.)
* Manage test plans and test cases in the test management database
* Modify existing test plans and testing information to correct errors, adapt to new use case scenarios or upgraded interfaces, and cover performance enhancements
* Assist in investigation and reproduction of product and customer issues
* Provide regular status updates on manual and automated testcase execution to management and associated development teams
* Provide effort estimation for scheduling purposes to management
* Collaborate with other technical and non-technical teams as needed
* Office Environment and in some cases, work occurs in the lab area
* Occasional lifting, bending, stooping required in maintaining lab area and equipment
* Perform other related duties as required


**Who you are:**  

* A degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering
* A minimum of 3 years’ experience in a development role and/or test case automation role
* Solid experience with testing data networks
* Great level of experience with HTTP and RESTful web service automation tools (Robot Framework, SoapUI, JMeter, Postman, Jenkins, etc.)
* Great level of experience with integrated testing of multi-server configurations
* Exceptional experience programming (C, C++, JAVA/JSCRIPT, Python, Visual Basic, scripting, etc.)
* Experience [BC3] [MR4] with development or testing using Unreal or other 3D graphics engines
* Experience with testing AWS web services and/or cloud-based architectures
* Experience with bug tracking and test cycle management tools (Jira, Bugzilla, etc.)
* Experience with development management tools such as source control and code review (FishEye, Crucible, Confluence, SVN, etc)
* Knowledge of computer networking (TCP/IP, HTTP, etc.)
* Knowledge of databases & SQL. (PostgreSQL, Amazon Aurora, etc.)
* Knowledge of operating systems (Linux and various Windows platforms)
* Knowledge of Geospatial data would be considered an asset
* Knowledge of broadcast and television production would be considered an asset


**Traits:**  

* A solid attention for detail and a critical mindset
* Excellent interpersonal and observational skills
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Solid analytical and trouble shooting skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
* Self-starter, quick learner and able to work with minimum supervision
* Passionate about learning and the Product Verification Role
* Able to work independently or as part of a team

job_description:
INTERNAL OPPORTUNITIES AT ROSS VIDEOThinking about what’s next for your career? At Ross Video we are committed to your professional growth and to providing opportunities to develop your career. Our internal talent mobility program is intended to facilitate effective hiring from within, as appropriate, to fill open opportunities in the company.
  
  

This position resides within the Manufacturing Engineering Services team. The group’s primary responsibilities are to support the Manufacturing Engineering Team, providing primary support for work instruction creation, MES project creation, change management and technical writing. This position is responsible for ensuring the quality and accuracy of our procedures, work instructions and product through consulting with technical owners and shop floor personnel, scheduled audits, and regular data metric review. Attention to detail, ability to work with others and a broad manufacturing process knowledge are key assets for this role.
  
.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager, Manufacturing Engineering Services
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* MES ADMINISTRATION: Digitize all manufacturing operations, integrate with ERP, automate data collection for real-time visibility and better decision-making.
* SHOP FLOOR SUPPORT: Guide operators through the process, provide real-time control to improve reactivity and efficiency.
* ECO IMPLEMENTATION: Implement MCO/ECO changes into the MES to ensure manufacturing has accurate information, ensuring proper data integrity and traceability.
* WIP/FIN CHANGE COORDINATION: Ensure product is quarantined and appropriately reworked/updated prior to shipment when a WIP/FIN change occurs.
* ECO REVIEW: Change management review of Engineering Change Orders (ECO’s) to ensure Bill of Materials and design data meet the requirements for MES importation.
* TECHNICAL WRITING: convert technical information in layman's terms, explain the functionality of a product or service, and share information with stakeholders.
* SYSTEM INTEGRATION: Assist in MES to Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) integration, maintenance, and training including validating; under the guidance of Manufacturing or Industrial Engineering.
* REPORT GENERATION: Providing reports - Assist the Manufacturing or Industrial Engineering teams in floor layout design.
* JIG/FIXTURE CREATION: Creation of jigs/fixtures, and control documentation using CAD tools, while working with members of the Manufacturing Engineering team.
* AUTOMATED EQUIPMENT PROGRAM PREPARATION: Preparing CAD/BOM files for automated equipment programming including creating step programs for SMT placement machines, SPI and AOI.
* ACER COORDINATION: Coordinate build requests for alternate component evaluations.


**Who you are:**  

* Post-secondary education or equivalent work experience in manufacturing processes.
* Knowledge of CAD systems is an asset.
* Advanced skill level with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook) and Microsoft Project.
* Experience in manufacturing, procedures, and the product lifecycle process

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

Under the direction of the Director, Production you will play a pivotal role in optimizing our manufacturing processes, ensuring seamless operations, and guiding continuous improvement initiatives. You will oversee all aspects of production, from planning and scheduling to execution and delivery. You will be given the opportunity to develop and implement strategies to enhance efficiency, monitor production metrics and KPI’s to track performance and identify areas of improvement. You will also be responsible for hiring, training and developing direct reports through coaching and engagement to meet labour capacity requirements.
  
Ross Video - Iroquois
  
  

**Who you report to:** Director, Production
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* A production manager is responsible for ensuring that the production of manufacturing products starts and finishes within budget and on time delivery
* Work with Production Planning to communicate and discuss events that are above and beyond the daily workload
* The production manager ensures all products meet the required quality standards working with Manufacturing Support to meet our code of ethics – “We Will not Ship Crap”
* Working with many stakeholders within the business: HR, Training
* Distribute necessary reports on a timely basis, reflecting quality and throughput metrics
* Work with supervisors, providing them the knowledge and direction to support their teams and business goals
* Strategically approach process and procedures; working with manufacturing support teams to create efficiency or optimization within the work area
* Promote career development by ensuring one-on-one meets happen in conjunction with yearly reviews.
* Address performance issues in a timely manner
* Participates in and approves any compensation cycle changes.
* Ensure compliance within all Ross policies, particularly safety standards and policies
* Ensure the department follows the Ross Code of Ethics
* Perform other related duties as required.


**Who you are:**  

* Post-secondary degree or appropriate experience
* Demonstrated management experience required 5-10 years
* Outstanding communication ability and leadership skills
* Excellent knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook
* Working knowledge of MAX and/or similar MRP/ERP program
* Working knowledge of Aegis – MES and/or similar manufacturing execution programs
* Experienced in technical manufacturing operations in a high mix, low volume environment


**Bonus points if you have the following:**  

* Passionate about guiding people in a high tech environment
* Able to pivot as business needs change

**Application Development:**

* Collaborate with a team of phenomenal motion graphic designers to help bring their creative vision to life
* Write clean, concise, and efficient code across the entire stack
* Design and write tests
* Identify and resolve bugs quickly
* Influence products seen by millions of viewers


**Device and Data Integration:**  

* Develop integrations to external data sources for use in real time graphics applications via RESTful APIs, message-based queues (e.g. Active MQ), etc...
* Travels to customer sites to commission field integrations with customer equipment that is not available in Ross Video Ltd’s laboratory for practical reasons. (not all cases).


**Productivity Growth:**  

* Works with Ross team members to identify and curate commonly used devices and user interface patterns to enable increasingly rapid development of new custom solutions that are partially based on these.
* Create and update operational guidelines and support documentation to ensure Ross Video can effectively support customers in the future.

* Knowledge of JavaScript or TypeScript
* Knowledge of ElectronJS
* Knowledge of NodeJS
* Knowledge of TypeScript would be an asset

* Team-oriented
* Ability to handle conflict in a professional and calm manner
* Organized and very detail orientated
* Excellent communication skills
* Strong interpersonal and observational skills
* Enthusiastic

* 2+ years using front-end technologies (JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3), including a modern, popular JavaScript framework (we use React with Redux)
* 2+ years using NodeJS
* Video or multimedia production experience is highly desirable, especially graphics
* System Integration experience

* Willing to travel on a project-by-project basis, and spend the working week at customer premises.
* Valid passport
* Valid driver’s license
* Sports fan, preferably in the six major professional North American sports leagues (American Football, Basketball, Hockey, Baseball, Soccer, and/or Golf), is highly desirable

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results in a way that’s fun and respectful to both ourselves and our customers.
  
  

Ross Video, recently recognized as one of Canada’s top 100 companies by MediaCorp is seeking exceptionally talented and motivated professionals to join our Enterprise Management team.
  
Winning a top 100 award is not easy, it requires excellence in multiple dimensions:
  
* Work Environment
* Compensation and Benefits
* Family Friendly Policies
* Employee Engagement
* Training and Development
* Community engagement


If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, intelligence, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

**What's the job all about:**  

We are able to delight our customers with our innovative products because they work better when combined with other Ross products. For example, our production switchers seamlessly integrate with our graphics and replay systems. This is no accident but the result of a sustained commitment to developing our Enterprise Management solutions: DashBoard and Ross Platform Manager. Together, these form the backbone that enables Ross Video to deliver offerings with a 1 + 1 = 3 value proposition. By a conservative estimate around 65% of Ross Video revenues are enabled by the work of our Enterprise Management team.
  
DashBoard in particular is an industry leading facility control and monitoring system with the role of creating powerful and customizable user interfaces that combine the power of all of Ross’s technology. As a free and open platform, you will be serving tens of thousands of users by providing additional product offerings and enhancements and leading the technical direction.
  
As the Principal Technical Lead, you are the technical leader for your product or products. You plan and oversee the development of solutions to allow our customers to achieve or exceed their business goals. In this technical role you are responsible and accountable for the implementation and quality of the products under your purview. You craft the architecture and design of your product to meet product goals in alignment with the practices and principals of our Senior Software Architects and Technical Director; you oversee the implementation to ensure architectural and code consistency; you ensure that best practices are being employed, all the while making certain that quality and security are primary considerations.
  
You coach, mentor, guide, and help nurture the development team (developers and testers) to realize its full potential and adopt our culture of technical excellence and continuous improvement.
  
Should you join this team, you’ll become a key part of ensuring that Ross Video’s secret to success continues to enable innovations across all our product lines. You’ll also work with some of the latest development technologies and information security disciplines.
  
  

**Who you are:**  

It would be great if you already have expertise in live production.
  
You’re passionate about working in Java, and you want to raise the level of excellence of the team both in Java and across the various development tools and framework, such as Eclipse/OSGi, Eclipse Rich Client Platform, Swing, SWT, Java Native Access, and OAuth2.0 to create powerful applications with eye-popping user interfaces.
  
You need to be able to capture the strategic direction of the product and apply your judgment to define the path forward to meet our customers’ needs. We want you to bring that excitement you crave for exploring new ideas to produce tangible results.
  
You need to love learning and progressing your skill set. That means you'll be comfortable talking about your weaknesses just as much as your strengths and working hard on improving will be a daily habit.
  
You love to experiment and be proactive in developing sound solutions. Being part of an R&D division means that you will help push the boundaries of our understanding through experimentation and exploration effectively driving innovation.
  
You are fluent in clean architectural design; are versed in Domain Driven Design concepts; you know and employ the SOLID principles of OO design. You know and espouse the value of test automation. You know how to debate passionately and make objective decisions.
  
We work in a very collaborative environment, and you enjoy mentoring the other members of the team to always do better. It is vital that you care more about delivering the result than exactly whose ideas achieved it.
  
That also means you'll need to be interested in the processes, constraints, and systems that help product designs flourish.
  
You also need 10+ years of experience (or an amazing display of design and coding maturity if you have less than that).
  
  

WHY WORK FOR ROSS VIDEO?
  
Because we can help you flourish. You will get to develop and deliver cutting edge technological solutions for the entertainment industry. You will be part of the Ross Video team working together to make that happen, and we find that a pretty energizing environment to be a part of.
  
#LI-KF1
  
  

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. job_description:
**Why Work at Ross Video?**

We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting-edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.


**About the job**

We are looking for an exceptional talent to join Ross as a Project Coordinator. At Ross, we’re proud to name this role as Services Operations Specialist. Our Services Operation Specialist mandate is to support a multi-disciplinary team in the effective and efficient delivery of value-added services within the Asia Pacific (APAC) region for Ross Video clients, partners, and internal stakeholders.


You will work closely with the APAC Services Manager daily and will be able to operate autonomously when required. You will be highly organized and possess the ability to successfully manage multiple tasks and associated deliverables under tight timelines.


This position is a combination of resource scheduling, demonstration & tradeshow equipment management, event planning and execution, demo & training room scheduling, and other operational activities.


**Who you report to:** Director of Services - APAC & Oceania


**What we offer:**

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.


Some of these perks include flexible hours, wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!


Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.


**What the job is all about:**

* Managing the day-to-day scheduling of our team of Demo Artists, Trainers, support specialists, and Commissioners. Using a combination of Salesforce, RISS, and Resource Guru software to review the requirements of internal demo requests and customer driven training requests, as well as liaising with the Project manager, to ensure that Ross resources are assigned as appropriate to their skill set.
* The Ross Singapore office holds a number of demo equipment and also stock of shelved piece part items for the purpose of providing onsite and online demonstrations and training to customers in the office. You will be responsible for ensuring that the Demo equipment is managed correctly. You will ensure that Demo Artists are scheduled time to prepare their kits for a given Demo or Training.
* As well as scheduling the appropriate Demo Artists and Trainers, for internal Demonstrations and training events, you will also manage scheduling of the Singapore Demo and Training facilities.
* Ross Video participates in a number of industry trade shows and conferences. You will work closely with Sales and Marketing to provide operational planning and execution support related to these important events.
* Responsible for liaising with our logistics firm to manage various freight forwarding documentation including Carnets and tax deferment forms related to the collection, delivery, and return of the Ross equipment, marketing collateral, and correspondence (eg. e-mail, letters, packages etc.).
* You will also use the Ross purchasing system to raise requisitions and expenses for equipment, tools and sundries required for the day-to-day running of the Singapore office equipment and supplies.
* Coordinate office activities and operations to secure efficiency and compliance to company policies.
* Assist with ad-hoc administrative or event-related duties if required.

**Who you are:**

* Diploma or above in IT or engineering, or equivalent Project Management certification.
* Minimum 3 years’ experience in project coordination or project management roles.
* Prior experience in a technology equipment manufacturer is advantageous.
* Experience working with Sales Force and Microsoft Office 365.
* Ability to be a team player who is analytical, highly motivated, and independent with excellent team spirit and interpersonal skills.
* Strong project planning and coordination capabilities.

**Apply now by clicking on the following URL:**

https://us232.dayforcehcm.com/CandidatePortal/en-US/rossvideo/Posting/View/6026

Reporting to the General Manager, Oceania, the Inside Sales Representative will play an active part in helping develop and manage Ross Video’s pipeline for revenue generation, through pursuing sales leads, prospecting calls, and establishing an ongoing rapport with existing customers and Business Partners.
  
This position is an integral part of the Oceania sales team, supporting our customers, and authorized business partners uncover unique opportunities and ways to help them achieve their goals.
  
Inside Sales Representatives exude integrity, while demonstrating drive and passion for exceeding orders targets through their excellent sales manner and superb communications skills.
  
  

What we offer
  
Ross offers competitive salaries, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Provide overall support to assigned Regional Sales Managers to determine and implement opportunity specific sales approaches.
* Handle inbound, unsolicited prospect calls and convert them into sales.
* Make outbound follow-up contact with existing customers via telephone and e-mail to determine customer satisfaction, cross-sell and up-sell opportunities.
* Develop a deep understanding of the company's products or services to effectively communicate features and benefits to potential customers.
* Prepare, review and present quotes, renewal proposals, sales loaners and contracts to potential clients, including discussing terms and closing deals.
* Provide post-sales support, address customer concerns, and ensure customer satisfaction to encourage repeat business.
* Maintain and update a sales pipeline, tracking leads and opportunities through various stages of the sales process.
* Utilize CRM software, Salesforce.com, to organize and manage customer interactions, update contact information, and track sales activities.
* Maintain accurate records of sales activities, customer interactions, and transactions.
* Forecast sales activities and prepare periodic sales report showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion.
* Set up and deliver sales presentations, product/service demonstrations, and other sales activities.
* Ensure customers’ order flow by meeting Ross’ clean order criteria.
* Work closely with the sales team, marketing, and other departments to align sales strategies and achieve sales targets.
* Assist in resolution of customer complaints regarding equipment, supplies, and services.
* Stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and market conditions to adjust sales strategies accordingly.
* Stay updated on product knowledge, sales techniques, and industry developments through continuous training and professional development.
* Where necessary, support efforts at trade shows, exhibits, and other events.
* When necessary, travel to meet with respective Regional Sales Manager or other members of the Sales Team.


**Who you are:**  

* Five years’ experience within a sales organization
* Demonstrated ability to convert prospects and close deals to exceed sales targets.
* Solid experience in opportunity qualification, planning, account development, and time management.
* Experience in sales forecasting & pipeline management.
* Practical knowledge of sales principles, methods, practices, and techniques.
* Experience selling video production equipment.
* Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills.
* Demonstrated ability to build and maintain lasting relationships with customers.
* Exceptional verbal communication and presentation skills.
* Strong communication skills.
* Desire to constructively contribute to a team environment.
* Ability to occasionally travel and attend sales events or exhibits.


**Bonus points if you have the following:**  

* Experience with customer relationship management (CRM) software such as Salesforce.com
* Familiarity with the key components used in video production technology

As a Surface Mount Technology (SMT) Operator, you will operate various machines to run the SMT Line. The role requires technical knowledge of printed circuit boards and surface mount technology.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager, SMT
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Set up and operation of Screen printers and Solder paste inspection (SPI)
* Monitor SPI for tolerance adherence and understand troubleshooting methods to keep in line with paste quality
* Manage changeover process to ensure efficiency in production time
* Setup each SMT machine to ensure parts are loaded properly, conveyors are aligned, and oven recipes are accurate
* Obtain parts from inventory and verifying loaded components from the setup department are accurate
* Understand the basic hardware mechanics of the SMT equipment
* Learn all production screens and tabs of the pick and place software to ensure how to navigate the machine operation
* Understand basic troubleshooting skills with regards to component placement accuracy, board loading/unloading and fiducial data
* Work closely with Automated Optical Inspection (AOI) operator to ensure quality is maintained according to IPC 610 standards. This feedback is in response to correcting defects that may occur while operating the pick and place machines and/or screen printer
* Works closely with SMT Support team to ensure quality and to maintain production flow on the lines by reducing troubleshooting downtime
* Run the AOI machine to monitor quality coming down the lines
* Maintain and rely on IPC-610x training to ensure the correct defect calls are made and to know when to elevate problems to support staff
* Fully understand MES with regards to routing and reading MWI’s. Review of production documentation and verifying BOM revisions match the pick and place programs
* Clean stencils and returning them to the proper storage location during the build process
* Maintain ESD practices
* Adhere to MSDS procedures and Health & Safety policies
* Area maintenance and general tidiness and organization of materials


**Who you are:**  

* Have a high school diploma
* Mechanical aptitude
* Able to work independently or as part of a team
* Capable of following procedures and work logically
* Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
* Conscientious and willing to ask questions
* Strong aptitude for learning
* Able to lift and bend


Bonus points if you have the following
  
* Previous experience with machine operation

The Hyperconverged signal processing team plays a key role in helping Ross Video achieving its corporate vision to lead the world in video production solution : We enable our customers to integrate any media into their production and we do that using highly acclaimed hardware platforms such as openGear and Ultrix. Here is your chance to join the world class, passionate and innovative team behind the Emmy award winning openGear platform ! On top of being responsible for delivering high quality RTL code for video processing systems, you also have a voice in shaping the products and help deliver our customer building world class media productions infrastructure.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Director, Hyperconverged Solutions - Processing
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Promote, refine and develop challenging and innovative video processing and transport features in the most integrated hardware platform in the broadcast industry.
* Develop RTL for high performance realtime media processing systems involving high bandwidth media interfaces to memory, PCIe or hardware accelerated processing functions such as video scaling or HDR/SDR conversion
* Implement realtime transport protocols in FPGA designs including SDI and SMPTE 2110
* Be involved in the architecture by reviewing schematic designs, advising on density of FPGA functions, thermal design, clocking etc
* Create complete IO ring designs for Arria10/Stratix-10/Ultrascale+/MPSoC/Agilex FPGAs to verify pin-outs and IP in Quartus and Vivado
* Develop high-level design requirements, manage/negotiate key part selection, and support aggressive project scheduling
* Generate both specification & design documentation to support cross functional team
* Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of FPGA & HW designs
* Efficient and systematic debugging skills.
* Assist in supporting other staff members as necessary through entire NPI process flow – including design, documentation, test, manufacturing and customer support


**Who you are:**  

* Intermediate - Senior level FPGA design knowledge and experience across broad range of topics including:
* FPGA building blocks & system architecture
* High speed transceivers, clock domain analysis, & timing closure
* Fluent in development languages used in FPGA design – Verilog, System Verilog, TCL scripting
* Ability to create Verilog simulation testbenches and run VCS simulations
* Expertise in current Xilinx & Intel devices and associated design and debugging tools
* Knowledge of high-speed serial interfaces using gigabit transceivers, DDR3/4 interfaces, HBM, and PLL’s
* Excellent debugging skills & proficient with typical lab equipment (scopes, JBERTs, network analyzers, WFMs, etc)
* Ability to work in an embedded environment. Linux, bash, C/C++ and networking skills a plus
* Knowledge of broadcast studio applications & workflow preferred; especially distribution / production systems a plus
* Understanding of digital video and associated audio standards a plus
* Signal Integrity knowledge a plus
* Sound interpersonal skills with ability to work as part of a team or independently as required
* Keen observational skills and problem solving intuition
* Self-starter with the tenacity to bring product to market
* Ability to learn new concepts quickly and work towards finding creative solutions to challenging problems
* Comfortable moving forward aggressively; balancing risks appropriately to optimize success across all business aspects – good, fast, and cheap
* Equally comfortable contributing as a team member or championing an idea with upper management
* Minimum 5 years FPGA & HW development experience with expertise in Video/Audio technologies preferred
