At Ross Video, we are Living Live! We are at the cutting edge of live video production, powering much of the world’s most compelling content with our smart production solutions.
  
Join our dynamic team as a UX Designer and unleash your creativity to transform and unify user experiences across the entire Ross Video product portfolio, making a real difference in the lives of our users. As a key member of our design team, you'll have the opportunity to shape cutting-edge designs spanning robotics, control panels, infrastructure, graphics, and more. Collaborating closely with senior management, product owners, technical leads, and our valued customers, you'll craft elegant and powerful solutions that leave a lasting impact. Join us today and be part of an exciting journey where your talents will shine!
  
**Who you report to:** Manager, UX & Industrial Design
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

As our UX Designer and Researcher, you will act as an investigator to apply usability research and user-centered design principles to improve and unify the customer experience across the Ross Video product portfolio, including both hardware and software. You will use the results of your investigations to create mockups and wireframes, and work with Ross’s teams to build awesome products!
  
* Creating wireframes, prototypes, and user flows to visualize and communicate design concepts.
* Iterating on designs based on feedback from stakeholders, incorporating usability best practices and industry standards.
* Collaborating with developers and engineers to establish technical requirements and ensure the successful implementation of design solutions.
* Creating and maintaining a user experience design guide for application across Ross Video’s broad product portfolio.
* Conducting user research, including interviews and usability testing, to gather insights and inform the design process.
* Establishing design processes and evangelizing best practices at Ross Video.
* Performing a variety of other interesting duties.


**Who you are:**  

* You have a bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Interaction Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Graphic Design, or a related discipline.
* You have proven experience as a UX designer or a similar role, showcasing a strong portfolio of successful projects.
* You have proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, or similar software.
* You have excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to effectively present and justify design decisions to stakeholders.
* You can quickly understand and work with technical requirements and industry-specified constraints.
* You have a passion for creating exceptional user experiences and a keen interest in the latest advancements in UX design.


**Bonus points if you have the following:**  

* Knowledge of television, stage, film, or news production
* Knowledge of frontend web technologies (HTML, CSS, JS)

This highly integral member of the team will represent Ross Video within a highly focused set of strategic accounts in the Network Television portfolio.
  
  

You will be building strategic, long term relationships with end users by calling on customer facilities directly to promote Ross products and services. This is both a hands-on and strategic position where you will be implementing strategic sales plans to accommodate territorial goals, engaging Product Managers in regular presentations to customers, assisting with the resolution of customer concerns and negotiating and closing sales.
  
  

You will have monthly order targets to meet and will be developing and maintaining sales forecasting activities and assisting in setting sales goals with integrators and business partners, where applicable.

**What we offer:**

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Deliver sales presentations to customers in person and remote
* Ensure the sales and marketing of product line follows the Ross Video code of ethics
* Perform market analyses to determine customer needs and price schedules
* Work in conjunction with the Ross Global sales support teams where the portfolio of Strategic accounts has locally-based business entities
* Advises and assists end-users concerning sales and purchase of Ross Video Product line.
* Assists in directing product marketing to customer base to establish Ross Video products in the region.
* Represents company at trade association meetings to promote product.
* Assist in coordination and liaison between sales department and other sales related units.
* Assists other departments within organization to prepare marketing plans specific to the strategic account portfolio
* Prepares periodic sales reports showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed sales expansion.
* Monitors and evaluates the activities and products of the competition.
* Reviews articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.


**Who you are:**  

* Significant experience selling & marketing video experience technology to Television Networks and affiliated business units
* Familiarity with key components used in video experience technology
* Strong Organizational Skills
* Understanding of strategic sales process
* Excellent communication & presentation Skills
* Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills
* Knowledge of use of Ross Video products
* Lateral Thinker
* Willing to Travel up to 60% of the time

job_title: Regional Sales Manager - Northeast USA (Job Req #2024-105)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

Join Ross Video and you will have an opportunity to be part of a growing company that is continuing to expand in the US marketplace.
  
  

In this role, you will be responsible for proactively and aggressively growing both existing and new business relationships for Ross Video in your region either directly or through one of Ross’ designated Channel Partners. The territory for this position includes the states of New York, Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Connecticut, Maine, Vermont, New Hampshire, Massachusetts, Rhode Island and Delaware. With a focus on developing accounts within the Corporate / AV Production Vertical. This is a shared responsibility role with the other Regional Sales Manager in the Northeast region.
  
  

You would work from a home-based office either in the region or in close proximity to our headquarters in Ottawa, Canada.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Director of Sales, USA East
  
  

What we offer
  
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Represent Ross Video with end users and customers and channel resale partners within the region.
* Negotiate and close sales.
* Meet annual, quarterly and monthly, quota targets in cooperation with other Northeast RSM
* Build key, long-term relationships with end users by calling on customer facilities directly to promote Ross products and services.
* Engage the Product Managers in regular presentations to customers.
* Deliver sales presentations to clients and re-sellers in the Territory.
* Develop and implement strategic sales plans to accommodate corporate and individual territorial goals.
* Develop and maintain sales forecasting activities and assists in setting of territory sales goals with integrators and dealers, where applicable.
* Perform market analyses to determine customer needs, price schedules, and discount rates.
* Advise and assist end users concerning sales and purchase of Ross Video Product line.
* Assist in directing product marketing to client base to establish Ross Video products in the region.
* Represent company at trade association meetings to promote product.
* Assist in coordination and liaison between sales department and other sales related units.
* Assist other departments within the organization to prepare marketing plans specific to the territory.
* Prepare periodic sales reports showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion.
* Monitor and evaluate the activities and products of the competition.
* Review articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.
* Ensure the Sales and marketing of Ross products, services and solutions follows the Ross Video code of ethics.
* Assist in resolution of customer issues regarding equipment, supplies, and services.


**Who you are:**  

In the position of Regional Sales Manager, you should have an entrepreneurial spirit. You should have experience and previous success in sales and business development related to live production or AV products, services, and solutions. You will have passionate commitment to customer service and should be prepared to develop business relationships on a face-to-face basis throughout your region. You will have a well-honed ability to communicate compellingly at all levels of an organization both in written and verbal form.
  
  

* Experience Selling & Marketing of Live Production Equipment
* Familiarity with Key Customers through the territory.
* Strong negotiating skills
* Solid user of Microsoft Office Products
* Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar Customer Relationship Management tool
* Excellent Communication & Presentation Skills
* Lateral Thinker


**Other:**  

* Willing to travel up to 60% of the time
* Valid passport
* Valid driver’s license

Ross Video is a world leader in High-Definition Video Production Equipment, designed and manufactured in Canada and sold world-wide. Our products are used by a who's who of the global entertainment industry, including top broadcast networks like NBC, ABC, CBS and Fox in the USA; Rogers, CTV and the CBC in Canada and others around the world from Fiji to Finland and everywhere in between. We are # 1 in providing behind the scenes HD production gear used in Sports Stadiums including places where the Atlanta Falcons, NY Mets, LA Lakers, Pittsburgh Penguins and Buffalo Bills play. **Who you report to:** Director of Services - APAC & Oceania


**What we offer:**

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.


Some of these perks include flexible hours, wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!


Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.


**What the job is all about:**

* Managing the day-to-day scheduling of our team of Demo Artists, Trainers, support specialists, and Commissioners. Using a combination of Salesforce, RISS, and Resource Guru software to review the requirements of internal demo requests and customer driven training requests, as well as liaising with the Project manager, to ensure that Ross resources are assigned as appropriate to their skill set.
* The Ross Singapore office holds a number of demo equipment and also stock of shelved piece part items for the purpose of providing onsite and online demonstrations and training to customers in the office. You will be responsible for ensuring that the Demo equipment is managed correctly. You will ensure that Demo Artists are scheduled time to prepare their kits for a given Demo or Training.
* As well as scheduling the appropriate Demo Artists and Trainers, for internal Demonstrations and training events, you will also manage scheduling of the Singapore Demo and Training facilities.
* Ross Video participates in a number of industry trade shows and conferences. You will work closely with Sales and Marketing to provide operational planning and execution support related to these important events.
* Responsible for liaising with our logistics firm to manage various freight forwarding documentation including Carnets and tax deferment forms related to the collection, delivery, and return of the Ross equipment, marketing collateral, and correspondence (eg. e-mail, letters, packages etc.).
* You will also use the Ross purchasing system to raise requisitions and expenses for equipment, tools and sundries required for the day-to-day running of the Singapore office equipment and supplies.
* Coordinate office activities and operations to secure efficiency and compliance to company policies.
* Assist with ad-hoc administrative or event-related duties if required.

**Who you are:**

* Diploma or above in IT or engineering, or equivalent Project Management certification.
* Minimum 3 years’ experience in project coordination or project management roles.
* Prior experience in a technology equipment manufacturer is advantageous.
* Experience working with Sales Force and Microsoft Office 365.
* Ability to be a team player who is analytical, highly motivated, and independent with excellent team spirit and interpersonal skills.
* Strong project planning and coordination capabilities.

**Apply now by clicking on the following URL:**

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

Ross Video powers video production for billions of global viewers daily with the industry’s widest range of smart production solutions. We are looking for an experienced, strategic, legal professional to join our team in the newly created role of Associate General Counsel.
  
  

As Associate General Counsel, you will advise and guide the organization on contract law and negotiations, IP law and regulatory securities law and disclosures, assist the General Counsel in creating formalized office practices and support the organization in various legal matters. The successful candidate is a team player with a strong ability to communicate and deal effectively with colleagues at all levels of the corporation, including Executive Leaders, senior sales and marketing and R&D staff and Board members.
  
  

**Who you report to:** General Counsel
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* In conjunction with the General Counsel, oversee corporate governance matters for Ross Video Limited and its global subsidiaries.
* Draft, review, and negotiate contracts with customers, suppliers, partners, and other third parties, including NDAs, RFPs, Supply Agreements, Sales Agreements, IP agreements, and M&A documents.
* Prepare regulatory disclosures and documents in a public company environment
* Assist with the administration of our employee stock option plan and related matters
* Implement and manage a legal document management system and ensure proper document management and retention.
* Support litigation, arbitration, and dispute resolution involving the corporation and its affiliates.
* Develop and implement policies, procedures, and best practices to ensure compliance with applicable laws, rules, and regulations in a public company.
* In conjunction with the General Counsel manage interaction with outside counsel globally.
* Monitor and assess legal developments and trends that may impact the corporation’s business and operations.
* Handle any other legal matters or special projects as assigned by the General Counsel and CFO


**Who you are:**  

* JD (LL.B) along with a relevant undergraduate degree.
* 5-10 years of experience as an in-house lawyer preferably in a public company.
* Experience with Intellectual Property in the technology sector would be advantageous.
* Excellent communication, drafting, and negotiation skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Attention to detail and strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Experience with legal documentation control software.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

Come Freelance with ROSS!
  
At Ross Mobile Productions (Ross MP), we power video production for hundreds of shows each year across the United States and the World using the industry’s widest range of smart production solutions, you will help create. Our company is experiencing strong growth in eSports, entertainment and sports and is searching for a dynamic, self-motivated, highly technical doer to take Ross MP engineering to the next level.
  
  

As a Broadcast Engineer at Ross MP, you will work with a team of like-minded experts building and then engineering trucks and fly packs with the latest and greatest Ross equipment. You will then deploy what your team builds in remote events for the top networks and brands in several industries. As a developing engineer, you will begin to develop new/creative/innovative technical offerings that will meet our customer’s needs, help differentiate Ross and Ross MP in the market place and continue the business’ strong expansion.
  
  

Ross Mobile Productions currently has 6 of the most powerful small mobile units in the industry, a studio and fly packs at all levels. 2021/2022 promises to be the most exciting time ever, worldwide, with new equipment and customers coming on board. Be a part of events for the biggest networks, eSports companies and media brands. Be a part of Ross MP.
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
  

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Working with dedicated broadcast hardware including all Ross products and other best standard industry equipment.
* Desire to learn and develop.
* Hand out and Inventory all Equipment on Remotes.
* Knowledge of video shading and cameras (Work as a V1 on shows).
* Proficient in one or several technical areas, mostly Mira Lead and RO, A1, Lead EVS, and TD.
* Be able to work with crew and help follow through with EIC/Tech manager plan.
* Instruct Crew as needed, direct the activities of crew members related to the operation of the mobile unit, including setup and breakdown of the truck.
* Pack and unpack your truck and drive to and from Remotes
* Learn to Build shows from the ground up, including router configuration, signal flow troubleshooting, and working with various technicians to establish show requirements and turn them into executed solutions.
* Provide information to EIC for the Post Show Report at the conclusion of each event.
* Work directly with the EIC to handle all required preventative and technical maintenance of onboard broadcast equipment.
* Maintaining a positive work atmosphere by behaving and communicating in a manner that works well with co-workers, supervisors, customers, and vendors.
* Responsible end-to-end for select, small scale events.
* Introduction to some system design and building and on-site integration and set up to include video path, audio path, fiber linked systems, digital video compression and transmission standards, PC networking, Master Control facilities and hub, and network storage systems. This will include broadcast trucks, fly packs and fiber kits.
* Estimate that you could travel more than 50% of the time
* Valid Driver’s License


**Who you are:**  

* 1-3 years relevant experience
* Strong technical mind
* Want to work with the coolest technology on the best events and maximize your potential, alongside a team of Ross superstars
* If you are familiar with broadcast signal flow or networking, have built or engineered equipment, worked on the technical side of the live event industry or love technology and trends
* You like sports and eSports
* Perform well under pressure and love challenges

job_title: Vice President of Sales, EMEA (Job Req #2024-090)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

The Vice President of Sales, EMEA, plays a critical role in steering Ross Video's strategic direction and execution of sales initiatives across multiple vertical markets, including Broadcast, Sports & Live Events, AV Corporate sectors and other segments within the EMEA region. This leadership position is tasked with setting and realizing sales objectives, spearheading strategic partnerships, and guiding the sales team towards achieving the company's expansive business goals. By working in concert with the Senior Vice President of Global Sales and other members of Ross leadership team, the VP of Sales, EMEA, ensures that regional strategies are not only aligned with global objectives but also tailored to capitalize on the unique opportunities and challenges across these diverse verticals. The role demands a proactive approach to expanding market share and fostering innovation in product and service offerings, with a focus on providing a superior customer experience, making Ross Video a preferred partner in the industry.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Senior Vice President of Global Sales
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Collaborate and align with the Corporate Marketing, Vertical Markets & Solutions, and Product teams to ensure a cohesive market strategy, leveraging cross-functional insights to drive regional sales initiatives and support global brand positioning.
* Strategically steer the EMEA sales direction, aligning regional goals with global sales objectives and customizing efforts to penetrate multiple vertical markets such as Broadcast, Sports & Live Events, and AV Corporate.
* Develop and implement strategic plans to meet sales targets and expand the customer base across the diverse EMEA markets.
* Lead the EMEA Team to consistently achieve quarterly and annual sales targets by managing a stratified client pipeline to ensure key prospects are identified, prioritized, and pursued to meet financial goals.
* Lead and collaborate with the EMEA Management Team to develop short and long term strategic plans, including the preparation of annual business plans.
* Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships, understanding their needs across various industries.
* Act as an example of sales excellence and strategic leadership, fostering a culture of accountability, collaboration, and high performance.
* Continuously seek and implement productivity improvements within the sales team to enhance both efficiency and effectiveness, leveraging innovative tools, processes, and strategies to optimize operations and drive superior sales performance.
* Enhance organizational effectiveness through strategic recruitment, mentoring, and development.
* Collaborate with the Channel Development Manager to develop and execute channel partner engagement and expansion strategies, aiming to widen market reach and deepen penetration in key segments, ensuring a unified approach to market penetration.
* Provide accurate sales forecasting and compile reports for executive leadership, facilitating informed strategic decisions.
* Create training and development plans for direct reports, including contributing to the evolution of the Ross Way To Sell (RWTS), and ensuring the sales team is following RWTS practices.
* Represent Ross Video at industry events, conferences, and trade shows to promote the company’s innovations across vertical markets.
* Monitor market trends and competitor activities, adapting strategies to maintain competitiveness and meet customer needs.
* Drive the adoption of sales processes and tools to maximize team productivity and effectiveness.
* Actively participate in the Global Sales Leadership Team, contributing to the formulation and execution of global sales strategies and initiatives.
* Exude the behaviors identified within Ross Video’s Culture Statements and adhere to the company’s Code of Ethics, setting a standard for integrity and professionalism within the team.
* Perform other related duties as required by the Senior Vice President of Global Sales, demonstrating flexibility and a commitment to Ross Video's overarching goals.


**Who you are:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in technology, business administration, marketing, sales, or a related field.
* 7+ years of proven experience in leadership roles within the broadcast or related technology sectors.
* Demonstrated ability to communicate, present, and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization, including executive and C-level.
* Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills.
* Proven ability to drive the sales process from plan to close with a track record of consistently meeting or exceeding targets.
* Strong experience in all aspects of sales, including growth strategies, distribution channel management, account development, and business planning.
* Demonstrate exceptional ability to influence without authority and effectively resolve conflicts, fostering a collaborative environment where diverse perspectives are valued and consensus is achieved.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, with proficiency in additional languages relevant to the EMEA region being highly desirable.
* Strong business acumen and industry expertise, with a deep understanding of regional market dynamics within the EMEA territory.
* Demonstrated knowledge of accounting and financial practices.
* Exceptional mentoring, coaching, and people management skills.
* Excellent negotiation and leadership skills, with the ability to set and achieve challenging goals.
* Advanced analytical and quantitative skills to interpret data and translate it into actionable insights.
* High level of integrity, professionalism, and the ability to maintain confidentiality.
* Willingness to travel extensively across the EMEA region and internationally as required.
* Willing to Travel up to 50% of the time.
* Valid Passport.
* Valid Driver’s License & a clear driving record.


The VP of Sales, EMEA, role at Ross Video is designed for a strategic leader dedicated to guiding the company's expansion across a broad spectrum of vertical markets. This individual will not only drive significant sales growth but also embody and promote Ross Video's core values and ethical standards. As a key member of the Global Sales Leadership Team, the successful candidate will play a crucial role in shaping and executing global sales strategies, ensuring the alignment of regional objectives with the company's overall goals. This leadership position emphasizes strategic thinking, team development, and a deep commitment to fostering long-term customer relationships, thereby securing Ross Video's position as a leader in the broadcast and media technology industry.
  
  

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
  
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

We are looking for a senior FPGA/Hardware Designer. The FPGA/Hardware Designer role will utilize the latest FPGA and SoC devices to provide IP and SDI-based transport solutions over leading-edge hardware platforms that power live video production.

As a member of the Hyperconverged Solutions R&D team, you will further advance the Ross industry-leading A/V infrastructure products including Ultrix, the ultimate hyperconverged platform.

Successful candidates will have serious technical chops to pair with a “find a way” attitude to harness the full power of themselves and their teammates in solving unique and challenging technical problems in a supportive, high-energy, and dynamic work environment.

What We Offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family/team, and we’ve got an energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

*  Promote, refine, and develop innovative features that you are passionate about in the most integrated hyperconverged hardware platform in the broadcast industry. 
*  Architect, design, implement, and test highly efficient leading-edge professional media transport solutions over SMPTE ST 2110/IP and SDI in high-performance FPGAs for Broadcast Routers, Multiviewers, and Switchers. 
*  Implement complex RTL algorithms for video and audio processing. 
*  Work closely with the management team to develop high-level design requirements, manage/negotiate key part selection, and support aggressive project scheduling. 
*  Generate both specification and design documentation to support cross-functional teams. 
*  Develop test features that can be utilized by Product Verification, Manufacturing, and Customer Support. 
*  Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of FPGA and HW designs through simulation and lab tests. 
*  Thoroughly self-test all design parts and support Product Verification team throughout development, including test plan review, feedback validation, and logic/hardware issue debugging/fixing as required. 
*  Support schematics development and board layout, frequently contributing directly to technical decisions relating to signal integrity, density, fabrication constraints, and thermal considerations. 
*  Assist in supporting other staff members as necessary through the entire NPI process flow, from design, documentation, implementation, and test to presales and customer service. 

Who you are:

Technical requirements:

*  FPGA/Hardware designer with 5+ years of professional experience developing SMPTE ST 2110 and SDI-based video/audio technologies. 
*  Deep knowledge across a broad range of topics including: 
*  FPGA building blocks, system architectures, speed/area tradeoffs. 
*  High-speed transceivers, physical implementation, clock domain analysis, and timing closure. 
*  FPGA compilation, simulation, and hardware testing. 
*  Intel and Xilinx FPGA devices. 
*  FPGA design, simulation, and debugging tools. 
*  External memory interface. 
*  Packet processing, switching/routing, scheduling. 
*  Fluent in FPGA hardware description and timing constraint languages: SystemVerilog (preferred), High-Level Synthesis (HLS), and VHDL, as well as TCL and SDC. 
*  Experience developing large FPGA designs including SoC and high-speed hardware interfaces such as NRZ/PAM4 100Gbps Ethernet, DDR4/5 interfaces and HBM, general-purpose 25G/56G/102G transceivers including reconfiguration, source-synchronous parallel busses, PLLs. 
*  Hands-on knowledge in IO ring, power and thermal estimates, floorplanning, timing analysis, and FPGA logic analyzers. 
*  Efficient and systematic troubleshooting and debugging skills, and proficiency with typical lab equipment: scopes, JBERTs, network analyzers, WFMs. 

Bonus points if you have: 

*  Development experience with Ethernet Switches products and chips, unicast/multicast routing protocols, and P4 language a plus. 
*  Experience with different broadcasting sync reference systems, including PTP, blackburst, and tri-level, a plus. 
*  Ability to work in a Linux-based embedded environment, including command-line, file system, and networking skills a plus. 
*  Knowledge of software languages such as C/C++, Bash, Python, and other design languages and scripts a plus. 
*  Understanding of digital video, audio, and associated broadcast standards such as SDI, AES, time code, MADI, PTP, and NMOS a plus. 
*  Knowledge of broadcast studio applications and workflow, especially router/distribution systems, a plus. 
*  Familiarity with development support tools such as Git, Jira, and Jenkins, a plus. 
*  Signal Integrity knowledge a plus. 

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion

At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Apply Now

Working in conjunction with the VP of Product, Product Specialist, closely with the development team, and other stakeholders, the Product Manager is responsible for creating and maintaining the vision, strategy, roadmap, business goals and marketing activities for their product portfolio.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Vpop Camera Motion Systems
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

Product Management
  
* Research market problems and competitive landscape
* Gather and integrate product ideas from customers, Sales, market research, and engineering into compelling and prioritized product capabilities.
* Identify new vertical opportunities as they emerge or are directed.
* Maintain a knowledgebase of Win/Loss product usage data gathered from Sales and directly from customers. Use this data to guide new product line requirements.
* Define, monitor, and maintain product pricing, margins, and various business models and review regularly to adjust to market forces (competitors, and feedback from Sales).
* Maintain relationships with key customers to ensure successful ongoing use of the product and gather feedback and input for roadmap
* Search for key development partners to augment the product line, brand and new markets.
* Creating and sharing roadmap vision and strategy
* Develop strategic multi-year product line roadmaps.
* Define product positioning and messaging, maintaining updates over time to address new product capabilities, changes in industry trends, and entry into new markets. Maintain alignment of positioning and messaging with User Personas and GEOs serviced.
* Author and provide appropriately scoped Market Requirements Document for new products, new releases for existing products, and new services, ensuring adequate detail to determine that the product responds to market requirements. This document will describe the capabilities to be implemented indicating whether these are customer requests, competitive matching or solutions to industry problems that are enabled via new or existing technologies.
* Collaborate with Development and marketing teams to plan product lifecycle events (product launch, releases, end of life, etc.)
* Communicate desired capabilities to the development team.
* Responsible for training of internal resources such as sales and professional services


Product Marketing
  
* Establish a distinctive competitive market position:
* Maintenance and evolution of the brand
* Collaborate with Product Marketing on:
* Promotional literature (brochures, cut sheets, etc.)
* Ads, Catalog, Website content, Product packaging
* Creation and supervision of show reels & training videos
* Success stories, Press releases, White papers
* Demo/tradeshow kit supervision
* Planning for key trade shows (IBC, NAB)
* Marketing announcements
* Launch and product update announcements
* Preparation of sales and dealer information packages


**Sales Support including:**  

* Attend regular product strategy meetings and summits.
* Participate in key customer demonstrations and proofs-of-concept
* Assist RSMs and BDMs with responses to tender documents, sales strategy and technical questions for key opportunities.
* Keep sales team up to date with new product status
* Review and make adjustment to sales quotes when needed
* Work with the Product Marketing & Pricing Systems team to ensure Salesforce is maintained with recent product information.


Other
  
* Responsible for ensuring a positive end-to-end customer experience.
* Assist in resolution of customer complaints regarding equipment, supplier and services
* Develop the team to a leading, independent unit.


**Who you are:**  

* A post-secondary degree in a related field (Engineering, Marketing)
* Good understanding of a production control room environment

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

As an SMT Operator, you will operate various machines to run the SMT Line. The role requires technical knowledge of printed circuit boards and surface mount technology.
  
  

**Who you report to:** Manager, SMT
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
  
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
  
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

* Set up and operation of screen printers and SPI
* Monitor SPI for tolerance adherence and understand troubleshooting methods to keep in line with paste quality
* Manage changeover process to ensure efficiency in production time
* Setup each SMT machine to ensure parts are loaded properly, conveyors are aligned, and oven recipes are accurate
* Obtain parts from inventory and verifying loaded components from the setup department are accurate
* Understand the basic hardware mechanics of the SMT equipment
* Learn all production screens and tabs of the pick and place software to ensure how to navigate the machine operation
* Understand basic troubleshooting skills with regards to component placement accuracy, board loading/unloading and fiducial data
* Work closely with AOI operator to ensure quality is maintained according to IPC 610 standards. This feedback is in response to correcting defects that may occur while operating the pick and place machines and/or screen printer
* Works closely with SMT Support team to ensure quality and to maintain production flow on the lines by reducing troubleshooting downtime
* Run the AOI machine to monitor quality coming down the lines
* Maintain and rely on IPC-610x training to ensure the correct defect calls are made and to know when to elevate problems to support staff
* Fully understand MES with regards to routing and reading MWI’s. Review of production documentation and verifying BOM revisions match the pick and place programs
* Clean stencils and returning them to the proper storage location during the build process
* Maintain ESD practices
* Adhere to MSDS procedures (PROC025A)
* Area maintenance and general tidiness and organization of materials


**Who you are:**  

* Have a high school diploma
* Mechanical aptitude
* Able to work independently or as part of a team
* Capable of following procedures and work logically
* Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
* Conscientious and willing to ask questions
* Strong aptitude for learning
* Able to lift and bend


Bonus points if you have the following
  
  

* Previous experience with machine operation

job_description:
The Technical Solutions Architect will support both the Asia Sales and Services teams in effort to increase sales of Ross Video technology in dynamic and innovative applications. Specifically, in the Asia market alongside the Regional Sales Managers.


This key role in the Ross Sales organization requires a unique blend of engineering/solutions solving skills along with the “soft skills” required in a sales process. The Technical Solutions Architect is responsible, during pre-and post-sales activities, for ensuring Ross Video’s Superior Customer Experience and that proposed deals include technical solutions that accurately address our customers’ business priorities and needs.


This requires collaboration with the Sales team, customer interaction and managing the client’s expectations throughout the engagement, as well as coordination with the Services implementation team (including Service Operations Specialists, Commissioners, Trainers and Technical Support Specialists) and the Creative Services team, to ensure a successful launch of Ross solutions at clients’ facilities.


**What we offer**

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.


Some of these perks include flexible hours, wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!


Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.


**Some of the things you will work on:**

* Participate and contribute to sales opportunities driven by the Regional Sales Managers, prioritizing efforts based on maximizing total impact on the team’s productivity.
* Scope technical solutions to address customer requirements, assess customers’ met and unmet needs, and recommend solutions that optimize value for both the customer and Ross Video.
* Coordinate closely with Ross’ internal Sales team and business partners to align solutions designed to meet our customers’ business requirements.
* Proactively engage in opportunity reviews, ensuring they are properly configured and aligned in the sales process.
* Educate and provide professional development to the team and business partners to enhance their product knowledge, technical acumen, and technical sales skills.
* Engage in customer facing product presentations, demos, training and workflow guidance to customers and business partners at their premise or tradeshows.
* Pursue additional business development opportunities and collaborate with Sales to ensure these are effectively covered and advanced.
* Develop project plans, assist scheduling with resource allocation, coordinate Ross technical services, third party resources and client teams.
* Work on systems oriented and highly technical projects.
* Work on tender responses and manage proposals for mid/large/solution-based RFPs/RFQs/RFIs.
* Help to prepare world-class customer facing proposal supplements.
* Create drawings that capture the spirit of specific opportunities, while also creating general variations for use by other groups at Ross.
* Assist in laying out and designing rail configurations for robotics opportunities.
* Provide market intelligence and client feedback to Product Managers on product & application requirements.
* Set up, configure and perform product demo for customers and business partners on Ross-specific products and workflows.
* Coordinate with the Demo and Tradeshow team and the Services team for upcoming system demos and events.
* Work with the Marketing team, alongside the Regional Sales Managers, in the planning of regional events.

**You should have:**

* Minimum 5 years of combined sales, sales engineering, presales experience, systems application, or product specialist experience.
* Record of achievement and technical solution expertise in a customer facing environment.
* Knowledge/experience in studio/broadcast/live event video production, broadcast video system design/engineering, or equivalent.
* Pose strong knowledge of industry standard protocols, connectors and terminations.
* Strong knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and CAD.
* Excellent communication & presentation Skills.
* Must be proficient in both Desktop and Server Networking practices.
* Able to work co-operatively with and across all company departments.
* Strong presentation skills.
* Possesses strong and creative problem-solving traits.
* Working knowledge of Salesforce and or similar CRM programs

**Bonus points if you have the following:**

* Existing knowledge and use of Ross Video products
* Knowledge of newsroom production workflow
* Knowledge of SMPTE 2110 IP and its implementation

If you are interested in this role, please apply at our Careers page over here: https://us232.dayforcehcm.com/CandidatePortal/en-US/rossvideo/Posting/View/5878

**Who you report to:** Director, Manufacturing Engineering
  
  

**What the job is all about:**  

You will manage the Process Engineering Team. The Process Engineering Team are the technical authority for all manufacturing shop floor processes. Their primary responsibility is to develop, optimize, and maintain manufacturing processes in line with product, capacity, quality, and efficiency requirements.
  
* Process Development: Responsible for designing and developing manufacturing processes
* Process Documentation: Create and maintain detailed documentation of manufacturing processes
* Environmental And Regulatory Compliance: Ensure that manufacturing processes adhere to environmental regulations and industry standards
* Npi Technical Review: Conduct technical review of newly released designs
* Automated Equipment Programming: Provide programming for automated equipment
* Material Selection: Collaborate with procurement teams to select and qualify materials
* Npi Build Support: Providing direct shop floor support for prototype builds
* Rca And Corrective Action Review: Conduct root cause analysis
* Skills/Process Training: Provide training to production operators and technicians
* Quality Control: Develop and implement quality control procedures
* Skills Development: support development and expansion of manufacturing skills


This position is located at our manufacturing facility in Iroquois, Ontario. Which is approximately a 30-minute drive from Kemptville, Brockville and Cornwall, or a 45-minute drive from southern Ottawa.
  
  

**Who you are:**  

* You are a post-secondary grad in Engineering or a related field with a technical background.
* 5+ years of experience in a manufacturing environment that includes exposure to process development, work instruction creation and procedure writing.
* Leadership experience
* In-depth experience in manufacturing processes and procedures and the product development process.
* Knowledge of CAD systems (AutoCAD or Inventor) is an asset.
* Advanced skill level with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook) and Microsoft Project.
* Some inventory, logistics & planning background, project management and Lean manufacturing experience are assets.
* Capable of managing several complex tasks at a time.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Ability to work with technical and non-technical staff.
* Well-organized, persistent, attentive to details and accuracy.
* Excellent leadership, planning, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
* Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to make decisions based on the company’s best interests.
* Must demonstrate the ability to work with several functional areas as well as interact with all levels of management. Continual process/systematic improvement projects while participating as a team member.


Ross Video is a world leader in high-definition Video Production Equipment, designed and manufactured in Canada and sold world-wide. Our products are used by a who's who of the global entertainment industry, including top broadcast networks like NBC, ABC, CBS and Fox in the USA; Rogers, CTV and the CBC in Canada and others around the world from Fiji to Finland and everywhere in between. We are # 1 in providing behind the scenes HD production gear used in Sports Stadiums including places where the Atlanta Falcons, NY Mets, LA Lakers, Pittsburgh Penguins and Buffalo Bills play. Our equipment was used extensively at the Vancouver 2010 and other Olympic games. Our systems are used by top acts including Springsteen, Blink 182, The Red Hot Chili Peppers and the Police to name a few. Top webcasters like Revision 3 and MLB.com use Ross. Our equipment is even used on the International Space Station. Join Ross and you will have a chance to work on advanced technology used in a wide variety of very cool ways by our clients.

• Assembly inspection (may or may not apply) which involves inspecting all through-hole components for orientation, correct component placement and ensuring that all finishing is completed properly. Data collection of defects would be included with inspection.

• Crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits or performs similar operations to join or secure parts in place.
• Connects component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points.
• Assembles and attaches hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, and switches to assemblies.
• Assembles cables, heat sinks and power supplies for finishing.
• Routing assemblies through MAX system either manually or electronically.
• Maintaining ESD and all safety practices.
• Follow all in place policies due to COVID-19 regulations

job_description:
The Inside Sales Representative is a key role in the Ross Video Sales Team. You will play an active part in helping develop Ross Video’s pipeline for revenue generation through the support to the Regional Sales Managers in the field, creation of sales leads, initiation of prospect calls, and establishment of ongoing rapport with existing customers and business partners.

In this role, you will assist the Asia Sales Team and are a direct extension of our front-line group of regionally based Sales Professionals, helping to work opportunities with both end users and via our authorized business partner network.

The Inside Sales Representative exudes integrity, drive and passion and exceed business targets through excellent telephone sales and superb communications skills.

Some of the things you will work on:

Provide overall support to assigned Regional Sales Managers to determine and implement opportunity specific sales approaches.
Handle inbound, unsolicited prospect calls and convert them into sales.
Make outbound follow-up contact with existing customers via telephone and e-mail to determine customer satisfaction, cross-sell and up-sell opportunities.
Develop a deep understanding of the company's products or services to effectively communicate features and benefits to potential customers.
Prepare, review and present quotes, proposals, and contracts to potential clients, including discussing terms and closing deals.
Provide post-sales support, address customer concerns, and ensure customer satisfaction to encourage repeat business.
Maintain and update a sales pipeline, tracking leads and opportunities through various stages of the sales process.
Utilize CRM software, Salesforce.com, to organize and manage customer interactions, update contact information, and track sales activities.
Maintain accurate records of sales activities, customer interactions, and transactions.
Forecast sales activities and prepare periodic sales report showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion.
Set up and deliver sales presentations, product/service demonstrations, and other sales activities.
Ensure customers’ order flow by meeting Ross’ clean order criteria.
Work closely with the sales team, marketing, and other departments to align sales strategies and achieve sales targets.
Assist in resolution of customer complaints regarding equipment, supplies, and services.
Stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and market conditions to adjust sales strategies accordingly.
Stay updated on product knowledge, sales techniques, and industry developments through continuous training and professional development.
Where necessary, support efforts at trade shows, exhibits, and other events.
When necessary, travel to sync up with respective Regional Sales Manager or other members of the Sales Team.

You should have:

University degree in Business Administration, or related discipline and/or equivalent work experience.
Minimum 5 years’ experience in a complex sales environment.
Demonstrated ability to convert prospects and close deals to exceed sales targets.
Solid experience in opportunity qualification, pre-call planning, call control, account development, and time management.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft applications, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook, to enhance efficiency and streamline processes within our team.
Experience with customer relationship management (CRM) software such as Salesforce.com is an added advantage.
Experience in sales forecasting & pipeline management.
Practical knowledge of inside sales principles, methods, practices, and techniques.
Experience selling broadcast equipment is an advantage.
Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills.
Demonstrated ability to build and maintain lasting relationships with customers.
Exceptional verbal communication and presentation skills.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

We are looking for a senior FPGA/Hardware Designer. The FPGA/Hardware Designer role will utilize the latest FPGA and SoC devices to provide IP and SDI-based transport solutions over leading-edge hardware platforms that power live video production.

As a member of the Hyperconverged Solutions R&D team, you will further advance the Ross industry-leading A/V infrastructure products including Ultrix, the ultimate hyperconverged platform.

Successful candidates will have serious technical chops to pair with a “find a way” attitude to harness the full power of themselves and their teammates in solving unique and challenging technical problems in a supportive, high-energy, and dynamic work environment.

What We Offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family/team, and we’ve got an energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

*  Promote, refine, and develop innovative features that you are passionate about in the most integrated hyperconverged hardware platform in the broadcast industry. 
*  Architect, design, implement, and test highly efficient leading-edge professional media transport solutions over SMPTE ST 2110/IP and SDI in high-performance FPGAs for Broadcast Routers, Multiviewers, and Switchers. 
*  Implement complex RTL algorithms for video and audio processing. 
*  Work closely with the management team to develop high-level design requirements, manage/negotiate key part selection, and support aggressive project scheduling. 
*  Generate both specification and design documentation to support cross-functional teams. 
*  Develop test features that can be utilized by Product Verification, Manufacturing, and Customer Support. 
*  Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of FPGA and HW designs through simulation and lab tests. 
*  Thoroughly self-test all design parts and support Product Verification team throughout development, including test plan review, feedback validation, and logic/hardware issue debugging/fixing as required. 
*  Support schematics development and board layout, frequently contributing directly to technical decisions relating to signal integrity, density, fabrication constraints, and thermal considerations. 
*  Assist in supporting other staff members as necessary through the entire NPI process flow, from design, documentation, implementation, and test to presales and customer service. 

Who you are:

Technical requirements:

*  FPGA/Hardware designer with 5+ years of professional experience developing SMPTE ST 2110 and SDI-based video/audio technologies. 
*  Deep knowledge across a broad range of topics including: 
*  FPGA building blocks, system architectures, speed/area tradeoffs. 
*  High-speed transceivers, physical implementation, clock domain analysis, and timing closure. 
*  FPGA compilation, simulation, and hardware testing. 
*  Intel and Xilinx FPGA devices. 
*  FPGA design, simulation, and debugging tools. 
*  External memory interface. 
*  Packet processing, switching/routing, scheduling. 
*  Fluent in FPGA hardware description and timing constraint languages: SystemVerilog (preferred), High-Level Synthesis (HLS), and VHDL, as well as TCL and SDC. 
*  Experience developing large FPGA designs including SoC and high-speed hardware interfaces such as NRZ/PAM4 100Gbps Ethernet, DDR4/5 interfaces and HBM, general-purpose 25G/56G/102G transceivers including reconfiguration, source-synchronous parallel busses, PLLs. 
*  Hands-on knowledge in IO ring, power and thermal estimates, floorplanning, timing analysis, and FPGA logic analyzers. 
*  Efficient and systematic troubleshooting and debugging skills, and proficiency with typical lab equipment: scopes, JBERTs, network analyzers, WFMs. 

Bonus points if you have: 

*  Development experience with Ethernet Switches products and chips, unicast/multicast routing protocols, and P4 language a plus. 
*  Experience with different broadcasting sync reference systems, including PTP, blackburst, and tri-level, a plus. 
*  Ability to work in a Linux-based embedded environment, including command-line, file system, and networking skills a plus. 
*  Knowledge of software languages such as C/C++, Bash, Python, and other design languages and scripts a plus. 
*  Understanding of digital video, audio, and associated broadcast standards such as SDI, AES, time code, MADI, PTP, and NMOS a plus. 
*  Knowledge of broadcast studio applications and workflow, especially router/distribution systems, a plus. 
*  Familiarity with development support tools such as Git, Jira, and Jenkins, a plus. 
*  Signal Integrity knowledge a plus. 

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion

At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Apply Now

The Project Coordinator provides day to day administrative support to the Project Management Office on tasks such as coordinating meeting details and logistics, managing the organization of project-related materials, and supporting onsite in-person/online project events with related resources.

The Project Coordinator will demonstrate advanced organizational skills with the ability to multi-task, and a strong attention to detail in the execution of their tasks. Working with the Organizational Change Manager, they will utilize their proficiency in writing to draft/edit internal communications, project documents and training reference materials. They will communicate effectively with stakeholders to assist with questions related to project activities and materials.

The Project Coordinator will be proficient with Microsoft Office 365 applications and will work in a variety of internal software applications related to the organization of project tasks, creation of training documentation/eLearning and management of content. They will also support the project team with activities such as reporting and organization of data and may be asked to support the wider Project Team with administrative and data processing tasks as required.

Who you report to: Organizational Change Manager

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

The Inside Sales Representative is a key role in the Ross Video Sales Team. You will play an active part in helping develop Ross Video’s pipeline for revenue generation through the support to the Regional Sales Managers in the field, creation of sales leads, initiation of prospect calls, and establishment of ongoing rapport with existing customers and business partners.
In this role, you will assist the Asia Sales Team and are a direct extension of our front-line group of regionally based Sales Professionals, helping to work opportunities with both end users and via our authorized business partner network.
The Inside Sales Representative exudes integrity, drive and passion and exceed business targets through excellent telephone sales and superb communications skills.
Who you report to: Manager - Inside Sales, Asia
What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
What the job is all about:
• Provide overall support to assigned Regional Sales Managers to determine and implement opportunity specific sales approaches.
• Handle inbound, unsolicited prospect calls and convert them into sales.
• Make outbound follow-up contact with existing customers via telephone and e-mail to determine customer satisfaction, cross-sell and up-sell opportunities.
• Develop a deep understanding of the company's products or services to effectively communicate features and benefits to potential customers.
• Prepare, review and present quotes, proposals, and contracts to potential clients, including discussing terms and closing deals.
• Provide post-sales support, address customer concerns, and ensure customer satisfaction to encourage repeat business.
• Maintain and update a sales pipeline, tracking leads and opportunities through various stages of the sales process.
• Utilize CRM software, Salesforce.com, to organize and manage customer interactions, update contact information, and track sales activities.
• Maintain accurate records of sales activities, customer interactions, and transactions.
• Forecast sales activities and prepare periodic sales report showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion.
• Set up and deliver sales presentations, product/service demonstrations, and other sales activities.
• Ensure customers’ order flow by meeting Ross’ clean order criteria.
• Work closely with the sales team, marketing, and other departments to align sales strategies and achieve sales targets.
• Assist in resolution of customer complaints regarding equipment, supplies, and services.
• Stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and market conditions to adjust sales strategies accordingly.
• Stay updated on product knowledge, sales techniques, and industry developments through continuous training and professional development.
• Where necessary, support efforts at trade shows, exhibits, and other events.
• When necessary, travel to sync up with respective Regional Sales Manager or other members of the Sales Team.
Who you are:
• University degree in Business Administration, or related discipline and/or equivalent work experience.
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in a complex sales environment.
• Demonstrated ability to convert prospects and close deals to exceed sales targets.
• Solid experience in opportunity qualification, pre-call planning, call control, account development, and time management.
• Advanced proficiency in Microsoft applications, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook, to enhance efficiency and streamline processes within our team.
• Experience with customer relationship management (CRM) software such as Salesforce.com is an added advantage.
• Experience in sales forecasting & pipeline management.
• Practical knowledge of inside sales principles, methods, practices, and techniques.
• Experience selling broadcast equipment is an advantage.
• Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills.
• Demonstrated ability to build and maintain lasting relationships with customers.
• Exceptional verbal communication and presentation skills.
• Self-motivated, with high energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm.
• Desire to constructively contribute to a team environment.
• Strong written communication skills.
• Fluent English

The Product Verification Specialist works closely with the Development and PV teams, developing and executing a series of comprehensive customer centered test suites prior to Product Release. The individual will ensure that test coverage and test case execution are as efficient and effective as possible.

Who you report to: Product Verification Manager, Hyperconverged Solutions

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

What the job is all about:
• The Product Verification Specialist is responsible for testing the wide range of products in the Connectivity product line. Duties include;
• Participation in the product development process with continual feedback on product usability and design testability.
• Design and implementation of custom testing solutions based on existing company technology.

• Third party equipment integration into the system and automated test suite.

The Executive Assistant is responsible for a wide variety of administrative duties to support the Vice President / Product Management organization. They are also required to maintain confidentiality and professionally interact with employees, management and the public.
This opportunity is in person majority of the week.

Who you report to: Vice President, Production Workflow & Cloud Services
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Administrative:
• Support VP calendar scheduling, including meetings, appointment coordination, conferences and other obligations
• Preparation and reconciliation of expense reports for various VPoPs
• Printing, faxing, mail/overnight packages, copying and filing
• Monitor emails/ messages upon request
Travel:
• Plan and coordinate domestic and international travel for VPoPs and occasionally team members
• Organize flights, accommodation and transportation
• Provide detailed itineraries and travel plans that align with executives’ schedules
On-boarding:
• Creating and assigning task lists for new employees in Dayforce as required
• Provide new team members with “welcome emails” including coordinating gift cards
Sales and trade shows:
• Schedule meetings for VPoPs and Product Managers for trade shows; including but not limited to NAB and IBC
• Assist EMEA Inside Sales with monthly management meetings; follow up on action items, send reminder emails and update meeting minutes.
General:
• Provide support for internal and external events: workshops, release planning, team lunches and after-hours team events
• Organize and prepare materials for meetings. As needed, attend, record and take minutes during meetings. Follow up on action items
• On request, draft and edit correspondence, reports, presentations and other documents as needed
• Coordinating thank you gifts, gift cards and any other necessary items for team events
• Cover front desk reception at the Ottawa campus as needed

Who you are:
• 1-3 year’s of work experience in a similar position
• Good organizational abilities and time management skills
• Knowledge of IT applications
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Strong knowledge of office procedures and practices
• Detail oriented
• Highly skilled with Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, Power Point)
• Ability to multi-task and work unsupervised
• Ability to handle stressful situations and to keep information confidential.
• Ability to problem solve efficiently and effectively
