The Direct Tax Manager position reporting to the Director of Tax and Compliance to support the tax function at Ross. Specifically, the role will be responsible for tax compliance and reporting, supporting audits, and assisting with special projects. You will be a key member of our Corporate Finance team! The complexity of compliance obligations continues to evolve & grow, both with changing legislation and our own corporate growth, making this an exciting, challenging, and dynamic opportunity!
Who you report to: Director, Tax and Compliance
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
What the job is all about:
• Responsible for completion of federal, international, provincial, and state income tax returns including all related analysis and support.
• Manage the statutory audits and tax return preparation for the Company’s international subsidiaries, as well as other local compliance.
• Assist with all tax related audits.
• Responsible for accounting for income taxes (IFRS) in the CDN, US and International subsidiaries.
• Responsible for determining monthly transfer pricing and management fee arrangements.
• Prepare supporting working papers for monthly IFRS consolidated tax provision, calculating monthly transfer pricing entries.
• Consult with operating management on tax issues and accounting staff on tax accounting issues.
• Ensuring that appropriate internal controls are in place over accounting for income taxes.
• Ensuring that appropriate internal controls are in place for compliance on related party /intercompany transactions.
• Maintains tax payment records for entities throughout the group, advises the finance team on required tax payments.
• Estimate and monitor annual cash taxes. Planning and accounting for income taxes.
• Preparation of all International reporting schedules.
• Reconcile all notice of assessments to returns filed.
• Assist in the implementation of tax planning strategies, which maximize savings on a defensible basis.
• Perform tax research, interpreting legislation and documenting findings.
• Fully engaged in tax technical work and making recommendations for change, as necessary.
Who you are:
• Self motivated with an ability to work both independently and in a team environment.
• Strong analytical skills and creativity to identify problems and potential solutions.
• Excellent organizational skills and ability to adjust and respond to multiple priorities and meet tight deadlines.
• Diligence.
• Completion of CICA In Depth Tax Course is considered an asset.
• 5+ Years of Tax Experience.
• Previous IFRS experience is considered an asset.
• Ability to look beyond the issue and see the “big” picture.

Ross Video, recently recognized as one of Canada’s top 100 companies by MediaCorp is seeking exceptionally talented and motivated professionals to join our Enterprise Management team.
Winning a top 100 award is not easy, it requires excellence in multiple dimensions:
• Work Environment
• Compensation and Benefits
• Family Friendly Policies
• Employee Engagement
• Training and Development
• Community engagement
Our ability to delight our customers with our innovative products is because they work better when combined with other Ross products. For example, our production switchers seamlessly integrate with our graphics and replay systems. This is no accident but the result of a sustained commitment to developing our Enterprise Management solutions: DashBoard, and Ross Platform Manager.
Enterprise Management’s Products form a key plank in Ross’ strategy to offer our customers Solutions rather than point products.
Should you join this team, you’ll work with some of the latest development technologies and information security disciplines.
Who you report to: VP of Product, Enterprise Management.
What the job is all about:
Working closely with the VP of Product, Technical Product Manager, and Development Team, you will be responsible for execution of and/or participation in all product management and marketing activities related your product line and related product lines
Product Management and Product Marketing including but not limited to:
• Maintenance and evolution of market and product strategy, including:
• Aligning product brand, customer, and user experience with Ross brand
• Researching market problems and competitive landscape
• Establishing a distinctive competitive market position
• Creating and sharing roadmap and release plans
• Define product positioning and messaging, maintaining updates over time to address new product capabilities, changes in industry trends, and entry into new markets. Maintain alignment of positioning and messaging with User Personas and GEOs serviced.
• Provide market problems guidance to be discussed and decided with the product team.
• Plan for and assist with outbound marketing and launch activities in collaboration with corporate marketing.
• Gather and integrate product ideas from customers, Sales, market research, and engineering into compelling and prioritized product requirements. Develop strategic multi-year product line roadmaps, including variety and timing of new product launches.
• Author and provide appropriately scoped Market Requirements for new products, new releases for existing products, and new services. Collaborate with Sales and Marketing during the creation and lead the cross-functional review and acceptance of documents to establish product and feature requirements.
• Author and provide appropriately scoped Product Requirements Documents (PRDs) to Engineering; collaborate with other stakeholders, and review with Engineering to ensure completeness of requirements specifications and acceptance.
• Identify new vertical opportunities as they emerge or are directed. Provide SME and market knowledge to cross-functional teams including Sales, Marketing, and other Business Units
• Provide strategic and detailed guidance during launch planning, defining GEO, channel, and sales strategies. Be responsible for the success of all product launches: define customer targets, sales targets, create and oversee the creation of collateral and ensure completeness.
• Define, monitor, and maintain product pricing, margins, and various business models (SaaS, volume discounted, partner, channel, OEM) and review regularly to adjust to market forces (competitors, and feedback from Sales).
• Identify Ross Video core distinctive competencies within the product line, continually developing such competencies toward further innovation and delivery of market-leading products. Provide continual consideration toward patent portfolio growth.
• Provide recommendations to the VP of Product for product and service decisions regarding introduction, evolution, market access, market growth, and product discontinuation decisions.
• Maintain a knowledgebase of Win/Loss data gathered from Sales and directly from customers. Use this data to guide new product line requirements
• In close collaboration with our marketing team, develop and implement key marketing initiatives related to the product, including:
• Promotional literature (brochures, cut sheets, etc.)
• Ads, Catalog, Website content, Product packaging
• Creation and supervision of show reels & training videos
• Participate in look & feel of manuals
• Success stories, Press releases, White papers
• Demo content supervision
• Demo/tradeshow kit supervision
• Preparation of sales and dealer information packages
• Planning for key trade shows (IBC, NAB)
• Responsible for training internal team members on named product lines
• Establish and foster community of internal and external expert users using social media engagement - Twitter, LinkedIn, Online Forums, and blogs
• Responsible for influencing and curating end-to-end customer experience, including:
• Marketing announcements
• Launch and product update announcements
• Download and access
• Product user experience
• Service and support experience

Sales Support
• Attend regular product strategy meetings and summits
• Participate in key customer demonstrations and proofs-of-performance
• Work with the sales team to design effective workflows in the pre-sales process
• Assist RSMs and BDMs with responses to tender documents and other technical questions
• Keep sales team up to date with new product status
• Work with the Product Marketing & Pricing Systems team to ensure Salesforce is maintained with recent product information

Other
• Embody Agile mindset and support Ross in the adoption of Agile practices
• Embrace the Ross Way to Market (RWTM) and contribute to its evolution and refinement over time.
• Perform other related duties as required

Who you are:
• A post-secondary degree in a related field (Engineering, Marketing)
• Experience selling & marketing broadcast equipment (preferred)
• Broadcast systems engineering experience (preferred)
• Excellent knowledge of a live production environment (preferred)
• Familiarity with software development processes
• Sales and/or marketing training
• Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint
• Positive
• Determined
• Passionate about broadcast & production industry
• Excellent writing & communication skills
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
• High tolerance of ambiguity
• Attention to detail
• Team oriented
• Problem solver
• Lateral thinker
• Organized and detail oriented
• Good teaching skills
• Able to work co-operatively with and across all company departments
• 3-5 years of experience in a Product Management role
• A solid understanding of broadcast & IT Systems
• Willing to Travel up to 10% of the time
• Valid Passport
• Valid Driver’s License

Working with a team you will fully understand the MES system for routing production, obtaining work instructions and logging defects. Preparing parts and PCB’s to be wave soldered or inserted at the electronics Royonics machine, operating this equipment.
What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
You will be joining our Production Team where we manufacture and build Ross Video products. We build a variety of products for Live TV productions: Production switchers, replay systems, video servers, virtual production, and mobile production units as well as robotic systems that automate the control and movement of TV cameras. Ross’ robots allow a single operator to pan, tilt, zoom, elevate, and reposition multiple cameras using simple joystick controls. Better yet, all these actions can be pre-programmed and fully automated to create mind-blowing visual effects.
Working with the Manufacturing Team in our Iroquois facility you could be working on:
Some of the things you will work on:
• Assembly inspection (may or may not apply) which involves inspecting all through-hole components for orientation, correct component placement and ensuring that all finishing is completed properly. Data collection of defects would be included with inspection.
• Press fit, aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jigs, fixtures, or other holding devices.
• Crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits or performs similar operations to join or secure parts in place.
• Connects component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points.
• Assembles and attaches hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, and switches to assemblies.
• Assembles cables, heat sinks and power supplies for finishing.
• Routing assemblies through MAX system either manually or electronically.
• Maintaining ESD and all safety practices.
• Follow all in place policies due to COVID-19 regulations

You should have experience with:
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Detail oriented
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• An excellent aptitude for learning

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Previous experience within a manufacturing environment
• Electronics Assembly

The System Debug Technician (SDT) will be responsible for providing testing & troubleshooting of completed assemblies including PCBAs in the manufacturing department. SDT will also work closely with the Test Development Team for new product introduction and validation of testing requirements. As an SDT you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of Ross Video Technologies and Products. This position is located in our state of the art manufacturing facility in Iroquois, On.
Who you report to: Manager Test, Technical Debug
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Troubleshooting, from fully assembled systems all the way down to the component level on PCBAs.
• Initiate repairs using appropriate routing and rework tools.
• Work with Production Managers, Specialists, and cell supervisors for work prioritization to ensure internal and external customer demands are met.
• Technical support to Production test staff, by validating infrastructure integrity and initiating repairs.
• Technical support to the Test Development team on NPI (new product introduction)
• Use various test equipment and tools (hardware and software) to test and debug products.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Working with a team you will fully understand the MES system for routing production, obtaining work instructions and logging defects. Preparing parts and PCB’s to be wave soldered or inserted at the electronics Royonics machine, operating this equipment.
What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
You will be joining our Production Team where we manufacture and build Ross Video products. We build a variety of products for Live TV productions: Production switchers, replay systems, video servers, virtual production, and mobile production units as well as robotic systems that automate the control and movement of TV cameras. Ross’ robots allow a single operator to pan, tilt, zoom, elevate, and reposition multiple cameras using simple joystick controls. Better yet, all these actions can be pre-programmed and fully automated to create mind-blowing visual effects.
Working with the Manufacturing Team in our Iroquois facility you could be working on:
Some of the things you will work on:
• Assembly inspection (may or may not apply) which involves inspecting all through-hole components for orientation, correct component placement and ensuring that all finishing is completed properly. Data collection of defects would be included with inspection.
• Press fit, aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jigs, fixtures, or other holding devices.
• Crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits or performs similar operations to join or secure parts in place.
• Connects component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points.
• Assembles and attaches hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, and switches to assemblies.
• Assembles cables, heat sinks and power supplies for finishing.
• Routing assemblies through MAX system either manually or electronically.
• Maintaining ESD and all safety practices.
• Follow all in place policies due to COVID-19 regulations

You should have experience with:
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Detail oriented
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• An excellent aptitude for learning

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Previous experience within a manufacturing environment
• Electronics Assembly
#LI-AS2

job_description:

Who you report to: Director, HR Operations

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

Benefits Management:

Coordinates benefits programs including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term and long-term disability, pension, and wellness. Primary contact for all broker and vendor relationships. Ross currently has plans in Canada, US, Australia, UK, Netherlands, Singapore, China and expat.

• Responsible for the administration of Pension and Benefits plans for all Ross locations.
• Reviews and resolves employee benefit issues and concerns regarding account and/or services issues with our vendors.
• Reconciliation and remittance of benefit, pension, wellness and health and safety billing to ensure premiums are paid accurately.
• Administer annual open enrolment process in the US and other annual updates to plans.
• Participates in annual benefit renewal process, provide census data, analyze proposals of renewal rates with carriers.
• Participate in the annual benefits budget process.
• Participates in year-end process, including data review and taxable benefits calculations.
• Coordinate with Dayforce team to ensure employee information via file feeds and other reports are updating vendors accurately.
• Analyze trends from a benefits perspective and assist with the development and competitiveness of programs.
• Coordinate with the Wellness Committee with a focus on developing programs to support educating and adoption of programs.
• Conduct routine review of plans to ensure compliance with governmental regulations.
• Ensures HR Hub has accurate information on benefits programs and create training material as required.

Leave Management:

Coordinates the support for all sick leave and workers’ compensation claims including general administration, case management, modified/gradual return to work plans and program compliance with legislation.

Coordinates maternity, parental and adoption leave including calculation of payments and return to work dates.

• Serves as the subject matter expert for the leave and workers’ compensation programs for all countries Ross operates in.
• Administers all aspects of leave and workers’ compensation programs. Provides case management and coordinates administrative aspects of the cases and claims.
• Works closely with payroll to track hours and manage all administrative aspects of leave and workers’ compensation claims.
• Works closely with employees to ensure that all relevant completed medical documents are provided.
• Partners closely with all HR business partners on all leave cases and workers’ compensation claims. Meets regularly with HRBPs to review claims’ status and develops strategies for resolution.
• Maintains appropriate contact with all employees on leave and coordinates all aspects of return to work.
• Coordinates with Health & Safety Specialist for accommodations for returning employees.
• Tracks leaves and report on metrics/analytics as requested.

Other:
• Assist with special HR projects and initiatives as required. Perform other related duties as required.

Who you are:
• Post secondary education in Business Administration, Accounting, or HR and 5 years’ experience in a Benefits/HR environment.
• Knowledge of benefits and pension theory and practice, with the ability to use judgment in applying this knowledge when dealing with complex and confidential issues.
• Strong understanding of benefits and pension legislation and compliance/filing requirements.
• Knowledge of benefits in the US and other countries is a benefit.
• Attention to detail and accuracy is essential.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Ability to deal with confidential information with a high degree of diplomacy.
• Excellent organizational skills.
• Team player but able to work independently.
• Excellent computer skills.
• Working knowledge of Ceridian (Dayforce) payroll software or comparable software.
• Experience with report writing software is an asset.
• High level of proficiency with MS Excel.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Ross Video is a rapidly expanding broadcast industry solutions provider. The Director of Sales for Latin America is a key member of the Global Sales leadership team and is directly responsible for driving sales throughout their regions. This individual is responsible for achieving quarterly/annual sales goals, building strategic business relationships, and implementing all sales strategy for their region. This position works closely with the Senior Vice President of Global Sales and is part of the front-line group that works hand in hand with Ross customers and business partners.

Who you report to: Senior Vice President of Global Sales

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

This unique position will include, but is not limited to, the following duties:

• Serve as a key member of the sales leadership team that drives the region’s strategic sales growth.
• Devise and deploy sales goals, strategies and objectives focusing on existing and new business and channel partnerships within their region and contribute to the preparation of sales quotas and budgets.
• Responsible for the overall hiring, motivation, and management of the direct reports in the region. Working with the Senior Vice President of Global Sales, this includes recruitment, mentoring, coaching, and evaluating team members while driving a culture of performance.
• Lead their team to consistently achieve quarterly and annual sales targets by managing a stratified client pipeline to ensure key prospects are identified, prioritized, and pursued to meet financial goals
• Attend trade shows and industry conferences to increase sales through improved levels of product knowledge and further develop industry contacts via networking.
• Participates and contributes to sales opportunities driven by the sales team, including face to face customer meetings and relationship development.
• Report and share information with the Senior Vice President of Global Sales, to ensure they are kept up to date on past, current, and predicted sales performance and customer relations.
• Collaborate with the regional leadership team to develop short- and long-term strategic plans, including the preparation of annual business plans.
• Create training and development plans for direct reports, including contributing to the evolution of the Ross Way To Sell (RWTS), and ensuring the sales team is following RWTS practices.
• Coach Sales Professionals on developing Win Plans. Periodically review Win Plans and aid with closing deals.
• Prepare and deliver high level presentations to television networks, business partners, and industry associations.
• Develop and maintain sales forecasting activities and assist in setting of territory sales goals with integrators and dealers, where applicable.
• Monitors and evaluates the activities and products of the competition by reviewing articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.
• Exudes the behaviors identified within Ross Video’s Culture Statements, as well as our company’s Code of Ethics.
• Performs other related duties as required.

Who you are:
• Bachelor’s degree in technology, business administration, marketing, sales, or a related field preferred
• 3+ years of management experience in a sales leadership role
• Strong experience in all aspects of sales, including growth strategies, distribution channel management, account development, and business planning
• Outstanding consultative selling abilities and excellent interpersonal skills at the executive level
• Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills
• Success closing large, complex sales in terms of dollar value and using multiple channels
• Demonstrated knowledge of accounting and financial practices
• Budgeting and forecasting skills
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Strong business acumen
• High level of proficiency with the Microsoft Office productivity suite
• Understanding of the Broadcast / Media Technology Market (Live Production experience an asset)
• Existing knowledge and use of Ross Video products, or experience selling hardware and software-based technology
• Extensive experience working with CRM’s such as Salesforce
• Proficiency level in Spanish. Portuguese a plus
• Willing to Travel up to 50% of the time
• Valid Passport
• Valid Driver’s License & a clear driving record

Ross Video, a leader in the video production industry technology and services sector, is undergoing rapid expansion globally. Our Cloud Solutions play an increasingly important role in this growth. In the role of Vice President, Cloud Solutions, you will be instrumental in shaping, implementing, and advancing our cloud strategy and solutions, directly influencing the future trajectory of Ross Video's products. Your role involves collaboration with other product leaders to develop and execute a visionary cloud strategy, transforming the landscape of live production and broadcast.
This is a hybrid role that combines business acumen and technical expertise, reporting directly to the Executive Vice-President & Chief Marketing Officer and working closely with the Chief Technology Officer.
Who you report to: Executive Vice-President & CMO
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Strategy & Planning
• Work cross-functionally with other Product Family Vice Presidents, the CMO and CTO in creating a strategy and roadmap for end to end Ross and Partner Company cloud productions.
• Collaborate closely with the Executive Leadership Team to ensure Cloud Solutions align with overall company objectives and strategies.
• Engage with other senior leaders in formulating and administering company policies and developing long-range goals and objectives for Cloud Solutions.
• Align strategies with market trends (product marketing) and technology trends (R&D).
• Work cross-functionally with other Product Family Vice Presidents in leveraging the reuse of associated cloud technologies.
Business & Sales
• Partner with marketing and sales teams to establish and achieve annual sales targets and strategies.
• Strive to surpass forecasted sales, gross margin, cash flow, and profitability targets for the product line.
• Provide regular performance updates to the Executive Leadership Team.
• Set objectives and develop strategies for managing departmental budgets.
• Train sales teams and channel partners to efficiently design customer solutions and effectively sell products.
• Forge relationships with end users through direct engagement, promoting Ross products and services.
• Conduct sales presentations to end users and business partners.
• Assist in preparing tender responses and, where necessary, participate in negotiations and closing sales.
Product Marketing
• Oversee all Marketing activities for Cloud Solutions, in close collaboration with the Corporate Marketing Team.
• Continuously train sales and dealer channels in coordination with the marketing team.
• Manage product marketing while aligning with R&D timelines.
• Ensure ethical marketing and sales of product lines as per the Ross Video Code of Ethics.
• Monitor and report on competitor activities, products and pricing.
• Conduct market analysis to understand market trends, customer needs.
• Explore new market applications and partnerships.
R&D & Technology
• Foster innovation and collaboration in Cloud Solutions across various R&D teams.
• Collaborate with Vice Presidents of Products to manage R&D activities related to Cloud Solutions.
• Partner with program management to ensure timely delivery of projects.
• Focus R&D teams on building performant, scalable, secure, and cost-efficient Cloud products and services.
• Stay informed about relevant technology trends to foster breakthrough solutions.
• Develop key technology partnerships and represent the company in industry organizations and standards efforts.
Management
• Foster creativity and determination within the team to achieve exceptional results.
• Develop and communicate both short-term and long-term strategic plans.
• Build and structure an effective team, collaborating with HR and managers for recruitment, training, and development.

Who you are:
• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or a related field.
• MBA or equivalent experience in marketing, strategy, and business planning.
• Minimum of 10 years’ experience in a senior product line management role, preferably in the live video production industry.
• Strategic mindset with a track record of developing, influencing, and executing plans.
• Hands-on leader with expertise in technical, business, and people management.
• Innovative thinker capable of generating valuable insights and creative solutions.
• Proven leadership ability, both directly and through influence.
• Strong problem-solving skills, including negotiation and conflict resolution.
• In-depth knowledge of cloud technologies and public cloud infrastructure.
• Skilled at driving internal and external alignment towards shared goals.
• Experience in creating and maintaining strategic alliances.
• Excellent communication, presentation, and relationship-building skills.
• Demonstrated ability to achieve results.

This position resides within the Process Engineering Team. The Process Engineering Team are the technical authority for all manufacturing shop floor processes. Their primary responsibility is to develop, optimize, and maintain manufacturing processes in line with product, capacity, quality, and efficiency requirements.

Reports to: Manager, Mechanical Process Development

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• PROCESS DEVELOPMENT: Responsible for designing and developing manufacturing processes including the selection of equipment/materials, defining manufacturing steps and establishing quality control measures. This expands to all shop floor manufacturing processes including, Receiving, Incoming Inspection, Kitting/Setup, Build, QC, Configuration and Shipping.
• PROCESS DOCUMENTATION: Create and maintain detailed documentation of manufacturing processes, including work instructions, standard operating procedures (SOPs), process flowcharts, training requirements and health and safety requirements.
• PROCESS OPTIMIZATION: Continually monitor and improve existing manufacturing processes to increase efficiency, reduce production costs and enhance product quality.
• CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT: Foster a culture of continuous improvement by regularly evaluating processes, soliciting feedback from production teams, and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and product quality.
• TECHNOLOGY INTEGRATION: Explore and implement new technologies and automation solutions to improve manufacturing efficiency and data collection.
• PROCESS/PRODUCT TROUBLESHOOTING: Investigate and resolve process-related issues, defects, and non-conformities. Utilize root cause analysis and corrective action to prevent recurrence.
• ENVIRONMENTAL AND REGULATORY COMPLIANCE: Ensure that manufacturing processes adhere to environmental regulations and industry standards, such as RoHS (Restriction of Hazardous Substances) compliance.
• JIG/FIXTURE DESIGN: Design and develop specialized tools, fixtures, and jigs that aid in the manufacturing and assembly processes. This includes but is not limited to SMT Stencils, reflow fixtures, wave solder fixtures, rework tooling and manual assembly aids.
• CAPACITY PLANNING: Monitoring production capacity capabilities ensuring capability to continually meet production demand.
• DESIGN FOR EXCELLENCE (DFX): Work closely with product design teams to ensure that products are designed in a way that is manufacturable and assembly-friendly, reducing production complexities and costs. This includes clear documentation of capabilities/requirements, technical review of design concepts and clearly defined manufacturing cost models highlighting the impact of design decisions.
• NPI TECHNICAL REVIEW: Conduct technical review of newly released designs ensuring the product is manufacturable, all required content is present, processes are developed and defined and provide production cost estimates including labor time and yield expectations for newly released products.
• ENGINEERING CHANGE REVIEW: Review product changes to ensure product remains manufacturable, processes are in place to accommodate change and any associated costs are documented and accounted for.
• AUTOMATED EQUIPMENT PROGRAMMING: Provide programming for automated equipment within manufacturing including for X-ray, wave solder, BGA rework, AOI, CNC, 3D printers and SMT placement (program preparation).
• QUALITY CONTROL: Develop and implement quality control procedures and inspection processes to ensure that raw materials and assembled products meet the required quality standards and specifications. This includes raw material inspection, automated and manual inspection requirements.
• MATERIAL SELECTION: Collaborate with procurement teams to select and qualify materials and components that meet quality and cost requirements.
• COST ANALYSIS: Conduct cost analyses to identify opportunities for cost reduction without compromising product quality or performance.
• SKILLS/PROCESS TRAINING: Provide training to production operators and technicians on new processes, equipment, and quality control procedures.
• MRB TECHNICAL REVIEW: Review, evaluate, and determine the proper disposition of nonconforming material.
• RCA AND CORRECTIVE ACTION REVIEW: Conduct root cause analysis, document and implement appropriate corrective action.
• SUPPLIER TECHNICAL REVIEW: Assist the procurement team by conducting technical review and audit of suppliers to ensure supplier capabilities meet technical and quality requirements.
• KPI AND METRIC DEFINITION: Defining and monitoring appropriate KPIs for all responsible processes including ensuring all appropriate reporting mechanisms and review are in place.
• WIP/FIN TECHNICAL MANAGEMENT – Document and communicate build requirements for implementing WIP/FIN changes including providing appropriate training where required.
• NPI BUILD SUPPORT: Providing direct shop floor support for prototype builds ensuring that build instructions are complete and followed and providing feedback to assist with product/process optimization prior to product release.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education in Engineering or equivalent experience.
• Some inventory, logistics and planning background is an asset.
• Experience in manufacturing processes and procedures and the product development process.
• Knowledge of CAD systems (AutoCAD or Inventor) is an asset.
• Advanced skill level with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook) and Microsoft Project.
• Capable of managing several complex tasks at a time.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
• Ability to work with technical and non-technical staff.
• Well-organized, persistent, attentive to details and accuracy.
• Excellent planning, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
• Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills.
• Ability to make decisions based on the company’s best interests.
• Must demonstrate the ability to work with several functional areas as well as interact with all levels of management. Continual process/systematic improvement projects while participating as a team member.
• Experience in a manufacturing environment that includes exposure to process development, work instruction creation and procedure writing a strong asset.
• A technical background.
• Prior project management and lean manufacturing experience is a definite asset.
• Valid Driver’s License and access to a vehicle for required travel to Ottawa for meetings.
#LI-PC1

At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! Übersicht und Organisation aller Transporte des Verleihs (Produktionstransporte), des Service-Centers (Wartungstransporte) und aller Transporte zwischen Filialen bzw. Filialen und Kunden für die Zentrale in der Feistritz im Rosental.

• Administrative activities

The Director, Information & Finance Systems oversees the management and implementation of corporate information systems, ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of the systems that support the financial and operational goals of the organization.

Who you report to: Chief Finance Officer

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Responsible for all Corporate Applications including ERP, CRM, CPQ, and PLM:
• Efficient, reliable operation
• Upgrades and enhancements
• User Access and Security
• Reporting and Business Intelligence
• Ensure that business leaders and department managers have accurate and timely tools and data to support efficient and effective decision-making.
• Help define Ross Video’s strategy for cloud-based system solutions.
• Lead critical systems projects, ensuring complete, on time and on budget implementations.
• Bridge MIS, Finance, Manufacturing, and Commercial groups.
• Gather business requirements, design and develop solutions to meet these needs.
• Coordinate the efforts of employees, partners, and contractors.
• Prepare an annual budget and control departmental spending throughout the year.
• Establish short- and long-range departmental goals, objectives, and procedures.
• Responsible for the overall hiring, motivation and management of the team which includes recruitment, mentoring, coaching and evaluating team members while driving a culture of performance.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education in Business or Technology
• Comprehensive knowledge of business principles and techniques of administration, leadership, organization, and management
• Experience with implementation of large information technology integrations (particularly ERP)
• In-depth understanding of the key business issues related to global enterprises and multi-site manufacturing organizations
• Detailed knowledge of and experience with change management
• Excellent Leadership, interpersonal and communication skills
• Innovative thinking, and proven record of delivering results
• Organized and detail-oriented
• Capable of managing several complex tasks simultaneously
• 10+ years of experience at a management position in high technology and/or manufacturing

Working with a team you will fully understand the MES system for routing production, obtaining work instructions and logging defects. Preparing parts and PCB’s to be wave soldered or inserted at the electronics Royonics machine, operating this equipment.
Who you report to: Manager, PCBA Assembly/Repair
What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
You will be joining our Production Team where we manufacture and build Ross Video products. We build a variety of products for Live TV productions: Production switchers, replay systems, video servers, virtual production, and mobile production units as well as robotic systems that automate the control and movement of TV cameras. Ross’ robots allow a single operator to pan, tilt, zoom, elevate, and reposition multiple cameras using simple joystick controls. Better yet, all these actions can be pre-programmed and fully automated to create mind-blowing visual effects.
Working with the Manufacturing Team in our Iroquois facility you could be working on:
What the job is all about:
• Assembly inspection (may or may not apply) which involves inspecting all through-hole components for orientation, correct component placement and ensuring that all finishing is completed properly. Data collection of defects would be included with inspection.
• Press fit, aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jigs, fixtures, or other holding devices.
• Crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits or performs similar operations to join or secure parts in place.
• Connects component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points.
• Assembles and attaches hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, and switches to assemblies.
• Assembles cables, heat sinks and power supplies for finishing.
• Routing assemblies through MAX system either manually or electronically.
• Maintaining ESD and all safety practices.
• Follow all in place policies due to COVID-19 regulations

Who you are:
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Detail oriented
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• An excellent aptitude for learning

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Previous experience within a manufacturing environment
• Electronics Assembly

In this role you will be responsible for SMT component replacement including micro-components, BGA’s, connectors both SMT and SMT/Thru hole combinations, perform lifted/damaged pad repairs and track cuts and working on Thru-hole component removal and insertion. Working with technical staff to receive and interpret direction and responsible for prioritizing daily work by production needs, RMA’s and Return to Customer defects. On occasion working with engineers to perform modifications to PCBA.
Who you report to: Manager, PCBA Assembly/Repair

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
What the job is all about:
• Prepping boards for repair include:
• Applying heat resistant materials to parts on the board for protection which include Kapton tape, heat blankets, pink shield
• Dismantling fully/partially assembled boards
• Baking boards, and logging times, in preparation for rework
• Ability to make choices, based on board damage or difficulty of task, on whether or not a defect is repairable or scrap
• Multi-tasking is always necessary as production requirements can affect prioritization of repairs
• Creativity is necessary when working with densely populated boards to get components on and off
• Accurately interprets and enters defect information within MES.
• Works closely with SMT and Mechanical Support staff
• Maintaining ESD practices.

You should have:
• An understanding of the X-Ray machine in order to deduce whether or not the solder quality adheres to IPC Standards
• An Excellent understanding of IPC-610 quality standards
• Knowledge of various tools – hot air guns, pre-heaters and traditional soldering/de-soldering tools and tips
• Air Vac is used for removing and replacing micro-components, BGA’s, Flip Chips and connectors. The necessary knowledge for running this equipment include:
• Stencil and paste process
• Creating profiles using solder sample boards and thermo couples
• Reballing BGA’s

Bonus points if you have the following:
• An Excellent understanding of IPC-610 quality standards
• MES system

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Ross Video is a world leader in high-definition video production equipment, designed and manufactured in Canada and sold worldwide. Our products are used by a who’s who of the global entertainment industry, including top broadcast networks like NBC, ABC, CBS, and Fox in the USA; Rogers, CTV, and the CBC in Canada; and others worldwide from Fiji to Finland and everywhere in between. We are # 1 in providing behind-the-scenes HD production gear used in Sports Stadiums, including places where the NY Mets, LA Lakers, Pittsburgh Penguins, and Buffalo Bills play. Our equipment was used extensively at the Vancouver 2010 and other Olympic games. Our systems are used by top acts, including Springsteen, Blink 182, The Red Hot Chili Peppers, and the Police, to name a few. Top webcasters like Revision 3 and MLB.com use Ross. Our equipment is even used on the International Space Station. Join Ross and you will have a chance to work on advanced technology used in a wide variety of cool ways by our clients.

Who you report to: Product Verification Team Lead

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries, comprehensive health plans, and several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, the option to work from home or office, generous paid time off, a fitness/wellness allowance, an employee share ownership program, development support, and many fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we've got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
We are seeking a talented Automation Testing Specialist to join the Carbonite switchers group at Ross Video. The Carbonite group is responsible for developing highly successful and acclaimed video Carbonite switchers and control surfaces, such as TouchDrive.

In this role, your primary focus will be to work with other team members to address automated testing needs for existing and emerging new products. The successful candidate will develop software to automatically test Ross Video products working with various switchers and other video analysis tools. This role requires a solid foundation of automation testing. This role will also involve debugging and identifying root causes of field tickets via automation testing.

As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work on industry-leading products and play a critical role in ensuring our customers receive exceptional solutions. If you are a skilled automation tester and/or have a broadcasting background with a passion for problem-solving and a commitment to delivering high-quality testing suites, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Qualifications:
• Experience in test automation development.
• Demonstrated expertise in Python scripting.
• Proficient in writing Gherkin-based test scripts using RobotFramework.
• Familiarity with Linux environments and shell scripting.
• Strong knowledge of SDLC and proficiency in test planning, PV tools, bug tracking systems.
• Basic understanding of networking concepts.
• Understanding of versioning tools such as GIT, SVN.
• Asset: Prior experience with drivers such as Selenium.
• Asset: Familiarity with broadcasting, switchers, or video production in general.
• Asset: Experience in Object-Oriented Programming.
• Asset: University Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalents.
• Asset: Strong software development skills.

Key Traits:
• Enjoys tackling new technical challenges.
• Excited to use strong programming skills for test automation in Ross Video products.
• Passionate and takes ownership of test automation execution.
• Values communication skills as much as technical skills.
• Enjoys continuous learning and staying updated on testing strategies and social media applications.
• This position involves hardware-related responsibilities and is conducive to either office-based or hybrid work arrangements.

As a Configuration Technician this role involves interpreting our customer configuration documentation, DWI’s or Sales Order notes to meet these requirements and use of these documents to verify configuration. Working in a team environment and supporting cross functional stakeholders.
Who you report to: Production Manager, Configuration & Systems
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

What the job is all about:
• Configuring systems to meet sales order criteria which involves picking finished goods hardware from stock to populate and align into frame chassis or systems for software loads, licensing and testing according to customer requirements
• Interpret customer configuration documentation, DWI’s or Sales Order notes to meet these requirements and use these documents to verify configuration
• Create data records which associate product serial numbers to their parent Sales Order
• System level debug if product doesn’t perform as expected with the configuration hardware in place
• Determine whether failures are assembly or system related hardware problems or are due to test infrastructure issues (failures at circuit board level passed to another dept for analysis)
• Confirm procedure adherence and infrastructure integrity. If the root cause is a PCBA, funnel it to the PCBA Test group for repair
• Perform light, system level assembly, interconnect and fasten assemblies
• Identify products failing test procedure/configuration specifications and route product accordingly, both physically and in the routing system
• This role will be part of a team which collectively manages its own floor stock. Proper inventory management practices must be well-understood and practiced (Part/Shelf identification, FIFO, and periodic inventory counts)
• Perform other related duties as required
Who you are:
• Able to work with in a Team environment
• Excellent communication skills
• Manufacturing experience , shipping experience would be an asset
• Understanding of inventory processes
• A+ Certification
• Solid level PC/Windows computer skills
Bonus points if you have the following:
• Demonstrated work experience
• Willing to share your knowledge
• Mechanical aptitude
• Good organizational skills

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Working with a team you will fully understand the MES system for routing production, obtaining work instructions and logging defects. Preparing parts and PCB’s to be wave soldered or inserted at the electronics Royonics machine, operating this equipment.
Who you report to: Manager, PCBA Assembly/Repair
What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
You will be joining our Production Team where we manufacture and build Ross Video products. We build a variety of products for Live TV productions: Production switchers, replay systems, video servers, virtual production, and mobile production units as well as robotic systems that automate the control and movement of TV cameras. Ross’ robots allow a single operator to pan, tilt, zoom, elevate, and reposition multiple cameras using simple joystick controls. Better yet, all these actions can be pre-programmed and fully automated to create mind-blowing visual effects.
Working with the Manufacturing Team in our Iroquois facility you could be working on:
What the job is all about:
• Assembly inspection (may or may not apply) which involves inspecting all through-hole components for orientation, correct component placement and ensuring that all finishing is completed properly. Data collection of defects would be included with inspection.
• Press fit, aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jigs, fixtures, or other holding devices.
• Crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits or performs similar operations to join or secure parts in place.
• Connects component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points.
• Assembles and attaches hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, and switches to assemblies.
• Assembles cables, heat sinks and power supplies for finishing.
• Routing assemblies through MAX system either manually or electronically.
• Maintaining ESD and all safety practices.
• Follow all in place policies due to COVID-19 regulations

Who you are:
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Detail oriented
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• An excellent aptitude for learning

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Previous experience within a manufacturing environment
• Electronics Assembly

The Sales Operations Specialist is a partner in a collection of sales territories, which you will come to know well. You will help drive the business in the region by offloading back-office tasks from Regional Sales Managers, such as creating and maintaining account and contact information in our
customer relationship management system. You will also help to manage sales activity by assisting with opportunity management, tracking activities related to annual territory plans and by performing data analysis and producing reports. Sales Operations Specialists exude integrity, drive, and passion while demonstrating a high level of attention to detail, superior organization & communications skills.

job_title: Product Specialist - Sports Analysis Graphics (Job Req #2024-004)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Product Specialist works to assist in the development of Ross Video’s market position for our Piero Sports Analysis product line.

What We Offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

 What the job is all about: 

You will work with the Product Management Team and Sales Management teams in all regions to develop new business, increase sales opportunities and thereby maximize revenue for the organization for our Piero Sports Analysis products. These Ross products also integrate with the wider Ross solution which includes products like Ross Virtual Solutions (AR, XR, Virtual Studio), Mira replay and production servers which you may also have to promote.

To achieve this, you will need to competently present and demonstrate our products to potential new customers and assist in converting them into clients. You will also seek to develop opportunities with existing clients by updating them on new features or discussing some of their requirements that may require new functionality or different workflows. Sharing other collaterals such as product documentation or new releases will be essential to that extent.

You will also be involved with post-sales activities as this role also includes assisting Ross customers with on-boarding activities (especially for first-time users), workflow consultancy and feedback gathering following the launch of Piero for a sports match or season.

Developing and maintain relationships with industry partners is also a key part of the role which may at times require a technical or workflow discussion which the development will assist you with.

It is also expected you will be providing feedback to development on existing or new features as a way to continuously improve our product. As a product expert, you will have a say in the product roadmap and go-to-market strategy by sharing critical information on market trends, customer requirements and competition.

You may also have to assist Ross staff with configuration support, thought leadership in the region, creating quotations in conjunction with the sales & technical solutions teams and providing support on tender responses.

In essence, the role will be about being product management’s eyes and ears on the ground in order to help grow the Piero business.

 Who you are: 

A thorough understanding of all types of our products in this space and their application is required, as is the ability to draw on experience to positively present Ross product features and performance against competitor products.

The Product Specialist will be required to travel extensively to support worldwide sales opportunities as well as attend Ross supported trade shows and events, therefore a valid Passport is required. Due to COVID travel restrictions, some of these activities may have to be conducted remotely.

*  5+ years of experience with broadcast equipment in pre or post-sales environment. Product management experience would be considered as asset. 
*  5+ years of experience with sports analysis / telestration. 
*  Proficient in Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Visio 
*  Able to take complex technical details and convey the information to others in an easy-to-understand manner 
*  Excellent written and verbal communication skills (in English) 
*  Organized and very detail orientated 
*  Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision 
*  Able to work co-operatively with and across all company departments 

 Bonus points if you have: 

*  Experience in selling and marketing broadcast equipment 
*  Knowledge of graphics operational workflows 
*  Multi-lingual skills 

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion

At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

As a Product Engineering Prime you will be an advocate for product success within the manufacturing department. You will work across multiple manufacturing teams and act as manufacturing’s technical liaison to the product development teams. You will manage and support the introduction of new products into manufacturing while additionally supporting the continuous improvement, optimization, and general oversight of existing products through their complete lifecycle.

Members of product engineering need to possess both a deep understanding of the technologies used in the products and an understanding of the manufacturing technologies required to produce them.

The manufacturing department at Ross Video specializes in high mix and low volume production, catering primarily to the live production industry's need for high-end electronics. With a comprehensive in-house operation that includes Surface Mount Technology (SMT), assembly, testing, and product configuration. Beyond electronics, the department also exhibits expertise in creating mechanically oriented production control panels and advanced robotic systems. This blend of technical precision and innovative engineering underscores Ross Video's commitment to quality and excellence in the fast-paced world of live production technology.

Who you report to: Product Engineering Manager

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Within manufacturing, spearhead the introduction of new products, coordinating with various manufacturing subject matter experts while monitoring the progress and results.
• Liaise between manufacturing and R&D to synchronize project timelines, expectations, and milestones. Engage early on product designs to work through manufacturing risk mitigations.
• Participate in DFX reviews and work with the technical teams to resolve potential issues.
• Review ECO’s to ensure proper product structures and approve MCO status changes.
• Ensure manufacturing readiness for launch schedules through progress tracking, issue resolution. and activity coordination.
• Foster collaboration between teams, facilitating feedback, and suggestions for design improvements.
• Estimate and measure the impact new designs will have on manufacturing in terms of labour, equipment, processes, facilities, and technological improvements.
• Conduct assessments to identify potential manufacturing improvements or upgrades and liaise with relevant teams regarding implementation plans.
• Collaborate with quality assurance teams to develop quality control plans and procedures, focusing on test and inspection oversight.
• Analyze product performance data, identifying areas for improvement and monitoring defect trends, yields, process times, and field return trends.
• Implement cost reduction initiatives without compromising product quality and conduct failure analysis to identify and resolve product-related issues, taking ownership of macro-level issues.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education (degree or diploma) in a technical field such as engineering.
• 7+ years of professional experience in a manufacturing or a high-tech environment.
• 4+ years managing simultaneous projects and activities.
• Knowledge of embedded systems and electronics.
• Knowledge of product lifecycle management.
• Knowledge of configuration management systems and best practices.
• Solid knowledge of electronic manufacturing processes, procedures, and best practices.
• Education or training on project/program management.
• Well organized, prepared, persistent, and detail oriented.
• Capable of managing numerous competing tasks.
• Able to independently problem solve and resolve issues.
• Capable of comfortably working with a variety of personalities
• Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Manager of Manufacturing Test Development will oversee the team that develops and maintains our manufacturing test systems and strategies across multiple product lines. This position is based in our Iroquois, Ontario manufacturing facility and will require a candidate capable of driving test excellence in a fast-paced and innovative environment.

Who you report to: Product Engineering Manager

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Lead the Manufacturing Test Development team to create robust, scalable test solutions for PCBA testing and end-product functional verification.
• Collaborate with R&D to understand product technology and determine appropriate manufacturing test requirements and strategies.
• Oversee the design and implementation of automated and semi-automated test equipment and software to enhance efficiency and coverage.
• Manage test development activities for New Product Introduction (NPI) and continuous product improvement.
• Support manufacturing staff by providing expertise on product testing and system implementation.
• Direct the investigation and resolution of high-priority failure modes and product issues.
• Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for test procedures, systems, and equipment.
• Identify and implement improvements in test coverage, cycle time reduction, scalability, and overall quality.
• Regularly report on the progress of test development projects and maintain cross-functional coordination to address technical challenges.
• Foster a culture of continuous learning and knowledge sharing within the team and with other departments.

Who you are:
• Undergraduate degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent educational background combined with work experience. EET would be an asset.
• 7+ years of experience in a manufacturing test development.
• In depth understanding of electronic hardware and digital components (e.g., CPUs, FPGAs, flash memory).
• Fluent in reading and interpreting electrical schematics and PCBA design files.
• Familiarity with a broad range of test equipment and test methodologies including boundary scan.
• Proficient in the principles of automation and interfacing with equipment and products
• Comprehension of data acquisition systems and protocols (TCP/IP, RS232, USB, CAN).
• Traits:
• Demonstrated leadership skills with the ability to manage and develop a technical team.
• A proactive problem-solver who embraces new challenges and continuous improvement.
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to disseminate knowledge and encourage collaborative input.
• Strategic thinker with strong analytical and project management skills.
• Demonstrated ability to lead people and projects to completion.
• Demonstrated ability to drive change and improvement.

The ideal candidate is part of our product development team creating world-leading next generation broadcast video processing technology. You participate in all phases of FPGA development from specifications and design to customer support. You coordinate with the product manager on overall product vision and lead the FPGA developers in the design of new products and the improvement of existing products.
You have an advanced knowledge of RTL coding, physical implementation, timing constraints, lab alidation/integration/troubleshooting of complex FPGA designs comprising a mix of custom RTL with hard and soft vendor IP cores within a larger embedded system context.
Our team is Agile and DevOps aligned, with a focus on continuous learning and automation. We hold backlog refinements and post-mortems, regularly tackle technical debt and reserve time for innovation.
If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. Major award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible.

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
What the job is all about:
• Architect, design, simulate and test leading edge SoC FPGA solutions
• Develop high-level design requirements and support product definitions
• Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of the FPGA, SW & HW
• Provide significant technical leadership to design review preparation, execution, and timely action item closure for complex issues
• Generate both specification & design documentation to support cross functional aspects of the NPI process
• Lead the overall FPGA delivery, which entails collaborating with cross-functional teams, suppliers and customers to ensure the overall design meets the requirements according to an established project plan
• Thoroughly self-test all designs and support PV/QA throughout development – this includes reviewing test plans, validating feedback, and debugging/fixing hardware problems as required
• Participate in Agile Scrum ceremonies like stand-ups, retrospectives, refinement, and sprint kick-offs
• Coach and mentor team members to attain breakthrough results in assigned deliverables
• Create first class FPGA designs by innovating in design, project management, tools and workflow
Who you are:
• In-depth knowledge of (System)Verilog
• Expert in FPGA workflow including RTL design capture, synthesis, timing closure, prototyping and release processes
• Knowledge of GIT revision control systems, branching and tagging methodologies
• Expertise in RTL debugging through simulations and in-FPGA logic analyzers
• Familiarity with the following technologies:
• SoC FPGA interconnects such as Avalon or AXI interfaces
• PCI Express, Ethernet 1/10/25/100GE, 12G-SDI, HDMI, DisplayPort
• Compression technologies: NDI, SRT, AVC/HEVC
• High-speed transceivers
• Timing recovery / Synchronization
• DMA engines, hardware acceleration (off-load engines), and high-performance memory controllers
• UVM Based Testbenches
• Vivado and Quartus development tools
• Knowledge of software languages such as C, C++, Python a plus
• Understanding of digital video, audio and associated audio standards a plus
• B.S. in Engineering required
• Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work as part of a team or independently as required
• Keen observational skills and problem solving intuition
• Organized and detail oriented self-starter
• Ability to learn new concepts quickly and work towards finding creative solutions to challenging problems
• Comfortable moving forward aggressively; balancing risks appropriately to optimize success across all business aspects – good, fast, and cheap
• Equally comfortable contributing as a team member or championing an idea with upper management
• Minimum 8 years FPGA development experience with expertise in Video/Audio technologies preferred
