job_title: Product Engineering Prime - Iroquois ON (Job Req #2024-026)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

As a Product Engineering Prime you will be an advocate for product success within the manufacturing department. You will work across multiple manufacturing teams and act as manufacturing’s technical liaison to the product development teams. You will manage and support the introduction of new products into manufacturing while additionally supporting the continuous improvement, optimization, and general oversight of existing products through their complete lifecycle.

Members of product engineering need to possess both a deep understanding of the technologies used in the products and an understanding of the manufacturing technologies required to produce them.

The manufacturing department at Ross Video specializes in high mix and low volume production, catering primarily to the live production industry's need for high-end electronics. With a comprehensive in-house operation that includes Surface Mount Technology (SMT), assembly, testing, and product configuration. Beyond electronics, the department also exhibits expertise in creating mechanically oriented production control panels and advanced robotic systems. This blend of technical precision and innovative engineering underscores Ross Video's commitment to quality and excellence in the fast-paced world of live production technology.

Who you report to: Product Engineering Manager

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Within manufacturing, spearhead the introduction of new products, coordinating with various manufacturing subject matter experts while monitoring the progress and results.
• Liaise between manufacturing and R&D to synchronize project timelines, expectations, and milestones. Engage early on product designs to work through manufacturing risk mitigations.
• Participate in DFX reviews and work with the technical teams to resolve potential issues.
• Review ECO’s to ensure proper product structures and approve MCO status changes.
• Ensure manufacturing readiness for launch schedules through progress tracking, issue resolution. and activity coordination.
• Foster collaboration between teams, facilitating feedback, and suggestions for design improvements.
• Estimate and measure the impact new designs will have on manufacturing in terms of labour, equipment, processes, facilities, and technological improvements.
• Conduct assessments to identify potential manufacturing improvements or upgrades and liaise with relevant teams regarding implementation plans.
• Collaborate with quality assurance teams to develop quality control plans and procedures, focusing on test and inspection oversight.
• Analyze product performance data, identifying areas for improvement and monitoring defect trends, yields, process times, and field return trends.
• Implement cost reduction initiatives without compromising product quality and conduct failure analysis to identify and resolve product-related issues, taking ownership of macro-level issues.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education (degree or diploma) in a technical field such as engineering.
• 7+ years of professional experience in a manufacturing or a high-tech environment.
• 4+ years managing simultaneous projects and activities.
• Knowledge of embedded systems and electronics.
• Knowledge of product lifecycle management.
• Knowledge of configuration management systems and best practices.
• Solid knowledge of electronic manufacturing processes, procedures, and best practices.
• Education or training on project/program management.
• Well organized, prepared, persistent, and detail oriented.
• Capable of managing numerous competing tasks.
• Able to independently problem solve and resolve issues.
• Capable of comfortably working with a variety of personalities
• Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills.

As an SMT Operator, you will operate various machines to run the SMT Line. The role requires technical knowledge of printed circuit boards and surface mount technology.

Who you report to: Manager, SMT

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Set up and operation of screen printers and SPI
• Monitor SPI for tolerance adherence and understand troubleshooting methods to keep in line with paste quality
• Manage changeover process to ensure efficiency in production time
• Setup each SMT machine to ensure parts are loaded properly, conveyors are aligned, and oven recipes are accurate
• Obtain parts from inventory and verifying loaded components from the setup department are accurate
• Understand the basic hardware mechanics of the SMT equipment
• Learn all production screens and tabs of the pick and place software to ensure how to navigate the machine operation
• Understand basic troubleshooting skills with regards to component placement accuracy, board loading/unloading and fiducial data
• Work closely with AOI operator to ensure quality is maintained according to IPC 610 standards. This feedback is in response to correcting defects that may occur while operating the pick and place machines and/or screen printer
• Works closely with SMT Support team to ensure quality and to maintain production flow on the lines by reducing troubleshooting downtime
• Run the AOI machine to monitor quality coming down the lines
• Maintain and rely on IPC-610x training to ensure the correct defect calls are made and to know when to elevate problems to support staff
• Fully understand MES with regards to routing and reading MWI’s. Review of production documentation and verifying BOM revisions match the pick and place programs
• Clean stencils and returning them to the proper storage location during the build process
• Maintain ESD practices
• Adhere to MSDS procedures (PROC025A)
• Area maintenance and general tidiness and organization of materials

Who you are:
• Have a high school diploma
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• Solid aptitude for learning
• Able to lift and bend

Bonus points if you have the following:

• Previous experience with machine operation

In this role you will be responsible for SMT component replacement including micro-components, BGA’s, connectors both SMT and SMT/Thru hole combinations, perform lifted/damaged pad repairs and track cuts and working on Thru-hole component removal and insertion. Working with technical staff to receive and interpret direction and responsible for prioritizing daily work by production needs, RMA’s and Return to Customer defects. On occasion working with engineers to perform modifications to PCBA.
Who you report to: Manager, PCBA Assembly/Repair

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
What the job is all about:
• Prepping boards for repair include:
• Applying heat resistant materials to parts on the board for protection which include Kapton tape, heat blankets, pink shield
• Dismantling fully/partially assembled boards
• Baking boards, and logging times, in preparation for rework
• Ability to make choices, based on board damage or difficulty of task, on whether or not a defect is repairable or scrap
• Multi-tasking is always necessary as production requirements can affect prioritization of repairs
• Creativity is necessary when working with densely populated boards to get components on and off
• Accurately interprets and enters defect information within MES.
• Works closely with SMT and Mechanical Support staff
• Maintaining ESD practices.

You should have:
• An understanding of the X-Ray machine in order to deduce whether or not the solder quality adheres to IPC Standards
• An Excellent understanding of IPC-610 quality standards
• Knowledge of various tools – hot air guns, pre-heaters and traditional soldering/de-soldering tools and tips
• Air Vac is used for removing and replacing micro-components, BGA’s, Flip Chips and connectors. The necessary knowledge for running this equipment include:
• Stencil and paste process
• Creating profiles using solder sample boards and thermo couples
• Reballing BGA’s

Bonus points if you have the following:
• An Excellent understanding of IPC-610 quality standards
• MES system

job_title: Product Specialist - Sports Analysis Graphics (Job Req #2024-004)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Product Specialist works to assist in the development of Ross Video’s market position for our Piero Sports Analysis product line.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
You will work with the Product Management Team and Sales Management teams in all regions to develop new business, increase sales opportunities and thereby maximize revenue for the organization for our Piero Sports Analysis products. These Ross products also integrate with the wider Ross solution which includes products like Ross Virtual Solutions (AR, XR, Virtual Studio), Mira replay and production servers which you may also have to promote.

To achieve this, you will need to competently present and demonstrate our products to potential new customers and assist in converting them into clients. You will also seek to develop opportunities with existing clients by updating them on new features or discussing some of their requirements that may require new functionality or different workflows. Sharing other collaterals such as product documentation or new releases will be essential to that extent.

You will also be involved with post-sales activities as this role also includes assisting Ross customers with on-boarding activities (especially for first-time users), workflow consultancy and feedback gathering following the launch of Piero for a sports match or season.

Developing and maintain relationships with industry partners is also a key part of the role which may at times require a technical or workflow discussion which the development will assist you with.

It is also expected you will be providing feedback to development on existing or new features as a way to continuously improve our product. As a product expert, you will have a say in the product roadmap and go-to-market strategy by sharing critical information on market trends, customer requirements and competition.

You may also have to assist Ross staff with configuration support, thought leadership in the region, creating quotations in conjunction with the sales & technical solutions teams and providing support on tender responses.
In essence, the role will be about being product management’s eyes and ears on the ground in order to help grow the Piero business.

Who you are:
A thorough understanding of all types of our products in this space and their application is required, as is the ability to draw on experience to positively present Ross product features and performance against competitor products.

The Product Specialist will be required to travel extensively to support worldwide sales opportunities as well as attend Ross supported trade shows and events, therefore a valid Passport is required. Due to COVID travel restrictions, some of these activities may have to be conducted remotely.

• 5+ years of experience with broadcast equipment in pre or post-sales environment. Product management experience would be considered as asset.
• 5+ years of experience with sports analysis / telestration.
• Proficient in Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Visio
• Able to take complex technical details and convey the information to others in an easy-to-understand manner
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills (in English)
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
• Able to work co-operatively with and across all company departments

Bonus points if you have:
• Experience in selling and marketing broadcast equipment
• Knowledge of graphics operational workflows
• Multi-lingual skills
#LI-KF1

The ideal candidate is part of our product development team creating world-leading next generation broadcast video processing technology. You participate in all phases of FPGA development from specifications and design to customer support. You coordinate with the product manager on overall product vision and lead the FPGA developers in the design of new products and the improvement of existing products.
You have an advanced knowledge of RTL coding, physical implementation, timing constraints, lab alidation/integration/troubleshooting of complex FPGA designs comprising a mix of custom RTL with hard and soft vendor IP cores within a larger embedded system context.
Our team is Agile and DevOps aligned, with a focus on continuous learning and automation. We hold backlog refinements and post-mortems, regularly tackle technical debt and reserve time for innovation.
If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. Major award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible.

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Architect, design, simulate and test leading edge SoC FPGA solutions
• Develop high-level design requirements and support product definitions
• Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of the FPGA, SW & HW
• Provide significant technical leadership to design review preparation, execution, and timely action item closure for complex issues
• Generate both specification & design documentation to support cross functional aspects of the NPI process
• Lead the overall FPGA delivery, which entails collaborating with cross-functional teams, suppliers and customers to ensure the overall design meets the requirements according to an established project plan
• Thoroughly self-test all designs and support PV/QA throughout development – this includes reviewing test plans, validating feedback, and debugging/fixing hardware problems as required
• Participate in Agile Scrum ceremonies like stand-ups, retrospectives, refinement, and sprint kick-offs
• Coach and mentor team members to attain breakthrough results in assigned deliverables
• Create first class FPGA designs by innovating in design, project management, tools and workflow

Who you are:
• In-depth knowledge of (System)Verilog
• Expert in FPGA workflow including RTL design capture, synthesis, timing closure, prototyping and release processes
• Knowledge of GIT revision control systems, branching and tagging methodologies
• Expertise in RTL debugging through simulations and in-FPGA logic analyzers
• Familiarity with the following technologies:
• SoC FPGA interconnects such as Avalon or AXI interfaces
• PCI Express, Ethernet 1/10/25/100GE, 12G-SDI, HDMI, DisplayPort
• Compression technologies: NDI, SRT, AVC/HEVC
• High-speed transceivers
• Timing recovery / Synchronization
• DMA engines, hardware acceleration (off-load engines), and high-performance memory controllers
• UVM Based Testbenches
• Vivado and Quartus development tools
• Knowledge of software languages such as C, C++, Python a plus
• Understanding of digital video, audio and associated audio standards a plus
• B.S. in Engineering required
• Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work as part of a team or independently as required
• Keen observational skills and problem solving intuition
• Organized and detail oriented self-starter
• Ability to learn new concepts quickly and work towards finding creative solutions to challenging problems
• Comfortable moving forward aggressively; balancing risks appropriately to optimize success across all business aspects – good, fast, and cheap
• Equally comfortable contributing as a team member or championing an idea with upper management
• Minimum 8 years FPGA development experience with expertise in Video/Audio technologies preferred

job_title: Regional Sales Manager, South East Asia
job_description:
Join Ross Video and you could be part of a growing company that is continuing to build a greater presence in the Asia marketplace.

In the position of Regional Sales Manager, you are responsible for proactively and aggressively growing both existing and new business relationships for Ross Video in this region either directly or through one of Ross’ designated Channel Partners.

Who you report to: Director of Sales, APAC

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

Some of the things you will work on:

As the Regional Sales Manager for South East Asia, your major responsibilities include developing new business and maintaining existing customer accounts and establishing solid relationships with all major companies in the cable, rental, OB, studio, Sports, Corporate, Government and Educational sectors of Live Video Production Markets.

You are responsible for establishing productive working relationships with Ross Video’s Channel Partners within the region. You will prepare and conduct technical presentations and demonstrations at customer visits as well as conferences and tradeshows as required. Approximately 60% of your time will be spent travelling to customers and potential customers’ facilities providing information and support as required. You will also prepare reports, forecasts, and handle all aspects of account maintenance.

Negotiate and close sales
Build and nurture relationships with end users
Deliver sales presentations to clients and business partners in the territory
Develop and implement strategic sales plans to accommodate corporate and individual territorial goals
Adhere to and follows the Ross Video code of ethics
Develop and maintain sales forecasting activities and assists in setting of territory sales goals with business partners
Perform market analysis to determine customer needs and pricing strategies
Direct channel development activity in the territory and coordinates sales distribution by establishing business partner territories, quotas and goals
Meet monthly order targets
Assist in directing marketing resources to establish Ross Video products in the region
Represent company at trade association meetings and exhibitions
Assist in coordination and liaison between sales department and other sales related units
Assist other departments within organization to prepare marketing plans specific to the territory
Prepare periodic sales report showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion
Monitor and evaluate the activities and products of the competition
Assist in resolution of customer complaints regarding equipment, supplies, and services

Who you are:

You have a deep understanding of the broadcast and/or video production business.
You have worked within a reseller and/or as a manufacturer’s account manager.
In addition, you have a minimum of 5+ years of experience selling and achieving sales targets both via direct and in-direct channels in the Broadcast industry or related field.

The successful candidate has proven ability to negotiate and manage complex sales through to successful completion. Excellent teamwork, communication and interpersonal skills are a must.

You show passion and commitment to customer service, and you are prepared to develop business relationships on a face-to-face basis throughout the whole of South East Asia. You have a well-honed ability to communicate compellingly at all levels of an organization both in written and verbal form.

5+ years’ experience in within the broadcast, live production, or related industry
Successful track record selling & marketing video production equipment
Ability to negotiate and manage complex sales through to effective completion
Excellent teamwork, communication, and interpersonal skills
Strong organizational Skills

Apply now by clicking on the following URL:

https://us231.dayforcehcm.com/CandidatePortal/en-US/rossvideo/Posting/View/5416

job_description:

We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Who you report to: Manufacturing Training Manager
What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, along with various perks to enhance your performance. These perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, a fitness/wellness allowance, an employee share ownership program, development support, and numerous enjoyable social activities and events. Most importantly, you will become a part of the Ross Video family and experience our energizing work environment.

What the job is all about:
• Use of the LMS platform to create content (SCORM), testing, and sign-off processes to validate that training is complete, where appropriate
• Working with procedures developed by Manufacturing Support to develop comprehensive training content for all relevant equipment and/or processes on the Manufacturing floor.
• Work closely with Manufacturing Support and Production Managers to discuss training gaps
• Works closely with Manufacturing Support and Production to create content. This may require hands-on training with Support, Managers, or Specialists
• This content may include developing training aids such as visual aids and checklists to provide the employee for ease of learning.
• Plan and implement training programs that will prepare employees for the next step in their career paths
• Write and draft technical documents such as SOPs, WIs, forms, and reference documents
• Perform administrative duties as needed by the Training Team
• Flexibility between shifts may be required to accommodate production needs and training
• Facilitate on the job training by using a combination of classroom, hands on and online courses for presentation purposes
• Collaborate with HR to assist in onboarding training

Who your are:
• Post secondary education is an asset
• Posses a mechanical aptitude
• Exceptional ability to make decisions and organize tasks
• A solid sense of responsibility and satisfaction in one's work and its impact on the company's success
• Ability to think critically and solve problems
• Ability to work well in a team
• Able to manage time effectively is of importance
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
• Proficiency in using MS Office and database software

Bonus points if you have the following:
• IPC-610-A/IPC-620-A Instructor certification
• Technical Writing/Administrative experience
• 2 years of experience as a Training Specialist or in a similar role that includes designing training programs and workshops
• Proficiency with software such as RISE 360 or a similar program.

What you should know:

This position is located at our manufacturing facility in Iroquois, ON, Canada. There is the possibility of occasionally working from home.

job_title: Freelance Demonstration Artist and Training Specialist - Inception
job_description:
FREELANCE OPPORTUNITIES AT ROSS VIDEOIn addition to our full time roles, we rely on talented external Freelancers to supplement our team. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible.

The Freelance Demonstration Artist and Training Specialist is responsible for performing training of Ross products, solutions, and integration at client locations globally. The position requires above average knowledge on Ross Inception, newsroom control systems, social media management and MOS. This front-line individual is responsible for managing customer expectations, completing required documentation, providing end user operational training, and ensuring integrity of the training experience. This key individual works closely with our Sales and Demonstration Artist Team to ensure delivery of the Ross Superior Customer Experience.
What the job is all about:
Demonstrations
• Perform on-site, off-site, online/remote customer demonstrations.
• Assist the Inception team with content creation, organization, and technical execution of major trade shows throughout the year.
• Is responsible for the operational and technical integrity of both the demo and training experience and offers effective solutions for areas of improvement in house and online.
• Set up demo equipment, assist with set-up and prepare/test gear prior to demos.
• Advise the Sales and Marketing Product Management (MPM) groups regarding current industry trends and customer feedback.
• Maintain above average knowledge base and skill set in the functionality and demonstration of all system features for Inception Solutions
• Develop demonstration techniques, methods, and materials for use by other demo staff.
Training
• Perform on-site, off-site, and online/remote customer training.
• Maintain training equipment, assist with set-up and prepare/test gear prior to training sessions.
• Assist in the development of Inception customer training methods, materials, and techniques.
• Provide feedback to the Inception PM & TPM on product operation, features and roadmap.
• Participate in the review process for upcoming software feature lists.
• Champion customer needs, notably operational features, roll-out and training methods as well as future feature requirements
• Actively participate in Ross’ user forums, lead key discussions, and assist Inception users.
• A maximum of 75% international travel is possible.
• Must have a valid passport and driver’s license.
Who you are:
• Post-secondary degree related to television broadcast or appropriate work experience in a broadcast/post/corporate video environment using a newsroom control system.
• Minimum of 5 years’ experience in training required.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills
• In-depth knowledge of newsroom workflows, production, customer needs and applications
• Experience in the selling and marketing process for broadcast equipment is very useful.
• Knowledge of use of Ross Video products and a willingness to learn how to demonstrate and train on these products, notably: Inception News and Inception Social
• Organized and very detail oriented.
• Ability to problem solve and troubleshoot.
• Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changing environments.
• Experience in the selling and marketing process for broadcast equipment is ideal.
• Fluent in English with additional languages a bonus

• Work Environment

• Family Friendly Policies

We are able to delight our customers with our innovative products because they work better when combined with other Ross products. For example, our production switchers seamlessly integrate with our graphics and replay systems. This is no accident but the result of a sustained commitment to developing our Enterprise Management solutions: DashBoard and Ross Platform Manager. Together, these form the backbone that enables Ross Video to deliver offerings with a 1 + 1 = 3 value proposition. By a conservative estimate around 65% of Ross Video revenues are enabled by the work of our Enterprise Management team.
DashBoard in particular is an industry leading facility control and monitoring system with the role of creating powerful and customizable user interfaces that combine the power of all of Ross’s technology. As a free and open platform, you will be serving tens of thousands of users by providing additional product offerings and enhancements and leading the technical direction.
As the Principal Technical Lead, you are the technical leader for your product or products. You plan and oversee the development of solutions to allow our customers to achieve or exceed their business goals. In this technical role you are responsible and accountable for the implementation and quality of the products under your purview. You craft the architecture and design of your product to meet product goals in alignment with the practices and principals of our Senior Software Architects and Technical Director; you oversee the implementation to ensure architectural and code consistency; you ensure that best practices are being employed, all the while making certain that quality and security are primary considerations.
You coach, mentor, guide, and help nurture the development team (developers and testers) to realize its full potential and adopt our culture of technical excellence and continuous improvement.
Should you join this team, you’ll become a key part of ensuring that Ross Video’s secret to success continues to enable innovations across all our product lines. You’ll also work with some of the latest development technologies and information security disciplines.

Who you are:
It would be great if you already have expertise in live production.
You’re passionate about working in Java, and you want to raise the level of excellence of the team both in Java and across the various development tools and framework, such as Eclipse/OSGi, Eclipse Rich Client Platform, Swing, SWT, Java Native Access, and OAuth2.0 to create powerful applications with eye-popping user interfaces.
You need to be able to capture the strategic direction of the product and apply your judgment to define the path forward to meet our customers’ needs. We want you to bring that excitement you crave for exploring new ideas to produce tangible results.
You need to love learning and progressing your skill set. That means you'll be comfortable talking about your weaknesses just as much as your strengths and working hard on improving will be a daily habit.
You love to experiment and be proactive in developing sound solutions. Being part of an R&D division means that you will help push the boundaries of our understanding through experimentation and exploration effectively driving innovation.
You are fluent in clean architectural design; are versed in Domain Driven Design concepts; you know and employ the SOLID principles of OO design. You know and espouse the value of test automation. You know how to debate passionately and make objective decisions.
We work in a very collaborative environment, and you enjoy mentoring the other members of the team to always do better. It is vital that you care more about delivering the result than exactly whose ideas achieved it.
That also means you'll need to be interested in the processes, constraints, and systems that help product designs flourish.
You also need 10+ years of experience (or an amazing display of design and coding maturity if you have less than that).

WHY WORK FOR ROSS VIDEO?
Because we can help you flourish. You will get to develop and deliver cutting edge technological solutions for the entertainment industry. You will be part of the Ross Video team working together to make that happen, and we find that a pretty energizing environment to be a part of.
#LI-KF1

At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Ross Video is seeking a Manager of Finance to join the California-based LED team. This position will report to the Director of FP&A and work closely with the General Manager of LED to support the team in ensuring the accounting, reporting and financial planning of the LED business unit.
This position requires the manager of Finance to be onsite at our Rancho Cordova office location 1-3 days a week.
Who you report to: Director, Financial Planning & Analysis

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
What the job is all about:
• Financial advisor to the LED team on management reporting, budgeting, forecasting and accounting support.
• Prepare financial review and analysis of sales contract proposals to ensure corporate objectives and profitability margins are achieved.
• Review projects monthly to ensure revenue, COGS and deferred revenue are recognized in accordance with project performance completion.
• Manage the daily financial operations of the LED business unit including ownership of the month end close process and upload financial results into Ross’ accounting system.
• Manage, prepare and distribute month-end and year-end financial reporting along with a monthly and yearly analysis of results for the LED group..
• Interface with the Corporate Services Operations team for invoicing and credit and collections,
• Partner with LED Senior Management team to prepare annual budget and monthly forecasts.
• Partner with the FP&A and LED Senior Management team to prepare detailed monthly revenue forecasts.
• Participate in and support conversion to Infor, the company’s new ERP system.
• Partner with the tax team to ensure compliance with collection of sales tax and recording of use tax.
• Review and approve requests for new vendors.
• Oversee the manufacturing accounting including WIP, inventory provision, cycle counts and physical inventory to ensure accurate reporting.
• Special projects and ad hoc analysis and report, as required by the business.
Who you are:
• University degree or Diploma in Business/Accounting and completion of a professional designation (CPA and or CPA/MBA).
• Minimum 2 years of industry (post CPA) experience.
• Advanced knowledge of MS Office and Excel.
• Knowledge of Great Plains Dynamics and/or Infor ERP is an asset.
• Working experience with Workday Adaptive is an asset.
• Relevant experience in a manufacturing setting supporting standard costing, fixed assets and project related costs required.
• Budgeting, forecasting and financial analysis experience required.
• Able to work as a part of a team as well as independently with effective communication skills.
• Ability to interpret and implement company policies and procedures with attention to details.
• Possess a strong level of critical, logical thinking and analysis to identify principles, trends, etc.
• Ability to effectively identify issues with recommendations for correction action.
• Critical thinker and strong problem solver able to identify issues, trends and provide action plan to correct issues.
• Effective organizational, time management and prioritizing skills.

Be part of a vibrant group where you can make a difference in the evolution of technology products. You will be part of a small and energetic team to help the world deliver stories, sports, news, concerts, and so much more. The sky’s the limit in live production!

As part of the development team, you will be helping conceive, design, develop and deliver products used in live broadcast. You will work to improve and grow the technical competence of our designs. Our small teams encourage outside of the box thinking, we value innovation and feedback, and you will work alongside a diverse group of people with a broad range of skills and experience. You will be working on real-world applications and get to see the results of your hard work firsthand.

OverDrive is a world leader in Automated Production Control (APC). This system is the focal point of airing live broadcasts within a news control room. Its limitless and highly complex system connects with third-party devices like Production Switchers, Graphics Engine, Robotic Cameras, Audio Mixers, and more to bring high quality live broadcast with an easy-to-use graphical user interface!
With over 500 systems on-air and commissioned, OverDrive serves its purpose to bring live news to your TV efficiently and eloquently.

WE'RE AFTER A PARTICULAR TYPE OF AWESOME

You need to be passionate about working in Java and love working with different development tools and frameworks, such as Eclipse, Java, React, Typescript, and relational databases, to create powerful applications with highly functional user experiences. We value experience in multi-threading, design patterns, best practices such as Domain Driven Design, Test Driven Development, Behavior Driven Development, high performance design, and Agile software methodologies (Scrum).

You enjoy exploring new ideas and know how to test your work quickly and effectively. We work in an Agile environment, with a flat structure that encourages minimal oversight and encourages freedom and flexibility to complete your task.

What the job is all about:
• Participate in the full software development lifecycle – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, documentation, testing, and maintenance.
• Write code across the full stack – UI, back-end services, and data storage.
• Provide design reviews and code reviews for fellow team members promoting high-quality work, sound software methodologies and attention to detail.
• Be part of a Scrum Team that has adopted the Agile methodology.
• Produce clean, testable, and efficient code based on specifications.
• Create technical documentation for reference and reporting.

Who you are:
• 8+ years of experience in software engineering or a related industry.
• A full-stack development background with the ability to contribute to both backend and frontend components.
• Object-oriented software design using Java. Any experience with Eclipse, Hibernate, or general Web Application design is an asset.
• HTML, JavaScript, TypeScript, and React experience is highly valued, notably jQuery or other JavaScript based frameworks.
• Experience with SQL-based databases, ideally any of MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, or SQL Server would be beneficial.
• Interest in implementing development processes and adopting best practices, particularly when it comes to enhancing both quality and performance.
• Proven ability to mentor and guide junior developers.
• Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills.

For complex projects, coordination with our services implementation team including Schedulers, Commissioners, Trainers, Creative Services Technical Support Specialists, and Field Service Developers, to ensure a successful launch of Ross solutions at clients’ facilities.

Ross has the world's largest portfolio of live media production equipment and applications. All of these products are created in house by our incredibly talented internal R&D teams. Our product portfolio is incredibly wide in scope and uses a huge variety of technologies and skills, these include: industrial design, electromechanical, circuit boards, FPGA, embedded software, SaaS applications, Robotics, AI/ML, and SecDevOps to name a few. The R&D teams do 12-15 releases every single month.
We are looking for a Vice President, Product Development to join our Product Development organization. Reporting directly to the CTO, this key role has strategic responsibility for the Product Development processes and outcomes of Ross’s global R&D team. Working in collaboration with leaders across the organization, this role will ensure we continue to innovate and deliver cool and practical solutions to our global customers efficiently. This role has the R&D Operations team reporting directly to them to achieve the organizations goals.
We are looking for somebody, who will thrive in a fast paced, cutting-edge technology environment, driving the team to be efficient, innovative, and successful.
Who you report to: CTO & Senior Vice President, Product Development

What the job is all about:
• Measure and drive improvements to the performance of R&D product teams
• Create a culture of continuous improvement with a focus on solving business problems including cost optimization, scalability, manufacturability, and maintainability of products
• Identify and highlight any underperforming teams and work with management on turnaround plans
• Ensure department-wide and cross-department processes are well documented and compliance is audited where appropriate
• Ensure cross-product and cross-department programs are effectively managed and deliver exceptional corporate value

As VP Product Development, you will be responsible for:
• Working with Ross Video’s R&D teams to efficiently develop and deliver exceptional solutions and products both on time and in budget
• Researching, reporting on, and implementing best practices for development processes and KPIs to create efficiencies within and across product teams
• Leading transformative change across hundreds of staff and dozens of product lines through indirect influence and inspiration
• Creating a culture of continuous learning and the practical use of technology to solve business problems with manufacturability and maintainability of products kept top of mind
• Bridging corporate strategy to R&D departmental initiatives
• Acting as a partner to business unit leaders across the global Ross business
• Work and collaborate closely with the Director of Product Management Operations
• Ensuring that product teams across the organization share technology as efficiently as possible, maximizing reuse and consistency where it makes sense
• Overseeing department-wide R&D programs, including planning and reporting
• Managing R&D budget: long and short-term planning, forecasting, monitoring, and reporting
• Effectively managing headcount planning and strategic staffing plans, working closely with senior leaders within R&D and Product Management
• Driving strategy and excellence in execution of central R&D functions, such as Product Compliance, Change Management, Component Engineering, Process Engineering, Central R&D Tools, and Product Security
• Managing and encouraging the creation of trade secrets and patents
• Other duties as required

Who you are:
• Exception interpersonal skills and strong ability to lead through both direct reporting relationships and indirect influence
• Proven track record of overseeing a Global R&D organization and working with multiple stakeholders across broad programs and lines of business
• Strong understanding of different R&D methodologies such as Agile and Waterfall as well as a keen interest in keeping up to date on the latest research in the field
• Expert familiarity and proven success with product lifecycles, release planning, project schedules, and budgeting across various development methodologies and variation in product lifecycles across teams
• Experience with New Product Introduction (NPI) in hardware, software, and SaaS
• Exceptional technical background and aptitude to quickly learn Ross Video’s broad and diverse product portfolio
• Experience working in the Media Technology, or a related industry
• Technical expertise in networking, video, AI/ML, and cybersecurity

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The successful candidate will be responsible for the execution of and/or participation in Ross Creative and Professional Services activities, by providing services for the design, creation, and implementation of XPression real-time graphics and graphics packages and assisting with key XPression Sales and Marketing opportunities.

This position is located in our Ottawa office or a home-based office setting, if mutually agreed upon.

Who you report to: Art Director of Creative Services

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Graphic Integration and Design:
• Creates XPression templates and animations, using native Xpression tools and provided base graphic elements – such as 3D models, still images, and clips.
• Designs XPression templates and animations from scratch, using native XPression tools and 3rd-party graphics applications such as Cinema 4D and Adobe Suite.
• Creates packages that conform to standardized workflows outlined by the Art Director.

Automation:
• Ensures appropriate automation hooks are created for outside control.
• Utilize XPression Visual Logic and scripting for automated, dynamic templates.
• Setup XPression Datalinq to pull in external data feeds and interface with external data aggregation systems.
• Use Ross Dashboard to create manual user interface panels and backup solutions for XPression automated graphics.

On-site Implementation:
• Responsible for implementation and integration of graphics packages at customer’s sites, as required.

Administrative:
• Attends meetings and conference calls as required to scope, complete, or otherwise facilitate successful completion of assigned projects as they relate to the job.
• Work with other creative and professional service members to institute a consistent and standardized workflow solution.

Documentation:
• Works with Ross team members to create style and operational guides for end users.
• Documents any custom scripting methodologies to ensure future support from Ross.
• May be required to create project style-guides of assets.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary degree or trade school diploma
• Advanced knowledge of Adobe creative suite
• Advanced knowledge of Cinema 4D and Redshift renderer knowledge a plus
• Intermediate knowledge of IT workflows
• Intermediate computer programming experience in VB, SQL, and/or JAVA is desirable
• Proficient in Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint
• Proficient knowledge of Unreal Engine a plus
• Minimum 2-5 years production experience in broadcast (studio or remote) or sport venue
• Minimum 2-5 years of graphic design experience.
• Proficient knowledge of broadcast graphics workflows
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
• Excellent communication skills
• Aptitude for animation and choreography of movement
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills
• High tolerance of ambiguity
• Team-oriented, and able to work co-operatively with Ross and end users
• Enthusiastic problem solver
• Willing to travel on a project-by-project basis up to 50% of the time
• Valid Passport and Valid Driver’s License

Ross Video powers video production for billions of global viewers daily with the industry’s widest range of smart production solutions. We are looking for a dynamic, organized self-starter to join our Human Resources team as HR Generalist to support Ross Video’s Europe, Middle East & Africa (EMEA) based teams.

Working closely with all members of the Human Resources team, the HR Generalist will not only play a significant role in support to managers and employees based in EMEA region but will also be involved in the development and maintenance of HR policies and programs. This is a hybrid role, working from the Reading, UK office at least 1 day per week and the balance from home.

 Manager – Regional HR



*  Serve as first point of contact for employee relations issues for our EMEA based teams by answering questions and resolving employee issues, according to established policies and procedures 
*  Assist in the implementation of HR programs; these programs could include but are not limited to annual compensation and performance review cycles, talent management initiatives and workforce planning and leadership development training 
*  Act as local Health & Safety representative; ensure compliance with jurisdictional H&S regulations including creating and updating policies and procedures, training, documentation and communication with local staff, maintain H&S bulletin boards, as applicable 
*  Support the full recruitment life-cycle for all EMEA region roles, from candidate sourcing to onboarding 
*  Provide guidance and support on HR policies or processes related to country specific legislation and compliance for the region; this could include but is not limited to time and leave policies, governmental compliance reporting submissions, internal or external audits, corporate wide policies that include HR subject matter 
*  Act as liaison between the regional client group and corporate head-office administrative teams; assist with implementation of corporate programs and initiatives as required 
*  Assist with special HR projects and local initiatives as required 
*  Perform other related duties as required 





*  University or college degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or related discipline, and/or equivalent work experience in an HR team 
*  Minimum 5+ years of HR experience preferably in a high-tech environment 
*  Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively collaborate with employees and local management team members 
*  Fluency in and English (oral and written) required 
*  Ability to deal with confidential information with a high degree of diplomacy; ability to build trusted relationships 
*  Organized and very detail orientated but also able to see the big picture 
*  Knowledge of UK employment related legislation required, additional regions in EMEA an asset 
*  Strong-working knowledge of MS-Office package and general computer software; familiarity with Ceridian Dayforce an asset

The System Debug Technician (SDT) will be responsible for providing testing & troubleshooting of completed assemblies including PCBAs in the manufacturing department. SDT will also work closely with the Test Development Team for new product introduction and validation of testing requirements. As an SDT you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of Ross Video Technologies and Products. This position is located in our state of the art manufacturing facility in Iroquois, On.
Who you report to: Manager Test, Technical Debug
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Troubleshooting, from fully assembled systems all the way down to the component level on PCBAs.
• Initiate repairs using appropriate routing and rework tools.
• Work with Production Managers, Specialists, and cell supervisors for work prioritization to ensure internal and external customer demands are met.
• Technical support to Production test staff, by validating infrastructure integrity and initiating repairs.
• Technical support to the Test Development team on NPI (new product introduction)
• Use various test equipment and tools (hardware and software) to test and debug products.
• As required, perform production configuration, testing and calibration following established procedures, policies, and protocols.
• Adhere to Ross Video Health and Safety policies
Who you are:
• Must have computer proficiency with Microsoft Office and core business-use tools.
• Knowledge of video and audio standards and broadcasting would be an asset
• Robotics’ experience would be an asset
• Ability to work rotational schedule
• Ability to solder if required (jig repair)
• Solid technical abilities and organizational skills
• High initiative and well developed analytical, problem solving and communication skills
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Ability to cope with varying levels of support and documentation
• Self-starter, quick learner and able to work with minimum supervision in meeting schedules

Working in the corporate Information Technology team located in Ottawa, the Intermediate Systems Administrator - Linux will have the responsibility to support every area of our rapidly growing company. The successful candidate will develop the fundamental system integrations and data structures for our Linux systems and will be part of a core team that directly contributes to Ross Video’s success.

Who you report to: Manager, IT Infrastructure

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Develops, plans, and implements solutions to support 1400+ users in a multi-site mixed-OS network environment
• Responsible for R&D Linux and Windows Servers, uptime, and operation within established service levels.
• Manages IT projects of medium to large scope, including new system rollouts, facility moves, and server environment deployments.
• Develops and implements automation, management and maintenance plans for Linux server and desktop environment.
• Creates, maintains, and validates appropriate disaster avoidance and recovery plans for this architecture.
• Maintain current technological edge in areas related to Ross’s network technologies.
• Optimizes servers and network infrastructure, VPN, Firewalls, data recovery, and malware/security software
• Troubleshoot network, computer, or system failures
• Liaise with external providers where appropriate
• Assist Systems Administrators and IT Help Desk Technicians as needed.
• Troubleshoot assigned IT Help Desk tickets and assist team members when required.
• Perform other related duties as required

• Bachelor of Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent training and experience
• Knowledge of compute cluster technologies such as Sun Grid Engine and SLURM
• RHCE / CCNA or equivalent experience with Linux and networking platforms
• Linux server services and configuration such as but not limited to BIND, DHCP, Apache, Print Services, NFS & other file services
• Linux automation, DevOps & scripting techniques such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Bash, Python, Ruby or Perl
• Knowledge of various Linux distributions including but not limited to Ubuntu, CentOS/RedHat Linux
• Experience with cloud infrastructure management & tools such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Terraform
• Palo Alto or other next-generation firewall (NGFW) platforms
• Enterprise Switch configuration: VLAN, QoS, PoE, Routing
• Linux, Windows and macOS operating systems including experience in upgrading and migrating those platforms
• Git, Jenkins, SVN, Bugzilla and other similar tools
• VMware Infrastructure (ESX)
• Working knowledge of Microsoft Exchange, Active Directory integrations to Linux
• Approachable and excellent communication skills. Ability to translate deep technical solutions at a high level
• Team player but able to work independently
• Able to envision the entire project and identify problem/risk areas
• Able to organize/create required documentation, be thorough, and very detail orientated
• High initiative and well developed analytical skills
• Technical, mechanical, hands-on person
• Minimum 4-6 years IT experience developing Linux network architecture
• Strong knowledge of Linux, Mac, and Windows Operating Systems
• Strong knowledge of networking and VPN protocols
• Linux Server design, monitoring, and troubleshooting experience
• Technical Linux and Windows or PC hardware background is a strong asset
• Experience in a product development environment is an asset
• Valid driver’s license and clean driving record, a reliable vehicle is a must
• Travel between Ottawa and Iroquois and remote offices when required.
• Valid Passport

Ross Video is looking for a senior level Manufacturing Test Developer that will help manufacturing build, test, then deliver high performing equipment used in the broadcast industry. You will collaborate on the development of a scalable manufacturing test and data system, that performs thorough PCBA investigation, functional product testing, data collection, and report generation. The system supports dozens of product categories and needs to ensure every product shipped exceeds the users’ expectations.
You will work alongside experts in test development, hardware, and software design, in our manufacturing facility is in Iroquois, Ontario. Which is approximately a 30-minute drive from Kemptville, Cornwall and Brockville, or a 45-minute drive from southern Ottawa.

Who you report to: Manager, Test development

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Collaborate with the test development team and R&D to understand the current technology under test and establish the necessary test requirements and plans
• Lead large NPI and Test Development projects.
• Help to Mentor junior developers.
• Design, develop, and implement automated and semi-automated test solutions for the various levels of product assembly
• Support the manufacturing staff, leveraging your knowledge of the products and the test station implementations
• Create and maintain support documentation for use by the Test Team, Manufacturing, and R&D
• Find and advise on improvements within test coverage, test times, product support, test system scalability, and quality efficiencies
• Make updates to the existing test scripts and test procedures based on engineering change orders
• Competently interpret electrical schematics and PCBA design files
• Capable of operating and interfacing with a wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.).
• Possess the knowledge and/or ability to learn scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, Python, etc.
• Capable of independently designing and developing manufacturing test solutions
• Ability to learn an object-oriented language and basic database interfacing
• Ability to transfer knowledge to others and welcomes the ideas and inputs of their peers
• Occasional travel to suppliers, partners, and other Ross Video sites may be required
Who you are:
• Undergraduate degree related to electrical engineering, computer engineering, computer science or equivalent education plus experience.
• Multiple years of experience with electronic hardware, with a good understanding of electronic theory, specifically digital components such as CPU’s, FPGA, flash, etc.
• Ability to comprehend electrical schematics and PCBA design files
• Familiarity with a wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.).
• Knowledge and/or ability to learn scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, Python, etc.
• Knowledge of data acquisition concepts such as TCP/IP, RS232, USB, and CAN
• A self-starter and problem solver that is not afraid to take on new challenges and initiate improvements
• Ability to transfer knowledge to others and welcomes the ideas and inputs of their peers

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Understanding of JTAG and Boundary Scan concepts
• Knowledge / experience of electronics manufacture, Lean Manufacturing, 5S
• Ability to learn an object-oriented language and basic database interfacing

This position is based with the Manufacturing Support Team. It has the responsibility and authority to plan, propose, train and coach Ross Video personnel in the implementation of advanced manufacturing techniques, for example Lean Manufacturing, 5S Housekeeping Techniques and Processes, Setup Time reduction, Demand Flow management etc., and to develop methods of measurement of success. In conjunction with manufacturing management, the incumbent will plan and direct activities to secure short lead time, flexible manufacturing and supply chain processes targeted to reduce lead times, increase service levels and flexibility, reduce overall costs and improve quality.

What the job is all about:
• The primary focus of this role is to provide crucial support to shop floor personnel on surface mount, through hole and mechanical issues
• Supporting shop floor equipment including screen printers, pick and place, reflow ovens, AOI, wave solder and mechanical assembly tools
• You will have the ability to execute root cause research to resolve supplier and manufacturing quality issues and be responsible to maintain and update manufacturing work instructions and procedures along with care of and the calibration, maintenance of manufacturing equipment
• This role supports all schedules and may require dedicated night shifts. As a dedicated team player, you will assist in the development and implementation of training, and of project plans
• This is a role for a team player, as you will collaborate with cross functional teams to provide advice that will expedite the adoption of techniques and processes that support lean manufacturing and elimination of waste
• Making decisions that support business and continuous improvement opportunities within an industrial engineering environment, always with safety in mind

Who you are:
• You possess a post-secondary education or equivalent work experience in electronics manufacturing and design processes and procedures
• (Minimum 5 years) with comprehensive knowledge of IPC standards for electronics manufacturing
• A demonstrated knowledge of SMT processes and equipment is preferred
• This role requires an ability to manage several complex tasks at a time, working individually or in a team
• Your ability to work with technical and non-technical team members is key to the role
• Your organisational abilities are persistent, and you show attention to detail and accuracy, with solid verbal and written communications skills, in English
• Experienced in continual process/systematic improvement projects while participating as a team member

• An advanced skill level with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook and excellent leadership, planning, negotiation and interpersonal skills
• Creative problem solver that can anticipate, identify, solve and prevent
• Ability to work well with technical and non-technical staff

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Technical Support Specialist is responsible for providing technical support remotely and onsite through remote sessions, ticketing systems, phone support on a as needed basis for Ross Video products, we assist customers in resolving issues by providing solutions to technical and service problems and provides the “Superior Customer Experience” through effective handling of customer issues or concerns. We work with some amazing customers, and you will get to be a part of helping them make an impact on their audiences. Please take a look at some of our Success Stories!

https://www.rossvideo.com/company/customers/

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, RRSP matching, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! Senior Members of our team also have the option of working from home.

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• Assist Customers with technical setup questions, troubleshooting efforts, and product specific solutions.
• Take ownership of customer issues reported and seeing problems through to resolution
• Research, diagnose, troubleshoot, and identify solutions to resolve issues
• Follow standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams
• Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers
• Empowering our customers to get the most of their products and solutions.
• Ensure proper recording and closure of all issues through a tracking system
• Prepare accurate and timely reports, as needed
• Document knowledge in the form of knowledge base technical notes and articles
• Expedite returned material from the field for service reasons
• Provide effective installation and commissioning services, technical product training and on-site support, as required. This may require travel on short notice.

Who you are:

• Technical diploma and knowledge of broadcast systems
• Customer service experience in a technical support environment
• Must be proficient in the English language (read, write, speak)
• Excellent trouble shooting and debugging skills
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
• Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, listening, and questioning skills
• Keen attention to detail with accurate record keeping
• Must be able to work with a team as well as independently
• Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
• Must possess a valid driver’s license and passport

Bonus points if you have the following:

• Additional education and computer courses are strong assets
• Prior knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM systems will be an asset
• Prior knowledge of Zendesk or other ticketing systems will be an asset
• Multilingual
#LI-JF1

As part of the Returned Materials (RMA) team, you will evaluate, initiate the repair, and record results of customer return cases. The information discovered by this position plays a crucial role in enacting improvements at all levels of the organization. You are working directly with the varied Ross stakeholders, with the mindset that accurate data provides appropriate and targeted feedback which allows for optimum results.
Who you report to: Manager, RMA
What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

Some of the things you will work on:
• Process RMAs using established processes and procedures while faithfully trying to reproduce the customer complaint.
• Identify issues to the root cause
• Interact with Tech Support techs for additional customer feedback
• Interact with R&D and Test Development regarding current PV regiment and test plans.
• Provide specific instructions using sanctioned tools for rework and upgrades.
• Due diligence in ensuring product identification at all levels are accurate and representative.
• Upon customer request, provide RMA feedback through an approved reporting mechanism.
• Follow all Company policies and procedures
• Assist RMA Coordinators in identifying incoming product

Who you are:
• University degree or College diploma which complements the knowledge set required or equivalent experience.
• Passionate about technology and energized by the challenge of learning new things.
• Approachable and excellent communication skills (oral and written).
• High initiative and well developed analytical and troubleshooting skills
• Must be able to work with a team as well as independently.
• Excellent interpersonal and observational skills
• Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
• Self-starter, quick learner and are able to work with minimum supervision while meeting the department’s objectives.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• A valid driving license and access to a vehicle for occasional travel to Ottawa
• comprehension of Ross Video’s portfolio.

Working both independently and in a team environment; working with and assisting senior technicians with all functional test equipment and fixtures to assure all systems are functional and operating within Ross standards.

Who you report to: Test Development Manager

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Troubleshooting anywhere from fully assembled systems all the way down to the component level on PCBAs
• Initiating repairs using appropriate routing and rework tools
• Working with Production Managers, Lead-Hands and cell supervisors for work prioritization to ensure internal and external customer demands are met
• Providing technical support to Production test staff, by validating infrastructure integrity and initiating repairs as well as providing technical support to the Test Development team on NPI (new product introduction).
• Use various test equipment and tools (hardware and software) to test and debug products and as required,
• Perform production configuration, testing and calibration following established procedures, policies and protocols and performing other related duties as required

Who you are:
• Electronics Technician/Technologist diploma or equivalent in experience is required
• Excellent understanding of electronic theory and applications, with an emphasis on digital components such as CPU, FPGA, flash, etc.
• A solid foundation in schematic reading and interpretation with a working knowledge of Linux and other command line interface with hardware and knowledge of JTAG technologies (IEEE 1149.1, 1149.6.). Familiarity with a wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analysers, DVMs, etc.)
• Experience with scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, or equivalent and experience with programming languages such as C, C++ or equivalent.
• An above average PC/Windows computer skill set specifically related to network and serial interface and configuration
• Must have computer proficiency with Microsoft Office and core business-use tools and knowledge of video and audio standards, and broadcasting would be an asset
• The ability to solder if required (jig repair) is an asset
• Exceptional technical abilities and organizational skills
• High initiative and well-developed analytical problem-solving skills
• Strong communication skills
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
• Talent to cope with varying levels of support and documentation
• Self-starter and quick learner and
• Able to work with minimum supervision while meeting schedules.
• Able to lift 50 lbs., and to work in a manufacturing environment in an individual workstation, within a moderately noisy setting
#LI-PC1
