Ross Video is looking for a Manufacturing Test Developer that will help manufacturing build, test, then deliver high performing equipment used in the broadcast industry. You will collaborate on the development of a scalable manufacturing test and data system, that performs thorough PCBA investigation, functional product testing, data collection, and report generation. The system supports dozens of product categories and needs to ensure every product shipped exceeds the users’ expectations.
You will work alongside experts in test development, hardware, and software design, in our manufacturing facility is in Iroquois, Ontario. Which is approximately a 30-minute drive from Kemptville, Cornwall and Brockville, or a 45-minute drive from southern Ottawa.

Who you report to: Manager, Test Development

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Collaborate with the test development team and R&D to understand the current technology under test and establish the necessary test requirements and plans
• Lead large NPI and Test Development projects.
• Help to Mentor junior developers.
• Design, develop, and implement automated and semi-automated test solutions for the various levels of product assembly
• Support the manufacturing staff, leveraging your knowledge of the products and the test station implementations
• Create and maintain support documentation for use by the Test Team, Manufacturing, and R&D
• Find and advise on improvements within test coverage, test times, product support, test system scalability, and quality efficiencies
• Make updates to the existing test scripts and test procedures based on engineering change orders
• Competently interpret electrical schematics and PCBA design files
• Capable of operating and interfacing with a wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.).
• Possess the knowledge and/or ability to learn scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, Python, etc.
• Capable of independently designing and developing manufacturing test solutions
• Ability to learn an object-oriented language and basic database interfacing
• Ability to transfer knowledge to others and welcomes the ideas and inputs of their peers
• Occasional travel to suppliers, partners, and other Ross Video sites may be required
Who you are:
• Undergraduate degree related to electrical engineering, computer engineering, computer science or equivalent education plus experience.
• Multiple years of experience with electronic hardware, with a good understanding of electronic theory, specifically digital components such as CPU’s, FPGA, flash, etc.
• Ability to comprehend electrical schematics and PCBA design files
• Familiarity with a wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.).
• Knowledge and/or ability to learn scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, Python, etc.
• Knowledge of data acquisition concepts such as TCP/IP, RS232, USB, and CAN
• A self-starter and problem solver that is not afraid to take on new challenges and initiate improvements
• Ability to transfer knowledge to others and welcomes the ideas and inputs of their peers

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Understanding of JTAG and Boundary Scan concepts
• Knowledge / experience of electronics manufacture, Lean Manufacturing, 5S
• Ability to learn an object-oriented language and basic database interfacing
#LI-PC1

This position resides within the Facility Maintenance Group. As an Equipment Maintenance Technician, you will perform preventative maintenance on manufacturing equipment, jigs and fixtures to ensure best performance of the equipment. Perform electrical and mechanical troubleshooting to determine problems in non-functioning electro-mechanical equipment used in the manufacturing process. Utilize and maintain our preventative maintenance software including adding new equipment and schedules based on equipment supplier recommendations, handling of maintenance requests through the system, tracking of maintenance supplies and related costs.

Who you report to: Manager, Iroquois Facilities

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Perform preventative maintenance and calibration on a wide variety of production equipment including: Printed circuit board assembly and repair equipment, CNC equipment, 3D printers, mechanical jigs and fixtures, torque drivers and other automated manufacturing equipment. Troubleshooting and repair of a variety of electro-mechanical equipment utilizing mechanical drawings, schematics and manuals as reference. Maintain and update our preventative maintenance software system log and track all preventative maintenance and repair activities, track costs of maintenance and repairs. Participate in the installation and commissioning of new equipment including physical installation and verification of the equipment. Review relevant documentation to ensure procedures and schedules are up to date.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education in a technical field or equivalent experience in a manufacturing environment, with experience performing preventative maintenance and troubleshooting on electro-mechanical equipment, using PM software.
• Able to make choices based on the company’s best interests.
• Familiar with all aspects of health, safety and compliance; surrounding safe working procedures.
• Familiar with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook).
• Well-organized and attentive to detail with an exceptional command of English, written and verbal with excellent communication skills.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team with technical and non-technical staff.
• Must demonstrate the ability to work and coordinate with several functional areas including management.
• Valid Driver’s License.
• Ability to travel outside of Canada for training.
#LI-PC1

The Ross Web Platform (RWP) is a full stack web application framework and is the foundation of several Ross Video products with more adoption planned. The RWP team takes pride in providing high quality and innovative solutions to our product teams and internal stakeholders. While we have individual specialties, we are all full stack developers.

The languages and technologies we work with includes but not limited to:
• Java
• JavaScript/TypeScript
• Eclipse/OSGi
• Jetty
• Struts
• Hibernate
• AWS
• JSP
• React
We are focused on our users’ needs, committed to technical excellence, practice mob programming, and strive for continuous improvement.

Who you report to: Software Manager, RWP
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

Who you are:
• A full stack or back-end web developer proficient in some of our languages (Java primarily) and technologies and willing to learn the others.
• A strong understanding of relational databases.
• Likes working with other people in a whole team environment, not just programming by yourself.
• Has some leadership experience or would like to gain leadership experience by helping the team move forward on its day-to-day tasks as well as achieve its long-term goals.
• Good organization and communication skills
• Bonus if you’re into any of these: BDD, DDD, TDD, XP, SOLID, clean code and architecture.

Which is approximately a 30-minute drive from Kemptville, Cornwall and Brockville, or a 45-minute drive from southern Ottawa. and Test Development projects. • Help to Mentor junior developers. • Design, develop, and implement automated and semi-automated test solutions for the various levels of product assembly • Support the manufacturing staff, leveraging your knowledge of the products and the test station implementations • Create and maintain support documentation for use by the Test Team, Manufacturing, and R&D • Find and advise on improvements within test coverage, test times, product support, test system scalability, and quality efficiencies • Make updates to the existing test scripts and test procedures based on engineering change orders • Competently interpret electrical schematics and PCBA design files • Capable of operating and interfacing with a wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.). • Possess the knowledge and/or ability to learn scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, Python, etc. • Capable of independently designing and developing manufacturing test solutions • Ability to learn an object-oriented language and basic database interfacing • Ability to transfer knowledge to others and welcomes the ideas and inputs of their peers • Occasional travel to suppliers, partners, and other Ross Video sites may be required Who you are: • Undergraduate degree related to electrical engineering, computer engineering, computer science or equivalent education plus experience. • Multiple years of experience with electronic hardware, with a good understanding of electronic theory, specifically digital components such as CPU’s, FPGA, flash, etc. • Ability to comprehend electrical schematics and PCBA design files • Familiarity with a wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.). • Knowledge and/or ability to learn scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, Python, etc. • Knowledge of data acquisition concepts such as TCP/IP, RS232, USB, and CAN • A self-starter and problem solver that is not afraid to take on new challenges and initiate improvements • Ability to transfer knowledge to others and welcomes the ideas and inputs of their peers Bonus points if you have the following: • Understanding of JTAG and Boundary Scan concepts • Knowledge / experience of electronics manufacture, Lean Manufacturing, 5S • Ability to learn an object-oriented language and job_description:
Whom you report to Director, Integrated Marketing

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries, comprehensive health plans, and several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, a wellness allowance, an employee share ownership program, professional development support, and many fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got an energising environment here.

What the job is all about:

· Develop the annual marketing plan for the APAC region in coordination with marketing, public relations, product teams and the regional sales team. Ensuring that the campaigns have a clear strategy with SMART objectives, tactics and KPIs that you will be expected to measure and report on.

· Develop social media channels, brand/marketing websites, mobile channels, and advertising platforms.

· You will work with external media and creative agencies to develop assets and review and recommend improvements to media plans.

· Monitor regional marketing budget, monthly reporting of marketing effectiveness and weekly project status reporting.

· Regularly report the progress and the results of the marketing activities to the Director of Integrated Marketing and the APAC sales management team.

· Provide regional guidance to the Corporate Marketing team to ensure that collateral is regionally appropriate and manage translations where required.

· Setting the strategy and objective of regional events and tradeshows in coordination with the sales and events teams.

· You are responsible for the planning and execution of modern marketing channels: social media, content, and digital marketing (platforms, calendaring, collaboration, and execution).

Who you are:

· A university degree, preferably in Marketing/Communication

· 5+ years of B2B marketing experience, ideally within the broadcast or technology industries

· Entrepreneurial mind-set and an ability to adapt and prioritize self-sufficiently.

· Ability to successfully partner with a broad range of regional colleagues from sales, product, and marketing.

· Ability to drive lead generation, explore creative ways to engage with our customers, and campaign management with minimal guidance.

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

· First-class organisational and project management skills, able to multi-task and deliver projects on time and within budget

job_title: Electronics Test Technician (Job Req #2023-197) Iroquois, On
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Working both independently and in a team environment; working with and assisting senior technicians with all functional test equipment and fixtures to assure all systems are functional and operating within Ross standards. This position is based in our Manufacturing facility in Iroquois, Ontario.

Who you report to: Test Development Manager

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Troubleshooting anywhere from fully assembled systems all the way down to the component level on PCBAs
• Initiating repairs using appropriate routing and rework tools
• Working with Production Managers, Lead-Hands and cell supervisors for work prioritization to ensure internal and external customer demands are met
• Providing technical support to Production test staff, by validating infrastructure integrity and initiating repairs as well as providing technical support to the Test Development team on NPI (new product introduction).
• Use various test equipment and tools (hardware and software) to test and debug products and as required,
• Perform production configuration, testing and calibration following established procedures, policies and protocols and performing other related duties as required

Who you are:
• Electronics Technician/Technologist diploma or equivalent in experience is required
• Excellent understanding of electronic theory and applications, with an emphasis on digital components such as CPU, FPGA, flash, etc.
• A solid foundation in schematic reading and interpretation with a working knowledge of Linux and other command line interface with hardware and knowledge of JTAG technologies (IEEE 1149.1, 1149.6.). Familiarity with a wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analysers, DVMs, etc.)
• Experience with scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, or equivalent and experience with programming languages such as C, C++ or equivalent.
• An above average PC/Windows computer skill set specifically related to network and serial interface and configuration
• Must have computer proficiency with Microsoft Office and core business-use tools and knowledge of video and audio standards, and broadcasting would be an asset
• The ability to solder if required (jig repair) is an asset
• Exceptional technical abilities and organizational skills
• High initiative and well-developed analytical problem-solving skills
• Strong communication skills
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
• Talent to cope with varying levels of support and documentation
• Self-starter and quick learner and
• Able to work with minimum supervision while meeting schedules.
• Able to lift 50 lbs., and to work in a manufacturing environment in an individual workstation, within a moderately noisy setting

#LI-LH1

job_description:
The Strategic Account Manager directs and coordinates the sale of Ross Video products and services and provides customer services to customer organizations alongside Ross Inside Sales Representatives and our Media Marketing department. This highly integral member of the team will represent Ross Video within a highly focused set of strategic accounts in the Network Television portfolio.

You will be building strategic, long term relationships with end users by calling on customer facilities directly to promote Ross products and services. This is both a hands-on and strategic position where you will be implementing strategic sales plans to accommodate territorial goals, engaging Product Managers in regular presentations to customers, assisting with the resolution of customer concerns and negotiating and closing sales. You will have monthly order targets to meet and will be developing and maintaining sales forecasting activities and assisting in setting sales goals with integrators and business partners, where applicable.

Who you report to: Vice-President - Global Strategic Accounts
What we offer: Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Deliver sales presentations to customers in person and remotely.
Ensure the sales and marketing of product line follows the Ross Video code of ethics.
Perform market analyses to determine customer needs and price schedules.
Work in conjunction with the Ross Global sales support teams where the portfolio of Strategic accounts has locally-based business entities.
Advises and assists end-users concerning sales and purchase of Ross Video Product line.
Assists in directing product marketing to customer base to establish Ross Video products in the region.
Represents company at trade association meetings to promote product.
Assist in coordination and liaison between sales department and other sales related units.
Assists other departments within organization to prepare marketing plans specific to the strategic account portfolio
Prepares periodic sales reports showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed sales expansion.
Monitors and evaluates the activities and products of the competition.
Reviews articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.

Who you are:
Significant experience selling & marketing video experience technology to Television Networks and affiliated business units
Familiarity with key components used in video experience technology
Strong Organizational Skills
Understanding of strategic sales process
Excellent communication & presentation Skills
Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills
Knowledge of use of Ross Video products
Lateral Thinker
Willing to Travel up to 60% of the time
Northeast USA based (preferred) and ability to work effectively from your home office.

If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

As an SMT Operator, you will operate various machines to run the SMT Line. The role requires technical knowledge of printed circuit boards and surface mount technology.

Who you report to: Manager, SMT

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Set up and operation of screen printers and SPI
• Monitor SPI for tolerance adherence and understand troubleshooting methods to keep in line with paste quality
• Manage changeover process to ensure efficiency in production time
• Setup each SMT machine to ensure parts are loaded properly, conveyors are aligned, and oven recipes are accurate
• Obtain parts from inventory and verifying loaded components from the setup department are accurate
• Understand the basic hardware mechanics of the SMT equipment
• Learn all production screens and tabs of the pick and place software to ensure how to navigate the machine operation
• Understand basic troubleshooting skills with regards to component placement accuracy, board loading/unloading and fiducial data
• Work closely with AOI operator to ensure quality is maintained according to IPC 610 standards. This feedback is in response to correcting defects that may occur while operating the pick and place machines and/or screen printer
• Works closely with SMT Support team to ensure quality and to maintain production flow on the lines by reducing troubleshooting downtime
• Run the AOI machine to monitor quality coming down the lines
• Maintain and rely on IPC-610x training to ensure the correct defect calls are made and to know when to elevate problems to support staff
• Fully understand MES with regards to routing and reading MWI’s. Review of production documentation and verifying BOM revisions match the pick and place programs
• Clean stencils and returning them to the proper storage location during the build process
• Maintain ESD practices
• Adhere to MSDS procedures (PROC025A)
• Area maintenance and general tidiness and organization of materials

Who you are:
• Have a high school diploma
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• Strong aptitude for learning
• Able to lift and bend

Bonus points if you have the following

• Previous experience with machine operation
#LI-AS2

The successful candidate will be responsible for the execution of and/or participation in Ross Creative and Professional Services activities, by providing services for the design, creation, and implementation of XPression real-time graphics and graphics packages and assisting with key XPression Sales and Marketing opportunities.

This position is located in our Ottawa office or a home-based office setting, if mutually agreed upon.

Who you report to: Art Director of Creative Services

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Graphic Integration and Design:
• Creates XPression templates and animations, using native Xpression tools and provided base graphic elements – such as 3D models, still images, and clips.
• Designs XPression templates and animations from scratch, using native XPression tools and 3rd-party graphics applications such as Cinema 4D and Adobe Suite.
• Creates packages that conform to standardized workflows outlined by the Art Director.

Automation:
• Ensures appropriate automation hooks are created for outside control.
• Utilize XPression Visual Logic and scripting for automated, dynamic templates.
• Setup XPression Datalinq to pull in external data feeds and interface with external data aggregation systems.
• Use Ross Dashboard to create manual user interface panels and backup solutions for XPression automated graphics.

On-site Implementation:
• Responsible for implementation and integration of graphics packages at customer’s sites, as required.

Administrative:
• Attends meetings and conference calls as required to scope, complete, or otherwise facilitate successful completion of assigned projects as they relate to the job.
• Work with other creative and professional service members to institute a consistent and standardized workflow solution.

Documentation:
• Works with Ross team members to create style and operational guides for end users.
• Documents any custom scripting methodologies to ensure future support from Ross.
• May be required to create project style-guides of assets.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary degree or trade school diploma
• Advanced knowledge of Adobe creative suite
• Advanced knowledge of Cinema 4D and Redshift renderer knowledge a plus
• Intermediate knowledge of IT workflows
• Intermediate computer programming experience in VB, SQL, and/or JAVA is desirable
• Proficient in Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint
• Proficient knowledge of Unreal Engine a plus
• Minimum 2-5 years production experience in broadcast (studio or remote) or sport venue
• Minimum 2-5 years of graphic design experience.
• Proficient knowledge of broadcast graphics workflows
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
• Excellent communication skills
• Aptitude for animation and choreography of movement
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills
• High tolerance of ambiguity
• Team-oriented, and able to work co-operatively with Ross and end users
• Enthusiastic problem solver
• Willing to travel on a project-by-project basis up to 50% of the time
• Valid Passport and Valid Driver’s License

If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Strategic Account Manager directs and coordinates the sale of Ross Video products and services and provides customer services to customer organizations alongside Ross Inside Sales Representatives and our Media Marketing department. This highly integral member of the team will represent Ross Video within a highly focused set of strategic accounts in the Network Television portfolio.

 You will be building strategic, long term relationships with end users by calling on customer facilities directly to promote Ross products and services. This is both a hands-on and strategic position where you will be implementing strategic sales plans to accommodate territorial goals, engaging Product Managers in regular presentations to customers, assisting with the resolution of customer concerns and negotiating and closing sales.

 You will have monthly order targets to meet and will be developing and maintaining sales forecasting activities and assisting in setting sales goals with integrators and business partners, where applicable.

Who you report to: Vice-President - Global Strategic Accounts

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• Deliver sales presentations to customers in person and remote
• Ensure the sales and marketing of product line follows the Ross Video code of ethics
• Perform market analyses to determine customer needs and price schedules
• Work in conjunction with the Ross Global sales support teams where the portfolio of Strategic accounts has locally-based business entities

• Advises and assists end-users concerning sales and purchase of Ross Video Product line.
• Assists in directing product marketing to customer base to establish Ross Video products in the region.
• Represents company at trade association meetings to promote product.
• Assist in coordination and liaison between sales department and other sales related units.
• Assists other departments within organization to prepare marketing plans specific to the strategic account portfolio

• Prepares periodic sales reports showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed sales expansion.
• Monitors and evaluates the activities and products of the competition.
• Reviews articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.

Who you are:

• Significant experience selling & marketing video experience technology to Television Networks and affiliated business units
• Familiarity with key components used in video experience technology
• Strong Organizational Skills
• Understanding of strategic sales process
• Excellent communication & presentation Skills

• Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills
• Knowledge of use of Ross Video products
• Lateral Thinker
• Willing to Travel up to 60% of the time
• Northeast USA based (preferred)
#LI-LH1

Mechanical Designer Reports to: Technical Product Manager (TPM) Mechanischer Konstrukteur Berichtet an: Technischer Produktmanager (TPM)
Overview
Development of systems or components for rope robotics and associated special applications up to series maturity. Coordinate all necessary work steps for on-time and budget-based completion.

Übersicht
Entwicklung von Systemen oder Komponenten für die Seilrobotik und zugehörige Sonderanwendungen bis zur Serienreife. Koordinierung aller notwendigen Arbeitsschritte für eine termingerechte und budgetgerechte Fertigstellung.

Duties, Responsibilities and
Accountability:
• Administrative activities:
• Development of mechanical parts, systems or tools

• Calculation of individual parts for proof for the authorities and customers
• Selection of materials and standard parts
• Implementation of the Design to Cost strategy
• Preparation of technical documentation of new developments
• Documented handover of series products to the service department
• Documentation of improvements from lessons-learned, customer feedback
• Planning and execution of tests including documentation
• Definition of wear limits and derivation of the necessary curing work
• Coordination of development projects up to series production

• Processing of project purchasing with posting in the ERP system if needed
• Support for incoming inspection of deliveries

Aufgaben, Zuständigkeiten und Verantwortlichkeiten:
• Administrative Tätigkeiten:
• Entwicklung von mechanischen Teilen, Systemen oder Werkzeugen
• Berechnung von Einzelteilen für den Nachweis gegenüber Behörden und Kunden
• Auswahl von Materialien und Normteilen
• Umsetzung der Design to Cost Strategie
• Erstellung der technischen Dokumentation von Neuentwicklungen
• Dokumentierte Übergabe von Serienprodukten an die Serviceabteilung
• Dokumentation von Verbesserungen aus Lessons-Learned, Kundenfeedback
• Planung und Durchführung von Tests inklusive Dokumentation
• Definition von Verschleißgrenzen und Ableitung der notwendigen Nachbehandlungsarbeiten
• Koordinierung von Entwicklungsprojekten bis zur Serienfertigung
• Bei Bedarf Abwicklung des Projekteinkaufs mit Verbuchung im ERP-System
• Unterstützung der Wareneingangskontrolle

• Mechanical work:
• Metal processing in the course of small modifications
• Assembly of new plants
• Implementation of improvements in existing plants

• Assembly and monitoring of test setups

• Mechanische Arbeiten:
• Metallverarbeitung im Zuge kleinerer Umbauten
• Montage von Neuanlagen
• Durchführung von Verbesserungen an bestehenden Anlagen
• Montage und Überwachung von Versuchsaufbauten

• Electronic work:
• System cabling and soldering

• Elektronische Arbeiten:
• Systemverkabelung und Löten

• Maintenance work, mainly for new developments or support for the service department:
• Mechanical and electrical inspections
• Execution of safety-relevant tests
• If necessary damage and fault repairs internationally

• Wartungsarbeiten, hauptsächlich bei Neuentwicklungen oder zur Unterstützung der Serviceabteilung:
• Mechanische und elektrische Inspektionen
• Durchführung von sicherheitsrelevanten Prüfungen
• Im Bedarfsfall Schadens- und Störungsbehebung international

Job Requirements:
Knowledge/Education/Training/Experience:
• Completed vocational training in the field of mechanics or mechatronics (apprenticeship, technical college/HTL)
• Basic knowledge of mechanics, electrical engineering
• Basic knowledge in the field of network technology is an advantage
• Basic knowledge in dealing with PLC technology is an advantage
• Experienced in using CAD programs, preferably Inventor
• Experienced in dealing with ERP system, preferably Modulex
• Basic knowledge in the strength calculation of mechanical components and assemblies

• Good understanding of standards and safe dealings with authorities
• Skillful and safe handling of hand tools

Berufliche Anforderungen:
Kenntnisse/Bildung/Ausbildung/Erfahrungen:
• Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung im Bereich Mechanik oder Mechatronik (Lehre, Fachhochschule/HTL)
• Grundkenntnisse in Mechanik, Elektrotechnik
• Grundkenntnisse auf dem Gebiet der Netzwerktechnik sind von Vorteil
• Grundkenntnisse im Umgang mit SPS-Technik sind von Vorteil
• Erfahrung im Umgang mit CAD-Programmen, vorzugsweise Inventor
• Erfahrung im Umgang mit ERP-Systemen, vorzugsweise Modulex
• Grundkenntnisse in der Festigkeitsberechnung von mechanischen Bauteilen und Baugruppen
• Gutes Verständnis für Normen und sicheren Umgang mit Behörden
• Geschickter und sicherer Umgang mit Handwerkzeugen

Traits:
• Practical thinking
• Independent work
• Solution-oriented thinking
• Spoken and written English
• Polite and professional appearance
• Understanding in the field of accurate and safe work
• Team Player

Eigenschaften:
• Praktisches Denken
• Selbstständiges Arbeiten
• Lösungsorientiertes Denken
• Englisch in Wort und Schrift
• Höfliches und professionelles Auftreten
• Verständnis auf dem Gebiet des genauen und sicheren Arbeitens
• Teamfähig

job_title: Manufacturing NPI - PCBA Technical Prime (Job Req 2023-310)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

As a Manufacturing NPI Technical Prime, you will collaborate on the introduction of new and changing technologies within manufacturing, owning the DFM analysis of our Connectivity product grouping. You will report directly to the Director, Manufacturing NPI and work alongside experts in manufacturing and R&D
Who you report to: Manager, Test Development
What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
What the job is all about:
• Perform DFM analysis on new and changing PCBA and mechanical designs
• Assist and collaborate with the creation of jigs and fixtures to support manufacturing.
• Help determine the proper production routing
• Review manufacturing and R&D documentation for accuracy
• Engage with the various R&D and manufacturing teams to provide DFM feedback and discuss design and process optimization.
• Educate and collaborate with R&D teams to ensure our manufacturing capabilities align with new designs and the product roadmap
• Monitor the product roadmap and discuss long-term implications with the manufacturing process, test, and support teams.
• Discuss implementation details with the various manufacturing teams while soliciting input and collaborating on the best solutions.
• Help continually improve our NPI processes for long term sustainability, efficiency, and effectiveness
• Transfer knowledge into and assist the Manufacturing Support Team.
Who you are:
• Post-secondary education or equivalent work experience in a manufacturing or manufacturing interfacing environment.
• Experience performing DFM analysis and creating detailed DFM reports in the field of PCB’s and Assemblies
• Experience creating and maintaining manufacturing work instructions and procedures.
• Advanced skill level with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook) and Microsoft Project.
• Lean manufacturing education/experience a preferred asset.
• Experience with Valor DFM software a solid asset.
• Education/experience using CAD modeling tools (AutoCAD, Inventor, etc.) a preferred asset.
• Experience with MES, PLM and ERP systems an asset.
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in an electronics-manufacturing environment that included exposure to manufacturing processes and procedures.
Bonus points if you have the following:
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team
• Ability to work well with technical and non-technical staff
• Well-organized, persistent, attentive to details and accuracy
• Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills
• Ability to make decisions based on the company’s best interests
• Must demonstrate the ability to work with several functional areas as well as interact with all levels of management.
#LI-PC1

job_title: Senior Full Stack Developer - Inception (Job Req #2022-414)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. Who you report to: Software Manager - Inception

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
We are currently looking for a senior full stack developer. The languages and technologies we work with includes but is not limited to Java, JavaScript, Eclipse/OSGi, Jetty, Struts, Hibernate, AWS, JSP, and React. We are focused on our users’ needs, committed to technical excellence, practice mob programming, and strive for continuous improvement.

What the job is all about:
• Experienced full stack developer proficient in Java, React and TypeScript.
• Exhibit excellent communications skills and engage in technical discussions with peers becoming a trusted source of knowledge.
• Come to team meetings ready to share your expertise.
• Troubleshoot development and production problems across multiple environments and operating platforms.
• Support other developers by providing advice and coaching.
• Work with other technical leaders to support defining software architectures and solutions from business requirements.
• Participate in the full software development lifecycle – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, automation, testing, and maintenance.
• Collaborate with the team on continuous improvement and innovation projects.
• Follow modern DevOps practices for provisioning and deployment.
• Work with others to ensure adherence to code standards and best practices.
• Produce reusable, testable, and efficient code.
• Ensure application performance, quality, and responsiveness.
• Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features.
• Understand the agile development workflows and support the success of the team throughout the sprint.

Who you are:
• University degree or equivalent educational experience (optimally a technical or engineering degree).
• Strong programming skills in languages such as Java and TypeScript.
• Experience working with OSGI and Eclipse Platform Frameworks.
• 2+ years of front-end development using React.js.
• Strong understanding of relational databases, especially MySQL and SQL queries.
• Passion for development with a continuous learning mindset.
• Demonstrated ability to work in both a team environment as well as individually.
• Experience with source control systems—specifically Git.
• Excellent analytic troubleshooting capabilities and problem-solving skills.
• Understanding of Agile methodologies.
• A positive attitude always looking to empower the success of others.
• Ability to work independently and effectively.
• Trustworthy, team-oriented, and transparent.

Bonus Points if you have the following:
• Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), such as ECS, Lambda, and S3.
• Experience in Behavior Driven Development (BDD) and Test-Driven Development (TDD) environments.
• Understand the concepts of Domain Driven Development (DDD) and how it can benefit overall development flow.
• Proficiency with automation testing frameworks and tools such as Selenium, Appium, Cucumber, or similar.

If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Working with a team you will fully operate and understand the MES system for routing production, obtaining work instructions and logging defects. Preparing parts and Printed Circuit Boards to be hand soldered, wave soldered, assembled, inspected, programmed and tested.
Who you report to: Production Manager
What the job is all about:
• Solder and manually assemble various electronic components to designated locations on printed circuit boards according to work instruction and deviations.
• Crimp, stake, screw, bolt, rivet, weld, cement and perform similar operations to join or secure parts in place.
• Connect component lead wires to printed circuits or route and connect wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points.
• Assemble and attach hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, and switches to assemblies.
• Apply epoxy, adhesives, lubricants, and various thread lockers to secure parts in place
• Install cables and heatsinks
• Attach and marry sub-assemblies
• Operate manual and semi-automated press fit equipment to align parts in specified relationship to each other in jigs, fixtures, or other holding devices.
• Operate semi-automated board prep machine
• Operate wave solder machine
• Operate programming and testing equipment
• Assembly inspection (may or may not apply) which involves inspecting all through-hole components for correct component selection, orientation, and placement. Inspect soldering quality. Inspect modifications and deviations including but not limited to wire attachments, removal/replacement of SMT components, and track cuts.
• Ensure all finishing is completed properly, deliver inspected products to designated departments, and ensure data collection of defects.
• Routing assemblies through MES and or MAX systems either manually or electronically.
• Maintaining ESD and all safety practices.
• Follow all in place policies due to COVID-19 regulations
• Rotational shift work
Who you are:
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Detail oriented
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• An excellent aptitude for learning
Bonus points if you have the following:
• Previous experience within a manufacturing environment
• Hand soldering experience
• Electronics assembly experience
#LI-AS2

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Where you'll be working:
Ross Video is a world leader in High-Definition Video Production Equipment, designed and manufactured in Canada and sold world-wide. Our products are used by a who's who of the global entertainment industry, including top broadcast networks like NBC, ABC, CBS and Fox in the USA; Rogers, CTV and the CBC in Canada and others around the world from Fiji to Finland and everywhere in between. We are # 1 in providing behind the scenes HD production gear used in Sports Stadiums including places where the Atlanta Falcons, NY Mets, LA Lakers, Pittsburgh Penguins and Buffalo Bills play. Our equipment was used extensively at the Vancouver 2010 and other Olympic games. Our systems are used by top acts including Springsteen, Blink 182, The Red Hot Chili Peppers and the Police to name a few. Top webcasters like Revision 3 and MLB.com use Ross. Our equipment is even used on the International Space Station. Join Ross and you will have a chance to work on advanced technology used in a wide variety of very cool ways by our clients.

What the job is all about:
As a member of the Component Engineering and Change Management team, reporting to the Component Engineering and Change Management manager, the candidate will contribute to the team’s success by leading initiatives around component environmental compliance, component lifecycle management, multi-sourcing of components and component engineering procedure creation
The candidate will revise Ross’ current environmental compliance process, establish sustainable procedures and act as subject matter expert. Additionally, the candidate will act as subject matter expert for various commodities and internal processes.

Who you are:
• At least 4 years of experience working in a component Engineering role, or equivalent
• Knowledge of Engineering Change Management principles
• Expert knowledge of Oracle Agile or other PLM system
• A sound knowledge of electronic components and the electronic industry
• Ability to multitask in fast paced environment
• In-depth knowledge of environmental compliance regulations such as REACH, RoHS, TSCA, WEEE and Prop65.
• Strong level using Excel: Pivot tables and Macros a definite asset
• An inquisitive self-starter, who can work effectively in a team or as an individual contributor
• An effective communicator, who can interact with internal stakeholders as well as external suppliers
• An individual contributor with a track record of independently leading small to medium scope projects
• Have demonstrated leadership skills commensurate with an intermediate level contributor

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Join our dynamic team as a UX Designer and unleash your creativity to transform and unify user experiences across the entire Ross Video product portfolio, making a real difference in the lives of our users. As a key member of our design team, you'll have the opportunity to shape cutting-edge designs spanning robotics, control panels, infrastructure, graphics, and more. Collaborating closely with senior management, product owners, technical leads, and our valued customers, you'll craft elegant and powerful solutions that leave a lasting impact. Join us today and be part of an exciting journey where your talents will shine!
Who you report to: Manager, UX & Industrial Design
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Creating wireframes, prototypes, and user flows to visualize and communicate design concepts.
• Iterating on designs based on feedback from stakeholders, incorporating usability best practices and industry standards.
• Collaborating with developers and engineers to establish technical requirements and ensure the successful implementation of design solutions.
• Creating and maintaining a user experience design guide for application across Ross Video’s broad product portfolio.
• Conducting user research, including interviews and usability testing, to gather insights and inform the design process.
• Establishing design processes and evangelizing best practices at Ross Video.
• Performing a variety of other interesting duties.

Who you are:
• You have a bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Interaction Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Graphic Design, or a related discipline.
• You have proven experience as a UX designer or a similar role, showcasing a strong portfolio of successful projects.
• You have proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, or similar software.
• You have excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to effectively present and justify design decisions to stakeholders.
• You can quickly understand and work with technical requirements and industry-specified constraints.
• You have a passion for creating exceptional user experiences and a keen interest in the latest advancements in UX design.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Knowledge of television, stage, film, or news production
• Knowledge of frontend web technologies (HTML, CSS, JS)
#LI-KS1

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

As a Senior Product Verification Specialist within the Caprica team, you will have a large impact on the team’s ability to release high quality products. Caprica is a piece of embedded software that enables other Ross products to perform easy, reliable, and effective Device Control within a newsroom or meeting room environment.

You will help guide the team’s overall quality strategy by creating test plans, iterating over our quality processes and activities, and guiding the team’s members towards higher quality results. You will also help accomplish our goals by performing manual testing, exploratory testing and writing automated test cases. You will install, configure, operate, and test with a variety of Ross Video and third-party tools to ensure that Caprica will function in the highly varied array of deployments that our customers employ.

Who you report to: Software Manager - Caprica

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Impact and improve the overall test strategy for Caprica
• Write high quality test plans for releases
• Work closely with the Product Owner to understand how new features will be used and incorporate this into test plans
• Build and maintain full system environments
• Work with other teams to ensure our cross-team goals are met
• Contribute to sprint work through manual test execution, exploratory testing and implementation of test cases into automation frameworks
• Report defects in the product to the development team and assist in getting them resolved

Who you are:
• 5+ years in a Product Verification or Quality Assurance role
• Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent industry experience
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Excellent attention to detail

Bonus points if you have the following:
• You have knowledge of one or more scripting languages such as Python and JavaScript
• Knowledge of one or more test automation tools such as Selenium, JUnit, Robot Framework, JMeter and Cucumber
• Experience with Git is an asset
• Experience working with Linux commands as well as an Intermediate level understanding of the Linux operating system
• Knowledge of live video production technology, particularly editorial workflow tools
• Knowledge and/or experience with networking, communication protocols and quality activities around embedded systems
#LI-KF1

At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

ROSS VIDEO THRIVES IN LIVE PRODUCTION, AND WE NEED YOUR HELP
We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results in a way that’s fun and respectful to both ourselves and our customers.
Ross Video, recently recognized as one of Canada’s top 100 companies by MediaCorp is seeking exceptionally talented and motivated professionals to join our Enterprise Management team.
Winning a top 100 award is not easy, it requires excellence in multiple dimensions:
• Work Environment
• Compensation and Benefits
• Family Friendly Policies
• Employee Engagement
• Training and Development
• Community engagement
If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, intelligence, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
WHAT'S IN THE JOB?
We are able to delight our customers with our innovative products because they work better when combined with other Ross products. For example, our production switchers seamlessly integrate with our graphics and replay systems. This is no accident but the result of a sustained commitment to developing our Enterprise Management solutions: DashBoard and Ross Platform Manager. Together, these form the backbone that enables Ross Video to deliver offerings with a 1 + 1 = 3 value proposition. By a conservative estimate around 65% of Ross Video revenues are enabled by the work of our Enterprise Management team.
The Ross Platform Manager in particular is a gateway to consolidating all Ross product solutions. Features you’ll work on include licensing, orchestration, role-based access control, and the migration of our existing solution to a modern framework, React. You will participate in an Agile team, working alongside your colleagues to design, develop and implement enterprise-grade solutions while employing software development best practices including the awareness and detection of code smells, inclusion of design patterns, and committing to delivering the highest quality solutions.
Should you join this team, you’ll become a key part of ensuring that Ross Video’s secret to success continues to enable innovations across all our product lines. You’ll also work with some of the latest development technologies and information security disciplines.
HAVE YOU GOT WHAT IT TAKES?
It would be great if you already have expertise in live production.
Your focus on cloud technologies has enabled you to not only advise but lead the charge on cloudifying existing enterprise-grade products and building cloud-native solutions. You are experienced with one or more cloud computing platforms (i.e., AWS), infrastructure as code, and relevant cloud computing concepts in the realm of networking, security, monitoring, and troubleshooting.
You’re passionate about working in Java, and you want to raise the level of excellence of the team both in Java and across the various development tools and framework, such as Eclipse/OSGi, Eclipse Rich Client Platform, Swing, SWT, Java Native Access, and OAuth2.0 to create powerful applications with eye-popping user interfaces.
You need to be able to capture the strategic direction of the product and apply your judgment to define the path forward to meet our customers’ needs. We want you to bring that excitement you crave for exploring new ideas to produce tangible results.
You need to love learning and progressing your skill set. That means you'll be comfortable talking about your weaknesses just as much as your strengths and working hard on improving will be a daily habit.
You love to experiment and be proactive in developing sound solutions. Being part of an R&D division means that you will help push the boundaries of our understanding through experimentation and exploration effectively driving innovation.
We work in a very collaborative environment, and you enjoy mentoring the other members of the team to always do better. It is vital that you care more about delivering the result than exactly whose ideas achieved it.
That also means you'll need to be interested in the processes, constraints, and systems that help product designs flourish.
WE'RE GROWING FAST
That means we are always looking for better ways to adapt our work environment and processes to meet the high demands of our customers. Our roles morph, we volunteer for extra tasks, we all care a lot about helping good things happen. If you don't like change, you’re in the wrong place. But if you do, then you can be part of an incredible journey.
WHY WORK FOR ROSS VIDEO?
Because we can help you flourish. You will get to develop and deliver cutting edge technological solutions for the entertainment industry. You will be part of the Ross Video team working together to make that happen, and we find that a pretty energizing environment to be a part of.
LOCATION
Ottawa, Canada. It's the Nation’s Capital with the longest skating rink (the Rideau Canal) in the winter, waterways in the summer, and hills for skiing and hiking 30 minutes from the office. Ottawa posts vibrant urban neighborhoods, as well as numerous recreational possibilities.
IN A NUTSHELL
Do you have integrity, intelligence, and a drive to get results? Then Ross is the place for you, and we'd like to hear from you.
Even if we are not presently listing a suitable position, you should still get in touch. We love hearing from game changers with a growth mindset.

#LI-KS1

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

The Technical Support Specialist is responsible for providing technical support remotely and onsite through remote sessions, ticketing systems, phone support on a as needed basis for Ross Video products, we assist customers in resolving issues by providing solutions to technical and service problems and provides the “Superior Customer Experience” through effective handling of customer issues or concerns. We work with some amazing customers, and you will get to be a part of helping them make an impact on their audiences. Please take a look at some of our Success Stories! https://www.rossvideo.com/company/customers/ What we offer: Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, RRSP matching, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! Senior Members of our team also have the option of working from home. Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here. What the job is all about: • Assist Customers with technical setup questions, troubleshooting efforts, and product specific solutions. • Take ownership of customer issues reported and seeing problems through to resolution • Research, diagnose, troubleshoot, and identify solutions to resolve issues • Follow standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams • Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers • Empowering our customers to get the most of their products and solutions. • Ensure proper recording and closure of all issues through a tracking system • Prepare accurate and timely reports, as needed • Document knowledge in the form of knowledge base technical notes and articles • Expedite returned material from the field for service reasons • Provide effective installation and commissioning services, technical product training and on-site support, as required. This may require travel on short notice. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Ross Video is a rapidly expanding broadcast industry solutions provider.
Reporting to the Senior Vice President of Global Sales, the General Manager will oversee and coordinate multiple functions within the Oceania region, including Sales, Service Delivery, Creative Services, Marketing and Market Vertical development. This role will also involve a significant component of selling and driving revenue growth. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the overall operations, developing business strategies, and ensuring the successful implementation of Ross Video's vision within Oceania.
Direct reports outside of the Global Sales department will have a dotted line reporting to the managers of their respective departments. This collaborative reporting structure will ensure alignment with departmental objectives, while facilitating a unified and cohesive approach to customer engagement, brand representation and market positioning.
This unique position will include, but is not limited to, the following duties:
General Management:
• Develop and implement a strategic and operational business plan for the Oceania region that aligns with Ross Video's global strategy and objectives.
• Drive cross-functional collaboration and synergy across different departments and teams within the Oceania region, fostering a cohesive and aligned approach to customer engagement, brand representation, and market positioning.
• Manage budgets, financial performance, and resource allocation for the Oceania region.
• Regularly collaborate with the managers of the cross-functional teams represented in the region, to ensure smooth operations and alignment with company-wide objectives.
• Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the Oceania team, promoting employee engagement, cooperation, and development.
• Responsible for the overall hiring, motivation, and management of the direct reports in the region. Working with the Senior Vice President of Global Sales and Department Leaders, this includes recruitment, mentoring, coaching, and evaluating team members while driving a culture of performance.
• Exudes the behaviors identified within Ross Video’s Culture Statements, as well as our company’s Code of Ethics.
Sales Leadership:
• Lead and inspire the sales team to achieve revenue targets, ensuring the consistent growth of sales within the Oceania region.
• Develop and execute strategic sales plans, in collaboration with the Senior Vice President of Global Sales, to expand market share and penetrate new customer segments.
• Foster strong customer relationships, acting as a trusted advisor to key clients and driving customer satisfaction.
Service Delivery Management:
• Oversee the service delivery operations, ensuring the timely and efficient execution of projects and customer support.
• Collaborate with the global service team to develop and implement standardized processes, service levels, and quality assurance measures.
• Maintain a customer-centric approach, striving for excellence in service delivery and exceeding customer expectations.
Creative Services Management:
• Manage the creative services team responsible for delivering high-quality video production solutions, including graphics, virtual sets, and augmented reality.
• Collaborate with internal stakeholders and clients to conceptualize and develop innovative solutions that align with customer requirements and market trends.
• Ensure the timely delivery of creative services projects while maintaining a high standard of quality and creativity.
Sports & Live Events:
• Lead and oversee the Sports & Live Events business within the Oceania region, working closely with clients, production teams, event organizers, and the SLE Vertical Market team.
• In collaboration with Sports & Live Events, develop and execute strategies to secure new sports and live event opportunities, maximizing revenue potential.
• Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful planning, execution, and post-event evaluation of sports and live event projects.
Marketing
• Develop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies and campaigns in the Oceania region, aligned with Ross Video's global marketing objectives and brand guidelines.
• Collaborate with the global marketing team to adapt and localize marketing materials, messaging, and campaigns to effectively reach and engage the Oceania market.
• Conduct market research and analysis to identify customer needs, market trends, and competitive landscape, providing valuable insights to inform marketing strategies and initiatives specific to the Oceania region.
Sales Responsibilities:
• Personally engage in sales activities, including prospecting, lead generation, customer presentations, and contract negotiations.
• Build and maintain relationships with key clients, influencers, and industry stakeholders.
• Stay up to date with industry trends, market conditions, and competitor activities to drive continuous improvement and identify new business opportunities.
• Attend trade shows and industry conferences to increase sales through improved levels of product knowledge and further develop industry contacts via networking.

Who you are:
Knowledge/Experience/Education/Training:
• Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field.
• 7+ years of experience in sales and/or general management roles in the broadcast or related industry.
• Strong leadership and team management skills, with a proven track record of achieving business targets and driving growth.
• Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills, with the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with customers, partners, and stakeholders.
• Demonstrated ability to develop and execute strategic plans, and to analyze and interpret market trends and customer needs.
• Strong commercial acumen, with experience managing budgets and financial performance.
• Ability to travel extensively within the region and occasionally internationally.
Other:
• Willing to Travel up to 50% of the time
• Valid Passport
• Valid Driver’s License & a clear driving record
• Relocation assistance will be available for this role

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Working with a team you will fully operate and understand the MES system for routing production, obtaining work instructions and logging defects. Preparing parts and Printed Circuit Boards to be hand soldered, wave soldered, assembled, inspected, programmed and tested.
Who you report to: Production Manager

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Solder and manually assemble various electronic components to designated locations on printed circuit boards according to work instruction and deviations.
• Crimp, stake, screw, bolt, rivet, weld, cement and perform similar operations to join or secure parts in place.
• Connect component lead wires to printed circuits or route and connect wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points.
• Assemble and attach hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, and switches to assemblies.
• Apply epoxy, adhesives, lubricants, and various thread lockers to secure parts in place
• Install cables and heatsinks
• Attach and marry sub-assemblies
• Operate manual and semi-automated press fit equipment to align parts in specified relationship to each other in jigs, fixtures, or other holding devices.
• Operate semi-automated board prep machine
• Operate wave solder machine
• Operate programming and testing equipment
• Assembly inspection (may or may not apply) which involves inspecting all through-hole components for correct component selection, orientation, and placement. Inspect soldering quality. Inspect modifications and deviations including but not limited to wire attachments, removal/replacement of SMT components, and track cuts.
• Ensure all finishing is completed properly, deliver inspected products to designated departments, and ensure data collection of defects.
• Routing assemblies through MES and or MAX systems either manually or electronically.
• Maintaining ESD and all safety practices.
• Follow all in place policies due to COVID-19 regulations
• Rotational shift work
Who you are:
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Detail oriented
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• An excellent aptitude for learning
Bonus points if you have the following:
• Previous experience within a manufacturing environment
• Hand soldering experience
• Electronics assembly experience
#LI-AS2
