As an SMT Operator, you will operate various machines to run the SMT Line. The role requires technical knowledge of printed circuit boards and surface mount technology.
Who you report to: Manager, SMT
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
What the job is all about:
• Set up and operation of screen printers and SPI
• Monitor SPI for tolerance adherence and understand troubleshooting methods to keep in line with paste quality
• Manage changeover process to ensure efficiency in production time
• Setup each SMT machine to ensure parts are loaded properly, conveyors are aligned, and oven recipes are accurate
• Obtain parts from inventory and verifying loaded components from the setup department are accurate
• Understand the basic hardware mechanics of the SMT equipment
• Learn all production screens and tabs of the pick and place software to ensure how to navigate the machine operation
• Understand basic troubleshooting skills with regards to component placement accuracy, board loading/unloading and fiducial data
• Work closely with AOI operator to ensure quality is maintained according to IPC 610 standards. This feedback is in response to correcting defects that may occur while operating the pick and place machines and/or screen printer
• Works closely with SMT Support team to ensure quality and to maintain production flow on the lines by reducing troubleshooting downtime
• Run the AOI machine to monitor quality coming down the lines
• Maintain and rely on IPC-610x training to ensure the correct defect calls are made and to know when to elevate problems to support staff
• Fully understand MES with regards to routing and reading MWI’s. Review of production documentation and verifying BOM revisions match the pick and place programs
• Clean stencils and returning them to the proper storage location during the build process
• Maintain ESD practices
• Adhere to MSDS procedures (PROC025A)
• Area maintenance and general tidiness and organization of materials
Who you are:
• Have a high school diploma
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• Strong aptitude for learning
• Able to lift and bend
Bonus points if you have the following
• Previous experience with machine operation

job_title: Content & Workflow Specialist, Sports & Live Events (Job Req #2023-291)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Ross Video is a global leader in providing cutting-edge production solutions for sports, live events and broadcasts. Our innovative products and services help customers create dynamic, engaging content and deliver it to audiences in real-time all around the world.

We are searching for a dynamic, highly motivated Content and Workflow Specialist to join our Sports and Live Events team at Ross - in its initiative to increase sales and support of Ross Video technology in these market spaces. In this role, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining graphics and workflow for our clients' live events and broadcasts. You will also be responsible for operating systems at some of the largest sporting events around the world. This key role within the Global Sales and Vertical Market Solutions organization requires a balance of creative and operational skills. This is a diverse role that reports directly to the Manager, Content & Workflow - Sports & Live Events and requires frequent interaction with the company’s prospects, partners, and internal teams to ensure that content and best overall workflow is deployed and supported. This unique position will include, but is not limited to the following responsibilities and duties:

Who you report to: Manager, Content & Workflow – Global

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• Deploy and maintain sports specialized workflow.
• Collaborate with clients to design and create high-quality graphics for their live events and broadcasts using Ross Video’s software and hardware solutions.
• Build graphic content, organize workflow and operate live systems for global top tier events.
• Build, maintain and engage in customer facing product presentations, demos, training, and workflow guidance to end-users and business partners at customer premises, tradeshows, or remote.
• Participate and contribute to sales opportunities driven by the Vice President of Sports & Live Events and Sales Management Team, prioritizing efforts based on maximizing total impact on the team’s productivity.
• Work closely with our sales and support teams to understand customer needs and provide them with customized solutions.
• Test and troubleshoot systems to ensure they are functioning properly before, during, and after live events.
• Train clients and internal staff on how to use Ross Video’s systems, workflow and software effectively.
• Ensures the Sales and Marketing of product lines follows the Ross Video Code of Ethics.
• Position requires travel up to 40% of the time

Who you are:

• Experience creating high-quality graphics for live events and broadcasts using industry-standard software such as Adobe Creative Suite, Cinema 4D, and Ross Video XPression
• Familiarity with video production workflows and technologies such as cameras, switchers, routers, and audio equipment.
• Diploma/Degree in a related field or equivalent work experience.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with clients and internal teams.
• Able to work co-operatively across all company departments.
• Strong knowledge of Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
• Computer IT skills
• Possess strong and creative problem-solving traits.
• Passionate about Ross Video equipment solutions
• Positive, determined, problem solver
• Deadline driven
• Strong organization and communication skills
• Ability to multi-task
• Ability to work well independently and self-motivate
• Attention to detail and a strong work ethic
• Desire to contribute to a team environment
• Ability to handle stressful situations
• Willing to Travel up to 40% of the time
• Must live within 75 miles of major airport
• Valid Passport
• Valid Driver’s License & a clear driving record
• Travel to annual NAB, IDEA, SVG, and other sports related trade shows (if required)
• Attend Sales Meetings as required

Ross Video is looking for a Project Manager to join our Rancho Cordova team in managing LED display projects. The successful candidate will be responsible for coordinating all activities associated with the timely, accurate, and on-budget completion of Ross LED projects. They will assist the pre-sales and deployment teams with defining the scope, schedule, costs, and resources required to complete the project (including labor, logistics, material, specialty tools, etc.) This is a diverse role that reports directly to the Deployment Manager and requires frequent interaction with the company’s prospects, clients, sales and service teams to ensure that solutions designed are efficiently deployed and supported. This role will also meet with clients and vendors and travel to various sites to assist with current installs and future bids.

Who you report to: Manager, LED Deployment

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Create and review SOWs and project contracts to determine the time to deliver and the available required internal and/or third-party resources to complete the project.
• Lead project kick-off meetings and schedule ongoing meetings throughout the project lifecycle as required.
• Act as the primary point of contact for clients and stakeholders.
• Maintain and develop a strong relationship with customers with direct interaction with a focus on improving customers’ perception of service, quality, on-time delivery, and responsiveness.
• Maintain ownership for resolving all project-related issues.
• Engage Finance/Accounting and Purchasing department personnel with all needs for purchasing and/or equipment.
• Responsible for sourcing sub-contractors and executing their agreements.
• Track manufacturing schedules, project-specific budgets and report to management weekly.
• Provide on-site install support as required.
• Provide and turnover all project-related close-out documents upon completion.
• Conduct site surveys as required.

Who you are:
• Bachelor’s degree in engineering, construction management or a related field.
• A minimum of 5 years of experience in project management of LED displays or similar technology.
• Knowledge of LED technology and content management systems.
• Understanding of the Broadcast/Media Technology Market.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to work with clients and colleagues in a professional and timely manner.
• Ability to work cooperatively with and across all company departments.
• Strong knowledge of Word and Excel.
• Ability to travel to various job sites as required.
• Positive, Determined, Problem Solver
• Deadline driven
• Strong organization and communication skills
• Ability to schedule duties/projects (multi-task)
• Ability to work well independently
• Attention to detail and a strong work ethic
• Desire to contribute to a team environment
• Ability to handle stressful situations
• Willing to Travel up to 25% of the time
• Must live within 100 miles of major airport
• Valid Passport
• Valid Driver’s License
• Travel to tradeshows as required
• Attend Sales Meetings, as required

Ross Video is looking for a senior level Manufacturing Test Developer that will help manufacturing build, test, then deliver high performing equipment used in the broadcast industry. You will collaborate on the development of a scalable manufacturing test and data system, that performs thorough PCBA investigation, functional product testing, data collection, and report generation. The system supports dozens of product categories and needs to ensure every product shipped exceeds the users’ expectations. You will work alongside experts in test development, hardware, and software design, in our manufacturing facility is in Iroquois, Ontario. Which is approximately a 30-minute drive from Kemptville, Cornwall and Brockville, or a 45-minute drive from southern Ottawa. What the job is all about:
• Plan and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases based on new product features, customer requirements or identified problems
• Collaborate with your teammates and advocate for quality throughout the software development lifecycle
• Identify test scenarios that are critical and repetitive and support automation development.
• Report defects with quality descriptions and work closely with the development team to see through and verify resolutions
• Support ongoing software development efforts which include participating in Agile based SDLC – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, documentation, testing and maintenance
• Work with other testers and developers to support end to end workflow testing.
• Continually contribute to the improvement of testing within the organization
• Investigative mindset and technical expertise that supports a range of testing approaches, tools, and techniques.
• You enjoy exploring and discovering interesting app behaviours
• Detail-oriented with strong communication and collaboration skills
• Good understanding of testing at scale, performance, and software reliability
• Ability to work closely in a team setting with an open, collaborative communication style
• Experience working with both Windows and MacOS environments.
• Solid understanding of the Agile development process
• Explore and run tests on apps and underlying code to reveal and communicate to project stakeholders' quality-related information.
• Plan and execute tests.
• Report on test results and provide technical details to support findings
• Create and maintain testing documentation and records.
• Contribute to the improvement of the testing practice overall
• Experience testing apps on iOS and Android based mobile devices.

• Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent industry experience
• Ability and desire to travel – not a requirement for this role but the opportunity may present itself if you enjoy interacting with and learning from your end-users as a product expert

• You have knowledge of one or more scripting languages such as Python and JavaScript
• Knowledge of one or more test automation tools such as Selenium, JUnit, Robot Framework, JMeter and Cucumber
• Experience with Git is an asset
• Experience working with Linux commands as well as an Intermediate level understanding of the Linux operating system
• Knowledge of live video production technology, particularly editorial workflow tools
• Automation experience utilizing tools and scripts for API level testing

Assist Customers with technical setup questions, troubleshooting efforts, and product specific solutions.

Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers
Empowering our customers to get the most of their products and solutions.
Ensure proper recording and closure of all issues through a tracking system
Prepare accurate and timely reports, as needed
Document knowledge in the form of knowledge base technical notes and articles
Expedite returned material from the field for service reasons
Provide effective installation and commissioning services, technical product training and on-site support, as required. This may require travel on short notice.

Who you are:
Technical diploma and knowledge of broadcast systems
Customer service experience in a technical support environment
Must be proficient in the English language (read, write, speak)
Excellent trouble shooting and debugging skills
Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, listening, and questioning skills
Keen attention to detail with accurate record keeping
Must be able to work with a team as well as independently
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
Must possess a valid driver’s license and passport

Bonus points if you have the following:
Additional education and computer courses are strong assets

Onsite / online training services.
Onsite/ online customer demonstrations.
Complete required documentation.
Troubleshoot technical/systems issues at customer facilities.

Secondary activities

Assist with set-up/demos and attend tradeshows as needed.

Demonstrations
On-site, off-site, online/remote customer demonstrations and tradeshow events
Ensures integrity of the demo experience and provides feedback and input re: areas for improvement

job_title: Project / Product Operations Manager, LED Manufacturing (Job Req #2023-252)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Working with the Marketing Product Manager and the Technical Product Manager, the POM helps manage and drive each project from concept through to a successful release to manufacturing and product launch to market.
The POM is responsible for managing project timelines and agreed feature set. She or he will liaise with Manufacturing, Manufacturing Test Engineering, and Tech Support to enable smooth product sales & order process, build of required hardware/software products, and own product lifecycle support.

Who you report to: Director, Technical Product Manager, LED

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Responsible and accountable for management of direct reports.
• Accountable to the TPM to provide the staffing resources to execute on the agreed project deliverables and an agreed schedule.
• Responsible for reporting on status of projects that are part of a government grant or other funding programs.
• Project Planning:
• Follows, advocates, and helps implement the corporate NPI process.
• Assists in identifying the resource and material costs/requirements for projects.
• Works with the development team to identify and mitigate risks - developing and documenting a risk mitigation plan.
• Assists the TPM in developing the project schedules (identifies critical paths). Ownership of project schedules; both creation and maintenance.
• Responsible for entry and maintenance of all product information and data in SalesForce, Agile/Jobscope, and Max.
• Project Execution:
• Maintains and tracks the project schedules.
• Assists the TPM, where required, in the coordination of project team development activities and for the effective follow-up - facilitating communication between individuals and teams.
• Generates project meeting minutes (including action item identification, assignment and follow-up) as per the requests of the TPM.
• Tracks all development, product verification, engineering services and manufacturing activities and identifies any potential project issues and challenges, including resource exposures or conflicts.
• Ensures that project status reports are generated on time as required.
• Works with the TPM, MPM, Manufacturing (including Scheduling, Test, and Procurement) in developing product BOMs for each level of all new products.
• Responsible for ensuring the timely delivery of required input to the Technical Documentation team.
• Responsible for providing communication on project status throughout the organization.
• Ensures that project status reports are generated on time as required.
• Release:
• Works with the TPM and MPM to define a product deployment plan.
• Works with the TPM and MPM to coordinate and ensure training is provided for Technical Support, Commissioning, Sales Engineer, and Training team.
• Owns and manages the Product release checklist and is responsible for ensuring that all disciplines (manufacturing, Marketing, Developments, etc) follow through with and complete tasks required for a successful release.
• Product Lifecycle Management:
• Works with the Technical Support and Development teams, via an escalation process, to ensure customer satisfaction by managing and tracking any product deployment issues - providing prompt and appropriate customer communications.
• Tracks all field service issues and report on them internally as well as any required customer communications.
• Where necessary, consults with the Field Service Team, TPM and MPM’s to determine any necessary actions required to resolve customer issues and/or dissatisfactions.
• Responsible for maintenance (ECO, MCO, EOL, etc) of all manufacturing data for all released products.
• Responsible for monitoring and maintaining manufactured product costing and reporting any appreciable changes to TPM and MPM.
• Responsible for communication throughout the organization for all product updates and new code releases.
• Operation:
• Works with the MPM and TPM to help develop and record the Strategic Product Line Roadmap.
• Provides support to entire product team on required purchases of materials, test equipment, and facility requirements.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education, engineering degree is a strong asset.
• Familiarity with the product development process and the associated requirements of manufacturing.
• Strong logistics and planning background.
• Management experience working with remote development teams is an asset.
• Familiarity with software planning and development.
• Strong knowledge of PM tools.
• Experience working with vendors, subcontractors, and 3rd party manufacturers is an asset.
• PMI Certification is an asset.
• International travel (up to 10%)

#LI-KS1

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results in a way that’s fun and respectful to both ourselves and our customers.

Ross Video, recently recognized as one of Canada’s top 100 companies by MediaCorp is seeking exceptionally talented and motivated professionals to join our Enterprise Management team.
Winning a top 100 award is not easy, it requires excellence in multiple dimensions:
• Work Environment
• Compensation and Benefits
• Family Friendly Policies
• Employee Engagement
• Training and Development
• Community engagement

If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, intelligence, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

WHAT'S IN THE JOB?
We are able to delight our customers with our innovative products because they work better when combined with other Ross products. For example, our production switchers seamlessly integrate with our graphics and replay systems. This is no accident but the result of a sustained commitment to developing our Enterprise Management solutions: DashBoard and Ross Platform Manager. Together, these form the backbone that enables Ross Video to deliver offerings with a 1 + 1 = 3 value proposition. By a conservative estimate around 65% of Ross Video revenues are enabled by the work of our Enterprise Management team.
DashBoard is an industry leading facility control and monitoring system with the role of creating powerful and customizable user interfaces that combine the power of all of Ross’s technology. As a free and open platform, you will be serving tens of thousands of users by providing additional product offerings and enhancements and leading the technical direction.
The Ross Platform Manager is a gateway to consolidating all Ross product solutions. Features you’ll work on include licensing, orchestration, role-based access control, DashBoard’s Custom Panel capabilities, and the migration of our existing solution to a modern framework, React.
Should you join this team, you’ll become a key part of ensuring that Ross Video’s secret to success continues to enable innovations across all our product lines. You’ll also work with some of the latest development technologies and information security disciplines. You will participate in an Agile team, working alongside your colleagues to design, develop and implement enterprise-grade solutions while employing software development best practices committing to delivering the highest quality solutions.
As the Product Verification Specialist, you are the last line of defense when it comes to delivering a product that meets our standards of excellence. You have a good understanding of testing at scale, performance, and software reliability and are knowledgeable of one or more scripting languages such Python or JavaScript. You are an advocate of test automation and are familiar with tools such as Selenium, Robot Framework, JMeter and Cucumber. With the desire and ability to reach out to other teams, visit customers and learn how software is used in a live video production environment, you excel at working and collaborating in a team setting with an open and collaborative communication style.
HAVE YOU GOT WHAT IT TAKES?
You strive to develop a comprehensive test plan and test cases based on new product features, customer requirements or identified problems. Additionally, you develop integration tests in collaboration with other product teams to ensure interoperability and a smooth end-to-end workflow for end-users.
You are a team player! You support ongoing software development efforts which means participating in Agile based SDLC – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, documentation, testing and maintenance, and are always in sync with your colleagues.
With a thirst for automation, you easily identify test scenarios that are critical and repetitive and effectively automate them.
Favoring organization and structure, you report bugs with quality descriptions and work closely with the development team to see through and verify fixes.
You need to love learning and progressing your skill set. That means you'll be comfortable talking about your weaknesses just as much as your strengths and working hard on improving will be a daily habit.
You also need 5+ years of experience (or an amazing display of design and testing maturity if you have less than that). And then there are the cultural requirements.
Bonus points if you have the following:
• Experience with live video production technology – if you have directed a live event, worked with a production switcher, operated a television camera or been in broadcast IT.
• Experience automating test cases (API level testing and user-level automation).
• Experience developing automated tests in a distributed environment.
• Experience in functional testing.
• Experience utilizing tools and scripts to test and optimize performance.
• Experience with Docker and VMWare.
• Deep knowledge of the various OS; Windows, Linux and MacOS.
• Intermediate Experience in Linux is an asset.
• Experience with Git is an asset.
• Ability and desire to travel – not a requirement for this role but the opportunity may present itself if you enjoy interacting with and learning from your end-users as a product expert.

WE'RE GROWING FAST
That means we are always looking for better ways to adapt our work environment and processes to meet the high demands of our customers. Our roles morph, we volunteer for extra tasks, we all care a lot about helping good things happen. If you don't like change, you’re in the wrong place. But if you do, then you can be part of an incredible journey.

WHY WORK FOR ROSS VIDEO?
Because we can help you flourish. You will get to develop and deliver cutting edge technological solutions for the entertainment industry. You will be part of the Ross Video team working together to make that happen, and we find that a pretty energizing environment to be a part of.

LOCATION
Ottawa, Canada. It's the Nation’s Capital with the longest skating rink (the Rideau Canal) in the winter, waterways in the summer, and hills for skiing and hiking 30 minutes from the office. Ottawa posts vibrant urban neighborhoods, as well as numerous recreational possibilities.

IN A NUTSHELL
Do you have integrity, intelligence, and a drive to get results? Then Ross is the place for you, and we'd like to hear from you.

Even if we are not presently listing a suitable position, you should still get in touch. We love hearing from game changers with a growth mindset.

FURTHER DETAILS

Make sure you understand what Ross Video is about, and then click on Apply Now below. Be sure to include a bit about you and your interests.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

job_title: Test Technician Robotics - Iroquois, Ontario (Job Req #2023-272)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

This position is in person at our Iroquois, Ontario facility.

As a Robotics Test Technician, you will focus on production and RMA (customer returns) testing/debug/processing at all levels of the product structure from PCBA to system level configuration. You will work closely with the Robotics Production Manager, Technical Lead (Sr Test Development Technologist) and Manufacturing Process Specialist in meeting production timelines while adhering to the test requirements. Reporting to the Robotics Production Manager, this position is located at our Manufacturing and Test facility in Iroquois, ON.

Who you report to: Production Manager, Robotics

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

Production (released, NPI)
• Using prescribed test instructions as delivered by the Technical Lead, perform functional sub-assembly and system level test.
• Identify products failing electrical and mechanical test procedure specifications. Troubleshoot and repair assembly accordingly using established processes and procedures.
• Configure systems to meet sales order criteria.
• Directed by the Robotics Production Manager and Technical Lead, you will test/debug other Robotic products which are currently built at 8 John St. This will help with throughput and your overall understanding of the technology.
• Feedback quality or test issues to Robotics Production Manager, Technical Lead and Manufacturing Process Specialist.
• Assist Robotics Production Manager, Technical Lead and Manufacturing Process Specialist during the NPI process. This could include assembly, testing, debug or some level of performance verification.
• As directed by either the Robotics Production Manager, Technical Lead or Manufacturing Process Specialist, rework, re-test or upgrade product as per a given ECO.
• Identify and report equipment needs and resources with the Robotics Production Manager, Technical Lead and Manufacturing Process Specialist.
RMA
• Process RMAs using established processes and procedures while faithfully trying to reproduce the customer complaint.
• Identify issues to the root cause
• Interact with Tech Support techs for additional customer feedback
• Provide specific instructions using sanctioned tools for rework and upgrades.
• Due diligence in ensuring product identification at all levels are accurate and representative.
• Upon customer request, provide RMA feedback through approved reporting mechanism.
• Assist RMA Coordinators in identifying incoming product
• Follow company policies and procedures.
• Perform other related duties as required.

Who you are:
• Two or three-year Electro-Mechanical Technician/Technologist program or equivalent experience.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Technical Support Specialist is responsible for providing technical support remotely and onsite through remote sessions, ticketing systems, phone support, and onsite support as needed for Ross Video products. We assist customers in resolving issues by providing solutions to technical and service problems and provide “Superior Customer Experience” through effective handling of customer issues or concerns. We work with some amazing customers, and you will get to be a part of helping them make an impact on their audiences. Please take a look at some of our Success Stories!

https://www.rossvideo.com/company/customers/

Who you report to: Manager, Technical Support - Ottawa

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Assist Customers with technical setup questions, troubleshooting efforts, and product specific solutions.
• Take ownership of customer issues reported and seeing problems through to resolution
• Research, diagnose, troubleshoot, and identify solutions to resolve issues
• Follow standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams
• Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers
• Empowering our customers to get the most of their products and solutions.
• Ensure proper recording and closure of all issues through a ticketing system
• Prepare accurate and timely reports, as needed
• Document knowledge in the form of knowledge base technical notes and articles
• Expedite returned material from the field for service reasons
• Provide effective installation and commissioning services, technical product training and on-site support, as required. This may require travel on short notice.
• Available for on call rotation or assistance with escalated issues after-hours
• Travel up to 25% to local West Coast customers upon request or for urgent support issues
• Car allowance may be included dependant on criteria
Who you are:
• Technical diploma and knowledge of Broadcast Engineering or similar field such as college or University degrees in Electrical, Mechanical, Computer or Robotics Engineering
• Located within an hour drive of Los Angeles metro area
• 5+ years Customer service experience in a technical support or field support environment
• Must be proficient in the English language (read, write, speak)
• Excellent trouble shooting and debugging skills
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
• Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, listening, and questioning skills
• Keen attention to detail with accurate record keeping
• Must be able to work with a team as well as independently
• Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
• Must possess a valid driver’s license and passport

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Additional education and computer courses are strong assets such as AWS, SMPTE 2110
• Prior knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM systems will be an asset
• Prior knowledge of Zendesk or other ticketing systems will be an asset
• Multilingual
#LI-JF1

This position is in person at our Iroquois, Ontario facility.

As part of the Returned Materials (RMA) team, you will evaluate, initiate the repair, and record results of customer return cases. The information discovered by this position plays a crucial role in enacting improvements at all levels of the organization.
You are working directly with the varied Ross stakeholders, with the mindset that accurate data provides appropriate and targeted feedback which allows for optimum results.

Who you report to: Manager, RMA

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Using information from customer-facing processes, you will evaluate and record results of RMA cases. You will follow prescribed processes for data collection and product reclamation while having the latitude working with the Manager to create test plans to best confirm customer complaints and start our understanding of the real root causes of problems.
• As part of the fact-finding process, regular interaction with Tech Support, R&D and Test Development provides the needed foundation and background to process cases in the most effective and efficient manner.
• Use sanctioned tools for rework and upgrade request to the manufacturing floor while ensuring product identification at all levels are accurate and representative.
• Upon customer request, provide RMA feedback through an approved reporting mechanism.
• Assist RMA Coordinators in identifying incoming product

Who you are:
• 3+ years as a Test Technician, Technical Support Specialist or Product Verification Specialist or other related positions
• 2-3 year Broadcast Technology an asset, 3 year Electronics Engineering diploma, or related experience
• Design and implementation of test strategies such as functional testing, performance testing, stress testing and system testing is essential
• Proficiency at system and component level troubleshooting and debug.
• Excellent understanding of product identification, revision, lifecycle, and structure at all levels.
• Excellent understanding of video/audio test equipment along with industry standards (ie: SMPTE).
• Broadcast equipment operation (see Ross portfolio for examples)
• Basic networking knowledge
• Self-starter, quick learner and can work with minimum supervision in meeting schedules and project deadlines
• High initiative and well developed analytical, problem solving, communication and troubleshooting skills.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is desired.
• Ability to cope with varying levels of support and documentation.
• Able to envision the entire project and look for problem areas
• Organized and very detail orientated

Bonus points if you have the following:
• A comprehension of Ross Video’s portfolio.
• Script writing using Autoit, TCL , JavaScript, Linux

Working in the corporate Information Technology team located in Ottawa, the Network Administrator will have the responsibility to deploy and maintain the fundamental network and security systems used by Ross Video and be part of a core team that directly contributes to the company’s success. The successful candidate will be in their final year or a recent college graduate in computer science, information technology, or related field. The candidate will be under the guidance of the Team Lead, Network Operations.

Who you report to: Team Lead, Network Operations

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• Responsible for monitoring, threat hunting, uptime, and operation within established service levels.
• Provide assistance in resolving basic technology and cyber support issues.
• Assist in delivery of IT projects of medium to large scope, including new system rollouts, facility moves, server and network environment deployments.
• Executes maintenance plans for IT Network and Security Infrastructure.
• Assists with the creation, maintenance, and validation of appropriate disaster avoidance and recovery plans.
• Optimizes servers and network infrastructure, VPN, and Firewalls in consultation with the Team Lead, Network Operations
• Troubleshoot network, computer, or system failures
• Liaise with external providers where appropriate (Telco/ISP, AWS, Azure, etc)
• Assist IT Help Desk Technicians as required., support other Systems Administrators as needed
• Troubleshoot assigned IT Help Desk tickets
• Participate in an on-call rotation to support company operations after core business hours.
• Perform other related duties as required

Who you are:
• Bachelor/College degree in a computer science, information technology, or related field, or equivalent training and/or co-op experience
• CCNA / RHCE / MCSA / Network+
• Approachable and excellent communication skills
• Team player but able to work independently
• Able to envision the entire project and look for problem areas
• Organized, thorough, and very detail orientated
• High initiative and well-developed analytical skills
• Technical, mechanical, hands-on person
• Up to 2 years' experience in Networking
• Strong knowledge of networking and security protocols
• Experience working with Palo Alto Firewalls and Dell/Aruba networking a plus but not necessary
• Experience with Routing Protocols (OSPF, BGP)
• Networking Automation and monitoring
• Technical Linux and Windows or PC hardware background a plus
• Experience operating in a R&D and Manufacturing environment a plus
• A valid driver’s license and clean driving record, a reliable vehicle is a must.
• Travel as required.
• Ability to obtain a valid Passport if required
• Able to work with equipment, which may involve climbing a ladder to run cables, lifting computers, crouching to assemble equipment, etc.
• Lift up to 50 lbs.

The Financial Analyst is a key member of the Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) team and responsible for financial analysis, budgeting, forecasting and management reporting. The Financial Analyst is a key business partner to multiple cross-functional stakeholders and provides financial support and analysis to help the company drive better business decisions.

Who you report to: Director, Financial Planning, M&A & Analysis

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Provide financial guidance and action to help drive and improve the forecast and budgeting processes.
• Enter/update financial data in our financial planning & budgeting software (Adaptive).
• Serve as Finance Business Partner to the R&D and Administration groups.
• Develop positive working relationships with key stakeholders in R&D and Administration.
• Finance lead on government assistance reporting (claims, status reports, etc.).
• Perform monthly headcount reconciliation and maintain New Hire data in Adaptive (new job reqs).
• Complete monthly upload of headcount and financial results in Adaptive and reconcile to the company’s ERP system.
• Prepare P&L reports for R&D and Administration teams.
• Assist/support manager with the company’s corporate insurance program.
• Participate in process improvement initiatives, ensuring process changes are properly implemented, documented and communicated.
• Complete and submit all government financial surveys.
• Perform backup duties for the FP&A team.
• Ad hoc analysis and reports, as required per business needs.
Who you are:
• University degree in Business/Accounting or Commerce.
• CA designation is an asset.
• Working experience with Workday Adaptive is an asset.
• Minimum 3+ years of industry experience.
• Ability to work collaboratively with all levels of the organization.
• Effective communication and presentation skills.
• Advanced skill level with Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUP’s, etc.)
• Possess a strong level of critical and logical thinking, analysis and reasoning to identify underlying principles, trends, issues, etc.

job_title: Product Specialist, Camera Motion Systems (Job Req #2023-259)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Product Specialist, Camera Motion Systems (CMS) works to assist in the development of Ross Video’s market position for our Camera Motion Systems product lines, which includes the following product lines (hereinafter referred to as the “Products”):
Robotics (CamBot, Furio, X-series, SmartShell, Vision[Ai]ry)
Cameras (AcidCam, PTZ)
This person works with the Camera Motion Systems Product Manager (PM) and Business Development Managers (BDMs), in harmony with the Ross sales teams, marketing staff, and other managers to increase sales opportunities and thereby maximize revenue for the organization. Experience with video production technologies and applications is required, while an understanding of video cameras, camera supports in general, or robotic camera systems in particular, would be welcome assets.

Who you report to: Product Manager, Camera Motion Systems

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• The primary role of the Product Specialist is to provide technical support to the BDMs, and assist them in supporting the global sales team as they strive to maintain and grow the CMS business. This includes:
• developing bid responses/bid specs,
• providing competitive analysis,
• reviewing quotes and sales orders for consistency and completeness,
• managing, maintaining and supporting “DIWs”,
• providing product demos
• occasionally filling in for the BDMs when they are not available for customer calls, presentations or demos.
• To develop and maintain a deep understanding of the product portfolio, the Product Specialist will assist the Product Manager in managing:
• sustaining activities,
• release rollouts,
• product recalls or advisories,
• and end-of-life processes.
• The product specialist will also be called upon to provide product training to new hires, and other internal customers, and help organize commissioner summits and training.
• In addition, the Product Specialist will take ownership of all OEM and distribution partnerships, including
• evaluating potential OEM or distribution products,
• negotiating partnership agreements,
• managing communications between the partner and Ross development teams where necessary,
• providing sales forecasts to the partner and Ross supply chain.
• Finally, the Product Specialist will assist in the development of marketing materials to support business development and sales activities, in conjunction with other members of the CMS product marketing team and the corporate marketing team. This will include, but is not limited to, customer-facing materials such as: cutsheets, brochures, application notes, video scripts, white papers, training documents (internal and external), and webtext.

Who you are:
• Experience developing, operating, selling or marketing video production equipment in a live broadcast environment is required
• Direct experience operating, selling or marketing robotic camera systems or related equipment would be a valuable asset.
• Ability to learn and demonstrate Ross Robotics and Camera products and ancillary equipment
• General knowledge of all Ross Video Products would be an asset
• The ability to converse in a second language would be considered an asset
• Excellent communication skills
• Excellent presentation skills
• Proficiency with Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint
• Energetic self-starter
• Self-reliant
• Self Motivated
• Passionate about Ross Video & our products
• Positive and determined
• High Tolerance of Ambiguity
• Attention to Detail
• Team Oriented
• Problem Solver
• Organized
• Lateral and strategic thinker
• Follow company policies, procedures and the Ross Code of Ethics
• Perform other related duties as required
• Willing to Travel up to 25% of the time
• Valid Passport
• Valid Driver’s License
• Travel required
#LI-LH1

The Solution Architect role will support the EMEA Sales team in its initiative to increase sales of Ross Video technology in dynamic and innovative applications. This key role in the Ross Sales organization requires a unique blend of engineering / solutions solving skills along with the “soft skills” required in a sales process. This is a diverse role that requires close collaboration with the company’s Sales, Marketing, Research and Development, and Technical Support teams to ensure proposed deals include technical solutions that accurately address our customers’ needs. This unique position will include, but is not limited to, the following duties:

Who you report to: Technical Solutions Manager, EMEA

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Participates and contributes to sales opportunities driven by the Regional Sales Managers, prioritizing efforts based on maximizing total impact on the team’s productivity.
• Scopes technical solutions to address customer requirements, assesses customers met and unmet needs and recommends solutions that optimize value for both the customer and Ross Video.
• Coordinates closely with Ross’ Sales team and business partners to align solutions designed to meet our customers’ business requirements.
• Proactively educates and provides professional development to team and business partners in order to enhance their product knowledge, technical acumen, and technical sales skills.
• Generates localized sales tools on various mediums for internal and external distribution (PowerPoint’s, Application Notes, Competitive Guides, etc.).
• Engages in customer facing product presentations, demos, training, and workflow guidance to end-users and business partners at customer premise or tradeshows.
• Opportunistically pursues additional business development opportunities and collaborates with Sales to ensure these are effectively covered and advanced.
• Ideally based in France, focused on the French speaking markets, this role would also offer support elsewhere in the EMEA territory as required.
• Works on systems oriented and highly technical projects.
• Creates drawings that capture the spirit of specific opportunities, while also creating general variations for use by other groups at Ross.
• Helps to prepare world-class customer facing proposal supplements.
• Manages proposals for large RFPs.
• Participates in developing and implementing product awareness collateral / presentations.
• Provides client feedback to Marketing Product Manager(s) on product & application requirements.
• Performs other related duties as required.

Who you are:
• Minimum 5 years of combined sales, sales engineering, presales experience.
• Record of achievement and technical solution expertise in a comparable sales role.
• Understanding of the Broadcast / Media Technology Market (Live Production experience an asset).
• Poses strong knowledge of industry standard protocols, connectors, and terminations.
• Advanced skill set in using in Visio or OmniGraffle as well as AutoCad Architect.
• Preferred experience in scheduling software MS Project or Merlin (OSX).
• Excellent Communication & Presentation Skills.
• Must be proficient in both Desktop and Server Networking.
• Able to work co-operatively with and across all company departments.
• Strong presentation skills.
• Strong knowledge of Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
• Possesses strong and creative problem-solving traits.
• Existing knowledge and use of Ross Video products (preferred).
• Experience working with CRM’s.
• Native French speaker or bilingual.
• Positive, Determined, Problem Solver
• Deadline driven.
• Strong organization and communication skills
• Ability to schedule duties/projects (multi-task)
• Ability to work well independently.
• Attention to detail and a strong work ethic.
• Desire to contribute to a team environment.
• Ability to handle stressful situations.
• Willing to Travel up to 60% of the time.
• Must live within 75 miles of major airport.
• Valid Passport
• Valid Driver’s License
• Travel to tradeshows as required.
• Attend Sales Meetings, as required.
#LI-LH1

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

We have an exciting and influential opportunity with the Production Switcher engineering team to help build the world’s most powerful video switchers. Reporting to the engineering director, the POM assists the Marketing Product Managers and Technical Product Managers to help manage and drive each project from concept, through successful release to manufacturing, and market launch.
The POM is responsible for managing project timeline and agreed feature set. In addition to the work in Engineering, they will liaise with Manufacturing and Manufacturing Test Engineering at our Iroquois factory, as well as with Tech Support to enable smooth product sales & order process, build of required hardware/software products, and support of the product lifecycle.

Who you report to: Director, Technical Product Manager – Production Switchers, Video Servers and Audio

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Accountable to the Director to provide the staffing resources to execute on the agreed project deliverables and an agreed schedule.
• Responsible for reporting on status of projects that are part of a government grant or other funding programs.
Project Planning:
• Follows, advocates and helps implement the corporate NPI process
• Assists in identifying the resource and material costs/requirements for the project
• Works with the project team to identify and mitigate risks - developing and documenting a risk mitigation plan
• Assists the TPMs in developing the project schedules (identifies critical paths). The POM owns the responsibility for creation and maintenance of project schedules.
• Responsible for entry and maintenance of all product information and data in SalesForce, Oracle Agile, Max and other tools, as needed.
Project Execution:
• Maintains and tracks the project schedules
• Assists the TPM, where required, in the coordination of project team development activities and for the effective follow-up - facilitating communication between individuals and teams.
• Generates project meeting minutes (including action item identification, assignment and follow-up) as per the requests of the TPM.
• Tracks all development, product verification, engineering services and manufacturing activities and identifies any potential project issues and challenges, including resource exposures or conflicts.
• Ensures that project status reports are generated on time as required.
• Works with TPMs, MPMs, Manufacturing (including Scheduling, Test, and Procurement) in developing product BOMs for each level of all new products
• Responsible for ensuring the timely delivery of required input to the Technical Documentation team
• Responsible for providing communication on project status throughout the organization
• Ensures that project status reports are generated on time as required
Release:
• Works with the MPM’s and Director to define a product deployment plan
• Works with the MPM and TPM to coordinate and ensure training is provided for Technical Support, Commissioning, Sales Engineer, and Training team
• Owns and manages the Product release checklist and is responsible for ensuring that all disciplines (manufacturing, Marketing, Developments, etc) follow through with and complete tasks required for a successful release
Product Lifecycle Management:
• Works with the Technical Support and Development teams, via an escalation process, to ensure customer satisfaction by managing and tracking any product deployment issues - providing prompt and appropriate customer communications.
• Tracks all field service issues and report on them internally as well as any required customer communications
• Where necessary, consults with the Field Service Team, TPM and MPM’s to determine any necessary actions required to resolve customer issues and/or dissatisfactions
• Responsible for maintenance (ECO, MCO, EOL, etc) of all manufacturing data for all released products
• Responsible for monitoring and maintaining manufactured product costing and reporting any appreciable changes to TPM and MPM
• Responsible for communication throughout the organization for all product updates and new code releases
Operation:
• Works with the MPM and TPM to help develop and record the Strategic Product Line Roadmap
• Provides support to entire product team on required purchases of materials, test equipment, and facility requirements
Who you are:
• Post-secondary education, engineering degree is an asset.
• PMI Certification is an asset
• Strong logistics and planning background.
• Familiarity with the product development process and the associated requirements of manufacturing.
• Familiarity with software planning and development.
• Strong knowledge of PM tools.
• Experience working with vendors, sheet metal shops, 3rd party manufacturers is an asset
• Valid Driver’s License and access to a vehicle for occasional travel to Iroquois location, approximately 2-3 times per month as needed
#LI-KF1

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The successful candidate will work closely with the development team; planning, designing, and executing manual and automated tests for robotic camera systems in the Ross Robotics product line. The candidate will also be responsible for implementing test lab best practices. The position will primarily be focused on the testing of mechanical and electrical products but will also cover software and cross-discipline projects. This position is located at our Ottawa Research & Development facility.

Who you report to: Product Operations Manager

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Test Planning: Under the supervision of the Product Operations Manager
• Assist the Product Operations Manager in determining work priorities, assigning tasks, creating schedules and monitoring progress
• Support Agile development methodologies including the Modified Agile for Hardware Development (MAHD) Framework
• Attend Product Requirements review and participate in technical debates
• Participates in analysis and design walkthroughs
• Providing input to the design team to ensure that testing considerations are incorporated in the design (design for testability)
• Provide manager with detailed test estimates for project planning purposes
• Translate the detailed requirements to a comprehensive test plan
• Modify existing test plans and testing information to correct errors, to adapt to new use case scenarios, upgraded interfaces and performance enhancements
• Participate in detail reviews of test plans
• Manage test plans and test cases in Jira
Test Execution: Under the supervision of the Product Operations Manager
• Accountable for the quality of work delivered for the specific project
• Effective test case execution with real time status updates of the results using Jira
• Analyze and troubleshoot test case failures resulting in an action plan
• Provide accurate and detailed bug reporting throughout the testing process
• Assist product development in the investigation/reproducibly of product issues
• Be aware of and provide input to the automation effort
• Maintain test cases throughout the product development cycle
• Participate, when required, with the multi-functional team in bug triages
• Provide regular status report updates to the management team
Robotics: Under the supervision of the Product Operations Manager and Technical Product Manager
• Provide test support for new robotics products
• Provide test support for robotics sustainment and customer issues
• Perform structural and performance testing on robotics design
• Work with manufacturing and manufacturing test teams to ensure that testing is consistent across teams
Lab prime: Under the supervision of the Product Operations Manager
• In depth understanding of lab best practices
• Participate in CMS lab User Group
• Implement and enforce lab and workplace safety practices
• Maintain lab assets, tools, and equipment
• Manage the use and sharing of physical lab assets
• Develop and build test environments
Other duties: Under the supervision of the Product Operations Manager
• Act as an occasional trainer for existing and new PV employees
• Assist the customer support team with customer quality issues.
• Participate in postmortems reviews, what worked, what didn’t, what can we do better
• Provide suggestions/plans for ongoing improvements and overall efficiencies to the Ottawa Lab
• Provide feedback to the Product Operations Manager on the team’s performance and recommend ways to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
• Follow company policies and procedures
• Perform other related duties as required
#LI-KF1

The Senior FPGA Developer role will utilize the latest FPGA and SoC devices to develop leading edge platforms that power live video production. As a designer within the Hyperconverged team, you will further advance the Ross industry leading Ultrix product family. Successful candidates will have serious technical chops to pair with a find a way attitude in order to harness the full power of themselves and their teammates in solving unique and challenging technical problems in a supportive, high-energy and dynamic work environment.

Who you report to: Director, Hyperconverged Solutions - Platforms

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we've got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Promote, refine and develop innovative features that you are passionate about in the most integrated hardware platform in the broadcast industry.
• Implement complex RTL algorithms for the processing of audio and video
• Implement video transport protocols in FPGA designs including SDI, 2110, HDMI, NDI, and other streaming formats
• Target the latest FPGA families including Stratix-10 and Ultriscale+ using Quartus and Vivado
• Develop high-level design requirements and support aggressive project scheduling
• Generate both specification & design documentation to support cross functional team
• Develop test features that can be utilized by manufacturing test, product verification and in the field
• Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of FPGA & HW designs
• Efficient and systematic debugging skills.
• Assist in supporting other staff members as necessary through entire NPI process flow – including design, documentation, test, presales and customer service

Who you are:
• Passionate team-player looking to expand their skillset and contribute in a fast-paced environmentPossess keen observational skills and problem-solving intuition
• Self-starter with the tenacity to bring product to market
• Comfortable moving forward aggressively while balancing risks appropriately to optimize success across all business & technical aspects of the product
• FPGA designer with knowledge and experience across broad range of topics including:
• FPGA building blocks & system architectures
• High speed transceivers, clock domain analysis, & timing closure
• You are an expert in RTL design for complex IP targeting large Xilinx or Altera FPGA SOC.
• Expertise in current Xilinx & Intel devices and associated design and debugging tools
• Knowledge of high-speed serial interfaces using gigabit transceivers, DDR3/4 interfaces, HBM, and PLL's
• Excellent debugging skills & proficient with typical lab equipment (scopes, JBERTs, network analyzers, WFMs, etc)
• Ability to work in an embedded environment. Linux, bash, C/C++ and networking skills a plus

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Experience designing video processing algorithms such as filters. video codecs (H264, H265, MPEG2), color space conversion, scaling, etc.
• Knowledge of broadcast studio applications & workflows; especially distribution / production systems a plus
• Understanding of digital video and associated audio standards a plus
• Familiar with video broadcast standards such as SDI, AES, Timecode, Madi, Tri-level syncs.
• Familiar with high-speed serial interfaces such as SDI, 100 GigE, Ethernet, PCIe
#LI-KS1

job_title: Product Verification and Automation Specialist (Job Req #2023-253)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

As the successful candidate you will become an expert in Ross KVM IP Matrix and Broadcast video/audio products. This expertise is gained through detailed direct testing of products as part of the team that develops and owns the product family. You own our product test strategy and vision. You decide the best way to test, how deep to test and how to involve the product team in the testing and automation. You practice continuous improvement using team and customer feedback. You lead the team to improve test coverage and test efficiency through automation and contribute to debugging of complex software and hardware issues.

Who you report to: Embedded DevOps Lead and Manager, Product Verification

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• A test strategy and testplan is captured and reviewed for each product release
• You propose equipment and lab setup along with automated and manual test partitioning
• development teams results in test tools and hooks to speed up product delivery and increase quality
• You are a key contributor to reproducing and debugging complex issues
• Everyone knows the status of testing, what is passing, failing, untested, being tested now, next in line for testing
• Everyone in the team feels involved in test design and execution and has related sprint tasks
• Issues slowing down testing are communicated and resolved with the team
• Bugs are regularly reviewed and triaged
• Risk calls on testing (or not testing) are continuously suggested and discussed
• Requests are made for documentation and explanations to understand the product functionality and use cases
• Feedback and suggestions are solicited, listened to and incorporated at your discretion
• Regular discussions are held other quality owners to collaborate on testing strategies, tools and to promote common practices across teams
• Informal team discussions and formal presentations are held to share your knowledge
• Time is managed so that commitments are met in a sustainable manner without burn out; Your manager, the delivery manager and sprint planning sessions are leveraged to actively sustain a work life balance.
• Career development is discussed in 1:1s with your manager, you provide feedback on what you’re enjoying, not enjoying, and what you want to try next

Who you are:
• Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering or related field
• A minimum of 3 years’ experience in a software development or test automation role
• 5+ years of experience in testing hardware or software systems
• Experience in developing and maintaining test automation scripts
• Experience with automation tools (Python, TCL, BASH, etc.)
• Knowledge of computer networking (TCP/IP, UDP, HTTP, etc.)
• Knowledge in using and configuring IP switches
• Knowledge of operating systems (Linux and Windows platforms)
• Experience with bug tracking tools (Jira, Bugzillla)
• Experience with test cycle management tools
• Experience with development management tools such as source control and code review
• Strong debugging skills and experience in root cause analysis
• Familiarity with software development processes and methodologies such as Agile, Scrum, and Kanban
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail
• Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment
• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
