job_description:
INTERNAL OPPORTUNITIES AT ROSS VIDEOThinking about what’s next for your career? At Ross Video we are committed to your professional growth and to providing opportunities to develop your career. Our internal talent mobility program is intended to facilitate effective hiring from within, as appropriate, to fill open opportunities in the company.

Working with the corporate Information Technology team located in Iroquois, the IT Leasing & Maintenance Coordinator will be responsible for coordinating the end of lease process, asset retrieval activities, reporting on IT leased asset inventory, and the renewal of hardware maintenance contracts. You will be part of a core team that directly contributes to Ross Video’s success!

Who you report to: Manager, IT Help Desk

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Facilitates the procurement of equipment and ensures leased asset tracking is accurate in IT asset management system.
• Maintains processes for leased asset management lifecycle.
• Ensure required leasing documentation is obtained and processed in a timely manner.
• Coordinates the deployment, return, buyout, or disposal of leased assets.
• Tracks and recovers equipment from Ross Video staff, contractors, and freelancers.
• Renews and tracks hardware maintenance on all IT related hardware.
• Conducts quarterly audits to ensure accuracy of asset data and reporting.
• Tracks and ships hardware to remote sites and users as requested.
• Adheres to licensing processes to support corporate license compliance.

Who you are:
• General knowledge of PC and Apple hardware and associated peripherals
• Working knowledge of asset management/software license tools such as Quest KACE
• Previous experience managing leased equipment contracts is considered an asset.
• Organized, thorough, and very detail orientated.
• Excellent interpersonal, communication and follow-up skills.
• Ability to adapt and accelerate in a fast-paced environment.
• Team-oriented but able to work independently.
• Valid driver’s license and clean driving record
• Travel between Ottawa and Iroquois when required
#LI-TEL1

Background Screening
Please note, certain positions at Ross Video are subject to background screening. If you are the successful candidate, you may be required to undergo a background check that may include employment verification, criminal records check, drug testing, credit checks, and motor vehicle records check for applicable roles.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

What the job is all about:
• The primary focus of this role is to provide crucial support to shop floor personnel on surface mount, through hole and mechanical issues
• Supporting shop floor equipment including screen printers, pick and place, reflow ovens, AOI, wave solder and mechanical assembly tools
• You will have the ability to execute root cause research to resolve supplier and manufacturing quality issues and be responsible to maintain and update manufacturing work instructions and procedures along with care of and the calibration, maintenance of manufacturing equipment
• This role supports all schedules and may require dedicated night shifts. As a dedicated team player, you will assist in the development and implementation of training, and of project plans
• This is a role for a team player, as you will collaborate with cross functional teams to provide advice that will expedite the adoption of techniques and processes that support lean manufacturing and elimination of waste
• Making decisions that support business and continuous improvement opportunities within an industrial engineering environment, always with safety in mind

Who you are:
• You possess a post-secondary education or equivalent work experience in electronics manufacturing and design processes and procedures
• (Minimum 5 years) with comprehensive knowledge of IPC standards for electronics manufacturing
• A demonstrated knowledge of SMT processes and equipment is preferred
• This role requires an ability to manage several complex tasks at a time, working individually or in a team
• Your ability to work with technical and non-technical team members is key to the role
• Your organisational abilities are persistent, and you show attention to detail and accuracy, with solid verbal and written communications skills, in English
• Experienced in continual process/systematic improvement projects while participating as a team member

Bonus points if you have the following:
• An advanced skill level with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook and excellent leadership, planning, negotiation and interpersonal skills
• Creative problem solver that can anticipate, identify, solve and prevent
• Ability to work well with technical and non-technical staff

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Working with the Marketing Product Manager and the Technical Product Manager, the POM helps manage and drive each project from concept through to a successful release to manufacturing and product launch to market.
The POM is responsible for managing project timelines and agreed feature set. She or he will liaise with Manufacturing, Manufacturing Test Engineering, and Tech Support to enable smooth product sales & order process, build of required hardware/software products, and own product lifecycle support.

Who you report to: Director, Technical Product Manager, LED

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Responsible and accountable for management of direct reports.
• Accountable to the TPM to provide the staffing resources to execute on the agreed project deliverables and an agreed schedule.
• Responsible for reporting on status of projects that are part of a government grant or other funding programs.
• Project Planning:
• Follows, advocates, and helps implement the corporate NPI process.
• Assists in identifying the resource and material costs/requirements for projects.
• Works with the development team to identify and mitigate risks - developing and documenting a risk mitigation plan.
• Assists the TPM in developing the project schedules (identifies critical paths). Ownership of project schedules; both creation and maintenance.
• Responsible for entry and maintenance of all product information and data in SalesForce, Agile/Jobscope, and Max.
• Project Execution:
• Maintains and tracks the project schedules.
• Assists the TPM, where required, in the coordination of project team development activities and for the effective follow-up - facilitating communication between individuals and teams.
• Generates project meeting minutes (including action item identification, assignment and follow-up) as per the requests of the TPM.
• Tracks all development, product verification, engineering services and manufacturing activities and identifies any potential project issues and challenges, including resource exposures or conflicts.
• Ensures that project status reports are generated on time as required.
• Works with the TPM, MPM, Manufacturing (including Scheduling, Test, and Procurement) in developing product BOMs for each level of all new products.
• Responsible for ensuring the timely delivery of required input to the Technical Documentation team.
• Responsible for providing communication on project status throughout the organization.
• Ensures that project status reports are generated on time as required.
• Release:
• Works with the TPM and MPM to define a product deployment plan.
• Works with the TPM and MPM to coordinate and ensure training is provided for Technical Support, Commissioning, Sales Engineer, and Training team.
• Owns and manages the Product release checklist and is responsible for ensuring that all disciplines (manufacturing, Marketing, Developments, etc) follow through with and complete tasks required for a successful release.
• Product Lifecycle Management:
• Works with the Technical Support and Development teams, via an escalation process, to ensure customer satisfaction by managing and tracking any product deployment issues - providing prompt and appropriate customer communications.
• Tracks all field service issues and report on them internally as well as any required customer communications.
• Where necessary, consults with the Field Service Team, TPM and MPM’s to determine any necessary actions required to resolve customer issues and/or dissatisfactions.
• Responsible for maintenance (ECO, MCO, EOL, etc) of all manufacturing data for all released products.
• Responsible for monitoring and maintaining manufactured product costing and reporting any appreciable changes to TPM and MPM.
• Responsible for communication throughout the organization for all product updates and new code releases.
• Operation:
• Works with the MPM and TPM to help develop and record the Strategic Product Line Roadmap.
• Provides support to entire product team on required purchases of materials, test equipment, and facility requirements.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education, engineering degree is a strong asset.
• Familiarity with the product development process and the associated requirements of manufacturing.
• Strong logistics and planning background.
• Management experience working with remote development teams is an asset.
• Familiarity with software planning and development.
• Strong knowledge of PM tools.
• Experience working with vendors, subcontractors, and 3rd party manufacturers is an asset.
• PMI Certification is an asset.
• International travel (up to 10%)

#LI-KS1

As an SMT Operator, you will operate various machines to run the SMT Line. The role requires technical knowledge of printed circuit boards and surface mount technology.

Who you report to: Manager, SMT

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Set up and operation of screen printers and SPI
• Monitor SPI for tolerance adherence and understand troubleshooting methods to keep in line with paste quality
• Manage changeover process to ensure efficiency in production time
• Setup each SMT machine to ensure parts are loaded properly, conveyors are aligned, and oven recipes are accurate
• Obtain parts from inventory and verifying loaded components from the setup department are accurate
• Understand the basic hardware mechanics of the SMT equipment
• Learn all production screens and tabs of the pick and place software to ensure how to navigate the machine operation
• Understand basic troubleshooting skills with regards to component placement accuracy, board loading/unloading and fiducial data
• Work closely with AOI operator to ensure quality is maintained according to IPC 610 standards. This feedback is in response to correcting defects that may occur while operating the pick and place machines and/or screen printer
• Works closely with SMT Support team to ensure quality and to maintain production flow on the lines by reducing troubleshooting downtime
• Run the AOI machine to monitor quality coming down the lines
• Maintain and rely on IPC-610x training to ensure the correct defect calls are made and to know when to elevate problems to support staff
• Fully understand MES with regards to routing and reading MWI’s. Review of production documentation and verifying BOM revisions match the pick and place programs
• Clean stencils and returning them to the proper storage location during the build process
• Maintain ESD practices
• Adhere to MSDS procedures (PROC025A)
• Area maintenance and general tidiness and organization of materials

Who you are:
• Have a high school diploma
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• Strong aptitude for learning
• Able to lift and bend

Bonus points if you have the following:

• Previous experience with machine operation
#LI-AS2

The Systems Administrator, IT Applications will assist in managing core operational needs for Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions in use by Ross Video. Reporting to the Manager of IT Applications, you will work closely with others on the IT Application team, IT Corporate Security, and our IT Asset manager ensuring we meet the operational requirements for data security and compliance. You will also flex your analytical skills and help us find ways to make improvements.

Who you report to: Manager, IT Applications

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Co-manage or completely manage day to day operations for the various Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions in use by Ross Video teams, with an eye to ensuring all aspects of security and compliance are adhered to
• Work with the IT Asset manager as required for licensing compliance
• Manages IT projects of small to large scale, including new solution rollouts, maintenance, and upgrades
• Conducts SaaS solution capacity forecasts and health assessments
• Creates, maintains, and validates appropriate disaster recovery plans with the larger IT team
• Optimize resource allocation by proposing improvements
• Monitor system logs to ensure health, uptime, and quality of service
• Perform relevant system & application patching and upgrades as they pertain to the SaaS solutions in use by Ross Video
• Maintain documentation regarding configurations, operations and troubleshooting procedures related to SaaS platforms
• Participate in the definition of standards, guidelines, best practices, and metrics as directed
• Assist in evaluating new requirements, technical design, and standards
• Troubleshoot assigned IT Help Desk tickets and assist team members when required
• Provide afterhours support on an as needed basis to support core company operations

Who you are:
• Bachelor of Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent training and experience in the IT field
• Proven administration skills for SaaS solutions, including integrating SaaS solutions with Azure AD for Single Sign On.
• Minimum 4-6 years IT Administration of SaaS solutions experience
• Solid understanding of virtualization and networking as they pertain to SaaS solutions an asset.
• SaaS solution integration with on premise solutions, monitoring, and troubleshooting
• Strong knowledge of Linux and Windows Operating Systems
• Approachable and possess excellent communication skills
• Team player but able to work independently
• Able to envision the entire project and look for problem areas
• Organized, thorough, and very detail orientated
• High initiative and well-developed analytical skills
• Technical, hands-on person

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Familiarity with AWS, Azure cloud platforms (an asset)
• Knowledge of monitoring and measurement systems (PRTG, Grafana, OpenManage) a plus
• Experience in a product development environment is an asset

The PCBA Technical Primes collaborate on the introduction of new and changing technologies within manufacturing, owning the DFM (Design for Manufacturing) and DFA (Design for Assembly) for all printed circuit boards and assemblies. The technical primes provide oversight with the initial builds at SMT and PCBA assembly, taking ownership of any necessary corrective actions.
This role is technical and requires a solid understanding of PCB and PCBA design standards. You will be guiding, motivating, mentoring, and leading a small group of PCBA manufacturing experts and working alongside experts in R&D. This role is based in our manufacturing facility Iroquois, On.

Who you report to: Manager, Test Development

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Leading the DFM and DFA analysis process on new and changing PCBA designs
• Organizing and prioritizing daily progress on NPI PCBA projects
• Motivate and coach team members to cohesively meet set goals and implement improvements
• Review manufacturing and R&D documentation for accuracy (PCBA design files, schematics, BOMs, assembly drawings, work instructions)
• Assign, schedule, and report on the team’s ongoing tasks and projects
• Take ownership and assist with the first time builds of new PCBA’s at SMT and PCBA assembly
• Build relationships and engage with the various R&D and manufacturing teams to provide DFM feedback and discuss design and process optimization
• Work in concert with the NPI Co-Ordinator’s, Product Engineers, and Test Developers with implementation plans and other ongoing NPI activities
• Monitor the product roadmap and discuss long-term implications with the manufacturing process, test, and support teams
• Help continually improve our NPI processes for long term sustainability, efficiency, and effectiveness
• Transfer knowledge into and assist the Manufacturing Support Team
• Follow all of the Ross compliance policies

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education or equivalent work experience in a manufacturing or manufacturing interfacing environment.
• Experience performing DFM analysis and creating detailed DFM reports in the field of PCB’s and Assemblies
• Advanced skill level with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook) and Microsoft Project.
• Lean manufacturing education/experience a solid asset.
• Experience with Valor DFM software a solid asset.
• Education/experience using CAD modeling tools (AutoCAD, Inventor, etc.) a solid asset.
• Experience with MES, PLM, and ERP systems an asset.
• Minimum 5 years of experience in an electronics-manufacturing environment that included exposure to PCBA manufacturing processes and procedures.
• Minimum 2 – 3 years’ experience as a team leader or in a position of management

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Ability to work well with technical and non-technical staff
• Well-organized, persistent, attentive to details and accuracy
• Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills
• Ability to make choices based on the company’s best interests
• Creative problem solver that can anticipate, identify, solve, prevent.

Reporting to and working closely with the Business Manager/ Project Manager of Creative Services, the coordinator is responsible for following through on given scope of work for projects, proposal writing and submission in conjunction with sales, sales operations, and business development. Upon adoption, the coordinator will be responsible for logistical project management including delegating assignments, scheduling of resources, and completion notification. Groups that you will interface with will include sports and live events, virtual set production team and dashboard and custom development teams.

Who you report to: Business Manager, Creative Services

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Project Scheduling
Working with the Creative Services Projects Manager (CSPM), the coordinator will be responsible for departmental resource ascertainment, assignments, and scheduling of resources using available scheduling systems. Planning and maintenance of the production calendar will be a key function of the position. They will also make scheduling improvement recommendations to the Business Manager.
Project Maintenance
Using the departmental Project Management System (Basecamp), the coordinator will initiate projects, manage the project queue making changes and updates to the project as they evolve. The coordinator will have regular interaction with the CSPM and assignees to determine and report on progress and bottlenecks. They will assist the CSPM to liaise with clients and Ross Project Managers (PM), keeping them up-to-date on project status.
Project Support
Creative Services uses a template to summarize completed projects. The template describes multiple creative and technical facets of each project. Working with the artists and PM’s, the coordinator will assist with completion of the project summary and associated project files. They will then liaise with Ross Technical Support and the client to ensure an understanding of project support, how to get help starting with technical support, and the trouble-ticket escalation process.
Project Completion
Determining the completion of a project is a key component of the job. The coordinator will work with PM, CSPM, the assignee, and the client to determine when a job is finished. Upon determination the coordinator will initiate the collection process with accounts receivable, ensuring they have all of the data they need to both invoice the client and ensure 3rd party are paid in a timely manner.
eCommerce
Ross Video has a growing eCommerce presence. Projects are initiated by Ross Creative Services, ARVS, and design partners. The coordinator will delegate and manage projects through the eCommerce process. Duties will include finalization of packages for effective marketing in our eCommerce space.

Who you are:
Post-secondary degree or trade school diploma
Knowledge of basic graphic design principles
Basic knowledge of broadcast or live event experience
Proficient with MS Office including Excel
basic knowledge of broadcast graphics workflows
Solid knowledge of broadcast production
Basic knowledge of IT workflows
Organized and very detail orientated
Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
Excellent communication skills
Strong interpersonal and observational skills
Enthusiastic
High tolerance of ambiguity
Team-oriented
Problem solver
Able to work co-operatively with Ross and end users
Basic XPression, Unreal engine and Dashboard knowledge desirable
Experience with SalesForce desirable
Project coordinatior experience
Technical support experience desirable
Broadcast production experience (studio, remote or live events) is desirable
Willing to travel on a project-by-project basis up to 10% of the time.
Valid passport
Valid driver’s license

This position will take place at the Ross Video Ottawa Office or a home-based office setting, if mutually agreed upon.

As the Principal Technical Lead, you are the technical leader for your product or products. You plan and oversee the development of solutions to allow our customers to achieve or exceed their business goals. In this technical role you are responsible and accountable for the implementation and quality of the products under your purview. You craft the architecture and design of your product to meet product goals in alignment with the practices and principals of our Senior Software Architects; you oversee the implementation to ensure architectural and code consistency; you ensure that best practices are being employed, all the while making certain that quality and security are primary considerations.
You coach, mentor, guide, and help nurture the development team (developers and testers) to realize its full potential and adopt our culture of technical excellence and continuous improvement.

Who you will report to: Director Technical Product Management

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Own the product development, from understanding the customers’ needs to supporting it in the field, and everything in between.
• Develop the best solutions for your customers.
• Interface with Tech Support to understand and resolve issues found in deployed software instances.
• Define vision and strategy for technical implementation of your products.
• Work with the Product Managers and Product Owners to understand customer requirements and ensure we are delivering the right things.
• Reduce the number of issues found by customers by promoting a preventative vs reactionary approach to development and testing.
• Create a culture of technical excellence within the team.
• Work with other teams to align on strategy, deliver solutions, tools, processes, and reuse where it makes sense.
• Work with the Product Owner to establish predictability in release dates and scope.
• Ensuring quality of releases, through proactive and preventative measures.
• Ensuring product meets corporate security standards.
• Ensuring team adherence to the DoD.
• Working with architects to ensure cross-product alignment.

We are currently looking for a Senior Financial Specialist to join the Ross Video Finance team to facilitate our transition to IFRS accounting standards and to help us build the framework for the reporting and disclosure requirements of a publicly traded company. This position will report to the Director, Corporate Financial Services and works with our third party consultants to execute the changes required in our accounting transactions and financial reporting processes to be compliant with IFRS standards. The position will participate in the journey of transitioning us from a privately held operation to a publicly traded company and oversee the development of financial reports and disclosure requirements. This position is primarily work from home with the ability to come into the Ottawa offices as required.

Who you report to: Director, Corporate Financial Operations

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Facilitate the transition to IFRS Accounting Standards, including assisting in the preparation of memorandums on complex accounting issues
• Work with third party consultants to assess and quantify the impact of the IFRS changes
• Become the subject matter expert on technical accounting for complex transactions
• Work with the ERP Implementation team to ensure that the accounting processes being developed are IFRS compliant and will generate the required IFRS reporting requirements
• Assist in the preparation of first time IFRS Statutory Financial Statements and Note Disclosures
• Once the reporting framework has been established, assume responsibility for generating accurate financial statements quarterly and annually, in accordance with IFRS accounting standards and internal policies and procedures
• Maintain monthly, quarterly and year-end working papers and spreadsheets to support financial reporting and analysis and preparation for external audits
Who you are:
• Bachelor’s degree in accounting or Finance
• CPA Designation
• Strong knowledge of IFRS and the disclosure requirements for a publicly traded company
• Minimum 3 years combined experience in accounting and finance
• Previous experience strongly desired in financial reporting, audit and controls testing
• Advanced Excel skills and excellent knowledge of MS Excel
• Solid knowledge of accounting functions
• Detail oriented and organized
• Proven ability to meet deadlines
• Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to interact with high credibility at all levels of the organization
• Must demonstrate flexibility, strong commitment to meeting deadlines, and solid decision-making skills
• Self-motivator with ability to work independently
#LI-TE1

We are seeking a talented software engineer to join the Carbonite switchers group at Ross Video – Carbonite group. Carbonite group is responsible for developing highly successful and acclaimed video Carbonite switchers and control surfaces, such as TouchDrive. In this role, your primary focus will be to address field support issues that are escalated to R&D. This will involve debugging, identifying, and fixing problems primarily based on field tickets and logs, with occasional customer-facing interactions. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work on industry-leading products and play a critical role in ensuring our customers receive exceptional solutions. If you are a skilled software engineer with a passion for problem-solving and a commitment to delivering high-quality solutions, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Who you report to: Technical Product Manager

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries, comprehensive health plans, and several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, the option to work from home or office, generous paid time off, a fitness/wellness allowance, an employee share ownership program, development support, and many fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we've got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Collaborate with the support team to triage and prioritize field tickets related to Carbonite products.
• Analyze and troubleshoot complex technical issues based on logs and other diagnostic information provided.
• Develop and implement software fixes for issues found in the field.
• Work with hardware engineers and software engineers to identify and resolve issues that may be related to software or hardware.
• Occasionally travel to various cities to address customer support issues.
• Architect solutions to satisfy customer requirements.
• Work with product management to understand customer requirements.
• Work with a product verification specialist to debug failing test cases.
• Participate in code reviews and design discussions to ensure high-quality, maintainable code.
• Stay up-to-date with the latest technologies and best practices in software engineering.
• Collaborate with other teams within Ross Video to ensure that software changes are properly integrated and tested.
• Perform other related duties as required

Who you are:
• Strong proficiency in C++ programming language, with at least 3 years of experience.
• Experience in debugging complex software issues using various tools and techniques.
• Experience with version control using SVN.
• Experience with software design patterns and principles of object-oriented programming.
• Familiarity with operating systems (Windows, Linux) and network protocols.
• Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze and diagnose complex technical issues.
• Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
• Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
• Passion for learning and staying up-to-date with the latest software development trends and technologies.
• Additional Skills and Qualifications
• Knowledge of television production.
• Knowledge of broadcast, audio, and video standards.
• Knowledge of Linux Open Source development tools.
• Familiarity with various Linux distributions, such as Yocto, Ubuntu, or even Buildroot.
• Familiarity with security standards and best practices.
• Knowledge of Linux scripting.
• Knowledge of HTML and JavaScript.
• Knowledge of GNU Make systems.

Ross Video is looking for a senior level Manufacturing Test Developer that will help manufacturing build, test, then deliver high performing equipment used in the broadcast industry. You will collaborate on the development of a scalable manufacturing test and data system, that performs thorough PCBA investigation, functional product testing, data collection, and report generation. The system supports dozens of product categories and needs to ensure every product shipped exceeds the users’ expectations.
You will work alongside experts in test development, hardware, and software design, in our manufacturing facility is in Iroquois, Ontario. Which is approximately a 30-minute drive from Kemptville, Cornwall and Brockville, or a 45-minute drive from southern Ottawa.

Who you report to: Manager, Test development

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Collaborate with the test development team and R&D to understand the current technology under test and establish the necessary test requirements and plans
• Lead large NPI and Test Development projects.
• Help to Mentor junior developers.
• Design, develop, and implement automated and semi-automated test solutions for the various levels of product assembly
• Support the manufacturing staff, leveraging your knowledge of the products and the test station implementations
• Create and maintain support documentation for use by the Test Team, Manufacturing, and R&D
• Find and advise on improvements within test coverage, test times, product support, test system scalability, and quality efficiencies
• Make updates to the existing test scripts and test procedures based on engineering change orders
• Competently interpret electrical schematics and PCBA design files
• Capable of operating and interfacing with a wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.).
• Possess the knowledge and/or ability to learn scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, Python, etc.
• Capable of independently designing and developing manufacturing test solutions
• Ability to learn an object-oriented language and basic database interfacing
• Ability to transfer knowledge to others and welcomes the ideas and inputs of their peers
• Occasional travel to suppliers, partners, and other Ross Video sites may be required
Who you are:
• Undergraduate degree related to electrical engineering, computer engineering, computer science or equivalent education plus experience.
• Multiple years of experience with electronic hardware, with a good understanding of electronic theory, specifically digital components such as CPU’s, FPGA, flash, etc.
• Ability to comprehend electrical schematics and PCBA design files
• Familiarity with a wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.).
• Knowledge and/or ability to learn scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, Python, etc.
• Knowledge of data acquisition concepts such as TCP/IP, RS232, USB, and CAN
• A self-starter and problem solver that is not afraid to take on new challenges and initiate improvements
• Ability to transfer knowledge to others and welcomes the ideas and inputs of their peers

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Understanding of JTAG and Boundary Scan concepts
• Knowledge / experience of electronics manufacture, Lean Manufacturing, 5S
• Ability to learn an object-oriented language and basic database interfacing

The successful candidate will be responsible for the design and development of mechanical structures in Autodesk Inventor and/or SolidWorks. You will be part of the multi-disciplinary team that develops cutting edge LED solutions for indoor, outdoor, broadcast, and performance setting. The Ross LED development team develops sophisticated hardware and software solutions from the ground up to enable immersive large-scale video and audio experiences controlled by market-leading software user interfaces. We bring video surfaces to life!

Who you report to: Director, Technical Product Manager, LED

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Design and develop mechanical structures for LED product line. Items could possibly range from modules, heatframes, rackmount boxes, panels, jigs, and other required parts.
• Work closely with hardware developers to design and develop mechanical circuit board outlines, mouting, and cooling solutions.
• You will take a project from concept, design, prototype and testing phases through to completion.
• Some industrial design work may be required.
• Work with manufacturing, plastic molders, metal vendors and machine shops to create prototypes with an eye to the ability to transfer the design to volume production.
• Accountable for accurate design documentation, either self-produced or via Drafting team.
• As required, point of contact for customer issues and working with Ross staff to find a solution to customer issues.
• Work with technical product manager with respect to requirements and engineering changes related to aspects of mechanical work.
• Publish to the project team (and others as required) weekly project status reports.
• Actively participate in supplier qualification, evaluation and selection for mechanical vendors.
• Evaluates design ideas based on factors such as appealing appearance, design-function relationships, serviceability, materials and methods engineering, application, budget, price, production costs, methods of production, market characteristics, and product specifications.
• Prepare accurate design documentation, and work with technical writing to support the development of user facing customer documentation.
• Participate in design reviews to ensure technical accuracy.
• Be familiar with Ross Video manufacturing practices, standards, and procedures.
• Follows internal procedures and Ross drafting conventions for all job functions.
• Advise and make recommendations to management on matters relating to quality assurance, in order to provide them with an improved basis for decision making and planning.
• Perform other related duties as required and do whatever is necessary to get the job done.

Who you are:
• Experience in the mechanical design cycle and knowledge of design principles
• Above average PC/Windows computer skills
• Familiar with use of Inventor Pro and AutoDesk Vault, SolidWorks, or other 3D CAD tools
• Degree in Mechanical Engineering or similar engineering program
• Creative, organized and very detail oriented
• Strong problem solving skills
• Strong oral and written communication skills
• Self-starter, quick learner and are able to work with minimum supervision in meeting schedules and project deadlines.
• Ability to multi-task.
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Work from the facility in Rancho Cardova

This position based in Rancho Cordova focuses on repair of D3 LED displays and providing a wide range of mechanical, electrical, electronics and control system on site technical support. Providing top-level system troubleshooting, electronics repair and testing. Assisting, interacting, and collaborating with systems technician, production, and project management team members to assure successful project completion. Check for common problems such as defective manufacturing or loose connections, refer to schematics and specifications to locate malfunction; electronics repair, and testing; document services performed; crimp connector terminals; assemble discrete wiring and harnesses, soldering components using hand and wave soldering techniques. Methodical approach to all intended tasks and approach to problem solving is necessary. Self-starter spirit with naturally strong rapport with customers and subcontractor trades will be highly valued.

Who you report to: Manager, LED Field Services

What the job is all about:
• Provide on-site and/or remote technical support including tasks such as system troubleshooting, electronics repair and testing.
• Install operating systems and video equipment for LED displays and performing commissioning procedures to ensure proper system functionality.
• Ability to manage and monitor all installed systems and infrastructure
• Competency in writing and maintaining custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower downtime due to required human intervention

• Assist Project Manager in physical installation, operator training and technical support of LED Display
• Coordination with various disciplined subcontractors as necessary during installation and supplemental maintenance visits
• Monitor and test performance of applications, foreseeing potential issues and identifying possible solutions
• Ability to work with developers to implement those fixes
• Excellence in communication as a liaison with vendors and other IT personnel to resolve issues
• Perform other duties as needed and directed by Field Service Manager.
Who you are:
• Strong soldering experience of small electrical components is required.
• Associates degree or higher in a technician, electrical engineering, computer technology or mechatronics-based field of study or 3+ years relevant experience in a related field.
• 2 years or greater of technician experience, preferably (but not required) within the electronics industry.
• Advanced computer hardware and networking knowledge.
• Proven ability to monitor systems successfully and efficiently
• Proven working experience in the above fields including installing, configuring, and troubleshooting UNIX /Linux based environments
• Experience with use of Multi-meter required, and fiber termination skills a plus.
• Experienced with reading and interpreting blueprints, construction drawings and schematics.
• Working knowledge and experience Microsoft Office tools, specifically Excel, Word, Project, and Visio.
• Valid driver's license and passport with ability to travel locally and worldwide on short notice via air or ground.
• Able to work from a ladder, at various heights, including on aerial platforms and carry tools/ladder/parts to and from work site.
• Required to bend, reach, lift and use hands, vision and hearing to perform essential on site and troubleshooting tasks.
• Must be able to take direction and work with minimal supervision and guidance in a fast paced and at times pressure packed environment.
• This is a fast-moving position with a high expectation to execute industry best service of top quality and the highest level of tech innovation using exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

As a Materials Analyst at Ross your role will be integral to the continued development of our end to end supply chain processes. Ross has rapidly evolving needs in the areas of supply chain sustainability and compliance, inventory forecasting, sales and operating plans and product lifecycle management. The successful candidate will be responsible for both the development and execution of processes related to these key business elements.

Who you report to: Vice President, SCM

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Purchasing and Planning relate to Supply Chain sustainability, Supply Chain risk management, and Supply Chain trade compliance. In conjunction with our stakeholders, ensure that Ross continues to evolve its approach in these areas to support overall corporate objectives
• Providing expertise and support to internal departments and external partners
• Generating and delivering reports from data analysis
• verifying the accuracy of reports and assisting in correcting any inaccuracies in the business data
• Offering suggestions and direction to help guide decision-makers, for E&O provisioning
• Explore and recommend appropriate 3rd party solutions, providing cost/benefit analysis.
• Identify long term supply gaps. Involve internal stakeholders in finding solutions, as necessary.
• E&O sales – Identify and pursue opportunities to dispose of E&O – Negotiate best possible return for same
• Create a robust model for regularly reporting on Supply Chain impact to cash flow, including but not limited to costed planning horizon models and projected ability to support revenue targets by product line.
• Participate (with Finance, Product Teams, and Sales) in creation of robust S&OP process.
• Familiarity with INFOR at a user level. being able to perform basic tasks and get information out of the system.
• Identify and make recommendations and create necessary reports and ad hoc reporting tools in the new ERP environment.

Who you are:
• University Degree or College Diploma in related discipline. Related accreditation is an asset.
• Minimum 5 years of experience in a manufacturing environment with MRP/ERP/WMS systems
• Considerable experience in analyzing and implementing strategic and long-term business planning activities including researching, developing, business performance reports.
• communication skills, both written and verbal
• Considerable experience in researching, identifying, and developing processes, business and technical requirements, documentation, design and system development
• Solid analytical skills and ability to use data to guide analytical outcomes
• Excellent Flexibility to work in a fast-paced environment and ability to prioritize tasks

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Minimum 7 years in a Business Analyst capacity or a related role
• Minimum 2 years of experience within capital markets and/or asset management
• Solid analytical, problem solving and negotiation and decision-making skills
• Creative thinker with the ability to generate new ideas and concepts
• Ability to multi-task effectively within a fast -paced and evolving work environment
• Collaborative team player with a positive disposition and willingness to contribute to common goals
• Employ a spirit of 'get it done together' sharing practices and ideas across functions
• Working knowledge of computers and programs such as MS Suite

Returned Materials (RMA) Technician
As part of the Returned Materials (RMA) team, you will evaluate, initiate the repair, and record results of customer return cases. The information discovered by this position plays a crucial role in enacting improvements at all levels of the organization. You are working directly with the varied Ross stakeholders, with the mindset that accurate data provides appropriate and targeted feedback which allows for optimum results.

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
Some of the things you will work on:
• Process RMAs using established processes and procedures while faithfully trying to reproduce the customer complaint.

• Identify issues to the root cause.
• Interact with Tech Support techs for additional customer feedback.
• Interact with R&D and Test Development regarding current PV regiment and test plans.
• Provide specific instructions using sanctioned tools for rework and upgrades.
• Due diligence in ensuring product identification at all levels are accurate and representative.
• Upon customer request, provide RMA feedback through an approved reporting mechanism.
• Assist RMA Coordinators in identifying incoming product.
Who you are:
• University degree or College diploma which complements the knowledge set required or equivalent experience.
• Passionate about technology and energized by the challenge of learning new things.
• Approachable and excellent communication skills (oral and written).
• High initiative and well developed analytical and troubleshooting skills
• Must be able to work with a team as well as independently.
• Excellent interpersonal and observational skills
• Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
• Self-starter, quick learner and are able to work with minimum supervision while meeting the department’s objectives.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• A valid drivers license and access to a vehicle for occasional travel to Ottawa
• Comprehension of Ross Video’s portfolio.

This position is based in Rancho Cordova, CA. focuses on customer materials being returned for repair and/or evaluation. This position is required to track all inbound and outbound customer RMA’s and keep record of on-going and completed work.

Who you report to: Director, Services

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Conduct all customer interactions pertaining to RMA’s.
• Organize on-time shipments of replacement and/or repaired customer products according to company service level guidelines.
• Identify, document, and communicate packaging damages and anomalies.
• Facilitate the quoting process on all repairs.
• Manage field product returns by correct assignment Return Material Authorization disposition from within CRM using appropriate databases.
• Set customer expectations and maintain customer relationship through RMA process, providing status and expectation setting.
• Work directly with Repair Depot team and logistics centers to set RMA workload priorities. This includes weighing multiple tangible and intangible variables to attain the best possible prioritization balance.
• Apply planning, scheduling and inventory management techniques to minimize backlog in support of a seamless customer experience.
• Document and maintain all current RMA processes, with constant attention to measurable and continuous improvement.
• Analyze and provide detailed trend reporting of product failures by teaming with our Customer Service & Support group.
• Other duties as required.

Who you are:
• Great attention to detail and very well organized.
• Excellent soft skills, written, verbal and communications skills.
• 3-5 years’ experience in customer service.
• Strong understanding of product structures and part number significance.
• Working knowledge and experience using Microsoft Office tools, specifically Excel, Word, Project and Visio.
• Required to bend, reach, lift and use hands, vision and hearing to perform essential on site and troubleshooting tasks.
• Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs.
• Able to work independently and be a self-starter, as well as team player in a knowledge sharing environment.
• Experience with an MRP system helpful.
• Prior RMA experience a plus.
• 2 years or greater of technician experience, preferably (but not required) within the electronics industry.

As a Content Manager at Ross Video, you will be responsible for developing the company’s brand and online presence through strategic and compelling digital content across various channels.

• Optimize all content for SEO in collaboration with the digital marketing team.
• Collaboration and alignment with internal and external stakeholders to ensure unified and consistent corporate messaging across the organization.

• Drive the editorial calendar across thought leadership, product announcements, and customers.
• Drive strategic SEO priorities of inbound marketing into our storytelling practice and incorporate learnings from analytics into content development.

• Exceptional writing output.
• Editing and creating content that is highly technical but still compelling.

• Able to work gracefully with senior executives, engineers, product teams, marketing, and business units, locally and internationally.
• Comfortable using a content management system and scheduling tools.
• Expert SEO knowledge.
• Ability to manage various stakeholder demands, and strategically prioritize aligned content deliverables that weave the Ross story together.

The Facilities Project Manager, working with the Corporate Facilities team located in Ottawa, will be responsible to manage the program of Capital projects undertaken across our leased facilities globally. • Working with Facilities Operations, will be responsible to document the project definition including scope, objectives and budget, as well as providing Subject Matter Expertise on technical feasibility
• Develop a detailed project plan to monitor and track progress keeping up to date throughout project cycle
• Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation including all financial approvals such as Budget submissions, Investment Proposals, PO requisition and tracking, change order approvals, as well as invoice payments and other approvals as required
• Manage changes to the project scope, project schedule and project costs using appropriate verification techniques and reporting all variances as required on regular basis
• Track project performance, specifically to analyze the successful completion of short and long-term goals against the Facilities Project Program determined during the Annual Budget approval process
• Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget and report on the causes for those projects not meeting project gating and/or milestones
• Work in a team environment to complete project tasks through coordination of internal resources and third parties/vendors (if required) for the flawless execution of projects
• Ensure resource availability and allocation internal to Ross
• Perform risk management to minimize project risks
• Report weekly on financial matrix as well as other key performance indicators
• Escalate all issues to management as needed
• Meet budgetary objectives set in the Project Program of Works and adjust project constraints based on financial analysis and prepare monthly reports for including accruals and forecast for project spending
• Develop spreadsheets, diagrams, and process maps to document work flows
• Use and continually develop leadership skills
• Perform other related duties as required.

Who you are:
• Project Manager accreditation required with College or university degree and/or equivalent work experience
• Min 5 years Project Management experience in construction/facilities fit up or relevant projects
• Ability to handle multiple concurrent demands while maintaining a professional attitude
• Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively collaborate with all levels of the organization, including Senior Management.
• Ability to respond quickly and accurately to all requests; strong trouble-shooting skills
• Attentive to detail and accuracy
• Strong-working knowledge of project management software as well as MS-Office package and general computer software
• Knowledge of Ross Video products and/or broadcast/television production an asset.
• May require travel to Ross Global offices as required for project leasing fit ups.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Solutions Specialists are responsible for ensuring and evangelizing the functional and technical excellence of all Ross products under the umbrella of Production Workflow. This includes, but is not limited to, OverDrive, Inception, Primestream and Streamline MAM, Media IO, softGear, DashBoard and Ross Platform Manager.

Solutions Specialists will work with Product Managers to accelerate sales enablement and assist where needed in sales opportunities. They will also work with Product Owners and the development teams to offer constant feedback and assistance with current market problems and how collectively we can help with practical solutions.

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
(Note: Each Solutions Specialist will have a core area of focus in a particular workflow, and will expand expertise from there)
• Network with our customers and collect feedback on Ross and competitor solutions.
• Gather market knowledge on the constantly evolving problems our customers face and feed that knowledge into product management and product marketing.
• Strategize with product management on how to best offer solutions for the greatest challenges our customers face.
• Become a Subject Matter Expert for a solution
• Work with customers to understand a Ross solution deployment and their requirements on the network.
• Advise customers on hardware and Virtual Machine requirements to ensure a solution that meets their requirements.
• Keeps current hardware requirements for all Ross Production Workflow solutions.
• Aid in testing of new hardware platforms for all Ross Production Workflow solutions.
• Assist Demo-Tradeshow-Exhibition teams in deploying Ross Production Workflow solutions for customer demos.
• Write demo scripts, create videos and small software applications to demonstrate product functionality for internal and external use
• Support training services in the development of new training offerings targeting Channel Partners, Ross customers and openGear Partners
• Support R&D teams in learning and adopting DashBoard for their product interfaces
• Provide support to Rocket Surgery, Solution Architecture and other Ross teams in the adoption and use of CustomPanel development skills
• Provide internal training to additional groups within Ross - Tech Support, DTE, PV, Manufacturing, Sales, Solutions Architecture and all other employees
• Collaborate in the development and execution of a strategy to share DashBoard knowledge within Ross and globally. May include the use of content management systems, social media and traditional documentation approaches
• Provide guidance to the Development Team during development of new features
• Provide guidance to the Product Manager on the product roadmap, development priorities, product direction, and new products – based on industry and customer trends
• Participate in trade show planning and execution
• Assist Regional or Key Account Sales Managers and Business Development Managers with responses to tender documents. Produce workflow and wiring diagrams and participate in key customer demonstrations and proofs of concept.
• Support Sales and Solutions Architecture in the generation and closing of deals related to DashBoard by competently presenting DashBoard products and solutions to potential new customers and assist in converting them into clients.
• Seek to develop opportunities with existing clients and ensure they stay satisfied and positive.
• Act as a technical liaison with technology partners in collaboration with the Product Manager to acquire software/hardware for testing and vetting of workflows in the office
• Assist Ross staff and customers with configuration support

Who you are:
• 5+ Years of industry experience (Broadcast, Media Production)
• 5+ Years of experience with any or all of the following Ross product (or like-products from other Vendors): OverDrive, Inception, DashBoard, Primestream or Streamline MAM, XPression, Ross Production Switchers
• Excellent English communication skills – written, verbal
• Able to take complex technical details and convey the information to others in an easy-to-understand manner
• Able to work effectively remotely
• Proficient in Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Visio

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Post-secondary degree or trade school diploma
• Post-secondary degree or diploma in computer science/engineering
• Experienced in the setup and adjustment of production systems
• Experience with broadcast equipment in pre- or post-sales environments
• Experience selling and marketing broadcast equipment preferred
• Broadcast or print design experience
• Additional working languages – French, Mandarin, Russian, Spanish
• 5+ years of experience with DashBoard device development and/or DashBoard CustomPanel development
• Familiarity with development with JavaScript and Java
• Familiarity with development practices, Agile delivery processes
• Proficient with Networking, Virtualization, Containerization, and Orchestration
• Proficient with IT Security
#LI-LH1

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! The Technical Services Manager (TSM) is a key member of the Technical Support department. The Technical Services Manager is responsible for strengthening customer relationships and ensuring customer satisfaction by monitoring support requests of key accounts, identify unresolved issues, and work with the appropriate teams on resolutions while managing customer communication. They hold regular review meetings with customers to discuss any issues or concerns and provide regular updates on open issues. The Technical Services Manager analyzes customer support requirements and identifies areas where the company can offer improved services ensuring that Ross meets its mission of providing a Superior Customer Experience. This position reports to the Manager, Partner Success.

Who you Report to: Manager, Partner Success

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Provides customer management, leadership support and is the customer advocate
• As the voice of the customer, engages the necessary internal resources to ensure that the customer’s concerns/escalations are resolved in a timely manner, including feature questions and enhancement requests, and communicates the updates to the customer.
• Monitors the progress of escalated issues of assigned customers.
• As needed, will travel to customer sites to assist in the troubleshooting/diagnosis of critical issues, engages the Director of Global Technical Support or appropriate designated Technical Support Manager and/or the appropriate Technical Product Manager (as needed), and drives issue escalations with Field Services and R&D teams.
• Ensures effective ownership, communication, coordination, and facilitation of support service activities with assigned customers.
• Schedules review meetings as needed with customers to discuss any issues, concerns or escalations.
• With the assistance of the Service Delivery Operations system administrator and/or analyst, compiles monthly support/RMA reports for assigned customers.
• Monitors and analyzes Technical Support statistics to formulate customer service strategies tailored to customer needs such as software and hardware upgrades, extended warranty requirements and critical spare solutions for uninterrupted operation.
• When requested, provides enhanced site services such as evaluating network and broadcast environments, identifying vulnerabilities, single points of failure, technical training requirements, drafting maintenance procedures and troubleshooting techniques.
• Performs other activities as needed to “Get the Job Done”.

Who you are:
• Strong knowledge of Broadcasting and IT infrastructure
• Extensive knowledge of the Ross family of products
• Ability to manage multiple assignments, set priorities, and adapt to changing conditions.
• Excellent crisis management skills.
• Superior customer skills, including excellent verbal and written communications.
• Familiarity with key components used in broadcast stations
• Post-secondary degree/diploma related to broadcast or relevant work experience
• Above average computer skills
• Knowledge of SalesForce would be an asset
• Proven leadership and management experience
• Passionate about the broadcast industry
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills
• Strong organizational skills and very detail oriented
• Self-starter, quick learner and able to work under minimal supervision
• Approachable, patient, calm with a desire to help others learn new objectives
• Ability to mitigate risk
• High initiative and well developed analytical skills
• Must be able to work well within a team, as well as independently
• High level of customer service experience
• Solid technical background in broadcasting
• Solid time / task management experience
• Minimum of 3 years’ experience in a broadcast environment
• 25% travel
• Must have a valid passport
• Must have a valid driver’s license
• Possible heaving lifting if moving equipment
• lifting up to 50 lbs, reaching, bending, stooping, cabling, etc.
#LI-JF1

The Technical Support Specialist is responsible for providing technical support remotely and onsite through remote sessions, ticketing systems, phone support on a as needed basis for Ross Video products, we assist customers in resolving issues by providing solutions to technical and service problems and provides the “Superior Customer Experience” through effective handling of customer issues or concerns. We work with some amazing customers, and you will get to be a part of helping them make an impact on their audiences. Please take a look at some of our Success Stories!

https://www.rossvideo.com/company/customers/

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, RRSP matching, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! Senior Members of our team also have the option of working from home.

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• Assist Customers with technical setup questions, troubleshooting efforts, and product specific solutions.
• Take ownership of customer issues reported and seeing problems through to resolution
• Research, diagnose, troubleshoot, and identify solutions to resolve issues
• Follow standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams
• Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers
• Empowering our customers to get the most of their products and solutions.
• Ensure proper recording and closure of all issues through a tracking system
• Prepare accurate and timely reports, as needed
• Document knowledge in the form of knowledge base technical notes and articles
• Expedite returned material from the field for service reasons
• Provide effective installation and commissioning services, technical product training and on-site support, as required. This may require travel on short notice.

Who you are:

• Technical diploma and knowledge of broadcast systems
• Customer service experience in a technical support environment
• Must be proficient in the English language (read, write, speak)
• Excellent trouble shooting and debugging skills
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
• Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, listening, and questioning skills
• Keen attention to detail with accurate record keeping
• Must be able to work with a team as well as independently
• Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
• Must possess a valid driver’s license and passport

Bonus points if you have the following:

• Additional education and computer courses are strong assets
• Prior knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM systems will be an asset
• Prior knowledge of Zendesk or other ticketing systems will be an asset
• Multilingual
