job_title: Solutions Architect, Graphics - Latin America (Job Req #2023-208)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Solution Architect will support the Latin Americas Sales team in its initiative to increase sales of Ross Video’s Graphics solutions including, production graphics, News MOS solutions and AR/VS solutions, using Ross Video’s award-winning XPression Real-Time Motion Graphics System and Ross Virtual Solutions. This key role in the Ross Sales organization requires a unique blend of graphics design / engineering / solutions solving skills along with the “soft skills” required in a sales process.
The Solution Architect is responsible, during pre-and post-sales activities, for ensuring Ross Video’s Superior Customer Experience. This requires collaboration with the sales team, customer interaction and managing the client’s expectations throughout the engagement. For complex projects, coordination with our services implementation team including Schedulers, Commissioners, Trainers, Creative Services Technical Support Specialists, and Field Service Developers, to ensure a successful launch of Ross solutions at clients’ facilities.

Who you report to: Director of Sales, Latin America

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Participate and contribute to sales opportunities driven by the Regional Sales Managers, prioritizing efforts based on maximizing total impact on the team’s productivity.
• Build relationships with prospects to promote Ross graphics systems and workflow.
• Travel to different territories to support and deliver key onsite customer demos and presentations and assess unique needs of the region.
• Demonstrate XPression software via webinar and at customer sites.
• Advise and assist end users, re-sellers, and system integrators concerning sales and purchase of Ross graphics.
• Organize Ross graphics road shows, training events, and other user activities in cooperation with product marketing.
• Scope technical solutions to address customer requirements, assess customers met and unmet needs, and recommend solutions that optimize value for both the customer and Ross Video.
• Coordinate closely with Ross’ internal Sales team and business partners to align solutions designed to meet our customers’ business requirements.
• Proactively engage in opportunity reviews ensuring they are properly configured aligned in the sales process.
• Educate and provide professional development to team and business partners to enhance their product knowledge, technical acumen, and technical sales skills.
• Engage in customer facing product presentations, demos, training, and workflow guidance to end-users and business partners at customer premise or tradeshows.
• Develop project plans, assist scheduling with resource allocation, coordinate Ross technical services, third party resources and client teams.
• Assist in resolution of customer complaints regarding equipment, supplies, and services.
• Follow company code of ethics, policies, and procedures.
• Perform other related duties as required.
Who you are:
• Experience working in or around broadcast television graphics and television news.
• Proficiency in broadcast graphics platforms from Ross Video and, or other competitive vendors.
• Understanding of the live production and MOS workflows, especially graphics and Media Asset Management.
• Passionate about broadcast & production industry.
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision.
• Organized and detail oriented with excellent writing and communication skills.
• Able to work co-operatively with and across all company departments.
• Minimum 5 years of combined sales, sales engineering, presales experience, systems application, or product specialist experience.
• Poses strong knowledge of industry standard protocols, connectors, and terminations.
• Strong knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and CAD.
• Excellent Communication & Presentation Skills.
• Must be proficient in both Desktop and Server Networking practices.
• Able to work co-operatively with and across all company departments.
• Possesses strong and creative problem-solving traits.
• Willing to Travel up to 60% of the time.
• Must live within 100 km of a major airport.
• Valid Passport and travel US visa
• Valid Driver’s License
• Occasional requirement to set-up equipment – involves lifting to 23kg, reaching, bending, stooping, etc.
• Language skills
• English speaking & writing proficiency is required.
• Spanish speaking & writing proficiency is required.
• Proficiency in Portuguese is desired.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Existing knowledge and use of Ross Video products (preferred)

We are currently searching for a dynamic, highly motivated Solution Specialist to join our Sports and Live Events team at Ross - in its initiative to increase sales of Ross Video technology in theses market spaces. This key role within the Global Sales organization requires a unique blend of engineering and operational customer facing “soft skills”, and post-sale project management. This is a diverse role that reports directly to the Manager – Solution Specialists - Sports & Live Events and requires frequent interaction with the company’s prospects, partners and service resource teams to ensure that solutions designed are efficiently deployed and supported. This unique position will include, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities and duties:
Who you report to: Manager - Solution Specialist, Sports & Live Events

What the job is all about:

• Participates and contributes to sales opportunities driven by the Vice President of Sports & Live Events and Regional Sales Managers, prioritizing efforts based on maximizing total impact on the team’s productivity.
• Pre and post-sale project management.
• Scopes technical solutions to address customer requirements, assess customers met and unmet needs, and recommends solutions that optimize value for both the customer and Ross Video.
• Coordinates closely with Ross’ internal Sales team and business partners to align solutions designed to meet customers’ business requirements.

Working with a team you will fully operate and understand the MES system for routing production, obtaining work instructions and logging defects. Preparing parts and Printed Circuit Boards to be hand soldered, wave soldered, assembled, inspected, programmed and tested.

Who you report to: Production Manager

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Solder and manually assemble various electronic components to designated locations on printed circuit boards according to work instruction and deviations.
• Crimp, stake, screw, bolt, rivet, weld, cement and perform similar operations to join or secure parts in place.
• Connect component lead wires to printed circuits or route and connect wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points.
• Assemble and attach hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, and switches to assemblies.
• Apply epoxy, adhesives, lubricants, and various thread lockers to secure parts in place
• Install cables and heatsinks
• Attach and marry sub-assemblies
• Operate manual and semi-automated press fit equipment to align parts in specified relationship to each other in jigs, fixtures, or other holding devices.
• Operate semi-automated board prep machine
• Operate wave solder machine
• Operate programming and testing equipment
• Assembly inspection (may or may not apply) which involves inspecting all through-hole components for correct component selection, orientation, and placement. Inspect soldering quality. Inspect modifications and deviations including but not limited to wire attachments, removal/replacement of SMT components, and track cuts.
• Ensure all finishing is completed properly, deliver inspected products to designated departments, and ensure data collection of defects.
• Routing assemblies through MES and or MAX systems either manually or electronically.
• Maintaining ESD and all safety practices.
• Follow all in place policies due to COVID-19 regulations
• Rotational shift work

Who you are:
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Detail oriented
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• An excellent aptitude for learning

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Previous experience within a manufacturing environment
• Hand soldering experience
• Electronics assembly experience
#LI-AS2

• Must have computer proficiency with Microsoft Office and core business-use tools and knowledge of video and audio standards, and broadcasting would be an asset

• Exceptional technical abilities and organizational skills
• High initiative and well-developed analytical problem-solving skills
• Strong communication skills
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
• Talent to cope with varying levels of support and documentation
• Self-starter and quick learner and
• Able to work with minimum supervision while meeting schedules.
• Able to lift 50 lbs., and to work in a manufacturing environment in an individual workstation, within a moderately noisy setting

You will also be responsible for the day-to-day activities of the product specialists’ team, including all HR responsibilities such as hiring, performance management, scheduling of tasks, approving work, etc.

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

What the job is all about:

Product Management
• Own the product lifecycle from product / feature ideation to launch.
• Define and maintain product roadmap in cooperation with Technical Product Manager / Senior Director of Product Management / VP of Graphics.
• Able to integrate ideas from customers, sales force, and engineering into killer product ideas.
• Monitor industry trends and define how they may influence product roadmap.
• Provide guidance to engineering team in terms of prioritization and definition of new products / features.
• Investigate the potential in new markets, with input from sales, business development managers and channel partners.
• Pricing strategies & price list maintenance.
• Competitive analysis (feature and price comparisons).
• Leverage SalesForce to gain business insights, in collaboration with business development managers.

• Oversee the development of promotional literature (brochures, cut sheets, etc.).

• Oversee demo content and tradeshow kit supervision.
• Configuration and ordering guides.
• Preparation of sales and dealer information packages.

• Develop and implement key marketing initiatives related to the product.
Sales Support
• Responsibility for sales results and influencing increased sales in the product line.
• Provide Sales training and Dealer training.
• Travel to support key onsite customer demos and presentations, attending key tradeshows, and travel to different territories to assess unique needs of the region.
• Work with Directors of Sales to create regional sales strategies.
• Key customer liaison.
Team Management
• Responsible for the day-to-day activities of the Product Specialists team including all HR responsibilities such as hiring, performance management, scheduling of tasks, approving work, etc.

Who you are:
• Post- secondary education in a related field.
• 10+ years of experience selling & marketing broadcast graphics equipment.
• Experience working in or around broadcast television graphics and television news.
• Strong background in broadcast & production graphics.
• Solid understanding of Virtual Graphics technologies (Unreal, Virtual Sets, Augmented Reality, Extended Reality).
• Experience selling & marketing broadcast equipment.
• Broadcast systems engineering experience.
• A solid understanding of broadcast & IT Systems.
• Excellent knowledge of a live production environment
• Familiarity with software development processes
• Sales and/or marketing training

Ross Video powers video production for billions of global viewers daily with the industry’s widest range of smart production solutions. We are looking for a dynamic, organized self-starter to join our Human Resources team to focus on our Compensation & Rewards programs and initiatives.

The Compensation & Rewards Specialist will be responsible for providing support on a broad range of compensation plans including base pay, bonus plans, sales incentive & executive compensation. They will monitor and review external trends, practices and innovations to ensure Ross Video remains competitive for all countries in which we have teams. This requires proven expertise in the areas of compensation design, administration and communication, in alignment with corporate global strategies.

Who you report to: Manager, HR Programs

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Support the continuing development of our global compensation & rewards programs and roadmap, working closely with relevant HR and business stakeholders to help deliver global compensation and reward initiatives.
• Manage the coordination, maintenance, and execution of all aspects of the compensation process including job evaluation, benchmarking, data audits, and ad hoc compensation reviews - ensuring market competitiveness, compliance and equity.
• Coordinate all activities related to the annual compensation planning cycle from budget recommendation through to approvals, communication and processing.
• Coordinate and facilitate the participation in salary surveys and analyze survey data providing recommendations and identifying areas of risk or concern; determine optimal sources and frequency of survey data.
• Work collaboratively across all areas of HR in delivering compensation practices that support talent acquisition, talent development and IDEA programs.
• Participate in the ongoing review and communication of compensation and pay practices.
• Lead the review and re-design of the reward and recognition program, that reflect and reinforce Ross Video’s culture and values.

Who you are:

job_title: Software Developer, Java (6 Month Contract) (Job Req #2023-209)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results in a way that’s fun and respectful to both ourselves and our customers.
Ross Video, recently recognized as one of Canada’s top 100 companies by MediaCorp is seeking exceptionally talented and motivated professionals to join our Enterprise Management team.
Winning a top 100 award is not easy, it requires excellence in multiple dimensions:
• Work Environment
• Compensation and Benefits
• Family Friendly Policies
• Employee Engagement
• Training and Development
• Community engagement
If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, intelligence, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Who you report to: Software Manager, RPM

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Reporting to the Software Manager, the successful candidate will be part of a dynamic and collaborative team where you will be working on the existing enterprise solution known as the Ross Platform Manager; a gateway to consolidating all Ross product solutions. Features you’ll work on include licensing, orchestration, role-based access control, and the migration of our existing solution to a modern framework, React. You will participate in an Agile team, working alongside your colleagues to design, develop and implement enterprise-grade solutions while employing software development best practices including the awareness and detection of code smells, inclusion of design patterns, and committing to delivering the highest quality solutions.
• Participate in the full software development lifecycle – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, documentation, testing and maintenance.
• Write code across the full stack – UI, back end services, and data storage.
• Provide design reviews and code reviews for fellow team members promoting high-quality work, sound software methodologies and attention to detail.

Who you are:
• 3 years of relevant software development experience
• Backend development experience with a thorough understanding of object oriented software design, data structures, algorithms, and data storage.
• Excellent software development skills in an object-oriented language such as Java with strong debugging skills.
• Experience with JavaScript, JSON, RESTful APIs, and HTTP(S) protocol.
• Experience with ReactJS and Redux
• Understanding of user interface development, TCP/IP, and UDP
• Knowledge of HTML and CSS

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Experience working with Eclipse/OSGi, Eclipse Rich Client Platform
• OAuth 2.0
• Expertise in live production

• Seek out, develop, and maintain relationships with 3rd-party graphics automation, design, and custom implementation companies, in concert with the product team, to generate minimal-effort, recurring Ross graphics revenue.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Technical Commissioning Specialist is responsible for performing the commissioning of Ross products and integrating these into the Broadcast systems at client locations across the USA. This front-line individual is responsible for managing customer expectations, implementing software and hardware configurations per product standards, completing required documentation, providing end user technical training and ensuring that the system performs as specified. This key individual works closely with our Sales and Technical Services Team to ensure delivery of the Ross Superior Customer Experience.

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about
• Provide effective:
• Onsite software installation/Upgrades
• Commissioning of multiple product lines
• Customer technical training services
• Complete required documentation. ie daily reports
• Customer/technical service
• Troubleshoot technical/systems issues at customer facilities
• Handle technical support calls and follow documentation policies
• Provide support to the implementation team, as required
• Assist with set-up of and attend tradeshows, as needed
• Perform other related duties as required
Who you are:
• Technical diploma and knowledge of broadcast systems
• Superior customer skills, including excellent verbal and written communications (English mandatory)
• Willingness to become an expert in Ross Video products
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, positive, determined, and able to work on multiple projects simultaneously
• Able to envision entire projects and look for problem areas, High initiative, resourceful and well-developed analytical skills
• High Tolerance of Ambiguity
• Must be able to work with a team as well as independently
• Ability to clearly communicate ideas to various audiences
• Ability to function is highly stressful situations
• Ability to learn quickly
• Excellent trouble shooting and debugging skills of Broadcast systems
• Strong knowledge of MS Word and Excel
• Strong Organizational skills
• Strong problem solving and prioritization skills
• A strong desire to get the job done
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills
• Valid Driver’s License
• Current Passport
• Possible heavy lifting if moving equipment
• Willing to travel 80-90% of the time (short-notice and international trips)
Bonus Points if you have the following:
• Additional education and computer courses are strong assets
• Knowledge of other languages is a definite asset
• Project management experience would be an asset
• Knowledge of Ross Video products would be a definite asset

#LI-JF1

Reporting to the Director, Corporate Financial Operations in Iroquois, the Credit and Collections Analyst is part of a team responsible for overseeing the credit and collections process, assessment of creditworthiness of potential customers, credit reviews of existing customers, collections of past due balances, escalation of difficult customers’ accounts to ensure minimization of risk of credit loss.

Who you report to: Director, Corporate Financial Operations

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Email and post invoices on a daily basis
• Prepare and arrange bank deposits
• Prepare new customer credit files & review existing customer credit limits.
• Monitor account credit limits, holds and aging of receivables, communicate to the necessary parties when an account is over its limit.
• Perform collection procedures on all invoices past due. Identify problem accounts - make prompt decisions for collection.
• Weekly and Month end reporting
• Work with Export Development Canada insuring new clients
• Perform other related duties as required.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education in Business Administration with 2 to 4 years’ experience in an accounting environment. Accounts Receivable experience preferred
• Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics is an asset
• General Understanding of ERP Order Entry process
• Proficient in MS Word & Excel
• Attention to detail and accuracy is critical
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Ability to communicate clearly and professionally with internal and external clients
• Ability to handle highly sensitive confidential information with a high degree of diplomacy
• Team player but able to work independently
• Computer literate
• Work remotely

The successful candidate will work closely with software development testing new features and enhancements as they are released. Testing will focus on the Ross XPression Real-Time Motion Graphics System which provides motion graphics, clip servers, workflow tools and purpose-built software application for virtual sets, scoreboards, logos 2D and 3D text, animation, lighting, maps, tickers, plugins, and more to live television shows. This may also include cloud-based, IP network, and IP security testing opportunities. You will also work with multiple 3rd party products that provide telestration, branding, A/R & V/R control and other on-air tools used by today’s broadcasters.

Who you report to: Product Operations Manager

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

Test Planning:
• Participates in analysis and design walkthroughs.
• Provide input to the development team to support designer testing.
• Investigate new functionality and incorporate into a comprehensive test plan.
• Provide detail test estimates for project planning purposes.
• Develop test ware (manual and or automated scripts) with a clear action and results section.
• Modify existing test plans and testing information to correct errors, to adapt to new use case scenarios, upgraded interfaces and performance enhancements.
• Manage test plans and test cases in the test management database.
• Design, configure, and document lab test setup for reuse.

Test Execution:
• In depth understanding, and accurate execution of the Ross Way to Develop.
• Accountable for the quality of work delivered for the specific project.
• Effective test case execution with real time status updates of the results using the test management database.
• Analyzes and troubleshoots test case failures resulting in an action plan.
• Provide accurate and detailed bug reporting throughout the testing process.
• Assist product development in the investigation/reproducibly of product issues.
• Writes automation test cases and maintains test cases throughout the product development cycle.
• Participate, when required, with the multi-functional team in bug triages.
• Provide regular status report updates to the management team.

Other duties:
• Act as an occasional trainer for other employees.
• Act as subject matter expert for XPression workflow.
• Assist the customer support team with customer quality issues.
• Assist in the organization and management of the lab area.
• Participate in postmortems reviews, what worked, what did not, what we can do better.
• Provide suggestions/plans for ongoing improvements and overall efficiencies to the lab.
• Perform other related duties as required.

Who you are:
• Education in Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering, Broadcast Technology, or equivalent is required.
• Knowledge of Windows, Linux and networking is required.
• 5+ years of experience in s
• 3+ years of experience in designing and implementing test strategies such as functional testing, performance testing, stress testing and system testing is required.
• Excellent analysis and troubleshooting skill are required.
• Proficient with PV methodologies, software testing principles, concepts, verification, validation methods, test & risk management are required.
• Knowledge of GUI testing is required.
• Knowledge of product development lifecycle(s) is desired.
• Test Case Automation experience is desired.
• Experience with collaborative and or iterative development model(s) is desired.
• Knowledge of cloud computing, virtualization, and security is desired.
• Script writing using batch files, Python, C#, VB, JavaScript, is an asset.
• Knowledge of JIRA, Jenkins, TestComplete, and Robot Framework is an asset.
• Knowledge of television production, and broadcast standards would be considered an asset.
• Experience with Non-Linear Editors (NLEs), newsroom computing systems (NRCS), production switchers, and character generators (CGs) would be considered an asset.
• A strong attention for detail and a critical mindset.
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills.
• Excellent oral and written communication skills.
• Strong analytical and trouble shooting skills.
• Ability to work and adapt in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
• Self-starter, quick learner, and ability to work with minimum supervision.
• Able to work independently or as part of a team.
• Occasional lifting, bending, stooping required in maintaining lab area and equipment.

Reporting to and working closely with the Business Manager/ Project Manager of Creative Services, the coordinator is responsible for following through on given scope of work for projects, proposal writing and submission in conjunction with sales, sales operations, and business development. Upon adoption, the coordinator will be responsible for logistical project management including delegating assignments, scheduling of resources, and completion notification. Groups that you will interface with will include sports and live events, virtual set production team and dashboard and custom development teams.

Who you report to: Business Manager, Creative Services

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

Project Scheduling
• Working with the Creative Services Projects Manager (CSPM), the coordinator will be responsible for departmental resource ascertainment, assignments, and scheduling of resources using available scheduling systems. Planning and maintenance of the production calendar will be a key function of the position. They will also make scheduling improvement recommendations to the Business Manager.

Project Maintenance
• Using the departmental Project Management System (Basecamp), the coordinator will initiate projects, manage the project queue making changes and updates to the project as they evolve. The coordinator will have regular interaction with the CSPM and assignees to determine and report on progress and bottlenecks. They will assist the CSPM to liaise with clients and Ross Project Managers (PM), keeping them up-to-date on project status.

Project Support
• Creative Services uses a template to summarize completed projects. The template describes multiple creative and technical facets of each project. Working with the artists and PM’s, the coordinator will assist with completion of the project summary and associated project files. They will then liaise with Ross Technical Support and the client to ensure an understanding of project support, how to get help starting with technical support, and the trouble-ticket escalation process.

Project Completion
• Determining the completion of a project is a key component of the job. The coordinator will work with PM, CSPM, the assignee, and the client to determine when a job is finished. Upon determination the coordinator will initiate the collection process with accounts receivable, ensuring they have all of the data they need to both invoice the client and ensure 3rd party are paid in a timely manner.

eCommerce
• Ross Video has a growing eCommerce presence. Projects are initiated by Ross Creative Services, ARVS, and design partners. The coordinator will delegate and manage projects through the eCommerce process. Duties will include finalization of packages for effective marketing in our eCommerce space.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary degree or trade school diploma
• Knowledge of basic graphic design principles
• Basic knowledge of broadcast or live event experience
• Proficient with MS Office including Excel
• basic knowledge of broadcast graphics workflows
• Solid knowledge of broadcast production
• Basic knowledge of IT workflows
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
• Excellent communication skills
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills
• Enthusiastic
• High tolerance of ambiguity
• Team-oriented
• Problem solver
• Able to work co-operatively with Ross and end users
• Basic XPression, Unreal engine and Dashboard knowledge desirable
• Experience with SalesForce desirable
• Project coordinatior experience
• Technical support experience desirable
• Broadcast production experience (studio, remote or live events) is desirable
• Willing to travel on a project-by-project basis up to 10% of the time.
• Valid passport
• Valid driver’s license

This position will take place at the Ross Video Ottawa Office or a home-based office setting, if mutually agreed upon.

#LI-JF1

job_title: Regional Sales Manager - Nordics & Netherlands (Job Req #2023-189)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Join Ross Video and you will have an opportunity to be part of a growing company that is continuing to build a greater presence in the European marketplace.

In the position of Regional Sales Manager – Nordics & Netherlands you should have an entrepreneurial spirit. You would be responsible for proactively growing both existing and new business relationships for Ross Video in this region either directly or through Ross’ designated Business Partners. You would work remotely reporting to our EMEA HQ in Reading and be supported by the local team as well as the rest of Ross Video. You should have experience and previous success in sales related to the Broadcast Industry. You will have passionate commitment to customer service and should be prepared to develop business relationships on a face to face basis throughout the whole of the Nordic and Netherlands region. You will have a well-honed ability to communicate compellingly at all levels of an organization both in written and verbal form.

Who you report to: Director of Sales, EMEA

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

As the Regional Sales Manager, your major responsibilities will include developing new business and maintaining existing customer accounts, while establishing solid relationships with all major companies in the OB, studio, cable, rental, corporate and educational sectors of the broadcast market. You will also be responsible for establishing productive working relationships with Ross Video’s Business Partners within the region. Approximately 50% of your time will be spent travelling to customers and potential customers’ facilities providing information and support as required. You will also prepare reports, forecasts, and handle all aspects of account maintenance, as well as ensuring Ross Way To Sell disciplines are followed, including Salesforce management.

• Negotiates and closes sales
• Builds and nurtures relationships with end users
• Delivers sales presentations to clients and business partners in the territory
• Develops and implements strategic sales plans to accommodate corporate and individual territorial goals
• Adheres to and follows the Ross Video code of ethics
• Develops and maintains sales forecasting activities and assists in setting of territory sales goals with business partners
• Performs market analysis to determine customer needs and pricing strategies
• Directs channel development activity in the territory and coordinates sales distribution by establishing business partner territories, quotas and goals
• Meets monthly order targets
• Assists in directing marketing resources to establish Ross Video products in the region
• Represents company at trade association meetings and exhibitions
• Assists in coordination and liaison between sales department and other sales related units
• Assists other departments within organization to prepare marketing plans specific to the territory
• Prepares periodic sales report showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion
• Monitors and evaluates the activities and products of the competition
• Assists in resolution of customer complaints regarding equipment, supplies, and services
• Follows company policies and procedures
• Performs other related duties as required

Who you are:

You will have a good understanding of the broadcast and/or video post-production business. Ideally you will have worked at a reseller and/or in the sales team at a manufacturer. In addition, you will have relevant experience selling and achieving sales targets both via direct and in-direct channels in the Broadcast industry or related field. The successful candidate will have the proven ability to negotiate and manage complex sales through to successful completion. Excellent teamwork, communication and interpersonal skills are a must.
• 5+ years’ experience within the broadcast / media technology industry
• Successful track record selling & marketing broadcast equipment/software
• Ability to negotiate and manage complex sales through to effective completion
• Excellent teamwork, communication and interpersonal skills ·
• Strong Organizational Skills
• Organized, positive and determined
• Passionate about Ross Video solutions
• Team oriented
• Problem solver
• Willing to travel up to 50% of the time
#LI-LH1

Solutions Specialists are responsible for ensuring and evangelizing the functional and technical excellence of all Ross products under the umbrella of Production Workflow. This includes, but is not limited to, OverDrive, Inception, Primestream and Streamline MAM, Media IO, softGear, DashBoard and Ross Platform Manager.

Solutions Specialists will work with Product Managers to accelerate sales enablement and assist where needed in sales opportunities. They will also work with Product Owners and the development teams to offer constant feedback and assistance with current market problems and how collectively we can help with practical solutions.

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
(Note: Each Solutions Specialist will have a core area of focus in a particular workflow, and will expand expertise from there)
• Network with our customers and collect feedback on Ross and competitor solutions.
• Gather market knowledge on the constantly evolving problems our customers face and feed that knowledge into product management and product marketing.
• Strategize with product management on how to best offer solutions for the greatest challenges our customers face.
• Become a Subject Matter Expert for a solution
• Work with customers to understand a Ross solution deployment and their requirements on the network.
• Advise customers on hardware and Virtual Machine requirements to ensure a solution that meets their requirements.
• Keeps current hardware requirements for all Ross Production Workflow solutions.
• Aid in testing of new hardware platforms for all Ross Production Workflow solutions.
• Assist Demo-Tradeshow-Exhibition teams in deploying Ross Production Workflow solutions for customer demos.
• Write demo scripts, create videos and small software applications to demonstrate product functionality for internal and external use
• Support training services in the development of new training offerings targeting Channel Partners, Ross customers and openGear Partners
• Support R&D teams in learning and adopting DashBoard for their product interfaces
• Provide support to Rocket Surgery, Solution Architecture and other Ross teams in the adoption and use of CustomPanel development skills
• Provide internal training to additional groups within Ross - Tech Support, DTE, PV, Manufacturing, Sales, Solutions Architecture and all other employees
• Collaborate in the development and execution of a strategy to share DashBoard knowledge within Ross and globally. May include the use of content management systems, social media and traditional documentation approaches
• Provide guidance to the Development Team during development of new features
• Provide guidance to the Product Manager on the product roadmap, development priorities, product direction, and new products – based on industry and customer trends
• Participate in trade show planning and execution
• Assist Regional or Key Account Sales Managers and Business Development Managers with responses to tender documents. Produce workflow and wiring diagrams and participate in key customer demonstrations and proofs of concept.
• Support Sales and Solutions Architecture in the generation and closing of deals related to DashBoard by competently presenting DashBoard products and solutions to potential new customers and assist in converting them into clients.
• Seek to develop opportunities with existing clients and ensure they stay satisfied and positive.
• Act as a technical liaison with technology partners in collaboration with the Product Manager to acquire software/hardware for testing and vetting of workflows in the office
• Assist Ross staff and customers with configuration support

Who you are:
• 5+ Years of industry experience (Broadcast, Media Production)
• 5+ Years of experience with any or all of the following Ross product (or like-products from other Vendors): OverDrive, Inception, DashBoard, Primestream or Streamline MAM, XPression, Ross Production Switchers
• Excellent English communication skills – written, verbal
• Able to take complex technical details and convey the information to others in an easy-to-understand manner
• Able to work effectively remotely
• Proficient in Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Visio

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Post-secondary degree or trade school diploma
• Post-secondary degree or diploma in computer science/engineering
• Experienced in the setup and adjustment of production systems
• Experience with broadcast equipment in pre- or post-sales environments
• Experience selling and marketing broadcast equipment preferred
• Broadcast or print design experience
• Additional working languages – French, Mandarin, Russian, Spanish
• 5+ years of experience with DashBoard device development and/or DashBoard CustomPanel development
• Familiarity with development with JavaScript and Java
• Familiarity with development practices, Agile delivery processes
• Proficient with Networking, Virtualization, Containerization, and Orchestration
• Proficient with IT Security

Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Working both independently and in a team environment; working with and assisting senior technicians with all functional test equipment and fixtures to assure all systems are functional and operating within Ross standards.

Who you report to: Test Development Manager

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Troubleshooting anywhere from fully assembled systems all the way down to the component level on PCBAs
• Initiating repairs using appropriate routing and rework tools
• Working with Production Managers, Lead-Hands and cell supervisors for work prioritization to ensure internal and external customer demands are met
• Providing technical support to Production test staff, by validating infrastructure integrity and initiating repairs as well as providing technical support to the Test Development team on NPI (new product introduction).
• Use various test equipment and tools (hardware and software) to test and debug products and as required,
• Perform production configuration, testing and calibration following established procedures, policies and protocols and performing other related duties as required

Who you are:
• Electronics Technician/Technologist diploma or equivalent in experience is required
• Excellent understanding of electronic theory and applications, with an emphasis on digital components such as CPU, FPGA, flash, etc.
• A solid foundation in schematic reading and interpretation with a working knowledge of Linux and other command line interface with hardware and knowledge of JTAG technologies (IEEE 1149.1, 1149.6.). Familiarity with a wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analysers, DVMs, etc.)
• Experience with scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, or equivalent and experience with programming languages such as C, C++ or equivalent.
• An above average PC/Windows computer skill set specifically related to network and serial interface and configuration
• Must have computer proficiency with Microsoft Office and core business-use tools and knowledge of video and audio standards, and broadcasting would be an asset
• The ability to solder if required (jig repair) is an asset
• Exceptional technical abilities and organizational skills
• High initiative and well-developed analytical problem-solving skills
• Strong communication skills
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
• Talent to cope with varying levels of support and documentation
• Self-starter and quick learner and
• Able to work with minimum supervision while meeting schedules.
• Able to lift 50 lbs., and to work in a manufacturing environment in an individual workstation, within a moderately noisy setting

#LI-AS2

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

Working with the Marketing Product Managers (MPM’s) and the Technical Product Manager (TPM’s), the POM helps manage and drive each project from concept through to a successful release to manufacturing and product launch to market

The POM is responsible for managing project timeline, budget, and agreed feature set. He or she will liaise with the Manufacturing, Manufacturing Test Engineering, and Tech Support to enable smooth product sales & order process, build of required hardware/software products, and own product lifecycle support as well as tracking and respond to customer issues that have been escalated by TS to the Development.

Who you report to: Vice President, Hyperconverged Solutions

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the jo is all about:
Project Planning Phase:
• Follows, advocates, and helps implement the corporate NPI process
• Assists in identifying the resource and material costs/requirements for the project
• Works with the project team to identify and mitigate risks - developing and documenting a risk mitigation plan
• Works with the TPM and project team in developing the project schedules. POM owns the responsibility for creation and maintenance of project schedules
• Responsible for entry and maintenance of all product information and data in SalesForce, Agile, and Max

Project Execution Phase:
• Maintains and tracks the project schedules
• Assists the TPM, where required, in the coordination of project team development activities and for the effective follow-up - facilitating communication between individuals and teams.
• Generates project meeting minutes (including action item identification, assignment and follow-up) as per the requests of the TPM.
• Tracks all Development, Product Verification, Engineering Services and Manufacturing activities and identifies any potential project issues and challenges, including resource exposures or conflicts
• Works with TPMs, MPMs, Manufacturing (including Scheduling, Test, and Procurement) in developing product BOMs for each level of all new products
• Responsible for ensuring the timely delivery of required input to the Technical Documentation team
• Responsible for providing communication on project status throughout the organization
• Ensures that project status reports are generated on time as required

Release Phase:
• Works with the MPM’s and TPM to define a product launch and deployment plan
• Works with the MPM and TPM to coordinate and ensure training is provided for Technical Support, Commissioning, Sales Engineer, and Training team
• Owns and manages the Product release checklist and is responsible for ensuring that all disciplines (manufacturing, Marketing, Developments, etc) follow through with and complete tasks required for a successful release

Product Lifecycle Management:
• Works with the Technical Support and Development teams, via an escalation process, to ensure customer satisfaction by managing and tracking any product deployment issues - providing prompt and appropriate customer communications.
• Tracks all field service issues and report on them internally as well as any required customer communications
• Where necessary, consults with the Field Service Team, TPM and MPM’s to determine any necessary actions required to resolve customer issues and/or dissatisfactions
• Responsible for maintenance (ECO, MCO, EOL, etc) of all manufacturing data for all released products
• Responsible for monitoring and maintaining manufactured product costing and reporting any appreciable changes to TPM and MPM
• Responsible for communication throughout the organization for all product updates and new code releases

Operation:
• Works with the MPM and TPM to help develop and record the Strategic Product Line Roadmap
• Provides support to entire product team on required purchases of materials, test equipment, and facility requirements

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education, engineering degree is a strong asset
• PMI Certification will be an asset
• Strong logistics and planning background
• Familiarity with the product development process and the associated requirements of manufacturing
• Familiarity with software planning and development.
• Strong knowledge of PM tools
#LI-KS1

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

As an SMT Operator, you will operate various machines to run the SMT Line. The role requires technical knowledge of printed circuit boards and surface mount technology.

Who you report to: Manager, SMT

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Set up and operation of screen printers and SPI
• Monitor SPI for tolerance adherence and understand troubleshooting methods to keep in line with paste quality
• Manage changeover process to ensure efficiency in production time
• Setup each SMT machine to ensure parts are loaded properly, conveyors are aligned, and oven recipes are accurate
• Obtain parts from inventory and verifying loaded components from the setup department are accurate
• Understand the basic hardware mechanics of the SMT equipment
• Learn all production screens and tabs of the pick and place software to ensure how to navigate the machine operation
• Understand basic troubleshooting skills with regards to component placement accuracy, board loading/unloading and fiducial data
• Work closely with AOI operator to ensure quality is maintained according to IPC 610 standards. This feedback is in response to correcting defects that may occur while operating the pick and place machines and/or screen printer
• Works closely with SMT Support team to ensure quality and to maintain production flow on the lines by reducing troubleshooting downtime
• Run the AOI machine to monitor quality coming down the lines
• Maintain and rely on IPC-610x training to ensure the correct defect calls are made and to know when to elevate problems to support staff
• Fully understand MES with regards to routing and reading MWI’s. Review of production documentation and verifying BOM revisions match the pick and place programs
• Clean stencils and returning them to the proper storage location during the build process
• Maintain ESD practices
• Adhere to MSDS procedures (PROC025A)
• Area maintenance and general tidiness and organization of materials

Who you are:
• Have a high school diploma
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• Strong aptiude for learning
• Able to lift and bend

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Previous experience with machine operation
#LI-AS2

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. The Events Manager is responsible for the planning, coordination, logistics and execution of Ross Video tradeshows and events. The Events Manager is a diverse role covering a broad spectrum of responsibilities, working closely with both marketing and sales teams. You will be seen as a trusted advisor to these teams to help deliver over 100 events per year, ranging from regional pop-up booths to major marquee shows. The primary focus of the role is seamless execution of our two primary tradeshows: NAB Show in Las Vegas and IBC in Amsterdam.

Who you report to: Director, Communications

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

• What the job is all about:
Manage master tradeshow list and events calendar, and North America event plan
• Coordinate and execute themes for events with marketing and sales
• Maintain event budgets for NAB Show and IBC
• Design, develop and manage display inventory for regional tradeshows - work with creative team to develop signage, displays, and large format graphics as required
• Coordination of space acquisition and selection
• Coordination and contract negotiation of all onsite services
• Coordination of staff clothing and promotional materials for shows
• Coordination of insurance and shipping/customs documentation and logistics
• Coordination of internal communication of pre-show event details
• Coordination of staff lists, flights, and hotel room bookings for major events
• Coordinate lead capture and follow-up activities with Digital Marketing team
• Coordination of onsite installation and dismantle support
• Tradeshow set-up and teardown
• Occasional requirement to set-up equipment and displays - involves lifting up to 50lbs, reaching, bending, stooping, etc.

Who you are:
• 7-10 years of experience leading tradeshow and event management
• 2+ years of people management experience (1-2 direct reports), along with ‘flex’ staff for on-site event execution and booth operations
• Exceptional Project Management skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office
• Post-secondary degree or diploma in Marketing, Advertising, or Event Coordination
• CMP, CSEP, or CMM certification is ideal.
• Working knowledge of various display systems and custom display fabrication methods
• Strong attention to detail.
• Strong organization and communication skills.
• Creative, enthusiastic, team-oriented, excellent time management skills.
• Ability to multi-task and take ownership.
• Excellent time management skills.
• Ability to create and nurture strong relationships with suppliers and business partners.
• Valid Driver’s License and access to a vehicle for occasional travel to Ottawa location
• Ability to travel approximately 20% of the time
• Ability to travel to major tradeshows for 2-3 weeks at a time
• Passport required for travel to US or overseas tradeshow events
#LI-LH1

job_title: Software and Delivery Tools Developer (Job Req #2023-179)
job_description:

This role aids our teams in reaching their full potential by developing/acquiring, deploying, maintaining, documenting, training, and supporting the software development, testing, and delivery tools our teams depend on. The successful applicant will join a small team, working closely with internal customers to understand their challenges and provide solutions to overcome them.
The ideal candidate will have 5+ years prior experience working in this capacity.

What the job is all about:
• Work closely with internal teams to understand their tooling requirements to help contribute to the successful delivery of customer value.
• Provide tooling solutions that support the teams’ workflows and desired outcomes.
• Maintain and support the infrastructure that the teams depend on to do their jobs.
• Provide various forms of documentation, ranging from how the infrastructure is constructed to end-user manuals/wikis.
• Train staff on the usage of tools and workflows.
• Prioritize requests based on ROI analysis.
• Develop in-house solutions where applicable.

Who you are:
• Jenkins
• Groovy & other scripting languages
• Automation testing frameworks
• Build pipelines and toolchains for Java, JavaScript, C, C++
• P2 Repositories
• Docker
• Nexus
• Gitlab
• SonarQube
• 5+ years prior experience supporting software development infrastructure
• Collaborative
• Problem solver
• Takes initiative
• Enthusiastic and motivated about work
• Excellent English communication (written and oral)
• Able to prioritize and drive tasks to completion
• Knows when to ask for help
• Hybrid (office/remote) work environment

As a Manufacturing NPI Mechanical Technologist, you will work within Ross Video’s manufacturing department to support the introduction and production of new and changing technologies.

Who you report to: Manufacturing NPI Mechanical Prime.

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• For each design release you will help review the mechanical implementation and ensure the design is manufacturable.
• Support the translation of the product’s mechanical specifications from engineering to manufacturing procedures.
• Help resolve production failures and issues during the prototype and pre-production phases of the product’s lifecycle.
• Provide support to the creation of documentation changes, including assembly procedures, work instructions and Manufacturing Execution System (MES) content.
• Support the initial builds of prototype units, collecting additional DFM information.
• Review change requests generated by engineering and production staff, and implement changes as required.
• Provide DFM feedback to the mechanical designers and product managers.
• Support any other business priorities as required within manufacturing.
• Perform the initial prototype assemblies, ensure the work instructions are accurate, and highlight any product or tooling deficiencies.
• Help train the production staff with new work instructions or tooling.
Who you are:
• Possess a strong mechanical acumen and has outstanding attention to detail
• 3-year college diploma coupled with relevant work experience.
• Ability to manage multiple priorities within a project-based environment.
• Excellent knowledge of Systems, Electro-Mechanical Manufacturing and Process Engineering.
• Knowledge of manufacturing and continuous improvement principles.
• Able to read and understand Mechanical drawings and wiring diagrams.
• Experience using AutoCAD or a relevant 3D modeling software package.
Bonus points if you have the following:

Your technical communication skills both verbal and written are important to this role along with your ability to organize and prioritize. Being goal oriented, comfortable in asking questions, possessing a can-do attitude, and able to collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams across the organization.

#LI-PC1

Working in the Corporate Information Technology team located in Ottawa, the IT Accounts Administrator will have the responsibility to support every area of our rapidly growing company. The successful candidate will develop system foundations and data structures for our business and will be part of a core team that directly contributes to Ross Video’s success.

Who you report to: Manager, IT Applications

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Manages and standardize per industry best practices the following:
• Distribution Lists (DL)
• Security Groups
• Azure Active Directory user accounts
• Azure B2C accounts
• Ensure accounts are correctly onboarded, maintained and securely deactivated, DL’s updated, etc. upon employee hiring/departure
• Work with the relevant stake holders to ensure compliance with GDPR and similar regulatory frameworks for removal requests
• Provides input to, and assists with implementation of disaster recovery plans
• Identify and adjust workflow procedures that lead to overall process improvements
• Monitor relevant system logs to ensure health, uptime, and quality of service
• Perform relevant patching and upgrades if required
• Maintain documentation regarding configurations, operational and troubleshooting procedures related to the various account systems
• Participate in the definition of standards, guidelines, best practices, and metrics as directed
• Assist in evaluating new requirements, technical design, and standards
• Troubleshoot assigned IT Help Desk tickets and assist team members when required
• Provide afterhours support on an as needed basis to support core company operations
• Perform other related duties as required

Who you are:
• Bachelor of Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent training and experience in the IT field
• In-depth knowledge and proven experience with Azure SSO, Azure Active Directory, Azure B2C
• Windows Server, Mac OS, Red Hat, CentOS, Ubuntu server administration an asset
• Knowledge of monitoring and measurement systems (PRTG, Grafana, OpenManage), MS365 monitoring tools (e.g.: Cloud App Security), Intune an asset
• Experience with VDI platforms (Dell Wyse, Windows RDS) an asset
• Familiarity with AWS, Azure and other cloud platforms (an asset)
• Approachable with excellent communication skills
• Team player but able to work independently
• Able to envision the entire project and look for problem areas
• Organized, thorough, and detail orientated
• High initiative and well-developed analytical skills
• Technical, hands-on person
• Minimum 4-6 years IT Account Administration experience with AD, Azure AD, Azure B2C, including monitoring, and troubleshooting
• Strong knowledge of Windows Operating Systems and Azure Active Directory management/integration, Linux and Mac OS integration with these services would an asset.
• AWS account management and administration an asset
• Experience in a product development environment is an asset
• Valid driver’s license and clean driving record, a reliable vehicle is a must
• Travel between Ottawa and Iroquois when required
• Possess or can obtain a valid passport
#LI-JF1

Reporting to the Director - Tax & Compliance, you will be a key member of our corporate finance team. In this newly created position, you will be responsible for indirect tax return preparations as well as assisting with completion of compliance reporting globally. The complexity of the global indirect tax obligations continues to evolve & grow, both with changing legislation and our own corporate growth, making this an exciting, challenging, and dynamic opportunity!

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Generate various financial reports such as sales, purchase, and GL account transaction reports to facilitate US sales and use tax filings
• Reconcile tax liability general ledger accounts and investigate outstanding items and process adjustment entries
• Assist Senior tax analyst to process US sales & use tax returns and payments
• Assist with US business & occupation, gross receipts, personal property tax filings
• Assist with US business registrations and renewals of tax licenses
• Assist with other indirect tax ad hoc projects, to include collecting data, responding to inquiries from taxing authorities, other departments, customers or vendors

Who You are:
• Completed degree or diploma from an accredited institution – preference for accounting/business
• Ideally one year working experience in an accounting or tax environment
• Knowledge of accounting and tax concepts and principles
• Proficiency in Microsoft office products, specifically Excel; Experience with ERP systems; Familiar with sales tax software such as Avalara and CCH
• Ability to analyze and reconcile large data sets
• Professional, friendly, and courteous in all interactions
• Great organizational and time management skills; Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy
• Strong communication skills, both verbal and written

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use.
