All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Demo Artist and Trainer is responsible for performing the commissioning of Ross products and integrating these into the Broadcast systems at client locations globally. The position requires above average knowledge on Ross Switchers, Servers, and Dashboard. This front-line individual is responsible for managing customer expectations, completing required documentation, providing end user technical & operational training, and ensuring that the system performs operationally as specified. This key individual works closely with our Sales and Services Team to ensure delivery of the Ross Superior Customer Experience.

Who you report to: Services Manager - EMEA

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

Provide effective:
• Onsite / online training services.
• Onsite/ online customer demonstrations.
• Complete required documentation.
• Troubleshoot technical/systems issues at customer facilities.
Secondary activities
• Provide support to the implementation team, as required.
• Assist with set-up/demos and attend tradeshows as needed.
• Perform other related duties as required.
Demonstrations
• On-site, off-site, online/remote customer demonstrations and tradeshow events
• Ensures integrity of the demo experience and provides feedback and input re: areas for improvement
• Setup demo equipment, assists with set-up and prepares/tests gear prior to demos
• Reports back to the Sales and Marketing Product Management (MPM) groups regarding current industry trends and customer feedback
• Maintains above average knowledge base and skill set in the functionality and demonstration of Ross Video’s product lines and solutions, which include Production Switchers and Video Servers
Training
• Perform on-site, off-site, and online/remote customer training
• Maintain training equipment, assist with set-up and prepare/test gear prior to training sessions
• Provide customer feedback to the MPM & TPM on product operation, features, and roadmap
• Actively participate in Ross’ user forums, lead key discussions, and assist Product users
• Specific product knowledge above average. Works to help support teammates technically or operationally
• Self-sufficient, onsite problem solving, fulfilling all communication duties for all departments or people involved (Sales, TS, PM)
• Superior communication with customers and internally regarding processes, setting-up and understanding customer expectations, raising issues if any
• Proper etiquette when communicating with customers
• Can correct, resolve issues, solve problems both internally and externally. Problem solves by collecting, recording, and analyzing missing information. Exercises own judgment when working on customer facing projects. Raises unusual problems to Manager
• Pre-project coordination with customers, understanding and conveying full scope of work to the customer

Who you are:
• Good working knowledge of broadcast systems
• Superior customer skills, including excellent verbal and written communications
• Above average skills on Ross Video products, including Ross Carbonite switcher, Ross Servers, and Dashboard
• Knowledge of other languages is a definite bonus
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, positive, determined, and able to work on multiple projects simultaneously.
• Able to envision entire projects and look for problem areas High initiative, resourceful and well-developed analytical skills
• High Tolerance of Ambiguity
• Must be able to maintain healthy relationships with customers
• Must be able to work with a team as well as independently
• Ability to clearly communicate ideas to various audiences
• Ability to function is highly stressful situations
• Ability to learn quickly
• Excellent trouble shooting and debugging skills.
• Basic IP knowledge is a must.
• Knowledge of Ross Video products and workflow solutions would be a definite asset.
• Strong Organizational skills
• Strong problem solving and prioritization skills
• A strong desire to get the job done.
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills.
• Strong skill set in live sports productions
• Work Environment:
• Onsite or Online where services are required
• Various customer locations (broadcast studios, control rooms, educational facilities, houses of worship, sports arenas, tradeshows…)
• Travel up to 70%
• Valid Driver’s License
• Current Passport

job_description:

Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Who you report to: Manager, IP/TLX Control Systems

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Design, simulate and test leading edge SW solutions for Video market
• Develop high-level design requirements and support aggressive project scheduling
• Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of both the embedded and application SW solutions
• Thoroughly self-test all designs and support DevTest & PV – this includes reviewing test plans to align focus, validating feedback, and debugging/fixing problems as required
• Assist in supporting other staff members as necessary

Who you are:
• Use of embedded Linux development frameworks such as Buildroot, Yocto and/or other related tools (e.g. crosstool-ng).
• Experience with ARM-based embedded processors, especially System-on-a-Chip devices such as Altera SOC and Xilinx Zynq.
• Linux – Based system configuration, including
• Custom Kernel and driver configuration, Modification, Development, and debugging
• Use of different init systems including sysv/busybox init and alternatives such as systemd, upstart etc.
• Strong knowledge of system startup sequencing, operation for Multi-stage boot environments
• Bootloader especially uBoot configuration, development troubleshooting and modification
• Strong knowledge of related interfaces/technologies such as IP Stack, storage, USB, I2C, SPI, PCIe, DMA and other systems.
• Strong C/C++ programming and troubleshooting skills
• Strong knowledge of build systems
• B.S. in Engineering required (M.S. in Engineering and/or equivalent experience preferred)
• Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work as part of a team or independently as required
• Keen observational skills and problem solving intuition
• Organized and detail oriented self-starter with ability to self-manage to meet aggressive deadlines
• Ability to learn new concepts quickly and work towards finding creative solutions to challenging problems
• Comfortable moving forward aggressively; balancing risks appropriately to optimize success across all business aspects – good, fast, and cheap
• Equally comfortable contributing as a team member or championing an idea with upper management
• Minimum 3+ years SW & Embedded development experience with expertise in Broadcast Routing Applications

The Manufacturing Training Manager is responsible for making Ross a great learning environment for all manufacturing participants, production teams and support teams; by fostering an educational culture, which pushes the organization forward. The Training Manager stays up to date on the best practices related to Adult Education and brings added value to the organization by recommending creative and innovative ways to elevate the skills of all manufacturing employees.
As the Manufacturing Training Manager, you will manage the development, implementation and maintenance of the training program within Ross Video Manufacturing. Your team will be responsible for both hard and soft skills training and includes the development and administration of the training system.

Who you report to: Director, PCBA Process Development

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Make sure there is full compliance and maintain knowledge of evolving legal frameworks and regulations, that address all safety aspects within the building relative to training, on and off the job.
• Ensure integration of Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI) principles and values into all curriculum developed and delivered
• Run the development of a comprehensive training plan for all relevant processes/equipment within Manufacturing based on documentation and processes defined by the Manufacturing Process team.
• Keeping up to date with new training practices and technologies, ensure the continued development and optimisation of Ross Video’s training program.
• Garnering regular feedback on training performance from both management and trainees to ensure customers are happy and their demands are being met.
• Respond to training requests, ensuring any requests are acted on promptly and effectively.
• Ensure classroom, hands on and online training courses are maintained for appropriate onboarding.
• Create and maintain a scheduled training plan for all employees to ensure optimised onboarding, training maintenance and implementation of new processes.
• Using the learning management system, administer content, testing and sign off processes to validate that training is complete and records are maintained.
• Working closely with the Manufacturing Process team and Production Management, ensure training plans are up to date and training schedules are communicated/coordinated.
• Mentor team members including Manufacturing Training Specialists and Manufacturing Trainers

Who you are:
• Post-Secondary Education or appropriate experience
• Experience in a leadership role
• Experience creating process and/or training documentation
• Experience providing in-person training
• Training certification is a solid asset (CPTM, CIT, CLDP. etc.)
• Experienced in technical manufacturing operations an asset
• Excellent knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Able to manage a team of diverse individuals
• Self-starter, quick learner and able to work with minimum supervision in meeting schedules and project deadlines
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Excellent oral and written communication skills
• Capable of following procedures and working logically
• Able to work on multiple projects

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Solid aptitude for learning.
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions

Reporting to the Manager, Creative Services, the successful candidate will be responsible for the execution of and/or participation in Ross Creative and Professional Services activities, by providing services for the design, creation, and implementation of Voyager Unreal projects, XPression real-time graphics and graphics packages.

This position is located in our Sydney office or a home-based office setting, if mutually agreed upon.

Who you report to: Creative Services Manager

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Graphic Design:
• Design templates and animations from scratch, using native XPression tools and 3rd-party graphics applications such as Cinema 4D and Adobe Suite.
• Design and build Voyager Unreal Engine AR and VR graphics.
• Create packages that conform to standardized workflows outlined by the Manager

Automation:
• Ensures appropriate automation hooks are created for outside control.
• Utilize XPression Visual Logic and scripting for automated, dynamic templates.
• Setup XPression Datalinq to pull in external data feeds and interface with external data aggregation systems.
• Use Ross Dashboard to create manual user interface panels and backup solutions for XPression automated graphics.

On-site Implementation:
• Responsible for implementation and integration of graphics packages at customer’s sites, as required.

Administrative:
• Attends meetings and conference calls as required to scope, complete, or otherwise facilitate successful completion of assigned projects as they relate to the job.
• Work with other creative and professional service members to institute a consistent and standardized workflow solution.

Documentation:
• Works with Ross team members to create style and operational guides for end users.
• Document any custom scripting methodologies to ensure future support from Ross.
• May be required to create project style-guides of assets.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary degree or trade school diploma
• Advanced knowledge of Adobe creative suite
• Advanced knowledge of Cinema 4D and Redshift renderer knowledge a plus
• Intermediate knowledge of IT workflows
• Intermediate computer programming experience in VB, SQL, and/or JAVA is desirable
• Proficient in Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint
• Proficient knowledge of Unreal Engine a plus
• Minimum 2-5 years production experience in broadcast (studio or remote) or sport venue
• Minimum 2-5 years of graphic design experience.
• Proficient knowledge of broadcast graphics workflows
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
• Excellent communication skills
• Aptitude for animation and choreography of movement
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills
• High tolerance of ambiguity
• Team-oriented, and able to work co-operatively with Ross and end users
• Enthusiastic problem solver
• Willing to travel on a project-by-project basis up to 50% of the time
• Valid Passport

As a Manufacturing NPI Mechanical Technologist, you will work within Ross Video’s manufacturing department to support the introduction and production of new and changing technologies.

Who you report to: Manufacturing NPI Mechanical Prime

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• For each design release you will help review the mechanical implementation and ensure the design is manufacturable.
• Support the translation of the product’s mechanical specifications from engineering to manufacturing procedures.
• Help resolve production failures and issues during the prototype and pre-production phases of the product’s lifecycle.
• Provide support to the creation of documentation changes, including assembly procedures, work instructions and Manufacturing Execution System (MES) content.
• Support the initial builds of prototype units, collecting additional DFM information.
• Review change requests generated by engineering and production staff, and implement changes as required.
• Provide DFM feedback to the mechanical designers and product managers.
• Support any other business priorities as required within manufacturing.
• Perform the initial prototype assemblies, ensure the work instructions are accurate, and highlight any product or tooling deficiencies.
• Help train the production staff with new work instructions or tooling.
Who you are:
• Possess a strong mechanical acumen and has outstanding attention to detail
• 3-year college diploma coupled with relevant work experience.
• Ability to manage multiple priorities within a project-based environment.
• Excellent knowledge of Systems, Electro-Mechanical Manufacturing and Process Engineering.
• Knowledge of manufacturing and continuous improvement principles.
• Able to read and understand Mechanical drawings and wiring diagrams.
• Experience using AutoCAD or a relevant 3D modeling software package.
Bonus points if you have the following:
Your technical communication skills both verbal and written are important to this role along with your ability to organize and prioritize. Being goal oriented, comfortable in asking questions, possessing a can-do attitude, and able to collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams across the organization.

The SMT Line Operator is responsible for utilizing setup documents to pick components, setup parts on feeders, load on feeder carts and board labelling. This role is key to SMT production process and supports the SMT Operators, providing them with the necessary parts to allow quality production. Working in a team environment collaborating with various stakeholders to maintain stock accuracy within the SMT stock locations.

Who you report to: Manager, SMT

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Utilizing setup documents to pick components, setup parts on feeders, load on feeder carts including understanding polarity, pitch and part identification
• Fully understand the operation of the MES system with respect to on-line documentation
• Manage SMT inventory stock locations and overstock
• Handle the SMT Unplanned Shortage process
• Board labelling
• Maintaining ESD practices.
• Adhering to MSDS procedures and all Ross Safety Policies
• Other duties as assigned
Who you are:
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Detail oriented
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• Exceptional aptitude for learning
• Manufacturing experience
• Have a high school diploma
• IPC 610D knowledge
• Able to work rotational shifts

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Manufacturing experience in a PCBA SMT environment

job_description:

Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Ross Video, recently recognized as one of Canada’s top 100 companies by MediaCorp is seeking exceptionally talented and motivated professionals to join our Enterprise Management team.

Winning a top 100 award is not easy, it requires excellence in multiple dimensions:
• Work Environment
• Compensation and Benefits
• Family Friendly Policies
• Employee Engagement
• Training and Development
• Community engagement

Our ability to delight our customers with our innovative products is because they work better when combined with other Ross products. For example, our production switchers seamlessly integrate with our graphics and replay systems. This is no accident but the result of a sustained commitment to developing our Enterprise Management solutions: DashBoard, Ross Platform Manager and the softGear™ Product Line.

softGear™ is a key plank in Ross’ cloud strategy with the softGear Streaming Gateway providing the key connection between Ground and Cloud for sharing content quickly, reliably, deterministically, and securely. But softGear is also a software-based media processing platform for which we have ambitious goals. We envision it as the counterpart to our existing, Emmy award-winning openGear on-premises solutions.

Should you join this team, you’ll work with some of the latest development technologies and information security disciplines.

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

Who you report to: VP of Product, DashBoard and softGear.

What the job is all about:

Working closely with the VP of Product, Technical Product Manager, and Development Team, you will be responsible for execution of and/or participation in all product management and marketing activities related your product line and related product lines

Product Management and Product Marketing including but not limited to:

• Aligning product brand, customer, and user experience with Ross brand
• Researching market problems and competitive landscape
• Establishing a distinctive competitive market position
• Creating and sharing roadmap and release plans
• Define product positioning and messaging, maintaining updates over time to address new product capabilities, changes in industry trends, and entry into new markets. Maintain alignment of positioning and messaging with User Personas and GEOs serviced.
• Provide market problems guidance to be discussed and decided with the product team.
• Plan for and assist with outbound marketing and launch activities in collaboration with corporate marketing.
• Gather and integrate product ideas from customers, Sales, market research, and engineering into compelling and prioritized product requirements. Develop strategic multi-year product line roadmaps, including variety and timing of new product launches.
• Author and provide appropriately scoped Market Requirements for new products, new releases for existing products, and new services. Collaborate with Sales and Marketing during the creation and lead the cross-functional review and acceptance of documents to establish product and feature requirements.
• Author and provide appropriately scoped Product Requirements Documents (PRDs) to Engineering; collaborate with other stakeholders, and review with Engineering to ensure completeness of requirements specifications and acceptance.
• Identify new vertical opportunities as they emerge or are directed. Provide SME and market knowledge to cross-functional teams including Sales, Marketing, and other Business Units
• Provide strategic and detailed guidance during launch planning, defining GEO, channel, and sales strategies. Be responsible for the success of all product launches: define customer targets, sales targets, create and oversee the creation of collateral and ensure completeness.
• Define, monitor, and maintain product pricing, margins, and various business models (SaaS, volume discounted, partner, channel, OEM) and review regularly to adjust to market forces (competitors, and feedback from Sales).
• Identify Ross Video core distinctive competencies within the product line, continually developing such competencies toward further innovation and delivery of market-leading products. Provide continual consideration toward patent portfolio growth.
• Provide recommendations to the VP of Product for product and service decisions regarding introduction, evolution, market access, market growth, and product discontinuation decisions.
• Maintain a knowledgebase of Win/Loss data gathered from Sales and directly from customers. Use this data to guide new product line requirements
• Develop and implement key marketing initiatives related to the product, including:
• Promotional literature (brochures, cut sheets, etc.)
• Ads, Catalog, Website content, Product packaging
• Creation and supervision of show reels & training videos
• Participate in look & feel of manuals
• Success stories, Press releases, White papers
• Demo content supervision
• Demo/tradeshow kit supervision
• Preparation of sales and dealer information packages
• Planning for key trade shows (IBC, NAB)
• Responsible for training internal team members on named product lines
• Establish and foster community of internal and external expert users using social media engagement - Twitter, LinkedIn, Online Forums, and blogs
• Responsible for influencing and curating end-to-end customer experience, including:
• Marketing announcements
• Launch and product update announcements
• Download and access
• Product user experience
• Service and support experience

Sales Support
• Attend regular product strategy meetings and summits
• Participate in key customer demonstrations and proofs-of-performance
• Work with the sales team to design effective workflows in the pre-sales process
• Assist RSMs and BDMs with responses to tender documents and other technical questions
• Keep sales team up to date with new product status
• Work with the Product Marketing & Pricing Systems team to ensure Salesforce is maintained with recent product information

Other
• Embody Agile mindset and support Ross in the adoption of Agile practices
• Embrace the Ross Way to Market (RWTM) and contribute to its evolution and refinement over time.
• Perform other related duties as required

Who you are:
• A post-secondary degree in a related field (Engineering, Marketing)
• Experience selling & marketing broadcast equipment (preferred)
• Broadcast systems engineering experience (preferred)
• Excellent knowledge of a live production environment (preferred)
• Familiarity with software development processes
• Sales and/or marketing training
• Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint
• Positive
• Determined
• Passionate about broadcast & production industry
• Excellent writing & communication skills
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
• High tolerance of ambiguity
• Attention to detail
• Team oriented
• Problem solver
• Lateral thinker
• Organized and detail oriented
• Good teaching skills
• Able to work co-operatively with and across all company departments
• 3-5 years of experience in a Product Management role
• A solid understanding of broadcast & IT Systems
• Willing to Travel up to 10% of the time
• Valid Passport
• Valid Driver’s License

job_title: Business Coordinator- Sports & Live Events (Job Req #2023-159)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Business Coordinator is a key role in the Ross Video, Vertical Market- Sports & Live Events (SLE) team. The play an active role in achieving sales and gross profit goals for the SLE Vertical Market by developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with customers, consultants, and partners, primarily through the RFP response process.

The BC works in close partnership with their sales and business development counterparts and should drive results in RFP response management for large, specialized projects, customer retention, and new leads/opportunities. This individual must have excellent skills at developing relationships which will allow them to understand the objectives of the customer, and be extremely detail oriented as they help manage all tasks, schedules and details associated with putting together a proposal.

Other responsibilities include developing warranty & maintenance contracts to help promote customer retention, updating Salesforce.com with essential metrics, and coordinating general opportunity responses with the SLE team. As such, the BC needs to understand the sports broadcast, professional sports, collegiate sports, and the emerging esports landscape at a global level.

Who you report to: Business Manager- Sports & Live Events

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Assist with day-to-day activities to support the Sports & Live Event sales efforts globally, including preparing quotes and providing guidance to re-sellers, system integrators and clients to facilitate the purchase of Ross solutions.
• Work collaboratively with the regionally based Sales Managers and Inside Sales representatives to determine and implement the best solution for the customer
• Assist consultants with updated RFP/Tender specification data.
• Coordinate RFP/Tender responses through collaboration with Solution Architect(s).
• Ensure customer order flow by following the clean order criteria.
• Maintain accurate customer data within the corporate CRM solution (Salesforce.com).
• Ensure follow-through of opportunities by completing requests, documenting activity within Salesforce.com and setting reminders for next steps.
• Assist in coordination and liaison between the Sports & Live Events department and other internal business units.
• Assist in resolution of customer enquiries regarding equipment, supplies, and service.
• Review articles in trade publications to keep abreast of the latest developments in the Sports & Live Event production market.
• When necessary, travel to sync up with respective Regional Sales Manager or other members of the Sales Team.
• Perform other duties as assigned.

Who you are:
• Practical knowledge of sales principles, methods, practices, and techniques.
• Familiarity with the key components used in broadcast video production applications is an asset.
• Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills.
• Demonstrated ability to build and maintain lasting relationships with customers.
• Exceptional verbal communication and presentation skills.
• Strong written communication skills.
• Highly proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, etc.).
• Excellent listening skills.
• Self-motivated, with high energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm.
• High attention to detail.
• Willingness to learn.
• Strong team player.
• Strong organization and communication skills.
• Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills.
• General interest and knowledge of global sport/esport leagues.
• Ability to schedule duties/projects (multi-task).
• Ability to work unsupervised, attention to detail and an evident work ethic.
• Ability to thrive in stressful situations.
• College Diploma or University Degree in related discipline and/or equivalent work experience.
• Two years’ work experience within a sales position.
• Demonstrated experience in RFP/Tender response, opportunity qualification, account development, and time management.
• Demonstrated ability to convert prospects and close deals to exceed sales targets.
• Experience in sales forecasting & pipeline management.
• Experience with customer relationship management (CRM) software such as Salesforce.com is an asset.
• Fluent English.
• Position is based in Ross’ Ottawa office; remote or hybrid work will be considered.
• Ability to occasionally travel and attend sales events or exhibitions.

Reporting to the Director - Tax & Compliance, you will be a key member of our corporate finance team. In this newly created position, you will be responsible for indirect tax return preparations as well as assisting with completion of compliance reporting globally. The complexity of the global indirect tax obligations continues to evolve & grow, both with changing legislation and our own corporate growth, making this an exciting, challenging, and dynamic opportunity!

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Generate various financial reports such as sales, purchase, and GL account transaction reports to facilitate US sales and use tax filings
• Reconcile tax liability general ledger accounts and investigate outstanding items and process adjustment entries
• Assist Senior tax analyst to process US sales & use tax returns and payments
• Assist with US business & occupation, gross receipts, personal property tax filings
• Assist with US business registrations and renewals of tax licenses
• Assist with other indirect tax ad hoc projects, to include collecting data, responding to inquiries from taxing authorities, other departments, customers or vendors

Who You are:
• Completed degree or diploma from an accredited institution – preference for accounting/business
• Ideally one year working experience in an accounting or tax environment
• Knowledge of accounting and tax concepts and principles
• Proficiency in Microsoft office products, specifically Excel; Experience with ERP systems; Familiar with sales tax software such as Avalara and CCH
• Ability to analyze and reconcile large data sets
• Professional, friendly, and courteous in all interactions
• Great organizational and time management skills; Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy
• Strong communication skills, both verbal and written

The Demo Artist & Trainer – Generalist is responsible for performing the commissioning and training of Ross products and integrating these into the Broadcast systems at client locations globally. The position requires above average knowledge on Ross Switchers, XPression, Dashboard and Ultrix. This front line individual is responsible for managing customer expectations, completing required documentation, providing end user technical & operational training and ensuring that the system performs as specified. This key individual works closely with our Sales and Technical Services Team to ensure delivery of the Ross Superior Customer Experience.

Who you report to: Manager, Training Solutions - Sports & Graphics

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Primary activities
• Provide effective
• Onsite installation/commissioning/training services.
• Complete required documentation.

• Troubleshoot technical/systems issues at customer facilities.
• Secondary activities
• Provide support to the implementation team, as required.
• Assist with set-up/demos and attend tradeshows as needed.

Demonstrations
• On-site, off-site, online/remote customer demonstrations and tradeshow events
• Ensures integrity of the demo experience and provides feedback and input re: areas for improvement
• Setup demo equipment, assists with set-up and prepares/tests gear prior to demos

• Maintains above average knowledge base and skill set in the functionality and demonstration of Ross Video’s product lines and solutions, which include: Production Switchers, Character Generation & Graphics, Video Severs & Social Media Management.
Training
• Customer training - on-site, off-site and online training
• Internal training - other Ross staff members
• Maintains integrity of the training experience and provides feedback and input re: areas for improvement
• Maintains training equipment, assists with set-up and prepares/tests gear prior to training sessions

Commissioning
• Perform Onsite software installation/Upgrades.
• Perform Commissioning of multiple product lines.
• Perform Customer technical training services.
• Perform Complete required documentation. ie daily reports

• Perform Troubleshoot technical/systems issues at customer facilities.

• Can correct, resolve issues, solve problems both internally and externally. Problem solves by collecting, recording, and analyzing missing information. Exercises own judgment when working on customer facing projects. Raises unusual problems to Manager

• Must be able to work with a team as well as independently
• Ability to clearly communicate ideas to various audiences
• Ability to function is highly stressful situations
• Ability to learn quickly

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

This role is expected to work closely with the Sales and Services team in Oceania to ensure that
our customers receive excellent service delivery from Ross Video.

Who you report to: Director of Services- APAC & Oceania

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

This role is expected to work closely with the Sales and Services team in Oceania to ensure that
our customers receive excellent service delivery from Ross Video.

What the job is all about:

Technical Commissioning
• Install Ross Video’s broadcast solutions at the customer’s location, ensuring the full operational functionality of the products.
• Perform commissioning at the customer’s location.
• Prepare and test all commissioned gear prior to engaging the client in product training sessions.
• Troubleshoot technical/systems issues at customer facilities.
• Respond to technical support calls and follow documentation policies.
• Provide support to the implementation team, as required.
• Assist with set-up of and attend tradeshows, as needed.
Training
• Perform on-site, off-site and online/remote customer technical training.
• Provide internal training for Ross Video’s employees.
• Maintain training equipment, assist with set-up and prepare/test gear prior to training sessions.
• Maintain training equipment; assist with set-up and prepare/test gear prior to training sessions.
Technical Support
• Research, diagnose, troubleshoot, and identify solutions to resolve customer issues.
• Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers.
• Ensure proper recording and closure of all issues through Zendesk.
• Escalate unresolved issues to appropriate internal teams.
• Prepare accurate and timely reports, as needed.
• Document knowledge in the form of knowledge based technical notes and articles.
• Expedite returned material from the field for service reasons.
• Must possess a valid driver’s license and passport

Travel required 50% of the time (short-notice and international trips)

Working with the Marketing Product Managers (MPM’s) and the Technical Product Manager (TPM’s), the POM helps manage and drive each project from concept through to a successful release to manufacturing and product launch to market

The POM is responsible for managing project timeline, budget, and agreed feature set. He or she will liaise with the Manufacturing, Manufacturing Test Engineering, and Tech Support to enable smooth product sales & order process, build of required hardware/software products, and own product lifecycle support as well as tracking and respond to customer issues that have been escalated by TS to the Development.
Who you report to:

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

Project Planning Phase:
• Follows, advocates, and helps implement the corporate NPI process
• Assists in identifying the resource and material costs/requirements for the project
• Works with the project team to identify and mitigate risks - developing and documenting a risk mitigation plan
• Works with the TPM and project team in developing the project schedules. POM owns the responsibility for creation and maintenance of project schedules
• Responsible for entry and maintenance of all product information and data in SalesForce, Agile, and Max
Project Execution Phase:
• Maintains and tracks the project schedules
• Assists the TPM, where required, in the coordination of project team development activities and for the effective follow-up - facilitating communication between individuals and teams.
• Generates project meeting minutes (including action item identification, assignment and follow-up) as per the requests of the TPM.
• Tracks all Development, Product Verification, Engineering Services and Manufacturing activities and identifies any potential project issues and challenges, including resource exposures or conflicts
• Works with TPMs, MPMs, Manufacturing (including Scheduling, Test, and Procurement) in developing product BOMs for each level of all new products
• Responsible for ensuring the timely delivery of required input to the Technical Documentation team
• Responsible for providing communication on project status throughout the organization
• Ensures that project status reports are generated on time as required
Release Phase:
• Works with the MPM’s and TPM to define a product launch and deployment plan
• Works with the MPM and TPM to coordinate and ensure training is provided for Technical Support, Commissioning, Sales Engineer, and Training team
• Owns and manages the Product release checklist and is responsible for ensuring that all disciplines (manufacturing, Marketing, Developments, etc) follow through with and complete tasks required for a successful release
Product Lifecycle Management:
• Works with the Technical Support and Development teams, via an escalation process, to ensure customer satisfaction by managing and tracking any product deployment issues - providing prompt and appropriate customer communications.
• Tracks all field service issues and report on them internally as well as any required customer communications
• Where necessary, consults with the Field Service Team, TPM and MPM’s to determine any necessary actions required to resolve customer issues and/or dissatisfactions
• Responsible for maintenance (ECO, MCO, EOL, etc) of all manufacturing data for all released products
• Responsible for monitoring and maintaining manufactured product costing and reporting any appreciable changes to TPM and MPM
• Responsible for communication throughout the organization for all product updates and new code releases
Operation:
• Works with the MPM and TPM to help develop and record the Strategic Product Line Roadmap
• Provides support to entire product team on required purchases of materials, test equipment, and facility requirements

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education, engineering degree is a strong asset
• PMI Certification will be an asset
• Strong logistics and planning background
• Familiarity with the product development process and the associated requirements of manufacturing
• Familiarity with software planning and development.
• Strong knowledge of PM tools

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. The Configuration Technician will be responsible for assembling components into finished assemblies and prepare for shipping, according to customer requirements.

Who you report to: Manager, Production

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Configuring systems to meet sales order criteria which involves picking finished goods hardware from stock to populate and align into frame chassis or systems for software loads, licensing and testing according to customer requirements
• Interpret customer configuration documentation, DWI’s or Sales Order notes to meet these requirements and using these documents to verify configuration
• Create data records which associate product serial numbers to the Sales Order
• As required, perform production configuration, system level debug for hardware or system errors
• Perform light level assembly, interconnect, and fasten assemblies
• Adhere to Ross Video Health and Safety policies

Who you are:
• Must have computer proficiency with Microsoft Office and core business-use tools.
• Ability to work rotational schedule
• Ability to lift 50 lbs (large panels)
• Good organizational skills
• High initiative and ability to work as a member of a team or independently
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
• Mechanical aptitude

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Experience in a manufacturing or shipping environment

The Inside Sales Specialist is a key role in the Ross Video Sales Team, reporting to the Inside Sales Manager, EMEA. You play an active part in helping develop Ross Video’s pipeline for revenue generation through the support to the Regional Sales Managers in the field, creation of sales leads, initiation of prospect calls, and establishment of ongoing rapport with existing customers.

You will be assisting the EMEA Sales Team and are a direct extension of our front-line group of regionally based Sales Professionals, helping to work opportunities with both end users and via our authorized business partner network.

Inside Sales Specialists exude integrity, drive and passion and exceed business targets through excellent telephone sales and superb communications skills.

Who you report to: Inside Sales Manager - EMEA

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support.

What the job is all about:

• Provide overall support to assigned Regional Sales Managers.
• Handle inbound, unsolicited prospect calls and convert them into sales.
• Make outbound follow-up contact with existing customers via telephone and e-mail to determine customer satisfaction, cross-sell and up-sell opportunities.
• Advise and assist business partners, system integrators and clients concerning sales and purchase of Ross Video product line.
• Emphasize product/service features and benefits, prepare quotes, and discuss terms.
• Identify decision makers within targeted leads to begin sales process.
• Overcome objections of prospective customers.
• Work collaboratively with regionally based Sales Managers to determine and implement opportunity specific sales approaches.
• Create and escalate qualified opportunities to Regional Sales Managers.
• Ensure follow-through of opportunities by completing requests, documenting activity within Salesforce.com and setting reminders for next steps.
• Forecast sales activities and prepare periodic sales report showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion.
• Maintain and expand the company’s database of prospects by entering new customer data and updating changes to existing accounts in the corporate CRM.
• Assist in creating RFP responses.
• Set up and deliver sales presentations, product/service demonstrations, and other sales activities.
• Assist in coordination and liaison between sales department and other sales related units.
• Assist in resolution of customer complaints regarding equipment, supplies, and services.
• Monitors and evaluates the activities and products of the competition including reviewing articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments.
• Where necessary, support efforts at trade shows, exhibits, and other events.
• When necessary, travel to sync up with respective Regional Sales Manager or other members of the Sales Team

Who you are:

• Two years’ work experience within a customer facing environment
• Demonstrated ability to convert prospects and close deals to exceed sales targets
• Solid experience in opportunity qualification, pre-call planning, call control, account development, and time management
• Experience with customer relationship management (CRM) software such as Salesforce.com is an added advantage
• Experience in sales forecasting & pipeline management
• Demonstrated ability to build and maintain lasting relationships with customers
• Practical knowledge of inside sales principles, methods, practices, and techniques
• Experience/knowledge of the broadcast industry advantageous
• Familiarity with the key components used in broadcast electronics applications is an advantage
• Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills
• Exceptional verbal communication and presentation skills
• Strong written communication skills
#LI-LH1

job_title: Director of Product Management – Production Workflow (Job Req #2023-137)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Who you report to: Vice President, Production Workflow & Cloud Services

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Responsible for management and/or execution in all activities related to the marketing and product management of the Production Workflow product portfolio in co-ordination with the business unit VP, including but not limited to:
Strategy & Planning
• Work closely with the Vice President – Production Workflow (VPOP) to ensure that product line objectives are aligned with company objectives and strategies.
• Participate in discussions with the Production Workflow Senior Leadership team in formulating and administering company policies and developing long range goals and objectives.
• Ensure alignment of market trends (marketing) and technology trends (R&D).
• Work closely to ensure alignment between product roadmaps internal and external to the Production Workflow team.
Marketing & Competitive
• Oversee the development and execution of all Marketing activities for the Production Workflow product portfolio, working closely with our Corporate Marketing Team and ensuring alignment of the Product Management team within Production Workflow.
• Responsible for developing and executing the global marketing plan for the portfolio with input from the Business Development team.
• Manage marketing and time to market with R&D development realities.
• Ensure the sales and marketing of the product line follows the Ross Video Code of Ethics.
• Monitor and evaluate the activities and products of the competition.
• Gather and analyze market and competitive information.
• Review articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.
• Identify and develop new market applications and partnerships.
• Perform market analyses to determine customer needs, price schedules, and discount rates.
• Work with OEM/VAR partners in developing new market opportunities.
• Analysis of financial performance of the product portfolio, including revenue and expense across the direct business unit but also business units’ adjacencies (services, manufacturing, etc.).
Business & Sales
• Lead the Production Workflow product management team to develop and execute annual sales targets and execution strategies.
• Drive to achieve and exceed forecasted sales, gross margin, cash flow and profitability targets for the portfolio.
• Provide regular product line performance updates to the Production Workflow Senior Leadership team and Ross Video Senior Executive Team.
• Develop strategy with the Director, Business Development, and the Global Business Development team to ensure marketing and sales are aligned and the sales organization is well supported in their execution.
• Work with the global BDM team to ensure the sales team and our channel partners are trained so that they can efficiently craft customer solutions and effectively sell products.
• Advise and assist Ross sales staff and channel partners in the sales of Production Workflow solutions.
• Deliver sales and strategy presentations to end users and business partners.
• Assist in the preparation of tender responses for key opportunities.
• Where applicable, assist in the negotiation and closing of sales.
Management
• Inspire the Production Workflow product management, marketing, and development teams to be creative, push hard and achieve breakthrough results.
• Ensure that both short term tactical plans and longer-term strategic plans are developed, communicated, and executed.
• Continue to build and structure an effective Infrastructure organization.
• Work closely with HR and your managers to recruit, train and develop talented staff.

Who you are:
• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or a related field, or significant product management experience at an executive level.
• A minimum of 10 years’ experience in a product line management role
• A minimum of 10 years’ experience in the broadcast industry
• Proven ability to collaborate, influence and execute plans.
• Significant experience in developing and executing effective and measurable marketing strategy and campaigns globally.
• Strong demonstrated leadership skills
• Excellent judgment and creative problem-solving skills, including negotiation and conflict resolution.
• Innovative thinker with a track record for translating strategic thinking into action plans and output
• Excellent written, oral and presentation skills
• Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a range of stakeholders
• Proven track record for generating results
• Willing to Travel up to 25% of the time
• Valid Passport
• Valid Driver’s License
#LI-LH1

Working in the corporate Information Technology team located in Ottawa, the IT Help Desk Technician will have worldwide responsibilities to support every area of our rapidly growing employee base with key focus on supporting and deploying Windows, Linux and macOS desktops and laptops. You will maintain and contribute to the software compliance and physical asset control. You will be part of a core team that directly contributes to Ross Video’s success. Given the hands-on nature of this role, you will be expected to work from the Ottawa office on Auriga Drive three+ days a week.

Who you report to: Manager, IT Help Desk

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Front line support for 1200+ users in an international multi-site mixed-OS network environment
• Responsible for providing optimal incident response times and escalations
• Ensures software compliance initiatives are maintained and followed
• Optimizes desktop and laptop build process to reduce manual intervention and streamline processes
• Troubleshoot endpoint, or system failures
• Liaise with external providers where appropriate
• Participate in an on-call rotation to support company operations after core business hours.
• Perform other related duties as required

Who you are:
• Background in Computer Science, Information Technology or relevant experience.
• Ability to adapt and accelerate in a fast-paced environment
• Approachable with excellent communication skills
• Team player but able to work independently
• Organized, thorough, and very detail orientated
• High initiative and well-developed analytical skills
• Technical, mechanical, hands-on person
• 2-5yrs hands on experience in a fast-paced Help Desk environment
• Strong knowledge of Windows, macOS and Linux Operating Systems with a PC and hardware background
• Valid driver’s license and clean driving record, a reliable vehicle is a must
• Travel between Ottawa and Iroquois when required
• Able to work with equipment, which may involve climbing ladder to run cable, lifting computers, crouching to assemble equipment, etc.
• Lift up to 50 lbs.
Bonus points if you have the following:

• Experience in a research and development environment is an asset
• Understanding of O365 and Microsoft Office tools

As a Shipper you are responsible to pick and assemble finished goods according to the Sales order, by inserting items into appropriate box/crate based on product specifications or general overpack practices for purpose of shipment. Affixing shipping labels on packed cartons or stencils, identifying shipping information on cartons/crates. You will work with various web-based shipping tools to identify and track all manner of shipments

Who you report to: Shipping Supervisor

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Communicating verbally or by phone/email with all departments delivering goods for orders
• Communicate verbally or by phone/email with Sales Admin to coordinate invoicing activities, manage ship dates and other various requests on an order-by-order basis
• Perform hi-level verification of inbound goods, checking for damage and completeness before passing to the Receiving Department
• Fully responsible for completeness and physical integrity of all outbound shipments, including method of final packaging
• Loading/unloading of transport vehicles, in a manner which respects the schedules of Ross Video and the respective carrier
• Arrange the transportation of product between Ross Video locations/offices and assists in box assembly and material prep, assists in keeping inventory of all boxes and various shipping materials.
• Participate in keeping all storage areas neat and tidy
• Operates forklift truck to move goods between locations and loading goods onto trucks Overtime and/or shift work may be required

Who you are:
• High school diploma
• Have a working knowledge of computers and software packages such as MS Word/Excel/Outlook
• You are capable of following procedures and work logically and have experience in the use of a Forklift
• Have an attention to detail and are organized
• Solid commitment to consistent, quality work habits and you are able to work independently or as part of a team
• Display a willingness and aptitude to learn new things
• Make good choices that represent the business’ best needs
• 1-2 years experience within a warehouse or shipping environment, with a valid driver’s license and clean abstract

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Who you report to: Manager, Commercial DashBoard Development

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

To develop and deliver customized control system solutions for the production of live content such as sports, broadcast, trade show, and social media. These solutions are delivered as a creative and technical service for internal need and for our customers.

Responsible for the execution of and participation in creative and technical services activities, including, but not limited to:

Custom Application Development:
• Evaluate customer requirements to design custom user interfaces and data parsing solutions for use in broadcast environments, in particular, real time graphics applications.
• Authoring of custom software as per customer requirements. Based on these requirements solutions could be any of, or a combination of; Web applications, Native Windows applications, and DashBoard, Ross Video Ltd’s control, monitoring and workflow automation software.
• Work with the customer and Creative Services Project Manager to gain final acceptance of the user interfaces.
• Assist in the development of turnkey graphics solutions for resale that may require modified control and data parsing interfaces.
Device and Data Integration:
• Develop integrations to external data sources for use in real time graphics applications (XML, HTML, XSLT, JSON, Database, HTTP)
• Develop tight control of the XPression real time graphics system via the XPression COM API and or via external TCP/IP protocol.
• Develop control of other Ross video Products (switchers, servers, routers etc.) when required.
• Develop control of third party devices when required
• Travels to customer sites to commission field integrations with customer equipment that is not available in Ross Video Ltd’s laboratory for practical reasons. (not all cases).
Productivity Growth:
• Works with Ross team members to identify and curate commonly used devices and user interface patterns to enable increasingly rapid development of new custom solutions that are partially based on these.
• Creates and documents operational guidelines and custom scripting methods to ensure that Ross can effectively support customers in the future.

Who you are:
• B.Eng or B.Sc. required in one of the following: Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Video/Film Production
• Knowledge of object oriented software development
• Knowledge of JavaScript, C#, Visual Basic, XML, HTML, JSON, XPATH
• Knowledge of TCP/IP networking including detailed familiarity with UDP, TCP, HTTP, FTP, SLP
• Knowledge of Ross DashBoard Panel development
• Knowledge of Python would be an asset
• Team-oriented
• Ability to handle conflict in a professional and calm manner
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
• Excellent communication skills
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills
• Enthusiastic
• Problem solver
• Able to work co-operatively with Ross and end users and a good fit with our Code of Ethics and Culture Statements
• Web Application development experience is required
• Video or multimedia production experience is highly desirable
• System Integration experience
• Face time with customers
• Experience with Ross DashBoard and Ross XPression preferred.
• Experience with Ross hardware and software products preferred.
• Willing to travel on a project-by-project basis, and spend the working week at customer premises.
• Located in Australia for on-site visits
• Valid passport
• Valid driver’s license

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. What the job is all about:

• Responsible for all procurement related activities for an assigned group of commodities and/or vendors.
• Responsible for all aspects of Vendor Relationship management. Coordinates all activities related to procurement of materials, parts, equipment, and supplies beginning with intent to purchase through delivery, throughout the life of the component/part. Assures that components/parts are delivered on schedule, at the negotiated price, and that they meet the quality standards of the company. Takes corrective action to maintain the long-term viability of the supply chain.
• Responsible for evaluating demands from Production Control for the advancement of products through Manufacturing. This occurs when there is a spike in the forecast.
• Will work with the R&D Lab in the recommendation and selection of suppliers for new products.
• Analyzes all new requirements for assigned commodities to ensure timely delivery at best possible price. Works closely with R&D department to ensure NPI Requirements are met.
• Establishes best applicable supply chain practices with vendor base, including Kanban, Demand Pull, and MRP Share techniques.
• May administer MRP Share and Consignment programs
• Investigates and/or interviews potential suppliers to determine if they meet the specified requirements. Will visit these vendors during prototype development to ensure accuracy of product and quality of work.
• Solicits and evaluates quotations for the requested commodity
• Negotiates the lowest practical cost for goods balanced against optimum quality and schedule needs. Considers freight and brokerage costs in these calculations.
• Assist in the negotiation and implementation of long-term Purchase Agreements.
• Maintains timely control of orders, amendments, shipping notices, and other documents.
• Performs all rescheduling and expediting of relevant purchase orders so as to meet production plan needs while maintaining minimal inventory
• Expedites and provides timely information with regards to Shortages
• Responsible for the procurement of Purchase Requisitions for non-MRP related items and demands for samples from R&D Lab, Test Dept., Manufacturing, Sales etc.
• Maintains accurate information with regards to Standard Cost, Lead Time and other related part data.
• Drives the disposition of excess inventory through sale, return, scrap, or other measures as appropriate.
• Perform other related duties as required.

Who you are:
• Bachelor Degree or Community College diploma in a related field or equivalent work experience.
• Working towards or has PMAC certification.
• Advanced skill level with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook) and other spreadsheet/database programs
• Demonstrated experience with MRP systems
• Capable of managing several complex tasks at a time
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team
• Ability to work with technical and non-technical staff
• Well-organized, persistent, a “doer”, attentive to details and accuracy
• Excellent planning, negotiation and interpersonal skills
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills (English)
• Ability to make decisions based on the company’s best interests
• Must demonstrate the ability to work with several functional areas as well as interact with all levels of management.
• Preference will be given to those with experience in purchasing printed circuit boards, electronics components and sheet metal/machine parts in an electronics manufacturing environment
• Experience in the Broadcast industry is an asset

If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Be part of a cross-functional team that is designing, developing and testing distributed, scalable and highly available applications, tools and services that tie together live video production technology across multiple locations. We are building software that will revolutionize the industry by leveraging a move to distributed architecture and cloud-based infrastructure. As part of this, we are seeking a Product Verification Specialist to drive product quality and ensure all software components provide a reliable, user-friendly and performant experience for our customers. The successful candidate will be obsessed with quality improvement and automated tests for regression and new features.

Who you report to: Software Manager, RPM

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Develop a comprehensive test plan and test cases based on new product features, customer requirements or identified problems
• Identify test scenarios that are critical and repetitive and automate them
• Report bugs with quality descriptions and work closely with the development team to see through and verify fixes
• Develop integration tests in collaboration with other product teams to ensure interoperability and a smooth end-to-end workflow for end-users
• Support ongoing software development efforts which means participating in Agile based SDLC – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, documentation, testing and maintenance

Who you are:
• Good understanding of testing at scale, performance and software reliability
• Knowledge of one or more scripting languages such as Python and JavaScript
• Knowledge of one or more test automation tools such as Selenium, JUnit, Robot Framework, JMeter and Cucumber
• Desire and ability to reach out to other teams, visit customers and learn how software is used in a live video production environment
• Ability to work and collaborate in a team setting with an open, collaborative communication style
• Ability to function in both Windows, Linux and MacOS environments
• Preferred qualifications (the following skills are not required but would be considered assets):
• Experience with live video production technology – if you have directed a live event, worked with a production switcher, operated a television camera or been in broadcast IT - consider it a bonus (but it is not a requirement for this role)
• Experience automating test cases (API level testing and user-level automation)
• Experience developing automated tests in a distributed environment
• Experience in functional testing
• Experience utilizing tools and scripts to test and optimize performance
• Experience with Docker and VMWare
• Intermediate Experience in Linux is an asset
• Experience with Git is an asset
• Ability and desire to travel – not a requirement for this role but the opportunity may present itself if you enjoy interacting with and learning from your end-users as a product expert

• Utilizing setup documents to pick components, setup parts on feeders, load on feeder carts including understanding polarity, pitch and part identification

• Handle the SMT Unplanned Shortage process
• Board labelling
• Maintaining ESD practices.
