The Facilities Team is responsible for designing and maintaining the leased global facilities, as well as providing facilities services to all Ottawa staff. We are a customer service team with Ross Video staff being our primary customers and are looking for a dynamic, customer focused self-starter to join our Facilities team as Physical Security Administrator

Working with the corporate Facilities team located in Ottawa, the Physical Security Administrator will report to and work closely with the Director, Global Facilities to support all facilities activities globally. This will include monitoring security procedures, reviewing and amending security policy, ensuring compliance with all aspects of the program including physical and administrative security systems and procedures. May conduct security briefings and maintains security education programs for physical security. Investigates security violations; may recommend corrective action. Assists in revision of procedure manuals ana may interface with outside agencies if required. The incumbent will be responsible for initiating and managing service provider contracts, budgets, procurement, vendor performance reviews, and responsible for ensuring that all activities are undertaken in accordance with Ross Policies and Procedures.

Who you report to: Director, Global Facilities

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Installing and monitoring security alarm and systems, conducting physical inspections according to protocols, and performing regular maintenance checks on security systems to ensure its quality and efficiency
• Ensures sites are following the security policies, procedures, and processes
• Maintain facility security and personnel security documentation and files in accordance with the policies and procedures
• Responsible to maintain appropriate facility security databases
• Develop and maintain visitor control functions including visitor logs and procedures for issuing visitor badges
• Working with H&S, develop emergency procedures for bomb threat, active shooter, force protection, Anti-Terrorism, fire evacuation and follows all checklists
• Responsible to create documentation/reports as they relate to security incidents that occur within the Ross premises
• Review security violation reports and handle and document approved exceptions
• Coordinate security assessments, tests, and/or reviews to ensure proper protection and/or corrective measures are taken when necessary
• Conduct audits as required on physical premises as well as the access control systems in use across the organization
• Responsible for developing and maintaining processes for tracking company issued access cards and or keys
• Provide a security briefing for new employees as well as annual refresher briefings for staff
• Excellent communication skills requiring a high degree of diplomacy and ability to deal with and influence persons at all levels of the organization
• Responsible for directing and coordinating services, for repairs and related activities for security systems
• Maintain applicable program directives, regulations, manuals, and guidelines.
• When requested generate activity reports from monitoring systems, tools, and applications
• Provide assistance to the business units in identifying and implementing appropriate physical security measures
• Collect research in terms of best practices, business processes, and procedures
• Compile and disseminate metrics for the department
• Work with management to provide effective mitigation of reported security concerns and complaints
• Provide recommendations and participate in the development of new policies and procedures to ensure continuous improvement in the physical security of Ross sites
• Perform other related duties as required.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education in Police Foundations, Public Safety, Law, other related field and Three (3) years’ experience required. Equivalent work experience in Security administration will be considered.
• Demonstrated positive working relationship with internal and external customers.
• Possess a high degree of originality, creativity, initiative requiring minimal supervision
• Knowledge of MS Office suite software including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
• Be a self-starter with ability to operate with minimal supervision.
• Demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent organizational skills, adept at multi-tasking and initiating projects.
• Ability to organize and prioritize tasks.
• Ability to handle multiple concurrent demands while maintaining a professional attitude
• Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively collaborate with all levels of the organization, including Senior Management.
• Ability to respond quickly and accurately to all client requests; strong trouble-shooting skills
• Attentive to detail and accuracy
• Strong-working knowledge of MS-Office package and general computer software
• Knowledge of Ross Video products and/or broadcast/television production an asset.
• May require travel to Global facilities
• Able to lift 25lbs

The Technical Support Specialist is responsible for providing technical support remotely and onsite through remote sessions, ticketing systems, phone support on a as needed basis for Ross Video products, we assist customers in resolving issues by providing solutions to technical and service problems and provides the “Superior Customer Experience” through effective handling of customer issues or concerns. We work with some amazing customers, and you will get to be a part of helping them make an impact on their audiences. Please take a look at some of our Success Stories!

https://www.rossvideo.com/company/customers/

Who you report to: Manager, Technical Support - Ottawa

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

What the job is all about:
• Assist Customers with technical setup questions, troubleshooting efforts, and product specific solutions.
• Take ownership of customer issues reported and seeing problems through to resolution
• Research, diagnose, troubleshoot, and identify solutions to resolve issues
• Follow standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams
• Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers
• Empowering our customers to get the most of their products and solutions.
• Ensure proper recording and closure of all issues through a tracking system
• Prepare accurate and timely reports, as needed
• Document knowledge in the form of knowledge base technical notes and articles
• Expedite returned material from the field for service reasons
• Provide effective installation and commissioning services, technical product training and on-site support, as required. This may require travel on short notice.

Who you are:
• Technical diploma and knowledge of broadcast systems
• Customer service experience in a technical support environment
• Must be proficient in the English language (read, write, speak)
• Excellent trouble shooting and debugging skills
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
• Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, listening, and questioning skills
• Keen attention to detail with accurate record keeping
• Must be able to work with a team as well as independently
• Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
• Must possess a valid driver’s license and passport

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Additional education and computer courses are strong assets
• Prior knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM systems will be an asset
• Prior knowledge of Zendesk or other ticketing systems will be an asset
• Multilingual

The Ross/D3 Field Systems Engineer (FSE) has responsibility for providing comprehensive technical support to key customer accounts. This includes identifying, analyzing, and solving complex technical issues, including module level and system level issues and problems. This can include analysis of the system configuration, customer signal content, network design and configuration, and overall system performance. This can also include consultation with the customer about ongoing performance, maintenance, and modifications to the system. The FSE has accountability for customer satisfaction and provides a key technical interface for key and critical customer accounts.

Who you report to: Manager, LED Field Services

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Monitor and manage all installed systems including network connections, power system performance, front end control systems, and LED display panels
• Evaluate existing systems and provide technical direction to customer technical staff
• Design and deploy customer requested changes to system configuration. Refer complex changes or requests for upgrades to the Ross/D3 Sales team and provide a technical link to the quotation process for upgrades or expansion.
• Install new or modified equipment at customer locations to ensure full functionality according to specifications
• Ensure a timely response to any technical issues, assessing the impact to customer operations and escalating as needed
• Provide customer consultation on proper operation and basic maintenance of system
• Manage and control tools, test equipment, technical documentation, and other assigned equipment
• Maintain operating systems, application software, and system management tools

Who you are:
• This role requires a self-motivated, results-oriented professional with a strong technical aptitude and a passion to succeed
• Ability to work independently, resolve technical engineering issues without detailed direction, and work as part of a team
• Experience with complex video and audio systems including digital signal processing, network control, and high-performance LED displays.
• Ability to build and configure Linux & Windows workstations and front-end systems
• Ability to provide advanced network troubleshooting
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
• Demonstrated ability to serve in a technical leadership role
• Demonstrated ability to analyze and solve complex technical problems in a customer facing role
• A Bachelor's degree in electronics/mechatronics engineering, or applicable computer science degree, preferred
• CCNA, Network+ preferred
• Minimum of five (5) years prior experience in an advanced technical role required
• Minimum of five (5) years prior experience in a customer facing role
• Must have or be able to obtain a valid passport.
• Valid Driver's License required to drive to customer locations
• Travel by car and air, with overnight travel required 25-50%

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

What the job is all about:
• Serve as a key member of the EMEA Management Team, centered on Continuous Improvement for the whole EMEA region
• Responsible for the overall hiring, motivation and management of Regional Sales Managers (RSMs) in their team. Working with the DOS EMEA, this includes recruitment, mentoring, coaching and evaluating team members while driving a culture of performance
• Devise and deploy sales goals and objectives focusing on existing and new business and channel partnerships within the region, including the preparation of sales quotas and budgets

The Internal Audit Analyst will work closely with pertinent internal stakeholders (e.g., Ross legal team, IT) and third-party consultants to design, implement, and manage non-financial audit controls across the organization. This role will be critical in ensuring Ross Video’s operations comply with pertinent industry frameworks (e.g., ISO 27001) and regulations (e.g., PIPEDA, GDPR, CCPA).
This position is most appropriate for a candidate with 2-3 years of public audit experience who now seeks to spearhead an internal audit program at an established, high-growth technology company.

Who you report to: Manager, Corporate IT Security & Compliance

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Collaborate with the IT Security team to implement non-financial audit controls across the organization to meet Ross Video’s regulatory (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and contractual requirements.
• Regularly conduct audit checks against all non-financial internal controls.
• In alignment with internal audit cycles, publishing internal audit reports for management and senior management to communicate the adequacy of internal controls; and identifying controls which need to be revised or otherwise improved, as applicable.
• Working with other members of the Corporate Security and Compliance team to catalogue ongoing audit evidence collected to facilitate or otherwise expedite desired program outcomes with independent third-party audit service providers
Who you are:
• REQUIRED: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Management Information Systems, Commerce, Finance, or a similar area of study.
• REQUIRED: Two (2) or more years of prior experience on an internal audit, or an external audit (“public audit”) team required
• Experience performing internal control reviews and working alongside external auditors to complete audit assessments (e.g., SOC1, SOC2, ISO 27001)
• Experience performing SOC, PCI, HIPAA, ISO 27001, or similar information security & data privacy advisory engagements
• Experience leading projects and successfully executing against fixed time constraints
• Basic understanding and experience planning and coordinating the stages to perform technology-focused audits and assessments
• Knowledge of internal controls and professional standards and regulations (e.g., SOC2, ISO 27001, FedRAMP)
• Knowledge of data analytics and emerging technologies beneficial
• Prior experience as a software developer, or otherwise conversant with software development practices is desirable.
• Capable of working in a deadline driven environment with a focus on details and accuracy
• Solid analytical and diagnostic skills and ability to break down complex issues and implementing appropriate resolutions
• Ability to translate the deep technical details within your area of expertise to non-technical or otherwise unversed staff
• Ability to successfully multi-task while working independently and within a group environment
• The successful candidate will possess a strong desire to pursue continuing education in the form of industry certifications and licenses (e.g., CISA, CIA, CRISC)
• Candidate must be available and willing to travel occasionally (up to 10%) to other offices to conduct onsite audit activities, as required
One or more of the following certifications:
• Certified Public Accountant (CPA)
• Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)
• ISO 27001 Lead Auditor certification
• Certified Internal Auditor (CIA)
• Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC)
Proficiency in the following software applications, operating systems, and platforms:
• REQUIRED: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel and Word
• Prior experience working with Unix and Windows OS’s
• Prior experience auditing systems and controls in cloud platforms Azure and AWS

• Provide HR insights to help create & drive talent development strategic priorities in assigned client groups, including workforce planning and talent acquisition, manager and employee development, succession planning, and role of the leader
• Coach leaders to foster increased employee engagement, inclusion and organization performance
Who you are:
• University degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or related discipline, and/or equivalent work experience in an HR team
• Minimum 6-8 years of progressive HR Business Partner or HR Advisor experience, preferably in a high-tech environment; experience partnering with R&D teams highly desired
• Demonstrated knowledge and understanding in the management of all aspects of HR functions
• Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively collaborate with all levels of the organization, including Senior Management
• Ability to deal with confidential information with a high degree of diplomacy; ability to build trusted relationships
• Experience coaching and mentoring managers and employees
• Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment
• Organized and very detail orientated but also able to see the big picture
• Strong-working knowledge of MS-Office package and general computer software; familiarity with Ceridian Dayforce an asset
Ross Video enjoys a hybrid work environment. This position requires on-site presence in our Ottawa office, with working from home possible the rest of the time. Occasional travel to visit remote client group locations may be required.

Order Management is an integral part of Ross’ success and a key contributor to Manufacturing Operations. An Order Management Agent’s primary responsibility is to manage the activities required to process and effectively deliver customer orders. You support various geographic sales territories, ensuring that orders are clean and processed in a timely fashion, that product and delivery requirements are communicated properly to Production Planning, and that shipping logistics are efficiently managed and meet Ross’ Compliance Policy. Order Management Agents project confidence while demonstrating organization, acute attention to detail, and creative problem-solving skills.

Who you report to: Manager-Order Management

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Order Verification:
• Reviews PO and Sales Force opportunity to ensure accuracy of all details whilst ensuring all contact information, shipping details, financial requirements, and product configuration is completed and approved. Confirm end user contact information is accurate and available.
Order Confirmation:
• Ensures payment terms are in place and requests payment if required. Acknowledge orders and set expectations with customers to determine a fulfillment plan. Manage any order changes and work as a liaison between Production Planning and Customer to determine a ship date.
Shipping Preparation for Sales Orders and Loans:
• Prepares customs clearance documentation specific to the region and schedules freight forwarders, while working with shipping to effectively carry out the logistics plan. You will also work with Logistics and Compliance Specialists to ensure that the routing plan is compliant and reduces cost and risk. Provide shipment tracking details to customer and maintain an archive of logistics documents.
Manage Sales Swaps/RMAs:
• Manages assets and credits within customer account and where required develop and execute a return shipment plan, other duties that may be assigned

Who you are:
• A working knowledge of Salesforce.com.
• Above average knowledge of MS Word, MS Excel, Outlook (E-Mail) programs.
• Knowledge of CUSMA (formerly NAFTA)/Customs/Harmonization Codes/Country of Origin.
• Proficient typing/word processing skills.
• Understanding of Export controls (denied parties, ECCN).
• A post-secondary education in a related field is a definite asset.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• A professional and confident communications manner.
• Solid organization and problem-solving skills
• Ability to schedule duties/projects (multi-task).
• Ability to work unsupervised, attention to detail and an evident work ethic.
• Desire to contribute to a team environment.
• Ability to handle stressful situations.
• Ability to be flexible and adaptable to changing processes as process is improved.
• 2-3 years’ experience working in an office setting.

Other:
• Must be able to start work as early as 8 am and stay as late as 6 pm to provide coverage for time zones. It is an 8 hour day plus 30 minute unpaid lunch and start times will vary.
• Must be flexible to work from home, the Iroquois office and occasionally, the Ottawa offices
• Restrictions apply for time off on the last business day of each month. This is to ensure the team is fully staffed to support order booking.
• Travel to various industry events may be required.
#LI-PC1

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. The successful candidate will work closely with the development team; planning, designing, and executing manual and automated tests for robotic camera systems in the Ross Robotics product line. The candidate will also be responsible for implementing test lab best practices. The position will primarily be focused on the testing of mechanical and electrical products but will also cover software and cross-discipline projects. This position is located at our Ottawa Research & Development facility.

Who you report to: Product Operations Manager

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

Test Planning: Under the supervision of the Product Operations Manager
• Assist the Product Operations Manager in determining work priorities, assigning tasks, creating schedules and monitoring progress
• Support Agile development methodologies including the Modified Agile for Hardware Development (MAHD) Framework
• Attend Product Requirements review and participate in technical debates
• Participates in analysis and design walkthroughs
• Providing input to the design team to ensure that testing considerations are incorporated in the design (design for testability)
• Provide manager with detailed test estimates for project planning purposes
• Translate the detailed requirements to a comprehensive test plan
• Modify existing test plans and testing information to correct errors, to adapt to new use case scenarios, upgraded interfaces and performance enhancements
• Participate in detail reviews of test plans
• Manage test plans and test cases in Jira

Test Execution: Under the supervision of the Product Operations Manager
• Accountable for the quality of work delivered for the specific project
• Effective test case execution with real time status updates of the results using Jira
• Analyze and troubleshoot test case failures resulting in an action plan
• Provide accurate and detailed bug reporting throughout the testing process
• Assist product development in the investigation/reproducibly of product issues
• Be aware of and provide input to the automation effort
• Maintain test cases throughout the product development cycle
• Participate, when required, with the multi-functional team in bug triages
• Provide regular status report updates to the management team

Robotics: Under the supervision of the Product Operations Manager and Technical Product Manager
• Provide test support for new robotics products
• Provide test support for robotics sustainment and customer issues
• Perform structural and performance testing on robotics design
• Work with manufacturing and manufacturing test teams to ensure that testing is consistent across teams

Lab prime: Under the supervision of the Product Operations Manager
• In depth understanding of lab best practices
• Participate in CMS lab User Group
• Implement and enforce lab and workplace safety practices
• Maintain lab assets, tools, and equipment
• Manage the use and sharing of physical lab assets
• Develop and build test environments

Other duties: Under the supervision of the Product Operations Manager
• Act as an occasional trainer for existing and new PV employees
• Assist the customer support team with customer quality issues.
• Participate in postmortems reviews, what worked, what didn’t, what can we do better
• Provide suggestions/plans for ongoing improvements and overall efficiencies to the Ottawa Lab
• Provide feedback to the Product Operations Manager on the team’s performance and recommend ways to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
• Follow company policies and procedures
• Perform other related duties as required
#LI-KF1

job_title: Software Developer - Linux & Operating Systems (Job Req #2023-119)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Be part of the team that develops cutting-edge Carbonite series of switchers for indoor, outdoor, broadcast, and performance settings. Our development team builds sophisticated hardware and software solutions from the ground up to provide our customers with the tools they need to get their creative vision on the air.
We're looking for a Linux expert to be part of our team which works on low-level operating system design and maintains and provides packages so that our existing and new platforms can be developed. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in layered operating system designs, have done so in shipping products, and have excellent knowledge of popular Linux-based operating systems such as Ubuntu, Fedora, Centos etc.

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries, comprehensive health plans, and several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, a fitness/wellness allowance, an employee share ownership program, development support, and many fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we've got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Be a part of a larger team to provide technical leadership and architecture, and implement our embedded application platforms on our existing and new switcher products.
• Own and participate in the design of highly customized Linux-based operating systems for our applications to work.
• Collaborate with the leadership, software team and product management to strive for a great user experience and utilize all our hardware can provide.
• Provide design and code reviews for fellow team members promoting high-quality work, sound software methodologies and attention to detail.
• Set up and documentation scalable automated software/firmware build and release pipelines, and continuous integration flows using platforms such as GitLab and Jenkins.
• Working with the R&D team to ensure the availability of software builds and infrastructure that support multiple development threads across projects during all phases of product development, from prototype to release.
• Keeping systems current and secure, including deploying updates and migrating legacy build systems to new build infrastructure.
• Working directly with the IT team for setup, administration and maintaining the availability of existing and new development tool systems

Who you are:
• You have strong software development skills, familiarity with Linux operating systems, and an open-source background.
• You have experience building customized and modular Linux-based operating systems for embedded systems.
• Familiar with DevOps concepts, CI platforms and Development tools (git, svn, GitLab, Jenkins)
• Familiar with shell scripting and various software package build flows, including those based on gnu make, CMake, Autotools etc.
• Familiarity with Linux distributions, package management (e.g. apt) and container tools (e.g. Docker)
• Familiarity with automation of embedded systems build systems, flows, and tooling (e.g. buildroot, yocto) is highly preferred
• Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work as part of a team or independently as required
• Familiarity with networking protocols, such as protocol buffers, gRPC, TCP/IP, and UDP technologies, is a plus.
• Direct development experience in embedded systems and application software is strongly preferred
• Automated building experience through tools such as Make, CMake, and bash scripting with DevOps tools such as Jenkins is a must.
• Familiarity with software development skills in languages such as C/C++ with strong debugging skills is a plus.
• Development experience with a thorough understanding of object-oriented software design, data structures, algorithms and data storage is an asset.
• Minimum 5 years of software build infrastructure / DevOps or equivalent related experience preferred
#LI-KF1

As a Software Manager, you are the technical lead for a team of software developers and product verification specialists. You will be involved in multiple aspects of the team’s development, with both technical and management responsibilities.

You will be responsible for maximizing the personal growth, productivity, and happiness of your reporting team members. You’re a person with an exceptional balance of technical and inter-personal skills, with the ability to harmonize both to mentor reports to success. It will be your job to build a strong bond with your reports and solidify a good manager-report trust relationship. Through this, you will gain a good understanding of the report’s personal goals and motivations and guide them in attaining success. You will be the representative of your reports when it comes to team culture, work-life balance, and career development. To be successful in this role, you must be passionate about building people into the best version of themselves.

• Create an environment where teams can focus and be productive

• Work with reports in building and executing on personal development missions
• Set employee goals and monitor progress towards achieving goals
• Provide ongoing feedback and conduct employee performance reviews
• Handle leave and time management for reports
• Participate in compensation planning for reports to ensure fair representation
• Hold the team accountable for delivering sprint commitments
• Amalgamate and communicate feedback from multiple sources to reports
• Occasionally assist the scrum team in completing sprint tasks

• Strong technical abilities with knowledge of advanced principles related to relevant technologies
• Exceptional leadership skills
• Exceptional interpersonal skills
• Exceptional communication skills
• Exceptional innovation and visionary skills
• Good organizational abilities and time management skills

With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Ross Video is looking for a senior level Manufacturing Test Developer that will help manufacturing build, test, then deliver high performing equipment used in the broadcast industry. You will collaborate on the development of a scalable manufacturing test and data system, that performs thorough PCBA investigation, functional product testing, data collection, and report generation. The system supports dozens of product categories and needs to ensure every product shipped exceeds the users’ expectations.
You will work alongside experts in test development, hardware, and software design, in our manufacturing facility is in Iroquois, Ontario. Which is approximately a 30-minute drive from Kemptville, Cornwall and Brockville, or a 45-minute drive from southern Ottawa.

Who you report to: Manager, Test development

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Collaborate with the test development team and R&D to understand the current technology under test and establish the necessary test requirements and plans
• Lead large NPI and Test Development projects.
• Help to Mentor junior developers.
• Design, develop, and implement automated and semi-automated test solutions for the various levels of product assembly
• Support the manufacturing staff, leveraging your knowledge of the products and the test station implementations
• Create and maintain support documentation for use by the Test Team, Manufacturing, and R&D
• Find and advise on improvements within test coverage, test times, product support, test system scalability, and quality efficiencies
• Make updates to the existing test scripts and test procedures based on engineering change orders
• Competently interpret electrical schematics and PCBA design files
• Capable of operating and interfacing with a wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.).
• Possess the knowledge and/or ability to learn scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, Python, etc.
• Capable of independently designing and developing manufacturing test solutions
• Ability to learn an object-oriented language and basic database interfacing
• Ability to transfer knowledge to others and welcomes the ideas and inputs of their peers
• Occasional travel to suppliers, partners, and other Ross Video sites may be required
Who you are:
• Undergraduate degree related to electrical engineering, computer engineering, computer science or equivalent education plus experience.
• Multiple years of experience with electronic hardware, with a good understanding of electronic theory, specifically digital components such as CPU’s, FPGA, flash, etc.
• Ability to comprehend electrical schematics and PCBA design files
• Familiarity with a wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.).
• Knowledge and/or ability to learn scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, Python, etc.
• Knowledge of data acquisition concepts such as TCP/IP, RS232, USB, and CAN
• A self-starter and problem solver that is not afraid to take on new challenges and initiate improvements
• Ability to transfer knowledge to others and welcomes the ideas and inputs of their peers

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Understanding of JTAG and Boundary Scan concepts
• Knowledge / experience of electronics manufacture, Lean Manufacturing, 5S
• Ability to learn an object-oriented language and basic database interfacing
#LI-PC1

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

Working within the Corporate Information Technology team located in Ottawa, the IT SA will have the responsibility to develop and guide the deployment of Ross Video’s next phase of hybrid IT infrastructure (Cloud and On-Prem). Liaising with the various stakeholders across Ross Video, the IT SA will identify future IT requirements and provide the technical leadership and skills transfer to meet these needs. Furthermore, the IT SA will design and manage the framework Ross IT will follow to expand into the Cloud while leveraging existing on-premises infrastructure investments such that operational ease of use, technical, compliance and licensing requirements are met. As part of a core team that directly contributes to Ross Video’s global success, this role will help support Ross Video’s rapid growth across our global operations.

Who you report to: Manager, IT Infrastructure

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Contribute to the definition, development, and implementation of policies, standards, and procedures that mitigate risk and maximize security, service availability, efficiency, and effectiveness of the Ross IT infrastructure.
• Accountable to establish strong collaborative relationships with various leaders and functional teams across the organization to identify where IT can support business needs and goals.
• Design, build and manage hardware and software solutions that are scalable, and improve current IT solutions.
• Provide mentorship and technical leadership to the larger Ross IT team to ensure day to day administration of on-premise and cloud solutions continue to meet or exceed operational expectations.
• Ensure systems and processes are compliant with data privacy, protection and other regulatory requirements.
• Liaise with vendors and service providers globally to evaluate and ensure both efficient and cost-effective acquisition of relevant cloud and on-prem based technology solutions.
• Ensure solutions are designed with the ability to enable appropriate chargeback reporting.
• Contribute to Project Management for future projects to ensure timelines and budget are maintained.
• Participate in Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity exercises to identify areas of improvement on an as needed basis.
• Provides input to the overall IT Budget for Software, *aaS, and Hardware related expense planning.

Who you are:
• Degree in Information Technology or equivalent related experience
• Deep understanding of IT System Architecture, with a focus on building operational excellence in a hybrid compute infrastructure and ensuring data protection.
• Partner with Corporate Security to design vulnerability and risk mitigation in at the start of projects.
• Awareness of current global data privacy regulations and tools
• Knowledge of best practices and standards across the IT organization
• Experience in building and delivering IT related strategies
• Ability to coach and mentor team members.
• Excellent written and oral communication skills.
• Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to translate clearly from a deep technical level to non-technical team members.
• Strong conflict management and negotiating skills.
• Superior analytical, evaluation, and problem-solving abilities.
• 10+ years of IT architecture and deployment experience in hybrid environments.
• Strong understanding of risk management concepts
• Understanding and application of current and emerging IT trends, to further business requirements.
• Current understanding of emerging threats and countermeasures
• Experience operating in a R&D and Manufacturing environment
• Valid driver’s license and clean driving record, a reliable vehicle is a must.
• Travel as required.
• Valid Passport

#LI-JF1

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion

The Hardware Manager will provide leadership and guidance to a talented and innovative team to deliver products for the next generation of Ross Camera Motion System products,and support the existing products in the market with relevant features, product compliance change and in-house manufacturing support.

Who you report to: Vice President, Camera Motion Systems

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Responsible for the quality of the products developed by your team.
• Guide the team to develop innovative and cost-effective solutions with a focus on designing for manufacture.
• Advise and make recommendations on matters relating to mechanical and hardware design, in order to provide a basis for decision making and planning, eg, motors, controllers, materials, power requirements, etc.
• Work closely with TPM, Software Manager and other teams as necessary to ensure appropriate HW/SW interfaces and partitioning of the design
• Respond to internal and customer issues regarding mechanical and hardware projects, focus on communications and delivery of resolutions
• Support the production team to enhance the manufacturability of existing products.
• Approve/create mechanical and hardware design specifications in response to Product Design Requirements
• Contribute to the new product introduction processes for our Camera Motion Systems team to deliver products for the broadcast market and other vertical markets.
• Responsible for designing products which can be easily manufactured in-house or at an external contractor.
• Admin/systems work to ensure our designs and modifications/changes are fully handed over to manufacturing and supply chain, focusing on zero excess stoc.
• Encourage documentation of solutions and decisions.
• Provide day-to-day guidance, leadership and support to the mechanical and hardware design teams, including managing schedules, verification of work, and monitoring progress, while working with the TPM and project operations manager (POM) to keep projects on track.
• Oversee HR related activities for the team including training, career development, recruitment and performance management including skills matrix and on-boarding.
• Responsible for the input to the roadmap from a mechanical and hardware viewpoint by contributing to what is possible and providing solutions to customer problems.
• Supporting projects from a design, resource, planning, forecasting viewpoint.
• Work closely with the TPM, POM and other managers to drive projects to completion
• Become an expert in Ross Camera Motion System products
• Perform other related duties as required

Who you are:
• Mechatronics experience preferred, mechanical and/or hardware essential.
• Proven design experience – innovation, within budget and timescales of project.
• Expert in managing hardware and mechanical projects including task breakdowns, effort estimates, schedules and tracking
• Knowledge of professional broadcast standards and equipment
• Above average Linux/PC/Windows computer skills
• Degree in relevant Engineering discipline
• Minimum of three years as a technical team lead or in a management role
• 8+ years of mechatronics / mixed discipline development experience
• Strong understanding of design process and requirements, ideally Agile experience
• Experience of NPI / Manufacturing support
• Experience in cost reduction and customer driven products
• Experience in architecture design
• Willingness to travel – Ottawa office based, manufacturing in Iroquois once per month and customer sites as required
• Self-starter, quick learner and are able to work with minimum supervision in meeting schedules and project deadlines.
• Ability to manage multiple projects and competing deadlines.
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills.
• High degree of technical skepticism to detect hidden problems before they become a crisis.
• Organized and very detail oriented.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The Finance Director - Spidercam shall be responsible for the management of overall financial operations of the Spidercam Group and will work with the VP Camera Motion Systems Ross Video and CEO Spidercam and Director of Financial Operations Ross Video to provide accurate and timely information, including financial analysis, management reporting and consolidated financial statements for the Spidercam group. They will be responsible for integrating Spidercam into the Ross Video suite of systems and ensuring that appropriate internal controls, policies and procedures are in place. The Finance Director will be responsible for overseeing the budget and forecasting process and providing financial analysis to support business proposals. They will also oversee the accounting functions including payroll, credit & collections, accounts payable, fixed assets, general ledger and the preparation of the consolidated financial results. The Finance Director will be responsible for transitioning to a new ERP system (Infor) as implemented by Ross Video in approximately one year’s time.

Who you report to: Director of Corporate Financial Operations Ross Video and dotted line to VP Camera Motion Systems Ross Video and CEO Spidercam

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Responsible for the accounting operations of Spidercam producing accurate and timely month-end accounts and statutory reports, maintaining the general ledger, trial balance and preparation of consolidated financial statements
• Provide financial support to the operation including financial analysis for new contracts and sales proposals
• Coordinate and prepare the annual budget and quarterly forecasts for submission to the Ross Video FP&A team
• Responsible for overseeing vendor management, accounts payable and treasury
• Responsible for overseeing credit and collections
• Work in conjunction with the Ross Video tax and compliance team to assist in the preparation of local tax return filings, commodity and customs filings / documentation and transfer pricing
• Establish and monitor internal controls to ensure that accounting activities are in accordance with established legal regulatory and company policies and procedures.
• Prepare financial information and working papers for monthly, quarterly and year end statutory reports and government filings as required
• Liaison with accounting and tax auditors / regulatory officials
• Lead the local transition to new ERP system
• Perform other related duties as required.

Who you are:
• University degree in Business/Accounting, with advanced degree or professional accounting designation (CA, CPA, CGA, CMA) or European equivalent
• 7+ years of financial experience with strong knowledge of financial analytics, financial accounting and management reporting.
• Thorough knowledge of all relevant statutory reporting requirements specifically in Austria and Germany
• Advanced knowledge of MS Office and Excel and general ledger software packages
• Effective communication and interpersonal skills – both verbal and written in at a minimum English and German
• High initiative and well-developed analytical skills
• Highly collaborative approach to problem solving
• Strong organization skills and attention to detail
Location / Travel
• This role is located in Feistritz im Rosental, Austria with options for working remotely in the short term
• Will be required to travel to other Spidercam locations as required (Hamburg, Germany and Atlanta, US, Canada)
• Flexible to potentially relocate to Germany if required

Finanzdirektor/in– Spidercam

Berichtet an: Den/Die Direktor/in für finanzielle Angelegenheiten des Unternehmens ) Director of Corporate Financial Operations) Ross Video und (weisungsgebunden; „gepunktete“ Linie) an die/den Vizepräsidenten/in für Camera-motion-Systeme von Ross Video und die/den CEO von Spidercam
Direkte Berichte von: Angestellte Buchhaltung

Überblick über die Position
Die/Der Finanzdirektor/in-Spidercam ist verantwortlich für die Abwickelung von sämtlichen finanziellen Angelegenheiten des Spidercam Konzerns und wird, um akkurate und pünktliche Information bezüglich finanzieller Analyse, Berichten der Geschäftsführung und fundierten Stellungnahmen zu den Finanzen bereitzustellen, eng mit der/dem Vizepräsidentin/en von Camera-motion-Systeme Ross Video, der/dem CEO von Spidercam und der/dem Direktor/in für finanzielle Angelegenheiten von Ross Video zusammenarbeiten. Die Verantwortlichkeit betrifft die Integration von Spidercam in das Systemumfeld von Ross Video und die Sicherstellung, dass die angemessenen internen Kontrollen, Richtlinien und Vorgänge eingehalten werden.
Die/Der Finanzdirektor/in ist für die Überwachung des Budgets, die Prognose des Prozesses und das Zurverfügungstellen von finanziellen Analysen zur Unterstützung von Geschäftsvorschlägen zuständig.
Der/Die Finanzdirektor sind auch zuständig für die Überwachung des Rechnungswesens, was die Lohnabrechnung, Kredite und Forderungen, Verbindlichkeiten, Anlagevermögen, die Hauptbuchführung und die Vorbereitung der festgelegten finanziellen Ergebnisse beinhaltet. Die/Der Finanzdirektor wird, wie von Ross Video eingeführt, für den Übergang in ein neues ERP-System (Infor) in voraussichtlich einem Jahr zuständig sein.

Verpflichtungen, Zuständigkeiten und Verantwortung:
• Zuständig für die Durchführung der Buchhaltung von Spidercam, was die Erstellung von pünktlichen Abrechnungen zum Monatsende und statutarischer Abschlüsse, die Führung des Hauptbuches, der Rohbilanz und die Vorbereitung festgelegter Stellungnahmen zu den Finanzen beinhaltet.
• Zurverfügungstellen von finanzieller Beratung für das Unternehmen, inklusive finanzielle Analyse für neue Verträge und Verkaufsangebote
• Koordinierung und Vorbereitung des Jahresabschlusses und vierteljährlichen Prognosen zur Abgabe an das Ross Video FP&A Team.
• Verantwortlich für die Überwachung des Verkaufsmanagements, der Verbindlichkeiten und der Kasse
• Verantwortlich für die Überwachung der Angelegenheiten von Kredit und Inkasso
• Die Zusammenarbeit mit dem Ross Video Team für Steuern und Compliance, um bei der Erstellung von lokalen Steuererklärungsformulare, Waren- und Zollformulare und Verrechnungspreisdokumentation zu assistieren.
• Die Erstellung und Überwachung von internen Kontrollmaßnahmen, um sicherzustellen, dass Maßnahmen der Buchhaltung mit den gesetzlichen Vorgaben und internen Richtlinien und Vorgängen übereinstimmen
• Vorbereitung von finanzieller Information und Arbeitsdokumenten für monatliche, halbjährliche und jährliche (Jahresende) Berichte und allfällige Dokumente der öffentlichen Hand.
• Kontakt mit Wirtschaftsprüfer/innen und Überwachungsstellen
• Leitung des lokalen Übergangs zum neuen ERP-System
• Durchführen ähnlicher der Qualifikation entsprechender Aufgaben, wenn benötigt.

Erfahrung und Qualifikationen:
• Universitätsabschluss in Betriebswirtschaftslehre mit fortgeschrittenem Grad oder eine andere professionelle Bezeichnung in der Buchhaltung (CA, CPA, CGA, CMA) oder ein europäisches Äquivalent
• Mindestens 7 Jahre Erfahrung in der Finanzwelt mit fundiertem Wissen über finanzielle Analyse, Buchhaltung und Managementberichterstattung.
• Übergreifendes Wissen über alle relevanten gesetzlichen Vorgaben über Berichte speziell in Österreich und Deutschland
• Fortgeschrittenes Wissen über die MS Office und Excel, sowie die die Software-Pakete zum Hauptbuch
• Gute Fähigkeiten in Kommunikation und dem interpersonellen Umgang in Sprache und Schrift, zumindest auf Englisch und Deutsch.
• Eigenständigkeit und sehr gute analytische Fähigkeiten
• Gute Zusammenarbeit im Team in der Problemlösung
• Starke Organisationsfähigkeit und detailorientiertes Arbeiten

Arbeitsort/Reisen
• Der Arbeitsort befindet sich in Feistritz im Rosental, Österreich, mit der Möglichkeit kurzzeitig remote zu arbeiten
• Es wird verlangt, wenn notwendig zu anderen Spidercam-Standorten zu reisen (Hamburg, Germany and Atlanta, US, Canada)
• Flexibel um eventuell den Arbeitsplatz nach Deutschland zu verlegen, wenn notwendig.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Ross Video are looking for a UK/EU based Project Manager to deliver Projects within the EMEA region, and occasionally on a global scale. You will be self-motivated with good inter-personal skills, be able to think ‘outside the box’ and to work under pressure.
The Project Manager is a key member of the Sales Team who plays a leadership role in ensuring that Ross meets its mission of providing a Superior Customer Experience. He or she manages key client projects.
The successful candidate will work directly with customers, business partners, and system integrators to ensure deliverables fall within the applicable scope/budget. He or she will coordinate with other Ross departments to ensure all aspects of each project are compatible, concerns are addressed, and work packages are completed whether in or out of scope.
A Project Manager with good Broadcast industry experience is an essential requirement, preferably from a Project Management, Technical Support or Project Engineering background. Broad experience and understanding across the broadcast content supply chain is also required. The role will require project experience to include hardware, software, and operational workflow delivery within Broadcast.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Responsible for liaising with the Regional Sales Manager and/or Ross pre-sales tech to ensure a comprehensive handover of expected deliverables.
• Lead and co-ordinate the scoping, technical requirements gathering, estimating, and planning for single or multiple projects or work streams.
• Due to the many products in Ross portfolios the position requires a broad understanding of all aspects of broadcasting technologies.
• The position will require time is spent on customer sites (including kick-off meetings, project definition, support of commissioners/trainers, rehearsal, go-live. etc.).
• Project manage the delivery and support of Ross Video projects from sales handover to completion (acceptance / hand over to technical support).
• Ensure shared clarity of scope, good estimating, solution development and management of risk and dependencies.
• To act as the first point of contact for all concerns, obstacles, and opportunities on a project. Issues could include supplier dependencies, infrastructure, and operational capability.
• Lead the commissioning and training teams, ensuring at point of commission/training the system is ready for delivery and the Ross teams have the adequate tools / knowledge to deliver their objectives.
• Work closely with project stakeholders to anticipate, manage, and resolve issues, risks, dependencies, and impediments that may impact on the delivery of your projects.
• Where a risk has been raised, identify, assess, plan, and implement an approved solution.
• Report on project progress in a consistent and timely manner.
• Work as an embedded project manager in a cross-discipline team comprised of software developers, commissioners, trainers, development, Product Managers, and Ross field experts.
• Ongoing point of contact post launch once a system has gone ‘live’, through to an agreed Project completion date.
• Effectively manage Proof of Concept Projects (POC).

Who you are:
• Knowledge and understanding of the installation and configuration of PCs, Operating systems, VMs, networks, and broadcast distribution standards, including IP and Cloud.
• As Broadcast is a fast-evolving environment, the ideal candidate will have willingness to learn.
• Ideally come from a Broadcast Technical Support, or Project Engineer Role.
• Previous experience or knowledge of Salesforce.
• Experience of managing projects from pre-sale/point of sale through to completion.
• Demonstrable experience of dealing with internal and external stakeholders.
• Sound knowledge of Broadcast technologies.
• Resident in the UK or EU, with the ability to work worldwide for trips from a few days to multiple weeks for large installs.
• Understanding or qualification in project methodologies.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Languages including French, Spanish, German are an advantage.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Ross Video are looking for a UK/EU based Project Manager to deliver Projects within the EMEA region, and occasionally on a global scale. You will be self-motivated with good inter-personal skills, be able to think ‘outside the box’ and to work under pressure.
The Project Manager is a key member of the Sales Team who plays a leadership role in ensuring that Ross meets its mission of providing a Superior Customer Experience. He or she manages key client projects.
The successful candidate will work directly with customers, business partners, and system integrators to ensure deliverables fall within the applicable scope/budget. He or she will coordinate with other Ross departments to ensure all aspects of each project are compatible, concerns are addressed, and work packages are completed whether in or out of scope.
A Project Manager with good Broadcast industry experience is an essential requirement, preferably from a Project Management, Technical Support or Project Engineering background. Broad experience and understanding across the broadcast content supply chain is also required. The role will require project experience to include hardware, software, and operational workflow delivery within Broadcast.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Responsible for liaising with the Regional Sales Manager and/or Ross pre-sales tech to ensure a comprehensive handover of expected deliverables.
• Lead and co-ordinate the scoping, technical requirements gathering, estimating, and planning for single or multiple projects or work streams.
• Due to the many products in Ross portfolios the position requires a broad understanding of all aspects of broadcasting technologies.
• The position will require time is spent on customer sites (including kick-off meetings, project definition, support of commissioners/trainers, rehearsal, go-live. etc.).
• Project manage the delivery and support of Ross Video projects from sales handover to completion (acceptance / hand over to technical support).
• Ensure shared clarity of scope, good estimating, solution development and management of risk and dependencies.
• To act as the first point of contact for all concerns, obstacles, and opportunities on a project. Issues could include supplier dependencies, infrastructure, and operational capability.
• Lead the commissioning and training teams, ensuring at point of commission/training the system is ready for delivery and the Ross teams have the adequate tools / knowledge to deliver their objectives.
• Work closely with project stakeholders to anticipate, manage, and resolve issues, risks, dependencies, and impediments that may impact on the delivery of your projects.
• Where a risk has been raised, identify, assess, plan, and implement an approved solution.
• Report on project progress in a consistent and timely manner.
• Work as an embedded project manager in a cross-discipline team comprised of software developers, commissioners, trainers, development, Product Managers, and Ross field experts.
• Ongoing point of contact post launch once a system has gone ‘live’, through to an agreed Project completion date.
• Effectively manage Proof of Concept Projects (POC).

Who you are:
• Knowledge and understanding of the installation and configuration of PCs, Operating systems, VMs, networks, and broadcast distribution standards, including IP and Cloud.
• As Broadcast is a fast-evolving environment, the ideal candidate will have willingness to learn.
• Ideally come from a Broadcast Technical Support, or Project Engineer Role.
• Previous experience or knowledge of Salesforce.
• Experience of managing projects from pre-sale/point of sale through to completion.
• Demonstrable experience of dealing with internal and external stakeholders.
• Sound knowledge of Broadcast technologies.
• Resident in the UK or EU, with the ability to work worldwide for trips from a few days to multiple weeks for large installs.
• Understanding or qualification in project methodologies.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Languages including French, Spanish, German are an advantage.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

company_description: Powering video productions for billions of global viewers, using the industry’s widest range of smart production solutions.

As a Shipper you are responsible to pick and assemble finished goods according to the Sales order, by inserting items into appropriate box/crate based on product specifications or general overpack practices for purpose of shipment. Affixing shipping labels on packed cartons or stencils, identifying shipping information on cartons/crates. You will work with various web-based shipping tools to identify and track all manner of shipments

Who you report to: Shipping Supervisor

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Communicating verbally or by phone/email with all departments delivering goods for orders
• Communicate verbally or by phone/email with Sales Admin to coordinate invoicing activities, manage ship dates and other various requests on an order-by-order basis
• Perform hi-level verification of inbound goods, checking for damage and completeness before passing to the Receiving Department
• Fully responsible for completeness and physical integrity of all outbound shipments, including method of final packaging
• Loading/unloading of transport vehicles, in a manner which respects the schedules of Ross Video and the respective carrier
• Arrange the transportation of product between Ross Video locations/offices and assists in box assembly and material prep, assists in keeping inventory of all boxes and various shipping materials.
• Participate in keeping all storage areas neat and tidy
• Operates forklift truck to move goods between locations and loading goods onto trucks Overtime and/or shift work may be required

Who you are:
• High school diploma
• Have a working knowledge of computers and software packages such as MS Word/Excel/Outlook
• You are capable of following procedures and work logically and have experience in the use of a Forklift
• Have an attention to detail and are organized
• Solid commitment to consistent, quality work habits and you are able to work independently or as part of a team
• Display a willingness and aptitude to learn new things
• Make good choices that represent the business’ best needs
• 1-2 years experience within a warehouse or shipping environment, with a valid driver’s license and clean abstract
• Available for shift work

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Motivated, reliable and goal oriented
• Have a proven dedication to customer care excellence
• A positive, “can do” attitude and customer-focused approach that will enable you to deal with challenging situations with integrity, empathy, and sincerity

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

job_description:
Installation Manager, LED Displays

Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting-edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results-driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood awards shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Ross D3 LED is looking for an experienced LED display Installation Manager. The Installation Manager is responsible for onsite and offsite project installations by leading team members to ensure projects are deployed and successfully installed to contract specifications. This position is hands-on leading personnel in person or remotely. This includes ensuring the effective execution of the pre-installation inspection process involving assessing pre-existing conditions, reviewing site & equipment measurements, and performing measure affirmations.

The ideal candidate will have an extensive background in structural mounting fundamentals, low-voltage electricity, LED display technology and processing control systems for indoor and outdoor applications.

This role will assist the pre-sales and project management teams with defining the installation scope, schedule, costs, and resources required to complete the projects on site (including labor, logistics, material, specialty tools, etc.)

The LED Install Manager will report directly to the LED Deployment Manager in Rancho Cordova, CA and requires frequent & timely interactions with the company’s clients, sales, project management and service teams to ensure that the solutions designed are efficiently deployed and supported.

Who do you report to the Manager, LED Project Deployment

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, a fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Responsible for the overall installation and turnover of LED displays, control systems and AV equipment.
Coordinate with Project Manager(s) to assign, dispatch and support Field Technicians for installations.
Complete job-site paperwork, timekeeping, and other documentation thoroughly and on a timely basis.
Communicate with subcontractors on install scope, product information, pricing, and timelines, as required.
Participate in pre-sales bids including attending bid planning meetings to identify customer needs, budget requirements, design, and bid submittal.
Provide technical assistance to the engineering team regarding custom mounting solutions.
Train new hires and Field Technicians
Answer questions and educate customers and staff on LED (and audio/visual) installation methods & site requirements.
Join project kickoff meetings to transition projects after contracts are received into Project Management.
Attend customer consultation meetings with Sales Representatives in-house or onsite as necessary.
Take responsibility for managing and tracking the flow of equipment from warehouse to job site to ensure materials match the project bill of materials.
Provide extended site service support as necessary.
Responsible for project turnover to the Service Support Team.
Expected Travel: 50%-60%

Who you are:
Minimum 5 years experience with installation in the LED display, audio/video integration, or indoor/outdoor signage industries.
Possesses strong and creative problem-solving traits specifically in construction environments. Ability to make quick decisions and correct issues in the field.
Ability to communicate effectively face-to-face, in groups, via telephone and written.
Able to work co-operatively with, and across, all company departments.
Strong knowledge of the MS Office Suite.
Ability to read architectural, structural, and electrical drawings.
Not afraid of paperwork. (Detailed documentation and turnover is highly emphasized.)
Maintain or acquire technical expertise to the level required to expertly install and configure full LED systems.
Able to climb ladders and scaffolding, mobility including walking, sitting, driving, lifting, and carrying, standing, kneeling, and crouching for long periods of time.
Ability to travel to various job sites required
Must live within 100 miles of a major airport
Valid Passport
Valid Driver’s License

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, or physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

job_title: Sales Operations Specialist (6 Month Contract) (Job Req #2023-102)
job_description:
