If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

At Ross Video, we are at the cutting edge of live video production, powering much of the world’s most compelling content with our smart production solutions. We are looking for a dynamic, organized individual to join us in the role of Sales Operations Specialist.
The Sales Operations Specialist is a partner in a collection of sales territories, which you will come to know well. You will help drive the business in the region by offloading back-office tasks from Regional Sales Managers, such as creating and maintaining account and contact information in our customer relationship management system. You will also help to manage sales activity by assisting with opportunity management, tracking activities related to annual territory plans and by performing data analysis and producing reports. In this key role, you will optimize the effectiveness of our Regional Sales Managers and Inside Sales Specialists.
Sales Operations Specialists exude integrity, drive and passion while demonstrating a high level of attention to detail, superior organization & communications skills.
This position will be based out of the United Kingdom with hybrid work opportunities.

Who you report to: Global Sales Operations Manager

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Work collaboratively with Regional Sales Managers (RSM), Inside Sales Specialists (ISS) and Renewal and Subscription Sales (RSS) to help drive regionally specific sales activity.
• Executing Sales related Administrative Activities.
• Organizing and executing approved equipment loans
• Conduct forecast calls with RSM and ISS to update opportunity status’ and create tasks and reminders for RSM and extended Ross Sales Team
• Ensuring activities related to approved territory plans are executed effectively and on time.
• Coordinating requests and approvals for product demonstrations and regional tradeshow activities
• Preparing and distributing quotes for warranty and software maintenance program renewals
• Proactively identifying and solving order issues prior to receiving a customer purchase
• Performing Data Management & Analysis
• Adding new clients and prospects to our customer database
• Updating and maintaining existing customer data including corporate, financial, and other related account details; contact information, accurate categorization,
• Preparing reports and analysis
• Offering regular insights to RSM and ISS that will assist in driving sales results.
• Assisting in the completion of Sales related forms like DIW.
• Helping RSMs clear roadblocks, both external and internal
• Assisting in coordination and liaison with other departments

Who you are:
• University degree in Business Administration, or related discipline and/or equivalent work experience
• Minimum 2 years of work experience in a sales support or customer service role
• Experience with customer relationship management software (Salesforce.com preferred)
• Experience with MS-Office package and general computer software
• Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills.
• Demonstrated ability to multi-task effectively.
• Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
• High energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm
• Superb attention to detail
• Fluency in English is a must

Bonus points if you have:
• Fluency in other languages is an asset

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! As the International Trade Compliance Specialist, you are responsible for executing import/export trade compliance regulations and logistics security programs on a global scale. The candidate must have the ability to problem-solve, work independently both remotely and in-office, as well as cross-functionally. You will assist with the development, implementation, maintenance and training of policies and processes related to international trade law regulations.

Who you report to: This position reports to the International Trade Compliance Manager and interacts heavily with the Order Operations & Global Logistics teams. This position also requires cross-functional collaboration with the Ross R&D operations teams.

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Conduct export controls EAR/ECL classification assessments and audits of hardware, software, and technical data related to the import of purchased goods and export of manufactured products.
• Respond to trade control related inquiries from internal and external parties.
• Responsible for growth and maintenance of company trade compliance policies, procedures, and documentation. This includes compliance reviews, and strategy for export/import programs that mitigates trade risks.
• Manage C-TPAT certification for Ross Video validated facilities.
• Continuously study and upgrade trade compliance knowledge and translate into practical business recommendations.
• Communication of global export, import and trade compliance operations based on current compliance regulations and business needs.
• Assist with application and management of export permits and licenses.
• Liaise with regulatory or international government agencies, ensuring conformity with Canadian and international regulations.
• Ensure processes are implemented and results are periodically audited with respect to Denied Party Screening.
• Motivated to complete tasks with process improvements.
• Provide support and guidance related to international trade and logistics security programs with various departments within the company.
• Perform other related duties as required.

Who you are:
• Strategic thinker with excellent communication, presentation, and training skills.
• Bachelor’s degree or College diploma in a related field or equivalent work experience. Minimum 5 years experience in International Customs/Trade Compliance.
• Very solid computer skills including Microsoft Office - Word, Excel and PowerPoint and SharePoint.
• Robust systems background, particularly with CRM’s, PLM’s, and ERP’s (Salesforce and Oracle Agile experience is an asset).
• Advanced understanding of export controls and trade sanctions.
• Well-organized, persistent, and attentive to details and accuracy with excellent planning and interpersonal skills to work with all levels of management.
• Ability to plan, multi-task and manage time effectively.
• Expertise and understanding within Canadian Export Reporting System (CERS B13).
• Familiarity with C-TPAT, dangerous goods, HS classification.
• International Logistics experience is an asset.
• Self-starter, quick learner with ability to work with minimum supervision.
• Able to work independently and as part of a team.

Bonus Points:
• Some awareness of the broadcast, news or sports and live events industry, technology and trends is an advantage.
• General knowledge and understanding of Ross Video’s product lines.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

The PCBA Test Specialist will work closely with PCBA Testers, Test Development and manufacturing department. As a PCBA Test Specialist you will oversee everyday production, set up test jigs, and validate if a PCBA passes or fails. Perform detailed functional testing using various test measurement instruments. Help validate system issue with the testers and involve debug technicians as needed.

Who you report to:

Manager Test & Technical Debug

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Works closely with supervisor to organize production through the group
• Examines product for conformance to specifications and quality standards.
• Demonstrates methods and trains workers in work processes.
• Inventories and requisitions tools, equipment, and supplies for department activities when necessary.
• Works closely with Test Development Group to improve production test methods, equipment performance and to implement and ensure processes are successful.
• Analyzes and resolves work problems or assists workers in solving work problems.
• Performs testing and calibration of products as described in test procedures.
• Follow test procedures to calibrate and test products.
• Configuring finished goods assemblies to customer specifications.
• Configuring completed assemblies to sellable models.
• Perform mechanical assembly, interconnect, and fasten assemblies.
• Identify products failing test procedure specifications and tag and route assembly accordingly.
• Use video and waveform monitors to measure and test electrical parameters according to test procedures.

Who you are:
• Electronics Technician diploma or equivalent in experience
• Related or additional courses in electronics or electronics assembly is highly desirable
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Rotational shift work required

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment

• Provide technical assistance to the engineering team regarding custom mounting solutions.
• Train new hires and Field Technicians
• Answer questions and educate customers and staff on LED (and audio/visual) installation methods & site requirements.
• Join project kickoff meetings to transition projects after contracts are received into Project Management.
• Attend customer consultation meetings with Sales Representatives in-house or onsite as necessary.
• Take responsibility for managing and tracking the flow of equipment from warehouse to job-site to ensure materials match project bill of materials.
• Provide extended site service support as necessary.
• Responsible for project turnover to the Service Support Team.
• Expected Travel: 50%-60%
•

Who you are:
• Minimum 5 years’ experience with installation in the LED display, audio/video integration, or indoor/outdoor signage industries.
• Possesses strong and creative problem-solving traits specifically in construction environments. Ability to make quick decisions and correct issues in the field.
• Ability to communicate effectively face-to-face, in groups, via telephone and written.
• Able to work co-operatively with, and across, all company departments.
• Strong knowledge of the MS Office Suite.
• Ability to read architectural, structural, and electrical drawings.
• Not afraid of paperwork. (Detailed documentation and turnover is highly emphasized.)
• Maintain or acquire technical expertise to the level required to expertly install and configure full LED systems.
• Able to climb ladders and scaffolding, mobility including walking, sitting, driving, lifting, and carrying, standing, kneeling, and crouching for long periods of time.
• Ability to travel to various job sites required
• Must live within 100 miles of major airport
• Valid Passport
• Valid Driver’s License

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Technical Commissioning Specialist is responsible for performing the commissioning of Ross products and integrating these into the Broadcast systems at client locations across the USA. This front-line individual is responsible for managing customer expectations, implementing software and hardware configurations per product standards, completing required documentation, providing end user technical training and ensuring that the system performs as specified. This key individual works closely with our Sales and Technical Services Team to ensure delivery of the Ross Superior Customer Experience.

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about
• Provide effective:
• Onsite software installation/Upgrades
• Commissioning of multiple product lines
• Customer technical training services
• Complete required documentation. ie daily reports
• Customer/technical service
• Troubleshoot technical/systems issues at customer facilities
• Handle technical support calls and follow documentation policies
• Provide support to the implementation team, as required
• Assist with set-up of and attend tradeshows, as needed
• Perform other related duties as required
Who you are:
• Technical diploma and knowledge of broadcast systems
• Superior customer skills, including excellent verbal and written communications (English mandatory)
• Willingness to become an expert in Ross Video products
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, positive, determined, and able to work on multiple projects simultaneously
• Able to envision entire projects and look for problem areas, High initiative, resourceful and well-developed analytical skills
• High Tolerance of Ambiguity
• Must be able to work with a team as well as independently
• Ability to clearly communicate ideas to various audiences
• Ability to function is highly stressful situations
• Ability to learn quickly
• Excellent trouble shooting and debugging skills of Broadcast systems
• Strong knowledge of MS Word and Excel
• Strong Organizational skills
• Strong problem solving and prioritization skills
• A strong desire to get the job done
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills
• Valid Driver’s License
• Current Passport
• Possible heavy lifting if moving equipment
• Willing to travel 80-90% of the time (short-notice and international trips)
Bonus Points if you have the following:
• Additional education and computer courses are strong assets
• Knowledge of other languages is a definite asset
• Project management experience would be an asset
• Knowledge of Ross Video products would be a definite asset

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

As an SMT Operator, you will operate various machines to run the SMT Line. The role requires technical knowledge of printed circuit boards and surface mount technology.

Who you report to: Manager, SMT

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Set up and operation of screen printers and SPI
• Monitor SPI for tolerance adherence and understand troubleshooting methods to keep in line with paste quality
• Manage changeover process to ensure efficiency in production time
• Setup each SMT machine to ensure parts are loaded properly, conveyors are aligned, and oven recipes are accurate
• Obtain parts from inventory and verifying loaded components from the setup department are accurate
• Understand the basic hardware mechanics of the SMT equipment
• Learn all production screens and tabs of the pick and place software to ensure how to navigate the machine operation
• Understand basic troubleshooting skills with regards to component placement accuracy, board loading/unloading and fiducial data
• Work closely with AOI operator to ensure quality is maintained according to IPC 610 standards. This feedback is in response to correcting defects that may occur while operating the pick and place machines and/or screen printer
• Works closely with SMT Support team to ensure quality and to maintain production flow on the lines by reducing troubleshooting downtime
• Run the AOI machine to monitor quality coming down the lines
• Maintain and rely on IPC-610x training to ensure the correct defect calls are made and to know when to elevate problems to support staff
• Fully understand MES with regards to routing and reading MWI’s. Review of production documentation and verifying BOM revisions match the pick and place programs
• Clean stencils and returning them to the proper storage location during the build process
• Maintain ESD practices
• Adhere to MSDS procedures (PROC025A)
• Area maintenance and general tidiness and organization of materials

Who you are:
• Have a high school diploma
• Mechanical Aptitude
• Able to work independently or as a part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Well organized, very detail oriented and able to work on multiple projects
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• Strong aptitude for learning
• Able to lift and bend

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Previous experience with machine operation

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

Working with a team you will fully understand the MES system for routing production, obtaining work instructions and logging defects. Preparing parts and PCB’s to be wave soldered or inserted at the Royonics machine, operating this equipment.

Who you report to: Manager, PCBA Assembly/Repair

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• As a PCBA Assembler you may inspect apply) which involves inspecting all through-hole components for orientation, correct component placement and ensuring that all finishing is completed properly. Data collection of defects would be included with inspection.
• Press fit, aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jigs, fixtures, or other holding devices.
• Crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits or performs similar operations to join or secure parts in place.
• Connects component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points.
• Assembles and attaches hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, and switches to assemblies.
• Assembles cables, heat sinks and power supplies for finishing.
• Routing assemblies through MAX system either manually or electronically.
• Maintaining ESD and all safety practices.
• Follow all in place policies due to COVID-19 regulations
• Rotational shift work
Who you are:
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Detail oriented
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• An excellent aptitude for learning

• Previous experience within a manufacturing environment

Who you report to: Vice President, Production Switchers & Video Servers

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

Responsible for management and/or execution in all activities related to the marketing and development of server solutions, in co-ordination with the Product VP, including but not limited to:

Strategy & Planning
• Work closely with the VPOP to ensure that product line objectives are aligned with company objectives and strategies.
• Participate in discussions with VPOP in formulating and administering company policies and developing long range goals and objectives.
• Ensure alignment of market trends (marketing) and technology trends (R&D).
• Work closely with other product team on Server roadmap and technology.

Business & Sales
• Lead the Server marketing team to develop and execute annual sales targets and execution strategies.
• Drive to achieve and exceed forecasted sales, gross margin, cash flow and profitability targets for the Server product line.
• Provide regular product line performance updates to the VPOP and other executives.
• Set objectives and formulate strategies and tactics for managing departmental budgets.
• Ensure that regular product forecast updates to manufacturing are executed and review inventory levels to ensure appropriate cash flow is maintained.
• Train the sales team and our channel partners so that they can efficiently craft customer solutions and effectively sell products.
• Advise and assist Ross sales staff and channel partners in the sales of Server products.
• Deliver sales presentations to end users and business partners.
• Assist in the preparation of tender responses for Server opportunities.
• Where applicable, assist in the negotiation and closing of sales.

Marketing & Competitive
• Oversee the development and execution of all Marketing activities for the Server product line, working closely with our Corporate Marketing Team.
• Manage marketing and time to market with R&D development realities.
• Ensure the sales and marketing of the product line follows the Ross Video Code of Ethics.
• Monitor and evaluate the activities and products of the competition.
• Gather and analyze market and competitive information.
• Review articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.
• Identify and develop new market applications and partnerships.
• Perform market analyses to determine customer needs, price schedules, and discount rates.
• Work with OEM/VAR partners in developing new market opportunities.

R&D & Technology
• Oversee the execution of all R&D activities within the Server product line.
• Stay on top of relevant technology trends and techniques that can be harnessed to create breakthrough solutions.
• Develop key technology partnerships.
• Accountable for research and development projects being completed on time, as per the agreed to feature set and timeline.
• Work with TPM to ensure that MAX contains the appropriate product structure information for the product line, including sales order numbers, structures below sales order numbers, engineering status of all parts, and phase-in phase out information.
• Works with TPM on the specification process at all levels, from the composition of the requirements of new features, to participation in detailed design specification review and all phases in-between.
• Works with the TPM to establish the hardware, FPGA and software architecture, functionality and feature sets
• Work with TPM in setting all features, product releases, and priorities with engineering, product management, and sales.
• Works with TPM to ensure the smooth transition of a new product to manufacturing and sales, including all required training (test, technical support)
• Publish to the project team, senior managers, and others as required, monthly, meaningful project status reports.

Management
• Inspire the Server marketing and development teams to be creative, push hard and achieve breakthrough results.
• Ensure that both short term tactical plans and longer term strategic plans are developed, communicated and executed.
• Continue to build and structure an effective Infrastructure organization.
• Work closely with HR and your managers to recruit, train and develop talented staff.

Who you are:

• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or a related field.
• A minimum of 10 years’ experience in a product line management role
• A minimum of 10 years’ experience in the broadcast industry
• Proven ability to collaborate, influence and execute plans
• Strong demonstrated leadership skills
• Excellent judgment and creative problem-solving skills, including negotiation and conflict resolution.
• Innovative thinker with a track record for translating strategic thinking into action plans and output
• Excellent written, oral and presentation skills
• Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a range of stakeholders
• Proven track record for generating results
• Willing to Travel up to 25% of the time
• Valid Passport
• Valid Driver’s License

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. At Ross Video, we are at the cutting edge of live video production, powering much of the world’s most compelling content with our smart production solutions. We are looking for a dynamic, organized individual to join us in the role of Sales Operations Specialist.
The Inside Sales Representative is a hands-on role that plays an active part in helping develop Ross Video’s pipeline for revenue generation through the creation of sales leads, initiation of prospect calls, and establishment of ongoing rapport with existing and potential customers. The successful candidate will be a direct extension of our front-line group of regionally based Sales Managers, helping to work opportunities with both end users and via our authorized business partner network. You must bring integrity, drive, passion, and superb communications skills.
This position is based in Ross Video’s Ottawa office, with occasional travel to sales events and industry conferences.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Work collaboratively with regionally based Sales Managers to determine and implement opportunity specific sales approaches guided by the Ross Way To Sell.
• Manage the day to day activities to support the sales efforts within several identified sales territories, including preparing quotes and providing guidance to re-sellers, system integrators and clients to facilitate the purchase of Ross solutions
• Manage monthly pipeline review activities to ensure accurate Territory forecasting
• Ensure customer order flow by following the clean order criteria
• Maintain accurate customer data within the corporate CRM solution
• Assist in resolution of customer issues regarding equipment, supplies, and services.
• Proactively manage key sales campaigns identified in the annual territory plan
• Assisting in coordination and liaison with other departments

Who you are:
• University degree in Business Administration, or related discipline and/or equivalent work experience
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in a complex sales environment
• Demonstrated experience in opportunity qualification, pre-call planning, call control, account development, and time management.
• Demonstrated ability to build and maintain lasting relationships with customers and partners.
• Exceptional communication and presentation skills.
• Experience with customer relationship management (CRM) software such as Salesforce.com
• Experience Selling Broadcast Equipment is an asset
• Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills.
• Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment
• Self-motivated, with high energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm.
• Desire to constructively contribute to a team environment

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Working with a team you will reviews and monitors the quality of incoming products or materials for Ross Video. This includes checking engineering criteria, regulatory markings and documentation and other quality standards.

Who you report to: Receiving Supervisor

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• As an Incoming Inspector you would be responsible for inspecting items prior to stocking
• Open and verifies the contents to the packing slip, Purchase Order and engineering database
• Ensure parts meet engineering criteria, including having proper regulatory markings and documentation (safety critical, compliance documents, etc) as per engineering database
• Inspection of circuit boards/ metal work/ raw material etc
• Reviewing the quality of materials and checking for physical defects
• Checking to verify accuracy of dimensions, paint finishes, etc
• Reject faulty material, records type and quantity of defects and advises the appropriate departments as required to initiate appropriate action
• Responsible for putting inspected stock away with proper bar codes, labels, markings and documentation and following special handling when required
• Updates to materials systems and routing as required
• Perform other related duties as required
• Energetic, enthusiastic, with a can-do attitude
• Organized and very detail oriented
• Team Player but able to work independently
• Ability to working in a high pressure, fast paced, and constantly changing environment
• Ability to handle multiple projects and prioritize tasks to achieve objectives
• Rotational shift work

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education or equivalent work experience in quality and/or inspection processes
• Strong computer skills with experience in collecting and reporting data (Excel)
• Experience with an MIS, AQL or similar quality and inspection systems is an asset
• Experience with measuring devices such as meters, gauges, computers, calipers, and other measuring instruments is an asset
• Mechanical aptitude

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Electronics Manufacturing experience with specific exposure to quality and/or inspection
• A technical background

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Rocket Surgery Virtual Creative Services is an award-winning virtual production team that provides full-service design and production expertise for some of the leading sports, news, and entertainment broadcasters in the world. We develop innovative and unique design for XR/MR media leveraging Ross Voyager (Unreal Engine). We are a team of artists/designers, programmers, and live-production engineers with a collaborative spirit and a drive to constantly improve and outdo ourselves from one project to the next.

We are seeking a talented Unreal Engine Technical Artist with full-time experience with advanced knowledge of virtual production workflows, advanced material construction, lighting systems, general level optimization, and fluency in Blueprints. Experience with real-time VFX for film and broadcast is a huge plus.

Reporting to Manger of VCS and working closely with the VCS/RSVP team, the Senior Technical Artist is responsible for leading the effort to optimize/QC the various Unreal/Voyager projects we deploy for our customers. Upon the contract agreement, the Sr. Technical artist will work together with the team bridging the gap from design to production operation. For use in live production, we employ various workflows that require blueprint logic and other data/control integration. Using Dashboard and Lucid Studio the Sr. Technical Artist helps establish the workflows to be used in production. This person will help establish proper asset management and best practices for the group. An understanding of source control and other could-based file/project management systems is needed.

Experience with Virtual set, Augmented reality, and In-camera VFX for LED with UE is ideal.
A general knowledge of camera/lens calibration for live virtual tracking data is required.
This position is a combination of design and content implementation for real-time rendering as well as live-production execution. Knowledge and or familiarity with virtual productions and Ross Video’s products used to support virtual productions preferred. This position is remote but occasional travel to project sites will be required. The Sr. Technical Artist will be required to travel to support other Rocket Surgery initiatives and major tradeshow demonstrations as needed.

Who you report to: Manager, Virtual Creative Services

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

Responsible for execution of and/or participation in activities related to virtual design and AR productions, including but not limited to:

• Collaborate with the VCS team to setup production planning
• 2D / 3D design and artwork implementation and testing/optimization
• Programming Blueprint or other logic for control/triggering of UE projects
• Project QC/testing prior to deployment
• Establish/Maintain standards and best practices for team
• Mentor other technical artists on VCS team
• Regular communication and planning with RVS product team -on latest developments- provide regular feedback to help with product roadmap
• Monitor industry trends and technologies, focusing on maintaining our edge with our service capability
• Travel to and from productions as needed
• Participate in trade show planning and execution
• Work with the RSVP Team and Virtual Solutions departments on product roadmaps, development priorities, product direction, and new products – based on industry and customer trends
• Help maintain and support the VCS workflow and back-up priorities.

Who you are:
• Accomplished Unreal Engine technical Artist with 3+ years of experience in game design development or Film/Broadcast production.
• Experience with Voyager, Xperssion, and other Ross hardware/software preferred but not required
• Virtual Production experience desired – thorough understanding of Augmented Reality, Virtual Set, and Mixed -Reality production techniques, especially those using Epic Unreal Engine.
• Understanding of Camera/Lens calibration for virtual production - usage of virtual tracking protocols ie FreeD, Stype, etc.
• Blueprint setup/construction and C++ experience
• Advanced Knowledge of material construction and Lighting techniques in UE
• Experience with 3D design packages ie Cinema 4D, Maya, 3DS, etc
• Familiarity with LED/XR/Mixed-Reality production techniques a huge plus
• Active passport with the ability to travel across Europe, Middle East, and APAC if needed
• Post-secondary degree or trade school diploma or equivalent experience
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
• Able to work co-operatively with and across all company departments
• Basic knowledge of Adobe creative suite
• Proficient with MS Office including Excel
• Advanced knowledge of broadcast graphics workflows and standards
• Basic knowledge of IT/networking workflows
• Knowledge of art creation pipelines, asset rendering/exporting/conversion
• Portfolio/website demonstrating technical artistic ability that includes Unreal based work.
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
• Passion for problem solving and debugging technical issues
• Excellent communication skills
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills
• Enthusiastic
• High tolerance of ambiguity
• Team-oriented
• Problem solver
• Able to work co-operatively with Ross and end users
• Willing to travel on a project-by-project basis up to 30% of the time.
• Valid passport
• Valid driver’s license
• Occasional requirement to set-up equipment – involves lifting up to 50 lbs, reaching, bending, stooping, etc.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

The System Debug Technician (SDT) will be responsible for providing testing & troubleshooting of completed assemblies including PCBAs in the manufacturing department. SDT will also work closely with the Test Development Team for new product introduction and validation of testing requirements. As an SDT you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of Ross Video Technologies and Products

Who you report to: Manager Test, Technical Debug

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Troubleshooting, from fully assembled systems all the way down to the component level on PCBAs.
• Initiate repairs using appropriate routing and rework tools.
• Work with Production Managers, Specialists, and cell supervisors for work prioritization to ensure internal and external customer demands are met.
• Technical support to Production test staff, by validating infrastructure integrity and initiating repairs.
• Technical support to the Test Development team on NPI (new product introduction)
• Use various test equipment and tools (hardware and software) to test and debug products.
• As required, perform production configuration, testing and calibration following established procedures, policies, and protocols.
• Adhere to Ross Video Health and Safety policies

Who you are:
• Must have computer proficiency with Microsoft Office and core business-use tools.
• Knowledge of video and audio standards and broadcasting would be an asset
• Robotics’ experience would be an asset
• Ability to work rotational schedule
• Ability to solder if required (jig repair)
• Solid technical abilities and organizational skills
• High initiative and well developed analytical, problem solving and communication skills
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Ability to cope with varying levels of support and documentation
• Self-starter, quick learner and able to work with minimum supervision in meeting schedules

As a Manufacturing NPI Technologist, you will collaborate on the introduction of new and changing technologies within manufacturing, working alongside the Manufacturing Technical Prime(s). The role will provide primary support during NPI builds for the Screen Printer, Pick and Place, AOI, reflow ovens, wave solder and manual assembly. You will report directly to the Manager, Test Development and work alongside experts in manufacturing. This role is technical and requires a strong understanding of PCB and PCBA design standards and a mechanical aptitude to assist in jig and tooling design for PCB assembly.

Who you report to: Manager, Test Development

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Support the PCBA build processes for NPI products and ECOs
• Help determine the proper production routing (the process steps required for assembly and test)
• Review manufacturing instructions for technical accuracy and efficiency
• Build relationships and engage with the Manufacturing Support Teams to support hand-off of NPI products to Production
• Assist and collaborate with the creation of jigs and fixtures to support manufacturing.
• Work in concert with the NPI Program Manager/Coordinators implementation plans and other ongoing NPI activities
• Discuss implementation details with the various manufacturing teams while soliciting input and collaborating on the best solutions.
• Help continually improve our NPI processes for long term sustainability, efficiency, and effectiveness
• Transfer knowledge into and assist the Manufacturing Support Team

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education or equivalent work experience (5 years) in a manufacturing or manufacturing interfacing environment.
• Working knowledge of IPC standards and requirements.
• Experience creating and maintaining manufacturing work instructions and procedures.
• Advanced skill level with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook) and Microsoft Project.
• Lean manufacturing education/experience a strong asset.
• Experience with Valor DFM software a preferred asset.
• Education/experience using CAD modeling tools (AutoCAD, Inventor, etc.) a solid asset.
• Experience with MES, PLM and ERP systems an asset.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team cross functionally, with technical and nontechnical staff and interact with all levels of management
• Well-organized, persistent, attentive to details and accuracy
• Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills
• Ability to make decisions based on the company’s best interests

This position based in Rancho Cordova focuses on repair of D3 LED displays and providing a wide range of mechanical, electrical, electronics and control system on site technical support. Providing top-level system troubleshooting, electronics repair and testing. Assisting, interacting, and collaborating with systems technician, production, and project management team members to assure successful project completion. Check for common problems such as defective manufacturing or loose connections, refer to schematics and specifications to locate malfunction; electronics repair, and testing; document services performed; crimp connector terminals; assemble discrete wiring and harnesses, soldering components using hand and wave soldering techniques. Methodical approach to all intended tasks and approach to problem solving is necessary. Self-starter spirit with naturally strong rapport with customers and subcontractor trades will be highly valued.

Who you report to: Manager, LED Field Services

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Provide on-site and/or remote technical support including tasks such as system troubleshooting, electronics repair and testing.
• Install operating systems and video equipment for LED displays and performing commissioning procedures to ensure proper system functionality.
• Ability to manage and monitor all installed systems and infrastructure
• Competency in writing and maintaining custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower downtime due to required human intervention
• Work alongside the team to help design information and operational support systems
• Assist Project Manager in physical installation, operator training and technical support of LED Display
• Coordination with various disciplined subcontractors as necessary during installation and supplemental maintenance visits
• Monitor and test performance of applications, foreseeing potential issues and identifying possible solutions
• Ability to work with developers to implement those fixes
• Excellence in communication as a liaison with vendors and other IT personnel to resolve issues
• Perform other duties as needed and directed by Field Service Manager.
Who you are:
• Strong soldering experience of small electrical components is required.
• Associates degree or higher in a technician, electrical engineering, computer technology or mechatronics-based field of study or 3+ years relevant experience in a related field.
• 2 years or greater of technician experience, preferably (but not required) within the electronics industry.
• Advanced computer hardware and networking knowledge.
• Proven ability to monitor systems successfully and efficiently
• Proven working experience in the above fields including installing, configuring, and troubleshooting UNIX /Linux based environments
• Experience with use of Multi-meter required, and fiber termination skills a plus.
• Experienced with reading and interpreting blueprints, construction drawings and schematics.
• Working knowledge and experience Microsoft Office tools, specifically Excel, Word, Project, and Visio.
• Valid driver's license and passport with ability to travel locally and worldwide on short notice via air or ground.
• Able to work from a ladder, at various heights, including on aerial platforms and carry tools/ladder/parts to and from work site.
• Required to bend, reach, lift and use hands, vision and hearing to perform essential on site and troubleshooting tasks.
• Must be able to take direction and work with minimal supervision and guidance in a fast paced and at times pressure packed environment.
• This is a fast-moving position with a high expectation to execute industry best service of top quality and the highest level of tech innovation using exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

• Maintain demo equipment, assists with set-up and prepares/tests gear prior to demos

• Post-secondary degree related to television broadcast or appropriate work experience
• Experience in the selling and marketing process for broadcast equipment is very useful
• Familiarity with key components used in broadcast electronics products
• Above average computer skills
• Knowledge of use of Ross Video products and a willingness to learn how to demonstrate these products

• Post production or corporate video experience an asset
• Extensive experience and knowledge of OverDrive
• Knowledge of Ross Switchers
• Experience with online training

• Passionate about OverDrive and automated production control
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills
• Organized and very detail oriented
• Ability to problem solve and trouble shoot

• Able to work independently or as part of a team

The CPQ systems admin provides support to Sales and Product Management Teams with CRM (Salesforce.com), CPQ (Apttus CPQ) and other commercial systems with an end goal of enabling Ross’ go to market strategies. The CPQ systems admin will provide day to day support to the product teams on various SFDC and CPQ tasks such as creating and configuring products (standalone, bundles, etc.), diagnosing quoting issues and providing pricing assistance. The CPQ systems admin will take a proactive approach on recommending new processes or functionality with Salesforce.com or the CPQ which will enhance the Product Team’s abilities to market their products and provide tools to our Sales team.

On the Sales side, the CPQ systems admin will help with quoting or pricing issues with the CPQ as well as enhancing output documents such as quote templates, among other duties. The Salesforce Administrator will also be very process-driven, creating and improving upon existing processes and process documentation. The CPQ systems admin may also be asked to lead specific projects related to Salesforce.com or the CPQ tool.

• Answer questions and provide super user assistance to product management and sales users.
• Assist in updating product and pricing data in SFDC.
• Help create and maintain product structures and rules within SFDC, ensuring consistency in how we present products across product lines
• Research and implement new commercial systems functionality as required (for example, guided selling, machine learning, etc.).
• Develop and deliver training to new Product Management staff (BDM’s, PM’s, POM’s) on how to use SFDC and the CPQ.
• Identify process/system gaps and offer solutions.
Who you are:
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, preferably in business, math or a related field
• Intermediate Knowledge & Proficiency (minimum 1 years’ experience) with Salesforce.com administration or development (Salesforce certification is a plus)
• Basic Knowledge & Proficiency (minimum 1-year experience) with Salesforce CPQ, Apttus CPQ or another CPQ tool (certification is a plus)
• Intermediate Knowledge & Proficiency with MS Excel (navigational shortcuts, formulas such as VLOOKUP and SUMIF, PivotTables and Pivot Charts)
• Basic Knowledge & Proficiency with standard office tools such as MS Word, PowerPoint, and Visio
• Knowledge of sales processes and/or experience in sales
• Knowledge of product management process and/or experience in product management/marketing
• Detail oriented and organized
• Proactive and action oriented
• Adaptable in fast-paced environment

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Strategic Account Manager directs and coordinates sale of Ross Video products and services and provides customer services to customer organizations alongside Ross Inside Sales Representatives and our Media Marketing department. This highly integral member of the team will represent Ross Video within a highly focused set of global strategic accounts within the Media and Entertainment industry.

You will be building strategic, long term relationships with end users by calling on customer facilities directly to promote Ross products and services. This is both a hands-on and strategic position where you will be implementing strategic sales plans to accommodate territorial goals, engaging Product Managers in regular presentations to customers, assisting with the resolution of customer concerns and negotiating and closing sales.

You will have monthly order targets to meet and will be developing and maintaining sales forecasting activities and assisting in setting of sales goals with integrators and dealers, where applicable.

Who you report to: Vice-President - Global Strategic Accounts

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Deliver sales presentations to customers in person and remote
• Ensure the sales and marketing of product line follows the Ross Video code of ethics
• Perform market analyses to determine customer needs and price schedules
• Work in conjunction with the Ross Global sales support teams where the portfolio of Strategic accounts has locally-based business entities
• Advises and assists end-users concerning sales and purchase of Ross Video Product line.
• Assists in directing product marketing to customer base to establish Ross Video products in the region.
• Represents company at trade association meetings to promote product.
• Assist in coordination and liaison between sales department and other sales related units.
• Assists other departments within organization to prepare marketing plans specific to the strategic account portfolio
• Prepares periodic sales reports showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed sales expansion.
• Monitors and evaluates the activities and products of the competition.
• Reviews articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.

Who you are:
• Significant experience selling & marketing video experience technology to the strategic account portfolio
• Familiarity with key components used in video experience technology
• Strong Organizational Skills
• Understanding of strategic sales process
• Excellent communication & presentation Skills
• Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills
• Knowledge of use of Ross Video products
• Lateral Thinker
• Willing to Travel up to 60% of the time

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The Solution Architect role will support the EMEA Sales team in its initiative to increase sales of Ross Video technology in dynamic and innovative applications. This key role in the Ross Sales organization requires a unique blend of engineering / solutions solving skills along with the “soft skills” required in a sales process. This is a diverse role that requires close collaboration with the company’s Sales, Marketing, R&D, and Technical Support teams to ensure proposed deals include technical solutions that accurately address our customers’ needs.

The successful candidate would ideally be based in a major city in Spain or Italy, focused on the Iberian and Italian markets this role would also offer support elsewhere in the EMEA territory as required for cover etc.

Who you report to: Technical Solutions Manager, EMEA

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Participates and contributes to sales opportunities driven by the Regional Sales Managers, prioritizing efforts based on maximizing total impact on the team’s productivity.
Scopes technical solutions to address customer requirements, assesses customer’s met and unmet needs and recommends solutions that optimize value for both the customer and Ross Video.
• Coordinates closely with Ross’ internal Sales team and business partners to align solutions designed to meet our customers’ business requirements.
• Proactively educates and provides professional development to team and business partners in order to enhance their product knowledge, technical acumen, and technical sales skills.
Generates localized sales tools on various mediums for internal and external distribution (PowerPoint’s, Application Notes, Competitive Guides, etc.).
• Engages in customer facing product presentations, demos, training, and workflow guidance to end-users and business partners at customer premise or tradeshows.
• Opportunistically pursues additional business development opportunities and collaborates with Sales to ensure these are effectively covered and advanced.
• Ensures the Sales and Marketing of product line follows the Ross Video Code of Ethics.
• Ideally based in a major city in Spain or Italy, focused on the Iberian and Italian markets this role would also offer support elsewhere in the EMEA territory as required for cover etc.
• Works on systems oriented and highly technical projects.
• Creates drawings that capture the spirit of specific opportunities, while also creating general variations for use by other groups at Ross.
• Helps to prepare world-class customer facing proposal supplements.
• Manages proposals for large RFPs.
• Transfers post sale information to the Implementation Projects team.
• Acts as a “Technical Evangelist” to help build trust and inspiration with our partners and customers.
• Participates in developing and implementing product awareness collateral / presentations.
• Provides client feedback to Marketing Product Manager(s) on product & application requirements.
• Travel to tradeshows as required
• Attend Sales Meetings, as required
• Willing to Travel up to 40% of the time
• Performs other related duties as required

Who you are:
• Minimum 5 years of combined sales, sales engineering, presales experience.
• Record of achievement and technical solution expertise in a comparable sales role.
• Understanding of the Broadcast / Media Technology Market (Live Production experience an asset).
• Poses strong knowledge of industry standard protocols, connectors and terminations.
• Advanced skill set in using in Visio or OmniGraffle as well as AutoCad Architect.
• Preferred experience in scheduling software MS Project or Merlin (OSX).
• Excellent Communication & Presentation Skills.
• Must be proficient in both Desktop and Server Networking.
• Able to work co-operatively with and across all company departments.
• Strong presentation skills.
• Strong knowledge of Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
• Possesses strong and creative problem-solving traits.
• Existing knowledge and use of Ross Video products (preferred).
• Experience working with CRM’s.
• Positive, Determined, Problem Solver
• Deadline driven
• Strong organization and communication skills
• Ability to schedule duties/projects (multi-task)
• Ability to work well independently
• Attention to detail and a strong work ethic
• Desire to contribute to a team environment
• Ability to handle stressful situations
• Must live within 75 miles of major airport
• Valid Passport and Valid Driver’s License

The Events Administrator is responsible for supporting the administrative activities behind the scenes of Ross Video tradeshows and events globally. Ross attends over 100 such events a year, ranging from regional pop-up booths of 100sqft to major marquee shows up to 10,000sqft. The Events Administrator will be hired to complete a six (6) month contract to facilitate the successful execution of such events in conjunction with a team of social media and event specialists.

Who you report to: Director, Communications

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

Under the supervision of the Director, Communications, the Events Administrator will be responsible for:
• Maintaining and updating the Ross Events Calendar
• Coordinating Event requirements using the Ross Request Process
• Provide marketing support for before, during and after events as required using directories
• Coordinating, order, inventory management of staff clothing and promotional materials.
• Event logistics including coordination of shipments and creation of customs documentation
• Internal communication of pre-show Event details.
• Coordination of staff lists, flights and hotel room bookings for major Events.
• Assisting other members of the Marketing team in event promotion and social media
• Perform other related duties as required

Who you are:
• A college level graduate, preferably in event management, marketing, or communications
• Experience in planning, organizing and executing events
• Demonstrated experience with Microsoft Office including Outlook, Excel and Word
• Previous exposure to Asana work management platform is an asset
• Graphic Design and Social Media skills an asset
• Organized with strong attention to detail

• Strong aptitude for learning

job_description: Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you. Come Freelance with ROSS! At Ross Mobile Productions (Ross MP), we power video production for hundreds of shows each year across the United States and the World using the industry’s widest range of smart production solutions, you will help create. Our company is experiencing strong growth in eSports, entertainment and sports and is searching for a dynamic, self-motivated, highly technical doer to take Ross MP engineering to the next level. As a Broadcast Engineer at Ross MP, you will work with a team of like-minded experts building and then engineering trucks and fly packs with the latest and greatest Ross equipment. You will then deploy what your team builds in remote events for the top networks and brands in several industries. As a developing engineer, you will begin to develop new/creative/innovative technical offerings that will meet our customer’s needs, help differentiate Ross and Ross MP in the market place and continue the business’ strong expansion. Ross Mobile Productions currently has 6 of the most powerful small mobile units in the industry, a studio and fly packs at all levels. 2021/2022 promises to be the most exciting time ever, worldwide, with new equipment and customers coming on board. Be a part of events for the biggest networks, eSports companies and media brands. Be a part of Ross MP. What we offer: Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here. What the job is all about: • Working with dedicated broadcast hardware including all Ross products and other best standard industry equipment. • Desire to learn and develop. • Hand out and Inventory all Equipment on Remotes. • Knowledge of video shading and cameras (Work as a V1 on shows). • Proficient in one or several technical areas, mostly Mira Lead and RO, A1, Lead EVS, and TD. • Be able to work with crew and help follow through with EIC/Tech manager plan. • Instruct Crew as needed, direct the activities of crew members related to the operation of the mobile unit, including setup and breakdown of the truck. • Pack and unpack your truck and drive to and from Remotes • Learn to Build shows from the ground up, including router configuration, signal flow troubleshooting, and working with various technicians to establish show requirements and turn them into executed solutions. • Provide information to EIC for the Post Show Report at the conclusion of each event. • Work directly with the EIC to handle all required preventative and technical maintenance of onboard broadcast equipment. • Maintaining a positive work atmosphere by behaving and communicating in a manner that works well with co-workers, supervisors, customers, and vendors. • Responsible end-to-end for select, small scale events. • Introduction to some system design and building and on-site integration and set up to include video path, audio path, fiber linked systems, digital video compression and transmission standards, PC networking, Master Control facilities and hub, and network storage systems. This will include broadcast trucks, fly packs and fiber kits. • Estimate that you could travel more than 50% of the time • Valid Driver’s License Who you are: • 1-3 years relevant experience • Strong technical mind • Want to work with the coolest technology on the best events and maximize your potential, alongside a team of Ross superstars • If you are familiar with broadcast signal flow or networking, have built or engineered equipment, worked on the technical side of the live event industry or love technology and trends • You like sports and eSports • Perform well under pressure and love challenges Equity, Diversity & Inclusion At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work.
