job_title: Regional Sales Manager- Poland & Hungary (Job Req #2023-069)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Join Ross Video and you have the opportunity to be part of a growing company that is continuing to build a greater presence in the EMEA marketplace.

In the position of Regional Sales Manager – Poland and Hungary you have an entrepreneurial spirit. You are responsible for proactively and aggressively growing both existing and new business relationships for Ross Video in this region either directly or through one of Ross’ designated Channel Partners.

You have experience and previous success in sales in Broadcast, Live Production or related industries. You show passion and commitment to customer service, and you are prepared to develop business relationships on a face-to-face basis throughout Poland and Hungary. You have a well-honed ability to communicate compellingly at all levels of an organization both in written and verbal form.

You work from your home office and are supported by our EMEA headquarters in the UK and the global headquarters in Canada.

Who you report to: Regional Sales Director

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

As the Regional Sales Manager for Poland and Hungary your major responsibilities include developing new business and maintaining existing customer accounts, and establishing solid relationships with all major companies in the cable, rental, OB, studio, Sports, Corporate, Government and Educational sectors of Live Video Production Markets. You are responsible for establishing productive working relationships with Ross Video’s Channel Partners within the region. You will prepare and conduct technical presentations and demonstrations at customer visits as well as conferences and tradeshows as required.
Approximately 60% of your time will be spent travelling to customers and potential customers’ facilities providing information and support as required. You will also prepare reports, forecasts, and handle all aspects of account maintenance.

• Negotiate and close sales
• Build and nurture relationships with end users
• Deliver sales presentations to clients and business partners in the territory
• Develop and implement strategic sales plans to accommodate corporate and individual territorial goals
• Develop and maintain sales forecasting activities and assists in setting of territory sales goals with business partners
• Perform market analysis to determine customer needs and pricing strategies
• Direct channel development activity in the territory and coordinates sales distribution by establishing business partner territories, quotas and goals
• Meet monthly order targets
• Assist in directing marketing resources to establish Ross Video products in the region
• Represent company at trade association meetings and exhibitions
• Assist in coordination and liaison between sales department and other sales related units
• Assist other departments within organization to prepare marketing plans specific to the territory
• Prepare periodic sales report showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion
• Monitor and evaluates the activities and products of the competition
• Assist in resolution of customer complaints regarding equipment, supplies, and services

Who you are:

You have a deep understanding of the broadcast and/or video production business. You have worked within a reseller and/or as a manufacturer’s account manager. In addition, you have a minimum of 5+ years of experience selling and achieving sales targets both via direct and in-direct channels in the Broadcast industry or related field.

The successful candidate has proven ability to negotiate and manage complex sales through to successful completion. Excellent teamwork, communication and interpersonal skills are a must.

This position, based in Rancho Cordova focuses on repair of D3 LED displays and providing a wide range of mechanical, electrical, electronics and control system on site technical support. Providing top-level system troubleshooting, electronics repair and testing. Assisting, interacting, and collaborating with systems technician, production, and project management team members to assure successful project completion. Check for common problems such as defective manufacturing or loose connections, refer to schematics and specifications to locate malfunction; electronics repair, and testing; document services performed; crimp connector terminals; assemble discrete wiring and harnesses, soldering components using hand and wave soldering techniques. A methodical approach to all intended tasks and approach to problem solving is necessary. A self-starter spirit with naturally strong rapport with customers and subcontractor trades will be highly valued.

Who you report to: Manager, LED Field Services

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Provide on-site and/or remote technical support including tasks such as system troubleshooting, electronics repair and testing.
• Install operating systems and video equipment for LED displays and performing commissioning procedures to ensure proper system functionality.
• Ability to manage and monitor all installed systems and infrastructure
• Competency in writing and maintaining custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower downtime due to required human intervention
• Work alongside the team to help design information and operational support systems
• Assist Project Manager in physical installation, operator training and technical support of LED Display
• Coordination with various disciplined subcontractors as necessary during installation and supplemental maintenance visits
• Monitor and test performance of applications, foreseeing potential issues and identifying possible solutions
• Ability to work with developers to implement those fixes
• Excellence in communication as a liaison with vendors and other IT personnel to resolve issues
• Perform other duties as needed and directed by Field Service Manager.

Who you are:
• Strong soldering experience of small electrical components is required.
• Associates degree or higher in a technician, electrical engineering, computer technology or mechatronics-based field of study or 3+ years relevant experience in a related field.
• 2 years or greater of technician experience, preferably (but not required) within the electronics industry.
• Advanced computer hardware and networking knowledge.
• Proven ability to monitor systems successfully and efficiently
• Proven working experience in the above fields including installing, configuring, and troubleshooting UNIX /Linux based environments
• Experience with use of Multi-meter required, and fiber termination skills a plus.
• Experienced with reading and interpreting blueprints, construction drawings and schematics.
• Working knowledge and experience Microsoft Office tools, specifically Excel, Word, Project, and Visio.
• Valid driver's license and passport with ability to travel locally and worldwide on short notice via air or ground.
• Able to work from a ladder, at various heights, including on aerial platforms and carry tools/ladder/parts to and from work site.
• Required to bend, reach, lift and use hands, vision and hearing to perform essential on site and troubleshooting tasks.
• This is a fast-moving position with a high expectation to execute industry best service of top quality and the highest level of tech innovation using exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
• Must be able to take direction and work with minimal supervision and guidance in a fast paced and at times pressure packed environment.

This key role has day-to-day managerial (both tactical and strategic) responsibility for the New Product Introduction processes at Ross Video, including process development and refinement, detailed scheduling and management of all New Product Introduction and Change Management activities in Ross Video’s manufacturing operation.

The Vice President, Manufacturing NPI will manage the interrelationships between Manufacturing and the R&D organization within Ross Video. Motivating and strengthening a forward-looking NPI operations strategy and plan to help the product lines achieve their customer and financial goals. Working in collaboration with the appropriate stakeholders and staff in Iroquois and globally, this role will ensure that development of new, creative and innovative products, is taken from concept to provision of prototypes and then to production launch quickly and professionally, and that new products are manufacturable and testable with high yield and very low customer-reported issues. Success in this role will be measured by customer, stakeholder and employee satisfaction.

Who you report to: This positions report to the Chief Manufacturing and Services Officer, and interacts heavily with Ross R&D operations, including the VP, Engineering and appropriate Product Teams.

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Develop, communicate, implement and refine a forward-looking NPI operations strategy and plan to help manufacturing operations and the product lines achieve their customer and financial goals. Working with Iroquois manufacturing staff, build and guide the team for efficient and effective product introduction from R&D through prototype and production ramp. Product in this case includes ancillary requirements, i.e. packaging, configurations, manuals and training.
• Work with manufacturing staff, the VP, Engineering and R&D to improve the manufacturability, serviceability, yield, reliability, testability and more (DFx) of designs and improve the Ross design process.
• As R&D is a critical investment for Ross Video, work with the various teams to select and implement appropriate measures of design effectiveness and timeliness.

• Strategic thinker with excellent leadership, communication, presentation and negotiation skills
• Post-secondary degree in a related field (i.e. manufacturing engineering) and appropriate experience
• A Master’s Degree in Business Administration would be considered an asset
• Very solid computer skills including Microsoft Office, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
• Robust systems background, particularly with CRM’s, MES’s and ERP’s (SalesForce experience is an asset)
• Some awareness of the broadcast, news or sports and live events industry, technology and trends is an advantage.

• Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills
• Powerful team building skills. Team building experience and expertise a strong asset.

Ross Video powers video production for billions of global viewers daily with the industry’s widest range of smart production solutions. We are looking for a dynamic, organized self-starter to join our Human Resources team as an HR Business Partner, aligned with our R&D organization.

The HR Business Partner is both a strategic and hands-on role that provides full cycle Human Resources support to Ross Video managers and staff, with a particular focus on the R&D organization. The role is critical in executing our talent initiatives, providing great internal client support, and driving HR functional excellence and process improvement.

Who you report to: Vice President, HR Business Partnerships & Programs

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Understand business goals and work to ensure the effective execution of HR programs, processes, policies, communications, and strategic initiatives to meet business objectives
• Take a hands-on approach to partnering as trusted advisor to client group leaders and employees in coaching, mentoring and educating on their obligations to ensure all company standards and practices are upheld to enable a safe, healthy and compliant work environment
• Provide HR insights to help create & drive talent development strategic priorities in assigned client groups, including workforce planning and talent acquisition, manager and employee development, succession planning, and role of the leader
• Coach leaders to foster increased employee engagement, inclusion and organization performance
Who you are:
• University degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or related discipline, and/or equivalent work experience in an HR team
• Minimum 6-8 years of progressive HR Business Partner or HR Advisor experience, preferably in a high-tech environment; experience partnering with R&D teams highly desired
• Demonstrated knowledge and understanding in the management of all aspects of HR functions
• Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively collaborate with all levels of the organization, including Senior Management
• Ability to deal with confidential information with a high degree of diplomacy; ability to build trusted relationships
• Experience coaching and mentoring managers and employees
• Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment
• Organized and very detail orientated but also able to see the big picture
• Strong-working knowledge of MS-Office package and general computer software; familiarity with Ceridian Dayforce an asset

Join Ross Video and you will have an opportunity to be part of a growing company that is continuing to expand in the US marketplace.

In this role, you will be responsible for proactively and aggressively growing both existing and new business relationships for Ross Video in your region either directly or through one of Ross’ designated Channel Partners. The territory for this position includes the states of New York, Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Connecticut, Maine, Vermont, New Hampshire, Massachusetts, Rhode Island and Delaware. This is a shared responsibility role with the other Regional Sales Manager in the Northeast region.

You would work from a home-based office either in the region or in close proximity to our headquarters in Ottawa, Canada.

Who you report to: Director of Sales- USA East

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Represent Ross Video with end users and customers and channel resale partners within the region.
• Negotiate and close sales.
• Meet annual, quarterly and monthly, quota targets in cooperation with other Northeast RSM
• Build key, long-term relationships with end users by calling on customer facilities directly to promote Ross products and services.
• Engage the Product Managers in regular presentations to customers.
• Deliver sales presentations to clients and re-sellers in the Territory.
• Develop and implement strategic sales plans to accommodate corporate and individual territorial goals.
• Develop and maintain sales forecasting activities and assists in setting of territory sales goals with integrators and dealers, where applicable.
• Perform market analyses to determine customer needs, price schedules, and discount rates.
• Advise and assist end users concerning sales and purchase of Ross Video Product line.
• Assist in directing product marketing to client base to establish Ross Video products in the region.
• Represent company at trade association meetings to promote product.
• Assist in coordination and liaison between sales department and other sales related units.
• Assist other departments within the organization to prepare marketing plans specific to the territory.
• Prepare periodic sales reports showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion.
• Monitor and evaluate the activities and products of the competition.
• Review articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.
• Ensure the Sales and marketing of Ross products, services and solutions follows the Ross Video code of ethics.
• Assist in resolution of customer issues regarding equipment, supplies, and services.

Who you are:
In the position of Regional Sales Manager, you should have an entrepreneurial spirit. You should have experience and previous success in sales related to live production products, services, and solutions. You will have passionate commitment to customer service and should be prepared to develop business relationships on a face-to-face basis throughout your region. You will have a well-honed ability to communicate compellingly at all levels of an organization both in written and verbal form.
• Experience Selling & Marketing of Live Production Equipment, specifically Production Switchers, Graphic Systems, Robotics, Cameras, Routing Systems, Master Control Systems, Newsroom Systems, Control Systems, and Media Asset Management.
• Familiarity with Key Customers through the territory.
• Strong negotiating skills
• Knowledge of Major Broadcast Transmission Standards
• Solid user of Microsoft Office Products
• Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar Customer Relationship Management tool

• Lateral Thinker

As a Full Stack Developer, you will help develop and deploy the Virtualized Switcher product to AWS (Amazon Web Services) and other cloud platforms. You will be working closely with other internal teams in designing cloud architectures following best practices for security, scalability, and availability.

• Participate in the full software development lifecycle – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, automation, testing, and maintenance.
• Develop new product features and new services.
• Evaluate new cloud technologies (languages, frameworks, etc.) and their suitability in making our products successful.
• Follow modern DevOps practices for provisioning and deployment.

• Backend development experience with a solid development background in either JavaScript, Java, Python or Go. Experience with C and C++ is a plus.
• Frontend development experience using JavaScript and specifically React is nice to have.
• Knowledge of cloud native technologies, with experience developing or supporting cloud-based applications.
• Knowledge of containers (Docker) and container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
• Knowledge of microservices architectures and API designs using principles like REST or GraphQL.
• Strong knowledge of Git and CI/CD automation using tools like Gitlab CI.
• Experience with Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes. Knowledge of other Cloud Native frameworks like Prometheus, Argo, Helm, Istio is a plus.
• Experience with OAuth 2.0 and other authentication flows.
• Experience with DevOps practices and the DevOps culture.

As part of the development team for the Virtualized Switcher, you will be working on leading-edge technologies in the cloud. Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

• Participate in the full software development lifecycle – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, automation, testing, and maintenance.

This key individual works closely with our Sales and Demonstration Artist Team to ensure delivery of the Ross Superior Customer Experience.

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

What the job is all about:
Perform on-site, off-site, online/remote customer demonstrations
Assist the Overdrive and Switcher Product team with content creation, organization and technical execution of major trade shows throughout the year
Responsible for the operational and technical integrity of both the demo and training experience and offer effective solutions for areas of improvement in-house and online
Set up demo equipment, assist with set-up and prepare/test gear prior to demos
Advise the Sales and Marketing Product Management (MPM) groups regarding current industry trends and customer feedback
Maintain above average knowledge base and skill set in the functionality and demonstration of all system features for Overdrive and Switcher Solutions
Develop demonstration techniques, methods and materials for use by other demo staff

Assist in the development of Overdrive & Switcher customer training methods, materials and techniques
Provide feedback to the Overdrive & Switcher MPM & TPM on product operation, features and roadmap
Participate in the review process for upcoming software feature lists
Champion customer needs, notably operational features, roll-out and training methods as well as future feature requirements
Actively participate in Ross’ user forums, lead key discussions and assist Overdrive and Switcher users
Maximum 80% international travel is required and flexible schedule
Must have a valid passport and driver’s license

Post-secondary degree related to television broadcast or appropriate work experience in a broadcast/post/corporate video environment using Overdrive.

Excellent communication and presentation skills
In-depth knowledge of graphic design, production, customer needs and applications
Experience in the selling and marketing process for broadcast equipment is very useful
Experience with Overdrive or Ross Switcher operation for live events
Knowledge of use of Ross Video products and a willingness to learn how to demonstrate and train on these products, notably: Overdrive & Ross Switchers/Vision mixers
Organized and very detail oriented
Ability to problem solve and trouble shoot

The successful candidate will be responsible for the execution of and/or participation in Ross Creative and Professional Services activities, by providing services for the design, creation, and implementation of XPression real-time graphics and graphics packages and assisting with key XPression Sales and Marketing opportunities.

This position is located in our Ottawa office or a home-based office setting, if mutually agreed upon.

Who you report to: Art Director
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Creates XPression templates and animations, using native Xpression tools and provided base graphic elements – such as 3D models, still images, and clips.
Designs XPression templates and animations from scratch, using native XPression tools and 3rd-party graphics applications such as Cinema 4D and Adobe Suite.
Creates packages that conform to standardized workflows outlined by the Art Director.
Ensures appropriate automation hooks are created for outside control.
Utilize XPression Visual Logic and scripting for automated, dynamic templates.
Setup XPression Datalinq to pull in external data feeds and interface with external data aggregation systems.
Use Ross Dashboard to create manual user interface panels and backup solutions for XPression automated graphics.
Responsible for implementation and integration of graphics packages at customer’s sites, as required.
Attends meetings and conference calls as required to scope, complete, or otherwise facilitate successful completion of assigned projects as they relate to the job.
Work with other creative and professional service members to institute a consistent and standardized workflow solution.
Works with Ross team members to create style and operational guides for end users.
Documents any custom scripting methodologies to ensure future support from Ross.
May be required to create project style-guides of assets.
Willing to travel on a project-by-project basis up to 50% of the time

Who you are:
Post-secondary degree or trade school diploma
Advanced knowledge of Adobe creative suite
Advanced knowledge of Cinema 4D and Redshift renderer knowledge a plus
Intermediate knowledge of IT workflows
Intermediate computer programming experience in VB, SQL, and/or JAVA is desirable
Proficient in Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint
Proficient knowledge of Unreal Engine a plus
Minimum 2-5 years production experience in broadcast (studio or remote) or sport venue
Minimum 2-5 years of graphic design experience.
Proficient knowledge of broadcast graphics workflows
Organized and very detail orientated
Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
Excellent communication skills
Aptitude for animation and choreography of movement
Strong interpersonal and observational skills
High tolerance of ambiguity
Team-oriented, and able to work co-operatively with Ross and end users
Enthusiastic problem solver
Valid Passport and Valid Driver’s License
Occasional requirement to set-up equipment – involves lifting up to 50 lbs, reaching, bending, stooping, etc

The Crewing Coordinator I will use technical knowledge and experience to recruit and coordinate the hiring of independent contractors for Ross Production Services remote and control room-based events. The successful candidate should have a basic understanding of all positions required for a televised event and the skill sets required for each position. This individual will be expected to contribute to our growing database of independent contractors throughout the United States by recruiting additional talent. The Crewing Coordinator I will be responsible for identifying available independent contractors, securing services, tracking and reporting any expenses including costs of travel while staying within a constructed budget. The successful candidate will serve on-call for selected morning, days and evenings and must be able to react in a timely manner to any changes with staffing needs or programing changes. This role may occasionally require travel to remote sites to assist with production events.

Who you report to:
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Crewing complete events in a timely manner while staying within the event budget parameters. Including the negotiation of rates, communication of the role and responsibilities of each position, travel policy and payment terms.
Record all crewing-related information in central organizational system for Operations, Engineering and Production staff to reference.
Collect and report feedback on independent contractors.
Participate in Operations, Engineering and Production weekly conference calls.
Maintain a basic understanding of all positions and equipment required for each production including but not limited to cameras, audio boards, replay machines, graphics platforms and production switchers.
Continue education to stay current with latest technologies and advancements in both RPS and the industry to recruit and hire the most qualified independent contractors.

Who you are:
Strong interpersonal skills including voice and email communication.
Knowledge of industry standard broadcast positions and equipment.
Capability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment.
Strong organizational skills.
Standard knowledge of PC and Microsoft Office Suite.

As the USA East Channel Manager, you have an entrepreneurial spirit, and will be responsible for defining and executing upon the strategic goals for Sales and Marketing efforts in delivering growth with our regional Channel Partners. This will include building key stakeholder relationships, identifying business trends for growth opportunities and working with the sales team to determine channel partner development priorities. To achieve success, you must be able to understand challenges, identify opportunities for improvement and plan and execute on training and development, commercial and marketing activities to increase the focus and competence of our business partners. You will interact with the Ross Video regional sales team to identify the partners to work with, share intelligence on opportunities and educate partners on solution fit. Ideally, you’ve experience working as a business partner or managing business partners in the Broadcast/Media solutions or product business, specifically in live video production / studio production.
You would work from a home-based office located in Eastern USA and be supported by our sales team in the region and our headquarters in Canada. You have experience and previous success in sales with Video Production Solutions. You are passionately committed to customer service and are prepared to develop business relationships on a face-to-face basis throughout the whole of the region. You have a well-honed ability to communicate compellingly at all levels of an organization both in written and verbal form.

Who you report to: Director of Sales - USA East

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Represent Ross Video to our Business Partners in Eastern USA
• Develop and implement strategic sales plans with key business partners, reviewing and measuring success regularly
• Develop product and solution curriculums for partner training
• Work with the USA Regional marketing team to develop a coherent plan around business partner communications and marketing activities including exhibitions and events
• Use the Ross Video partner program to increase indirect sales revenues with channel partners
• Review Partner Program for enhancement to grow revenues
• Support regional sales managers to hit monthly quota targets through indirect sales development
• Build key, long-term relationships with partner executives and management
• Deliver sales presentations and training to channel partners in the territory
• Structure and deliver key announcements to partners
• Perform market analyses to determine customer needs, price schedules, and discount rates.
• Use your passion for technology workflow, and solutions to continue to improve our solution fit offered by partners
• Represent company at trade association meetings to promote product and partner relations.
• Assist other departments within organization to prepare marketing plans specific to the territory.
• Prepare periodic sales reports showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion
• Monitor and evaluate the activities and products of the competition.
• Review articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised
• Follow company policies and procedures
• Perform other related duties as required

Who you are:
• Experience Selling & Marketing Video Solutions and/or Live Production Equipment to channel partners
• Familiarity with channel partners and consultants through the territory
• Experience in establishing partner networks for Video Production Solutions
• Strategic vision
• Solid user of Microsoft Office Products
• Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tool
• Excellent communication and presentation skills
• Skillful negotiator
• Lateral thinker
• Positive and determined
• High tolerance of ambiguity
• Problem Solver
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills
• High initiative and well-developed analytical skills
• Strong presentation skills
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Passionate about Ross Video and wanting to share that
• Willing to travel up to 60% of the time
• Valid Passport
• Valid Driver’s License

job_description:

All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Demonstration Artist and Training Specialist is responsible for performing training of Ross products, solutions and integration at client locations globally. The position requires above average knowledge on Ross Switchers, Ultrix, Inception or NRSC’s, Caprica and automation system, Overdrive. This front-line individual is responsible for managing customer expectations, completing required documentation, providing end user operational training and ensuring integrity of the training experience. This key individual works closely with our Sales and Demonstration Artist Team to ensure delivery of the Ross Superior Customer Experience.

Who you report to: Manager, Training Solutions - News Production Workflow

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Perform on-site, off-site, online/remote customer demonstrations
• Assist the Overdrive and Switcher Product team with content creation, organization and technical execution of major trade shows throughout the year
• Responsible for the operational and technical integrity of both the demo and training experience and offer effective solutions for areas of improvement in-house and online
• Set up demo equipment, assist with set-up and prepare/test gear prior to demos
• Advise the Sales and Marketing Product Management (MPM) groups regarding current industry trends and customer feedback
• Maintain above average knowledge base and skill set in the functionality and demonstration of all system features for Overdrive and Switcher Solutions
• Develop demonstration techniques, methods and materials for use by other demo staff
• Perform on-site, off-site and online/remote customer training
• Provide internal training for Ross staff
• Maintain training equipment, assist with set-up and prepare/test gear prior to training sessions
• Assist in the development of Overdrive & Switcher customer training methods, materials and techniques
• Provide feedback to the Overdrive & Switcher MPM & TPM on product operation, features and roadmap
• Participate in the review process for upcoming software feature lists
• Champion customer needs, notably operational features, roll-out and training methods as well as future feature requirements
• Actively participate in Ross’ user forums, lead key discussions and assist Overdrive and Switcher users
• Maximum 80% international travel is required and flexible schedule
• Must have a valid passport and driver’s license

Who you are:
• Post-secondary degree related to television broadcast or appropriate work experience in a broadcast/post/corporate video environment using Overdrive.
• Minimum of 5 years experience in training required or 5 years experience operating
• Excellent communication and presentation skills
• In-depth knowledge of graphic design, production, customer needs and applications
• Experience in the selling and marketing process for broadcast equipment is very useful
• Experience with Overdrive or Ross Switcher operation for live events
• Knowledge of use of Ross Video products and a willingness to learn how to demonstrate and train on these products, notably: Overdrive & Ross Switchers/Vision mixers
• Organized and very detail oriented
• Ability to problem solve and trouble shoot
• Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changing environments
• Experience in the selling and marketing process for broadcast equipment is ideal
• Fluent in English with additional languages a bonus

There is an immediate need for a Senior Cost Analyst to support the Ross Video Manufacturing operation in Iroquois and play a key role in the transition of the business to a new ERP platform. Overall, this position will be responsible for product costing, inventory and manufacturing variances, drive process improvement in costing and variance analysis and participate as a member of the ERP implementation team. This position supports operations staff in reviewing, analyzing and reporting on inventory valuation, inventory transactions, direct and indirect labour, direct material and subcontract costs and other overhead costs incurred in the operational segment. This position will report to the Director, Corporate Financial Accounting and will operate partially on site at the manufacturing location and the remainder may be available as a work from home.

Who you report to: Director, Corporate Financial Operations

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

What the job is all about:
• Perform all aspects of cost accounting including the preparation, review and analysis of product inventory costing, standard costing, overhead allocation and variance analysis
• Perform month end process for cost accounting and preparation of month end inventory reports
• Review costs on a periodic basis and manage standard cost updates for multiple products / services
• Provide recommendations for the system and process enhancements to generate more robust and accurate cost accounting information
• Member of the ERP Implementation team and provide cost accounting guidance and recommendations for the required process enhancements and future state deliverables.
• Perform other related duties as required.

Who you are:
• Solid experience in a manufacturing setting supporting standard costing, manufacturing variance analysis
• Previous experience implementing an ERP manufacturing, costing and financial platform
• In depth knowledge of manufacturing, purchasing, receiving and inventory work flows required.
• University degree or Diploma in Business/Accounting
• Advanced knowledge of MS Office and Excel.
• Ability to apply knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles & Cost Accounting Standards
• Work experience in Great Plains accounting software and MAX considered an asset
• Able to work efficiently as a part of a team as well as independently
• Ability to assess workflows and make recommendations for process improvement
• Ability to interpret and implement company policies and procedures.
• Attention to detail in all areas of work.
• Professional written and verbal communication skills.
• Good problem-solving skills and the ability to make the necessary decisions to move forward the work at hand.
• Good organizational, time management and prioritizing skills.

As a member of the Hyperconverged Signal Processing team, you will be responsible for delivering high quality embedded code for the Linux BSP used within our latest video processing platform. This platform is designed to meet the current and future needs of broadcast customers.

As part of a small, committed design team, you aren't just a cog in a machine, on top of being responsible for delivering technical solutions, you also have a voice in shaping the products and help deliver our customer with the ultimate solution for their needs.

Some examples of our products include:
Latest generation of the industry only Open signal processing platform OGX : link
Our latest signal processing modular card based on latest FPGA technology : link
Our high end modular control panel : link

Who you report to: Software Manager

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

• Deliver high quality C and/or C++ software to solve real-time processing problems under Linux
• Clarify requirement and design features. Articulate the design and the assumption and though process behind the design
• Debug embedded systems to find and fix bugs.
Who you are:

• 5 years of experience in embedded development.
• Strong C coding skills.
• Familiar with C++ coding in an embedded environment.
• Ability to collaborate and communicate complex technical concepts.
• Good understanding of hardware.
• Have used various revision control systems
Bonus points if you have the following:
• Good understanding of networking Ethernet/TCP/UDP/IEEE 1588
• Good understanding of Linux driver and kernel development tool
• Experience with buildroot, yocto or other embedded bsp/distro’s
• Strong skills in C++ especially C++-11 and later.
• Good understanding of OS security approaches and strategies

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Where you'll be working:

Ross Video is a world leader in Live Video Production Equipment. Our products are used by a who’s who of the global entertainment industry, including top broadcast networks like NBC, ABC, CBS and Fox in the USA, Rogers, CTV and the CBC in Canada and others around the world from Fiji to Finland and everywhere in between. We are # 1 in providing behind the scenes production gear used in world-class Stadiums where the top-tier sporting events such as the Olympics and NFL Superbowl are held. Our systems are used by top touring live acts to provide video walls, backdrops, and other production elements. Top webcasters like Revision 3 and MLB.com use Ross, as do well-known streaming services, and other familiar names such as Apple and Google. Our equipment is even used on the International Space Station. Join Ross and you will have a chance to work on advanced technology used to produce video and connects people all around (and sometimes high above) the globe.

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

In this roll, you’ll work with the industry-award winning Hyperconverged Solutions Product Team to deliver world-class products. Reporting to the Virginia R&D Leadership you’ll design, deploy, and maintain software build systems, test automation, and development tool infrastructure for the creation of leading-edge products in the live production market.

In this role, activities include, but are not strictly limited to:
• Set up and documentation of scalable automated software/firmware build and release pipelines and continuous integration flows using platforms such as GitLab and Jenkins.
• Working with the R&D team to ensure availability of software builds and infrastructure that support multiple threads of development across projects during all phases of product development, from prototype to release.
• Keeping systems current and secure, including deploying updates and migrating legacy build systems to new build infrastructure.
• Working directly with the IT team for setup, administration and maintaining availability of existing and new development tool systems
• Working with the R&D and Product Verification teams for integration of build systems with automated testing with collection of test results

Who you are:

• B.S. in Engineering required (M.S. in Engineering and/or equivalent experience preferred) with 5y experience or equivalent
• Familiar with DevOps concepts, CI platforms and Development tools (git, svn, GitLab, Jenkins)
• Familiar with shell scripting and various software package build flows including those based on gnu make, CMAKE, autotools etc.
• Familiarity with Linux distributions, package management (e.g. apt) and container tools (e.g. Docker)
• Familiarity with automation of embedded systems build systems, flows and tooling (e.g. buildroot, yocto) highly preferred
• Sound interpersonal skills with ability to work as part of a team or independently as required
• Keen observational skills and problem-solving intuition
• Organized and detail-oriented self-starter with ability to self-manage to meet aggressive deadlines
• Ability to learn new concepts quickly and work towards finding creative solutions to challenging problems
• Comfortable moving forward aggressively; balancing risks appropriately to optimize success across all business aspects – good, fast, and cheap
• Equally comfortable contributing as a team member or championing an idea with upper management
• Minimum 5 years software build infrastructure / DevOps or equivalent related experience preferred
• Direct development experience in embedded systems and application software strongly preferred

At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! What the job is all about:
• Promote, refine and develop innovative features that you are passionate about in the most integrated hardware platform in the broadcast industry.
• Develop schematics and support detailed board layout for designs (frequently contributing directly to technical decisions relating to signal integrity, density, fabrication constraints, and thermal considerations)
• Create complete IO ring designs for Stratix-10/Ultriscale+ FPGAs to verify pin-outs and IP in Quartus and Vivado
• Familiarity with basic circuit design and DC power design
• Implement video transport protocols in FPGA designs including SDI and SMPTE 2110
• Develop high-level design requirements, manage/negotiate key part selection, and support aggressive project scheduling
• Generate both specification & design documentation to support cross functional team

Who you are:
• Senior level HW & FPGA design knowledge and experience across broad range of topics including:
• FPGA building blocks & system architectures
• High speed transceivers, clock domain analysis, & timing closure
• Fluent in development languages used in FPGA design – Verilog, System Verilog, TCL scripting

• Knowledge of high-speed serial interfaces using gigabit transceivers, DDR3/4 interfaces, HBM, and PLL’s

job_description:

With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Where you'll be working:

Ross Video is a world leader in Live Video Production Equipment. Our products are used by a who’s who of the global entertainment industry, including top broadcast networks like NBC, ABC, CBS and Fox in the USA, Rogers, CTV and the CBC in Canada and others around the world from Fiji to Finland and everywhere in between. We are # 1 in providing behind the scenes production gear used in world-class Stadiums where the top-tier sporting events such as the Olympics and NFL Superbowl are held. Our systems are used by top touring live acts to provide video walls, backdrops, and other production elements. Top webcasters like Revision 3 and MLB.com use Ross, as do well-known streaming services, and other familiar names such as Apple and Google. Our equipment is even used on the International Space Station. Join Ross and you will have a chance to work on advanced technology used to produce video and connects people all around (and sometimes high above) the globe.

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

In this roll, you’ll work with the industry-award winning Hyperconverged Solutions Product Team to deliver world-class products. Reporting to the Virginia R&D Leadership you’ll design, deploy, and maintain software build systems, test automation, and development tool infrastructure for the creation of leading-edge products in the live production market.

In this role, activities include, but are not strictly limited to:
• Set up and documentation of scalable automated software/firmware build and release pipelines and continuous integration flows using platforms such as GitLab and Jenkins.
• Working with the R&D team to ensure availability of software builds and infrastructure that support multiple threads of development across projects during all phases of product development, from prototype to release.
• Keeping systems current and secure, including deploying updates and migrating legacy build systems to new build infrastructure.
• Working directly with the IT team for setup, administration and maintaining availability of existing and new development tool systems
• Working with the R&D and Product Verification teams for integration of build systems with automated testing with collection of test results

Who you are:

• B.S. in Engineering required (M.S. in Engineering and/or equivalent experience preferred) with 5y experience or equivalent
• Familiar with DevOps concepts, CI platforms and Development tools (git, svn, GitLab, Jenkins)
• Familiar with shell scripting and various software package build flows including those based on gnu make, CMAKE, autotools etc.
• Familiarity with Linux distributions, package management (e.g. apt) and container tools (e.g. Docker)
• Familiarity with automation of embedded systems build systems, flows and tooling (e.g. buildroot, yocto) highly preferred
• Sound interpersonal skills with ability to work as part of a team or independently as required
• Keen observational skills and problem-solving intuition
• Organized and detail-oriented self-starter with ability to self-manage to meet aggressive deadlines
• Ability to learn new concepts quickly and work towards finding creative solutions to challenging problems
• Comfortable moving forward aggressively; balancing risks appropriately to optimize success across all business aspects – good, fast, and cheap
• Equally comfortable contributing as a team member or championing an idea with upper management

• Direct development experience in embedded systems and application software strongly preferred

Participate and contribute to sales opportunities driven by the Sports & Live Events team

Scope and recommend technical solutions that address customer requirements and that optimize value for both the customer and Ross Video

Diploma/Degree in Broadcasting Technology, Digital Media or a related program (Industry experience will be considered in the absence of formal education)
A foundational understanding of broadcast standards, post-production tools, pro video software suites (e.g. Adobe Creative Suite), non-linear editing, and motion graphics
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Determined and creative problem-solver
Deadline driven and attentive to detail
Valid passport and willingness to travel, as required

Existing knowledge of Ross Video products
Experience in live production environments (Sports, News, Corporate, Live Events)

job_title: Business Development Manager, Production Workflow (Job Req #2022-073)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

We are seeking a talented individual with experience operating or selling one or more of Newsroom, Automated Production Control & Asset Management to join our worldwide business development team. This dynamic individual works to build on Ross Video's market position as the world leader in all live event and broadcast markets.

The ideal Business Development Manager (BDM) for Production Workflow is a strategically-minded workflow specialist with strong business skills. The role has a unique market focus on the United States, including broad news workflow and asset management opportunities.

The Business Development Manager role is expected to achieve financial growth and grow market share, define long-term strategic goals, build key customer relationships, identify business opportunities, and work closely with the sales team to negotiate, and close business deals. The successful candidate will develop geographic specific strategies with the Director of Business Development, Directors of Sales, Regional Sales Managers, and the VP, Production Workflow & Cloud Services. This strategy will provide a regional focus and encompass approaches for live event production across all platforms. The person will also provide technical and workflow related feedback directly to the Product Specialist Team to ensure solution fit for current and future opportunities.

Who you report to: Director of Business Development, Production Workflow

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Develop, execute, and manage business development efforts for Ross Video’s products for Automated Production Control worldwide, and news workflow opportunities in the United States.
• Works directly with Ross Corporate Marketing, to develop Automated Production Control (OverDrive) platforms marketing material for web, press, presentations etc.
• Provide sales support to the sales team internationally to:
• negotiate and close sales
• prepare RFP/RFQ or bid responses.
• prepare application diagrams and descriptions for sales opportunities
• deliver sales presentations to clients and re-sellers
• build relationships with end users by calling on customer facilities directly to promote Ross Production Workflow solutions.
• Monitor and evaluate the activities and products of the competition to Provide valuable feedback to the product development team.
• Work directly with Product Development Team to prepare and maintain competitive analysis documentation for the product line and other collateral documents as required.
• Actively work with Product Marketing Teams to tailor messaging and implement marketing strategy specific to live event and content creation for customers
• Participate in partner events, and several tradeshows association meetings throughout the year
• Prepare and deliver sales training
• Prepare and deliver dealer training
• Work in tandem with the various product specialist(s) to deliver outstanding high-level demonstrations and to develop the best sales strategy for each opportunity.
• Meet monthly/annual orders targets.
• Build relationships with prospects and customers by calling on customer facilities either directly or alongside sales managers to promote Ross Production Workflow Solutions for APC
• Leverage existing relationships with clients and resellers to promote OverDrive and other Production Workflow solutions.
• Seek out, develop, and maintain relationships with 3rd-party solutions in partnership with the Product Management team to generate minimal-effort - run rate product revenue.
• Advise and assist end users, re-sellers, and system integrators concerning sales and purchase of APC solutions.
• Facilitate Ross Solution Road shows, training events, and other user activities in cooperation with other Ross’s stakeholders.
• Develop and Maintain solutions Sales forecasting with the sales team to achieve sales goals.
• Prepare periodic sales reports showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion.
• Assist in resolution of customer complaints regarding equipment, supplies, and services.

Who you are:
• Have experience in a news environment OR a history of successfully selling into the news technology market, coupled with deep knowledge of how the market works and the technology it relies upon
• Physically located in North America - USA or Canada (location and remote working flexible)
• Familiarity with Systems and Workflows specific to the Automated Production Control Solutions market
• Knowledge of Automated workflows
• Knowledge of Process and Operational Workflows at Live event facilities
• Maintain a cursory knowledge of all Ross Video Products
• Demonstrable comfort being customer facing in a hybrid role that is both technical and sales related
• Strong organizational and orchestration skills
• Excellent communication and presentation skills
• Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Experience with Ross solutions
• Additional languages (fluencies)
• Knowledge of any of the following:
• Newsroom (NRCS)
• MAM
• Graphics
• MOS workflow
• Cloud Infrastructure

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

job_description:
As a Production Manager you will maintain adequate capacity to provide quick response to both customers and R&D, meeting targeted customer shipment lead times and on time delivery percentages.

Monitor production productivity and use resources appropriately (i.e., cross training, capacity management). Review orders and schedules with fellow managers to ensure that SMT Lines and all corresponding departments are aligned to meet shipping deadlines and on-time delivery to stockrooms to ensure Systems has adequate lead-time to build and meet shipping deadlines.

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

Some of the things you will work on:

When scheduling, ensure that lines are scheduled to encompass both scheduling needs and ensure capacity efficiency.
Work with Production Planning to communicate and discuss events that are above and beyond the daily workload.
Work with MFG Support to ensure that all products meet quality standards: “We will not ship crap”
In conjunction with Human Resources and Director, Production, responsible for all Human Resource aspects of the department (including, but not limited to hiring, dismissal, discipline, performance reviews, vacation, time-off approvals and team building events)
Ensure Supervisors and Specialists have adequate knowledge of equipment and personnel capabilities within their assigned area

Working with the Specialists and MFG Trainer, ensure appropriate training is provided on new processes and/or equipment as necessary, to enable full capacity and sufficient backups
Work collaboratively with the Manufacturing Support Team and Specialists to implement new processes and procedures
Enforce safety standards according to company policies
Prepare, distribute and communicate on a daily, weekly, month basis, reporting that reflects quality and throughput metrics. Actively engage in ensuring the results of these reports meet standards and work with the Production Supervisor, Specialists and MFG Support to maintain results.
Some travel may be required

Ensure the department follows the Code of Ethics
Follow company policies and procedures.
Perform other related duties as required.

You should have:

Post-secondary degree or appropriate experience.
Excellent knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook.
Working knowledge of MAX and/or similar MRP/ERP program.
Working knowledge of Aegis – MES and/or similar manufacturing execution programs.
Experienced in technical manufacturing operations in a high mix, low volume environment.

Outstanding interpersonal and observational skills.
Organized and very detail orientated.
Good oral and written communication skills
Self-starter, quick learner and able to work with minimum supervision in meeting schedules and project deadlines.
Able to work independently or as part of a team.

Able to manage a team of diverse individuals
Upholds and maintains high product standards

Bonus points if you have the following:

10+ years experience in electronics manufacturing environment

Solid management skills

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Where you'll be working:

Ross Video is a world leader in Live Video Production Equipment. Our products are used by a who’s who of the global entertainment industry, including top broadcast networks like NBC, ABC, CBS and Fox in the USA, Rogers, CTV and the CBC in Canada and others around the world from Fiji to Finland and everywhere in between. We are # 1 in providing behind the scenes production gear used in world-class Stadiums where the top-tier sporting events such as the Olympics and NFL Superbowl are held. Our systems are used by top touring live acts to provide video walls, backdrops, and other production elements. Top webcasters like Revision 3 and MLB.com use Ross, as do well-known streaming services, and other familiar names such as Apple and Google. Our equipment is even used on the International Space Station. Join Ross and you will have a chance to work on advanced technology used to produce video and connects people all around (and sometimes high above) the globe.

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

In this roll, you’ll work with the industry-award winning Hyperconverged Solutions Product Team to deliver world-class products. Reporting to the Virginia R&D Leadership you’ll design, deploy, and maintain software build systems, test automation, and development tool infrastructure for the creation of leading-edge products in the live production market.

In this role, activities include, but are not strictly limited to:
• Set up and documentation of scalable automated software/firmware build and release pipelines and continuous integration flows using platforms such as GitLab and Jenkins.
• Working with the R&D team to ensure availability of software builds and infrastructure that support multiple threads of development across projects during all phases of product development, from prototype to release.
• Keeping systems current and secure, including deploying updates and migrating legacy build systems to new build infrastructure.
• Working directly with the IT team for setup, administration and maintaining availability of existing and new development tool systems
• Working with the R&D and Product Verification teams for integration of build systems with automated testing with collection of test results

Who you are:

• B.S. in Engineering required (M.S. in Engineering and/or equivalent experience preferred) with 5y experience or equivalent
• Familiar with DevOps concepts, CI platforms and Development tools (git, svn, GitLab, Jenkins)
• Familiar with shell scripting and various software package build flows including those based on gnu make, CMAKE, autotools etc.
• Familiarity with Linux distributions, package management (e.g. apt) and container tools (e.g. Docker)
• Familiarity with automation of embedded systems build systems, flows and tooling (e.g. buildroot, yocto) highly preferred
• Sound interpersonal skills with ability to work as part of a team or independently as required
• Keen observational skills and problem-solving intuition
• Organized and detail-oriented self-starter with ability to self-manage to meet aggressive deadlines
• Ability to learn new concepts quickly and work towards finding creative solutions to challenging problems
• Comfortable moving forward aggressively; balancing risks appropriately to optimize success across all business aspects – good, fast, and cheap
• Equally comfortable contributing as a team member or championing an idea with upper management
• Minimum 5 years software build infrastructure / DevOps or equivalent related experience preferred
• Direct development experience in embedded systems and application software strongly preferred

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

The Product Operations Specialist provides support to Sales and Product Management Teams with CRM (Salesforce.com), CPQ (Apttus CPQ) and other commercial systems with an end goal of enabling Ross’ go-to market strategies.

The Product Operations Specialist will provide day to day support to the product teams on various SFDC and CPQ tasks such as creating and configuring products (standalone, bundles, etc.), diagnosing quoting issues and providing pricing assistance. The CRM / CPQ systems specialist will take a proactive approach on recommending new processes or functionality with Salesforce.com or the CPQ which will enhance the Product Team’s abilities to market their products and provide tools to our Sales team.

On the Sales side, the Product Operations Specialist will help with quoting or pricing issues with the CPQ as well as enhancing output documents such as quote templates, among other duties. The Product Operations Specialist will also be very process-driven, creating and improving upon existing processes and process documentation.

The Product Operations Specialist may also be asked to lead specific projects related to Salesforce.com or the CPQ tool.

Who you report to: Manager, CPQ Systems

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family.

What the job is all about:
• Support to Sales and Product Management on commercial systems (Apttus / Conga CPQ, SFDC, Conga composer, etc.)
• Answer questions and provide super user assistance to product management and sales users.
• Assist in updating product and pricing data in SFDC.
• Help create and maintain product structures and rules within SFDC, ensuring consistency in how we present products across product lines
• Research and implement new commercial systems functionality as required (for example, guided selling, machine learning, etc.).
• Develop and deliver training to new Product Management staff (BDM’s, PM’s, POM’s) on how to use SFDC and the CPQ.
Who you are:
• BA/BS degree or equivalent
• Basic Knowledge & Proficiency (minimum 1 years’ experience) with Salesforce.com administration or development (Salesforce certification is a plus)
• Basic Knowledge & Proficiency (minimum 1-year experience) with SteelBrick/Salesforce CPQ, Apttus CPQ or another CPQ tool (certification is a plus)
• Intermediate Knowledge & Proficiency with MS Excel (navigational shortcuts, formulas such as VLOOKUP and SUMIF, PivotTables and Pivot Charts)
• Basic Knowledge & Proficiency with standard office tools such as MS Word, PowerPoint, and Visio
• Knowledge of sales processes and/or experience in sales
• Knowledge of product management process and/or experience in product management/marketing
• Extremely detail oriented – passionate about accuracy
• Organized – able to juggle the demands of multiple projects
• Excellent planning and scheduling skills
• Proactive and action oriented
• Strong interpersonal skills - an ability to collaborate effectively within a team environment
• Adaptable in a fast-paced, multi-project environment
• “Change agent” who is interested in improving internal processes
• Excellent communication skills – comfortable presenting to audiences of 10-20 ppl
• Analytical problem solver – able to understand and create solutions for complex requirements
• Ability to collaborate as well as work independently

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. As a member of the Hyperconverged Signal Processing team, you will be responsible for delivering high quality embedded code for the Linux BSP used within our latest video processing platform. This platform is designed to meet the current and future needs of broadcast customers.

As part of a small, committed design team, you aren't just a cog in a machine, on top of being responsible for delivering technical solutions, you also have a voice in shaping the products and help deliver our customer with the ultimate solution for their needs.

Some examples of our products include:
Latest generation of the industry only Open signal processing platform OGX : link
Our latest signal processing modular card based on latest FPGA technology : link
Our high end modular control panel : link

Who you report to: Software Manager

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• Deliver high quality C and/or C++ software to solve real-time processing problems under Linux
• Clarify requirement and design features. Articulate the design and the assumption and though process behind the design
• Debug embedded systems to find and fix bugs.
Who you are:

• 5 years of experience in embedded development.
• Strong C coding skills.
• Familiar with C++ coding in an embedded environment.
• Ability to collaborate and communicate complex technical concepts.
• Good understanding of hardware.
• Have used various revision control systems
Bonus points if you have the following:
• Good understanding of networking Ethernet/TCP/UDP/IEEE 1588
• Good understanding of Linux driver and kernel development tool
• Experience with buildroot, yocto or other embedded bsp/distro’s
• Strong skills in C++ especially C++-11 and later.
• Good understanding of OS security approaches and strategies
