job_title: HR Operations Specialist- Immigration & Programs (Job Req #2022-513)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Passionate about live production, Ross Video designs, manufactures and delivers dependable technology and services that power exceptional live video productions seen by billions of viewers around the world every day. Working closely with all members of the Human Resources team, the HR Operations Specialist will play a significant role in our Immigration and Short-Term Business Traveler Programs, ESOP and Stock Option programs. You will be involved in updating and rolling out new programs, policy changes, and providing ongoing support for HR Operations programs.

Who you report to: Director, HR Operations

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

Immigration
• Manage immigration program and coordinate with foreign nationals for immigration processes. Ensures all paperwork, including applications for immigration and visas are completed accurately and in a timely manner.
• Responsible for tracking all visas/work permits to ensure they are renewed
• Provide support to Short-Term business travelers as well as tracking for immigration and tax compliance.
• Manage Travel Tracking program to ensure compliance with Duty of Care responsibilities.

Corporate Programs
• Responsible for coordinating the annual minimarket for the ESOP (Employee Share Ownership Program). This includes all employee communication, tracking, documentation, accuracy of transactions, and issuance of share certificates
• Responsible for managing the quarterly Share Option grants and the associated documentation. Ensure accuracy of transactions and coordinate with Accounting for financial reporting.
• Manage the software program to ensure accurate tracking.

Compliance Programs:
• Provide guidance and support on HR policies, programs or processes related to benefits, employment legislation and compliance with special focus on global consistency.
• These programs could include but are not limited to time and leave policies, governmental compliance reporting submissions, internal or external audits, corporate wide policies that include HR subject matter.
• Coordinate translation for employer resources as needed.
• Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.
• Provide research as requested.

HR Operations & Knowledge Management:
• Provide oversight, support, reporting and analysis for HR specialty programs, ensuring HR standards and governance are applied to all content and deliverables.
• Provide support for consistent development of HR materials. Ensure HR standards and governance applied to all content and deliverables.
• Contribute to overall knowledge management, documentation and organization of materials related to HR programs, policies, and processes.
• Provide back-up support for HRIS system, HR Hub, metrics reporting, sales incentive reporting and other HR Ops team responsibilities.
• Assist with special HR projects and initiatives as required. Perform other related duties as required.

Who you are:

• Knowledge of Immigration rules and process for Canada & the US. Experience outside of North America is an asset.
• Tech savvy – experience implementing new software is an asset.
• Strong excel experience with a willingness to work hands-on in the details as well as in the analysis.
• HR systems experience – knowledge of Dayforce and SharePoint are an asset.
• Strong attention to detail & organization skills; ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks
• Minimum 2 years’ experience in HR with a Degree/Certificate in Human Resources, Business or related discipline, HR Certification an asset
• Excellent oral and written communications skills with the ability to communicate effectively to various levels of the organization.
• Able to maintain confidentiality with a high degree of diplomacy
• Team-oriented and enjoys working within a collaborative environment
• Positive attitude and able to work in a fast-paced environment
• Knowledge of employment related legislation an asset
• Occasional travel to Iroquois/Ottawa office for team meetings

job_title: Solution Specialist – Sports & Live Events, North America
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

At Ross Video, we are Living Live! We are at the cutting edge of Live Video production, powering much of the world’s most compelling Live Events with our High Impact/High Efficiency Solutions.

Who you report to: Technical Solutions Manager – Global

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

We are currently searching for a dynamic, highly motivated Solution Specialist to join our Sports and Live Events team at our Ottawa headquarters - in its initiative to increase sales and support of Ross Video technology in theses market spaces.

This is an entry level role within the Global Sales organization, where the selected recruit will be immersed in Ross technology and workflows with an emphasis on building technical proficiency and customer facing soft skills. This is a diverse role that reports directly to the Technical Solutions Manager - Sports & Live Events and requires frequent interaction with the company’s prospects, partners and internal engineering and technical support teams to ensure customer expectations are met, and that customers are supported after initial deployment of Ross solutions. This unique position will include, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities and duties:
Position will be located at our Ottawa headquarters
Participate and contribute to sales opportunities driven by the Vice President of Sports & Live Events and Sales Management Team, prioritizing efforts based on maximizing total impact on the team’s productivity
Assist with solution performance benchmarking and troubleshooting customer technical and workflow issues
Pre-sale technical consultation and post-sale project support.
Scope technical solutions to address customer requirements, assess customers met and unmet needs, and recommends solutions that optimize value for both the customer and Ross Video
Work on system oriented and highly technical projects.
Generates localized sales tools on various mediums for internal and external distribution (PowerPoint’s, Application Notes, Competitive Guides, etc.).
Engages in customer facing product presentations, demos, training, and workflow guidance to end-users and business partners at customer premise, tradeshows, or remote

Who you are:
Diploma/Degree in Broadcasting technology and or Digital Media. (Industry experience will be considered in the absence of formal education)
Excellent communication & presentation skills.
Able to work co-operatively with and across all company departments.
Strong knowledge of Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Basic computer IT skills
Basic Knowledge of “Pro video” software suites (Example: Adobe Creative Suite)
Possess strong and creative problem-solving traits.
Strong acumen for learning new technology
Positive, determined, problem solver
Deadline driven
Strong organization and communication skills
Ability to multi-task
Ability to work well independently and self-motivate
Attention to detail and a strong work ethic
Desire to contribute to a team environment
Ability to handle stressful situations
Willing to Travel up to 40% of the time
Must live within 75 miles of major airport
Valid Passport
Valid Driver’s License & a clear driving record
Travel to annual NAB, IDEA, SVG, and other sports related trade shows (if required)
Attend Sales Meetings as required

Bonus Points if you have the following:
Existing knowledge of Ross Video products
Experience in live production environments (Sports, news, Corporate, Live Event)
Experience with broadcast and professional video software and hardware
Knowledge of industry standard protocols, connectors, and terminations.
Exposure to Object Oriented Programming languages (javascript, vb.net etc.)

job_title: Product Verification Specialist- Primestream, Streamline (Job Req #2022-522)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Primestream/Streamline Product Verification Specialist is a full-time role, reporting to the Software Manager. The successful candidate will help ensure the quality of new features in leading edge web technologies for our media asset management systems. From graphics to video production, you'll work with the team to develop systems to organize, manage, search and report on media content being used in all aspects of live broadcast.
There’s a lot of content that goes into live broadcast. From the video packages for news stories, to sports team logos, there is a lot for a facility to organize. Unbelievably, in this age of technology, there are still newsrooms trying to manage their content with tapes and disks! Surely there are better ways to work with your media? That’s where Primestream & Streamline comes in!
Primestream & Streamline are Media Asset Management systems that specializes in content delivery for live broadcast. We provide a central and convenient interface for organizing media, editing metadata, previewing assets, searching for content, order management and fulfillment. We also provide automated workflows for moving content for use on air, cleaning old content and generating reports on a wide range of information. That’s what we do today, but we have a lot more work to do. We need you to help us get there.
We are a team who believe in incremental development and strive for continuous improvement with our agile workflow. We know we’re not perfect and as we expect to make mistakes, but also to learn from those mistakes and grow as a result to become stronger, faster and better.
We are highly customer focused as customer satisfaction is our highest priority. If that means jumping on a plane and flying half-way around the world to address an issue, then that’s what we’ll do. We go above and beyond for all of our clients – big and small.
We believe in technical excellence and want to create craftspeople as opposed to developers and testers. We think that following best practices, such as TDD, clean code, adhering to SOLID design principles, clean architecture, test automation, and high levels of collaboration among the team produces the most maintainable and extendable applications.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Working in an Agile environment and participate in all scrum meetings
• Collaborate with the development team to ensure feature requirements and scenarios are complete, understood and accepted.
• Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases, based on new product features and identified issues, to ensure quality.
• Aid in the development of product automation test suites
• Execution of manual test cases and reporting results
• Continuous comprehension of Ross and third party products to ensure interoperability and proper end-to-end workflows.

Who you are:
• Minimum 2-year diploma in Broadcast, Electronics, Programming or a minimum of 3 years of equivalent test experience
• Experience with PV methodologies, software testing principles, concepts, verification, validation methods, test & risk management
• Good understanding of testing at scale, performance and software reliability
• Ability to work and collaborate in a team setting with an open, collaborative communication style
• Ability to function in both Windows, Linux and MacOS environment
• Possesses a great attention to detail and critical mindset
• Good analysis and troubleshooting skills

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Expertise in live production and/or broadcast production
• Experience with PV tools, bug tracking systems and test plan development (Jira, Zephyr Scale)
• Experience automating test cases (API and User Interface levels)
• Experience with Git
• Knowledge of one or more scripting languages such as Java, JavaScript, PHP etc.

At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. This role may occasionally require travel to remote sites to assist with production events.

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• Crewing complete events in a timely manner while staying within the event budget parameters. Including the negotiation of rates, communication of the role and responsibilities of each position, travel policy and payment terms.

• Collect and report feedback on independent contractors.
• Participate in Operations, Engineering and Production weekly conference calls.
• Maintain a basic understanding of all positions and equipment required for each production including but not limited to cameras, audio boards, replay machines, graphics platforms and production switchers.
• Continue education to stay current with latest technologies and advancements in both RPS and the industry to recruit and hire the most qualified independent contractors.

The Hardware FPGA Designer role will utilize the latest FPGA and SoC devices to develop leading edge platforms that power live video production. As a designer within the Switchers team, you will further advance the Ross industry leading Carbonite product family of switchers. Successful candidates will have serious technical chops to pair with a find a way attitude in order to harness the full power of themselves and their teammates in solving unique and challenging technical problems in a supportive, high-energy and dynamic work environment.

Who you report to: Technical Product Manager

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we've got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Promote, refine and develop innovative features that you are passionate about in the most integrated hardware platform in the broadcast industry.
• Implement video transport protocols in FPGA designs including SDI, HDMI, NDI, and other streaming formats
• Implement complex RTL algorithms for the processing of audio and video
• Create complete IO ring designs for Stratix-10/Ultriscale+ FPGAs to verify pin-outs and IP in Quartus and Vivado
• Develop high-level design requirements, manage/negotiate key part selection, and support aggressive project scheduling
• Generate both specification & design documentation to support cross functional team
• Develop test features that can be utilized by manufacturing test, product verification and in the field
• Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of FPGA & HW designs
• Efficient and systematic debugging skills.
• Assist in supporting other staff members as necessary through entire NPI process flow – including design, documentation, test, presales and customer service
Who you are:
• Passionate team-player looking to expand their skillset and contribute in a fast-paced environment
• Possess keen observational skills and problem-solving intuition
• Self-starter with the tenacity to bring product to market
• Comfortable moving forward aggressively while balancing risks appropriately to optimize success across all business & technical aspects of the product
• FPGA designer with knowledge and experience across broad range of topics including:
• FPGA building blocks & system architectures
• High speed transceivers, clock domain analysis, & timing closure
• You are an expert in RTL design for complex IP targeting large Xilinx or Altera FPGA SOC.
• Expertise in current Xilinx & Intel devices and associated design and debugging tools
• Knowledge of high-speed serial interfaces using gigabit transceivers, DDR3/4 interfaces, HBM, and PLL's
• Excellent debugging skills & proficient with typical lab equipment (scopes, JBERTs, network analyzers, WFMs, etc)
• Ability to work in an embedded environment. Linux, bash, C/C++ and networking skills a plus
Bonus points if you have the following:
• Knowledge of broadcast studio applications & workflows; especially distribution / production systems a plus
• Understanding of digital video and associated audio standards a plus
• Familiar with video broadcast standards such as SDI, AES, Timecode, Madi, Tri-level syncs.
• Familiar with high-speed serial interfaces such as SDI, 10/40 GigE, Ethernet, PCIe
• Signal Integrity knowledge a plus
• Ability to develop schematics and support detailed board layout for designs (frequently contributing directly to technical decisions relating to signal integrity, density, fabrication constraints, and thermal considerations)
• Experience designing video processing algorithms such as filters. video codecs (H264, H265, MPEG2), color space conversion, scaling, etc.

The R&D Operations team provides support across the entire R&D organization, helping with program status reporting, transfer to manufacturing, training programs, process development, tools development & support, test automation, coordinating centralized support, site-wide social activities, patent applications, and a bunch of other stuff to help the R&D team as a whole be as effective as possible. We are the grease or the glue (depending on the situation!) and get to work with several corporate functions outside of R&D, including facilities, finance, manufacturing, tech support, sales, marketing and IT/IS

As part of this team, the R&D Operations Specialist will be the one to help define and use tools and systems to identify what is going on (both in the R&D Operations team and the larger R&D Team) as well as ensure things keep moving in a timely fashion at a sustainable pace.

We are looking for someone to join a fun team that is focused on helping Ross Video continue to build some really cool products for some really cool customers. If you enjoy being part of something exciting that has an impact on billions of people across the entire globe, we should talk!

• Work closely with the VP Product Development, the Sr. Director of R&D Operations and the R&D Operation Specialist team to execute the day-to-day activities of the Operations team in an effective and transparent manner
• Manage inter-/intra- team meetings & Community Of Practice forums (reserve resources, send out invites, capture minutes, track updates meeting-over meeting)
• Track resource allocations for operations service teams to make sure we can execute at a sustainable pace
• Consolidate project status across the R&D teams and produce department wide reports
• Arrange for internal training seminars under the guidance of the CTO & VP Product Development

• Experience in MS Office

• Coding / Scripting / Macro experience an asset
• Understanding of technical product development and an interest in the Live Video Broadcast market
• Self-motivated
• Self-sufficient team player
• Willingness to try new things and propose improvements
• Good communicator – oral and written

• Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment
• Friendly energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm
• Superb attention to detail

The successful candidate will work closely with Service Delivery Management, the Training team’s Product Primes and Ross Video’s Product Teams to design, develop, and implement engaging learning activities leading to certification. This includes instructor-led training offered in person or online, self-instructional e-learning modules, instructional videos, and other learning solutions as needed. The incumbent will work closely with subject matter experts to convert highly technical and operational content into effective learning materials. They will also collaborate with other trainers as needed to align projects, discuss initiatives, and develop company best practices for learning and development. The incumbent may also develop non-technical training for management or professional development and perform other duties as required.

Who you report to:
The Instructional Design Specialist will report to the Manager of Learning and Development within the Service Delivery Operations team.

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
Design and Development
• Assess needs and recommend appropriate learning solutions. Partner with key stakeholders within the learning function and subject matter experts across the organization to identify target audience learning needs and ensure learning activities meet business requirements.
• Analyze existing training materials and recommend improvements.
• Apply proven theories, practices, models, and developing trends to optimize instructional design and development. Be creative in finding learning solutions that may be new or innovative and that effectively address learning needs.
• Prepare and manage learning documentation (e.g. course plans, storyboards).
• Create effective e-learning in the form of self-instructional modules for specific target groups or for company employees generally.
• Develop and manage learning assets that can be used in different projects (e.g. audio clips, images, videos).
• Contribute to the overall success of the Learning and Development function by identifying ways to continually improve design and development, tools, and learning experiences.
• Collaborate with the Manager, Learning and Development to establish priorities, manage projects, and improve learning and development programs.
• Manage own work to meet deadlines and proactively identify and advise on issues that may affect the timely design and development of learning solutions.
• Accountable for the accuracy and quality of all instructional design work.
Other duties
• Leverage templates and requirements to develop and produce training.
• Communicate effectively orally and in writing with individuals at all levels of the organization.
• Use the company Learning Management System (LMS) to distribute learning materials and track results. Work with the Manager, Learning and Development and with other administrators to continually improve ways of working with the LMS.
• Stay current with learning-oriented technology trends and innovations to continually create quality learning solutions.
• Follow company policies and procedures.
• Perform other duties related to instructional design and development.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary degree in instructional design, educational technology, or related field.
• 5+ Years of experience designing and developing learning solutions in a business environment.
• Demonstrated experience in completing training projects on time and with consistent good results.
• Demonstrated skills developing e-learning, more specifically with the Articulate Suite of authoring software, and including demonstrable examples of e-learning modules.
• Extensive skills working with other software to create learning materials, like the Microsoft Office suite, graphics, audio, and video editing software, and online presentation or learning software.
• Collaborative and proactive with strong interpersonal skills.
• Strong attention for detail.
• Excellent oral and written communication skills.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
• Self-starter, quick learner, and ability to work with minimum supervision.
• Passionate about learning, instructional design and discovering new technologies.
• Able to work independently and as part of a team.

• Knowledge of live broadcast workflows and production
• Experience in a high technology domain

In this role you will be responsible for SMT component replacement including micro-components, BGA’s, connectors both SMT and SMT/Thru hole combinations, perform lifted/damaged pad repairs and track cuts and working on Thru-hole component removal and insertion. Working with technical staff to receive and interpret direction and responsible for prioritizing daily work by production needs, RMA’s and Return to Customer defects. On occasion working with engineers to perform modifications to PCBA.

Who you report to: Production Manager

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Some of the things you will work on:
• Prepping boards for repair include:
o. Applying heat resistant materials to parts on the board for protection which include Kapton tape, heat blankets, pink shield
p. Dismantling fully/partially assembled boards
q. Baking boards, and logging times, in preparation for rework
• Ability to make choices, based on board damage or difficulty of task, on whether or not a defect is repairable or scrap
• Multi-tasking is always necessary as specialists commonly require small jobs done in order to do their daily tasks
• Creativity is necessary when working with densely populated boards to get components on and off
• Accurately interprets and enters defect information within MES.
• Works closely with SMT and Mechanical Support staff
• Maintaining ESD practices.

You should have:
• An understanding of the X-Ray machine in order to deduce whether or not the solder quality adheres to IPC Standards
• An Excellent understanding of IPC-610 quality standards
• Knowledge of various tools – hot air guns, pre-heaters and traditional soldering/de-soldering tools and tips
• Air Vac is used for removing and replacing micro-components, BGA’s, Flip Chips and connectors. The necessary knowledge for running this equipment include:
• Stencil and paste process
• Creating profiles using solder sample boards and thermo couples
• Reballing BGA’s

Bonus points if you have the following:
• An Excellent understanding of IPC-610 quality standards
• MES system

• Have a mechanical aptitude
• Analytical and organized with problem-solving skills
• Able to adapt, think fast and work well with others
• Able to switch between various departments and personnel throughout the organization
• Excel in a fast-paced, priority driven, team environment
• Excellent communication

Reporting to the Art Director, Creative Services, the successful candidate will be responsible for the execution of and/or participation in Ross Creative and Professional Services activities, by providing services for the design, creation, and implementation of XPression real-time graphics and graphics packages and assisting with key XPression Sales and Marketing opportunities.
This position is located in our Ottawa office or a home-based office setting, if mutually agreed upon.

Who you report to: Art Director

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Creates XPression templates and animations, using native Xpression tools and provided base graphic elements – such as 3D models, still images, and clips.
• Designs XPression templates and animations from scratch, using native XPression tools and 3rd-party graphics applications such as Cinema 4D and Adobe Suite.
• Creates packages that conform to standardized workflows outlined by the Art Director.
• Ensures appropriate automation hooks are created for outside control.
• Utilize XPression Visual Logic and scripting for automated, dynamic templates.
• Setup XPression Datalinq to pull in external data feeds and interface with external data aggregation systems.
• Use Ross Dashboard to create manual user interface panels and backup solutions for XPression automated graphics.
• Responsible for implementation and integration of graphics packages at customer's sites, as required.
• Attends meetings and conference calls as required to scope, complete, or otherwise facilitate successful completion of assigned projects as they relate to the job.
• Work with other creative and professional service members to institute a consistent and standardized workflow solution.
• Collaborate and assist with other creative and professional service members to enhance the overall skillset of the group.
• Work interdepartmentally to develop workflow-based solutions the support the values and overall company product developmental goals.
• Works with Ross team members to create style and operational guides for end users.
• Documents any custom scripting methodologies to ensure future support from Ross.
• May be required to create project style-guides of assets.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary degree or trade school diploma
• Advanced knowledge of Adobe creative suite
• Advanced knowledge of Cinema 4D and Redshift renderer
• Intermediate knowledge of IT workflows
• Intermediate computer programming experience in VB, SQL, and/or JAVA is desirable
• Proficient in Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint
• Proficient knowledge of Unreal Engine a plus
• Minimum 5-10 years production experience in broadcast (studio or remote) or sport venue
• Minimum 5-10 years of graphic design experience.
• Advanced knowledge of broadcast graphics workflows
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
• Excellent communication skills
• Aptitude for animation and choreography of movement
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills
• High tolerance of ambiguity
• Team-oriented, and able to work co-operatively with Ross and end users
• Enthusiastic problem solver
• Willing to travel on a project-by-project basis up to 50% of the time
• Valid Passport and Valid Driver's License
• Occasional requirement to set-up equipment – involves lifting up to 50 lbs, reaching, bending, stooping, etc

This key role in the Ross Sales organization requires a unique blend of engineering / solutions solving skills along with the “soft skills” required in a sales process. The Solutions Architect is responsible, during pre-sales activities, for ensuring Ross Video’s Superior Customer Experience. This requires collaboration with the sales team, customer interaction and managing the client’s expectations throughout the engagement.

This is a diverse role that requires close collaboration with the company’s Sales, Marketing, Research and Development, and Technical Support teams to ensure proposed deals include technical solutions that accurately address our customers’ needs.

Ideally based in Sydney, this position will focus on the Australia, New Zealand and Pacific Island territories.

Who you report to: Technical Solutions manager, Asia

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a wide range of fun social activities and events!

• Participate and contribute to sales opportunities driven by the Regional Sales Managers, prioritizing efforts based on maximizing total impact on the team’s productivity.
• Scope technical solutions to address customer requirements, assesses customer’s met and unmet needs and recommends solutions that optimize value for both the customer and Ross Video.
• Coordinate closely with Ross’ Sales team and business partners to align solutions designed to meet our customers’ business requirements.
• Proactively educate and provide professional development to team and business partners in order to enhance their product knowledge, technical acumen, and technical sales skills.
• Generate localized sales tools on various mediums for internal and external distribution (PowerPoint’s, Application Notes, Competitive Guides, etc.).
• Engage in customer facing product presentations, demos, training, and workflow guidance to end-users and business partners at customer premise or tradeshows.
• Opportunistically pursue additional business development opportunities and collaborate with Sales to ensure these are effectively covered and advanced.
• Work on systems oriented and highly technical projects as well as managing and coordinate project delivery in collaboration with Services team.
• Create drawings that capture the spirit of specific opportunities, while also creating general variations for use by other groups at Ross.
• Help to prepare world-class customer facing proposal supplements.
• Manage proposals for large RFPs.
• Participate in developing and implementing product awareness collateral / presentations.
• Provide client feedback to Marketing Product Manager(s) on product & application requirements.

• Record of achievement and technical solution expertise in a comparable sales role.
• Understanding of the Broadcast / Media Technology Market (Live Production experience an asset).
• Possess strong knowledge of industry standard protocols, connectors and terminations.
• Advanced skill set in using in Visio or OmniGraffle as well as AutoCad Architect.
• Preferred experience in scheduling software MS Project or Merlin (OSX).
• Excellent Communication & Presentation Skills.
• Must be proficient in both Desktop and Server Networking.
• Proactive and able to work co-operatively with and across all company departments.
• Strong presentation skills.
• Strong knowledge of Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
• Possesses strong and creative problem-solving traits.

This is a critical role within the Service Delivery team, as you are organizing and scheduling customer training, commissioning and demonstration dates. You are also scheduling internal training and assigning projects to both full-time Service Delivery employees and freelancers. This role has a high number inbound email and requests on a daily basis. Triaging and addressing them in a timely and efficient manner is key to success in this role.

You will work in close collaboration with Solutions Architects, Project Management, Technical Support and the Demonstration and Tradeshow Equipment (DTE) teams to schedule required resources including staff, equipment and facilities. You’ll also work closely with the Sales team as part of an initiative to proactively schedule our commissioning and training services.

Who you report to: Manager, Training Operations

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Maintaining and updating all training, commissioning and demo request projects within SalesForce in terms of scheduling, resources assigned as well as customer correspondence notes.
• Working with the Salesforce Developers to create custom reports and dashboards.
• Continuously maintaining and updating the master schedule to ensure full accuracy.
• Ensuring that training, commissioning and demonstrations expenses are properly tracked and invoiced.
• Tracking all travel and accommodation expenses to ensure accurate billing.
• Producing technical services reports and scorecards identifying key trends and information (for example: number of days spent on specific product training, resource demand over time, types of requests for GEO, etc…).

Who you are:
• Strong working knowledge of MS Office, specifically Word, Excel, and Outlook.
• Working knowledge of Salesforce
• High School diploma
• Excellent communication skills.
• Well-organized, detail oriented and able to multi-task.
• Ability to effectively function in a fast-paced environment.
• Professional telephone etiquette and effective interpersonal skills.
• Additional education and computer courses are considered strong assets
• Occasional travel is required to our Iroquois office, and there is a possibility of working at major international tradeshows (NAB or IBC).

As the Manager of the RMA Department, you have the responsibility and authority to plan, steer, train and coach Ross Video personnel in the support of RMAs (customer returns).
The department incudes RMA administration (receipt and internal processing), Electronic Technicians (evaluation and debug), PCBA repair, Mechanical Assembly and RMA testing.
This position is located at our Manufacturing and Test facility in Iroquois, ON.

Who you report to: Manager, Test Development

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Debug/repair planning and prioritization, working closely with onsite Test Development team to ensure Technicians have the tools and training to be self-sufficient in debugging/testing customer returns.
• Organize and or provide on-going training and knowledge sharing.
• work with Mfg IS team to assure RMA and repair data is aggregated and made available to company stakeholders (product teams, technical support, manufacturing and management) as necessary and appropriate
• In consultation with Test Development, design and install test infrastructure along with maintenance and upgrades when needed.
• Record and analyze debug activity.
• Hiring and managing of direct reports. Working in tandem with assigned HR Business Partner, this would include job description creation/amendments, resume reviews, and interviews with final hiring authority and all other associated duties with respect to people management.
• Onboard and on-going training of direct reports regarding specific tools, processes, and workflows.
• Prepare yearly capital and labour budget. Procurement of equipment and tools related to the debugging and testing of product.
• Collaboration with multiple stakeholders with respect to quality and optimisation of process and procedures.

Who you are:
• Minimum 2 years as supervisor, or manager with direct reports in a manufacturing/test environment.
• Minimum 3-year post-Secondary Education in Electronics or equivalent.
• Proficient in electronic theory and applications, with emphasis on digital components such as CPU, FPGA, flash, etc.
• Solid understanding of JTAG technologies (IEEE 1149.1, 1149.6.) along with associated development tool.
• A good understanding of Networking Protocols, PTP, IGMP Snooping, Multicast, SNMP, QoS, ACL, etc., Experience with scripting and programming languages (i.e.: AutoIt, TCL, Java, C, C++).
• Have experience in data acquisition concepts and with TCP/IP, RS232, USB and CAN communication.
• Robust foundation in schematic reading and interpretation
• Working knowledge of source code writing for microprocessors (Atmel) and FPGA (Xilinx/Altera) design.
• Familiarity with wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.). Knowledge of schematic capture and layout tools
• Knowledge of Video (SDI, video over IP) and Audio (AES and analog) standards (SMPTE)
• Working experience with Linux, Win7 and Win10.
• Understanding and hands-on experience with databases and SQL.
• Knowledge of computer networking configuration.
• Computer proficiency with Microsoft Office and core business-use tools.
• Experience working in PLM, MRP and MES software packages.
• In-depth experience in manufacturing processes and procedures and the product development process
• Some inventory, logistics and planning background are an asset.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Excellent leadership, planning, negotiation, interpersonal and decision-making skills able to work with various levels of management, departments and personnel throughout the organization on a variety of technical, procedural and process issues.
• Must have excellent verbal, written and documentation skills with experience developing and presenting to upper-level management, peers, and other direct or in-direct team members.
• Self-starter, quick learner and can work with minimum supervision in meeting schedules and project deadlines
• High initiative and well developed analytical, problem solving, communication and troubleshooting skills.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is desired.
• Ability to cope with varying levels of support and documentation.
• Able to envision the entire project and look for problem areas

Join Ross Video and you will have an opportunity to be part of a growing company that is continuing to expand in the US marketplace.

In this role, you will be responsible for proactively and aggressively growing both existing and new business relationships for Ross Video in your region either directly or through one of Ross’ designated Channel Partners. The territory for this position includes the states of Montana, Wyoming, Colorado, Utah and Nevada along with additional, named key, national accounts.

You would work from a home-based office in the region and be supported by our headquarters in Canada.

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

Some of the things you will work on:
• Represent Ross Video with end users and customers and channel resale partners within the region.
• Negotiate and close sales.
• Meet annual, quarterly and monthly, quota targets.
• Build key, long-term relationships with end users by calling on customer facilities directly to promote Ross products and services.
• Engage the Product Managers in regular presentations to customers.
• Deliver sales presentations to clients and re-sellers in the Territory.
• Develop and implement strategic sales plans to accommodate corporate and individual territorial goals.
• Develop and maintain sales forecasting activities and assists in setting of territory sales goals with integrators and dealers, where applicable.
• Perform market analyses to determine customer needs, price schedules, and discount rates.
• Advise and assist end users concerning sales and purchase of Ross Video Product line.
• Assist in directing product marketing to client base to establish Ross Video products in the region.
• Represent company at trade association meetings to promote product.
• Assist in coordination and liaison between sales department and other sales related units.
• Assist other departments within the organization to prepare marketing plans specific to the territory.
• Prepare periodic sales reports showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion.
• Monitor and evaluate the activities and products of the competition.
• Review articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.
• Ensure the Sales and marketing of Ross products, services and solutions follows the Ross Video code of ethics.
• Assist in resolution of customer issues regarding equipment, supplies, and services.

Who you are:
• In the position of Regional Sales Manager, you should have an entrepreneurial spirit. You should have experience and previous success in sales related to live production products, services, and solutions. You will have passionate commitment to customer service and should be prepared to develop business relationships on a face-to-face basis throughout your region. You will have a well-honed ability to communicate compellingly at all levels of an organization both in written and verbal form.
• Experience Selling & Marketing of Live Production Equipment, specifically Production Switchers, Graphic Systems, Robotics, Cameras, Routing Systems, Master Control Systems, Newsroom Systems, Control Systems, and Media Asset Management.
• Familiarity with Key Customers through the territory.
• Strong negotiating skills

The Director of Product Management Operations (DPMO) is an important staff position, reporting into the Executive Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer. The DPMO is responsible for systems, processes and tools across our product management teams while driving planning cycles.

The DPMO collaborates closely with product managers and VPs across the product, vertical markets and sales teams. The DPMO over time will grow an appropriately sized team to support the needs of Product Management Operations.

Who you report to: Executive Vice President & Chief Marketing Officer

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• RWTPM – work with key stakeholder groups (VPs of Product, R&D Operations, Product Managers, Marketing and Sales), to define, develop and implement the Ross Way to Product Manage across the company. Ensure RWTPM dovetails with The Ross Way to Sell and Ross Way to Develop.
• Better Practices – establish key practices and processes as part of RWTPM.
• Training – establish onboarding and training and development program for Product Managers.
• Annual Operations Cadence – Coordinate the annual planning and review cadence from a Product Management perspective including SGRASPP, PGRASPP, Budget Setting, Quarterly Reviews, etc.
• Tools & Technology – Initiate ongoing investigations, development, and deployment of the use of technology in support our Product Marketing efforts.
• Data & Reporting – Establish standardized reports that support Product Managers and Product Teams from the various enterprise systems used corporately by Ross.
• Strategy – Develop a multi-year strategic plan for PMO that supports Ross’ corporate strategic growth plan working across stakeholder groups to ensure relevance and alignment.
• R&D Operations – Collaborate effectively with R&D Operations team on joint projects, events and initiatives.
• Human Resources – Work closely with HR on PMO strategies and plans around Product Management needs, training, skills matrix and development plans.
• Finance – Work with Finance on standardized PM reporting needs, budget cycle, business plans, etc.
• Team – Over time build a team to support PMO as Ross Scales as a Company.
• Initiatives – Take responsibility for leading Product Management related initiatives as they arise.
• Culture - promote a culture of high performance and continuous improvement that values learning and a commitment to quality.
• Ethics & Teamwork - exude the behaviors identified within Ross Video’s Culture statements, as well as the company’s Code of Ethics.

Who you are:

• Years of first-hand product management experience in a technology setting
• A solid understanding of and passion for product management theories, tools and practices
• Familiarity with Pragmatic and/or other product marketing frameworks
• Great with people
• Highly collaborative and open to feedback
• Bias to positive action and getting things done
• Demonstrated skill and comfort in proactively building relationships with a range of stakeholders.
• Able to manage change
• Able to manage complex, multi-stakeholder projects
• Innovative thinker with a track record for translating strategic thinking into action plans and output.
• Influencer who is able to evangelize and move a group that doesn’t report to them directly toward a future state.
• Excellent judgment and creative problem-solving skills, including negotiation and conflict resolution.
• Exceptional written, oral, interpersonal and presentation skills
• Post-secondary degree or diploma

We currently have an exciting opportunity for an EMEA Marketing Manager to join a growing and fast-paced global technology company headquartered in Ottawa, Canada, with offices in Reading and London, UK.

As the EMEA Marketing Manager, you will be key in driving and implementing the EMEA marketing strategy across all online/offline channels. Working closely with their international office and managing local agencies, you will be responsible for overseeing the entire brand image across multiple touchpoints, increasing market position and share, and working closely with the sales team to drive revenue pipeline growth.

This is a fantastic chance to join an energized and motivated workforce at the forefront of manufacturing live production technology. They span multiple industries, working with top-tier broadcasters, sports stadiums, football teams and fortune 500 companies. There is never a dull moment for a marketer at Ross!

• Drive a strategic, data-driven regional marketing strategy across online/offline channels.
• Own and manage the yearly regional budget with the Manager of Regional Marketing.
• Regularly report the progress and the results of the marketing activities to the Manager of Regional Marketing and the EMEA sales team.
• Collaborate with team members to ensure alignment on output, especially working closely with the product and vertical marketing teams to ensure the delivery of integrated campaigns.
• Ensure that all marketing output from both regional and corporate levels is language appropriate and sent at the most opportune time to deliver impact.
• Setting the strategy and objective of regional events and tradeshows in coordination with the sales and events teams.

• A university degree, preferably in Marketing/Comms
• 6+ years of B2B marketing experience, ideally within the technology
• Proven track record delivering multi-channel marketing campaigns at an EMEA level
• First-class organizational and project management skills, able to multi-task and deliver projects on time and within budget
• Fast learner, creative thinker and highly self-motivated
• Outstanding communication and analytical skills

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Working with a team you will fully understand the MES system for routing production, obtaining work instructions and logging defects. Preparing parts and PCBs to be wave soldered or inserted at the electronic insertion machine.

Who you report to: Production Manager

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we have a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Operate electronic insertion machine in a single or dual capacity
• Operate wave solder machine
• Perform Final Inspection involving inspecting all through-hole components for orientation, correct component placement and ensuring that all finishing is completed properly
• Collecting data on defects would be included with inspection
• Operate a press fit, aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jigs, fixtures, or other holding devices and crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits or performs similar operations to join or secure parts in place
• Connect component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connect wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points
• Assemble and attach hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, and switches to assemblies
• You will also assemble cables, heat sinks and power supplies for finishing
• Test assemblies using dedicated test stations
• Keep up to date on Manufacturing technology and new processes
• Adhere to all Ross Video Safety protocols and maintain ESD practices

Who you are:
• A Mechanical aptitude
• Ability to work independently or as part of a team
• Capability of following procedures and working logically
• Detail-oriented mindset, conscientious and willing to ask questions
• An excellent aptitude for learning
• Able to work a rotational shift schedule
Bonus points if you have the following:
• Previous experience within a manufacturing environment and Electronics Assembly

At Ross Video, we are Living Live! We are at the cutting edge of live production, powering much of the world’s most compelling content with our smart production solutions. We are looking for a dynamic, results oriented Regional Sales Manager to join our Oceania sales team.

In this role, you will be responsible for proactively and aggressively growing both existing and new business relationships for Ross Video in both Australia and New Zealand either directly or through one of Ross’ designated Channel Partners.

You would work from a home-based office in the region and be supported by our local team in Sydney, Australia and by our regional sales office in Singapore.

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Represent Ross Video with end users and customers and channel resale partners within the region.
• Negotiate and close sales.
• Meet annual, quarterly, and monthly quota targets.
• Build key, long-term relationships with end users by calling on customer facilities directly to promote Ross products and services.
• Engage the Product Managers in regular presentations to customers.
• Deliver sales presentations to clients and re-sellers in the Territory.
• Develop and implement strategic sales plans to accommodate corporate and individual territorial goals.
• Develop and maintain sales forecasting activities and assists in setting of territory sales goals with integrators and dealers, where applicable.
• Perform market analyses to determine customer needs, price schedules, and discount rates.
• Advise and assist end users concerning sales and purchase of Ross Video Product line.
• Assist in directing product marketing to client base to establish Ross Video products in the region.
• Represent company at trade association meetings to promote product.
• Assist in coordination and liaison between sales department and other sales related units.
• Assist other departments within the organization to prepare marketing plans specific to the territory.
• Prepare periodic sales reports showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion.
• Monitor and evaluates the activities and products of the competition.
• Review articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.
• Ensure the Sales and marketing of Ross products, services and solutions follows the Ross Video code of ethics.
• Assist in resolution of customer issues regarding equipment, supplies, and services.

Who you are:

In the position of Regional Sales Manager, you should have an entrepreneurial spirit. You should have experience and previous success in sales related to live production products, services, and solutions. You will have passionate commitment to customer service and should be prepared to develop business relationships on a face-to-face basis throughout your region. You will have a well-honed ability to communicate compellingly at all levels of an organization both in written and verbal form.

• Experience Selling & Marketing of Live Production Equipment, specifically Production Switchers, Graphic Systems, Robotics, Cameras, Routing Systems, Master Control Systems, Newsroom Systems, Control Systems, and Media Asset Management.
• Familiarity with Key Customers through the territory.
• Strong negotiating skills
• Knowledge of Major Broadcast Transmission Standards
• Solid user of Microsoft Office Products
• Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar Customer Relationship Management tool
• Excellent Communication & Presentation Skills
• Skillful Negotiator
• Lateral Thinker

job_title: Marketing Coordinator, Digital and Community (Job Req #2022-482)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Ross Video has one of the largest and most comprehensive portfolios of solutions in live production and communicate with a diverse range of audiences every day. From broadcast professionals to content creators working in Sports, E-sports, Houses of Worship, Education and Corporate environments, Ross has the experience and expertise to help customers deliver more compelling video content. To support our growth and expansion, we now have a need for a Digital and Communities Coordinator to work within our Corporate Marketing team, helping ensure we engage with our various audiences appropriately and consistently.
With a particular emphasis on digital marketing programs and online communities, this role reports to the Digital Marketing Director and will suit an articulate self-starter who has first-class communication skills and the ability to manage a busy and fluid workload.

Who you report to: Director, Digital Marketing

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Participate in the development of Ross Video digital communities, focused on strategy, development, organization, and moderation.
• Facilitate execution of campaigns utilizing digital outreach channels such as email marketing, SMS, and other methods in coordination with the Digital team and campaign managers.
• Work with outside agencies as necessary in development, budgeting, and execution of marketing programs.
• Cultivate healthy and safe online environments focused on customer support, growth, and loyalty as well as positive non-customer brand awareness and positive brand experience.
• Provide platform support to users as well as internal and external stakeholders within the company.
• Monitor and report on performance of community platforms and digital outreach using tools such as Google Analytics and Hubspot.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education - Marketing, Journalism, Public Relations or equivalent
• Minimum 3 years of related experience
• Organized and very detail orientated.
• Strong interpersonal, observational, and analytical skills.
• Self-starter, quick learner and able to work under minimum supervision.
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Excellent communication skills

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Previous experience working in the hi-tech industry

The Technical Support Specialist is responsible for providing technical support remotely and onsite through remote sessions, ticketing systems, phone support on a as needed basis for Ross Video products, assists customers in resolving issues by providing solutions to technical and service problems and provides the “Superior Customer Experience” through effective handling of customer issues or concerns.

Who you report to: Manager, Technical Support Product Primes

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Assist Customers with technical setup questions, troubleshooting efforts, and product specific solutions.
• Take ownership of customer issues reported and seeing problems through to resolution
• Research, diagnose, troubleshoot, and identify solutions to resolve issues
• Follow standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams
• Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers
• Ensure proper recording and closure of all issues through a tracking system
• Prepare accurate and timely reports, as needed
• Document knowledge in the form of knowledge base technical notes and articles
• Expedite returned material from the field for service reasons
• Provide effective installation and commissioning services, technical product training and on-site support, as required. This may require travel on short notice.

Who you are:
• Technical diploma and knowledge of broadcast systems
• Customer service experience in a technical support environment
• Must be proficient in the English language (read, write, speak)
• Excellent trouble shooting and debugging skills
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
• Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, listening, and questioning skills
• Keen attention to detail with accurate record keeping
• Must be able to work with a team as well as independently
• Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
• Must possess a valid driver’s license and passport
• Network troubleshooting including Putty and Wireshark packet capture and analysis
• Linux knowledge + network troubleshooting to trace dataflow (ngrep / tcpdump etc)
• Determine if network traffic is impacted by firewalls or similar appliances
• Extensive log reading and analysis across multiple control points
• Troubleshooting / debugging device interconnects between multiple different product lines. Robotics, video playout server, video routers, audio mixers, graphics engines, broadcast switchers, etc.
• windows server troubleshooting specifically on the application / network side
• Database knowledge Postgres
• Video broadcast experience an asset

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Additional education and computer courses are strong assets
• Prior knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM systems will be an asset
• Prior knowledge of Zendesk or other ticketing systems will be an asset

As a Manufacturing NPI Coordinator, you will help facilitate the various NPI activities within manufacturing. Collaborating across the various manufacturing teams you will ensure all the tasks associated with transferring a product or product change into manufacturing are performed accurately and within schedule.
The role requires technical knowledge of printed circuit boards, surface mount technology, and mechanical assemblies, but also requires an individual who can manage many simultaneous activities and guide tasks to completion.

Who you report to: Manufacturing NPI Program Manager

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Ensure manufacturing readiness for new products by initiating and monitoring the progress of required NPI activities such as: DFM analysis, SMT readiness, Production Routing, Manufacturing Instructions, Manufacturing Test Readiness, Training, Part Procurement, Planning, and Part Disposition
• Monitor for new ECO’s (engineering change orders) and then coordinate their implementation
• Ensure individuals and teams across departments are properly informed about NPI progress and product related issues, helping to keep NPI activities on schedule
• Drive, direct and track activities related to NPI and Change Management
• Create reports showing the progress, status, and issues with the various ongoing NPI activities
• Create structures such as processes, checklists, and KPI’s to standardize, monitor and then improve the NPI activities
• Work with the Configuration Management team to improve our CM guidelines and ensure all ECO’s are adherent
• Engage the R&D teams to better understand their needs and coordinate the necessary manufacturing activities throughout the product design phase and release
• Organize various readiness reviews and coordinate any necessary meetings to promptly resolve issues
• During prototype and pre-production lifecycle phases monitor for R&D build requests and work with production on prioritizing scheduling

Who you are:
• 5+ years of professional experience in a manufacturing or a high-tech environment
• 2+ years managing simultaneous projects and activities
• Creating detailed status reports and possessing excellent presentation skills
• Experience with MES, PLM, and MRP systems Post-secondary education (degree or diploma), preferably in a technical field
• Knowledge of product lifecycle management
• Knowledge of configuration management systems and best practices
• Solid knowledge of manufacturing processes, procedures, and best practices
• Education or training on project/program management

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Well organized, prepared, persistent, and detail oriented
• Capable of managing numerous competing tasks
• Able to independently problem solve and resolve issues
• Capable of comfortably working with a variety of personalities
• Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills

One (1) Full-Time Permanent Role
The Position

As an Industrial Engineer, you will work to optimize the efficiency of processes across all manufacturing areas in our Iroquois facilities.
Collaborating with Manufacturing management, NPI and production engineering teams you will help develop SOP’s and efficiency measurement standards in a broad range of areas. Utilizing these measurements, you will focus the efforts of the team to achieve meaningful change and improvements in efficiency, quality and safety.

Who you report to:

Director, Manufacturing Process

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• Analyze space and capacity of facilities with current and forecasted workload.
• Assess the techniques, staffing, and equipment utilized to determine production rates and capacities of individual work cells.
• Analyze facility layout and provide recommendations to improve space and production efficiency.
• Recommend changes to work methods, safety measures, and labour strategies to improve efficiency, quality, and work environment.
• Reduce and remove non value added time that is present in the manufacturing process.
• Manage projects of various size related to facility layout and design.
• Build operational reports, manage key KPIs and develop SOP’s and work measurement standards in the manufacturing, warehousing, and shipping departments.
• Maintain site-level performance dashboards to assess the effectiveness of processes and assist management in highlighting opportunities for improvement.
• Manages the overall implementations of capital equipment projects. Evaluates capital equipment investments and prepares cost justifications for projects.
• Ability to interact with multi-functional department related to manufacturing engineering project execution.

Who you are:
• Minimum 3 years Engineering experience in manufacturing environment.
• Minimum 3 years Experience in a high mix, low volume manufacturing environment preferred.
• Minimum 3 years of applied green belt or black belt Six Sigma methodologies.
• Experience with PCB assembly processes is an asset.
• Advanced Excel, AutoCAD and Visio experience.
• Intermediate experience with Power BI or other data investigation tools.
• Green belt or black belt certification in Lean Six Sigma methodologies.
• Software – Hands on Autodesk Inventor and AutoCAD
• Proven ability to create and execute project plans that have achieved the identified targets.
• Excellent planning and organizational skills.
Effective verbal and written communication skills fluent in English language, both written and spoken

Education:
• BEng in Industrial Engineering or related discipline
• BEng with related experience
• Six Sigma Black Belt preferred
Bonus points if you have the following:
• Valid Drivers’ License
• Project / Program Management
• Excellent communication skills
• Able to work in a robust team environment
• Self-starter
Wage: $85000-$115000/annually

Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vison, Generous Paid Time Off, Employee Share Ownership, Fitness/Wellness Allowance, Reading Allowance, FEAP, RRSP Matching

Location of employment :
8 John Street
Iroquois, Ontario
K0E 1X0
