Welcome to the Ross Corporate Marketing team! As the Marketing Automation Specialist, your primary role is to develop operational excellence around our use of our marketing automation platform (currently HubSpot), and its efficient integration with other company platforms like Salesforce CRM, Ross Media website, as well as various analytics and campaign reporting tools.

The primary purpose of this role is to drive customer engagement and retention by building campaign logic, testing and analyzing workflow, generating leads, tracking, and measuring results. This role will also help to build out our digital demand programs with a focus on digital advertising and email marketing. In this position you will act as analyst, adviser, and trainer, enabling your marketing colleagues to implement efficient and effective digital marketing campaigns.

Who you report to: Director, Digital Marketing

What we offer:
 Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
 Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
 Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Development and execution of digital marketing campaigns.
• Manage marketing automation efforts and processes, proactively researching and implementing the latest best practices, strategies, and industry standards.
• Identify list segmentation criteria based on audience behavior, demographic, geographic, psychographic characteristics, etc.
• Maintain Marketing Automation integration with CRM (Salesforce) and assist in the integration of additional platforms into the marketing automation software.
• Manage lead flow as it pertains to user journey, including ensuring accurate tracking and data analytics of users from first touch to conversion.
• Assist with web properties (including Hubspot landing pages, Wordpress pages, and other contact forms) to provide frictionless conversion paths.
• Evaluate campaign metrics and distribute campaign performance to the marketing team.
• Perform A/B testing to define and execute improvements to productivity, conversion rates, and campaign ROI
• Create recommendations to improve campaigns.
• Support marketing operations initiatives in HubSpot and Salesforce, such as managing the lead lifecycle, lead scoring, lead nurturing, segmentation, and data cleansing.
• Working in close cooperation with the Sales Operations team to implement, maintain, and monitor a healthy lead generation workflow
• Ensure compliance while executing email marketing campaigns and data collecting

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education with emphasis on Marketing, Advertising, or a general business program
• 3+ years of experience in a demand generation role, working with multiple projects and the ability to meet specific deadlines
• Strong knowledge of inbound marketing/digital marketing best practices, including SEO, SEM, and PPC ads on Google/Social platforms
• Strong computer and database skills
• Familiarity with the marketing and sales processes
• Strong knowledge of inbound marketing/digital marketing best practices
• Strong knowledge of CRM (Salesforce) and Marketing Automation platforms (HubSpot, Pardot, or Marketo)
• Strong knowledge of digital web platforms including Wordpress and Hubspot landing pages
• A working knowledge of basic web development languages such as HTML and CSS
• A working knowledge of Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel)
• Good communication skills, specifically as it relates to providing internal training, developing and delivering user documentation and presenting projects and project metrics

Ross Video powers video production for billions of global viewers daily with the industry’s widest range of smart production solutions. We are looking for a dynamic, organized self-starter to join our Human Resources team to lead our Equity, Diversity & Inclusion (ED&I) program and initiatives.
The ED&I Program Manager is both a strategic and hands-on role that is responsible for the implementation of Ross Video’s ED&I governance framework and execution of all ED&I related initiatives, in alignment with corporate global strategies.

Who you report to: Vice President, HR Business Partnerships & Programs

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Oversee the formation of the ED&I governance framework and committee; consult with ED&I Executive Sponsors, Committee Members, Regional Implementation Champions, and project teams to ensure appropriate design and roll-out of ED&I initiatives.
• Lead ED&I initiative design, including ensuring ED&I is embedded into HR & corporate programs; integrate an ED&I lens into talent acquisition, performance management, career development, retention and succession strategies.
• Implement the ED&I action plan with measurable goals and key performance indicators (KPIs).
• Analyze key data to provide critical inclusion and diversity measurement and reporting, including representation, for required regulatory reporting.
• Stay up to date on current ED&I practices; scan the external environment for potential ED&I partnerships appropriate for Ross Video.

Who you are:
• University degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or related discipline, and/or equivalent work experience in an HR team.
• Demonstrated experience in implementing ED&I for global companies.
• Experience in change management methodologies; experience with collecting, analyzing, and reporting on quantitative and qualitative data related to ED&I
• Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively collaborate with all levels of the organization, including Senior Management.
• Ability to deal with confidential information with a high degree of diplomacy; ability to build trusted relationships
• Skilled at facilitating respectful discussions about sensitive topics that raise contrary views.
• Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment, both autonomously and as part of a team.
• Strong-working knowledge of MS-Office package and general computer software

Ross Video enjoys a hybrid work environment. This position ideally requires occasional on-site presence in our Ottawa office with working from home possible most of the time. Occasional travel to visit remote client group locations may be required.

You plan and oversee the development of solutions to allow our customers to achieve or exceed their business goals. In this technical role you are responsible and accountable for the implementation and quality of the products under your purview. You craft the architecture and design of your product to meet product goals in alignment with the practices and principals of our Senior Software Architects; you oversee the implementation to ensure architectural and code consistency; you ensure that best practices are being employed, all the while making certain that quality and security are primary considerations.

You coach, mentor, guide, and help nurture the development team (developers and testers) to realize its full potential and adopt our culture of technical excellence and continuous improvement.

Who you report to: Director, Technical Product Management

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

• Own the product development, from understanding the customers’ needs to supporting it in the field, and everything in between.
• Develop the best solutions for your customers.
• Interface with Tech Support to understand and resolve issues found in deployed software instances.
• Define vision and strategy for technical implementation of your products.
• Work with the Product Managers and Product Owners to understand customer requirements and ensure we are delivering the right things.
• Reduce the number of issues found by customers by promoting a preventative vs reactionary approach to development and testing.
• Create a culture of technical excellence within the team.
• Work with other teams to align on strategy, deliver solutions, tools, processes, and reuse where it makes sense.
• Work with the Product Owner to establish predictability in release dates and scope.

• Ensuring product meets corporate security standards.

• Working with architects to ensure cross-product alignment.
• Driving a culture of innovation and capturing Ross Intellectual Property (trade secrets, patents, and copyright) throughout the development cycle.
• Identifying, prioritizing, and planning technical debt reduction.
• Managing the introduction of 3rd party and FOSS software.
• Identifying, documenting, submitting, and defending audits for government R&D tax incentives.
• Mentoring and coaching staff on best practices for achieving clean architecture and clean code.

Who you are:
• You have the ability to design complex, efficient, and high-quality systems under pressure
• You are and effective leader, technical coach, and mentor.
• You are fluent in clean architectural design; are versed in Domain Driven Design concepts; you know and employ the SOLID principles of OO design.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Primestream/Streamline Software developer is a full-time role, reporting to the Software Manager. The successful candidate will help develop new features in leading edge web technologies for our media asset management systems. From graphics to video production, you'll work with the team to develop systems to organize, manage, search and report on media content being used in all aspects of live broadcast.
There’s a lot of content that goes into live broadcast. From the video packages for news stories, to sports team logos, there is a lot for a facility to organize. Unbelievably, in this age of technology, there are still newsrooms trying to manage their content with tapes and disks! Surely there are better ways to work with your media? That’s where Primestream & Streamline comes in!
Primestream & Streamline are Media Asset Management systems that specializes in content delivery for live broadcast. We provide a central and convenient interface for organizing media, editing metadata, previewing assets, searching for content, order management and fulfillment. We also provide automated workflows for moving content for use on air, cleaning old content and generating reports on a wide range of information. That’s what we do today, but we have a lot more work to do. We need you to help us get there.
We are a team who believe in incremental development and strive for continous improvement with our agile workflow. We know we’re not perfect and as we expect to make mistakes, but also to learn from those mistakes and grow as a result to become stronger, faster and better.
We are highly customer focused as customer satisfaction is our highest priority. If that means jumping on a plane and flying half-way around the world to address an issue, then that’s what we’ll do. We go above and beyond for all of our clients – big and small.
We believe in technical excellence and want to create craftspeople as opposed to developers and testers. We think that following best practices, such as TDD, clean code, adhering to SOLID design principles, clean architecture, test automation, and high levels of collaboration among the team produces the most maintainable and extendable applications.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

Who you are:
• You have a post secondary degree in Computer Science, or other relevant Engineering discipline.
• Minimum of 5 years experience full stack software development, full life cycle in an agile environment.
• Knowledge and experience with Java, JavaScript, jQuery, HTML, CSS, Jetty, Ajax, Eclipse, OSGi, Struts, and Hibernate, React, Redux, NPM, Webpack, and Jest.
• Experience with Test Driven Design, Behavior Driven Design, Domain Driven Design, Java Design Patters, and SOLID principals of Object Oriented design and implementation.
• Knowledge and experience with unit testing and test automation.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Experience with one or more of cloud platforms: AWS, Azure, or Google Web Platform.
• Knowledge of professional broadcast equipment in television standards.
• Familiar with Git code revision system.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

At Ross Video, we are Living Live! We are at the cutting edge of live video production, powering much of the world’s most compelling content with our smart production solutions. We are looking for a Senior FPGA Developer to join our dynamic team. Working in a development team, the successful candidate will get the opportunity to help shape the future of the video broadcast industry.
Who you report to: Technical Product Manager, LED

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Work within an interdisciplinary team to develop high-level design requirements, product system architecture, device selection and project schedules.
• Design, develop, simulate and test FPGA designs as per product specifications or product line guidelines.
• Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of the FPGA.
• Generate interface documentation to other hardware and software team members.
• Review schematics and design documents as required, pertaining to the FPGA interface and functionality, and peer review the work of colleagues.
• Troubleshoot, debug and fix FPGA issues and related problems as required.
• Assist in training other staff members; mentor more junior staff.
• Report project and task status as required.
• Perform other related duties as required
Who you are:
• You are an expert in RTL design for complex IP targeting large Xilinx or Altera FPGA SOC.
• Recent experience with Xilinx (preferred) or Altera design software including synthesis, SOC design tools and timing closure.
• Verilog/System, Verilog, and/or VHDL RTL experience.
• Experience working with scripted tool flow (tcl, perl, sh, Python), source control.
• Experience working with lab equipment to debug complex designs that could involve multiple people.
• Familiar with video broadcast standards such as SDI, AES, Timecode, Madi, Tri-level syncs.
• Familiar with high-speed serial interfaces such as SDI, 10/40 GigE, Ethernet, PCIe
• Experience designing video processing algorithms such as filters. video codecs (H264, H265, MPEG2), color space conversion, scaling, etc.
• Work experience with constrained random verification methodology such as VMM or UVM.
• Experience working with high-speed memory interface such as DDR3/4.
• Experience with the creation of code generation tool and workflow automation.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

Who you report to: Director of Product Operations

Maximizing the value of our products, resulting from the work of the scrum team. The Product Owner will be the main point of contact for the product team and will provide the product line monthly report in R&D sync meetings.
You’ll be managing the product backlog for a specific release, creating and reviewing product backlog items and working day-to-day with the scrum team. You will collaborate with product management on the best way to achieve the product vision and goals. You’ll work with target customers to validate your ideas and create excellent solutions that will change the way productions are made.

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Collaboration
• Work with Product Management to ensure a deep understanding of the release goals/themes and product vision. Work together to define and monitor KPIs that indicate how the product investment is delivering value.
• Work day-to-day with the scrum team to support the delivery of the product. Responsibilities include: managing the product backlog, creating and reviewing user stories and acceptance criteria with the team, creating epics and story maps, defining sprint goals, capturing feature requests and enhancements
• Work with customers and end users to fully understand the problem space and revise existing features to better align with their needs
• Provide feedback and suggestions to the Product Manager on their product roadmap, future release plans and product direction
• Participate in all scrum activities as a including: leading backlog refinement, participating in retrospectives and planning, daily stand-ups, defining definition of done
• Participate in cross-team planning activities and track cross-team dependencies/commitments
• Work with subject matter experts to ensure a quality product, including: Architects, Quality Assurance Experts, Test Automation Experts
• Innovation, Design and Specification
• Develop and prototype innovative approaches to solving existing and emerging problems. Perform user acceptance testing as needed.
• Create product specification documentation to support the development team in delivering products that address customer needs and achieve the product vision, including: mockups, interaction designs, information architecture and data models
• Continuously participate in customer feedback sessions and research, both before and after feature implementation
• Create user experience artifacts to aid the scrum team in keeping the user top of mind: scenarios, user stories, personas, use cases etc.
• Work closely with User Experience Design team to create mockups and interaction designs for new features that are inline with Ross standards
• Decision Making
• Maintains the priority of the items in the release backlog, including user stories, bugs, tech support escalations to maximize the value of the product, while staying aligned with the vision and strategy
• Makes day-to-day business vs technical trade-off decisions in tandem with the Technical Product Lead.
• Stakeholder Management and Communication
• Regularly reporting on progress towards sprint and release goals to product management, dependent R&D teams, R&D and executives
• Explain and regularly communicate the rationale behind the priority of items in the product backlog to all release stakeholders
• Ensure customer stakeholders, both internal and external, are informed when priorities change or risks emerge
• Facilitate bi-weekly sprint reviews, collect and solicit feedback and capture changes in product backlog

Who you are:
• Post-secondary degree or trade school diploma
• Understanding of Agile principles, practices and ceremonies
• Solid understanding of the role and value of a product owner
• Experience with backlog prioritization, user story development
• Excellent communication skills, written and verbal
• Ability to work well with remote team members
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Proficient in Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Visio
• Proficient with Jira
• Experience working as a product owner in a technology company delivering solutions to the technology market
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
• Able to work co-operatively with and across all company departments
• High Tolerance of Ambiguity

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Ability to work with asset management systems is a plus
• Software development experience is an asset
• Broadcast production experience is desired
• Experience with 5+ product releases as product owner or 10+ product releases working as an Agile delivery team member is preferred
• Passionate about Ross Video & our products

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! Working with the Marketing Product Manager and the Technical Product Manager, the POM helps manage and drive each project from concept through to a successful release to manufacturing and product launch to market.
The POM is responsible for managing project timeline and agreed feature set. She or he will liaise with Manufacturing, Manufacturing Test Engineering, and Tech Support to enable smooth product sales & order process, build of required hardware/software products, and own product lifecycle support.

Be part of the multi-disciplinary team that develops cutting edge LED solutions for indoor, outdoor, broadcast, and performance setting. The Ross LED development team develops sophisticated hardware and software solutions from the ground up to enable immersive large scale video and audio experiences controlled by market-leading software user interfaces. We bring video surfaces to life! Learn more at: https://d3led.com/

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

What the job is all about:
• Responsible and accountable for management of direct reports.
• Accountable to the TPM to provide the staffing resources to execute on the agreed project deliverables and an agreed schedule.
• Responsible for reporting on status of projects that are part of a government grant or other funding programs.
Project Planning:
• Follows, advocates, and helps implement the corporate NPI process.
• Assists in identifying the resource and material costs/requirements for projects.
• Works with the development team to identify and mitigate risks - developing and documenting a risk mitigation plan.
• Assists the TPM in developing the project schedules (identifies critical paths). Ownership of project schedules; both creation and maintenance.
• Responsible for entry and maintenance of all product information and data in SalesForce, Agile/Jobscope, and Max.
Project Execution:
• Maintains and tracks the project schedules.
• Assists the TPM, where required, in the coordination of project team development activities and for the effective follow-up - facilitating communication between individuals and teams.
• Generates project meeting minutes (including action item identification, assignment and follow-up) as per the requests of the TPM.
• Tracks all development, product verification, engineering services and manufacturing activities and identifies any potential project issues and challenges, including resource exposures or conflicts.
• Ensures that project status reports are generated on time as required.
• Works with the TPM, MPM, Manufacturing (including Scheduling, Test, and Procurement) in developing product BOMs for each level of all new products.
• Responsible for ensuring the timely delivery of required input to the Technical Documentation team.
• Responsible for providing communication on project status throughout the organization.
• Ensures that project status reports are generated on time as required.
Release:
• Works with the TPM and MPM to define a product deployment plan.
• Works with the TPM and MPM to coordinate and ensure training is provided for Technical Support, Commissioning, Sales Engineer, and Training team.
• Owns and manages the Product release checklist and is responsible for ensuring that all disciplines (manufacturing, Marketing, Developments, etc) follow through with and complete tasks required for a successful release.
Product Lifecycle Management:
• Works with the Technical Support and Development teams, via an escalation process, to ensure customer satisfaction by managing and tracking any product deployment issues - providing prompt and appropriate customer communications.
• Tracks all field service issues and report on them internally as well as any required customer communications.
• Where necessary, consults with the Field Service Team, TPM and MPM’s to determine any necessary actions required to resolve customer issues and/or dissatisfactions.
• Responsible for maintenance (ECO, MCO, EOL, etc) of all manufacturing data for all released products.
• Responsible for monitoring and maintaining manufactured product costing and reporting any appreciable changes to TPM and MPM.
• Responsible for communication throughout the organization for all product updates and new code releases.
Operation:
• Works with the MPM and TPM to help develop and record the Strategic Product Line Roadmap.
• Provides support to entire product team on required purchases of materials, test equipment, and facility requirements.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education, engineering degree is a strong asset.
• Familiarity with the product development process and the associated requirements of manufacturing.
• Strong logistics and planning background.
• Management experience working with remote development teams is an asset.
• Familiarity with software planning and development.
• Strong knowledge of PM tools.
• Experience working with vendors, subcontractors, and 3rd party manufacturers is an asset.
• PMI Certification is an asset.

At Ross Video, we are at the cutting edge of live video production, powering much of the world’s most compelling content with our smart production solutions. We are looking for a dynamic, organized individual to join us in the role of Sales Operations Specialist.
The Sales Operations Specialist is a partner in a collection of sales territories, which you will come to know well. You will help drive the business in the region by offloading back-office tasks from Regional Sales Managers, such as creating and maintaining account and contact information in our
customer relationship management system. You will also help to manage sales activity by assisting with opportunity management, tracking activities related to annual territory plans and by performing data analysis and producing reports. In this key role, you will optimize the effectiveness of our Regional Sales Managers and Inside Sales Specialists.
 Sales Operations Specialists exude integrity, drive and passion while demonstrating a high level of attention to detail, superior organization & communications skills.
This position is based in Ross Video’s Ottawa office, with occasional travel to sales events and industry conferences.

This position is a maternity leave replacement and is a one-year contract.

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Work collaboratively with Regional Sales Managers (RSM) and Inside Sales Specialists (ISS) to help drive regionally specific sales activity.
• Executing Sales related Administrative Activities
• Organizing and executing approved equipment loans
• Ensuring activities related to approved territory plans are executed effectively and on time
• Coordinating requests and approvals for product demonstrations and regional tradeshow activities
• Preparing and distributing quotes for warranty and software maintenance program renewals
• Proactively identifying and solving order issues prior to receiving a customer purchase
• Performing Data Management & Analysis
• Adding new clients and prospects to our customer database
• Updating and maintaining existing customer data including corporate, financial and other related account details; contact information, accurate categorization,
• Updating opportunity status
• Preparing reports and analysis
• Offering regular insights to RSM and ISS that will assist in driving sales results
• Creating tasks and reminders for RSMs and the extended Ross Sales Team
• Assisting in the completion of Sales related forms like DIW.
• Helping RSMs clear roadblocks, both external and internal
• Assisting in coordination and liaison with other departments

Who you are:
• University degree in Business Administration, or related discipline and/or equivalent work experience
• Minimum 2 years of work experience in a sales support or customer service role
• Experience with customer relationship management software (Salesforce.com preferred)
• Experience with MS-Office package and general computer software
• Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills.
• Demonstrated ability to multi-task effectively
• Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment
• High energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm
• Superb attention to detail

Evaluate customer requirements to design custom user interfaces and data parsing solutions for use in broadcast or sport venue environments, in particular, real-time graphics applications. (XML, HTML, XSLT, JSON, Database, HTTP)
Develop tight control of the XPression real-time graphics system via the XPression COM API and or via external TCP/IP protocol.

Working in the corporate Information Technology team located in Ottawa, the IT Help Desk Technician will have worldwide responsibilities to support every area of our rapidly growing employee base with key focus on supporting and deploying Windows, Linux and macOS desktops and laptops. You will maintain and contribute to the software compliance and physical asset control. You will be part of a core team that directly contributes to Ross Video’s success.

What the job is all about:
• Front line support for 1200+ users in an international multi-site mixed-OS network environment
• Responsible for providing optimal incident response times and escalations
• Ensures software compliance initiatives are maintained and followed
• Optimizes desktop and laptop build process to reduce manual intervention and streamline processes
• Troubleshoot endpoint, or system failures
• Liaise with external providers where appropriate
• Participate in an on-call rotation to support company operations after core business hours.
• Perform other related duties as required

Who you are:
• Background in Computer Science, Information Technology or relevant experience.
• Ability to adapt and accelerate in a fast-paced environment
• Approachable with excellent communication skills
• Team player but able to work independently
• Organized, thorough, and very detail orientated
• High initiative and well-developed analytical skills
• Technical, mechanical, hands-on person
• 2-5yrs hands on experience in a fast-paced Help Desk environment
• Strong knowledge of Windows, macOS and Linux Operating Systems with a PC and hardware background
• Valid driver’s license and clean driving record, a reliable vehicle is a must
• Travel between Ottawa and Iroquois when required
• Able to work with equipment, which may involve climbing ladder to run cable, lifting computers, crouching to assemble equipment, etc.
• Lift up to 50 lbs.

• Experience in a research and development environment is an asset

All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. The Inside Sales Representative is a hands-on role that plays an active part in helping develop Ross Video’s pipeline for revenue generation through the creation of sales leads, initiation of prospect calls, and establishment of ongoing rapport with existing and potential customers. The successful candidate will be a direct extension of our front-line group of regionally based Sales Managers, helping to work opportunities with both end users and via our authorized business partner network. You must bring integrity, drive, passion, and superb communications skills.
This position is based in Ross Video’s Ottawa office, with occasional travel to sales events and industry conferences.

Who you report to: Inside Sales Manager, North America

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Work collaboratively with regionally based Sales Managers to determine and implement opportunity specific sales approaches guided by the Ross Way To Sell.
• Manage the day to day activities to support the sales efforts within several identified sales territories, including preparing quotes and providing guidance to re-sellers, system integrators and clients to facilitate the purchase of Ross solutions
• Manage monthly pipeline review activities to ensure accurate Territory forecasting
• Ensure customer order flow by following the clean order criteria
• Maintain accurate customer data within the corporate CRM solution
• Assist in resolution of customer issues regarding equipment, supplies, and services.
• Proactively manage key sales campaigns identified in the annual territory plan
• Assisting in coordination and liaison with other departments

Who you are:
• University degree in Business Administration, or related discipline and/or equivalent work experience
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in a complex sales environment
• Demonstrated experience in opportunity qualification, pre-call planning, call control, account development, and time management.
• Demonstrated ability to build and maintain lasting relationships with customers and partners.
• Exceptional communication and presentation skills.
• Experience with customer relationship management (CRM) software such as Salesforce.com
• Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills.
• Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment
• Self-motivated, with high energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm.
• Desire to constructively contribute to a team environment

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Experience Selling Broadcast Equipment
• Bilingual in French and English

The Client Delivery Specialist is a key member of the Client Services organization. The Client Delivery Specialist oversees and assists in the planning, delivery, and implementation of Ross Video’s client projects, which have a beginning and specified deliverables. The Client Delivery Specialist is also responsible for ensuring Ross Video’s Superior Customer Experience. The position works in close collaboration with clients, system integrators, Ross Video’s scheduling department, Commissioning & Training Teams, and Global Technical Support to ensure efficient project planning. Further, the position works collaboratively with Inside Sales, Regional Sales Managers, and Solutions Architects throughout all service activities in realizing the very best customer experience.

This role can be done virtually from anywhere in Australia.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Ensure appropriate levels of services and duration, commissioning and training, are sold for client engagements
• Determine what resource type (i.e. Ross Video staff, Ross partner, freelancer) should be assigned to a client engagement
• Maintain project records in relevant ERP, professional services automation, and CRM systems
• Collaborate with Ross Sales Team and client in completing Project Discovery Checklist
• Develop a detailed work plan and baseline schedule for the project
• Work with Ross Scheduling Department in determining required Ross resources
• Ensure customer readiness for service deployment
• Conduct an email introduction as part of project kick-off with Ross stakeholders and client
• Monitor the progress of the project and adjust as necessary to ensure the successful completion of the project
• Review the quality of the work completed with the project team on a regular basis to ensure that it meets the project standards
• Review daily and/or weekly status update emails from each of the on-site project resources and make the necessary interventions
• Monitor time reported against time allocated for each deliverable and ensures the project stays within budget
• Close out the project with formal customer acceptance of the deliverables and customer final sign-off
• Provide guidance on and manage the transition from project implementation to Global Technical Support
• Organize post-mortem on any project that fails to meet defined quality and/or financial metrics and provide recommendations and project feedback to affected stakeholder groups
• Perform other duties as required

• Superior customer skills, including excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
• Ability to manage multiple assignments, set priorities and ability to adapt to changing conditions
• Strong crisis management skills
• Strong knowledge of Microsoft, Excel, PowerPoint, and exceptional presentation skills
• Travel required up to 25%
• Familiar with Ross Video products and solutions, both operationally & technically
• Strong Broadcast industry experience
• Previous experience with managing projects
• Strong organizational and project coordination/management skills
• Analytical problem solver with attention to detail

• Preferred language spoken and written include English and Mandarin

The SMT Touchup Repair Assembler is responsible for the touchup of SMT and thru-hole components on circuit boards while adhering to IPC standards for hand soldering and repair.

Who you report to: PCBA Manager

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Preparing parts and PCBs to be wave soldered
• Operate wave solder machine (may or may not apply)
• Assembly inspection (may or may not apply) which involves inspecting all through-hole components for orientation, correct component placement and ensuring that all finishing is completed properly, with data collection pf defects
• Press fit, aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jigs, fixtures, or other holding devices
• Crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits or performs similar operations to join or secure parts in place
• Connects component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points
• Assembles and attaches hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, and switches to assemblies
• Assembles cables, heat sinks and power supplies for finishing
• Routing assemblies through MAX system either manually or electronically
• Maintaining ESD practices

Who you are:
• Minimum 2 years of experience working in Electronic Manufacturing, specifically with SMT and thru-hole components
• Proficient in hand soldering
• Proficient in reworking circuit components on de-soldering and hot air stations
• Ability to read and interpret schematics, and associated drawings
• Knowledge of working with microscope
• Able to work with other production team members especially with QC department to resolve quality issues
• Fully understand the MES system for routing production, obtaining work instructions and logging defects
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Detail oriented
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• Strong aptitude for learning

What the job is all about:
• Inspection of electronic cards, sub-assemblies, and systems or units to ensure that all product meets the established specifications for reliability and workmanship as per IPC standards
• Develop a working knowledge of the work processes in Receiving, Inspection, Stockroom, and Shipping
• Develop Warehouse quality audit schedule, perform internal quality audits, and participate in external quality audits to ensure compliance

• Identify corrective and preventative actions to eliminate quality related defects in the current work processes
• Coach Warehouse personnel on quality procedures, standards, and audits

• Participate in Open Box Reviews of new Ross products

• Work with Incoming Inspection, Purchasing, Production and Engineering personnel to establish appropriate inspection criteria

• Well organized, detail oriented and able to work on multiple priorities
• Approachable and possess excellent communication skills
• Understanding of inspection techniques
• Able to read and comprehend moderately complex instructions and effectively present
• information in one-on-one and small group situations
• Ability to perform these operations using weight measurement and distance
• Min. 5yrs experience in a manufacturing environment with MRP/ERP/WMS systems

• Energy, enthusiasm, and a can-do attitude.

What the job is all about:
• Evaluate customer requirements to design custom user interfaces and data parsing solutions for use in broadcast or sport venue environments, in particular, real-time graphics applications. (XML, HTML, XSLT, JSON, Database, HTTP)

• Responsible for implementation and integration of graphics packages at customer's sites, as required.
• Attends meetings and conference calls as required to scope, complete, or otherwise facilitate successful completion of assigned projects as they relate to the job.

This role is responsible for supporting customers through a variety of technical support roles. This includes troubleshooting problems at the module level and system level. This includes serving as an individual contributor and also providing advanced backup support to other technicians on the LED team including LED staff and subcontractors. The work will include investigation and analysis of problems, devising plans to correct those problems, implementing the plans, testing the solutions, and documenting the results. The work will also include supporting updates and upgrades as needed.
The technology involved will include computer hardware, video processing systems, communication systems, and display systems. Software technology will include Windows based and Linux based operating systems, control software, and embedded firmware. An intermediate to advanced proficiency in these technologies will be required for this job.
Critical skills include failure analysis of hardware and software, including troubleshooting at the system level, module level, and circuit level, as well as strong documentation and communication abilities. This role will work as a mentor and resource for other technicians and in general for other field resources.

Who you report to: Director, Services

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Ownership and accountability for solving Support related technical problems in the field
• Actively support the in house Technician team by helping to solve problems in the repair process and on the tech support team
• Collaborate and work closely with the Production team as needed, especially to support and enable the production of support related repairs and replacements.
• Help to create and manage a CRM database of customer specific information including equipment configurations and history
• Support the Supply Chain team by helping to identify compatible parts and assemblies, especially when a customer needs a replacement part that is obsolete or discontinued.
• Support an ongoing continuous improvement process by identifying areas for improvement and participating in implementing process improvements
• Function as part of team dedicated to making customers happy by providing high quality products and services.
• Serve as the voice of the customer as part of the New Product Introduction process, providing feedback to the Product Design teams on design for support and testability

Who you are:
• Intermediate to advanced knowledge of computer software applications in a Windows system (Linux system knowledge is a plus)
• Intermediate to advanced troubleshooting skills
• Knowledge and experience in video subsystems, video displays, and video signal distribution
• Knowledge and experience in broadcast systems is a plus
• Working knowledge of electronic components and pcb assembly
• Working knowledge of engineering documentation
• Basic understanding of electronic and electro-mechanical manufacturing processes
• Strong communication and customer service skills
• Ability to set priorities, work independently, and proceed with minimal supervision
• Ability to manage multiple tasks and be productive
• Able to lift and carry packages and parts weighing up to 50 pounds
5 years of more of technical experience in a manufacturing or R and D lab environment
• Demonstrated troubleshooting skills in computer systems and video display systems
• 2-year degree in Electronics or Computer Science
• Education in identifying electro-mechanical and mechanical components, or equivalent knowledge gained from experience
• Experience working with computer-based CAD or documentation or ERP systems

• Progress towards a BS degree in engineering or computer science is a plus

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Materials & Inventory Specialist ensures that material handling processes are followed, the inventory needs of the operations are met and inventory records are accurate. This includes activities such as monitoring cycle count reports, performing audits and tracking quality metrics, as well as researching inventory discrepancies and driving continual improvements. The successful candidate will work closely with the Materials, Supply Chain, and Manufacturing Support Teams.

Who you report to: Director, Warehousing

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Contribute to the development and documentation of new and existing manufacturing processes related to the handling of materials (SOP’s, KPI's, work instructions, training materials, etc.)
• Work with multiple departments to optimize the movement of materials throughout the storage and production areas
• Maintain accurate inventory records and visibility by ensuring SOPs are executed in all areas
• Investigate inventory discrepancies, conduct root cause analysis, and provide explanations and corrective actions to inventory variances
• Monitor & analyze cycle count parameters to prioritize counts, improve efficiencies and accuracy
• Actively participate in quality management and time studies for various material handling elements in the manufacturing processes
• Participate in establishing inspection criteria and parameters to measure quality of incoming goods
• Work with supply chain team and suppliers to achieve improved quality of incoming goods
• Proactively work to prevent unnecessary aging of materials
• Support warehouse projects, floor layout changes and system implementations
• Maintain ESD practices and all other safety practices
• Perform other related duties as required

Who you are:
• Experience in an electronics manufacturing environment with specific exposure to purchasing, planning, inventory control and cycle counting
• A technical background is a solid asset

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Energy, enthusiasm, and a can-do attitude
• Used to working in a high pressure, fast paced, and constantly changing environment
• Ability to handle multiple projects and prioritize tasks to achieve objectives
• An effective collaborator, who empowers and enables others to share ideas, raises awareness, gets buy-in, and delivers fast and well-rounded solutions to complex problems

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

The SMT Line Operator is responsible for utilizing setup documents to pick, setup parts on feeders, load on feeder carts and perform changeover for the SMT lines. Working closely with Pick and Place Operator/Technician’s to ensure efficiencies within the pick and place set-ups, as well as defect issues at the AOI and reflow. Fully understanding the operation of the Manufacturing Execution System (MES), with respect to on-line documentation, WIP tracking and defect management.

Who you report to: Production Manager

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• AOI machine operation, including adhering to the First off Procedure to ensure assembly quality throughout the run
• Board labelling
• Work the manual paste dispense station
• Maintaining ESD practices
• Adhering to MSDS procedures
• Keeping up to date on Manufacturing technology and new processes
• Other duties as assigned

Who you are:
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Capable of following procedures and work logically
• Detail oriented
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• Exceptional aptitude for learning

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Manufacturing experience in a PCBA SMT environment

The Marketing Event Specialist is responsible for the planning, coordination, logistics and execution of Ross Video tradeshows and events globally. Ross attends over 100 such events a year, ranging from regional pop-up booths of 100sqft to major marquee shows up to 10,000sqft.

Working hand-in-hand with multiple teams in Ross, the role supports brand consistency, drives lead capture and led nurture, facilitates networking and customer/partner training (demonstrations, seminars, visuals, and speaking opportunities).

Who you report to: Event Marketing Manager

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

Under the supervision of the Event Marketing Manager, the Marketing Event Specialist will be responsible for:
• Coordination of all functions and aspects of an Event from space acquisition and selection to onsite execution
• Coordination and contract negotiation of all onsite services, while giving due consideration to facility constraints/rules and unions.
• Maintaining and distributing a display inventory for Regional Events.
• Maintaining Event Calendar
• Coordinating Event requirements using the Ross Request Process.
• Provide marketing support for before, during and after events as required using directories
• Coordinating, order, inventory management of staff clothing and promotional materials.
• Coordinating show rider insurance
• Event logistics including physically packing shipments, coordination of shipment, and creation of customs documentation
• Internal communication of pre-show Event details.
• Coordination of staff lists, flights and hotel room bookings for major Events.
• Staff the booth for the two major corporate tradeshows; IBC in September and NAB in April of each year
• Post Event tracking and follow up (costs, leads, improvements).
• Assisting other members of the Marketing team, as requested, in event promotion and social media
• Travel required for 15% of the role. Two major tradeshows annually each requiring travel for 2 consecutive weeks
• Requirement to set-up equipment and displays - involves lifting up to 50 lbs, reaching, bending, stooping, etc.
• Perform other related duties as required

Who you are:
• Event Coordination (CMP, CSEP, or CMM) or Marketing certification at a College level
• Demonstrated experience with Microsoft Office and Adobe Acrobat
• Graphic Design an asset
• Social media skills an asset
• 2-3 years of experience in an Event Coordination role, working with multiple projects and the ability to meet specific deadlines
• Organized with a strong attention to detail
• Enthusiastic and able to work independently or as part of a team
• Ability to multi-task and take ownership
• Excellent time management skills
• Strong aptitude for learning
• Valid Driver’s License and access to a vehicle for travel between
Ottawa locations and/or Iroquois location
• Valid Passport

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! As a key contributor to Ross Video’s Service Delivery Operations team, the Project Manager will be the primary driver in implementing system updates and delivering on internal operational and technical projects for the Service Delivery Department. The incumbent will coordinate the completion of the elements of assigned projects on time, within budget and within scope, working with stakeholders and system resources from a quality, scheduling, and project execution perspective. They will manage change as well as setting and managing deadlines, assign responsibilities as required and monitor and summarize progress of projects for visibility with management. Throughout this, they will ensure that stakeholders are engaged and informed, and all aspects of the projects meet the requirements of the department and the needs of the organization.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Managing one or more complex or high impact departmental projects affecting multiple teams.
• Developing and maintaining detailed project plans, monitoring, and tracking progress to share with Management and stakeholders
• Ensuring that the project is delivered on-time, within scope, and within budget
• Coordinating and driving project activities to deliver required functionality on schedule
• Closely monitoring project resources, tasks, risks, and milestones. Making course corrections
• Documenting and managing changes to the project scope and project schedule using appropriate verification techniques
• Creating and maintaining comprehensive project documentation
• Working in a team environment to complete project tasks through coordination of internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects
• Responsible for managing all day-to-day project activities for individual contributors, potentially spanning departments. Directing activities, assigning responsibilities, setting expectations, and motivating team members toward achieving objectives
• Tracking and reporting on project performance, analyzing the successful completion of short and long-term goals and escalating issues to management as needed
• Partnering with Service Delivery management to ensure projects are prioritized based on the requirements of the organization, with the recommended technology solution and the estimated effort and resources required to satisfy requirements.
• Managing effective relationships with management, all stakeholders, and third party/vendors as needed.
Who you are:
• Post-Secondary Education in related field or equivalent experience.
• 5+ years of demonstrated professional experience as a Project Manager.
• Extensive demonstrated experience managing projects of low to high complexity and risk (remotely/across multiple locations) in a corporate setting
• Demonstrated experience leading technical implementations, systems development projects and process redesign efforts
• Strong Knowledge of Project Management tools and practices
• Demonstrated experience gathering business, functional, and/or technical requirements considered an asset
• Ability to handle multiple concurrent demands while maintaining a professional attitude.
• Excellent communication skills and the ability to effectively collaborate with all levels of the organization, including senior management
• Ability to respond quickly and accurately to all client requests
• Excellent trouble-shooting skills
• Attentive to detail and accuracy
• Working knowledge of Project Management software, MS-Office package and general computer software
Bonus points if you have the following:
• PMI and/or Agile SCRUM certifications
• Knowledge of Ross Video products and/or broadcast/television production

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. The Information Systems team is responsible for the corporate applications that make this possible – including Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Customer Relationship Management (CRM), and Product Data Management (PDM) systems. We are about to embark on a major initiative to implement the Infor LN cloud-based ERP in order to support Ross Video’s continued growth, and we are looking for an MIS Analyst to join the team. Sound like you? Read on!

Who you report to: Director, Information Systems

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Be a key member of the ERP implementation team
• Provide long-term support of corporate applications
• Use technical and business know-how to streamline and optimize business processes

Who you are:
• Minimum of three years of experience with ERP systems – BaaN/LN or GP an advantage
• Experience with Expense Management applications an advantage
• Experience with end-to-end system implementations (process design, configuration, data migration, user training)
• Knowledge of one or more of the following functional areas: Finance, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Engineering
• Comfortable designing and building workflows, reports, integrations and automation tools
• Proficient in SQL Server administration and SQL scripting
• Experience with IT Service Management processes and procedures and Software Development Life Cycle
• Degree or Diploma in Business, Engineering or Science is preferred but relevant work experience may be considered

The Ross Web Platform (RWP) is a full stack web application framework and is the foundation of several Ross Video products with more adoption planned. The RWP team takes pride in providing high quality and innovative solutions to our product teams and internal stakeholders. While we have individual specialties, we are all full stack developers. The languages and technologies we work with includes but is not limited to Java, JavaScript, Eclipse/OSGi, Jetty, Struts, Hibernate, AWS, JSP, and React. We are focused on our users’ needs, committed to technical excellence, practice mob programming and strive for continuous improvement.

Who you report to: Principal Technical Lead, Software Manager, RWP

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

Who you are:
• A full stack or back end web developer proficient in some of our languages (Java primarily) and technologies and willing to learn the others.
• Like working with other people in a whole team environment, not just programming by yourself.
• Bonus if you’re into any of these: BDD, DDD, TDD, XP, SOLID, clean code and architecture.

As the Principal Technical Lead, you are the technical leader for your product or products. You plan and oversee the development of solutions to allow our customers to achieve or exceed their business goals. In this technical role you are responsible and accountable for the implementation and quality of the products under your purview. You craft the architecture and design of your product to meet product goals in alignment with the practices and principals of our Senior Software Architects; you oversee the implementation to ensure architectural and code consistency; you ensure that best practices are being employed, all the while making certain that quality and security are primary considerations.
You coach, mentor, guide, and help nurture the development team (developers and testers) to realize its full potential and adopt our culture of technical excellence and continuous improvement.

Who you report to: Director, Technical Product Management

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Own the product development, from understanding the customers’ needs to supporting it in the field, and everything in between.
• Develop the best solutions for your customers.

• Mentoring and coaching staff on best practices for achieving clean architecture and clean code.

• Strong knowledge of modern web front-end design
• Extensive experience with React and JavaScript
• Experience developing mobile applications
• Ability to design complex, efficient, and high-quality systems under pressure

• Fluent in clean architectural design; are versed in Domain Driven Design concepts

The CPQ Systems Administrator provides support to the Sales and Product Management Teams with CRM (Salesforce.com), CPQ (Apttus/Conga CPQ) and other commercial systems with an end goal of enabling Ross’ go-to-market strategies.
The CPQ Systems Administrator will provide day to day support to the Product teams on various system and product setup tasks such as creating and configuring products (standalone, bundles, etc.), diagnosing quoting/ordering issues and providing pricing assistance. The CPQ Systems Administrator will take a proactive approach on recommending new processes or functionality with both CRM and CPQ systems which will enhance the Product Team’s abilities to market their products and provide the right tools to our Sales team.
On the Sales side, the CPQ Administrator will help resolve technical issues related to quoting, pricing and ordering, as well as enhancing client-facing proposal templates, among other duties. The CPQ System Administrator will also be very process-driven, creating and improving upon existing processes and process documentation.
The CPQ Administrator may also be asked to lead specific projects related to Salesforce.com or the CPQ tool.

Who you report to: Manager, Commercial Operations

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Support to Sales and Product Management on commercial systems (Apttus/ CPQ, SFDC, Etc.)
• Answer questions and provide super user assistance to product marketing and sales users.

• Research and implement new commercial systems functionally as required (for example guided selling, machine learning, etc.)

• Intermediate Knowledge & Proficiency (minimum 3 years’ experience) with Salesforce.com administration or development (Salesforce certification is a plus)

• Basic Knowledge & Proficiency with standard office tools such as MS Word, PowerPoint, and Visio
• Intermediate Knowledge & Proficiency (minimum 3-years’ experience) with SteelBrick/Salesforce CPQ and/or Apttus/Conga CPQ (certification is a plus)
• Knowledge of sales processes and/or experience in sales Knowledge of product management process and/or experience in product management/marketing
• Extremely detail oriented – passionate about accuracy
• Organized – able to juggle the demands of multiple projects
• Excellent planning and scheduling skills
• Proactive and action oriented
• Strong interpersonal skills - an ability to collaborate effectively within a team environment

• Basic understanding of SOQL is an asset

Ross Video is a rapidly expanding broadcast industry solutions provider. The Director of Sales for APAC is a key member of the Global Sales leadership team and is directly responsible for driving sales throughout their regions.

In this role, you are responsible for achieving quarterly/annual sales goals, building strategic business relationships, and implementing all sales strategy for their region. This position works closely with the Senior Vice President of Global Sales and is part of the front-line group that works hand in hand with Ross customers and business partners.

Who you report to: Senior Vice President of Global Sales

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• Serve as a key member of the sales leadership team that drives the region’s strategic sales growth.
• Devise and deploy sales goals, strategies and objectives focusing on existing and new business and channel partnerships within their region and contribute to the preparation of sales quotas and budgets.
• Responsible for the overall hiring, motivation, and management of the direct reports in the region. Working with the Senior Vice President of Global Sales, this includes recruitment, mentoring, coaching, and evaluating team members while driving a culture of performance.
• Lead their team to consistently achieve quarterly and annual sales targets by managing a stratified client pipeline to ensure key prospects are identified, prioritized, and pursued to meet financial goals
• Attend trade shows and industry conferences to increase sales through improved levels of product knowledge and further develop industry contacts via networking.
• Participates and contributes to sales opportunities driven by the sales team, including face to face customer meetings and relationship development.
• Report and share information with the Senior Vice President of Global Sales, to ensure they are kept up to date on past, current, and predicted sales performance and customer relations.
• Collaborate with the North America Sales leadership team to develop short- and long-term strategic plans, including the preparation of annual business plans.
• Create training and development plans for direct reports, including contributing to the evolution of the Ross Way To Sell (RWTS), and ensuring the sales team is following RWTS practices.
• Coach Sales Professionals on developing Win Plans. Periodically review Win Plans and aid with closing deals.
• Prepare and deliver high level presentations to television networks, business partners, and industry associations.
• Develop and maintain sales forecasting activities and assist in setting of territory sales goals with integrators and dealers, where applicable.
• Monitors and evaluates the activities and products of the competition by reviewing articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.

Who you are:

• Bachelor’s degree in technology, business administration, marketing, sales, or a related field preferred
• 3+ years of management experience in a sales leadership role
• Strong experience in all aspects of sales, including growth strategies, distribution channel management, account development, and business planning
• Outstanding consultative selling abilities and excellent interpersonal skills at the executive level
• Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills
• Success closing large, complex sales in terms of dollar value and using multiple channels.
• Demonstrated knowledge of accounting and financial practices
• Budgeting and forecasting skills
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Strong business acumen
• High level of proficiency with the Microsoft Office productivity suite
• Understanding of the Broadcast / Media Technology Market (Live Production experience an asset)
• Existing knowledge and use of Ross Video products, or experience selling hardware and software-based technology
• Extensive experience working with CRM’s such as Salesforce.
