At Ross Video, we are at the cutting edge of live video production, powering much of the world’s most compelling content with our smart production solutions. We are looking for a dynamic, organized individual to join us in the role of Sales Operations Specialist.
The Sales Operations Specialist is a partner in a collection of sales territories, which you will come to know well. You will help drive the business in the region by offloading back-office tasks from Regional Sales Managers, such as creating and maintaining account and contact information in our
customer relationship management system. You will also help to manage sales activity by assisting with opportunity management, tracking activities related to annual territory plans and by performing data analysis and producing reports. In this key role, you will optimize the effectiveness of our Regional Sales Managers and Inside Sales Specialists.
 Sales Operations Specialists exude integrity, drive and passion while demonstrating a high level of attention to detail, superior organization & communications skills.
This position is based in Ross Video’s Ottawa office, with occasional travel to sales events and industry conferences.

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

• Organizing and executing approved equipment loans
• Ensuring activities related to approved territory plans are executed effectively and on time

• Preparing and distributing quotes for warranty and software maintenance program renewals

• Adding new clients and prospects to our customer database

• Updating opportunity status
• Preparing reports and analysis

• Creating tasks and reminders for RSMs and the extended Ross Sales Team
• Assisting in the completion of Sales related forms like DIW.
• Helping RSMs clear roadblocks, both external and internal
• Assisting in coordination and liaison with other departments

• Experience with customer relationship management software (Salesforce.com preferred)

The Facilities Team is responsible for designing and maintaining the leased global facilities, as well as providing facilities services to all Ottawa staff. We are a customer service team with Ross Video staff being our primary customers and are looking for a dynamic, customer focused self-starter to join our Facilities team as Facilities Manager US.

Working with the corporate Facilities team located in Ottawa, the Facilities Manager – US will be located in Rancho Cordova and will report to and work closely with the Manager, Global Facilities to support all facilities activities in US sites. The Facilities Manager - US is responsible for implementation of facility management operations, preventative maintenance, project management and fit up work and code compliant maintenance program in a multi-state territory and planning and coordinating all contracted service providers in the US portfolio. This role will be the first point of contact for internal and external customers seeking support and information on the US facilities, as well as be key to ensuring all stakeholders are engaged, informed and all activities related to the physical well-being of leased buildings in the US are coordinated through Facilities Management in advance, or in the case of emergencies, brought to the FM’s attention as soon as possible. The incumbent will be responsible for initiating and managing service provider contracts, budgets, procurement, vendor performance reviews, other facility management contracts and responsible for ensuring that all activities are undertaken in accordance with Ross Policies and Procedures.

Who you report to: Manager, Global Facilities

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

What the job is all about:
• Manage facility management, operations, maintenance, and project management program for leased facilities in the US with prime support to Rancho Cordova site
• Responsible for planning and coordinating all contracted services engaged in managing and maintaining the US leased sites. Authorize, verify, and approve work conducted by service providers and contractors. Conduct comprehensive on-site facilities review and evaluation to ensure facilities meet operational, maintenance, and asset preservation goals
• Work closely and collaboratively to coordinate with service providers and landlords for leased facilities to ensure that demand and preventive maintenance is conducted in a timely manner to meet contract and industry quality standards and prolong life of equipment and assets.
• Conduct on-site facilities review and evaluation and anticipate facilities operations, maintenance, and asset preservation needs. Recommend operational and equipment efficiencies to optimize energy use and reduce cost
• Establish and maintain positive high-level relationships with the client, all stakeholders, and third party/vendors
• Collaborate with stake holders to plan, control, and determine necessary project work to preserve, maintain, and improve facilities
• Verify work of service providers and contractors to meet established requirements and provide feedback for validation of work or improvement as necessary
• Working closely and collaboratively with the stake holders, coordinate the architecture design process for facility alterations to ensure the functional requirements are met, including mechanical, electrical, structural, plumbing, energy, and compliance with the American Disabilities Act (ADA) requirements
• Assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility
• Track project performance, specifically to analyze the successful completion of short and long-term goals
• Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget
• Perform risk management to minimize project risks
• Report weekly on financial matrix as well as other key performance indicators
• escalate all issues to management as needed
• Meet budgetary objectives and adjust project constraints based on financial analysis
• Use and continually develop leadership skills
• Provide recommendations and participating in the development of new policies and procedures to ensure continuous improvement in the smooth, professional operation of facilities.
• Perform other related duties as required
• Requires travel to US leased locations
• Able to lift 25 lbs

• Facilities Management Certificate and a minimum of 4 years experience OR a college / university degree and a minimum of 6 years facilities management experience
• Experience in building structure/systems management, facilities maintenance, project management, and budgeting/cost analysis experience, which includes one (1) year of supervisory experience
• Min 5 years Project Management experience in construction/facilities fit up projects
• Ability to handle multiple concurrent demands while maintaining a professional attitude
• Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively collaborate with all levels of the organization, including Senior Management
• Ability to respond quickly and accurately to all client requests; strong trouble-shooting skills
• Attentive to detail and accuracy
• Strong-working knowledge of MS-Office package and general computer software
• Knowledge of Ross Video products and/or broadcast/television production an asset

You show passion and commitment to customer service, and you are prepared to develop business relationships on a face to face basis throughout the UK and Ireland. • Responsible for establishing productive working relationships with Ross Video's Channel Partners within the region
• Prepare and conduct technical presentations and demonstrations at customer visits as well as conferences and tradeshows as required.

• Negotiates and closes sales
• Builds and nurtures relationships with end users
• Delivers sales presentations to clients and business partners in the territory
• Develops and implements strategic sales plans to accommodate corporate and individual territorial goals
• Adheres to and follows the Ross Video code of ethics

You play an active part in helping develop Ross Video’s pipeline for revenue generation through the support to the Regional Sales Managers in the field, creation of sales leads, initiation of prospect calls, and establishment of ongoing rapport with existing customers.

You will be assisting the EMEA Sales Team and are a direct extension of our front-line group of regionally based Sales Professionals, helping to work opportunities with both end users and via our authorized business partner network.

Inside Sales Specialists exude integrity, drive and passion and exceed business targets through excellent telephone sales and superb communications skills.

Who you report to: Inside Sales Manager - EMEA

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Provide overall support to assigned Regional Sales Managers.
• Handle inbound, unsolicited prospect calls and convert them into sales.
• Make outbound follow-up contact with existing customers via telephone and e-mail to determine customer satisfaction, cross-sell and up-sell opportunities.
• Advise and assist business partners, system integrators and clients concerning sales and purchase of Ross Video product line.
• Emphasize product/service features and benefits, prepare quotes, and discuss terms.
• Identify decision makers within targeted leads to begin sales process.
• Overcome objections of prospective customers.
• Work collaboratively with regionally based Sales Managers to determine and implement opportunity specific sales approaches.

• Ensure follow-through of opportunities by completing requests, documenting activity within Salesforce.com and setting reminders for next steps.
• Forecast sales activities and prepare periodic sales report showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion.
• Maintain and expand the company’s database of prospects by entering new customer data and updating changes to existing accounts in the corporate CRM.
• Assist in creating RFP responses.
• Set up and deliver sales presentations, product/service demonstrations, and other sales activities.
• Assist in coordination and liaison between sales department and other sales related units.
• Assist in resolution of customer complaints regarding equipment, supplies, and services.
• Monitors and evaluates the activities and products of the competition including reviewing articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments.
• Where necessary, support efforts at trade shows, exhibits, and other events.
• When necessary, travel to sync up with respective Regional Sales Manager or other members of the Sales Team

• Demonstrated ability to convert prospects and close deals to exceed sales targets
• Solid experience in opportunity qualification, pre-call planning, call control, account development, and time management
• Experience with customer relationship management (CRM) software such as Salesforce.com is an added advantage
• Experience in sales forecasting & pipeline management
• Demonstrated ability to build and maintain lasting relationships with customers
• Practical knowledge of inside sales principles, methods, practices, and techniques
• Experience/knowledge of the broadcast industry advantageous
• Familiarity with the key components used in broadcast electronics applications is an advantage
• Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills
• Exceptional verbal communication and presentation skills
• Strong written communication skills
• Fluent English, French, Spanish or German an advantage

• Print bar codes, labels & manuals specific to a work order
• Transfer components to proper containers (moisture sensitive open and resealed).

• Maintain Dry Pak cabinets and Canban carts in Manufacturing

The successful candidate will be a direct extension of our front-line group of regionally based Sales Managers, helping to work opportunities with both end users and via our authorized business partner network. You must bring integrity, drive, passion, and superb communications skills.
This position is based in Ross Video’s Ottawa office, with occasional travel to sales events and industry conferences.

Who you report to: Inside Sales Manager, North America

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Work collaboratively with regionally based Sales Managers to determine and implement opportunity specific sales approaches guided by the Ross Way To Sell.
• Manage the day to day activities to support the sales efforts within several identified sales territories, including preparing quotes and providing guidance to re-sellers, system integrators and clients to facilitate the purchase of Ross solutions
• Manage monthly pipeline review activities to ensure accurate Territory forecasting
• Ensure customer order flow by following the clean order criteria
• Maintain accurate customer data within the corporate CRM solution
• Assist in resolution of customer issues regarding equipment, supplies, and services.
• Proactively manage key sales campaigns identified in the annual territory plan
• Assisting in coordination and liaison with other departments

Who you are:
• University degree in Business Administration, or related discipline and/or equivalent work experience
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in a complex sales environment
• Demonstrated experience in opportunity qualification, pre-call planning, call control, account development, and time management.
• Demonstrated ability to build and maintain lasting relationships with customers and partners.
• Exceptional communication and presentation skills.
• Experience with customer relationship management (CRM) software such as Salesforce.com
• Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills.
• Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment
• Self-motivated, with high energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm.
• Desire to constructively contribute to a team environment

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Experience Selling Broadcast Equipment
• Bilingual in French and English

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. job_title: Sales Order and Configuration Administrator (Job Req #2022-396)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

As a Sales Order and Configuration Administrator you will work closely department Specialist, Order Entry, Planning and Shipping to fulfill daily orders. Decipher and fulfill customer configuration requirements by aligning the sales order line items to the configuration documentation. Pick assemblies from finished goods to fulfill sales order line item requirements and ensuring any testing and configuration is performed on these items when necessary.

Who you report to: Production Director

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Perform basic hardware set-up, component insertion, software installation and testing on systems as per sales order requirements
• Identify products failing test procedure/configuration specifications
• Have a solid understanding of MAX for product structures and scanning product bar codes into the sales order module for shipping traceability
• Have a solid understanding of MES in following instructions and routing through the PACK process point to receive product into stock
• Maintains a FIFO inventory system within the finished goods inventory which includes accurately receiving and picking stock
Who you are:
• Mechanical aptitude
• Able to work independently or as part of a team
• Well-organized, very detail oriented, and able to work on multiple projects
• Conscientious and willing to ask questions
• High School Diploma
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in manufacturing environment
• Working knowledge of computers and software programs such as MS Word/Excel/Outlook

• College diploma and/or additional education and computer courses

Be part of a cross-functional team that is designing, developing and testing distributed, scalable and highly available applications, tools and services that tie together live video production technology across multiple locations. We are building software that will revolutionize the industry by leveraging a move to distributed architecture and cloud-based infrastructure. As part of this, we are seeking a Product Verification Specialist to drive product quality and ensure all software components provide a reliable, user-friendly and performant experience for our customers. The successful candidate will be obsessed with quality improvement and automated tests for regression and new features.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Develop a comprehensive test plan and test cases based on new product features, customer requirements or identified problems
• Identify test scenarios that are critical and repetitive and automate them
• Report bugs with quality descriptions and work closely with the development team to see through and verify fixes
• Develop integration tests in collaboration with other product teams to ensure interoperability and a smooth end-to-end workflow for end-users
• Support ongoing software development efforts which means participating in Agile based SDLC – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, documentation, testing and maintenance

Who you are:
• Good understanding of testing at scale, performance and software reliability
• Knowledge of one or more scripting languages such as Python and JavaScript\
• Knowledge of one or more test automation tools such as Selenium, JUnit, Robot Framework, JMeter and Cucumber
• Desire and ability to reach out to other teams, visit customers and learn how software is used in a live video production environment
• Ability to work and collaborate in a team setting with an open, collaborative communication style
• Ability to function in both Windows, Linux and MacOS environment

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Experience with live video production technology – if you have directed a live event, worked with a production switcher, operated a television camera or been in broadcast
• Experience automating test cases (API level testing and user-level automation)
• Experience developing automated tests in a distributed environment
• Experience in functional testing
• Experience utilizing tools and scripts to test and optimize performance
• Experience with Docker and VMWare
• Intermediate Experience in Linux is an asset
• Experience with Git is an asset
• Ability and desire to travel – not a requirement for this role but the opportunity may present itself if you enjoy interacting with and learning from your end-users as a product expert

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Renewal & Subscription Sales Specialist (RSS) position is a blending of service & sales motions. The RSS team will be focused on achieving their individual team quota as well as working in partnership with our Regional Sales Managers and Inside Sales team members, to help achieve annual team sales targets. Each RSS member must possess a hybrid skill set. Extremely strong attention to detail to build renewals, search asset lists and prepare lengthy proposals as well as the confidence and professionalism to be customer facing and selling Ross renewals and subscription-based products.
Adhering to the principals of the 'Ross Way to Sell', the RSS team, will contribute and drive RossCare+ renewal sales as well as subscription, SAAS and cloud product sales, to ensure long-term customer success with all our product offerings. Amplifying focus on customer loyalty as a high importance, to ensure long term customer success rates.
This position is home-based with occasional travel to sales events and industry trade shows

Who you report to: Manager, Renewals & Subscription Sales

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Managing the different components of subscription product sales and support renewals
• Preparing the renewal proposals, and notifications as required
• Contacting end users/Business Partners directly to discuss renewal and/or subscription contracts
• Partnering with team members, both on the Renewal & Subscription Sales team as well as Regional Sales Managers, Inside Sales and Sales Operations to ensure effective communication both internally and externally to drive sales of our RossCare+ program and subscription products
• Escalating customer pain points to Tech Support team and ensure customers are supported during times of dissatisfaction
• Forecasting trends and suggestions on how those trends can enhance retention rates on our subscription-based products
• Bridging the gap between Sales, and Service/Customer Success.
• Refining renewal strategies that proactively engage a client to renew YoY
Who you are:
• University degree in Communications, Business Administration, or related discipline, and/or equivalent work experience
• 5+ years of experience in the fields of sales, customer success, or renewal sales – or in the B2B SaaS industry is a huge advantage
• Highly focused; able to consistently achieve sales objectives through effective account management and commitment to customer satisfaction
• Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment
• Strong communication skills
• Extremely detail orientated
• Build lasting business relationships through performance and credibility. Develop positive rapport with people at all levels of responsibility
• Strong-working knowledge Salesforce.com, MS-Office package and general computer software
• Experience with the 'Ross Way to Sell' an asset

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Automated Production Control (APC) is now commonplace in the Broadcast industry, delivering operational efficiencies, while taking complexity out of the production process. OverDrive is Ross Video’s World leading APC solution, and with new customers and new features to develop, we’re looking to add to the team.

We are looking for a professional Embedded Software Developer to execute on the complete software development lifecycle for Caprica, which is the Device Control Engine within OverDrive.

We are a team currently transitioning into an agile workflow and believe in incremental development and continual improvement. We know we’re not perfect and as we embark on this journey, we expect to make mistakes, but also to learn from those mistakes and grow as a result to become stronger, faster, better.
Customer satisfaction is our highest priority, so we are highly customer focused. If that means jumping on a plane and flying half-way around the world to address an issue, then that’s what we’ll do. We go above and beyond for all of our clients – big and small.

We believe in technical excellence and want to create craftspeople as opposed to developers and testers. We think that following best practices, such as TDD, clean code, adhering to SOLID design principles, clean architecture, test automation, and high levels of collaboration among the team produces the most maintainable and extendable applications.

What the job is all about:
• Architect solutions to satisfy project requirements
• Code new features and peer review other designer’s software changes
• You’ll work with management to break down designs into tasks, making effort estimates, and will also work with product management to understand the customer’s requirements
• Work with product verification specialist once software is coded to debug failing test cases and with hardware designers to understand how new features are implemented
• Work with Technical Support & Fields services to help resolve customer issues once the product is in the field

Who you are:
• Proven working experience in software development
• Strong C coding skills
• A Post-secondary degree in Engineering or Computer Science or in a related area with appropriate experience
• Knowledge of GNU Make systems
• Knowledge of Linux Open Source development tools
• Above average Linux computer skills
• Knowledge of low level and/or real time programming
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills
• The ability to work independently and as part of a team
• Experience in hands-on development and troubleshooting multithreaded applications
• Experience in hands-on development and troubleshooting on embedded targets
• Experience in Agile software development is an asset
• Knowledge of Linux scripting is an asset

We are always looking for better ways to adapt our work environment and processes to meet the high demands of our customers. Our roles morph, we volunteer for extra tasks, we all care a lot about helping to make good things happen. If you don't like change, you’re in the wrong place, but if you do, then you can be part of an incredible journey.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Work with the Product Manager and Product Owner to understand customer requirements and ensure we are delivering the right things
• Reduce the number of issues found by customers by promoting a preventative vs reactionary approach to development and testing
• Help ensuring product meets corporate security standards
• Active participation in technical debt reduction
• Participation in software development full lifecycle
• In collaboration with technical product lead, develop products with clean architectural design, and employ the SOLID principles of OO design and implementation
• Help drive the unit testing toward full code coverage
Who you are:
• You have a post secondary degree in Computer Science, or other relevant Engineering discipline with minimum of 7 years of software development experience.
• You have a strong knowledge of, and experience with web front-end technologies like JavaScript, TypeScript, React,
• You have some experience with SQL, Struts, Hibernate, SSL Authentication, Restful API, LDAP, OSGi, GitLab, Jenkins, Unit testing, Mockito, Ant, Maven, Unix, Eclipse.
• You have some experience in C/C++.
• You have the ability to design complex, efficient, and high-quality systems under pressure.
• Experience with full stack software development, full life cycle in an agile environment.
• You have knowledge, and better, experience with Test Driven Design, Behavior Driven Design, Domain Driven Design, Java Design Patters, and SOLID principals of Object Oriented design and implementation.
• You have knowledge and experience with unit testing and test automation.
• You know the value of team work, coaching and mentoring more junior team members to learn and contribute to a scalable and secure product.
• Having experience with one or more of cloud platforms: AWS, Azure, or Google Web Platform, is a strong asset.
• Having experience with either Cucumber or Selenium is a plus.
• Having knowledge of professional broadcast equipment in television standards is a plus.
• You have good interpersonal and communication skills.
• You demonstrate strong observational and problem solving skills.
• You are organized and detail orientated.
• You are self-starter, quick learner and can work with minimum supervision.

Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Welcome to a very different kind of job posting. Why? Because social media should be fun and creative. So, we’ve decided that this posting should match the role.

As the Social Media Specialist at Ross Video, you will be responsible for creating compelling digital content across all social channels through an inclusive lens.

What does this mean? It’s corporate speak for, “Create awesome, fun, professional, and socially conscious content for the Ross Video social media channels that’s accessible and uses inclusive language”.

It means that we’re looking for that special someone who understands how social networks work, how to create compelling content for the audience, and takes the initiative to implement action through a socially conscious lens.

This role is based in Ottawa, Canada but open to North America and offers remote and flexible opportunity (after all, it’s a digital world now).

Who you report to: Director of Communications

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Be an online storytelling anchor for the Ross brand, ensuring our social content has a purpose and quality that people want to engage with and share (ie. Don’t just jump into a scheduling tool and throw a few, “because I have to” tweets out there. Have fun with it. Tell a story. Jump on different trends and try something creative.)
• The meat and potatoes: Create written, visual, and video content designed for news feeds and social-first audiences that’s inclusive and accessible. And have fun with it.
• Drive a strategic, data-driven social strategy across platforms (Is Marketing fun? Heck yes! And even though it’s fun, there should be a strategy and purpose to drive the platforms.)
• Integrate the social strategy into the marketing content calendar (And bonus, you get to collaborate with some great people ie. the ones writing this right now. Neat, eh?)
• Incorporate learnings from analytics into the development of content (I feel like this is the elementary school equivalent of saying, “Show your work”, or maybe we should say, “Use data to drive your work”)
• Collaborate with team members to ensure alignment on output. It’s important to work in a team with different viewpoints and backgrounds, this is what makes for great teams! You’ll play a key role in establishing what the unified output looks like to the world. (“With great power, comes with great responsibility #SpiderMan)

Who you are:
• Strong understanding of global politics, social issues, anti-racism, trans, and LGBTQ+ rights
• Uses and understands inclusive language
• Understands and can implement inclusive and accessible communication strategies. In marketing we often talk about our “target audience”, but it’s more than that. It’s about understanding that everybody communicates differently, receives information in different methods, and have different requirements to be able to consume information. Understanding this is an important part of the role
• Range (but not a requirement) of 3-5 years’ experience with:
• Writing and creative output
• Editing and creating content that is highly technical but still compelling
• Able to work with senior executives, engineers, product teams, marketing and business units, locally and internationally
• Comfortable using a content management system and scheduling tools
• Basic photo and video editing skills
• Understanding of different social trends and social media networks

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

The successful candidate will be an energetic and clear communicator who has deep experience in program and project management. Collaborating across all Ross product teams as well as global sales directors and principal solution architects, the candidate will manage and monitor large and complex, highly technical projects that span multiple functions, product lines, and business units. The candidate will report directly to the Vice President – Product Development. This position works with teams located around the globe and may be located at any Ross Video office, or remotely, however some travel is expected if located outside of Ottawa, Canada. 
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. 
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! 
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here. 
What the job is all about:
Negotiate shared objectives and roadmap priorities with cross functional team members
Lead and oversee large, global, cross functional, complex, and technically challenging programs
Define, measure, and report program and individual project success criteria and objectives
Lead New Program Introductions (NPI) and other business critical and/or revenue generating efforts from charter through to commercialization into the marketplace
Utilize appropriate processes to execute the programs, flexible and innovative
Define and document program management practices, as appropriate
Identify and actively manage risks with contingency plans and mitigating activities
Effectively engage program participants, impacted teams, stakeholders, and executives
Mentor project managers and project coordinators in the R&D Operations team
Perform other related duties as required
Who you are:
Experience in product management, system architecture, or solution architecture required
BS Degree in Science, Engineering, or BA in Marketing, Business preferred
MS, MBA, or equivalent preferred
PMP Certification preferred
Knowledge of cloud, data center, and specialized hardware is highly beneficial
Knowledge of broadcast and television production would be considered an asset
Amazing communicator at the executive, project, and technical level
Passionate about what technology can achieve
Prefer action to actions
Comfortable working through influence and negotiation
Prefer working with others to find unexpected solutions
Excited about project scheduling and reporting tools
Beneficial to have experience in leading acquisition integration teams
Equity, Diversity & Inclusion 
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. • Amazing communicator at the executive, project, and technical level
• Passionate about what technology can achieve
• Prefer action to actions
• Comfortable working through influence and negotiation
• Prefer working with others to find unexpected solutions
• Excited about project scheduling and reporting tools
• Beneficial to have experience in leading acquisition integration teams

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you. 
Ross Video is looking for an intermediate to senior level Manufacturing Test Developer that will help manufacturing build, test, then deliver high performing equipment used in the broadcast industry. You will collaborate on the development of a scalable manufacturing test and data system, that performs thorough PCBA investigation, functional product testing, data collection, and report generation. The system supports dozens of product categories and needs to ensure every product shipped exceeds the users’ expectations. You will work alongside experts in test development, hardware, and software design, in our manufacturing facility is in Iroquois, Ontario. Which is approximately a 30-minute drive from Kemptville, Cornwall and Brockville, or a 45-minute drive from southern Ottawa. 
Who you report to:
 Manager, Test Development 
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. 
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! 
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here. 
What the job is all about:
Design, develop and implement automated and semi-automated test solutions for the various electronic products and sub-assemblies
Support our quality initiatives by leveraging your ability to understand the designs of technical products and your knowledge of testing best practices
Collaborate with various departments, including R&D and production, to assure quality products are delivered to market
Find and advise on improvements within test coverage, test times, product support, test system scalability, and quality efficiencies
Who you are:
Possess an undergraduate degree in electrical or computer engineering and have professional experience (preferred +3 years) with electronic hardware
Having a solid understanding of electronic theory, explicitly digital components such as CPU’s, FPGA, flash
Ability to comprehend electrical schematics and PCBA design files
Knowledge and/or ability to learn scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, Python, etc.
Understanding of data acquisition concepts such as TCP/IP, RS232, USB, and CAN
Resilient problem solver that is not afraid to take on new challenges and initiate improvements
Bonus points if you have the following:
You either have or are willing and able to learn an object-oriented language and basic database interfacing
Experience with JTAG and Boundary Scan development
Equity, Diversity & Inclusion 
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you. 
In this role you will be responsible for SMT component replacement including micro-components, BGA’s, connectors both SMT and SMT/Thru hole combinations, perform lifted/damaged pad repairs and track cuts and working on Thru-hole component removal and insertion. Working with technical staff to receive and interpret direction and responsible for prioritizing daily work by production needs, RMA’s and Return to Customer defects. On occasion working with engineers to perform modifications to PCBA. 
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. 
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! 
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here. 
What the job is all about:
Prepping boards for repair include:
Applying heat resistant materials to parts on the board for protection which include Kapton tape, heat blankets, pink shield
Dismantling fully/partially assembled boards
Baking boards, and logging times, in preparation for rework
Ability to make choices, based on board damage or difficulty of task, on whether or not a defect is repairable or scrap
Multi-tasking is always necessary as specialists commonly require small jobs done in order to do their daily tasks
Creativity is necessary when working with densely populated boards to get components on and off
Accurately interprets and enters defect information within MES.
Works closely with SMT and Mechanical Support staff
Maintaining ESD practices.
Who you are:
An understanding of the X-Ray machine in order to deduce whether or not the solder quality adheres to IPC Standards
An Excellent understanding of IPC-610 quality standards
Knowledge of various tools – hot air guns, pre-heaters and traditional soldering/de-soldering tools and tips
Air Vac is used for removing and replacing micro-components, BGA’s, Flip Chips and connectors. The necessary knowledge for running this equipment include:
Stencil and paste process
Creating profiles using solder sample boards and thermo couples
Reballing BGA’s
Bonus points if you have the following:
An Excellent understanding of IPC-610 quality standards
MES system

The Technical Support Specialist is responsible for providing technical support remotely and onsite through remote sessions, ticketing systems, phone support on an “as needed” basis for Ross Video products. We assist customers in resolving issues by providing solutions to technical and service problems and provides the “Superior Customer Experience” through effective handling of customer issues or concerns. We work with some amazing customers, and you will get to be a part of helping them make an impact on their audiences. Please take a look at some of our Success Stories! 
https://www.rossvideo.com/company/customers/ 
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. 
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, RRSP matching, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! 
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here. 
What the job is all about:
Assist customers with technical setup questions, troubleshooting efforts, and product specific solutions including production switchers, graphics, routers and connectivity, camera motion systems and production workflow
Take ownership of customer issues reported and seeing problems through to resolution
Research, diagnose, troubleshoot, and identify solutions to resolve issues
Follow standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams
Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers
Empowering our customers to get the most from their Ross products and solutions
Ensure proper record keeping and closure of all issues through a tracking system
Prepare accurate and timely reports, as needed
Document knowledge in the form of knowledge-based technical notes and articles
Expedite returned material from the field for service reasons
Provide effective installation and commissioning services, technical product training and on-site support, as required, which may require travel on short notice
Who you are:
Technical diploma in fields such as Broadcasting, Electronics, Robotics, Electrical Engineering, or similar
2+ years relevant work experience in Broadcast and Audio-Visual installation, with ideal work experience as any of the following: Broadcast Technologist, Electronics Technologist, Robotics Technologist, Electrical Technologist, or similar
Knowledge of broadcast systems and knowledge of Ross products
Customer service experience in a technical support environment an asset
Must be proficient in the English language (read, write, speak), bilingual (French) an asset
Excellent troubleshooting and debugging skills
Well-organized, very detail and accuracy oriented, and able to work on multiple projects simultaneously
Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, active listening, and questioning skills
Must be able to work both with a team and independently
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
Must possess a valid driver’s license and passport
Bonus points if you have the following:
Additional education and computer courses are strong assets i.e. Cisco, Cloud and SAS
Prior knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM systems is an asset
Prior knowledge of Zendesk or other ticketing systems is an asset
Multilingual

What the job is all about:

• Developing and maintaining System Assembly manufacturing processes, with an ability to project manage process implementation projects, including the review and the acquisition of capital assets
• Knowledge of Manufacturing Execution System (MES) with an understanding of auditing on BOM’s, operational sequences and work instruction for completeness
• Estimate manufacturing cost to determine time standards.
• Have 3D CAD experience to design, fabricate and implement any fixturing to optimize process/test workflows.
• Collaboration with all types of stakeholders, from functional areas as well as different levels of management are key factors in your role.
• An understanding of the latest manufacturing techniques to implement continuous improvement and strive for excellence with the use of tools such as Kaizen, PFMEAs, SPC and DOE.
• This role requires collaboration and continuous engagement with our R&D and NPI teams to ensure System Assembly processes are developed for future production needs.
• If you are a self-starter, motivated and passionate about electronics this may be a fit for you.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education in mechatronics or mechanical or industrial processing or has electronics enclosure manufacturing experience and some background in quality and understands the corrective action process
• Background in electronics and enclosure manufacturing with 5 years preferred experience
• Ability to work independently or can be part of a team
• Collaborating with technical and non-technical staff in an organized way
• A work ethic that presents persistently with excellent attention to detail and accuracy
• Solid communication skills in English, both written and verbal
• Confident in making decisions based on the Company’s best interest are essential elements in this role
• An advanced level of knowledge with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook) CAD related software and Microsoft Project is preferred

Bonus points if you have the following:
• A technical background is a solid asset
• Prior experience in Printed Circuit Board Assembly, Six Sigma methodologies, 3D CAD software, MES, and other related software

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
The successful candidate will work closely with product development to design, write, edit, and proofread manuals, quick start guides, and other product documentation.
You will be part of the multi-disciplinary team that develops cutting edge LED solutions for indoor, outdoor, broadcast, and performance setting. The Ross LED development team develops sophisticated hardware and software solutions from the ground up to enable immersive large-scale video and audio experiences controlled by market-leading software user interfaces. We bring video surfaces to life!
Be part of the multi-disciplinary team that develops cutting edge LED solutions for indoor, outdoor, broadcast, and performance setting. The Ross LED development team develops sophisticated hardware and software solutions from the ground up to enable immersive large scale video and audio experiences controlled by market-leading software user interfaces. We bring video surfaces to life! Learn more at: https://d3led.com/
Who you report to:
 Technical Product Manager, LED
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
What the job is all about:
Work with R&D developers, product testers, and other Ross Video staff as required to design, write, edit, and proofread product documentation. Documentation includes technical manuals, user manuals, setup guides, upgrade guides, release notes, online Help systems, and miscellaneous other documents. Subject matter includes descriptive and procedural information about hardware and software components.
Become an expert in Ross Video products. This expertise will be gained through participation in Ross training programs, review of the current documentation, direct contact with the product itself, and working with technical personnel.
Advise and make recommendations to management on matters relating to quality assurance, in order to provide them with an improved basis for decision making and planning.
In-depth understanding and accurate execution of the Ross Way to Develop, Ross Technical Writing Workflow, and Style Guide.
Provide regular status report updates to the team.
Participate in post-mortem reviews: what worked, what did not, what we can do better
Who you are:
You have a post-secondary degree in English, Journalism, Computer Software Engineering, or related areas
5+ Years of technical writing experience
Working knowledge of word processing, graphics, and desktop publishing programs is required
A strong attention for detail and a critical mindset
Strong interpersonal skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Self-starter, quick learner, and able to work with minimum supervision
Passionate about learning new technologies
Able to work independently or as part of a team
Bonus points if you have the following:
A diploma in a technical field
Knowledge of television production
Knowledge of product development lifecycle(s)
Experience with collaborative and or iterative development model(s)

You help design, develop, and maintain products or solutions to allow our customers to achieve or exceed their business goals. In this technical role you participate in all of Software Product Lifecycle stages and aspects. You are equally able to maintain/enhance existing products as well as building new products from ground up in collaboration with the Product Manager, Product Owner, Technical Product Lead, and the development team. You are a team player who coaches, mentors and guides more junior team members.

 DashBoard Software Manager
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. What the job is all about:
Work with the Product Manager and Product Owner to understand customer requirements and ensure we are delivering the right things
Reduce the number of issues found by customers by promoting a preventative vs reactionary approach to development and testing
Help ensuring product meets corporate security standards
Active participation in technical debt reduction
Participation in software development full lifecycle
In collaboration with technical product lead, develop products with clean architectural design, and employ the SOLID principles of OO design and implementation
Help drive the unit testing toward full code coverage
Who you are:
You have a post secondary degree in Computer Science, or other relevant Engineering discipline with minimum of 7 years of software development experience.
You have extensive experience in Java.
You have knowledge of, and experience with JavaScript, React, XML, JSON, SQL, Struts, Hibernate, SSL Authentication, Restful API, LDAP, OSGi, GitLab, Jenkins, Unit testing, Mockito, Ant, Maven, Unix, Eclipse.
You have the ability to design complex, efficient, and high-quality systems under pressure.
Experience with full stack software development, full life cycle in an agile environment.
You have knowledge, and better, experience with Test Driven Design, Behavior Driven Design, Domain Driven Design, Java Design Patters, and SOLID principals of Object Oriented design and implementation.
You have knowledge and experience with unit testing and test automation.
You know the value of team work, coaching and mentoring more junior team members to learn and contribute to a scalable and secure product.
Having experience with one or more of cloud platforms: AWS, Azure, or Google Web Platform, is a strong asset.
Having experience with either Cucumber or Selenium is a plus.
Having knowledge of professional broadcast equipment in television standards is a plus.
You have good interpersonal and communication skills.
You demonstrate strong observational and problem solving skills.
You are organized and detail orientated.
You are self-starter, quick learner and can work with minimum supervision.

As the International Logistics Analyst, you are responsible for cost reporting and research, auditing logistics, supplier metrics, and providing KPI reports for stakeholders. The candidate must have the ability to problem-solve, work independently both remotely and in office, as well as cross-functionally. Motivated and be driven to improve processes by developing key metrics in logistics. You will conduct ongoing review of the transportation network to identify opportunities to increase efficiency and decrease supply chain costs. 
Who you report to:
 Manager - Order Operations, Global Logistics, and Trade Compliance 
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best. 
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events! 
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here. 
What the job is all about:
Responsible for Free Trade Agreements maintenance and compliance reporting duties as well as maintenance of broker database
Audits, CERS, freight billing, approval of freight billing and entries in Paramount
Collaboration with internal stake holders with respects to advising on weight break optimization (overpack or loose), and carrier account optimization for unusual scenarios
Manage communications with brokers and carriers, negotiate freight rates with carriers and sets-up new freight accounts
Escalate lost, damaged, or delayed shipments with carriers and initiate the claims processes
Demonstrated experience with reading Bills of Materials (BOM) for rules of origin and able to assigns CoO and HS codes for all internal and external shippable part numbers
Experience with ATA Carnets and Temporary Import Bonds (TIB)
Motivated to complete tasks with process improvements initiates in mind, for streamlining and cost savings opportunities
Collaborate with cross functional teams and stakeholders on business goals and objectives
Advises on Certificates of Origin content
Supports Global Flash location shipments
Supports Reverse Logistics (Service Level Agreement)
Follow company safety and other policies and procedures
Perform other related duties as required
Who you are:
Bachelor’s degree or Community College diploma in a related field or equivalent work experience. Minimum 10 years' experience in Logistics and Customs Compliance preferably in an electronics manufacturing environment
Advanced skill level with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook) and other spreadsheet/database programs
Experience with Power BI and a demonstrated experience with MRP/ERP and CRM systems
Advanced knowledge of WTO and trade agreements-USMCA, CETA (Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement) and International Customs Compliance
Knowledge of Migra and an advanced understanding of Incoterms and expertise within Canadian Export Reporting System (CERS-B13)
Advance knowledge of HS Codes and Duty Rates
Capable of managing several complex tasks at a time, work independently and as part of a team, with technical and non-technical staff
Well-organized, persistent, attentive to details and accuracy, with excellent planning, negotiating and interpersonal skills to work with all levels of management
Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills
Ability to make choices based on the company’s best interests
Bonus points if you have the following:
Problem solving skills with the ability to work well under pressure and deadlines
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Position is a work from home role, with the ability to meet in office as needed
Equity, Diversity & Inclusion 
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! Manager manufacturing Systems

Work on projects and tasks associated with shop floor data collection, control software, and data research. A hands approach on development of custom software solutions and the set-up, configuration, and support of third-party platforms.
Participate in the development of tools and dashboards that interface across numerous systems including our MRP, ERP and PLM platforms.
Develop new technologies and methodologies that help drive improvements throughout the facility including warehousing, supply-chain, production, and quality.
Document the implementations, provide introductory training to users, and monitor releases for continual improvements.
Collaborate with the corporate IS department in understanding the corporate policies while interfacing with systems outside of manufacturing.

You possess a Computer Science or Engineering Degree; or equivalent training and experience in an electronics environment. A minimum 5 years of overall experience within technology and software systems in a professional environment
Good understanding of SQL or related RDBMS skills with an appreciation for effective data presentation and reporting
Development using .NET technologies (C#) and JavaScript (Angular)
Working knowledge of SQL query language and REST API’s, an understanding of modern revision control processes (Git) and release management principles
Data Management and data manipulation knowledge and experience with demonstrated knowledge of production floor systems (MES) that collect data and drive processes
Basic understanding of supply-chain/planning requirements within an MRP or ERP system
Solid technical communication skills both verbal and written, in English. An ability to collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams across the organization

Exposure to manufacturing systems and processes.

As a Manufacturing Systems Developer, you will be a valued member of the Manufacturing Systems team dedicated to implementing a word class information system to support Ross Video’s manufacturing facilities. You will report to the Manager, Manufacturing Systems and work alongside experts in Ross Video’s manufacturing facilities while coordinating with the corporate IS team.

Who you report to:

Manager manufacturing Systems

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Work on projects and tasks associated with shop floor data collection, control software, and data research. A hands approach on development of custom software solutions and the set-up, configuration, and support of third-party platforms.
• Participate in the development of tools and dashboards that interface across numerous systems including our MRP, ERP and PLM platforms.
• Develop new technologies and methodologies that help drive improvements throughout the facility including warehousing, supply-chain, production, and quality.
• Document the implementations, provide introductory training to users, and monitor releases for continual improvements.
• Collaborate with the corporate IS department in understanding the corporate policies while interfacing with systems outside of manufacturing.
• Client development with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML.
• Good understanding of manufacturing shop floor processes, data collection, manufacturing execution systems, supply-chain software (MRP/ERP) are a bonus.

Who you are:
• You possess a Computer Science or Engineering Degree; or equivalent training and experience in an electronics environment. A minimum 5 years of overall experience within technology and software systems in a professional environment
• Good understanding of SQL or related RDBMS skills with an appreciation for effective data presentation and reporting
• Development using .NET technologies (C#) and JavaScript (Angular)
• Working knowledge of SQL query language and REST API’s, an understanding of modern revision control processes (Git) and release management principles
• Data Management and data manipulation knowledge and experience with demonstrated knowledge of production floor systems (MES) that collect data and drive processes
• Basic understanding of supply-chain/planning requirements within an MRP or ERP system
• Solid technical communication skills both verbal and written, in English. An ability to collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams across the organization

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Exposure to manufacturing systems and processes
• Preference for candidates that have supported multi-site facilities and API development in .NET Core (C#), Classic ASP, ASP.NET. with exposure to Angular framework or TypeScript

This position resides within the PCBA Process Development Group. The group’s primary responsibilities are to support ongoing change management and manufacturing shop floor activities within PCBA production. This position is responsible for ensuring the quality and accuracy of our procedures, work instructions and product through consulting with technical owners and shop floor personnel, scheduled audits, and quality data metrics. Attention to detail, ability to work with others and a broad manufacturing process knowledge are key assets for this role.

Who you report to:

Manager, PCBA Process Development

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• The right candidate has a background in electronics manufacturing with 5 years preferred experience.
• This includes experience in developing and maintaining PCBA manufacturing processes, with an ability to manage process implementation projects, including the review and the acquisition of capital assets.
• Knowledge of Manufacturing Execution System (MES) with an understanding of auditing on BOM’s, work instruction for completeness and accuracy.
• Comfortable in sharing knowledge to facilitate training to employees on new processes, both in a classroom and manufacturing environment setting.
• This role requires collaboration and continuous engagement with our R&D and NPI teams to ensure PCBA manufacturing processes are developed for future production needs
• If you are a self starter, motivated and passionate about electronics this may be a fit for you.
Who you are:

• You have an ability to work independently or can be part of a team, collaborating with technical and non-technical staff in an organised way.
• Your work ethic presents persistently with excellent attention to detail and accuracy. You have solid communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
• Confident in making decisions based on the Company’s best interest are essential elements in this role. Your collaboration with all types of stakeholders, from functional areas as well as different levels of management are key factors in your role.
• Possesses a Post-secondary education in electronics or has electronics manufacturing experience and some background in quality and understand the corrective action process.
• An advanced level of knowledge with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook) and Microsoft Project is preferred.

Bonus points if you have the following:

Minimum 5 years’ experience in an electronics-manufacturing environment that includes exposure to manufacturing processes and procedures with a technical background is a solid asset. Prior experience programming SMT, MES and related software.

• Operate electronic insertion machine in a single or dual capacity
• Operate wave solder machine
• Perform Final Inspection involving inspecting all through-hole components for orientation, correct component placement and ensuring that all finishing is completed properly
• Collecting data on defects would be included with inspection
• Operate a press fit, aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jigs, fixtures, or other holding devices and crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits or performs similar operations to join or secure parts in place
• Connect component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connect wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points
• Assemble and attach hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, and switches to assemblies
• You will also assemble cables, heat sinks and power supplies for finishing
• Test assemblies using dedicated test stations
• Keep up to date on Manufacturing technology and new processes
• Adhere to all Ross Video Safety protocols and maintain ESD practices

• Ability to work independently or as part of a team
• Capability of following procedures and working logically

• Previous experience within a manufacturing environment and Electronics Assembly

The Project Coordinator – North America role is a hands-on customer facing role that plays an active part in helping the Technical Solutions team gain visibility and reporting for ongoing projects through the sales process. This successful candidate will have both inter-team duties and be outward facing to create a rapport with existing business partners through our distribution channel and end users that use distribution for procurement.

The Project Coordinator works within Technical Solutions Team, ensuring pre-sale activities stay on task when requiring technical collaboration and project management personnel. This resource will be a bridge for Project Management and Solutions Architects along with other departments such as Inside Sales, Order Management, and other key departments within Ross Video. The person will also assist with maintaining technical details of our products used by the team, other departments, and business partners as well as driving key opportunities with end users and authorized business partners.

You must bring integrity, drive, passion, and superb communications skills.
