Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

• Work collaboratively with the regionally based Sales Managers and Inside Sales representatives to determine and implement opportunity specific sales approaches guided by the Ross Way to Sell.
• Assist the North America Technical Solution Team with identifying upcoming projects requiring technical resources and project management assignments.
• Help with day-to-day activities to support the Technical Solutions Team providing guidance to re-sellers through distribution channels, system integrators and clients to facilitate the purchase of Ross solutions.
• Manage monthly project pipeline review activities to ensure proper coverage across the team.
• Develop reporting within the corporate CRM system and Project Management tools for at a glance status day to day.
• Maintain accurate customer data within the corporate CRM solution
• Assist in resolution of customer complaints regarding equipment, supplies, and services.
• Perform other related duties as required.

• University degree in Business Administration, or related discipline and/or equivalent work experience
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in a complex sales environment
• Experience in RFP responses
• Ability to build and maintain lasting relationships with consultants, customers, and business partners
• Exceptional communication and presentation skills
• Highly proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, etc.)
• Highly proficient with customer relationship management (CRM) software such as Salesforce.com
• Experience with Solution Sales
• Experience Selling Live Video Production software and hardware an asset
• Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills
• Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment

Electronics/Test Technician

Working both independently and in a team environment you will be working with and assisting senior technicians with all functional test equipment and fixtures to assure all systems are functional and operating within Ross standards.

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Manager, Test & RMA

What you will do:
• Troubleshooting, from fully assembled systems all the way down to the component level on PCBAs, initiating repairs using appropriate routing and rework tools.
• Working with Production Managers, Lead-Hands and cell supervisors for work prioritization to ensure internal and external customer demands are met.
• Providing technical support to Production test staff, by validating infrastructure integrity and initiating repairs as well as providing technical support to the Test Development team on NPI (new product introduction).
• Use various test equipment and tools (hardware and software) to test and debug products and as required, perform production configuration, testing and calibration following established procedures, policies and protocols and performing other related duties as required.

What you need to know:
• Electronics Technician/Technologist diploma or equivalent in experience is required with an excellent understanding of electronic theory and applications, with an emphasis on digital components such as CPU, FPGA, flash, etc.
• A solid foundation in schematic reading and interpretation with a working knowledge of Linux and other command line interface with hardware and knowledge of JTAG technologies (IEEE 1149.1, 1149.6.).
• Familiarity with a wide variety of test equipment (i.e.: high-speed scopes, video/audio generators/analyzers, DVMs, etc.).
• Experience with scripting languages such as AutoIt, TCL, or equivalent and experience with programming languages such as C, C++ or equivalent.
• An above average PC/Windows computer skill set specifically related to network and serial interface and configuration.
• You must have computer proficiency with Microsoft Office and core business-use tools and knowledge of video and audio standards, and broadcasting would be an asset.
• The ability to solder if required (jig repair) is an asset.

Who you are:
• You have exceptional technical abilities and organizational skills with a high initiative and well-developed analytical problem solving and communication skills.
• You can work in a fast-paced environment and you are able to cope with varying levels of support and documentation; a self-starter, quick learner and able to work with minimum supervision in meeting schedules.
• Work in a manufacturing environment in an individual workstation, within a moderately noisy setting.

Investigate, specify, design, implement, test, and maintain new features.

Bachelor Degree in a STEM field of study, or prior job experience in programming
C++ coding skills including all of C, object-oriented programming, integer bit operations, memory management, multi-threading (either C++ native or OS-provided threading), and use of STL templates.

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Embedded/Realtime programming experience

As a Buyer you are responsible for all procurement related activities for an assigned group of commodities and/or vendors. Responsible for all aspects of Vendor Relationship management. Coordinating all activities related to the procurement of materials, parts, equipment, and supplies beginning with intent to purchase through delivery, throughout the life of the component/part. Assuring that components/parts are delivered on schedule, at the negotiated price, and that they meet the quality standards of the company.

What the job is all about:
• Responsible for evaluating demands from Production Control for the advancement of products through Manufacturing.
• Collaborating with the R&D Lab in the recommendation and selection of suppliers for new products.
• Analyze all new requirements for assigned commodities to ensure timely delivery at best possible price. Works closely with R&D department to ensure NPI Requirements are met.
• Establishes best applicable supply chain practices with vendor base, including Kanban, Demand Pull, and MRP Share techniques.
• May administer MRP Share and Consignment programs
• Investigates and/or interviews potential suppliers to determine if they meet the specified requirements. Will visit these vendors during prototype development to ensure accuracy of product and quality of work.
• Solicits and evaluates quotations for the requested commodity, negotiates the lowest practical cost for goods balanced against optimum quality and schedule needs.
• Assist in the negotiation and implementation of long-term Purchase Agreements.
• Maintains timely control of orders, amendments, shipping notices, and other documents.
• Communicates as necessary on all rescheduling and expediting of relevant purchase orders so as to meet production plan needs while maintaining minimal inventory
• Expedites and provides timely information with regards to Shortages
• Responsible for the procurement of Purchase Requisitions for non-MRP related items and demands for samples from R&D Lab, Test Dept., Manufacturing, Sales etc.
• Maintains accurate information with regards to Standard Cost, Lead Time and other related part data.
• Guides the disposition of excess inventory through sale, return, scrap, or other measures as appropriate.
• Follow all Ross Health & Safety policies
• Perform other related duties as needed.

Hybrid work environment – work from home and office

• Bachelor’s Degree or Community College diploma in a related field or equivalent work experience.
• Working towards or has PMAC/APICS certification.
• Advanced skill level with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook) and other spreadsheets/database programs
• Demonstrated experience with MRP systems
• Capable of managing several complex tasks at a time
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with technical and non-technical staff
• Well-organized, persistent, a “doer”, attentive to details and accuracy
• Excellent planning, negotiation, and interpersonal skills
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills (English)
• Ability to make choices based on the company’s best interests

Repair Specialist

As a Repair Specialist you will work with SMT component replacement including micro-components, BGA’s, connectors both SMT and SMT/Thru hole combinations, performing lifted/damaged pad repairs and track cuts, thru-hole component removal and insertion. Your knowledge of various tools – hot air guns, pre-heaters and traditional soldering/de-soldering tools and tips is imperative in this role as is your familiarity of Air Vac, which is used for removing and replacing micro-components, BGA’s, Flip Chips and connectors

Who you report to:

Production, Manager

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about

• Possessing the necessary equipment knowledge and familiarity with stencil and paste processes
• creating profiles using solder sample boards and thermo couples, reballing BGA’s and prepping boards for repair, which includes: Applying heat resistant materials to parts on the board for protection, which include Kapton tape, heat blankets, pink shield.
• Dismantling fully/partially assembled boards and baking boards, logging times in preparation for rework.
• Must have a Solid understanding of IPC-610 quality standards and be able to receive and interpret direction from technical staff.
• Responsible for prioritizing daily work based on production needs, RMA’s and return to customer defects.
• Able to make choices, based on board damage or difficulty of task, on whether or not a defect is repairable or scrap.
• Multi-tasking is a necessary step in this role as you will commonly require small jobs to be complete in order to do your daily tasks
• Able to occasionally work with engineers to perform modifications to pcba’s – this may include mod wires, track cuts or any unconventional methods of placing components
• Creativity is necessary when working with densely populated boards to get components on and off.

Who you are

• Must understand the X-Ray machine in order to deduce whether or not the solder quality adheres to IPC Standards.
• Able to accurately interpret and enter defect information within MES. Works closely with SMT and Mechanical Support staff and maintain ESD practices.
• Possess a mechanical aptitude and have basic computer skill.
• You are able to work independently or as part of a team and capable of following procedures and work logically, with a solid attention to detail and an aptitude for learning

Bonus points if you have the following:
• High School Diploma
• IPC-7711B/7721B Rework, Modification and Repair of Electronic Assemblies
• Previous experience within a manufacturing environment
• 2-3 years soldering experience

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The Service Delivery organization is responsible for ensuring our clients maximize the potential and value of their Ross Video products and solutions. We are a global 24/7 organization of dedicated Live Broadcast professionals who install, implement, train, and support our clients. We are passionate about technology and are committed to helping others be successful.

The projects we work on include the largest broadcasters, stadiums, and eSports events with clients such as Disney, NBC, Sky, BBC, Apple, Facebook (Meta), and ESPN. Our people may work individually or on teams of 10 or more people.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
The Manager of Training Operations is a key member of Ross Video’s Service Delivery Team. This multidisciplinary role is responsible for the effective operations management of the Ross Video Service Delivery training, digital transformation, system administration, and financial management functions. This supporting role provides leadership to ensure that Ross Video meets its mission of providing a superior customer experience, across our client-facing Global Technical Support, Commissioning, and Training Development business units. This position reports to the Vice President, Service Delivery.

• Create an operations strategic plan for both Service Delivery processes and internal staff, overseeing its implementation and assessing its outcomes to enable smooth delivery of best-in class service.
• Identify and explore new methods, procedures, and technology to improve Service Delivery’s processes to better address the needs of our internal stakeholders and external customers.
• Lead Service Delivery digital transformation and systems integration projects ensuring they are delivered to the necessary specifications and time/cost requirements
• Lead, build, and manage the delivery and ongoing operation of the Ross Video customer-facing eLearning program
• Manage the effective operation of Ross Video’s Flash spare parts program ensuring the on-time delivery of critical RMA spares to our global clients and partners.
• Oversee the creation of written materials for the department, providing content for review and updating, according to our corporate templates and guidelines.
• Manage the billing and administrative processes in support of the Director of Client Services, Director of Global Technical Support, Manager of EMEA Services, and Manager of APAC Services.

Who you are:
• Exceptional leader, renowned planner with excellent communication and presentation skills.
• Detail oriented with the ability to build solid relationships.
• Hands-on experience in process development, improvement and reporting.
• People management experience.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Familiarity with the broadcast, news or sports and level events industry is a definite asset.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

Ross Video is looking for Project Manager to deliver Projects within the APAC region, and occasionally on a global scale. Location in Singapore or Australia is an advantage but other locations within APAC can be considered if the candidate deemed fit for the position. You will be self-motivated with good inter-personal skills, be able to think ‘outside the box’ and to work under pressure.

The Project Manager is a key member of the Sales Team who plays a leadership role in ensuring that Ross meets its mission of providing a Superior Customer Experience. He or she manages key client projects.

The successful candidate will work directly with customers, business partners, and system integrators to ensure deliverables fall within the applicable scope/budget. He or she will coordinate with other Ross departments to ensure all aspects of each project are compatible, concerns are addressed, and work packages are completed whether in or out of scope.

A Project Manager with good Broadcast industry experience is an essential requirement, preferably from a Project Management, Technical Support or Project Engineering background. Broad experience and understanding across the broadcast content supply chain is also required. The role will require project experience to include hardware, software, and operational workflow delivery within Broadcast.

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Responsible for liaising with the Regional Sales Manager and/or Ross pre-sales tech to ensure a comprehensive handover of expected deliverables.
• Lead and co-ordinate the scoping, technical requirements gathering, estimating, and planning for single or multiple projects or work streams. This must be written in clear and concise deliverables with demarcation of responsibilities defined in Statement of Work (SOW), which to be distributed and agreed with all project stakeholders.
• Due to the many products in Ross portfolios the position requires a broad understanding of all aspects of broadcasting technologies.
• The position will require time is spent on customer sites (including kick-off meetings, project definition, support of commissioners/trainers, rehearsal, go-live. etc.).
• Project manage the delivery and support of Ross Video projects from sales handover to completion (acceptance / hand over to technical support).
• Ensure shared clarity of scope, good estimating, solution development and management of risk and dependencies.
• To act as the first point of contact for all concerns, obstacles, and opportunities on a project. Issues could include supplier dependencies, infrastructure, and operational capability.
• Lead the commissioning and training teams, ensuring at point of commission/training the system is ready for delivery and the Ross teams have the adequate tools / knowledge to deliver their objectives.
• Work closely with project stakeholders to anticipate, manage, and resolve issues, risks, dependencies, and impediments that may impact on the delivery of your projects.
• Where a risk has been raised, identify, assess, plan, and implement an approved solution.
• Report on project progress in a consistent and timely manner.
• Work as an embedded project manager in a cross-discipline team comprised of software developers, commissioners, trainers, development, Product Managers, and Ross field experts.
• Ongoing point of contact post launch once a system has gone ‘live’, through to an agreed Project completion date.
• Effectively manage Proof of Concept Projects (POC).

Who you are:
• Knowledge and understanding of the installation and configuration of PCs, Operating systems, VMs, networks, and broadcast distribution standards, including IP and Cloud.
• As Broadcast is a fast-evolving environment, the ideal candidate will have willingness to learn.
• Ideally come from a Project Management, Broadcast Technical Support, or Project Engineer Role.
• Experience of managing projects from pre-sale/point of sale through to completion and with vast knowledge in managing medium to large scale sized projects.
• Previous experience or knowledge of Salesforce
• Demonstrable experience of dealing with internal and external stakeholders.
• Sound knowledge of Broadcast technologies.
• Resident in Singapore or Australia with the ability to work worldwide for trips from a few days to multiple weeks for large installs.
• Understanding or qualification in project methodologies (PRINCE2 / PMP).

Bonus points if you have the following:
Languages including Mandarin, Cantonese are an advantage but not essential.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

You will report to the Technical Product Manager in the LED group.

What the job is all about:
Implement in C a driver that controls a hardware accelerator to perform color correction for high dynamic range video
Work with an FPGA designer to help debug a lab issue and create code to help gather additional telemetry and status information
Participate in a design/code review of a field system update software and provide your feedback on how to better handle a fault condition
Review test coverage strategy and provide feedback to further improve coverage to the product verification team
Configure the descriptor chain for an MSGDMA to move Audio from Ethernet streams to DDR
Post timestamps from hardware to a gPTP module through a Linux Ethernet driver
Work with the hardware designer to resolve timestamp FIFO overflow issues
Document an API documentation to support integration with another software team
Design a thread safe register interface module for a high speed register interface
Participate in a daily scrum meeting and work with team members afterward to resolve a blocking integration issue
Discuss the implementation of a new customer requested feature with the marketing team and technical product manager
Work with the project manager to generate a project work break down with time estimates for each of your tasks
Help maintain the Linux R&D build server and create a script to add a new feature to our build automation flow
Meet with software and RTL designers to propose lab integration strategy
Teach co-op how to analyze network packets with wireshark
Explain the interrupt strategy to an FPGA designer; ensuring it meets our system requirements
Update JIRA with the progress made on current tasks
Perform other related duties as required
Who you are:
Bachelors degree in computer science, computer engineering, software engineering or related discipline
Experienced with C and C++.
Experience with ARM multi-processor systems within an embedded Linux environment
Possess experience developing under Linux with GNU tool chain.
Experience working with scripted tool flow (tcl, perl, sh), source control.
Experience working with lab equipment to debug complex designs that could involve multiple people.
Knowledge of TCP/IP networking including familiarity with UDP, TCP, HTTP, FTP, SLP, Zeroconf.
Knowledge of software design for embedded system with a mix of application, library and driver development is an asset
Ability to resolve memory leaks and deadlocks
Knowledge of creating hardware stubs for simulated testing
Experience performing static code analysis
Knowledge of revision control systems, branching and tagging methodologies
Expertise in software debugging through JTAG interfaces and logic analyzers
Familiarity with hardware integration and lab tools

The successful candidate will work closely with Service Delivery Management, the Training team’s Product Primes and Ross Video’s Product Teams to design, develop, and implement engaging learning activities leading to certification. This includes instructor-led training offered in person or online, self-instructional e-learning modules, instructional videos, and other learning solutions as needed. The incumbent will work closely with subject matter experts to convert highly technical and operational content into effective learning materials. They will also collaborate with other trainers as needed to align projects, discuss initiatives, and develop company best practices for learning and development. The incumbent may also develop non-technical training for management or professional development and perform other duties as required.

Who you report to:

The Instructional Design Specialist will report to the Manager of Learning and Development within the Service Delivery Operations team.

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

Design and Development
• Assess needs and recommend appropriate learning solutions. Partner with key stakeholders within the learning function and subject matter experts across the organization to identify target audience learning needs and ensure learning activities meet business requirements.
• Analyze existing training materials and recommend improvements.
• Apply proven theories, practices, models, and developing trends to optimize instructional design and development. Be creative in finding learning solutions that may be new or innovative and that effectively address learning needs.
• Prepare and manage learning documentation (e.g. course plans, storyboards).
• Create effective e-learning in the form of self-instructional modules for specific target groups or for company employees generally.
• Develop and manage learning assets that can be used in different projects (e.g. audio clips, images, videos).
• Contribute to the overall success of the Learning and Development function by identifying ways to continually improve design and development, tools, and learning experiences.
• Collaborate with the Manager, Learning and Development to establish priorities, manage projects, and improve learning and development programs.
• Manage own work to meet deadlines and proactively identify and advise on issues that may affect the timely design and development of learning solutions.
• Accountable for the accuracy and quality of all instructional design work.
Other duties
• Leverage templates and requirements to develop and produce training.
• Communicate effectively orally and in writing with individuals at all levels of the organization.
• Use the company Learning Management System (LMS) to distribute learning materials and track results. Work with the Manager, Learning and Development and with other administrators to continually improve ways of working with the LMS.
• Stay current with learning-oriented technology trends and innovations to continually create quality learning solutions.
• Follow company policies and procedures.
• Perform other duties related to instructional design and development.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary degree in instructional design, educational technology, or related field.
• 5+ Years of experience designing and developing learning solutions in a business environment.
• Demonstrated experience in completing training projects on time and with consistent good results.
• Demonstrated skills developing e-learning, more specifically with the Articulate Suite of authoring software, and including demonstrable examples of e-learning modules.
• Extensive skills working with other software to create learning materials, like the Microsoft Office suite, graphics, audio, and video editing software, and online presentation or learning software.
• Collaborative and proactive with strong interpersonal skills.
• Strong attention for detail.
• Excellent oral and written communication skills.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
• Self-starter, quick learner, and ability to work with minimum supervision.
• Passionate about learning, instructional design and discovering new technologies.
• Able to work independently and as part of a team.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Knowledge of live broadcast workflows and production
• Experience in a high technology domain

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

The ideal candidate with work with the software team to create world-leading next generation broadcast video processing technology. They will also work closely with the hardware designers to participate in the design of new products, the improvement of existing products and help to diagnose and resolve customer issues.

Who you report to:

You will report to the Technical Product Manager in the LED group.

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Implement in C a driver that controls a hardware accelerator to perform color correction for high dynamic range video
• Work with an FPGA designer to help debug a lab issue and create code to help gather additional telemetry and status information
• Participate in a design/code review of a field system update software and provide your feedback on how to better handle a fault condition
• Review test coverage strategy and provide feedback to further improve coverage to the product verification team
• Configure the descriptor chain for an MSGDMA to move Audio from Ethernet streams to DDR
• Post timestamps from hardware to a gPTP module through a Linux Ethernet driver
• Work with the hardware designer to resolve timestamp FIFO overflow issues
• Document an API documentation to support integration with another software team
• Design a thread safe register interface module for a high speed register interface
• Participate in a daily scrum meeting and work with team members afterward to resolve a blocking integration issue
• Discuss the implementation of a new customer requested feature with the marketing team and technical product manager
• Work with the project manager to generate a project work break down with time estimates for each of your tasks
• Help maintain the Linux R&D build server and create a script to add a new feature to our build automation flow
• Meet with software and RTL designers to propose lab integration strategy
• Teach co-op how to analyze network packets with wireshark
• Explain the interrupt strategy to an FPGA designer; ensuring it meets our system requirements
• Update JIRA with the progress made on current tasks
• Perform other related duties as required

Who you are:
• Bachelors degree in computer science, computer engineering, software engineering or related discipline
• Experienced with C and C++.
• Experience with ARM multi-processor systems within an embedded Linux environment
• Possess experience developing under Linux with GNU tool chain.
• Experience working with scripted tool flow (tcl, perl, sh), source control.
• Experience working with lab equipment to debug complex designs that could involve multiple people.
• Knowledge of TCP/IP networking including familiarity with UDP, TCP, HTTP, FTP, SLP, Zeroconf.
• Knowledge of software design for embedded system with a mix of application, library and driver development is an asset
• Ability to resolve memory leaks and deadlocks
• Knowledge of creating hardware stubs for simulated testing
• Experience performing static code analysis
• Knowledge of revision control systems, branching and tagging methodologies
• Expertise in software debugging through JTAG interfaces and logic analyzers
• Familiarity with hardware integration and lab tools

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. As the Manager of Test and RMA Technicians, you have the responsibility and authority to plan, lead, train and coach the employees who support test production along with RMA (customer) returns. This position is located at our Manufacturing and Test facility in Iroquois, ON.
Who you report to:
Director, Production
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
What the job is all about:
If you are a self starter, motivated, innovative, analytical this will interest you….
As the Manager your emphasis will be on mentoring, guidance, and training to ensure the Techs have the necessary tools to meet their responsibilities and goals. This would include the creation, delivery and monitoring of technical content and procedural guides.
Working closely with the Test Development team to ensure Technicians have the tools and training to be self-sufficient in debugging production and customer returns in the most effective and efficient manor.
Provide feedback to the various Support groups regarding build quality and improvement opportunities.
Your responsibilities also include but are not limited to; actively working with and participating in Lifecycle management and NPI meetings. Managing and supervising direct reports in all facets of the business, including yearly capital and labour budgeting, procurement, quality and people management. Working in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is desired.
An excellent communicator who can provide feedback regarding test optimization and provide relevant data on RMA cases to various stakeholders as well as metrics in relation to debugging activities. A willingness to foster and share information with the goal to minimize returns is crucial.
Working with cross functionally diverse teams, to design and install test infrastructure, whilst you maintain and enhance where needed. A creative innovative approach to business with optimization of processes and procedures in mind.
Who you are:
The ideal candidate possesses a minimum of 2 years supervisor, or managerial experience in a manufacturing/test environment with an education in Electronics or relevant experience, at minimum a 3-year post-secondary education in electronics or equivalent.
Proficient in electronic theory and applications, with emphasis on digital components such as CPU, FPGA, flash, etc.., along with schematic reading and interpretation.
Excellent communications skills needed to work with various levels of management, departments, and personnel throughout the organization on a variety of technical, procedural and process issues.
High initiative and well developed analytical, problem solving, and troubleshooting skills.
Hands-on experience with scripting and programming languages (ie: AutoIt, TCL, Java, C, C++) along with database (SQL) queries.
Working experience with PLM, MRP and MES software packages.
Bonus points if you have the following:
Experience in manufacturing processes and procedures and the product development process.

• Working with an understanding of electronics and owning a keen eye in recording and tracking movement of parts, as this is key to your involvement in this role.
• Monitor items that need mechanical work performed, and responsible for the delegation of workflow.
• Working with cross functional teams and stakeholders within the manufacturing environment.
• Troubleshooting and analyzing boards to determine the needs with respect to metalwork/heat spreaders etc., removal and in the case of RMA’s, systems may need to have assemblies removed.
• Familiarization of small parts and assemblies in how they are stored and their relationship with corresponding serial numbers and how these parts are replaced.

• A willingness to learn and ask questions.
• Experience in a manufacturing electronics environment
• Able to work in a fast paced environment, paying attention to minute details
• Experience in all facets of inventory processes

• High school diploma
• Have a working knowledge of computers and software packages such as MS Word/Excel/Outlook
• You are capable of following procedures and work logically and have experience in the use of a Forklift
• Have an attention to detail and are organized
• Solid commitment to consistent, quality work habits and you are able to work independently or as part of a team
• Display a willingness and aptitude to learn new things
• Make good choices that represent the business’ best needs
• 1-2 years experience within a warehouse or shipping environment, with a valid driver’s license and clean abstract

• Motivated, reliable and goal oriented
• Have a proven dedication to customer care excellence

At Ross Video, we are Living Live! We are at the cutting edge of live video production, powering much of the world’s most compelling content with our smart production solutions. We are looking for a Senior FPGA Developer to join our dynamic team. Working in a development team, the successful candidate will get the opportunity to help shape the future of the video broadcast industry.
Who you report to:
The Senior FPGA Developer will report to the Technical Product Manager, LED, within the LED team.
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
What the job is all about:
Work within an interdisciplinary team to develop high-level design requirements, product system architecture, device selection and project schedules.
Design, develop, simulate and test FPGA designs as per product specifications or product line guidelines.
Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of the FPGA.
Generate interface documentation to other hardware and software team members.
Review schematics and design documents as required, pertaining to the FPGA interface and functionality, and peer review the work of colleagues.
Troubleshoot, debug and fix FPGA issues and related problems as required.
Assist in training other staff members; mentor more junior staff.
Report project and task status as required.
Perform other related duties as required
Who you are:
You are an expert in RTL design for complex IP targeting large Xilinx or Altera FPGA SOC.
Recent experience with Xilinx (preferred) or Altera design software including synthesis, SOC design tools and timing closure.
Verilog/System, Verilog, and/or VHDL RTL experience.
Experience working with scripted tool flow (tcl, perl, sh, Python), source control.
Experience working with lab equipment to debug complex designs that could involve multiple people.
Familiar with video broadcast standards such as SDI, AES, Timecode, Madi, Tri-level syncs.
Familiar with high-speed serial interfaces such as SDI, 10/40 GigE, Ethernet, PCIe
Experience designing video processing algorithms such as filters. video codecs (H264, H265, MPEG2), color space conversion, scaling, etc.
Work experience with constrained random verification methodology such as VMM or UVM.
Experience working with high-speed memory interface such as DDR3/4.
Experience with the creation of code generation tool and workflow automation.

With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
At Ross Video, we are Living Live! We are at the cutting edge of live video production, powering much of the world’s most compelling content with our smart production solutions. We are looking for a UX Designer to join our dynamic team.
Who you report to:
The UX Designer & Researcher will report to the Manager, UX & Industrial Design within the R&D Operations group.
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
What the job is all about:
As our UX Designer and Researcher, you will act as an investigator to apply usability research and user-centered design principles to improve and unify the customer experience across the Ross Video product portfolio, including both hardware and software. You will use the results of your investigations to create mockups and wireframes, and work with Ross’s teams to build awesome products!
More specifically, you will be:
Designing and executing usability studies
Creating sketches, wireframes, and both low and high-fidelity mockups
Investigating new ways to evaluate user experience with Ross products
Performing accessibility evaluations against standards like the WCAG
Working with product teams to apply usability best practices to products.
Helping establish design processes and evangelize best practices at Ross Video.
Who you are:
If you possess a degree, diploma or experience in Human-Computer Interaction, Design, or User Experience, this role may be just for you. If you are known for your ability to work within industry-specified constraints to improve and unify user experience across a broad product portfolio and you can communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions clearly and effectively to design team and customers, please apply!
Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.
Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

Position Overview
Ross Video powers video production for billions of global viewers daily with the industry’s widest range of smart production solutions. We are looking for an organized self-starter to join our Human Resources team as a Talent Sourcing Specialist.
Working as a member of the Ross Video Talent Acquisition team, the Talent Sourcing Specialist will be an expert in talent sourcing and establishing positive relationships with potential candidates through all means of candidate recruitment. The Talent Sourcing Specialist plays an essential role in identifying and attracting the talented individuals we require for our growing R&D organization.
Reporting to the Manager, HR Programs, your responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
Working with the R&D Talent Acquisition Partner and the rest of the Talent Acquisition team to develop, champion and lead proactive talent attraction strategies and processes.
Identifying new recruitment sources, channels and characteristics of successful candidates for our R&D roles.
Building and maintaining a network of potential candidates through pro-active market research and on-going relationship management; conduct in-depth interviews of potential candidates to garner interest and assess suitability for Ross Video.
Identify opportunities to promote Ross Video as an employer of choice amongst designated groups, and foster positive relationships with the applicable communities.
Facilitate applicant testing, schedule interviews and co-ordinate resources.
May be required to manage the full recruitment life-cycle for some Ross client groups, from candidate sourcing to onboarding.
Participate in special projects/recruiting initiatives, including assessment of best practices in sourcing and screening techniques.
Other duties as required.
Experience & Background
Minimum 3+ years of corporate and/or search firm experience with a successful track record as a talent sourcing specialist in a high volume, fast-paced and changing environment; experience in a high-tech environment an asset.
Well versed in candidate generation; experience in recruiting passive candidates.
Experience building and utilizing a variety of sourcing plans and tools, including proactive phone and internet research; experience driving candidate sourcing initiatives using search engines, social networks, etc.
Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively collaborate with others.
Ability to deal with confidential information with a high degree of diplomacy; ability to build credibility and trust.
Organized and very detail orientated; experience managing and prioritizing multiple searches, projects and relationships.
Strong-working knowledge of LinkedIN Recruiter and MS-Office package and general computer software; familiarity with Ceridian Dayforce an asset.

At Ross Video, we are Living Live! We are at the cutting edge of live video production, powering much of the world’s most compelling content with our smart production solutions. We are looking for a dynamic, organized leader to join our team in the role of Product Operations Manager.
Who you report to:
The Product Operations Manager will report to the Technical Product Manager (TPM) of Hyperconverged Solutions. Working with the Technical Product Manager (TPM’s), the Product Operation Manager (POM) helps manage and drive each project from concept through to a successful release to manufacturing and product launch to market.
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
What the job is all about:
The POM plays an essential role in our product development process by ensuring the many contributing teams are aligned and share information efficiently. This requires a deep understanding of the hardware development, manufacturing and validation process to effectively liaise with development, manufacturing, test engineering, component, and compliance teams.
Your contribution is critical in ensuring that projects deliver on time, within budget, and transition seamlessly to manufacturing to enable smooth product sales & order process.
These responsibilities require that the candidate :
Project Planning Phase:
Follows, advocates, and helps implement the corporate NPI process
Works with the TPM, project leads, and project team in developing the project schedules. POM owns the responsibility for the creation and maintenance of project schedules
Work with engineering services and manufacturing NPI teams to ensure the availability of needed resources for the successful delivery of the project
Project Execution Phase/Release phase :
Maintains, tracks, and report progress against schedule for waterfall and agile teams
Assists the TPM and project leads, where required, in the coordination of project team development activities and for the effective follow-up - facilitating communication between individuals and teams.
Tracks all development, product verification, engineering services, and manufacturing activities identifying any potential project issues and challenges, including resource exposures or conflicts
Works with TPMs, MPMs, Manufacturing (including scheduling, test, and procurement) in developing product BOMs for each level of all new products
Responsible for providing communication on project status throughout the organization
Coordinate with engineering services and manufacturing team to schedule R&D build, compliance
Order equipment required for projects including submitting capital requests and justifications
Owns and manages the Product release checklist and is responsible for ensuring that all disciplines (manufacturing, marketing, developments, etc) follow through with and complete tasks required for a successful release
Product Lifecycle Management:
Track and manage the resolution of lifecycle escalations from component engineering and procurement teams to proper resolution including working with the product management team to prioritize, and schedule all activities including ACER build, validation, and related ECO updates.
Responsible for maintenance (ECO, MCO, EOL, etc) of all manufacturing data for all released products
Responsible for monitoring and maintaining manufactured product costing and reporting any appreciable changes to TPM and MPM
Responsible for communication throughout the organization for all product updates and new code releases
Who you are:
Post-secondary education, an engineering degree is a strong asset
PMI Certification will be an asset
Strong logistics and planning background
Familiarity with the product development process and the associated requirements of manufacturing
Strong knowledge of PM tools
Familiarity with agile software development process including experience with SCRUM is a strong asset

At Ross Video, we are Living Live! We are at the cutting edge of live video production, powering much of the world’s most compelling content with our smart production solutions. We are looking for a Senior FPGA Developer to join our dynamic team. Working in a development team, the successful candidate will get the opportunity to help shape the future of the video broadcast industry.
Who you report to: Technical Product Manager, LED

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Work within an interdisciplinary team to develop high-level design requirements, product system architecture, device selection and project schedules.
• Design, develop, simulate and test FPGA designs as per product specifications or product line guidelines.
• Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of the FPGA.
• Generate interface documentation to other hardware and software team members.
• Review schematics and design documents as required, pertaining to the FPGA interface and functionality, and peer review the work of colleagues.
• Troubleshoot, debug and fix FPGA issues and related problems as required.
• Assist in training other staff members; mentor more junior staff.
• Report project and task status as required.
• Perform other related duties as required
Who you are:
• You are an expert in RTL design for complex IP targeting large Xilinx or Altera FPGA SOC.
• Recent experience with Xilinx (preferred) or Altera design software including synthesis, SOC design tools and timing closure.
• Verilog/System, Verilog, and/or VHDL RTL experience.
• Experience working with scripted tool flow (tcl, perl, sh, Python), source control.
• Experience working with lab equipment to debug complex designs that could involve multiple people.
• Familiar with video broadcast standards such as SDI, AES, Timecode, Madi, Tri-level syncs.
• Familiar with high-speed serial interfaces such as SDI, 10/40 GigE, Ethernet, PCIe
• Experience designing video processing algorithms such as filters. video codecs (H264, H265, MPEG2), color space conversion, scaling, etc.
• Work experience with constrained random verification methodology such as VMM or UVM.
• Experience working with high-speed memory interface such as DDR3/4.
• Experience with the creation of code generation tool and workflow automation.

As the Principal Technical Lead, you are the technical leader for your product or products. You plan and oversee the development of solutions to allow our customers to achieve or exceed their business goals. In this technical role you are responsible and accountable for the implementation and quality of the products under your purview. You craft the architecture and design of your product to meet product goals in alignment with the practices and principals of our Senior Software Architects; you oversee the implementation to ensure architectural and code consistency; you ensure that best practices are being employed, all the while making certain that quality and security are primary considerations.

You coach, mentor, guide, and help nurture the development team (developers and testers) to realize its full potential and adopt our culture of technical excellence and continuous improvement.

Who you report to: Director, Technical Product Management

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Own the product development, from understanding the customers’ needs to supporting it in the field, and everything in between.
• Develop the best solutions for your customers.
• Interface with Tech Support to understand and resolve issues found in deployed software instances.
• Define vision and strategy for technical implementation of your products.
• Work with the Product Managers and Product Owners to understand customer requirements and ensure we are delivering the right things.
• Reduce the number of issues found by customers by promoting a preventative vs reactionary approach to development and testing.
• Create a culture of technical excellence within the team.
• Work with other teams to align on strategy, deliver solutions, tools, processes, and reuse where it makes sense.
• Work with the Product Owner to establish predictability in release dates and scope.
• Ensuring quality of releases, through proactive and preventative measures.
• Ensuring product meets corporate security standards.
• Ensuring team adherence to the DoD.
• Working with architects to ensure cross-product alignment.
• Driving a culture of innovation and capturing Ross Intellectual Property (trade secrets, patents, and copyright) throughout the development cycle.
• Identifying, prioritizing, and planning technical debt reduction.
• Managing the introduction of 3rd party and FOSS software.
• Identifying, documenting, submitting, and defending audits for government R&D tax incentives.
• Mentoring and coaching staff on best practices for achieving clean architecture and clean code.

Who you are:
• You have the ability to design complex, efficient, and high-quality systems under pressure
• You are and effective leader, technical coach, and mentor.
• You are fluent in clean architectural design; are versed in Domain Driven Design concepts; you know and employ the SOLID principles of OO design.
• You know and espouse the value of test automation.
• You know how to debate passionately and make objective decisions.
• You work collaboratively with others and facilitate groups.

• Schematic capture, circuit simulation, lab debug and verification
• Work in coordination with the PCB layout team, FPGA, mechanical, and firmware designers
• Assist in validating new electrical and electronic components
• Work closely with the software and technical writing team to ensure a final quality product

• Good interpersonal and communication skills (team player)
• Ability to work well with inter-disciplinary colleagues
• Strong observational and problem solving skills
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Self-starter, quick learner and can work with minimum supervision in meeting schedules and project
• Minimum of 7 years development experience
• Experience with high-speed PCB design practices, signal integrity and EMC
• Experience designing hardware with FPGAs (Xilinx preferable), optical interconnect, and high-speed memory
• Experience in design under regulatory controls (safety etc.)

• Tracks all development, product verification, engineering services and manufacturing activities and identifies any potential project issues and challenges, including resource exposures or conflicts.
• Ensures that project status reports are generated on time as required.
• Works with the TPM, MPM, Manufacturing (including Scheduling, Test, and Procurement) in developing product BOMs for each level of all new products.
• Responsible for ensuring the timely delivery of required input to the Technical Documentation team.
• Responsible for providing communication on project status throughout the organization.
• Ensures that project status reports are generated on time as required.
Release:
• Works with the TPM and MPM to define a product deployment plan.
• Works with the TPM and MPM to coordinate and ensure training is provided for Technical Support, Commissioning, Sales Engineer, and Training team.
• Owns and manages the Product release checklist and is responsible for ensuring that all disciplines (manufacturing, Marketing, Developments, etc) follow through with and complete tasks required for a successful release.
Product Lifecycle Management:
• Works with the Technical Support and Development teams, via an escalation process, to ensure customer satisfaction by managing and tracking any product deployment issues - providing prompt and appropriate customer communications.
• Tracks all field service issues and report on them internally as well as any required customer communications.
• Where necessary, consults with the Field Service Team, TPM and MPM’s to determine any necessary actions required to resolve customer issues and/or dissatisfactions.
• Responsible for maintenance (ECO, MCO, EOL, etc) of all manufacturing data for all released products.
• Responsible for monitoring and maintaining manufactured product costing and reporting any appreciable changes to TPM and MPM.
• Responsible for communication throughout the organization for all product updates and new code releases.
Operation:
• Works with the MPM and TPM to help develop and record the Strategic Product Line Roadmap.
• Provides support to entire product team on required purchases of materials, test equipment, and facility requirements.

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education, engineering degree is a strong asset.
• Familiarity with the product development process and the associated requirements of manufacturing.
• Strong logistics and planning background.
• Management experience working with remote development teams is an asset.
• Familiarity with software planning and development.
• Strong knowledge of PM tools.
• Experience working with vendors, subcontractors, and 3rd party manufacturers is an asset.
• PMI Certification is an asset.
• Driver’s License and access to a vehicle for occasional travel to Iroquois location (1 hour south of Ottawa).

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
Assembler (PCBA)
Working with a team you will fully understand the MES system for routing production, obtaining work instructions and logging defects. Preparing parts and PCBs to be wave soldered or inserted at the electronic insertion machine.
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we have a pretty energizing environment here.
Some of the things you will work on:
Operate electronic insertion machine in a single or dual capacity and operate wave solder machine. Perform Final Inspection which involves inspecting all through-hole components for orientation, correct component placement and ensuring that all finishing is completed properly. Data collection of defects would be included with inspection. Operate a press fit, aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jigs, fixtures, or other holding devices and crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits or performs similar operations to join or secure parts in place. You will connect component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points. You will assemble and attach hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, and switches to assemblies. You will also assemble cables, heat sinks and power supplies for finishing. You will test assemblies using dedicated test stations. You will keep up to date on Manufacturing technology and new processes. You will always adhere to all Ross Video Safety protocols and maintain ESD practices.
You should have:
A Mechanical aptitude and the ability to work independently or as part of a team. The capability of following procedures and work logically. A detail-oriented mindset, be conscientious and willing to ask questions. An excellent aptitude for learning. You will need to be able to work a rotational shift schedule.
Bonus points if you have the following:
Previous experience within a manufacturing environment and Electronics Assembly.
Equity, Diversity & Inclusion

This position will be assigned to various roles and workstations throughout Systems Assembly as operationally required and will play a role in all stages of production by helping in various departmental cells. They will provide relief to the department cell that has current constraints in the flow of production. This position will require flexibility as they could work in different cells each day/week.
What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Production Manager
Some of the things you will work on:
Assembles metal boxes and positions and mounts units according to instructions. Reading work orders, follows MWI’s. Responsible to position and align parts in specified relationship to each other in jig, fixture, or another holding device.
Crimp, screw, bolts, rivet and cleaning or performs similar operations to join or secure parts in place and connect component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points. Installing finished assemblies or subassemblies in metal boxes and assemble and attach hardware, such as caps, knobs, switches, clamps, bumpers, clips, fasteners, nuts, washers, labels to assemblies. Performing intermediate assembly tasks, such as cleaning, packaging unpacking metal to prepare for builds. Functional tests of assemblies and metal boxes and maintains records data. Shift work, overtime may be required.
You should have:
A self-starter with a mechanical aptitude, analytical, organized and excellent problem-solving skills. You possess the ability to adapt, think fast and work well with others. This position may work with various departments and personnel throughout the organization. Working in a fast-paced, priority driven, team environment; knowing that communication is key to finding and speaking with the right people to get things completed. Strong ability to use computer to retrieve drawings or any information needed to perform the build.
Bonus points if you have the following:
Manufacturing experience, a high school diploma. Some experience with computer systems assembly or testing.

Manufacturing Systems Manager
As a Manufacturing Systems Manager, you will lead a team dedicated to implementing a word class system to support Ross Video’s manufacturing facilities. You will report to the Director, Manufacturing NPI and work alongside experts in Ross Video’s manufacturing department while coordinating with the corporate IS team.
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
What the job is all about:
We are seeking someone with a deep knowledge of information systems within a manufacturing environment. Someone who can efficiently work on projects associated with shop floor data collection, control software, and data analysis. Software tools and dashboards will be developed to interface across numerous systems including MES, MRP, ERP, and PLM platforms.
Possessing an excellent understanding of manufacturing’s needs, processes, and priorities will enable this role to work efficiently with the various manufacturing teams. The goal is to collectively define new initiatives and identify new technologies that drive improvements throughout the facilities. Developing a strategic outlook for the manufacturing systems while be key to ensure short term projects create a scalable and sustainable system.
Most days you will be ensuring your team understands the assignments and has what they need to succeed. Some days you may need to dive into the details and provide hands on development support and lead by example. It will be important to build a high-performance result driven culture.
Who you are:
You possess a university degree in computer science or engineering with more than 5 years of relevant work experience within a high-tech/manufacturing environment. To support the products we build, you should have knowledge of electro-mechanical systems and manufacturing processes. You should appreciate the need for effective data presentation and reporting. Having excellent leadership skills, you can demonstrate you have driven projects to completion and overcome the challenges of implementing improvements. The role requires a good technical background in the following topics:
.Net technologies (C#) and JavaScript (Angular)
SQL architecture or related RDBMS skills
SQL query language and REST API’s
Modern revision control processes (Git) and release management principles
Advanced Data Management/Quality Assurance/Quality Control knowledge and experience
Production floor systems (MES) that collect data and drive processes
Bonus points if you have the following:
Your technical communication skills both verbal and written are important to this role, along with your ability to organize and prioritize. Being goal oriented, comfortable in asking questions, possessing a can-do attitude, and able to collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams across the organization

Reporting to the Art Director, Creative Services, the successful candidate will be responsible for the execution of and/or participation in Ross Creative and Professional Services activities, by providing services for the design, creation, and implementation of XPression real-time graphics and graphics packages and assisting with key XPression Sales and Marketing opportunities.
This position is located in our Ottawa office or a home-based office setting, if mutually agreed upon.
Duties, Responsibilities and Accountability:
Graphic Integration and Design:
Creates XPression templates and animations, using native Xpression tools and provided base graphic elements – such as 3D models, still images, and clips.
Designs XPression templates and animations from scratch, using native XPression tools and 3rd-party graphics applications such as Cinema 4D and Adobe Suite.
Creates packages that conform to standardized workflows outlined by the Art Director.
Automation:
Ensures appropriate automation hooks are created for outside control.
Utilize XPression Visual Logic and scripting for automated, dynamic templates.
Setup XPression Datalinq to pull in external data feeds and interface with external data aggregation systems.
Use Ross Dashboard to create manual user interface panels and backup solutions for XPression automated graphics.
On-site Implementation:
Responsible for implementation and integration of graphics packages at customer's sites, as required.
Administrative:
Attends meetings and conference calls as required to scope, complete, or otherwise facilitate successful completion of assigned projects as they relate to the job.
Work with other creative and professional service members to institute a consistent and standardized workflow solution.
Documentation:
Works with Ross team members to create style and operational guides for end users.
Documents any custom scripting methodologies to ensure future support from Ross.
May be required to create project style-guides of assets.
Job Requirements:
Knowledge/Education/Training:
Post-secondary degree or trade school diploma
Advanced knowledge of Adobe creative suite
Advanced knowledge of Cinema 4D and Redshift renderer knowledge a plus
Intermediate knowledge of IT workflows
Intermediate computer programming experience in VB, SQL, and/or JAVA is desirable
Proficient in Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint
Proficient knowledge of Unreal Engine a plus
Experience:
Minimum 2-5 years production experience in broadcast (studio or remote) or sport venue
Minimum 2-5 years of graphic design experience.
Proficient knowledge of broadcast graphics workflows
Traits:
Organized and very detail orientated
Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
Excellent communication skills
Aptitude for animation and choreography of movement
Strong interpersonal and observational skills
High tolerance of ambiguity
Team-oriented, and able to work co-operatively with Ross and end users
Enthusiastic problem solver
Other:
Willing to travel on a project-by-project basis up to 50% of the time
Valid Passport and Valid Driver's License
Physical Demands:
Occasional requirement to set-up equipment – involves lifting up to 50 lbs, reaching, bending, stooping, etc
Work Environment:
Home based or Ross Ottawa Office

As a SMT Line Operator you will be responsible for utilizing setup documents to pick, setup parts on feeders, load on feeder carts and perform changeover for the SMT lines. Working closely with Pick and Place Operator/Technician’s to ensure efficiencies within the pick and place set-ups, as well as defect issues at the AOI and reflow. An understanding of the MES system with respect to on-line documentation, WIP tracking and defect management.
Who you report to:
Production Manager
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
What the job is all about:
You will be joining our Production Team where we manufacture and build Ross Video products. We build a variety of products for Live TV productions: Production switchers, replay systems, video servers, virtual production, and mobile production units as well as robotic systems that automate the control and movement of TV cameras. Ross’ robots allow a single operator to pan, tilt, zoom, elevate, and reposition multiple cameras using simple joystick controls. Better yet, all these actions can be pre-programmed and fully automated to create mind-blowing visual effects.
Working with the Manufacturing Team in our Iroquois facility you could be working on our AOI equipment, adhering to the First off Procedure to ensure assembly quality throughout the run. You will be responsible for board labelling and working on the manual paste dispense station. At all times maintain Company ESD, MSDS and safety practices. You are required to keep abreast of manufacturing technology and new processes. Working collaboratively with your team and other departments to create the best product for our customers. Able to work independently or as part of a team and follow procedures in an organised logical approach. Attention to detail is important in this role.
Who you are:
A High School Diploma or related demonstrated work experience with knowledge of IPC 610, is a solid asset. Manufacturing environment experience in electronics in a high-tech industry is considered an asset. You are conscientious and willing to ask questions, with a positive attitude in getting the job done. You possess an aptitude for learning.
Bonus points if you have the following:
Able to work independently or as part of a team and passionate about learning.
