As the Digital Marketing Director at Ross Video, you will lead both digital strategy and digital operations within the marketing team, with focus on three pillars of responsibility: digital channels (RossVideo.com, social channels including LinkedIn, Facebook, YouTube, Twitter, Instagram), digital content (social, blogs, email, case studies, etc.) and digital operations (analytics, martech, paid media).
This role has direct reports based both virtually and in the Ottawa office. Some travel to the office may be required if located outside the region. Estimated travel less than 15%.
Who you report to:
 VP of Marketing
What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.
What the job is all about:
Core Responsibilities
Responsible for development and implementation of Ross Video’s overall digital marketing strategy, focused on success metrics across awareness, engagement, and demand-gen.
Lead the management of all digital channels (emphasis on evolving RossVideo.com into a world-class online property) including user experience, content implementation, technology/platform decisions, and design.
Lead the development of integrated content strategy across vertical and product marketing, from case study creation to SEO optimization.
Increase engagement in our social channels and communities by overseeing content creation for blogs, LinkedIn, YouTube, Facebook, and Twitter.
Lead paid media efforts (supported by marketing managers and agency) from content boosting to full campaigns across SEM and social.
Collaborate with sales ops to develop unified process and martech/salestech approach as foundation to emerging demand-gen programs.
Lead email marketing – planning current content and segmentation to engage with customers, as well as future automated programs with custom and personalized content based on audience segments.
Manage all digital vendors, agencies, and platform providers.
Build strategies for existing and emerging digital platforms and stay in the know of new trends and shifts in digital marketing.
Team Management
Manage a team of 5 or more direct reports.
Manage internal and external contributors and vendors.
Be a positive and collaborative leader for the digital marketing team.
Work hand-in-hand with other functions within marketing, especially creative, to deliver consistent look & feel, and unified experience.
Collaborate with stakeholder groups across vertical, region, and product.
Who you are:
Strong preference for candidates with agency experience and/or experience in mid-size B2B technology company (hardware or software).
8+ years of digital strategy and/or digital operations experience.
3+ years of experience leading small teams / direct reports.
Strong understanding of B2B digital content models, social media, and content distribution best practices.
Highly effective project manager (certified or general).
Comfortable (to expert) in demand-gen process and supporting technology.
Experience working with CMS, Automation, CRM, and digital analytics programs (currently WordPress, HubSpot, Salesforce, and GA).
Proficient in Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
University degree or college diploma in Communications, Marketing, Business, or related field preferred.

We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
Production Workflow – Product Verification Specialist
WHAT'S IN THE JOB?
Be part of a cross-functional team that is designing, developing and testing distributed, scalable and highly available applications, tools and services that tie together live video production technology across multiple locations. We are building software that will revolutionize the industry by leveraging a move to distributed architecture and cloud-based infrastructure. As part of this, we are seeking a Product Verification Specialist to drive product quality and ensure all software components provide a reliable, user-friendly and performant experience for our customers. The successful candidate will be obsessed with quality improvement and automated tests for regression and new features.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop a comprehensive test plan and test cases based on new product features, customer requirements or identified problems
Identify test scenarios that are critical and repetitive and automate them
Report bugs with quality descriptions and work closely with the development team to see through and verify fixes
Develop integration tests in collaboration with other product teams to ensure interoperability and a smooth end-to-end workflow for end-users
Support ongoing software development efforts which means participating in Agile based SDLC – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, documentation, testing and maintenance
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
Good understanding of testing at scale, performance and software reliability
Knowledge of one or more scripting languages such as Python and JavaScript
Knowledge of one or more test automation tools such as Selenium, JUnit, Robot Framework, JMeter and Cucumber
Desire and ability to reach out to other teams, visit customers and learn how software is used in a live video production environment
Ability to work and collaborate in a team setting with an open, collaborative communication style
Ability to function in both Windows, Linux and MacOS environments
Preferred qualifications (the following skills are not required but would be considered assets):
Experience with live video production technology – if you have directed a live event, worked with a production switcher, operated a television camera or been in broadcast IT - consider it a bonus (but it is not a requirement for this role)
Experience automating test cases (API level testing and user-level automation
Experience developing automated tests in a distributed environment
Experience in functional testing
Experience utilizing tools and scripts to test and optimize performance
Experience with Docker and VMWare
Intermediate Experience in Linux is an asset
Experience with Git is an asset
Ability and desire to travel – not a requirement for this role but the opportunity may present itself if you enjoy interacting with and learning from your end-users as a product expert
WHY WORK FOR ROSS VIDEO?
Because we can help you flourish. You will get to develop and deliver cutting edge technological solutions for the news and entertainment industry. You will be part of the Ross Video team working together to make that happen, and we find that a pretty energizing environment to be a part of.
We value our people and listen to their feedback. We also offer great perks, flexible hours, free coffee and soft drinks (and a commercial espresso machine for when you need that extra jolt), team building events, BBQs, and other fun activities. You'll also get to work on real-world projects that have a meaningful impact to our customers and are in use all over the world, every day.
WE'RE GROWING FAST
That means we are always looking for better ways to adapt our work environment and processes to meet the high demands of our customers. Our roles morph, we volunteer for extra tasks, we all care a lot about helping good things happen. If you don't like change, you’re in the wrong place. But if you do, then you can be part of an incredible journey.
Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

As a Content Specialist at Ross Video, you will be responsible for creating compelling digital content across all social and digital channels, with heavy focus on blogging

Who you report to: Director, Digital Marketing

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• Be an online storytelling anchor for the Ross brand, ensuring our content has a purpose and quality that people want to save, bookmark, and share.
• Create written content in a variety of forms, including web & landing pages, social content, email, guides, papers, decks, case studies, and videos.
• Help coordinate the marketing content calendar (focused on blog) balancing editorial across thought leadership, product announcements, and customers.
• Weave SEO priorities of inbound marketing into our storytelling practice and incorporate learnings from analytics into the development of content.
• Help refine product messaging, and work with product teams to translate category expertise into blogs, guides, and thought leadership pieces.
• Collaborate with team members to ensure 100% alignment on output.
Who you are:
• 3-5 years 'hands-on' in the following:
• Exceptional writing output.
• Editing and creating content that is highly technical but still compelling.
• Relevant bachelor’s degree or diploma (or evidence you don't need one).
• Strong preference for candidates with agency experience and/or experience in mid-size B2B technology company (hardware or software). Regardless of background, strong understanding of B2B marketing is required.
• Able to work gracefully with senior executives, engineers, product teams, marketing, and business units, locally and internationally.
• Comfortable using a content management system and scheduling tools.
• Search/SEO knowledge is highly desirable.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.
Overview
The Client Delivery Specialist is a key member of the Client Services organization. The Client Delivery Specialist oversees and assists in the planning, delivery, and implementation of Ross Video’s client projects, which have a beginning and specified deliverables. The Client Delivery Specialist is also responsible for ensuring Ross Video’s Superior Customer Experience. The position works in close collaboration with clients, system integrators, Ross Video’s scheduling department, Commissioning & Training Teams, and Global Technical Support to ensure efficient project planning. Further, the position works collaboratively with Inside Sales, Regional Sales Managers, and Solutions Architects throughout all service activities in realizing the very best customer experience.
Duties, Responsibilities & Accountability
Ensure appropriate levels of services and duration, commissioning and training, are sold for client engagements.
Determine what resource type (i.e. Ross Video staff, Ross partner, freelancer) should be assigned to a client engagement.
Maintain project records in relevant ERP, professional services automation, and CRM systems.
Collaborate with Ross Sales Team and client in completing Project Discovery Checklist
Develop a detailed work plan and baseline schedule for the project.
Work with Ross Scheduling Department in determining required Ross resources.
Ensure customer readiness for service deployment.
Conduct an email introduction as part of project kick-off with Ross stakeholders and client.
Monitor the progress of the project and adjust as necessary to ensure the successful completion of the project.
Review the quality of the work completed with the project team on a regular basis to ensure that it meets the project standards.
Review daily and/or weekly status update emails from each of the on-site project resources and makes the necessary interventions, as necessary.
Monitor time reported against time allocated for each deliverable and ensure the project stays within budget.
Close out the project with formal customer acceptance of the deliverables and customer final sign-off.
Provide guidance on and manage the transition from project implementation to Global Technical Support.
Organize post-mortem on any project that fails to meet defined quality and/or financial metrics and provide recommendations and project feedback to affected stakeholder groups.
Perform other duties as required.
Job Requirements:
Knowledge/Experience:
Superior customer skills, including excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to manage multiple assignments, set priorities and ability to adapt to changing conditions.
Strong crisis management skills.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft, Excel, PowerPoint, and exceptional presentation skills.
Working knowledge of Salesforce and Resource Guru is beneficial.
Travel required up to 25%.
Familiar with Ross Video products and solutions, both operationally & technically.
Strong Broadcast industry experience.
Previous experience with managing projects.
Strong organizational and project coordination/management skills.
Analytical problem solver with attention to detail.
Preferred language spoken and written include English, French and Spanish.

HR Representative
Position Overview
Ross Video powers video production for billions of global viewers daily with the industry’s widest range of smart production solutions. We are looking for a dynamic, organized self-starter to join our Human Resources team as HR Representative to support Ross Video’s team in our Rancho Cordova office.
Working closely with all members of the Human Resources team, the HR Representative will not only play a significant role in on-site support to employees based in the Rancho Cordova office but will also be involved in the development and maintenance of HR policies and programs.
Reporting to the Director, Human Resources, your responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
Serve as first point of contact for employee relations issues in the Rancho Cordova office and manufacturing facility by answering questions and resolving employee issues, according to established policies and procedures.
Assist in the implementation of HR programs; these programs could include but are not limited to annual compensation and performance review cycles, talent management initiatives and workforce planning and leadership development training.
Act as local Health & Safety representative; ensure compliance with state and federal H&S regulations including creating and updating policies and procedures, training, documentation and communication with local staff, maintain H&S bulletin boards.
Support the full recruitment life-cycle for all local Manufacturing Production roles, from candidate sourcing to onboarding.
Provide guidance and support on HR policies or processes related to broader US employment legislation and compliance; this could include but is not limited to time and leave policies, governmental compliance reporting submissions, internal or external audits, corporate wide policies that include HR subject matter.
Assist with special HR projects and initiatives as required.
Perform other related duties as required.
Experience & Background
University or college degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or related discipline, and/or equivalent work experience in an HR team.
Minimum 3+ years of HR experience preferably in a high-tech or manufacturing environment.
Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively collaborate with employees and local management team members.
Ability to deal with confidential information with a high degree of diplomacy; ability to build trusted relationships.
Organized and very detail orientated but also able to see the big picture.
Knowledge of US employment related legislation required
Strong-working knowledge of MS-Office package and general computer software; familiarity with Ceridian Dayforce an asset.

We have a world-leading family of robotic cameras and want to push the boundaries regarding control of those cameras to the next level. We want to make our control systems the best in the business and need your help.
We are looking for a software developer to join the Camera Motion Systems team. This role will focus primarily on developing our next generation robot and camera control system based on Ross Video’s industry leading DashBoard platform. However, you should not fear low-level code, motion control, hardware, and mechanical design. You should demonstrate a keen interest in learning about these areas, as a siloed approach does not work well in robotics.
You will be part of a small, multi-disciplined and highly skilled team, where your contributions will be immediately noticed. We strongly encourage end-to-end ownership and there is opportunity for direct customer exposure.

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

• Contribute to the development of our next generation robot and camera control system based on Ross Video’s industry leading DashBoard platform.
• Participate in the full software development lifecycle as part of a multi-disciplinary scrum team
• Perform other related duties as required
• Occasional assisted heavy lifting
• Equipment assembly using hand tools (hex keys, screwdrivers)

• Post-secondary degree in Engineering or Computer Science or related discipline
• Backend development experience with a thorough understanding of object-oriented software design, data structures, algorithms and data storage
• Proven track record in creating and maintaining rich, powerful, and intuitive GUIs
• Programming experience in an object-oriented language such as Java. Knowledge of C# and C/C++ would be an asset
• Web development experience (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, JSON and HTTP protocols)
• Strong software/system analysis and debugging capabilities
• Superior Windows/PC computer skills; above average knowledge of Linux shell environment
• Solid knowledge of IPv4 networking basics (addressing, gateways, firewalls)
• Experience of Eclipse IDE an asset
• Previous experience working in the time-sensitive live broadcast industry is an asset
• Self-starter, quick learner, and detail orientated

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Working in a development team at the Ottawa Research and Development facility, the successful candidate will experience first-hand the highs and lows of real software development while working with customers, top-level developers and managers. Working on the Acuity Series, Production Switchers team; you will be designing, writing, testing and fixing code primarily in C. You will also advise and make recommendations to management on matters relating to software development, in order to provide them with an improved basis for decision making and planning.

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here

What the job is all about:
• Tasks will range from creating custom-built applications to creating new practices and policies

Who you are:
• You enjoy new technical challenges, and are excited at the prospect of writing code for actual, shipping products
• You are a self-starter, happy to take the reins and take initiative
• When you finish something, you're already looking for the next challenge
• You like people. Knowledge is all around you, and you know that finding and talking to the right people is the way to get things done
• You recognize that communication skills are as important as technical skills
• You know how to ask questions - and how to listen to answers.
• You absorb knowledge like a sponge. You're happy to dig through code, track down obscure issues, and solve problems other people haven't
• Experience with embedded software development, networking, and real-time applications
• Experience with developing software with the user experience in mind
• Strong C/C++ programming and troubleshooting skills
• Knowledge of broadcast/live video applications & workflow preferred systems a plus

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.

The Marketing Manager - Products is responsible for the strategy and execution of marketing programs for Ross Video’s Product Lines including product launches. You will work closely with Product Line stakeholders as well as Corporate Marketing, Sales and Services teams to formulate programs, campaigns and content that drive awareness, engagement, and lead generation with Ross’ target audiences.

You will have an established track record working cross-functionally within a business-to-business environment. You will tie strategy to execution by translating program requirements and goals into operational plans, while maintaining a close eye on results

Who you report to: Manager, Marketing – Products & Verticals

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• Work with Product Managers, Regional Marketing, Vertical Marketing, Sales Operations and Sales teams, in addition to the Senior Leadership Team to develop solution- orientated, integrated marketing campaigns ​
• Develop and refine expertise for assigned vertical markets (VM)​
• Develop and refine expertise for assigned product lines (PL)​
• Become a trusted partner to assigned PLs and VMs​
• Own, manage and implement marketing campaigns​
• Be an active and contributing member of the Corporate Marketing team​
• Formally report back on a regular basis to stakeholders on campaign progress​
• Work with Corporate marketing to ensure consistent standards, quality, branding, tone and process adherence across all marketing activities​
• Leverage Corporate Marketing resource to develop world class collateral that helps achieve campaign objectives​
• Work with Ross’ Community Specialist to manage social media for assigned business lines and solutions​
• Develop (along with key stakeholders) an annual marketing plan for assigned Business Leaders and Verticals​
Who you are:
• Marketing / digital marketing degree or diploma or engineering degree / diploma (with appropriate marketing experience)
• 3-5 years’ experience running integrated marketing campaigns in a high technology B2B environment
• Experience in any of the following verticals would be valued: Sports & Live Events, Worship Productions, Internet Protocol, Broadcast or Telecommunication Infrastructure, Live Production, Government, Education and/or Esports
• Experience in marketing Cloud/SaaS based products
• Heightened communication skills; written and oral
• Able to take complex technical details and convey the information to others in an easy-to-understand manner
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Aptitude for technology
• Understanding of target marketing
• Understanding of metrics of success - measuring the success / value of a campaign
• Marketing analytics - Understanding of Marketing ROI
• Expertise with campaign planning (project management), social media tools and CRM (ideally, Salesforce, HubSpot and Bambu)

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Ross Video is a rapidly expanding broadcast industry solutions provider. The Director of Sales for APAC is a key member of the Global Sales leadership team and is directly responsible for driving sales throughout their regions.

In this role, you are responsible for achieving quarterly/annual sales goals, building strategic business relationships, and implementing all sales strategy for their region. This position works closely with the Senior Vice President of Global Sales and is part of the front-line group that works hand in hand with Ross customers and business partners.

Who you report to: Senior Vice President of Global Sales

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, professional development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video team, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• Serve as a key member of the sales leadership team that drives the region’s strategic sales growth.
• Devise and deploy sales goals, strategies and objectives focusing on existing and new business and channel partnerships within their region and contribute to the preparation of sales quotas and budgets.
• Responsible for the overall hiring, motivation, and management of the direct reports in the region. Working with the Senior Vice President of Global Sales, this includes recruitment, mentoring, coaching, and evaluating team members while driving a culture of performance.
• Lead their team to consistently achieve quarterly and annual sales targets by managing a stratified client pipeline to ensure key prospects are identified, prioritized, and pursued to meet financial goals
• Attend trade shows and industry conferences to increase sales through improved levels of product knowledge and further develop industry contacts via networking.
• Participates and contributes to sales opportunities driven by the sales team, including face to face customer meetings and relationship development.
• Report and share information with the Senior Vice President of Global Sales, to ensure they are kept up to date on past, current, and predicted sales performance and customer relations.
• Collaborate with the North America Sales leadership team to develop short- and long-term strategic plans, including the preparation of annual business plans.
• Create training and development plans for direct reports, including contributing to the evolution of the Ross Way To Sell (RWTS), and ensuring the sales team is following RWTS practices.
• Coach Sales Professionals on developing Win Plans. Periodically review Win Plans and aid with closing deals.
• Prepare and deliver high level presentations to television networks, business partners, and industry associations.
• Develop and maintain sales forecasting activities and assist in setting of territory sales goals with integrators and dealers, where applicable.
• Monitors and evaluates the activities and products of the competition by reviewing articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.

Who you are:

• Bachelor’s degree in technology, business administration, marketing, sales, or a related field preferred
• 3+ years of management experience in a sales leadership role
• Strong experience in all aspects of sales, including growth strategies, distribution channel management, account development, and business planning
• Outstanding consultative selling abilities and excellent interpersonal skills at the executive level
• Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills
• Success closing large, complex sales in terms of dollar value and using multiple channels.
• Demonstrated knowledge of accounting and financial practices
• Budgeting and forecasting skills
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Strong business acumen
• High level of proficiency with the Microsoft Office productivity suite
• Understanding of the Broadcast / Media Technology Market (Live Production experience an asset)
• Existing knowledge and use of Ross Video products, or experience selling hardware and software-based technology
• Extensive experience working with CRM’s such as Salesforce.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. At Ross Video, we are Living Live! We are at the cutting edge of live production, powering much of the world’s most compelling content with our smart production solutions. We are looking for a dynamic, results oriented Regional Sales Manager to join our Oceania sales team.

In this role, you will be responsible for proactively and aggressively growing both existing and new business relationships for Ross Video in both Australia and New Zealand either directly or through one of Ross’ designated Channel Partners.

You would work from a home-based office in the region and be supported by our local team in Sydney, Australia and by our regional sales office in Singapore.

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Represent Ross Video with end users and customers and channel resale partners within the region.
• Negotiate and close sales.
• Meet annual, quarterly, and monthly quota targets.
• Build key, long-term relationships with end users by calling on customer facilities directly to promote Ross products and services.
• Engage the Product Managers in regular presentations to customers.
• Deliver sales presentations to clients and re-sellers in the Territory.
• Develop and implement strategic sales plans to accommodate corporate and individual territorial goals.
• Develop and maintain sales forecasting activities and assists in setting of territory sales goals with integrators and dealers, where applicable.
• Perform market analyses to determine customer needs, price schedules, and discount rates.
• Advise and assist end users concerning sales and purchase of Ross Video Product line.
• Assist in directing product marketing to client base to establish Ross Video products in the region.
• Represent company at trade association meetings to promote product.
• Assist in coordination and liaison between sales department and other sales related units.
• Assist other departments within the organization to prepare marketing plans specific to the territory.
• Prepare periodic sales reports showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion.
• Monitor and evaluates the activities and products of the competition.
• Review articles in trade publications to keep abreast of technological developments in types of professional equipment merchandised.
• Ensure the Sales and marketing of Ross products, services and solutions follows the Ross Video code of ethics.
• Assist in resolution of customer issues regarding equipment, supplies, and services.

Who you are:

In the position of Regional Sales Manager, you should have an entrepreneurial spirit. You should have experience and previous success in sales related to live production products, services, and solutions. You will have passionate commitment to customer service and should be prepared to develop business relationships on a face-to-face basis throughout your region. You will have a well-honed ability to communicate compellingly at all levels of an organization both in written and verbal form.

• Experience Selling & Marketing of Live Production Equipment, specifically Production Switchers, Graphic Systems, Robotics, Cameras, Routing Systems, Master Control Systems, Newsroom Systems, Control Systems, and Media Asset Management.
• Familiarity with Key Customers through the territory.
• Strong negotiating skills
• Knowledge of Major Broadcast Transmission Standards
• Solid user of Microsoft Office Products
• Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar Customer Relationship Management tool
• Excellent Communication & Presentation Skills
• Skillful Negotiator
• Lateral Thinker

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. job_title: Software Developer - C++ and QT (Job Req #2021-485)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

As a Software Developer, you will be assigned large task components and you will work closely with the product manager to determine the scope and extent of the needed feature.

You will work on Ross’ line of Video Servers to adapt them to new customer needs and fix issues. Using Visual Studio and/or the LLVM compilers, you will use the latest C++ versions available and add to your experience in designing large software modules independently. How you choose to build your solutions will be largely self-directed. Hash through your ideas and problems with peers while helping them with their issues and ideas.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is about:
• Investigate, specify, design, implement, test, and maintain new features.
• Fix and enhance existing code
• Occasionally dive in and make rapid fixes to solve critical customer issues in a timely manner

Who you are:
• Bachelor Degree in a STEM field of study, or prior job experience in programming
• Exceptional C++ coding skills including all of C, object-oriented programming, integer bit operations, memory management, multi-threading (either C++ native or OS-provided threading), and use of STL templates.
• Familiarity with at least one version control system
• Familiarity with TCP/IP client-server programming
• Excellent written and oral communication skills

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Bachelor Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or similar
• Experience with Qt
• Ability to write in at least one other programming language (Python, C#, Go, etc)
• Embedded/Realtime programming experience
• Experience in the video equipment industry
• Experience using SQLite to store simple project files and user preferences
• Experience using the FFmpeg libraries

Please note: This will be located in our Ottawa office or can be remote work within Canada

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. job_title: Team Lead - Manufacturing Process Support (Job Req # 2022-165)
job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Team Lead – Manufacturing Process Support

This position resides within the PCBA Process Development Group. The group’s primary responsibilities are to support ongoing process management and manufacturing shop floor activities within PCBA production. This position is responsible for leading the process support team, monitoring shop floor activities within PCBA production to ensure processes are adequately defined and are being followed and ensuring that shop floor operators receive the optimum level of support. Attention to detail, ability to work with others and a broad manufacturing process knowledge are key assets for this role

What we offer:

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Leading the PCBA support team to ensure performance metrics for shop floor support are defined, monitored and acted upon. Ensuring the shop floor adheres to PCBA manufacturing processes. Assisting with process implementation projects and monitoring key quality and efficiency reports, ensure measures are implemented on the shop floor to optimizes both the quality and efficiency of PCBA production.
• Continuous engagement with the Production Management team to ensure shop floor performance is being documented, communicated and acted upon appropriately.
• Continuous engagement with the PCBA Process team to ensure any process improvement opportunities are being identified, communicated and implemented efficiently and effectively.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
• Ability to work with technical and non-technical staff.

Who you are:
• Well-organized, persistent, attentive to detail.
• Exceptional English written and verbal communication skill.
• Ability to make choices based on the company’s best interests.
• Must demonstrate the ability to work with several functional areas as well as interact with all levels of management.
• Minimum 5 years experience in an electronics-manufacturing environment that included exposure to manufacturing processes and procedures.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• A technical background is a solid asset.
• Project management experience is considered as an excellent asset

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Our teams put a strong emphasis on clean code and technical excellence. We develop our products with a mission critical mindset, ensuring that quality always comes first.

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Developing and styling a common library of React components
• Creating frameworks and design patterns for front-end platforms
• Interacting with RESTful APIs
• Writing and maintaining unit tests
• Developing and maintaining CI pipelines
• Participating in SCRUM ceremonies and adhering to the Agile methodology
Our current technology stack includes:
• React.js for component development
• Redux for state management
• Webpack for module bundling
• Babel for transpiling
• NPM for in-house and third-party packages
• Lerna for multi-repository management
• SCSS for styling
• Jest for testing

Who you are:
An experienced JavaScript developer who has a strong understanding of modern web technologies. Since our application is primarily developed in React.js, with Redux for state management, we need a senior developer with a solid background in using this framework. We leverage Babel so we can embrace the latest ECMAScript specifications. We follow the Agile methodology, working in 2-week sprints while honouring all SCRUM ceremonies.

All of this said, nothing here is set in stone. We are a dynamic company that will always stay on top of the bleeding edge of technology and best practice. To be successful in our team, you will need to be comfortable adapting to change and keeping up to date with the latest and greatest of the industry. Innovation is key at Ross Video.

This front-line individual is responsible for managing customer expectations, completing required documentation, providing end user operational training, and ensuring integrity of the training experience. This key individual works closely with our Sales and Demonstration Artist Team to ensure delivery of the Ross Superior Customer Experience.

This role is a home-based position.

What the job is all about:
• Perform on-site, off-site, online/remote customer demonstrations
• Assist the XPression Product team with content creation, organization, and technical execution of major trade shows throughout the year
• Set up demo equipment, assist with set-up and prepare/test gear prior to demos
• Advise the Sales and Marketing Product Management (MPM) groups regarding current industry trends and customer feedback
• Maintain above average knowledge base and skill set in the functionality and demonstration of all system features for XPression and XPression Solutions
• Develop XPression demonstration techniques, methods, and materials for use by other demo staff
• Perform on-site, off-site, and online/remote customer training
• Provide internal training for Ross staff
• Maintain training equipment, assist with set-up and prepare/test gear prior to training sessions
• Assist in the development of XPression customer training methods, materials, and techniques
• Provide feedback to the XPression MPM & TPM on XPression operation, features, and roadmap
• Participate in the review process for upcoming software feature lists
• Champion customer needs, notably operational features, roll-out and training methods as well as future feature requirements
• Actively participate in Ross’ user forums, lead key discussions, and assist XPression users
• Maximum 75% international travel is required
• Must have a valid passport and driver’s license

• Post-secondary degree related to television broadcast or appropriate work experience in a broadcast/post/corporate video environment using XPression.
• Minimum of 5 years’ experience in training required
• Excellent communication and presentation skills
• In-depth knowledge of graphic design, production, customer needs and applications
• Experience in the selling and marketing process for broadcast equipment is very useful
• Experience with character generator operational for live events
• Knowledge/experience in Adobe Creative Cloud, Maya/3ds Max, After Effects, Illustrator and/or Cinema 4D, Photoshop, Virtual Set Construction
• Knowledge of use of Ross Video products and a willingness to learn how to demonstrate and train on these products, notably: Streamline & MOS Workflow
• Organized and very detail oriented
• Ability to problem solve and trouble shoot
• Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changing environments

The Primestream/Streamline Software developer is a full-time role, reporting to the Software Manager. The successful candidate will help develop new features in leading edge web technologies for our media asset management systems. From graphics to video production, you'll work with the team to develop systems to organize, manage, search and report on media content being used in all aspects of live broadcast.
There’s a lot of content that goes into live broadcast. From the video packages for news stories, to sports team logos, there is a lot for a facility to organize. Unbelievably, in this age of technology, there are still newsrooms trying to manage their content with tapes and disks! Surely there are better ways to work with your media? That’s where Primestream & Streamline comes in!
Primestream & Streamline are Media Asset Management systems that specializes in content delivery for live broadcast. We provide a central and convenient interface for organizing media, editing metadata, previewing assets, searching for content, order management and fulfillment. We also provide automated workflows for moving content for use on air, cleaning old content and generating reports on a wide range of information. That’s what we do today, but we have a lot more work to do. We need you to help us get there.
We are a team who believe in incremental development and strive for continous improvement with our agile workflow. We know we’re not perfect and as we expect to make mistakes, but also to learn from those mistakes and grow as a result to become stronger, faster and better.
We are highly customer focused as customer satisfaction is our highest priority. If that means jumping on a plane and flying half-way around the world to address an issue, then that’s what we’ll do. We go above and beyond for all of our clients – big and small.
We believe in technical excellence and want to create craftspeople as opposed to developers and testers. We think that following best practices, such as TDD, clean code, adhering to SOLID design principles, clean architecture, test automation, and high levels of collaboration among the team produces the most maintainable and extendable applications.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

Who you are:
• You have a post secondary degree in Computer Science, or other relevant Engineering discipline.
• Minimum of 5 years experience full stack software development, full life cycle in an agile environment.
• Knowledge and experience with Java, JavaScript, jQuery, HTML, CSS, Jetty, Ajax, Eclipse, OSGi, Struts, and Hibernate, React, Redux, NPM, Webpack, and Jest.
• Experience with Test Driven Design, Behavior Driven Design, Domain Driven Design, Java Design Patters, and SOLID principals of Object Oriented design and implementation.
• Knowledge and experience with unit testing and test automation.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Experience with one or more of cloud platforms: AWS, Azure, or Google Web Platform.
• Knowledge of professional broadcast equipment in television standards.
• Familiar with Git code revision system.

Manufacturing NPI Program Manager

As a Manufacturing NPI Program Manager, you will oversee the execution of NPI projects and activities while helping to successfully launch new products and implement changes to existing products and services.

Collaborating across various departments within Ross Video you will help organize the transfer of technology from R&D into Manufacturing and assist in building a more scalable and efficient product launch program. Solid organizational skills and an attention to detail will be necessary to drive multiple simultaneous NPI implementations quickly and accurately.

The role requires technical knowledge of printed circuit boards and mechanical assemblies but also requires an individual who can manage professional relationships and drive activities to completion.

Who you report to:
You will report directly to the Director, Manufacturing NPI and work alongside experts in manufacturing and R&D.

What we offer:
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Ensure manufacturing readiness for new products by initiating and monitoring the progress of required NPI activities such as: DFM analysis, SMT readiness, Production Routing, Manufacturing Instructions, Manufacturing Test Readiness, Training, Part Procurement, Planning, and Part Disposition
• Monitor for new ECO’s (engineering change orders) and then coordinate their implementation
• Ensure individuals and teams across departments are properly informed about NPI progress and product related issues, helping to keep NPI activities on schedule
• Drive, direct and track activities related to NPI and Change Management
• Create reports showing the progress, status, and issues with the various ongoing NPI activities
• Create structures such as processes, checklists, and KPI’s to standardize, monitor and then improve the NPI activities
• Work with the Configuration Management team to improve our CM guidelines and ensure all ECO’s are adherent
• Engage the R&D teams to better understand their needs and coordinate the necessary manufacturing activities throughout the product design phase and release
• Organize various readiness reviews and coordinate any necessary meetings to promptly resolve issues
• During prototype and pre-production lifecycle phases monitor for R&D build requests and work with production on prioritizing scheduling

Who you are:
• Post-secondary education, preferably an engineering degree (Electrical, Mechanical, or Industrial)
• Knowledge of product lifecycle management and product development phases
• Knowledge of configuration and change management systems and best practices
• In-depth knowledge of manufacturing processes, procedures, and best practices
• Understanding of printed circuit boards, surface mount technology and mechanical assemblies
• Education or training on project/program management
• Well organized, prepared, persistent, and detail oriented
• Capable of managing several complex and competing tasks
• Ability to interact with all levels of management.
• 10+ years of professional experience in a manufacturing or a high-tech environment
• 5+ years managing simultaneous projects and activities
• Creating detailed status reports and possessing excellent presentation skills
• Experience with MES, PLM, and MRP/ERP systems

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Able to independently problem solve and resolve issues
• Capable of comfortably working with a variety of personalities
• Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills

The Senior Hardware FPGA Designer role will utilize the latest FPGA and SoC devices to develop leading edge platforms that power live video production. As a senior designer within the Hyperconvergered Solutions team, you will further advance the Ross industry leading A/V infrastructure products including, Ultrix, the ultimate connectivity platform. Successful candidates will have serious technical chops to pair with a “find a way” attitude in order to harness the full power of themselves and their teammates in solving unique and challenging technical problems in a supportive, high-energy and dynamic work environment.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• Promote, refine and develop innovative features that you are passionate about in the most integrated hardware platform in the broadcast industry.
• Implement video transport protocols in FPGA designs including SDI and SMPTE 2110
• Implement complex RTL algorithms for the processing of audio and video
• Create complete IO ring designs for Stratix-10/Ultriscale+ FPGAs to verify pin-outs and IP in Quartus and Vivado
• Develop high-level design requirements, manage/negotiate key part selection, and support aggressive project scheduling
• Generate both specification & design documentation to support cross functional team
• Develop test features that can be utilized by manufacturing test, product verification and in the field
• Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of FPGA & HW designs
• Efficient and systematic debugging skills.
• Assist in supporting other staff members as necessary through entire NPI process flow – including design, documentation, test, presales and customer service

Who you are:
• Passionate team-player looking to expand their skillset and contribute in a fast-paced environment
• Possess keen observational skills and problem-solving intuition
• Self-starter with the tenacity to bring product to market
• Comfortable moving forward aggressively while balancing risks appropriately to optimize success across all business & technical aspects of the product
• Senior level FPGA designer with knowledge and experience across broad range of topics including:
• FPGA building blocks & system architectures
• High speed transceivers, clock domain analysis, & timing closure
• You are an expert in RTL design for complex IP targeting large Xilinx or Altera FPGA SOC.
• Expertise in current Xilinx & Intel devices and associated design and debugging tools
• Knowledge of high-speed serial interfaces using gigabit transceivers, DDR3/4 interfaces, HBM, and PLL’s
• Excellent debugging skills & proficient with typical lab equipment (scopes, JBERTs, network analyzers, WFMs, etc)
• Ability to work in an embedded environment. Linux, bash, C/C++ and networking skills a plus

Bonus points if you have the following:

• Knowledge of broadcast studio applications & workflows; especially distribution / production systems a plus
• Understanding of digital video and associated audio standards a plus
• Familiar with video broadcast standards such as SDI, AES, Timecode, Madi, Tri-level syncs.
• Familiar with high-speed serial interfaces such as SDI, 10/40 GigE, Ethernet, PCIe
• Signal Integrity knowledge a plus
• Ability to develop schematics and support detailed board layout for designs (frequently contributing directly to technical decisions relating to signal integrity, density, fabrication constraints, and thermal considerations)
• Experience designing video processing algorithms such as filters. video codecs (H264, H265, MPEG2), color space conversion, scaling, etc.

Be part of a cross-functional team that is designing, developing and testing distributed, scalable and highly available applications, tools and services that tie together live video production technology across multiple locations. We are building software that will revolutionize the industry by leveraging a move to distributed architecture and cloud-based infrastructure. As part of this, we are seeking a Product Verification Specialist to drive product quality and ensure all software components provide a reliable, user-friendly and performant experience for our customers. The successful candidate will be obsessed with quality improvement and automated tests for regression and new features.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Develop a comprehensive test plan and test cases based on new product features, customer requirements or identified problems
• Identify test scenarios that are critical and repetitive and automate them
• Report bugs with quality descriptions and work closely with the development team to see through and verify fixes
• Develop integration tests in collaboration with other product teams to ensure interoperability and a smooth end-to-end workflow for end-users
• Support ongoing software development efforts which means participating in Agile based SDLC – requirements gathering, scoping, design, implementation, documentation, testing and maintenance

Who you are:
• Good understanding of testing at scale, performance and software reliability
• Knowledge of one or more scripting languages such as Python and JavaScript\
• Knowledge of one or more test automation tools such as Selenium, JUnit, Robot Framework, JMeter and Cucumber
• Desire and ability to reach out to other teams, visit customers and learn how software is used in a live video production environment
• Ability to work and collaborate in a team setting with an open, collaborative communication style
• Ability to function in both Windows, Linux and MacOS environment

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Experience with live video production technology – if you have directed a live event, worked with a production switcher, operated a television camera or been in broadcast
• Experience automating test cases (API level testing and user-level automation)
• Experience developing automated tests in a distributed environment
• Experience in functional testing
• Experience utilizing tools and scripts to test and optimize performance
• Experience with Docker and VMWare
• Intermediate Experience in Linux is an asset
• Experience with Git is an asset
• Ability and desire to travel – not a requirement for this role but the opportunity may present itself if you enjoy interacting with and learning from your end-users as a product expert

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Who you report to: Director of Product Operations

Maximizing the value of our products, resulting from the work of the scrum team. The Product Owner will be the main point of contact for the product team and will provide the product line monthly report in R&D sync meetings.
You’ll be managing the product backlog for a specific release, creating and reviewing product backlog items and working day-to-day with the scrum team. You will collaborate with product management on the best way to achieve the product vision and goals. You’ll work with target customers to validate your ideas and create excellent solutions that will change the way productions are made.

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Collaboration
• Work with Product Management to ensure a deep understanding of the release goals/themes and product vision. Work together to define and monitor KPIs that indicate how the product investment is delivering value.
• Work day-to-day with the scrum team to support the delivery of the product. Responsibilities include: managing the product backlog, creating and reviewing user stories and acceptance criteria with the team, creating epics and story maps, defining sprint goals, capturing feature requests and enhancements
• Work with customers and end users to fully understand the problem space and revise existing features to better align with their needs
• Provide feedback and suggestions to the Product Manager on their product roadmap, future release plans and product direction
• Participate in all scrum activities as a including: leading backlog refinement, participating in retrospectives and planning, daily stand-ups, defining definition of done
• Participate in cross-team planning activities and track cross-team dependencies/commitments
• Work with subject matter experts to ensure a quality product, including: Architects, Quality Assurance Experts, Test Automation Experts
• Innovation, Design and Specification
• Develop and prototype innovative approaches to solving existing and emerging problems. Perform user acceptance testing as needed.
• Create product specification documentation to support the development team in delivering products that address customer needs and achieve the product vision, including: mockups, interaction designs, information architecture and data models
• Continuously participate in customer feedback sessions and research, both before and after feature implementation
• Create user experience artifacts to aid the scrum team in keeping the user top of mind: scenarios, user stories, personas, use cases etc.
• Work closely with User Experience Design team to create mockups and interaction designs for new features that are inline with Ross standards
• Decision Making
• Maintains the priority of the items in the release backlog, including user stories, bugs, tech support escalations to maximize the value of the product, while staying aligned with the vision and strategy
• Makes day-to-day business vs technical trade-off decisions in tandem with the Technical Product Lead.
• Stakeholder Management and Communication
• Regularly reporting on progress towards sprint and release goals to product management, dependent R&D teams, R&D and executives
• Explain and regularly communicate the rationale behind the priority of items in the product backlog to all release stakeholders
• Ensure customer stakeholders, both internal and external, are informed when priorities change or risks emerge
• Facilitate bi-weekly sprint reviews, collect and solicit feedback and capture changes in product backlog

Who you are:
• Post-secondary degree or trade school diploma
• Understanding of Agile principles, practices and ceremonies
• Solid understanding of the role and value of a product owner
• Experience with backlog prioritization, user story development
• Excellent communication skills, written and verbal
• Ability to work well with remote team members
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Proficient in Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Visio
• Proficient with Jira
• Experience working as a product owner in a technology company delivering solutions to the technology market
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
• Able to work co-operatively with and across all company departments
• High Tolerance of Ambiguity

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Ability to work with asset management systems is a plus
• Software development experience is an asset
• Broadcast production experience is desired
• Experience with 5+ product releases as product owner or 10+ product releases working as an Agile delivery team member is preferred
• Passionate about Ross Video & our products

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.
