We are seeking a talented individual with experience in Automated Production Control to join our worldwide business development team. This dynamic individual works to build on Ross Video’s market position as the world leader in all live event and broadcast markets.

The ideal Business Development Manager (BDM) for Production Workflow is a global expert for Automated Production Control opportunities, with a unique market focus on the United States, specifically broad news workflow and asset management opportunities.

The Business Development Manager role is expected to achieve financial growth and grow market share, define long-term strategic goals, build key customer relationships, identify business opportunities, and work closely with the sales team to negotiate, and close business deals. The successful candidate will develop geographic specific strategies with the Directors of Sales, Regional Sales Managers, and the Vice President, Production Workflow & Cloud Services. This strategy will provide a regional focus and encompass approaches for live event production across all platforms. The person will also provide technical and workflow related feedback directly to the Product Specialist Team to ensure solution fit for current and future opportunities.

Who you report to: Vice President, Production Workflow & Cloud Services

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Develop, execute, and manage business development efforts for Ross Video’s products for Automated Production Control worldwide, and news workflow opportunities in the United States.
• Works directly with Ross Corporate Marketing, to develop Automated Production Control (OverDrive) platforms marketing material for web, press, presentations etc.
• Provide sales support to the sales team internationally to:
• negotiate and close sales
• prepare RFP/RFQ or bid responses.
• prepare application diagrams and descriptions for sales opportunities
• deliver sales presentations to clients and re-sellers
• build relationships with end users by calling on customer facilities directly to promote Ross Production Workflow solutions.
• Monitor and evaluate the activities and products of the competition to Provide valuable feedback to the product development team.
• Work directly with Product Development Team to prepare and maintain competitive analysis documentation for the product line and other collateral documents as required.
• Actively work with Product Marketing Teams to tailor messaging and implement marketing strategy specific to live event and content creation for customers
• Participate in partner events, and several tradeshows association meetings throughout the year
• Prepare and deliver sales training
• Prepare and deliver dealer training
• Work in tandem with the various product specialist(s) to deliver outstanding high-level demonstrations and to develop the best sales strategy for each opportunity.
• Meet monthly/annual orders targets.
• Build relationships with prospects and customers by calling on customer facilities either directly or alongside sales managers to promote Ross Production Workflow Solutions for APC
• Leverage existing relationships with clients and resellers to promote OverDrive and other Production Workflow solutions.
• Seek out, develop, and maintain relationships with 3rd-party solutions in partnership with the Product Management team to generate minimal-effort - run rate product revenue.
• Advise and assist end users, re-sellers, and system integrators concerning sales and purchase of APC solutions.
• Facilitate Ross Solution Road shows, training events, and other user activities in cooperation with other Ross’s stakeholders.
• Develop and Maintain solutions Sales forecasting with the sales team to achieve sales goals.
• Prepare periodic sales reports showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion.
• Assist in resolution of customer complaints regarding equipment, supplies, and services.

Who you are:
• Experience in news environment is required
• Familiarity with Systems and Workflows specific to the Automated Production Control Solutions market
• Knowledge of Automated workflows
• Knowledge of Process and Operational Workflows at Live event facilities
• Maintain a cursory knowledge of all Ross Video Products
• Demonstrable comfort being customer facing in a hybrid role that is both technical and sales related
• Strong organizational and orchestration skills
• Excellent communication and presentation skills
• Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
• Speak & write fluently minimum two languages, English is mandatory

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Experience with Ross solutions

PIERO – Software Developer (3D Graphics) Job Description
WHAT IS PIERO?
PIERO is an award-winning sports analysis tool from Ross Video. PIERO’s systems use image recognition or encoded camera heads to overlay tactical graphics on sports content. PIERO brings new angles to every game, on the screen and in the studio, with visually engaging and informative effects.
PIERO’s graphical analysis can be seen in use by some of the world’s leading sports broadcasters, as well as being used for tactical analysis by some of the world’s most recognizable sports clubs & organizations. It applies industry-leading graphics to more than 20 of the world’s major sports.
WHAT’S IN THE JOB?
We are a development team currently transitioning to a fully Agile workflow and believe in incremental development and continual improvement. Customer satisfaction, quality and innovation are our top priorities.
While we have individual specialties, we are all full stack developers. Some of the languages and technologies we work with today include Java, C++, OpenGL, GIT and Jira.
We’re embarking on an exciting and ambitious 2021 roadmap for PIERO, with enhanced 3D graphics and features key to our plans. We’re looking for a 3D graphics developer, that can bring our ambitions to fruition, as we solidify Piero as the leader in its field.
We believe in technical excellence and want to create craftspeople as opposed to developers and testers. We think that following best practices, such as clean code, clean architecture, and high levels of collaboration among the team produces the most maintainable and extendable applications.
Requirements:
Degree in software engineering (with programming modules).
Java object orientated programming.
Knowledge & experience of 3D real time graphics.
Desirable skills: C++, GIT, mathematical qualifications, OpenGL, Unreal Engine, Machine Learning/Neural Networks, CUDA, building RESTful APIs, working in broadcasting environment.
Experience working in an Agile development environment.
Excellent problem solving and debugging skills.
Knowledge & experience of working with video compression & codecs.
Ability to multi-task and prioritize effectively.
Excellent communications skills.
Versatility and eagerness to learn.
Our roles morph, we volunteer for extra tasks, we all care a lot about helping to make good things happen.
WHY WORK WITH US?
We can help you flourish. You will get to develop and deliver innovative technological solutions for the entertainment industry. You will be part of the Ross Video family, working in harmony to make that happen. We offer flexible working & working from home patterns, within a relaxed working environment.
We value our team members, listen to their feedback and you'll get to work on real-world projects that have a meaningful impact to our customers and are in use all over the world, every day. We think that’s a pretty energizing environment.

This position based in Rancho Cordova, CA, focuses on assisting in the successful installation of D3 LED displays and providing a wide range of mechanical, electrical, electronics and control system on site technical support. Providing top-level system troubleshooting, electronics repair and testing. Assisting, interacting, and collaborating with systems technician, production, and project management team members to assure successful project completion. Check for common problems such as defective manufacturing or loose connections, refer to schematics and specifications to locate malfunction; electronics repair, and testing; document services performed; crimp connector terminals; assemble discrete wiring and harnesses, soldering components using hand and wave soldering techniques. Methodical approach to all intended tasks and approach to problem solving is necessary. Self-starter spirit with naturally strong rapport with customers and subcontractor trades will be highly valued.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Provide on-site and/or remote technical support including tasks such as system troubleshooting, electronics repair and testing.
• Install operating systems and video equipment for LED displays and performing commissioning procedures to ensure proper system functionality.
• Ability to manage and monitor all installed systems and infrastructure
• Competency in writing and maintaining custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower downtime due to required human intervention
• Work alongside the team to help design information and operational support systems
• Assist Project Manager in physical installation, operator training and technical support of LED Display
• Coordination with various disciplined subcontractors as necessary during installation and supplemental maintenance visits
• Monitor and test performance of applications, foreseeing potential issues and identifying possible solutions
• Ability to work with developers to implement those fixes
• Excellence in communication as a liaison with vendors and other IT personnel to resolve issues
• Perform other duties as needed and directed by Field Service Manager.
• This is a fast-moving position with a high expectation to execute industry best service of top quality and the highest level of tech innovation using exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

Who you are:
• Associates degree or higher in a technician, electrical engineering, computer technology or mechatronics-based field of study or 3+ years relevant experience in a related field.
• Advanced computer hardware and networking knowledge.
• Proven ability to monitor systems successfully and efficiently
• Must be able to take direction and work with minimal supervision and guidance in a fast paced and at times pressure packed environment.​
• Proven working experience in the above fields including installing, configuring, and troubleshooting UNIX /Linux based environments
• Experienced with reading and interpreting blueprints, construction drawings and schematics.
• Working knowledge and experience Microsoft Office tools, specifically Excel, Word, Project, and Visio.
• Valid driver's license and passport with ability to travel locally and worldwide on short notice via air or ground.
• Able to work from a ladder, at various heights, including on aerial platforms and carry tools/ladder/parts to and from work site.
• Required to bend, reach, lift and use hands, vision and hearing to perform essential on site and troubleshooting tasks.

Bonus points if you have the following:
• 2 years or greater of technician experience, preferably (but not required) within the electronics industry.
• Experience with use of Multi-meter required, soldering and fiber termination skills a plus.

Background Screening

Please note, certain positions at Ross Video are subject to background screening. If you are the successful candidate, you may be required to undergo a background check that may include employment verification, criminal records check, drug testing, credit checks, and motor vehicle records check for applicable roles.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Manufacturing Engineering Specialist

This position resides within the PCBA Process Development Group. The group’s primary responsibilities are to support ongoing change management and manufacturing shop floor activities within PCBA production. This position is responsible for ensuring the quality and accuracy of our procedures, work instructions and product through consulting with technical owners and shop floor personnel, scheduled audits, and quality data metrics. Attention to detail, ability to work with others and a broad manufacturing process knowledge are key assets for this role.

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

Some of the things you will work on:

Developing and maintain PCBA manufacturing processes, whilst managing our process implementation projects; including the review and acquisition of capital assets. You will perform regular audits of the Manufacturing Execution System (MES) including BOM’s, drawing and work instruction completeness and accuracy. Creating and maintenance of procedures as well as providing training to shop floor employees on new processes in both classroom and manufacturing settings. Daily responsibilities also include monitoring quality data, troubleshooting and performing corrective action as appropriate. Partnering with our R+D and NPI teams to ensure PCBA manufacturing processes are developed for future production needs. Other duties may be assigned.

Ideally, you will have most of the following:

Post-secondary education or equivalent work experience in a manufacturing environment, with experience creating and maintaining manufacturing work instructions and procedures.

Experience with Quality and Corrective Action processes and with MES is an asset. Advanced skill level with standard office tools (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook) and Microsoft Project and:
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team
• Ability to work with technical and non-technical staff
• Well-organized, persistent, attentive to details and accuracy
• Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills
• Ability to make choices based on the company’s best interests
• Must demonstrate the ability to work with several functional areas as well as interact with all levels of management.
• Minimum 5 years experience in an electronics-manufacturing environment that included exposure to manufacturing processes and procedures.
Bonus points if you have the following:
• A technical background is a solid asset
• Prior experience programming SMT, MES and related software.
• Valid Driver’s License and access to a vehicle for occasional travel to Ottawa location
• Ability to lift 50 lbs.
Work Environment: Office and manufacturing shop floor, Moderate Noise

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. Overview:
Reporting to the Manager, Creative Services, the successful candidate will be responsible for the
execution of and/or participation in Ross Creative and Professional Services activities, by
providing services for the design, creation, and implementation of Voyager Unreal projects,
XPression real-time graphics and graphics packages.

This position is located in our Sydney office or a home-based office setting, if mutually agreed
upon.

Duties, Responsibilities and Accountability:
Graphic Design:
• Design templates and animations from scratch, using native XPression tools and 3rd-party
graphics applications such as Cinema 4D and Adobe Suite.
• Design and build Voyager Unreal Engine AR and VR graphics.
• Create packages that conform to standardized workflows outlined by the Manager

Automation:
• Ensures appropriate automation hooks are created for outside control.
• Utilize XPression Visual Logic and scripting for automated, dynamic templates.
• Setup XPression Datalinq to pull in external data feeds and interface with external data
aggregation systems.
• Use Ross Dashboard to create manual user interface panels and backup solutions for
XPression automated graphics.

On-site Implementation:
• Responsible for implementation and integration of graphics packages at customer’s sites,
as required.

Administrative:
• Attends meetings and conference calls as required to scope, complete, or otherwise
facilitate successful completion of assigned projects as they relate to the job.
• Work with other creative and professional service members to institute a consistent and
standardized workflow solution.

Documentation:
• Works with Ross team members to create style and operational guides for end users.
• Document any custom scripting methodologies to ensure future support from Ross.
• May be required to create project style-guides of assets.

Job Requirements:
Knowledge/Education/Training:
• Post-secondary degree or trade school diploma
• Advanced knowledge of Adobe creative suite
• Advanced knowledge of Cinema 4D and Redshift renderer knowledge a plus
• Intermediate knowledge of IT workflows
• Intermediate computer programming experience in VB, SQL, and/or JAVA is desirable
• Proficient in Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint
• Proficient knowledge of Unreal Engine a plus

Experience:
• Minimum 2-5 years production experience in broadcast (studio or remote) or sport venue
• Minimum 2-5 years of graphic design experience.
• Proficient knowledge of broadcast graphics workflows

Traits:
• Organized and very detail orientated
• Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
• Excellent communication skills
• Aptitude for animation and choreography of movement
• Strong interpersonal and observational skills
• High tolerance of ambiguity
• Team-oriented, and able to work co-operatively with Ross and end users
• Enthusiastic problem solver

Other:
• Willing to travel on a project-by-project basis up to 50% of the time
• Valid Passport

Physical Demands:
• Occasional requirement to set-up equipment – involves lifting up to 50 lbs, reaching,
bending, stooping, etc

Work Environment:
• Home based or Ross Sydney Office

Reporting to the Manager, Product Management and Business Development, this exciting role combines product management, product marketing and sales support.

As a product manager, you will take complete ownership of a product line consisting of Virtual Graphics solutions. Ross is a worldwide leader in broadcast graphics, and we want you to help us grow our leadership position by winning more customers and penetrating new market segments.

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

Product Management
• Lead the product, taking complete ownership of all direct product decisions and influencing external factors which are key to the success of the product.
• Identify / assess significant business opportunities, and drive product vision, strategies and roadmaps in the context of broader organizational strategies and goals.
• Incorporate data, research and market analysis to inform product strategies and roadmaps, in cooperation with Technical Product Manager / Senior Director of Product Management / VP of Graphics
• Lead and motivate a team of engineers and other cross-functional representatives.
• Capture of market / customer requirements.
• Product specification and generation of Epics for refinement by Product Owners / Technical Product Managers
• Assess and document market requirements including impact analysis and competitive benchmarking.
• Create pricing strategies & maintain price books accordingly.
• Produce and maintain configuration and ordering guides
Product Marketing
• Drive comprehensive go-to-market strategy including production of sales and partner materials in conjunction with marketing team.
• Oversee the development of promotional literature (brochures, cut sheets, etc.)
• Participate and oversee the creation of the following: ads, catalog, website content, blogging, success stories, press releases, product packaging and white papers.
• Participate in look and feel of manuals
• Oversee the creation and supervision of show reels & training videos
• Oversee demo content and tradeshow kit supervision
• Prepare sales and dealer information packages
• Plan for key trade shows and internal events (IBC, NAB, GRASPP, etc.)
• Develop and implement key marketing initiatives related to the product
Sales Support
• Responsibility for sales results and influencing increased sales in the product line
• Provide Sales training and Dealer training
• Travel to support key onsite customer demos and presentations, attending key tradeshows, and travel to different territories to assess unique needs of the region
• Work with Directors of Sales to create regional sales strategies
• Key customer liaison for all managed products
Other responsibilities
• Provide regular product forecast updates to manufacturing
• Initiation of and participation in product brainstorming sessions/surveys
• Keep the engineering department up-to date with industry and customer trends
• Work with platform team on new system development and maintenance of existing platforms, in cooperation with Technical Product Manager
• Build and maintain strategic partnerships that may help augment the product’s functionality, feature set, and provide complete solutions for customers

Who you are:
• Post- secondary education in a related field
• 5+ years of experience product managing / marketing a line of broadcast graphics product
• Solid understanding of virtual / augmented reality technologies
• Experience with broadcast & IT Systems
• Excellent knowledge of live production environments
• Familiarity with software development processes
• Superior analytical skills with strong skills in financial modeling and pricing strategies
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
• A keen eye for detail

Bonus points if you have the following:
• Fluency in Spanish.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

As the Principal Technical Lead, you are the technical leader for your product or products. You plan and oversee the development of solutions to allow our customers to achieve or exceed their business goals. In this technical role you are responsible and accountable for the implementation and quality of the products under your purview. You craft the architecture and design of your product to meet product goals in alignment with the practices and principals of our Senior Software Architects; you oversee the implementation to ensure architectural and code consistency; you ensure that best practices are being employed, all the while making certain that quality and security are primary considerations.
You coach, mentor, guide, and help nurture the development team (developers and testers) to realize its full potential and adopt our culture of technical excellence and continuous improvement.

Who you will report to: Director Technical Product Management

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Own the product development, from understanding the customers’ needs to supporting it in the field, and everything in between.
• Develop the best solutions for your customers.
• Interface with Tech Support to understand and resolve issues found in deployed software instances.
• Define vision and strategy for technical implementation of your products.
• Work with the Product Managers and Product Owners to understand customer requirements and ensure we are delivering the right things.
• Reduce the number of issues found by customers by promoting a preventative vs reactionary approach to development and testing.
• Create a culture of technical excellence within the team.
• Work with other teams to align on strategy, deliver solutions, tools, processes, and reuse where it makes sense.
• Work with the Product Owner to establish predictability in release dates and scope.
• Ensuring quality of releases, through proactive and preventative measures.
• Ensuring product meets corporate security standards.
• Ensuring team adherence to the DoD.
• Working with architects to ensure cross-product alignment.
• Driving a culture of innovation and capturing Ross Intellectual Property (trade secrets, patents, and copyright) throughout the development cycle.
• Identifying, prioritizing, and planning technical debt reduction.
• Managing the introduction of 3rd party and FOSS software.
• Identifying, documenting, submitting, and defending audits for government R&D tax incentives.
• Mentoring and coaching staff on best practices for achieving clean architecture and clean code.

Who you are:
• You have the ability to design complex, efficient, and high-quality systems under pressure
• You are and effective leader, technical coach, and mentor.
• You are fluent in clean architectural design; are versed in Domain Driven Design concepts; you know and employ the SOLID principles of OO design.
• You know and espouse the value of test automation.
• You know how to debate passionately and make objective decisions.
• You work collaboratively with others and facilitate groups.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We are looking for a software developer to join the Camera Motion Systems team. In our group, software work goes right from bare metal up to the control GUI. This role will focus primarily on the SmartShell software stack. However, you should not fear low-level code, motion control, hardware, and mechanical design. You should demonstrate a keen interest in learning about these areas, as a siloed approach does not work well in robotics.

We have a world-leading family of robotic cameras and want to push the boundaries regarding control of those cameras to the next level with regard to ease of use and complexity of function. We want to make our control systems the best in the business and need your help. You will be part of a small, multi-disciplined and highly skilled team, where your contributions will be immediately noticed. As a member of the robotics development team, you will be guiding and shaping the design, development and delivery of products used in live video production. We strongly encourage end-to-end ownership and there is lots of opportunity for direct customer exposure.

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Develop our next generation robot and camera control system based on Ross Video’s industry leading DashBoard platform.
• Develop features requested by customers in the existing SmartShell control system
• Perform other related duties as required.

Who you are:
• Proven track record in creating and maintaining rich, powerful, and intuitive GUIs
• Programming experience is required. You will encounter C# and Java in this role. You might even see some C++/C…
• Knowledge of event-based programming would be an asset.
• Strong software/system analysis and debugging capabilities.
• Superior Windows/PC computer skills; above average knowledge of Linux shell environment. Solid knowledge of IPv4 networking basics (addressing, gateways, firewalls).
• Previous experience working in or closely with a development group is an asset.
• Previous experience working in the time-sensitive live broadcast industry is an asset.
• Good knowledge of at least one modern UI framework
• Self-starter, quick learner, and detail orientated

The ideal candidate with work with the software team to create world-leading next generation broadcast video processing technology. They will also work closely with the hardware designers to participate in the design of new products, the improvement of existing products and help to diagnose and resolve customer issues.

What we offer
Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.
Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!
Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:

• Promote, refine and develop innovative features that you are passionate about for advanced video and IP embedded systems
• Develop schematics and support detailed board layout for designs (frequently contributing directly to technical decisions relating to signal integrity, density, fabrication constraints, and thermal considerations)
• Create complete IO ring designs for Stratix-10/Ultriscale+ FPGAs to verify pin-outs and IP in Quartus and Vivado
• Familiarity basic circuit design and DC power design
• Develop high-level design requirements, manage/negotiate key part selection, and support aggressive project scheduling
• Generate both specification & design documentation to support cross functional team
• Develop test features that can be utilized by manufacturing test and product verification, and in the field
• Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of FPGA & HW designs
• Efficient and systematic debugging skills.
• Assist in supporting other staff members as necessary through entire NPI process flow – including design, documentation, test, presales and customer service

Who you are:

Knowledge/Education/Training:
• Senior level HW design knowledge and experience across broad range of topics including:
a. Power trees, video and audio circuit design & system architectures
b. High speed transceivers, clocking and reset analysis
• Familiarity with development languages used in FPGA design – Verilog, System Verilog, TCL scripting
• Expertise in current Xilinx & Intel devices
• Knowledge of high-speed serial interfaces using gigabit transceivers, DDR3/4 interfaces, HBM, and PLL’s
• Excellent debugging skills & proficient with typical lab equipment (scopes, JBERTs, network analyzers, WFMs, etc.)
Traits:
• Sound interpersonal skills with ability to work as part of a team or independently as required
• Keen observational skills and problem-solving intuition
• Self-starter with the tenacity to bring product to market
• Ability to learn new concepts quickly and work towards finding creative solutions to challenging problems
• Comfortable iterating designs: balancing risks appropriately to optimize success across all business aspects – good, fast, and cheap
• Equally comfortable contributing as a team member or championing an idea with management
Experience:

• Minimum 5 years HW development experience with expertise in FPGAs and Video/Audio technologies preferred

Bonus Points if you have the following:

• Ability to work in an embedded environment. Linux, bash, C/C++ and networking skills is a plus
• Knowledge of broadcast studio applications & workflow preferred; especially distribution / production systems is a plus
• Understanding of digital video and associated audio standards a plus
• Signal Integrity knowledge is a plus

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Policy
At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team.
company_seo_description: For XPression and Voyager customers in video, broadcast, and venue production, Rocket Surgery offers unmatched design, workflow, and data integration expertise because having Ross Video as our parent company gives us exclusive insight, input, and influence into its advanced systems.
company_description: Powering video productions for billions of global viewers, using the industry’s widest range of smart production solutions.

job_description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

What we offer

Ross offers competitive salaries and comprehensive health plans, as well as several perks to help you perform at your best.

Some of these perks include flexible hours, generous paid time off, fitness/wellness allowance, employee share ownership program, development support and a ton of fun social activities and events!

Best of all, you will be part of the Ross Video family, and we’ve got a pretty energizing environment here.

What the job is all about:
• Promote, refine and develop innovative features that you are passionate about in the most integrated hardware platform in the broadcast industry.
• Develop schematics and support detailed board layout for designs (frequently contributing directly to technical decisions relating to signal integrity, density, fabrication constraints, and thermal considerations)
• Create complete IO ring designs for Stratix-10/Ultriscale+ FPGAs to verify pin-outs and IP in Quartus and Vivado
• Familiarity with basic circuit design and DC power design
• Implement video transport protocols in FPGA designs including SDI and SMPTE 2110
• Develop high-level design requirements, manage/negotiate key part selection, and support aggressive project scheduling
• Generate both specification & design documentation to support cross functional team
• Develop test features that can be utilized by manufacturing test and product verification, and in the field
• Work with other members of the team to verify the functionality of FPGA & HW designs
• Efficient and systematic debugging skills.
• Assist in supporting other staff members as necessary through entire NPI process flow – including design, documentation, test, presales and customer service

Who you are:
• Senior level HW & FPGA design knowledge and experience across broad range of topics including:
• FPGA building blocks & system architectures
• High speed transceivers, clock domain analysis, & timing closure
• Fluent in development languages used in FPGA design – Verilog, System Verilog, TCL scripting
• Expertise in current Xilinx & Intel devices and associated design and debugging tools
• Knowledge of high-speed serial interfaces using gigabit transceivers, DDR3/4 interfaces, HBM, and PLL’s
• Excellent debugging skills & proficient with typical lab equipment (scopes, JBERTs, network analyzers, WFMs, etc.)
• Sound interpersonal skills with ability to work as part of a team or independently as required
• Keen observational skills and problem-solving intuition
• Self-starter with the tenacity to bring product to market
• Ability to learn new concepts quickly and work towards finding creative solutions to challenging problems
• Comfortable moving forward aggressively; balancing risks appropriately to optimize success across all business aspects – good, fast, and cheap
• Equally comfortable contributing as a team member or championing an idea with upper management
Bonus points if you have the following:
• Minimum 5 years FPGA & HW development experience with expertise in Video/Audio technologies preferred
• Knowledge of broadcast studio applications & workflow preferred; especially distribution / production systems a plus
• Understanding of digital video and associated audio standards a plus
• Signal Integrity knowledge a plus
• Ability to work in an embedded environment. Linux, bash, C/C++ and networking skills a plus

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that’s something we’re passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

At Ross, we put the health and safety of our employees and their families first. It is our responsibility to provide a safe work environment, and as such, we strongly encourage all employees globally to get vaccinated against Covid-19. As a global company, we understand that policies and legislations may vary from country to country. In certain jurisdictions, Ross has implemented a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccine Policy for all employees and proof of vaccination may be required during the hiring process.
